description: Mrs. Richard M. Nixon and former United States Attorney General John N. Mitchell will be the principal speakers at the 51st annual luncheon of the Women's National Republican Club, to be held at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel on March 11, it was announced yesterday:

title: Beatrice Foods Elects Executives to Top Posts
description: William G. Karnes has been elected chairman of the board of the Beatrice Foods Company and continues as chief executive officer. He is succeeded as president by Don L. Grantham, who also becomes chief operating officer.

title: WHEAT FUTURES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Prices of wheat and soybean ftitures closed sharply lower yesterday on the Chicago Board of Tride.

title: Tropical Fruit Co., Rochester Troupe, Offers Dance Here
description: The Tropical Fruit Company of Rochester has energy, good spirits and choreography that is based on games. The games were not particularly meaningful or entirely clear in objective Monday evening at the Cubiculo, but they provided the company with the opportunity to show its inventive skill in creating an ambiance of frisky fun.

title: Bowker Off to a Quiet Start at Berkeley
description: BERKELEY, March 1Albert H. Bowker, past chancellor at the City University of New York and prime mover of the city's open admissions policy, has been chancellor at the University of California hi Berkeley; for six months now. But hardly anyone on the sprawling, 178acre campus seems to have noticed his takeover.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: President Nixon has the support of 83 per cent of Republicans across the nation for the Republican nomination, according to the latest Gallup Pool.

title: Whole China Communique Was intensely Negotiated
description: WASHINGTON, March 1The statements on TaiWan, Vietnam and other sensitive issues in the communique, issued by President Nixon and Premier Chou Enlai, altholigh presented as divergent declaretions by each side, had actually been subjected to some intensive negotiation between them, an Administration official said today.

title: Woman in the News
description: When Naomi Bronheim Levine was growing up in the Mal she had a lisp and later, after college, it kept, her from becoming a schoolteacher

title: HelpWanted Ad Index Unchanged in January
description: The helpwanted advertising index in January remained unchanged from the month before, the Conference Board reported yesterday. The index, at '85 per cent of the 1967 average, was 10 points above the level of January, 1971.

title: Parishioners Protest Suspension of a Priest Here
description: He's created a scandal, said a spokesman for the Roman Catholic Archidiocese of New York.

title: Clash Near Angkor
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, March 1 (AP)Enemy troops slashed out of their fixed positions around the ancient ruins of Angkor today and struck Cambodian troops trying to surround them, the Cambodian command reported.

title: Mayor Says Council Unit Used Phony Figures on Loan Losses
description: Mayor Lindsay denied yesterday that the city would lose $60million because of fraud and ineptitude in the Municipal Loan Program, as had been charged Tuesday in a report by a City Council committee.

title: 2 AIRLINES GIVEN ACCESS TO BERLIN
description: BERLIN, March 1For the first time since World War II, the three Western powers have agreed to open West Berlin to international air travel, granting landing rights to nonallied air lines, those of the Scandinavians and the Austrians.

title: Look at Your Dog... Is He Smiling?
description: Does your dog have ESP? Use body language you don't always understand? Suffer from psychosomatic ailments like asthma? Paralysis? Show signs of sibling rivalry?

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MADISON, Wis., March 1 (AP)Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, is the only Presidential prospect to have withdrawn from Visconsin's April 4 primary before Tuesday's deadline for filing disclaimers.

title: SPANISH RIDDLE FLORIDA CHOICE
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., March 1  Spanish Riddle, the supplementary entrant owned, by Roy Anderson of New York and Palm Beach, Fla., will be the favorite, with his entrymate Upper Case, in the 21st Florida Derby at Gulfstream Park tomorrow.

title: Egypt Plans Aid for Lebanese
description: CAIRO, March 1 (UPI)Egypt decided today to donate$500,000 toward the reconstruction of southern Lebanese villages damaged in recent Israeli attacks.. Information Minister Abdel Kader Hatem said the decision had been made during a fourhour meeting, of the Cabinet to discuss the political and military situation resulting from the Israeli aggressions on Lebanon and Syria.

title: Leafs neat Blues
description: ST. LOUIS, March 1 (UPI)Goals by Garry Monahan, Ron Ellis and Jim Harrison gave the Toronto Maple Leafs a 31 victory tonight over the St. Louis Blues.

title: Abortion Reform Killed
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, March 1 (UPI)The Oklahomi Senate Judiciary Commitee killed a proposal today to liberalize the state's abortion laws. The actipn came on a voice vote to indefinitely postpone consideration.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., March 1 (UPI)Roy Emerson of Australia lost to Fred Stolle, countryman, 76, 64, in the first round of the $50,000 Saga Bay tennis tournament for contract pros today.

title: Pentagon RingOff on A.T.&T.
description: Someone seems to have left the telephone off the hook at the Pentagon. Two weeks ago the Defense Department, as one of the country's biggest users of telephone service, was on the warpath against higher phone bills authorized by state and Federal regulatory commissions.

title: Colts Release Richardson
description: BALTIMORE, March 1 (AP)Willie Richardson, 32yearold wide receiver for the Baltimo're Colts, was given his release today.

description: Following last Week's Senate lead, the House passed by voice vote yesterday a bill to, give the Civil Aeronautics Board specific power to reject any airline fares by foreign carriers on routes to this country.

title: A Maverick Farnier Who Finds Gold in Natural Food Products
DEMOCRATS PLAN DISTRICTING FIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, March 1 The probability of a court challenge to New York's Congressional redistricting plan began to develop here today even as incumbent Democrats anxiously awaited their new district lines being drawn by the Republicancontrolled Legislature in Albany.

description: WASHINGTON, March 1 (UPI)  Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird said today that he hoped to keep draft calls below 50,000 this year. That would be the smallest number of men drafted in any year since 1949, when the figure was 10,000.

description: PHILADELPHIA, March 11 (AP)Bob Rule's 20 points led a balanced Philadelphia 76ers attack in a 10899 victory over the Buffalo Braves tonight.

description: CHICAGO, March 1Japan is willing to reduce its balanceoftrade deficit and help American companies achieve greater penetration of Japanese markets, Nobuhiko Ushiba,, Japan's Ambassador to the United States said today.

description: BOST0N, March 1 (AP)Cornell clinched first place in the Eastern Collegiate Athletic Conference DiVision I hockey standing by beating Boston University, 32, tonight on Mug Marett's goal early in the third period.

title: Nets Subdue Squirires, 114111
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., March 11 Charlie Scott of the Virginia Squires, the chief wrecker of the Nets, was quieter than usual and John Roche Made a lot more noise. than usual tonight as the New Yorkers, driving for a playoff berth, beat the Squires; 114111 at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: Duck. Dance, 15, Wins At Aqueduct's Opening

description: The Carnegie HallJeunesses Musicales presentation at Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night was a piano recital by Eva Maria Zuk. Miss Zuk was born in Poland and taken to Venezuela, where she is a citizen, when she was young. The recital was given under the patronage of Guillermo EspinosaFernandez, Venezuela's consul general.

description: WOODSBURGH, L.I., March 1An associate justice of the Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court ruled tonight that the Long Island Rail Road must comply with a lower court order to honor 10trip tickets.

description: To the Editor:

description: I guess It began over a year ago with ominous rumbling and editorialgnashing of teeth by Young Americans for Freedom, Human Events, The American Conservative Union and National Review. Despite the tactical lesson of Vietnam, you used the discredited approach of escalationthe graduated political response. Richard the Apostate was chided, derided and, finally, tentatively excommunicated by you, as spokesmen for the unelected conservative elite, many of you respected political thinkers, few of you practical

title: U.N. Assembly President Expected to Be a Pole
description: UNITED NATIONS, March 1 (UPI)Poland today formally announced the candidacy of her new Deputy Foreign Minister, Stanislaw Trepczynski, for the presidency of the 27th United Nations General Assembly, which opens here in September.

title: $260,000 Record Is Set For Reclining Figure
description: Henry Moore's sculpture Reclining Figure was sold last night by Cranbrook Acad. emy for $260,000, a record auction, price for a sculpture by a living artist.

title: JORDAN MAKES PLEA FOR OLD JERUSALEM
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 1  Jordan appealed to the Islamic world today to do everything possible to stop Israel from changing the status and character of the Old City of Jerusalem.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, March 1 Herbert G. Klein, President Nixon's Director of Communications, said today that members of the Republican National Committee were showing great concern over school busing as an electionyear issue,

title: Tuition Rise Announced
description: WORCESTER, Mass., March 1 (AP)  Worcester Polytechnic Institute announced today It will increase tuition by $125; to $2,650 yearly, effective next September.

title: India Offers Treaty
description: NEW DELHI, March 1 (AP)Prime NEW, Indira Ghandil offered a nowar treaty to Pakistan today, saying that India is keen to settle all outstanding disputes between the two neighbors.

title: SAIGON ENDORSES NIXON CHINA TRIP
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 1In South Vietnam's first official reaction to President Nixon's China trip, Foreign Minister Tran Van Lam said today that his Government approved of the final WashingtonPeking communique and felt it upheld American commitments to his country.

title: TOKYO WILL STUDY ATOM ARMS CHARGE
description: TOKYO, March 1 (AP)Foreign Minister Takeo Fukuda today promised a thorough investigation into a charge by a former United States Air Force sergeant that the United States had brought nuclear weapons into Japan 10 years ago.

title: Sonies Defeat Pistons
description: DETROIT, March 1 (UPI)The firepower of the playercoach, Lenny Wilkens, and Spencer Haywood and Dick Snyder led Seattle to a 116102 victory over the Detroit Pistons tonight as the Supersonics took second place, a halfgame ahead of Golden State, in the Pacific Division.

title: Staff of the I.L.O. Protests Possible Reduction of Jobs
description: GENEVA, March 1  About 700 members of the International Labor Organization's headquarters staff staged a silent demonstration today to protest against the possible elimination of 140 jobs for economy reasons.

title: Koosman's Debut Is Encouraging
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 1Spring, the season, of hope, smiled on the New York Mets twice today: Jim Fregosi played third base without making any errors and Jerry Koosthan pitched two shutout innings on his road back.

title: CITY CRACKS DOWN ON UNSAFE TAXIS
description: Taxi Commissioner Michael J. Lazar disclosed yesterday that his inspectors had staged raids recently at taxicab fleet garages and at Kennedy International Airport and that they had issued 180 summonses and suspended the medallions of 20 cabs, mainly on grounds of safety violations.

title: Sheik Mujib, in Moscow, Opens Talks With Kosygin
description: MOSCOW, March 1  Sheik Mujibur Rahman, Prime Minister of Bangladesh, arrived here by air today at the head of a political and economic delegation and promptly plunged into talks with Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin on future relations between the two countries.

title: ATOM DEVICE SETS AN ENERGY RECORD
description: WASHINGTON, March 1The Atomic Energy Commission announced today that Its $250million atom smasher in Batavia, Ill., had boosted a stream of protons to the highest energy level ever achieved by man, 200 billion electron volts, or almost three times as high as produced by the largest Soviet machine.

title: Candidates Day
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., March 1  Senator Henry M. Jackson campaigned today at two retirement communities and proposed raising Social Security benefits to a minimum of $150 and a maximum of $600 a month.

title: ' Sometimes a Great Notion':Story of Logging Strike Opens at 22 Theaters Fonda Heads Family in Independence Fight
description: "Sometimes a Great Notion," Ken Kesey's second novel, adapted by John Gay and directed by Paul Newman, opened at 22 theaters here yesterday, which probably means that it will be in and out of town so quickly that a lot of people who might like to see it won't have the chance.It's not a great film, nor is it what the trade likes to describe as an East Side film, that is, something that exhibits a kind of white-collar starchiness towards the idea of manual labor or sweaty physical efort of any sort."Sometimes a Great Notion" is an extremely interesting, if impure (happily impure, I might add) example of a genre of action film that flourished in the 1930's in movies about tuna fishermen, bush pilots, high-wire repairmen and just about any physical pursuit you can think of with the possible exception of tolltaking, which (except on some thruways) lacks the necessary element of danger.As in Howard Hawks's "Only Angels Have Wings," these films are, at their best, considerably less simple-minded than they soundbeing expressions of lives lived almost entirely in terms of rugged, essentially individualistic professionalism."Sometimes a Great Notion" is set in the remote lumber country of the Pacific Northwest and has to do with the patriarchal Stamper family, which is continuing to run its small, independent logging operation while the other loggers in the area are frozen by a strike against a huge lumber combine.Like old Henry Stamper (Henry Fonda), who sees the strike as a pinko commie conspiracy and pays no attention to the bitterness of his former logging friends, and his son, Hank (Paul Newman), whose social conscience is the size of a pea; the movie evokes a poetic rather than a political truth in the story of the Stampers nutty efforts to maintain their clearly outdated independence. When they are defeated, it's not the result of political pressure but because fateas in the apolitical action films of the 1930'shas stepped in.Mr. Newman, who took over the direction of the film (which is only his second) after Richard A. Colla left the project early in the filming, has been remarkably successful both in creating vivid, quite complicated characters and in communicating the sense of beautiful idiocy that is the strength of the two older Stampers.As he showed in "Rachel, Rachel," Mr. Newman knows how to direct actors, and he has obtained lovely performances from Mr. Fonda, Michael Sarrazin and Richard Jaeckel (as two of the younger Stampers), as well as from Lee Remick, who plays what old Henry obviously considers to be a second-class citizen, that is, the woman who happens to be married to his son and whose only joy in life is a German yellow canary.Mr. Newman's handling of the logging and action sequences, some of which are as melodramatic as anything I've seen since Edward G. Robinson lost his hand in Hawks's "Tiger Shark," is also surprisingly effective, not because of any contemporary fanciness but because of what looks like a straight-forward confidence in the subject.My only real objection to the film, I think, is a certain impatience with the screenplay, which lumberingly sets up almost a very physical and emotional crisis that can (and, indeed) must erupt before this kind of movie can be said to have decently met its obligations.Quite early, you know full well who must suffer the fatal logging accident, who will prove himself to be a man, and who will emerge from defeat unreconstructed and triumphant, leading a log-pack down river to the amazement of the striking lumbermen on the bank. I have not read this particular Kesey novel, but the final gesture is authentic Keseyian comic-horror: a dismembered arm, which has been kept in a deep freeze, is attached to the tugboat mast, the fingers shaped to form the universal hand signal for defiance.

title: Metropolitan. Life's Funds Held Ample and Available for Loans
description: The Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, which pumped nearly $2.4billion into the economy in longterm investments last year, disclosed here yesterday that it has more of the same in mind for 1972.

title: DR. MOSHE SNEH, IS DEAD IN ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, March 1 Dr. Moshe Sneh, a leader of the Israel Communist party, whose charm and brilliance endeared him to a nation that abhors Communists, died tonight in Jerusalem. He was 63 years old.

title: Fresh Yankee Upset as Yonkers Opens
description: YONKERS, March 1Upsets shocked the notsosilent majority of the 19,342 harness fans who turned out for the opening of Yonkers Raceway's firsthalf, 73card meeting tonight.

title: THOMAS C. LINN, 77, EXTIMES REPORTER
description: SALISBURY, N. C., March 1 Thomas Calvin Linn, who had been a member of the news staff of The New York Times from 1920 until his retirement in 1954, died Feb. 8 after a long illness. He was 77 years old and had made his home here with his sister, Mrs. George Collins.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: TRENTON, March 1Giving in to intense, lastminute pressure from New Jersey's most powerful Democratic leaders, the party's state chairman, Salvatore A. Bontempo, filed a Presidential delegate plan tonight that retained a statewide slate. This promises to bolster the chances of Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine.

title: Le Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CONCORD, N. H., March 1Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr. disclosed today financial contributions of more than $129,000 to his New Hampshire campaign, including one from a Democrat working for Senator Vance Hartke.

title: 75 Postal Workers Sit in For 8 Hours at Main Office
description: About 75 postal workers left the General Post Office at midnight after staging an eighthour sitin yesterday in a contract dispute.

title: U.S. Pilots Duel With MIG's, Believe They Shot One Down
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, March 2 (AP)United States fighterbombers dueled with two Communist MIG21 interceptors along the North VietnamLaos border 125 miles southwest of Hanoi last night, the United States Command said today, and the American pilots reported the probable destruction of one of the MIG's.

title: Atlanta to Hear Graham
description: ATLANTA, March 1 (AP)Billy Graham announced today that he would bring, his 1973 crusade to Atlanta. The 10day crusade is scheduled to begin May 4

title: Chou's Return Given Saturation Coverage in Media
description: PEKING, March 1The statecontrolled media, gave, saturation coverage today to Premier Chou Enlai's return to the capital from Shanghai, making it clear that President Nixon's visit is to be presented to the masses as a diplomatic coup for China and a personal triumph for the Premier.

title: Merger News
description: Revco D. S., Inc., and White Cross Stores, Inc., announced yesterday that they had begun negotiations for a possible merger of White Cross into Revco. Both companies operate discount drugstores. The companies said the discussions had indicated an exchange ratio of 0.75 share of Revco common for each share of White Cross common. Based on the closing price of Revco on the New York Stock Exchange yester terday of 53, up , the transaction is valued at approximately $82million. White Cross finished yesterday on the. Big Board at 34, up 3. The company has 2,047,521 common shares outstanding.

title: Raider Eyes Exxon Trademark.
description: PARIS, March 1  Robert Aries, whose profitable hobby is to pick up any valuable patents and trademarks that aren't nailed down, has a mexxage for the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey).

title: Auction of Folk Art at Coliseum To Benefit Museum's Collection
description: Nearly 100 works of folk art will be auctioned tomorrow evening at a benefit preview for the Museum of American Folk Art at the annual antiques fair at the Coliseum. About twothirds of the items are from the museum's collection; the rest are donations.

title: Alcoa Names Executive
description: The Aluminum Company, of America announced yesterday the election of James R. Pasman Jr. as a vice president. Mr. Pasman will also become treasurer, succeeding Matt W. Stanley, who has been the company's treasurer since 1960 and a vice president since 1964.

title: SMITH AND RICHEY TRIUMPH AT NET
description: HAMPTON, Va., March 1 (AP)Stan Smith and Cliff Richey carved out impressive secondround victories in the $35,000 Hampton indportennis tournament tonight.

title: Redistricting the Reformers
description: The proposed new. Congressional district lines for New York City are a political abomination. As they have been sketched out by Republicans in Albany, the boundaries suggest to even a casual observer that there has been collusion by the Republicans and the regular Democrats to do in the Reform Democrats.

title: Havlicek Sparks Celtics
description: BOSTON, March 1 (AP)John Havlicek led a thirdperiod surge with 15 points tonight as the Boston Celtics rolled to their fourth consecutive National Basketball Association victory  a 115105 triumph over the Cleveland Cavaliers.

title: British Blackouts Ended
description: LONDON, Thursday, March 21 Power cuts in Britain ended early today, three days after) 280,000 coal miners ended their eightweek strike and went back to work. Restrictions on the use of electricity for advertising, floodlighting and display, however, are being continued.

title: BROOKS ROBINSON SIGNS AT $110,000
description: MIAMI, March 1  Brooks Robinson ended a 40minute holdout today, but seven other Baltimore Orioles  five regulars, a 20game winner and a No. 1 subremained unsigned, making the Orioles the most salaryembattled team in the majors.

title: Irish Parade to Carry British Exodus Theme
description: This year's St. Patrick's Day parade will be dedicated to the theme England get out of Ireland, Judge James J. Comerford, parade committee chairman, said last night.

title: Hearings Indicate Ellsberg Trial Will Raise Issue of Secrecy Rules
description: LOS ANGELES, March 1 Pretrial hearings indicate that the trial of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr. will result in a detailed debate by expert witnesses on some of the critical sections of the Pentagon papers, the Defense Department study; of American involvement In Vietnam.

title: KRIPS CONDUCTS ROBUST BRUCKNER
description: There was a time, improbable as it may now seem, when the symphonies of Bruckner were collector's items in the concert hall. Now, we are in a period of bvercorrection and perhaps overkill. This season, certainly, one could scarcely escape Bruckner even if he were so minded: this listener has alrdady reviewed the Seventh Symphony three times in the last couple, of months.

title: Stock Position Clarified
description: Victor K. Kiam 2d, president of the Benrus Corporation, acquired 45,600 share's of Benrus, stock in December, 1971, upon the exercise of rights, and not through an option plan as reported in The New York Times on Feb. 17.

title: Green Reassures Koreans
description: SEOUL, South Korea, March 1 (Reuters)  Marshall Green, Assistant Secretary of State for Eastern and Pacific Affairs, told Foreign Minister Kim Yong Shik of South Korea today that there was no secret deal in Peking that would go against Seoul's interest.

title: JERSEY BUS STRIKE AFFECTS 700,000; TALKS BOG DOWN
description: About 700,000 New Jersey bus riders had to find other transportation, yesterday as the Anialgamated Transit Union went on strike against Transport of New Jersey, one of the largest private bus companies in the country.

title: MINIM ASKS TO REBUT CHARGES
description: WASHINGTON, March 1Deputk Attorpey General Richard G. Kleindienst will appear before a special session of the Senate Judiciary Committee to morrow to answer under oath allegations of improprieties growing out of the Justice Department's Settlement of an antitrust action against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: JULIAN R. HOLZER
description: Julian R. Holzer, president of the Holzbr Watch Company a distributor of Swiss watches in this country, died of a heart attack on Tuesday evening while dining with friends. He was 61 years old and lived at 70 East 77th Street.

title: News of Dogs
description: Dogshow history was made 11 days ago at Greenville, S.C., when Ch. Szentivani Ingo was named best, for Duna (Hungarian for Danube), as the dog is called by his owners, Dr. and Mrs. Marion J. Levy Jr. of Princeton, N.J., is the first Komondor to achieve that honor in the United States.

title: Candidates Day
description: MILFORD, N. H., March 1 (AP)Mayor Sam Yorty of Los Angeles, back in New Hampshire to caMpaign for next Tuesday's Pressidential primary, suggested today that unemployed aerospace scientists be given the job of developing a nationwide antidrug program.

title: Price Changes
description: Several major paper companies moved yesterday to raise prices on some of their products.

title: CHARLES HOLLENDER OF REGENTS LAW UNIT
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., March 1Charles Hollender, a lawyer and former director of the law enforcement bureau of the Regents of the State of New York, died yesterday in New Rochelle Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at 221 Rose Hill Road.

title: Pacific Board Balks
description: WASHINGTON, March 1The Pacific Coast Stock Exchange has informed the. Securities Commission that it will not voluntarily change its rules to expel from membership brokerage firms that do most of their business for institutional investors with which they are affiliated.

title: PENTAGON OPPOSES WAR AMNESTY PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, March 1 (AP)  Amnesty for Vietnam draft resisters and deserters was opposed today by the Pentagon and the American Legion. They said it could wreck the armed forces and defame the millions who served honorably and without protest.

title: Notes on People
description: Queen Frederika, the selfexiled mother of King Constantine of Greece, is no longer in trouble with the Holy Synod of the Greek Orthodox Church, The synod has dropped charges, brought against her by Bishop Avgoustinos, Metropolitan of Florina, that her autobiography contained antiChristian doctrines and ideas against Orthodoxy. The book, Measure of Understanding, published in London last May, advances the Queen Mother's thoughts on the monarchy, her love for her late husband, King Paul, and her religious philosophy. The synod ruled that there were no grounds to justify Bishop Avgoustinos's charges.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: These Specialists Eat To the Heart's Content
description: CHICAGO, March 1 (AP)Heart specialists attending the annual meeting of the American College of Cardiology chose their lunches today from menus low in cholesterol, fats and calories, which are considered contributors to heart disease.

title: A Drug Ring at Kennedy Is Under U. S. Investigation
description: A special grand jury in Brooklyn is investigating possible corruption involving people working at Kennedy International Airport, including United States Customs personnel, in connection with a $20million marijuana smuggling operation originating on the island of Jamaica.

title: Advertising:
description: As a direct result of the financial plight Of Lennen & Newell, the Reader's Digest, will be including a new clause in its advertising contracts that will make advertisers as well as agencies responsible for payment.

title: Virginia Reapportionment Is Ruled Unconstitutional
description: RICHMOND, March 1 (AP)A threejudge Federal court ruled today that Virginia's Congressional reapportionment was unconstitutional and gave the General Assembly a 25day grace period to amend the 1971 law.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: FRANKLIN, Ga.Without warning, like a suddenly remembered line of poetry or the fragrnent of a beloved melody, daffodils in full bloom signaled from the roadside in Georgia's Heard County, and it was almost more than a disoriented New Englander could bear.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 45YearOld man was killed in a smoky fire in an apartment. house in the Fort Greene section of Brookiyn last night, the Fire Department said. His two young nices were rescued and hospitalized for semoke inhalation.

title: Al Philburn Is Dead at 69; Jazz Trombonist of Thirties
description: Al Philburn, a jazz trombonist who played with Paul Specht, Cass Hagan, Ed Kirkeby and Red Nichols in the bands of the twenties and thirties, died on Tuesday in Glen Cove (LI.) Community Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 87 Arleigh Drive, Albertson, L.I.

title: HOUSE VOTES FUNDS FOR SECURITY PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, March 1The House Internal Security Committee won its annual fight for survival today as the House, 302 to 102, granted it 525,000 to investigate suspected subversion.

title: MIGNON DUNN SINGS CARMEN WITH GUSTO
description: Sixteen years ago Mignon Dunn made her debut with the New York City Opera as Carmen. Since then she has moved to the Metropolitan Opera, where Carmen was one of her roles this season. Last Saturday and Tuesday nights, Miss Dunn went back to the City Opera to help out when its Carmen, Joy Davidson, became indisposed, The transplant was beneficial both to the mezzosoprano and the company.

title: 23 Hurt Near Long Tieng
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 1 (UPI)A North Vietnamese shell hit a Laotian ammunition dump on a ridge near the beleaguered base of Long Tieng yesterday and the resultant explosion wounded 23 men, military sources said today.

title: RATELLE INJURED IN RANGER VICTORY BY 41 OVER SEALS
description: The almostdiabolical lateseason injury jinx that has hounded the Rangers through good times and bad struck again last night when the New Yorkers lost Jean Ratelle, the greatest scorer in the team's history, for the remainder of the regular National Hockey League season.

title: VICTOR BABIN, 63, OF 2PIANO TEAM
description: CLEVELAND, March 1Victor Babin, pianist and director since 1961 of the Cleveland Institute of Music, died today in University Hospital. He was 63 years old.

title: Market Place: Lehman Holds Annual Meeting
description: Virtue is its own reward, the saying goes, and stockholders of the Lehman Corporation may have to settle for just that.

title: New Building Gained $2.7Billion in January
description: New construction spending advanced $2.7billion, or 2 per cent, in January to a seasonallyadjusted annual rate of $118.3billion, the Commerce Department said in Washington yesterday. The revised December figure of $115.6billion marked an increase of $2billion from the previous month.

title: CHILE WON'T HONOR DEBT TO ANACONDA
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 1 (AP)Chile today suspended shipment of copper consigned to the Anaconda Company and a senior Government official announced that $203million in Chilean promissory notes held by the United States company would not be honored.

title: Ton of Marijuana Seized
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., March 1 (UPI)The state police, acting on a tip, intercepted today a ton of marijuana being transported in a trailer and arrested two men. Harold Jerry Davis, 35 years old, of Sand Lake, N.Y., and Arthur Marlon Cooper, 27, of Rogersville, Tenn., were charged with trafficking, possession and conspiracy to traffic in narcotics.

title: Gold Price Rise Approved By Senate in 86to1 Vote
description: WASHINGTON, March 1 The. Senate passed today, by a vote of 86 to 1 after brief debate, the legislation formally reducing the international value of the dollar by raising the official price of gold from $35 to $38 an ounce.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Candidates Day
description: DURHAM, N. H., March 1 (AP)Senator George McGovern said tonight that New Hampshire's Presidential primary March, 7 might well be a cliffhanger election despite polls that showed Senator Edmund S. Muskie far ahead.

title: 2 TeenAgers Found Dead
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 1 (UPI)  The police found the bulletriddled bodies of two teenagers in the back of a rod truck in front of a Belfast hospital tonight. About 10 minutes earlier, troops in the Belfast dock area had fired on a red truck which sped away, an Army spokesman said.

title: HOUSE PANEL KILLS TRANSIT STRIKE BILL
description: WASHINGTON, March 1 (AP) The House Transportation subcommittee killed today a bill that would have set up permanent emergency mechanisms for settling rail and airline labor disputes and strikes. The vote was 6 to 5.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 2, 1972

title: Bridge: Rare Is the Defense in Which Both Players Come Through
description: Deals that require brilliant cooperative defense are very rare, and when they do occur it is almost inevitable that at least one of the defenders will fail to rise to the occasion. Both players passed, the test on the diagramed deal, which was played Tuesday in the Metropolitan Commercial League's Swiss team championship.ln a match between two Javored teams, the NorthSouth pair, representing New York Life, bid aggressively to four spades. The combined hands have only 21 highcard points, but they fit well and South has fair prospects of making 10 tricks by ruffing hearts repeatedly in the dummy.

title: 2d of 5 Defendants Found Guilty of 3 Yablonski Murders in 1969
description: WASHINGTON, Pa., March 1Paul E. Gilly of Cleveland, the second defendant to go on trial for the 1969 murders of Joseph A. Yablonski, the unsuccessful candidate for president of the United Mine Workers; his Wife and daughter, found guilty tonight of firstdegree murder.

title: MARIAN GREY, 89, EXPERT ON LACE
description: SNEDEN'S LANDING., N. Y. March 1Mrs. Marian Powys Grey, an authority handmade lace and lacemaking and a member of a distinguished literary family, died today at her home here. She was 89 years old.

title: Tunnels Destruction Is Topic Of Purported Berrigan Letter
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 1 The jury in the bombingkidnapping conspiracy trial of the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and six other antiwar activists listened today to the reading of a purported letter from Father Berrigan to a New York nun in which the Writer directed that the priority project for the winter 0,197071 would be the destruction of utility tunnels in Washington.

title: Deieliinski and Miss Tasigian Take Slaloms at Lake Placid
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., March 1On a day that saw the temperatures climb and drop, within a few hours, a 21yearold medical student from Poland and a 21yearold brunette from Turin, Italy, captured gold medalS at the World UniverSity Winter Games today.

title: Philadelphia to Fight for a Curb on Poor
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 1Philadelphia officials decided today to ask the United States Supreme Court to restrict the voice of slum residents in guiding Model Cities programs.

title: URUGUAY SWEARS IN HER NEW PRESIDENT
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 1 Juan Marfa Bordaberry, a 43yearold conservative, today assumed the presidency of Uruguay with a notable lack of public enthusiasm and maximum security.

title: Lakers Set Back Bucks On Late Shot, 109 to 108
description: MADISON, Wis., March 1 (UPI)Gail Goodrich made a 15foot jump shot with five seconds left to give the Los Angeles Lakers a 109108 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks tonight in a game between the National Basketball Association's top two teams.

title: Advertising:
description: The Reader's Digest was about halfway into, a. 24month, $2.4million air industry advertising campaign to make nonflyers flyers, when it decided to sell the sponsors on a second goround'.

title: ANTIGENS STUDIED FOR DISEASE CLUE
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Feb. 29Tests used by doctors in heart and kidney transplants have led scientists to investigate the research applications of the tests hi a wide variety of diseases: unrelated to transplant operations.

title: $20BILLION PLAN TO AID EDUCATION. VOTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, March 1The Senate, after rejecting a series of amendments designed to prevent the use of busing as a means of desegregating schools, passed today a broad education bill that would aid schools and students at every level.

title: Candidates Day
description: PITTSBURGH, March 1 (AP) Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota, campaigning, for the Democratic Presidential nomination, today asked the leaders of Pennsylvania's organized labor movement for their support.

title: ISRAELIS ATTACK GUERRILLAS ANEW
description: JERUSALEM, March 1 Israeli and Syrian warplanes bombed each other's front line areas today, in the tense aftermath of a fourday Israeli operation inside Lebanon aimed at breaking up Palestinian commando encampments.

title: Pakistan Plans Curbs on Landowners
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, March 1President Zulfikar All Bhutto announced a land re form program for Pakistan to night that, he said, would affect more than one million acres that had escaped previous reform programs.

title: Amendments Voted
description: Members of the New York Stock Exchange yesterday approved, by a vote of 852 to 109, a broad plan to reorganize the governing structure of the Big Board.

title: Miss Durr Upset by Briton In Michigan First Round
description: ROCHESTER, Mich., March 1 (UPI)  Unseeded Corinne Molesworth of Britain upset Francoise Durr of France, 62, 26, 76, in the first round of the $15,000 KMart women's tennis tournament today.

title: Speedier Hearings Asked
description: WASHINGTON, March 1The Government asked the Supreme Court today to expedite hearings on Senator Mike Gravel's legal effort to stop a Federal grand jury in Boston from investigating efforts he made to publish the Pentagon papers last year.

title: Study Brands City Region Housing Disaster Area'
description: A major civilrights housing group charged yesterday that the metropolitan region had become a housing disaster area for jobseeking black and Puerto Rican poor people.

title: Providence Tops St. John's For 18th Triumph, 73 to 65
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., March 1 Providence College defeated St. John's, 7365, tonight before 3,500 fans at the winner's court. Both teams are bound for postseason tournaments.

title: Mayor Rebukes Head of City Antipoverty Council
description: Mayor Lindsay rebuked the chairman of the city's Council Against Poverty yesterday for plainly offensive remarks about the Forest Hills housing issue made on a radio program Tuesday night.

title: Royals Bow to Rockets
description: EL PASO, Tex., March 1 (AP)The Houston Rockets got 26point performances from Elvin Hayes and Stu Lantz to defeat the Cincinnati Royals, 10896, tonight.

title: China Pays U.N. Dues, Refusing Some Items
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 1China has made a $3million first installment on her United Nations dues hut, like the Soviet Union, is refusing to pay for some peacekeeping expenses and other budget items.

title: Mist Davis's Lawyers Ask Relaxation of Trial Security
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., March 1 (UPI)  Angela Davis's attorneys suggested today that the elaborate security surrounding her trial be relaxed.

title: $125Million Stock Offer Set By TransCanada Pipelines
description: TORONTO, March 1 (Canadian Press)TransCanada Pipelines, Ltd., announced today new issue of shares totaling $125million, believed to be the largest equity issue in Canadian history.

title: Rumania Says Nixon Trip Helps Process of Detente
description: VIENNA, March 1 (Reuters)Rumania broke her silence today on the ChineseAmerican communiqu and hailed President Nixon's visit to China as a positive act and a fundamental premise for improving the international political climate.

title: Vladimir Golschmann, Conductor, Dies
description: Vladimir Golschmann, conductor of the St. Louis Symphony Orchestra from 1931 to 1957, died last night at his, home. He was 78 years old.

title: Discrimination by H E.W....
description: Under mandate of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 the Department of Health, Education and Welfare has stepped up its investigation of discriminatory hiring and promotion practices by institutions of higher learning. At issue is not only the treatment of racial minorities and of womenbut also the even more vital question of academic freedom. Columbia University, which narrowly escaped the loss of $13 million in Federal contracts, was only the latest of a number of institutions to be probed.

title: Computer Snarl Cuts OTB Bets Sharply
description: Another failure yesterday of the Offtrack Betting Corporation's mechanics, by the Computer Sciences Corporation system, took a deep bite out of the potential handle on the opening day of the New York thoroughbred racing season and annoyed hundreds of customers because of closed betting windows and maddening delays.

title: IN THE NATION
description: RIVERSIEE, Calif., March 1To Improve the education of kids is a lot harder than we thoUght it would be. That's. one thing Arthur L. Littleworth, the thoughtful young attorney who heads this city's school board, has learned since Riverside became the first city of over 100,000 population to integrate its schools.

title: March Enters the City With a Springy Step
description: If there is any truth in the old saying, look out for something resembling an enormous, furious lion at the end of March.

title: State Says City Relief Is Abused
description: The State Welfare Inspector General, George F. Berlinger, estimated yesterday that 10 to 15 per cent orthe 1.2 million people on the city's relief rolls were ineligible.

title: Republican Fails to Get Repeal of Hot Dog Tax to Assembly Vote
description: ALBANY, March 1 A maverick Republican Assemblyman, aided by the minority Democrats, tried unsuccessfully today, to pry a bill out of committee that would repeal the socalled hot dog tax enacted last year and got into an angry shouting match with the chairman of the Assembly Ways and Means Committee.

title: Merger News
description: The New York State Banking Board yesterday approved the application of the giant First National City Corporation, the largest banking concern in the state, to acquire the tiny Silver Creek National Bank, just outside Buffalo.

title: Books of The Times
description: LIMBO. By Joan Silver and Linda Gottlleb. 181 pages. Viking. $6.95.

title: GOVERNOR ASSAILS LAWYERS FIGHTING INSURANCE REFORM
description: ALBANY, March 1A long, complicated and occasionally contentious hearing on nofault auto insurance opened today with some sharp remarks by Governor Rockefeller about the role of lawyerslegislator lawyers in particularwho are opposed to the idea.

title: MARIAN WELLS HALL, DECORATOR, WAS 76
description: Marian Wells Hall, one of New York's best known interior decorators, died Tuesday in Manalapan, Fla., while visiting a friend, Mrs. Harold S. Vanderbilt. She was 76 years old.

title: Candidates Day
description: BOSTON, March 1Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine, the front running candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination, set out tonight on a threeweek journey designed to assure his lead over his rivals.

title: HESBURGH WARNS ON BARRING BUSING
description: WASHINGTON, March 1 The Rev. Theodore M. Hesburgh, chairman of the United States Commission on Civil Rights, told the House Judiciary Committee today that enactment of a constitutional amendment against busing of schoolchildren would undermine what progress we have made in race relations, both in our schools and in society as a whole.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Irreverent Paris Weekly Stirs Up Political Storms
description: PARIS, March 1Today, as they do every Wednesday, several hundred thousand Frenchmen, including those in high places, picked up Le Canard Enchatne to see who was being subjected to the ferocious humor of one of Europe's most famous satirical weeklies.

title: Day of Reckoning for Conservatives
description: The American people have had considerable experience with summitry by now, and it is Poisible to make, some fairly confident generalization's about the trip to China that PreSident Nixon has just completed.

title: Bullets Rally to Win
description: PHOENIX, March 1 (UPI)The Baltimore Bullets rallied from 18 points down midway in the third quarter tonight to defeat the Phoenix. Suns, 9590. The Bullets first lead of the contest came with two minutes left when Jack Marin's Jump shot gave them a 9290 advantage. Baltimore scored the game's last eight points after Phoenix had led 9087 at the threeminute mark.

title: Taiwanese Losing Faith in a Dream Of Creating an Independent Republic
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 1In his English class in a private school, a Taiwanese instructor clandestinely teaches his studentst the words to the song The Impossible Dream from the musical Man of La Mancha.

title: Bouncy Market Sets Highs As Trading Outruns Ticker
CHARISMA NAMED YACHTING WINNER
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, March 1 (AP)Racing officials today declared Charisma, a 55foot aluminum sloop owned by Jessie Phillips of Dayton, Ohio, the winner of the 184mile MiamitoNassau ocean yacht race.

title: Le Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Major Changes Made by A.S.P.C.A.
description: The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals has made a number of innovationsranging from improving conditions in animal cages to naming one of kits most vociferous critics to its boardafter six months of intensive discussions with a coalition of its opponents. These critics charged the society last year with inhumane methods and cruelty to animals.

title: City U. Dean Named
description: Dr. Mary Jane Kingkade, associate dean of the faculties at Lehman College since, 1968, has been appointed dean for university and special programs of the City University's Graduate School and University Center. The appointment. was announced by Minna S. Rees, president of the graduate division.

title: SABRES DEFEATED. BY CANADIENS 41
description: MONREAL, March 1 (UPI) Yvan CoUrnoyer and Marc Tardif each: scored two goifs and added an assist tonight to lead. the Montreal Canadiens to a 41 victory over. the Buffalo Sabres.

title: Cooling  of Hot Stocks Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 1 (AP) The New York State Attorney General's office urged the Securities and. Exchange ComMission today to ban trading of all new stock issues for at least three days after the initial distribution to allow them time to cool off.

title: George D. Smith, 74, Chairman Of United Parcel Service, Dies
description: George D. Smith; chief executive officer and chairman of the board of United Parcel Service, died on Tuesday in los Angeles after a brief illness. He was 74 years old.

title: Palm Beach Set Turns Out for Wildlife Fund Action
description: PALM BEACH, March 1The real question is whether Palm Beach, famous for its big game hunters with their trophylined walls, would be on a conservation kick if Prince Bernhard of the Netherlands weren't in town. But the Prince, president of the World Wildlife Fund Intehatkinal, is here, and thanks to a blacktie auction last night, the fund is $61,670 richer.

title: PIONEER 10 LIFTOFF PUT OFF THIRD TIME
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., March 1For the third time this week, the launching of Pioneer 10, the spacecraft designed to explore the environs of Jupiter, was postponed tonight.

title: PRICES OF BONDS SHOW STRENGTH
description: In an actionpacked day in the credit markets, bond prices gained strength, shortterm interest rates rose, and the Federal Government borrowed $3billion by selling a strip's. of Treasury bills.

title: Post Triumphs by 8268
description: GREENVALE, L. I., March 1 C.W. Post relied on its bench strength to pull out an 8268 triumph over New York Tech tonight.

title: Garage HeldKey to Hackensack's Renewal
description: HACKENSACK, N. J. March 1In what was described by this city's MOO as a tangible beginning to the rebirth of Hackensack's oncethriving downtown shopping area, it was announced today that a design contract had been awarded for the construction of a 1,500car parking facility.

title: DOLLAR NARROWS A GAP IN EUROPE
description: PARIS, March 1Tile dollar registered a modest improventent in the major financial centers today as European interest rates slid back again, helping to narrow that troublegime  gap between rates in EuroPe and the United States.

title: CHINATOWN YOUTH SLAIN IN THEATER
description: Two young men were shot, one of them fatally, in a movie theater in Chinatown last night by two gunmen who escaped as startled patrons scattered to the exits. The Police said the cause of the shooting was not immediately determined.

title: French Find HalfTon of Heroin In a Boat Seized Off Marseilles
description: PARIS, March 2 French customs agents in Marseilles found almost half a ton of pure heroin aboard a shrimp boat early today.

title: U.S. Businessmen Assure Europe on Protectionism
description: VERSAILLES, France, March 2Americanbased multinational corporations think they have the muscle to defeat the BurkeHartke bill in Congress this year and are chiefly worried about the possibility that its tax provisions, which would trim multinational sails, might be appended to other legislation.

title: Formal Proceedings Set on Staff's Charges of Law Violations
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 The Securities and Exchange CommisSion ordered'. formal proceedings today on charges that the Susquehanna Corporation and four prominent banks had violated the securities laws in their financial dealings with each other.

title: WellArmed South Vietnamese Gain Confidence as Americans Withdraw
description: FIRE BASE BALDY, South VietnamThe North Vietnamese are good fighters, the South Vietnamese Army private said as he shouldered his rucksack and headed for an assault helicopter.

title: Schenk Betters Own Mark For 3,000 Meters in Skating
description: INZELL, West Germany, March 2 (AP)Ard Schenk of the Netherlands, who won three speed skating gold medals at the last Winter Olympics, shattered his own. world,record for 3,000 meters today with a time of 4 minutes 8.3 seconds.

title: HADASSAH SETS UP FUND FOR CENTER;Allocates $1 Million for Israeli Pharmacology
description: Hadassah, the Women's Zionist Organization of America, allocated $1million yesterday for the establishment of a department of clinical pharmacology at its HadassahHebrew University Medical Center in Jerusalem.

title: Quadrangle Books Appoints Chief
description: Herbert Nagourney was named president yesterday of Quadrangle Books, Inc., a subsidiary of The New York Times Company.

title: Big Retail Chains Sales Rise
description: Six of the country's largest retail chains reported yesterday substantial gains in sales for the four weeks ended Feb. 26. The period involved represented the first month in the retail industry's new fiscal year, which began Feb. 1.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Povertyand Disease Still Haunting Everest Villages
description: KHUMJUNG, NepalDespite new initiatives to bring public health, education and even tourists to the people living in the shadow of Mount Everest, the vast slopes and lonely villages are still haunted by disease, poverty and the abominable snowman.

title: Germany Posts Surplus
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, March 2 (Reuters)West Germany's basic balance of payments showed a provisional surplus of 954 million marks in January against a December, 1971, surplus of 1,376 million and a deficit of 488 million in January last year, the Bundesbank said today. The mark is currently quoted at approximately 31.4350.

title: DAM THAT RUPTURED WAS BUILT AFTER 66
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., March 2 (AP)  A geologist for the Geological Survey said today that the dam in Buffalo Creek hallOw that broke last Saturday, causing a flood that killed 76 persons, was not one his agency had questioned, in 1966.

title: Kissinger Identified as Source Of China Background Briefing
description: WASHINGTON, March 1The Boston Globe and the Knight newspaper chain today identified Henry. A. Kissinger as the Nixon Administration source who briefed newsmen yesterday about President Nixon's discussions with Premier Chou Enlai of China.

title: Israeli Ovetflight Thwarted, Syrians Say
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 2 Syria said today that her air and ground defenses foiled an attempt by Israeli planes to enter Syrian airspace over the Latakia area in the northwestern part of the country.

title: 3 Insurers Differ on No Fault Savings
description: ALBANY, March 2Representatives of the insurance industry differed today on whether there would be savings in premiums under the no fault auto insurance plan being discussed here.

title: 5 Indicted in Embezzlement Of Union Funds in Newark
description: NEWARK, March 2 (AP) Five present or former officials of a New Jersey union were indicted by a Federal grand jury today on charges that they embezzled $32,000 in union funds.

title: SCHOOL RECEPTION STARTLES LINDSAY
description: A visit by Mayor Lindsay to an antinercotics program in a Williamsburg high school turned sour yesterday when a group of Puerto, Rican students accused him of ignoring other school needs.

title: Municipal Loan Scandal
description: The Municipal Loan Program was designed to convert into decent homes the thousands of battered hulks that stand empty and deteriorating in the slum sections New York City. But, ironically, it has now been revealed as little more than a battered hulk itself.

title: Peking Publicity Goes On The Globe and Mall, Toronto
description: PEKING, March 2The campaign to drive the impact of the Nixon visit home to the Chinese people developed further today with a 26minute rerun of the visit's early highlights on the state television network.

title: Israelis Seize Marijuana
description: TEL AVIV, March 2 (UPI)The Israeli police announced today the seizureof SImillion worth of marijuana and the arrest of four. members of a smuggling ring.

title: Israeli Pantyhose Scheme
description: TOKYO, March 2Japanese textile companies, unsuccessful opponents of last year's mandatory Government restrictions on exports to the United States, are complaining about competition from inexpensive imports here and asking the Government for countermeasures.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The Republicans are very much up and the Democrats very far down these days, but that's the way it usually is for the louts just before the first Presidential primary election, and the present mood is likely to change dramatically in the nine months before the vote.

title: Black Dance Troupe Finds Motivation In Social Protest
description: Black social protest is the reason for being of Morse Donaldson's Dance Company otherwise known as Armageddon in Babylon. Judging by the integrated group's concert Wednesday night at, Riverside Church Mr. Donaldson appears more interested in message than artistic medium. He is, however, a choreographer with a firm grasp of various techniquesballet, modern dance and jazz.

title: BADFINGER MARRED BY TECHNICAL ILLS
description: Badfinger, a fine English rock group, was very nearly ruined by its technical assistance at Carnegie Hall Wednesday night. First it was the spotlights, aimlessly wandering around the stage, never quite catching up with the soloists, occasionally leaving the entire auditorium in darkness.

title: JERSEYANS LEARN YOU CAN GET THERE
description: Hundreds of thousands of New Jersey bus riders used alternative modes of travel without major difficulties again yesterday as the deadlock continued for the second day in the strike against Transport of New Jersey.

title: KLEINDIENST SAYS HE SET UP TALKS ON I. T. T. ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, March 2Acting Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst said today that he had played a role in events that led the Justice Department to drop three antitrust suits against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: Richey, Gimeno Win
description: HAMPTON, Va., March 2 (AP)  In the quarter final round of the 69th annual United States indoor tennis championships today, Cliff Richey, San Angelo, Tex., defeated George Govan, France, 75, 63, and Andres Gimeno, Spain, defeated Jim Connors, Belleville, Ill., 63, 76.

title: HOUSE UNIT TO STUDY DOWDY OUSTER MOVE
description: WASHINGTON, March (UPI)The House ethics committee voted 11 to 0 today to look into the bribery conviction. of Representative John Dowdy, Democrat of Texas, in the first step toward possible House action against him.

title: Hadfield Held Blameless In Striking of Linesman
description: MONTREAL, March 2 (UpI) Vic Hadfield of the New York Rangers has been absolved from further penalties in the incident in which a linesman, Atari Glaspell, was struck in the face during the Rangers California Golden Seals game last night in New York, the National Hockey League president, Clarence Campbell, announced today.

title: Genesco Executive Resigns
description: Ronald J. Wilhite has resigned as vice president of the national retail group of Genesco, Inc., it was announced yesterday by Franklin M. Jarman, Genesco's chairman. Mr. Wilhite, who joined. Genesco's Roos/Atkins store division in 1960 as a store manager, was named to his most recent post in 1970.

title: Narragansett Races Off
description: PAWTUCKET, R. I., March 2 (AP)Horse racing at Narragansett Park was canceled today because of a muddy track.

title: Equalizing of State Pensions Urged for Male and Female Teachers
description: ALBANY, March 2  A change in teachers pensions that would end a $2,800ayear advantage that the retired male has over the retired female teacher was proposed today before a legislative hearing on discrimination.

title: Candidates Day
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., March 2Senator George McGovern of South Dakota, sensing a surge of support in the New Hampshire Democratic Presidential primary, said again today that he felt voter sentiment in the state was almost evenly divided and indicated that he thought the race might now be neckandneck.

title: Cards, Minus Torre, Begin Full Drills
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 2Joe Torre, the best hitter in baseball last summer, continued his holdout as the St. Louis Cardinals opened full workouts today, with indications that his bidding had reached $145,000.

title: GAMBLER IS SLAIN IN POOL HALL HERE
description: Two gunmen wearing cashmere overcoats rubbed out a Brooklyn gambling figure in a crowded Bushwick pool hall early yesterday the police said.

title: Phil Donn, Former Head Of Dorothy Hubbs, Dies
description: Phil Donn, who retired as president of Dorothy Hubbs, Inc., dressmakers, 498 Seventh Avenue, six months ago, died yesterday in Miami. He was 72 years old.

title: DANCES OFFERED BY SALLY BOWDEN
description: Singing whales and chirping birds have had their turn and now the recorded wolf howl is being appropriated for concert dance accompaniment. Wednesday evening at the Cubiculo Sally Bowden presented two solo works, the longer of which was performed to the cries and barks of wolves alternating with short musical inserts.

title: HUMPHREY FAVORED BY UNION DELEGATES
description: PITTSBURGH, March 2 Delegates to the convention of the Pennsylvania Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations indicated today an overwhelming preference for Senator Hubert H. Humphrey for President in.a poll.

title: Askew Presses Busing Fight
description: TALLAHASSE, Fla., March 2 UPI)A spokesman for Gov. Reubin Askew said today that the Governor was soliciting contributions from Florida and outofstate sources to finance a paid advertising campaign to defeat the, antibusing amendment on the.Presidential primary ballot. DonPride, the: press secretary; said the paid campaign, Was separate from free time Governor Askew has requested for a statewide television speech against the straw vote question.

title: Pinto Station Wagon Price
description: DETROIT, March 2 (AP)The new Ford Pinto station wagon will carry a basic sticker price of $2,285, the Ford Motor Company announced today.

title: Store Sales Increase
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The Commerce Department today estimated last week's department store sales at $664million, up 10 per cent from the yearearlier $602million. Last week's total retail store sales were about $7,344,000,000, up 2 per cent from $7,224,000,000.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: STOCKS OFF A BIT AS RALLY FIZZLES
WELFARE CHECKS UNDER SCRUTINY
description: A fiveimonth examinatIon of a million welfare checks has produced $300,000 worth that city Social Services Department officials alleged yesterday were cashed illegally by a Brooklyn candy store that also dealt in narcotics.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FILMS Latenight shows in movie houses for those who can't stand to watch films on TV at home have long been a feature of Manhattan living. The latest fillip to this phenomenon is at the Playboy Theater, a firstrun feature house at 110 West 57th Street.

title: Age Fails to Dim Sparkle Of Eubie Blake at Piano
description: Eubie Blake seems to get better as the years go by It is hard to believe that Mr. Blake, who is now 89 could ever have performed with more zest and sparkle and exuberance or could have played the piano with more assurance and authority than he did Wednesday afternoon at Town Hall's weekly 5:45 Interlude.

title: Courts and Prisons Gain in City Budget
description: The city's courts, prisons and methadone treatment program are the only projects given new, nonmandatory money in Mayor Lindsay's proposed 1972.73 expense budget, according to Budget Director David A. Grossman.

title: Overcharging for Cereals Laid to General Mills
description: WASHINGTON, March 2American ,con'sumers may be paying exorbitant overcharges for vitaminfortified cereals, foodadditive expert told a Senate subcommittee today.

title: Housing Decline Expected
description: DETROIT, March (UPIThe housing market is in for a slight decline this year after brisk showing In 1971 largely because of an anticipated drop in subsidized starts, the advance Mortgage Company predicted today in a semiannual survey.

title: BROKER IS ARRESTED ON CHARGE OF LYING
description: John Forti, president of Gibraltor Investors, Inc,, an overthecounter brokerage house at 17 Battery Place, was arrested yesterday on a charge of lying about stock transactions, State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:There is a tendency in all of us to head for the sand to bury our heads when there is something bothering us that we need to avoid badly enough., What is alarming is how naively this ruse leads us to insist that the source of the bother no longer exists or never was, despite universal and overwhelming evidence to the contrary.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 50 Senators Urge Support for Radios Aimed at East Bloc
description: WASHINGTON, March 2More than 50 Senators joined today in the introduction of a resolution to put pressure on Senator J. W. Fulbright, chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, to drop his opposition to a House measure to finance Radio Liberty and Radio Free Europe and end a deadlock that threatens the future of the two Americancontrolled stations.

title: Frank Martin Is Back On the Winning Track
description: Sooner or later, Frank (Pancho) Martin was bound to start saddling winners at Aquedtict. He started yesterday.

title: SLIGHT GAIN MADE BY OTC AND AMEX
APOLLO 14 LINKED TO VAPOR OH MOON
description: HOUSTON,. March 2 (Reuters)  A computer study hes shown that water vapor detected on the moon last year could have come from urine dumped in lunar orbit from the Apollo 14 spaceship.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President conferred at the. Key Biscayne White House with Henry A. Kissinger, his special foreign affairs adviser, and several of his domestic aides. The President sent, his health message to Congress.

title: Bridge:  Even a Stroke at 65 Failed To Dim Casner'e Love of Game
description: The New York bridge scene lost a popular veteran last week when Ambrose Casner died at the age of 68. In spite of the effects of a stroke suffered three years earlier, he played the game to the end with his customary enthusiasm: A few days before his death he competed in a Greater New York Bridge Associationl tournament and won a minor event.

title: GINGER'S THE NAME GUMSHOE'S THE GAMEADVT
Romulus Hanover Dies
description: MONTREAL, March 2 (AP)Romulus Hanover, who set a Canadian harnessracing record in 1967 when he paced the mile in 1:57 15, has died.

title: Keeper of the City Purse Strings
STOKOWSKI CODA IS SECRET SHARED
description: At the end of his concert with the Ameriean Symphony Orchestra da Camera at Town Hall on Wednesday night Leopold Stokowski let the audience in on a secret he had been keeping for some six or seven decades.

title: Moscow Pledges Assistance to Dacca
description: MOSCOW, March 2The Soviet Union and Bangladesh signed two aid agreements today while Sheik Mujibur Rahman, the visiting Prime Minister of the new Bengali state, was received by Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist leader.

title: Control Is Lifted On Athlete Earnings In Extra Contests
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (AP)  The Pay Board unanimously exempted from its pay standards today the money professional athletes earn from playoff and allstar games.

title: TEXT OF MEMORANDUM
description: Following is the text of a purported memorandum froM Mrs. Dita D. Beard, a Washington lobbyist for the International Telephone and Telegraph Company, to W. R. Merriam, head of the company's Washington office, as released by Jack Anderson, the Washington columnist:

title: A Hearty Pot Roast With Lemon Flavor
Screen: 2 Leynse Films at the Whitney
description: The title makes it sound like a song rejected from South Pacific, but it is actually a location in the Sea of Japan and Humphrey Leynse's Out There a Lone Island, which opened yesterday at the Whitney Museum is set on the small Korean island of Ullungdo 140 miles off the coast of Korea.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Canada Blames Big 2 for Stand By China and France on ATests
description: GENEVA, March 2Canada charged today that the United StatesSoviet nuclear arms race was responsible for what she described as the evident lack of interest by China and France in accepting any limitation on their nuclear tests.

title: Excerpts From Mayor's Message on the 197273 Executive Budget
S F. Heckert Jr. Weds Mrs. Boger
description: SANTA. BARBARA, Calif., March 2Mrs., Elizabeth Rodgers Boger of Southport Conn. widow of Robert Forrester Boger was married here this afternoon to Sidney Frederick Heckert Jr., a widower of Santa Barbara.

title: Connecticut Lottery Gives Its 1st Prize In Special Drawing
description: Herman C. Yellen, a 59yearold wholesale liquor company executive who says he has no financial difficulties, yesterday became the first winner of the Connecticut State, Lottery's superprize of $75,000.

title: Britain Is Softening Ulster Jail Tactics
description: LONDON, March 2  The British Government decided today to prohibit harsh interrogation methods used by its security forces against suspects detained in Northern Ireland.

title: Brooklyn Urges Rise in Cultural Funds
description: Leaders of Brooklyn's cultural life, in tones ranging from despair to resignation, told a state commission yesterday that the borciugh',s institutions were being shortchanged on public funds.

title: Rocky Road to College Aid...
description: Senate approval of the higher education aid bill unfortunately means less than the $20 billion that meets the eye. The amount of money dangled before the hardpressed universities stands in marked contrast to the depressing estimates of the actual allocationssomewhere around $200 millionthat the Administration believed ready to earmark for direct institutional aid, if the bill survives.

title: Rackelshaus May Ran For Indiana Governor
description: WASHINGTON, March 2William D. Ruckelshaus, administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, is giving serious consideration to leaving his post in order to run as a Republican candidate for the governorship of Indiana.

title: DAYCARE CENTERS FACING A WALKOUT
description: A strike authorization was voted last night by Local 1707 of the Community and Social Agency Employes after efforts to negotiate a new contract between the management of cityfinanced daycare centers and 2,200 employes were reported deadlocked.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Hamilton Brothers Exploration Company a new affiliate of the Hamilton Brothers Petroleum CorPoration, made an offering of 1.2 Million units Of Common stockand warrants through a Syndicete headed by Moygan Stanley & Co. The units, pribed at $25 apiece, were sold finance oil and gas expleration.

title: Ads in Selling of President Musical Irk McGinniss
description: PHILADELPHIA March 2Joe McGinniss author of The Selling of the President, is far from sold on the musical version of the book now trying out here and scheduled to open March 28 on Broadway.

title: U. S. Officials Say Recognition Of Bangladesh Is Being Planned
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 Senior foreign policy officials of the Nixon Administration said today that the United States was preparing to recognize Bangladesh within four to six weeks.

title: House in New Hampshire Rejects Income Tax Plan
description: CONCORD, N.H., March 2The New Hampshire House turned down 217 to 154, today the second attempt by Gov. Walter R. Peterion to pass an income tax

title: TV: Brinkley Speaking, Out Increasingly on Issues
description: David Brinkley is a radical. He admits it. He also admits he may have become more conservative in some ways, but it is the extent and depth of his radicalization that is surprising, even to himself at times.

title: SENATE APPROVES HOUSING PROGRAM AIDING BIG CITIES
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The Senate passed today a major housing bill that includes consolidation of urban grants. a feature that could. result in more Federal assistance to large cities and much more flexibility in the use of the money on the local level

title: TWO TITLES WON BY SOVIET SKIERS
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., March 2On another warm day that caused one French skater to remark,"The water on the rink, it is flowing like wine, and a Russian skier to comment, The water, it is flowing like the Volga, the Soviet, Union dominated the world University Winter Games crosscountry relays today.

title: Ohlsson Takes an Unusual Recital Route
U.S. TO STUDY LAW ON UNFAIR TRADE
description: WASHINGTON, March. 2 William Eberle, the Presi dent's Special Representative for Trade Negotiations, announced today a fullscale study aimed at establishing Government policy for administering the section of the basic trade law dealing with unfair trade; praptices.

title: BRITISH RESERVES AT FEBRUARY PEAK
description: LONDON, March 2Britain's official reserves increased by $11million in February and stood at a record level of $6,991,000,000, at the end of the month, the Treasury said today.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: HONG KONGAccording to the Hong Kong China watchers' scale, President Nixon's Peking picnic was a modest success diplomatically although, as coming events may prove, it had immense significance in American politics.

title: Herbert Feis, Historian, Dies; Awarded Pulitzer Prize in 61
description: Herbert Feis, the former academic economist and government adviser who won a Pulitzer Prize in 1961 for his history; of the Potsdam conference, between War and Peace, died yesterday at a residential hotel in Winter Park, Fla. He was 78 years old.

title: CREDITS GIVEN INDIA, ZAIRE AND INDONESIA
description: The International Development Association, the softloan affiliate of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, said yesterday that it had approved four credits totaling $79.3million for conomic development projects in India, Zaire and Indonesia.

title: MRS. CORNELIUS FLYNN
description: Mrs. Helen Kelly Flynn, a partner with her husband, Cornelius L. Flynn, in the law firm of Flynn & Flynn, 200 Park Avenue, died yesterday at her home, 15 Bridal Way, Palisade, N. J. Her age was 71.

title: PRICES OF BONDS CONTINUE TO RISE
Books of The Times
description: Our specialized society has evolved new kind of book: one that translates our behavior into the modalities and the terminology of a particular discipline and in so doing provokes in us a sudden and often deceptive shock of recognition. Finding ourselves described in new terms we assume that we are being seen and understood in new Ways. The paraphernalia of science upstages our common sense, and before we know it, we are in the embrace of, a fad. Marshall MacLuhan's books, Charles Reich's Greening of America, the works of Marx and Freud and of the Existentialists are all guilty, in varying degrees, of this kind of translation.

title: LOUIS SAIFF JR.
description: WATERTOWN, N. Y., March 2Louis Saiff Jr., retired general manager of the Brockway Company, publisher of The Watertown Daily Times, died Saturday of a coronary ailment. His age was 65.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Best of Times May Come In I.C.4A for Joe Savage
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March Last spring, during a freshman English class, Joe Savage came to grips with Waiting for Godot, the Samuel Beckett classic.

title: MONSANTO RAISES PRICE OF CHEMICAL
description: The Monsanto Company said yesterday that its industrial chemicals unit had raised prices of ethyl vanillin by $1 a pound to a new base price of $8.75 a pound in 100pound quantities and over, effective immediately.

title: Otis Lee Wiese, Former Editor Of McCall's Magazine, Is Dead
description: Otis Lee Wiese, former editor and publisher of McCall's magazine and a former director and vice president of the McCall Corporation, died yesterday at the University Club here, where he was living. He was 67 years old.

title: Candidates Day
description: DOVER, N. H., March 2Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, appealed to the voters of neighboring New Hampshire today to disregard the overtones of the Presidential primary campaign and give his candidacy a vote of confidence on Tuesday.

title: Marcos Awaits Arrival
description: MANILA, March 2  President Ferdinand E. Marcos said tonight, on the eve of the arrival of Assistant Secretary Green, that he was eager to be briefed on plans of an American phaseout from Southeast Asia reportedly discussed in Peking.

title: Social Security Card in 1st Grade Asked
Rangers Down Sabres For Sixth Straight,43
L.I. Lighting Reports Rise In Its earnings for 1971
description: MINEOLA, L.I., March 2, The Long Island Lighting Company reported a 15 per cent a share increase in earnings during 1971, the 19th successive year in which earnings rose; according to the company's annual report. Earnings are now $2.11 a share.

title: January Textile Imports High
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (AP) The flow of textile imports into the United States was heavy in January, the Government said today.

title: France Holds 6% Rate
description: PARIS, March 2 (UPI)The Bank of France today maintained its discount rate of per cent despite expectations it would slash it.

title: Poll in Florida Shows Big Edge for Wallace
Senate Panel Concludes Inquiry Into Amnesty for Draft Evaders
description: WASHINGTON, March 2A Senate subcOmmittee took a fleeting look this week into the question of amnesty for the men who have evaded the draft or deserted from the armed forces during the war in Indochina.

title: Democrats Ask State to Reform Its Higher Education Policies
description: ALBANY March 2A task force of Democratic Assemblymen called today for sweeping changes in the state's highereducation policies and practices including the cancellation of State University tuition increases scheduled to be imposed this summer.

title: A MONETARY SETUP REVISED FOR E.E.C.
description: BRUSSELS, March 2 The Common Market Commission today put forward new proposals to revive the European community's plans for creating economic and monetary union. Those plans were stalled last year by the world monetary crisis.

title: Health Services Aide Named
description: Dr. June Christmas, head of Harlem Hospital's psychiatric rehabilitation facility, was appointed first deputy commissioner of mental health and mental retardation services yesterday by the city Health Services Administrator, Gordon Chase. In her new $34,710ayear post, Dr. Christmas will have primary responsibility for planning policy and developing programs and analyses.

title: Market Aide to Stand For Election in Italy
description: BRUSSELS, March 2Franco Maria Malfatti, the 44yearold president of the Common Market Commission, announced today that he would leave his post March 22 to take part in the Italian general election scheduled for May 7.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on Colonialism 10:30 A.M.

title: Community Advocates. Balm for Aggrieved in Harlem
description: When Harlem's new, innovative Small Claims Court opened last December, court officials expected to get about six to eight complainants a day.

title: DOCTOR TESTIFIES AT ULSTER INQUIRY
description: COLERAINE, Northern Ire land, March 2A Northern Ireland medical officer testified today that six of the 13 men killed by British paratroopers in Londonderry on Jan. 30 had been carrying weapons.

title: Musician Founds Group To Bring City Harmony,
description: The best music I can think of today is the vibration between people. That's a lot more music to me now than the vibration on the string of a violin or a guitar.

title: U.S. Ends Alert
description: SAIGON, March 2 (Reuters)The United States command ended today the special alert that had confined to barracks all American troops not on essential missions for the last three weeks. South Vietnamese forces, however, remained on partial alert.

title: Moroccan King Prepares To Give Up Some Powers
description: RABAT, Morocco, March 2After the voters adoption of Morocco's third Constitution in nine years, King Hassan II prepared today to hand over some of his powers to the Government and Parliament and to tackle problems arising since the attempt by army elements last summer to overthrow him.

title: Factory Inventories Up $200Million in January
