description: WASHINGTON, March 2  Manufacturers inventories rose $200million in January after remaining essentially flat in 1971, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: PASARELL UPSETS LAYER IN TENNIS
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., March 2 (UPI)  Charles Pasarell of Puerto Rico broke Rod Laver's string of 15 match victories in a row tonight with an upset over the Australian star, 63, 36, 76, in the $50,000 Saga Bay tennis classic.

title: British Protest 6Year Term Given a Boy, 14, in Turkey
description: LONDON, March 2Britons reacted with shock and outrage today to the prison sentence of six years and three months imposed by a Turkish court yesterday on a 14yearold English schoolboy convicted of selling hashish.

title: Yablonski Slayer Sentenced to Die In Electric Chair
description: WASHINGTON Pa March 2  A jury of fiVe, women and seven men today sentenced Paul E. Gilly to death in the state's electric chair for the 1969 murders of Joseph A. Yablonski the United Mine Workers insurgent, and his wife and daughter.

title: Boxers'
description: The State Athletic Commission reversed its longstanding policy yesterday and decided to permit properly accredited women journalists into dressing rooms at boxing and wrestling matches,

title: Busing Held Key Issue for Blacks in Florida Primary
Indians Seeking Autonomy Cite Bangladesh
description: MADRAS, India  The ruling party in this southern state of Tamil Nadu has launched a Bangladeshstyle autonomy movement, causing a national furor.

title: U.S. Presses Demands
description: Harold C. Passer, Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Economic Affairs, said yesterday the United States needs more concessions from the Japanese because of the continuing American trade deficit. He spoke at a luncheon meeting of the Japan Society here.

title: ILLEGAL SHIPPING IS LAID TO 2 HERE
description: Two executives of a Long Island electronics concern were arraigned in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday on charges of illegally shipping $75,000 worth of oscilloscopes to Belgium to be forwarded to a European Communist country, which was not identified in the court papers.

title: CHINA TRADE DEALS ANNOUNCED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (Reuters)The United States today announced approval of the first trade deals with China since President Nixon returned from Peking Monday.

title: MRS. ONASSIS HELD A PUBLIC FIGURE
description: Judge Irving Ben Cooper declared in Federal Court here yesterday that It would be normal for photographers to want to take pictures of Mrs. Aristotle Onassis.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: MAN, W. Va., March 2 (Reuters)  Mobile homes were moved today into some of the coal towns devastated in last Saturday's disaster. They will serve as temporary quarters for many of the estimated 4,000 people left homeless.

title: Puerto Rico Plans Promotion Abroad To Woo Investment
description: Puerto Rico will begin promotion this year of industrial investment there by companies based in Western Europe and Japan, Manuel A. Casiano, head of the island commonwealth's Industrial ElevelopMent Administration, said yesterday.

title: MONEY. SUPPLY UP Al FASTER PACE
John Dykstra, President of Ford Alter McNamara, Is Dead at 73
description: SOUTHFIELD, Mich., March 2 (AP) .John Dykstra, former president of the. Ford Motor ComPany, died today at the age of 73.

title: UPPER CASE FIRST IN FLORIDA DERBY
Clearer Prospectuses Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (AP) The Financial Analysts Federation recommends that more detailed, improved disclosures be required in prospectuses of companies that want to go public.

title: Republic Steel Cites Lag For Bolt, and Nut Division
description: CLEVELAND, March 2 (UPI) The Republic. Steel Corporation said today that a lack of profitability caused in large part by fdreign competition, threatens the continued operation of its bolt and nut division.

title: Cypriote Synod Urges Makarios to Resign as President of Island
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, March 2Archbishop Makarios was called upon today by members of the Holy Synod of the Cypriote Orthodox Church to resign as President of Cyprus, a position he has held since, the island gained independence from Britain in 1959.

title: Candidates Day
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., May 2A polite reception from the Florida Legislature and an endorsement by the Governor of North Dakota; capped a day of hard campaigning here by Senator Hubert Humphrey.

title: Dock Workers Reactions To Early Pension Awaited
description: One of the many uncertainties hanging over the proposed contract settlement between the International Longshoremen's Association and stevedore interests is the way dock workers here will react to the prospect of a oneshot early retirement program. The offer that I.L.A. members are scheduled to vote on next Wednesday includes the prospect of retirement at $300 a month for men who are age 50 and have 20 years service, and retirement at $350 a month for 25 years service at age 55.

title: Meat Inspection Criticized
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (AP)Thetonly veterinarian In the House, Representative John Melchor, said today that meat inspection As so, lax that his family eats no:cuts that cannot be inspected in their home before it is cooked. The Montana Democrat said in a House speech that inspection of imported meat is so slipshod and inadequate that we do not use any meat or meat products which might contain imported meats.

title: Davis Trial Seats a Preliminary Panel
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., March 2For the first time? the jury box was full today in the courtroom here where Angela Davis is being tried on charges of murder, kidnapping and criminal conspiracy.

title: Issues in Jersey Bus Strike
description: PARTIESTransport of New Jersey, formerly Public Service Coordinated Transport, is the state's largest bus company, operating 2,500 buses on 140 routes in 405 municipalities in 20 of the 21 counties, plus 30 trolley cars in the Newark City Subway. The company, which transports 700,000 fares a day, also carries passengers into New York City, Philadelphia and as far west as Allentown, Pa.

title: No, This One Is Not Szechuan It's Fukienese
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: REALTY MEN MAKE LOAN PLAN OFFER
description: A proposal that the real estate industry take over the Municipal Loan Program was made yesterday to Mayor Lindsay and the City Council which has been investigating the program.

title: Green Arrives in Taipei
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 2 (Reuters)  Assistant Secretary of State Marshall Green arrived from Seoul today to brief Chinese Nationalist leaders on President Nixon's visit to mainland China.

title: MORE ARRESTS DUE IN MAJOR DRUG CASE
description: Further arrests are expected shortly in connection with Federal grand jury investigation into a multimilliondollar marijuanasmuggling operation involving customs employes and others who work at Kennedy International Airport, Federal authorities reported yesterday.

title: Recognition Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (AP)  A resolution urging President Nixon to recognize Bangladesh was approved by a House Foreign Affairs subcommittee today, 6 to 1. Representative Cornelius E. Gallagher, Democrat of New Jersey, said he hoped to get full Foreign Affairs Committee action on the resolution in the next two weeks.

title: South Koreans Briefed
description: SEOUL, South Korea, March 2Assistant Secretary Green assured South Korean leaders today that President Nixon did not make any secret deals on Korea during his visit to Peking.

title: Soviet Is Said to Dismantle Some of Its Older Missiles
Pennsy Subsidiary Reaches an Accord On Revising Debts
description: The Great Southwest Corporation, a subsidiary of the Pennsylvania Company, announced yesterday that it had reached agreements with representatives of, its major domestic and foreign creditors to extend maturities on its debt in excess of $100million.

title: C.B.S. Will Televise Its Pilots As Three 90Minute Specials
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System has come up with new idea in the growing network practice of amortizing expensive investment in pilot films for each new season through advance airing as primetime specials or movies.

title: Gilbert's 68 Sets Pace By Stroke in Doral Golf
City Rule Proposed To Help Consumer In Suits on Cheating
description: Consumer Affairs Commissioner Bess Myerson proposed a new city regulation yesterday that would force merchants to list the corporate or partnership name on their sales slips.

title: Spiders Kill 4 in Brazil
description: ARACAJU, Brazil, March 2 (UPI)Black widow spiders have killed four persons and sent three to hospitals in Sergipe , State, it was reported today.

title: MORRIS HALPERN, 42, RABBI IN MONTREAL
description: MONTREAL, March 2Rabbi Morris Halpern, spiritual leader of the Beth Ora Congregation, died of a heart attack yesterday. He was 42 yeazs old.

title: Market Place:
description: PARIS, March 2The Credit Lyonnais offers paradise to the American in France with a bundle who wants his money managed by banks and not brokers.

title: Squires Said to Make McAdoo Top Secret A.B.A. Draft Pick
description: Bob McAdoo, a 6foot9Irich junior forward from the University of North Caroline, was the first player chosen in the secret  American Basketball Association college draft yesterday, The Associated, Press reported.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Needham Sees Decision by Congress Possible on Institutional Ties
description: James J. Needham, a member of the Securities and Exchange Commission, said yesterday that Congress ultimately might decide the controversial matter of institutional membership on the nation's stock exchanges.

title: Contented Colonials
description: One of the strange things of life in the modern world is that there are some people who like to be colonies of treat Britain, British Foreign Secretary Sir Alec DouglasHome observed the other day in Madrid.

title: Danbury Inmates to Meet Today With U.S. Aide on Grievances
description: A top official of the United States Bureau of Prisons will meet today with a committee of inmate representatives at the Federal Correctional Institution in Danbury, Conn, where an inmate work stoppage has crippled operations.

title: Kennan Now Backs An Agency in U.N. On World Pollution
description: George F. Kennan, who had, been the leading advocate o the argument that only developed countries could solve the world's environmental problems, lent his support yesterday to the United Nations Conference on the Human Environment, which would involve all nations, developed and under developed.

title: Dr. Ronan T apes On An. Aged Rail Shed And Ends Up Loser
description: Demolishing parts of an old railroad can be as frustrating as building a new one, Metropolitan Transportation Authority officials discovered yesterday.

title: Rescue Workers Try To Reach Boy in Hole
description: EL MONTE, Calif., March 2 (AP)A 5yearold boy fell into a narrow hole today while playing near a highway construction project. Rescue workers sank a shaft nearby and began tunneling toward the boy.

title: Notes on People
description: President Nixon nominated Maj. Gen. Vernon A. Walters an Army intelligence officer who speaks eight languages for the important post of Deputy Director of the Central Intelligence Agency. The 55yearold general, who has frequently served as an inIF for the President will succeed Lieut. Gen. Robert E. Cushman Jr., who stepped down to become commandant of the Marine Corps. General Walters is currently senior military attache in the Embassy, in Paris. If confirmed by the Senate for the new post he will hold the rank of lieutenant general.

title: BLOOD BANK STUDY ORDERED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 President Nixon announced in a message to Congress today that he had directed the Departnient of Health, Education and Welfare to recommend to me as soon as possible a plan for developing a safe, fast and efficient nationwide blood collection and distributIon system.

title: Gulf &
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 2Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., intends to concentrate on consumeroriented acquisitions in the future, Charles G. Bluhdorn, chairman, said here today.

title: SHOEMAKER SETS A STAKES RECORD OF 555 VICTORIES
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March (UPI)Bill Shoemaker established a career stakes winning mark today when he rode Royal Owl to victory by nearly length inthe $54,850 San Jacinto Stakes at Santa Anita.

title: B'nai B'rith Says State U. Discriminates
description: The AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith accused the State University cif New York at Albany yesterday of having distorted Federal employmentopportunity guidelines by establishing tablishing a program of racial quotas or preferential treatment for members of minority groups and for women.

title: Birth Rates Found Ina Sharp Decline Among Poor Women
description: WASHINGTON, March 2Birth rates among lowerincome women declined so sharply, in the. late nineteensixties that they bore a million fewer children than they would have at the earlier rates, according to a new private study of Census Bureau data.

title: The I.T.T. Hearings
description: The circumstances surrounding settlement of the antitrust suit against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation last year and the degree of involvement of high Justice Department officials in making that settlement require more extended investigation by the Senate Judiciary Committee. At stake is not only the nomination of Richard G. Kleindienst to be Attorney General but alsoand more importantthe integrity departmental procedures under the retiring Attorney General, John Mitchell.

title: 4 Die in German Train Crash
description: MUNICH, West Germany, March 2 (Reuters)  Two oiltank trains collided and exploded outside a main railway station near here tonight, killing at least four persons. Htindreds of people fled their homes when about 15 cars loaded with oll exploded at Ingolstadt, about 50 miles north of here.

title: Nuclear Energy Drives HeartAid Pump in Calf
description: WASHINGTON, March. 2The first use of nuclear energy to power an artificial heart pump in a living animal was announced today by the. National Heart and Lung Institute.

title: India Is Critical
description: CALCUTTA, India, March 2 (AP)Prime Minister Indira Gandhi today condemned the reference to the Kashmir ceasefire line in the NixonChou joint communique and said it amounted to blatant interference in the internal affairs of India.

title: Rail Carloadings Decline
description: WASHINGTON, March 2The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic in the holiday week ended Feb. 26 totaled an estimated 14 billion tonmiles, 4 per cent below the corresponding nonholiday week last year. Carloadings totaled 461,590, down 9.2 per cent. The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported the week's tonnage dropped 6.0 per cent.

title: COUNCILMAN HIT IN NEWARK RIFT
description: NEWARK, March 2A black City, Councilman slapped the white Council president across the face today as the Council; split along racial lines, debated salary increases for city officials.

title: Thaler's Trial Is Opened Here; Knowledge of Theft Is at Issue
description: Seymour R. Thaler went on trial in Federal Court here yesterday as prosecution and defense agreed that the case hinged on whether the former State Senator had known he was dealing with stolen securities when he sold United States Treasury. bills in 1970.

title: Rogers Political Role Endorsed by Mitchell
In a Wing of the Elysee President Pompidop pts for Modern
description: PARISIn a country largely content to live with traditional furniture, often inherited from one's parents and grandparents, President and Mrs. Georges Pompidou have just given a powerful boost to contemporary design by having four rooms of the Elysee Palace redecorated.

title: Red Smith
description: A man in a bright pink shirt said to a man with Adolphe Menjou mustaches The six horse, had to be tons the best. He got left and still got up for third. Frowning, he rechecked the past performance figures on the three horse, a $21.80 winner named Tropical Sunset. How could you bet him? A firsttime starter, and he don't even show a work.

title: MRS. WALTER A. THOMAS
description: PALMERTON, Pa., March 2 Mrs. Sara Buckland Thomas, widow of Walter A. Thomas, former head of the oxide division of the New Jersey Zinc Company, died today at the age of 84.

title: What Right to Strike?
description: In commenting on the recent West Coast dock strike [on the OpEd page of Feb. 8], George Meany made a powerful but, it seems to me, wholly mistaken defense of the right to strike as a basic and unlimited right in a free society. Mr. Meany's intractable position in this mattera position shared by many othersis based on at least three fallacies:

title: FIGHT THREATENS G.O.P.IN ASSEMBLY
description: ISLIP, L. I., March 2Republican control of the next State Assembly was threatened today by a controversy brewing in remote Long Island Assembly district.

title: Mills Almost Shows Up At New Hampshire Rally
U.S. Deaths 6 in Week
description: SAIGON, March 2 (UPI)The weekly casualty, report issued by the United States command said today that six Americans were killed in action last week, the highest toll thus far this year. This was an increse of four over the previous week.

title: Candidates Day
description: MIAMI, March 2  Senator Henry M. Jackson tailed today for increased Federal spending in educating and training retarded children and urged expanded efforts in medical re. search to assist them.

title: Making the Case for Speedy Trials
description: Hers is a street scene that could happen next week. It is the end of the day for the neighborhood grocer and his wifeand the beginning of an ordeal. The elderly couple are held up at gunpoirit by a young man. He escapes with the day's receipts but is observed fleeing by a passerby who thinks he recognizes him as someone from the neighborhood.

title: Uruguayan Devaluation Set by New Government
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 2 (Reuters)Uruguay's new Government effectively devalued the peso today by fixing it at 495 to. the United States dollar for exports and 1500 for imports on the, commercial money market, the central bank announced.

title: KENNEY SIGNS PACT; ALL YANKS IN FOLD
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 2;Jerry Kenney finally signed his contract today, giving the Yankees a complete roster of signed players. That may be the only area in which the New Yorkers beat Baltimore this year.

title: Rogers Assures Taiwan On Defense Commitment
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 The Chinese Nationalist Ambassador, James C. H. Shen, said today that he had been assured by Secretary of State William P. Rogers that the United States remained committed to the 1954 defense treaty with Taiwan.

title: Stage: Magic View of Twelfth Night
BILL FOR AID FUNDS IS VOTED IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (AP) The Senate completed action today on a $3.2billion foreign aid appropriation bill, ending a fourmonth Congressional battle. The rollcall vote was 45 to 36.

title: ...and Caution on Busing
description: The political and emotional whirlwind that has buffeted the school busing issue threatens destruction any legislation associated with it. This is as true of the proposed $1.5 billion assistance to school districts which are in the process of desegregation as of the entirely unrelated higher education aid bill.

title: Executive Changes
description: William R. White has been promoted to executive vice president and Joseph C. Wolf to senior vice president at the Emigrant Savings Bank.

title: Craft Denies Distortions In Views on Stravinsky
description: Only two people know anything about Stravinsky, Robert Craft said Wednesday in an interview about Lillian Libman's forthcoming memoirs of the composer's final years. Only Mrs. Stravinsky and I know. Nobody else can come in now and say what happened. I'll be arrogant and say that.

title: American Planes Strike In the North and in Laos
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, March 3 (AP)American fighterbombers struck inside North Vietnam and Laos yesterday in exchanges of fire with enemy antiaircraft defenses, and an Air Force light reconnaissance plane was shot down over southern Laos, United States military spokesmen said.

title: Before the Trials, What?; More people spend time in pretrial jails than in postconviction prisons.
description: NEW HAVENThe Site Selection Board of New York City is scheduled to decide whether to authorize the purchase for $1.5 million of a single block in Manhattan, across from the overcrowded Tombs, for a second men's house of detention. From this small beginning, an error of historic dimensions may evolve.

title: Crop Curtailed, Soviet May Bay U.S. Grain
description: MOSCOW, March 3  Western economists believe the setback dealt to the winter grain crop by an, unusual cold wave across the Soviet south has increased prospects for a new Soviet purchase of American grain, possibly when President Nixon visits Moscow late in May.

title: Moscow Is Curious
description: MOSCOW, March 3  A public lecture titled Will the Leaning Tower of Pisa Fall? drew about 70 people here the other day.

title: MILLS PROPOSES OWN HEALTH PLAN
description: ATLANTA, March 3Representative Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, outlined today plans for a national health insurance project that he said would assure adequate protection for those who need help while avoiding spending public funds for those who do not need it.

title: St. John's Wins 4 Events In Metropolitan Swimming
description: St. John's registered four victories in Section I of the Metropolitan collegiate swimming championships at Queens College last night to take a wide lead over Monmouth College in the team standing. St. John's has 327 points entering the final day of the threeday meet. Monmouth is next with 235 points.

title: General Tells Inquiry in Ulster That the Troops Expected Trouble
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 3  The British Army commander in Northern Ireland, Maj. Gen, Robert Ford, said today that there tad been no plan to Three a confrontation. with the lrish Republican Army at the time of the Londonderry killings.

title: China, in U.N., Assails U.S.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 3  China charged the United States today with forcibly occupying Taiwan and conspiring with Japan to give her control of a number of Islands in the East China Sea claimed by china.

title: AUTO SALES SET RECORD IN MONTH
BRYDHES OFFERS TUITIONAID BILL
description: ALBANY, March 3  Senate Majority Leader Earl W. Brydges introduced a bill today to expand the state's tuitionloan program for college and university students and provide loans for students cur. rently excluded from the program because of their family's relatively high income.

title: Solomon Disputes Reuss on Hunt Report
description: A member of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers clashed yesterday with a leading Democratic Congressman over the report of the Presidential Commission on Financial Structure and Regulation.

title: Candidates'
description: LITTLETON, N.H., March 3 (AP)Mayor Sam Yorty of Los Angeles called today, for an intensified allout educational program at the high school level aimed at eradicating drug abuse.

title: Son of Mufti of Jerusalem Charged in British Slayings
description: BLACKPOOL, England, March 3 (AP)Dr. Ahmad Alami, 32 years old, son of the Mufti of Jerusalem, was charged in Magistrates Court today with stabbing three child patients to death at a hospital here Feb. 17.

title: Japan to Bar Military Craft From Commercial Air Lanes
description: TOKYO, March 3 (Reuters)The Japanese Government decided today to ban military aircraft from commercial air lanes.

title: BLACK HAWKS SAVE 44 TIE WITH SEALS
description: OAKLAND, Calif., March 3 (UPI)Pit Martin's 15footer with less than seven minutes remaining gave the Chicago Black Hawks a 44 tie tonight with the California Golden Seals.

title: WBAI HEAD JAILED IN CONTEMPT CASE
description: Edwin A. Goodman, general manager of radio station WBAI, was sentenced to 30 days in jail yesterday for contempt of court for refusing to turn over to the Manhattan District Attorney's office the tapes of its broadcast of the uprisings in the Manhattan House of Detention for Men in October, 1970.

title: Notes on People
description: Martin Sivelg top aide John W. McCortimck when Mr. McCormack was Speaker of the House, was sentenced to three years in prison for bribersy and Conapiracy.

title: Coast Boy, 6, Rescued From Shaft
description: EL MONTE, Calif., March 3 (AP) s A 6yearold boy was freed from a narrow, deep.dirt shaft today after being trapped nearly seven hours underground.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Deputy Mayor Timothy W. Costello lifted yesterday his order barring two major drug companies from doing business with the city because they had failed to comply with the city's antidiscrimination employment policy.

title: Lawrence Memorial Set
description: A memorial service for William H. Lawrence, national affairs editor of A.B.C. News and former White House correspondent of The New York Times, will be held Thursday at noon in the National Press Club in Washington. Mr. Lawrence, who was 56 years old, died Thursday of a heart attack in Manchester, N. H., while covering the New Hampshire primary.

title: 2 Soviet Speed Skaters Triumph at Lake Placid
G.O.P. Leaders Confident As Capital Meeting Ends
Condor Captures Yachting Series In the Bahamas
KINKS FROM ENGLAND STAR AS ROCK GROUP
description: It was good.to see and hear the Kinks back at Carnegie Hall Thursday night. Their last appearance there was a musical and personal fiasco of such diMensions that it was easy. to question whether they would survive as at group.

title: British Act on Dumping of Poison Waste
description: LONDON, March 3The British Government announced a renewed war against the polIluter today and promised stiff penalties against anyone dumping dangerous wastes on land. Peter Walker, Secretary of State for the Environment, introduced a bill in the House of Commons under which irresponsible dumpers face a fiveyear jail sentence, an unlimited fine, or both. At present the penalty for dumping poisonous wastes on land is a fine equivalent to $260.

title: Report on Moon's Vapor Is Disputed by Scientist
description: A scientist at Bellcomm, Inc., took issue yesterday with a Reuters news agency report from Houston that a Bellcomm computer study had indicated that water vapor detected on the moon last year could have come from urine ejected in lunar orbit from the Apollo 14 spaceship.

title: Pendulum Reverses an Gray Flannel Is Back
description: Where have all the, hippies gone? There was. this men's fashion show yesterday at Alexander's, the one department store pad where you can count on real cool threads, and what happens? The models came out looking like nice British gentlemen or the grayflunneled types of Harry Truman's day. What's more, they start out by singing about tradition, parodying the song from Fiddler on the Roof. Tradition  or classicism  was the store's message to men for spring and summer. To get the press audience in the mood, the store served its idea of a traditional British breakfast and perfumed the entire third floor with the smell of kippers.

title: KENNETH A. BONHAM OF HOME PRODUCTS
description: Kenneth A. Bonham, the retired executive vice president of American Home Products, died Tuesday at his residence in LauderdalebytheSea, Fla., after a heart attack. He was 68 years old.

title: Rosewall Tops Taylor
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., March 3 (AP)Australian Ken Rosewall outlasted England's Roger Taylor, 63, 67, 62, in a twohour match today to advance to the semifinals of the $50,000 Saga Bay tennis tournament.

title: LETTERS ARE READ TO BERRIGAN JURY
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 3 A proposal to kidnap Henry A. Kissinger, an adviser to President Nixon, opens the door to murder, the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan warned a New York nun, according to letters introduced by the Government today at the antiwar conspiracy trial of the priest and six other defendants.

title: Paintings by Walt Kuhn On View at the Kennedy
description: The fewvery fewstrong pictures in the exhibition of paintings and watercolors by Walt Kuhn now on view at the Kennedy Galleries, 20 East 56th Street, do little to strengthen his reputation, especially for the work of his later years. Kuhn, who died in 1949 at the age of 72, was a participant in the historic 1913 Armory Show that started modernism in America. Though not, by any means, the most radical member of the vanguard, Kuhn was an accomplished and interesting painter. An avid circus buff, he is known particularly for his paintings of clowns and circus performers. His reputation, like that of many painters of his generation, is, at the moment, up for reexamination. My own view is that he was an able draftsman, though a frequently diffident and uneven painter. The strongest case to be made for Kuhn, it seems to me, would have to he made on the basis of only his best work

title: 2 Retail Chains Will Close Here;
description: Two of the bestknown men's apparel store chains in the New York metropolitan areaBroadstreet's and Weber & Heilbronerannounced yesterday that they were going out of business, marking another major failure on the New York retailing scene.

title: HOUSE CHIEFS ASK HIGHER PAY FLOOR
description: WASHINGTON, March 3House Democratic leaders have renewed their drive to pry from the Rules Committee a bill that could provide pay increases for millions of America's lowestpaid workers.

title: GIMENO, NANTES GAIN IN DOUBLES
description: HAMPTON, Va., March 3 (AP)The topseeded team of Andres Gimeno and Manuel Orantes of Spain advanced into the doubles final of a $35,000 indoor tennis tournament today with the thirdseeded duo of Ilie Nastase and Ian Tiriac of Rumania.

title: Kiss Costs Man $500
description: CAMDEN, N. J., March 2 (AP) John Carbonaro, 39 years old, of nearby Cherry Hill, has been fined $500 by a Federal judge after pleading no defense to charge of grabbing and kissing a stewardess for Trans World Airlines last November on flight from Philadelphia to Los Angeles. Mr. Carbonaro allegedly kissed the stewardess, Linda Lee Sarver of Madra, Calif., on the arm as she passed his seat.

title: MERGER PLAN BACKED BY LONDON EXCHANGE
description: LONDON, March 3The London Stock Exchange announced today that its members had approved by a vote of 2,152 to 442 a plan to amalgamate with the six provincial exchanges now operating in Britain and Ireland,

title: KURT GROSSMANN, A CORRESPONDENT
description: Kurt R. Grossmann, journalist and former president of the German League for Human Rights, died Thursday of a heart attack in St. Petersburg, Fla., where he was vacationing with his wife. He was 74 years old and lived at 8246 Lefferts Boulevard, Kew Gardens, Queens.

title: Hughes Case Stirs Forensic Unit
description: ATLANTA, March 3The fact that handwriting experts incorrectly identified letters and check endorsements as having been written by Howard R. Hughes, the billionaire, has aroused considerable concern at the annual meeting of the Anierican Academy of Forensic Scientists here.

title: Candidates Day
description: ATLANTA, March 3 (AP)Representative Shirley Chisholm, campaigning for the Democratic Presidential nomination, urged members of Spelman College audience today to run as delegates committed to her in state party delegate caucuses.

title: Governor. Ponders Delay on Approval Of OTB in Upstate
description: ALBANY, March 3 (UPI)Governor Rockefeller's office confirmed today that serious consideration was being given to a moratorium on approving offtrack betting plans upstate.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your recent editorial Threat to White Cloud Peaks treats most cavalierly the contribution American Smelting and Refining Company (Asarco) has made to the known wealth of this country through its discovery of a major, lowgrade deposit of molybdenum in the Little Boulder Creek valley of Challis County, Idaho. The United States is richer for our having disclosed the existence of this deposit for it will now be available in time of future need. Molybdenum is a vital raw material, used primarily as an alloying element in high performance steels.

title: COURT RULES HISS CAN GET PENSION
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (AP) Alger Hiss a central figure in the Congressional investigation of the State.Departnient in 1948; won a court decision today ordering the: GovernMent to pay,.irn pension benefits.

title: Newark Losing Ballantine Plant
description: NEWARK, March 3 The closing of the P. Ballantine & Sons Brewery, one of the major employers here, was announced today by the brewery's parent company, the Investors Funding Corporation.

title: Dance: Joffrey Romps
description: The dancers in the City Center Joffrey Ballet are not asually presented as innocents. Their image, particularly in the rock ballets, is hip. Catastrophes that engulf them, such as war in The Green Table, are universal and would destroy even the most sophisticated. What innocence exists in the company's ballets is mock innocence. Pineapple Poll in Pineapple Poll for instance.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: With the U.N. Conference on the Human Environment scarcely fifteen weeks away, it is extremely distressing to learn (news story Feb. 8) that because East Germany is not invited to the conference, the Soviet Union and its eastern European allies are refusing to help prepare the draft documents and may refuse to participate at Stockholm.

title: MRS. WITTENBERG
description: Mrs. Sophia Alperstein Wittenberg, honorary president of Beth Abraham Hospital, the Bronx, died yesterday in Philadelphia, where she had moved. Her age was 85. She was the widow of Samuel Wittenberg.

title: HARRY A. BERNBACH
description: Harry A. Bernbach, president of Peerless Weighing & Vending Machine Company and director of RockOla Manufacturing Company of Chicago, died yesterday at his home, 166 East 63d Street, after a long illness. He was 68 years old.

title: COMINCO TO RAISE PRIME ZINC PRICE
description: Price Change

title: Industrial Leader In Britain Predicts Economic Growth
description: LONDON, March 3  Sir John Partridge, president of the British Confederation of Industry, today predicted a period of rapid expansion for the British economy, accompanied by a rise in living standards and a reduction in unemployment.

title: Woman Dies in Car Blast
description: DETROIT, March 3 (UPI)A 45yearold woman who was the victim of a car bombing, believed intended against her husband, died today at Saratoga General Hospital. Mrs. May Woodhead lost both legs and suffered other injuries when the explosion blasted the family car and ,garage when she tried to start the engine Feb. 23 at her home. The police were seeking two men, one a former convict against whom Mrs. Woodhead's husband, William, was to have testified in a court in Boston the day the bombing occurred.

title: DANBURY PRISON SEEKING ACCORD
description: DANBURY, Conn., March 3The warden of the Federal Correctional Institution here and the deputy director of the Bureau of Prisons met today with a committee of inmates and asked. them to halt their work stoppage pending negotiation of grievances.

title: Adm. George M. ChaMbers Dies; Helped in Designing of Nautilus
description: WINDSOR, Conn., March  Rear Adm. George M. Chambers, retired, who helped design and build the Navy's first nuclearpowered submarine, Nautilus, died Wednesday of a heart attack. His age was 64.

title: Pioneer Craft on Course For Long Flight to Jupiter
description: PASADENA, Calif., March (UPI)Pioneer 10 cruised on a nearperfect course today in the beginning of a longrange picturetaking mission to Jupiter and responded flawlessly to radioed commands from earth.

title: BigName Troupe Tours New Hampshire for Nixon
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., March 3Nearly a score of celebrity standins for President Nixon blitzed New Hampshire. today. The cast of surrogates for Mr. Nixon, who has said that he will not involve himself directly in politics until he has been renominated, included two Cabinet Secretaries, one Equal Employment Opportunities Commissioner, four United States Senators, five United States Representatives, four Governors, including Nelson A. Rockefeller of New York, Lainie Kazan, singer, and the St. Louis Cardinals third baseman, Joe Torre.

title: Church Aid for Bangladesh
description: GENEVA, March 3 (Reuters) The World Council of Churches has approved a $13million relief program for Bangladesh over the next 16 months. The program will provide food, medical care, housing, water and transport as well as support for agricultural work, fishing and industry.

title: ExYank Is Seaver's Foe Today
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 3The New York Mets ended Phase I of spring training today and prepared to open Phase II tomorrow: the 28game exhibition season.

title: Heroin Delivery in U.S. Laid to Seized Captain
description: MARSEILLES, France, March 3 (AP)The owner of a shrimp boat seized for allegedly carrying narcotics admitted tonight that he had delivered 220 pounds of pure heroin to Miami last year, the police reported.

title: Candidates'
description: PENSACOLA, Fla. March 3 A group of 45 managers and department heads at a Monsanto Chemical Company plant listened impassively here today as Senator Henry M. Jackson spoke of environmental problems while massive clouds of blue, smoke swirled by the windows of the meeting room.

title: Air Stewardesses Fight Weight Rule
description: When a 23yearold United Air Lines stewardess arrived at Newark Airport recently to make a flight to Chicago, a United official took one look at her and ordered that she be weighed.

title: Art: Ryman's WhiteonWhite Oeuvre
description: A sort of interesting thing happened at the Guggenheim Museum the other day when I dropped in to see the Robert Ryman show. Mr. Ryman paints whiteonwhite canvases and these were ranged on the museum's white walls over the first several levels of the ramp. A Frenchwoman was following close on my heels at the entrance, her admission fee clutched in her hand, but she took one surprised look at the place and said, Mais c'est vide! and pocketed her fee and walked out.

title: Suspect Is Arrested In Death of Witness
description: MINEOLA, L. I., March 3 The Nassau County District Attorney, William Cahn, announced today the arrest of a 32yearold man and charged that he had murdered a New York, City woman to prevent her from testifying in a Federal narcotics case.

title: Peking, in Attack on Sato, Says Japan Covets Taiwan
description: PEKING, March 3 (Reuters)China strongly attacked Premier Eisaku Sato of Japan today. and accused him of planning to antagonize Peking and make aggressive moves toward Taiwanplans the Chinese said were doomed to failure.

title: MARIANNE KNEISEL, VIOLINIST, 75, DEAD
description: BLUE HILL, Me., March 3  Marianne Kneisel, violinist and director of Kneisel Hall, idied of cancer here Wednesday. She would have been 75 years old on March 10.

title: College Bars Bargaining Unit
description: Faculty members of Manhattan College in the Bronx by a vote of 130 to 121 elected resolution to empower the campus chapter of the American Association of University Professors to act as the collective. bargaining unit for the entire aculty.

title: Genesco, Inc., Reorganizes Its National Retail Group
description: Genesco, Inc., said yesterday that it had reorganized its national retail group. The S. H. Kress Company, a store division, has been made part of the parent company's unified retailchain group, headed by Fred A. Lang, corporate vice president and group director.

title: Morocco's Leader Accepts Resignation Of 7Month Cabinet
description: RABAT, Morocco, March 3King Hassan II.today accepted the resignation of the Cabinet led by Premier Mohammed Karim Lamranl and began consultations to form a transitional Cabinet that will hold legislative elections, due this summer.

title: Police Criticize Customs
description: PARIS, March 3The police in Marseilles, trying to trace the source of the 935 pounds of heroin discovered aboard the shrimp boat yesterday, complained today that the case had been made public too soon by the customs service.

title: Abacus Fund Deal With Paine, Webber Is Being Amended
description: Abacus Fund, Inc., announced yesterday that terms of its proposed taxfree merger with Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis, Inc., are being amended to eliminate the limitation on the number of Abacus stockholders who may elect cash in lieu of Paine, Webber securities.

title: Candidates'
description: MIAMI, March 3  Mayor Lindsay began a fourday Florida campaign swing today by linking three of his liberal opponents for the Democratic Presidential nomination to Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama.

title: Virginian to Leave House
description: RICHMOND, March 3 (AP)Representative Watkins M. Abbitt,. Democrat, a leading conservative ln Virginia politics for more than 20 years; announced today that he would retire from Congress at the end of his term this year.

title: Atztiques: Elegantly Carved Etagere Is Installed at Metropolitan Museum
description: The 19thcentury etagere juSt installed in the entrance. hall. of the. Ainerican.Wing at the Metropolitan Museum of Aft. has elegantly. carved ornamentation that suggests that its maker, Alexander Roux, was one of the best cabinetmakers of his day.

title: SHARP GAINS MADE ON AMEX AND OTC
FEDAYEEN TO SHIFT BASES IN LEBANON
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 3The leadership of the Palestinian guerrilla movement has reportedly decided to take steps to avoid confrontations with the Lebanese Army, which has moved into areas on the border with Israel that had been under commando control.

title: SLALOM IS TAKEN BY MISS STEER
NO TALKS SLATED IN BUSLINE STRIKE
description: The strike against Transport of New Jeriey one of the nation's largest private bus operators, went through its third day yesterday With no signs of any imminent settlement.

title: Former Norfolk Mayor Is Shot Dead on Street
description: NORFOLK, Va., March (AP)Former Mayor W. Fred Duckworth, 72 years old, was shot and killed on a Norfolk street tonight.

title: GoldMine Shifts Urged In Soviet to Raise Output
description: MOSCOW, March 3  An unusual report on Soviet goldfining operations in northeast Siberia, opposite Alaska, discloses that the gold content of placer mines is steadily declining, requiring increasing volumes of excavation to keep gold output at present levels.

title: Wilson's New Proposal
description: LONDON, March 3  Former Prime Minster Harold Wilson called on the British Government tonight to begin a gradual release of the prisoners held in Northern Ireland under the controversial internment policy.

title: Rusk on Environment Parley
description: Former Secretary of State Dean Rusk declared yesterday that he supports East German participation in the, Stockholm Environment Conference and that both East and West should make concessions so, that the East Germans could participate.

title: ANTONIO D. SABIA
description: STAMFORD, Conn., March 3 Antonio D. Sabia, president of the Genovese Supply Company, died Wednesday at his home at 19 Idlewood Road after a brief illness. He was 78 years old.

title: TexasEl Paso Rallies
description: EL PASO, Tex., March 3 (AP) The nation's No. 1 defensive team in college basketball, TexasEl Paso, spottedthe Western Athletic Conference champion, Brigham Young, a 14point halftime lead tonight, then ripped apart the proud Cougars for 73.69 W.A.C. victory.

title: NIXON SETS UP PANEL ON COTTON ACCORDS
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., March 3 President Nixon today issued an Executive order establishing machinery to oversee and carry out all cotton agreements with some 20 nations, as well as an agreement last Oct. 15 setting overall ceilings on textile imports from Japan, South Korea, Taiwan and Hong Kong.

title: 2 Doctors Urge a Halt in Human Genetics Engineering
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 Two doctors writing in an important. scientific journal have called for a moratorium ,on attempts at human genetics engineering, saying no one knows enough yet to try such manipulations safely.

title: Candidates'
description: MIAMI, March 3 Senator Hubert H. Humphrey charged today that the Nixon Administration had failed to recognize a Soviet naval buildup in the Caribbean Sea.

title: COPPER FUTURES HOED SOME GAINS
description: Prices of copper futures here yesterday continued to reflect improved industrial demand for refined copper, They rose  cent a pound to contract highs before profit taking trimmed the gain.

title: ExCon Ed Employe Admits Cheating Bronx Business
description: A former employe of the Consolidated Eidson Company who was accused of misusing his job as a , business representative to cheat small businessmen in the South Bronx pleaded guilty in State Supreme Court yesterday to all charges in a 14count indictment.

title: 4 Die at German Railway
description: INGOLSTADT, West Germany, March 3 (AP)A train carrying oiltank cars crashed into another one in the. Ingolstadt station last night, killing three persons, and afterward the stationmaster threw himself in front of a moving train and died, the police reported. About 20 cars exploded or caught fire.

title: ARGENTINA SEEKS. ANOTHER CABINET
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 3Argentina's 12 Cabinet Ministers and the president of the Central Bank resigned today, leaving President Alejandro A. Lanusse free to form a new government.

title: Athens Bars Foe's Departure
description: ATHENS, March 3One of three former members of Parliament invited to testify before United States Congressional subcommittees on making Pirteus a home port for the sixth fleet was informed today that he would not be allowed to leave Greece because he has a prison sentence pending.

title: U.S. STAND IN CHINA ASSAILED BY HANOI
description: HONG KONG, March 3 In its first official reaction to President Nixon's China trip, North Vietnam today denounced the American side of the joint Peking communiqu and accused the United States of sowing discord among Communist countries.

title: Democrats Are pleased By Convention Fund
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., March 3 (AP)San Diego may be having'trouble paying,for the Republican National Convention, but a Democratic official says that some $950,000 in cash, goods and services has already been raised by Miami Beach for the Democratic National Convention here July 913.,

title: D. TROWBRIDGE ELLIMAN
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., March 3D. Trowbridge Elliman, retired real estate broker, died today at the age of 70.

title: BHUTTO DISMISSES 2 MILITARY CHIEFS
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan March 3  President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto today dismissed ?we two military officers most inasponsible for putting him a power last December. He accused them of Bonaparte actions.

title: Index of Commodity Prices Rose to 112.7 in the Week
DEFORMED BABIES LINKED TO A DRUG
description: SYDNEY, Australia March 3 A Sydney gynecologist who was one of the first to expose the dangers of Thalidomide said today that another widely prescribed tranquilizer may also produce deformed births.

title: Stanford U. Gives In, Drops Indian Symbol
description: PALO ALTO, Caif., March 3 (UPI)Stanford University officially dropped the American Indian as a symbol today, bowing to demands by Indian groups on the campus.

title: Narragansett Racing Off
description: PAWTUCKET, R.I., March 3 (AP)Today's horse racing meet at Narragansett Park was canceled because of poor track conditions.

title: Naples Bay Yields Relics
description: NAPLES, Italy, March 3 (Reuters)Archeological remains apparently of ancient Greek origin have been found by fishermen in the Bay of Naples off Pozzuoli. Fragments of statues, a whole statue of cules, the marble head of a woman, marble pillars and mosaic floors, and what must have been the foot of a vast human figure have been found.

title: Winter Is Back, Spring Must Wait
description: Winter, banished by three days of sunny springlike weather, reasserted itself here yesterday in the form of rain, sleet, lightning, thunder and temperatures that plummeted to subfreezing levels more than 40 degrees below the recordsetting 70degree temperatures of earlier in the week.

title: Hans Albert Ascher Dies; Investment Broker Was 76
description: Hans Albert Ascher, an investment broker for 54 years, died Thursday at Lenox Hill Hospital after a month's illness. He was 76 years old and lived at 415 East 52d Street.

title: Farmer Who Helped Free Miss Davis Returns Home
description: CARUTHERS, Calif., March 3 (UPI)Rodger L. McAfee, the dairy farmer who posted bail for Angela Davis, was back in his home today and said that his four sons would return to school on Monday.

title: City Budget Director Decries Annual Display of Histrionics
description: With a mixture of amusement and exasperation, the city's Budget Director yesterday deplored the annual histrionics involved in fashioning a city budget.

title: West Virginia Flood Toll Put at 88 Dead
description: MAN, W. V., March 3 (AP)Hope began to wane tody that many of the 94 persons still missing since the Buffalo Creek hollow flood would be found alive.

title: Muskie Files in Carolina
description: RALEIGH, N. C., March 3 (AP)Senator Edmund S. Mus,kie, Democrat of Maine, formalty entered the North Carolina Presidential primary today when a committee paid the $1,000 filing fee to the state Board of Elections. He is the first Democrat to enter the North Carolina Presidential primary, to be held May 6.

title: A Consideration of Faith After Auschwitz
description: There is a potentially irreconcilable conflict between the JudaeoChristian image of the Biblical God as the just Lord of history and the terrible events of the twentieth century. The problem is especially urgent within Judaism. The traditional Jewish doctrine of the chosen people, no matter how interpreted, is difficult to maintain in the face of Auschwitz. If history expresses God's purposeful activity, especially toward his elect community, God himself must be regarded as ultimately responsible for the death camps. Contemporary Biblical faith, whether Jewish or. Christian, must either assert that God had his mysterious reasons for permitting Hitler's genocidal activities or that faith must see its image of God dissolve together with Auschwitz's other victims.

title: Bridge: First of 3 Weekends Devoted To Swiss Teams Begins Today
description: The great popularity of Swiss team contests is attested not only by the size of the fields but also by the decision of the Greater New York Bridge Association to devote three weekends annually to this form of competition.

title: Chilean Leaders Ban Hair of HippieLength
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 3 (UPI)The Marxistled Government today barred male students with shoulderlength hair from attending public schools. The order was praised by educators and criticized by teenagers and some parents.

title: N.C.R., Control Data Pick JointVenture Executives
description: The newly formed jointventure company being organ ized by the National Cash Register Company and the Control Data Corporation yesterday named Paul J. Bulver as president and J. Thomas Oaster as vice president in charge of financial matters.

title: SENATE ASKS ROLE IN PACTS ON BASES
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 The Senate, by a vote of 50 to 6, approved today a resolution calling upon the executive branch to submit as treaties, requiring the consent of the Senate, recent agreements with Portugal and Bahrain concerning military bases.

title: PLIGHT OF BIHARIS AN ISSUE IN INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, March 3Opposition parties in India are making the plight of the Bihari minority in Bangladesh a campaign issue in an attempt to dent the formidable popularity of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi before the state elections scheduled for next week.

title: RATE OF JOBLESS DECLINES TO 5.7%, LOWEST SINCE '70
description: WASHINGTON, March 3The nation's unemployment rate declined in February for the second consecutive month and reached the lowest level since October, 1970, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Market Place: Europeans Play Seek and Hide
description: PARIS, March 31In European investing circlesfar from the madding crowd at Broad and Wallthere is an insistent refrain about our market that may be helpful to the small investor back in the United States.

title: PRODUCTION OF CARS FELL FOR FEBRUARY
description: DETROIT, March 3 (AP)United States and Canadian autornakers kept up a strong pace Of production. in February, remaining nearly even with last year's record firstquarter output.

title: Allies Clear Sale of U.S. Station to China
description: PARIS, March 3  The United States has obtained clearance from nine of its allies for the sale of a satellite ground station to China. But Japan and other allies have interpreted the sale as a political act and have made it clear that they intend to use the same criterion.

title: Taiwan Hears Nixon Aide and Hints a Softer View
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 3Chinese Nationalist resentments growing out of. President Nixon's visit to China appeared somewhat softened here today after a 24hour visit by Marshall Green,, United States Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian Affairs. But Taipei's attitude toward Washington remained visibly cool.

title: F.D.A. Seeks Information
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration said today that it had asked Australian authorities for Dr. McBride's data on imipramine.

title: CONTRACTS AWARDED
description: ITT Canada, Ltd., has been awarded a contract for up to $70million to build postal mechanization equipment for 14 Canadian cities. The lettersorting equipment would be manufactured over the next fours years by the Canadian subsidiary of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation. The Canadian company had already received a $4.4million contract for mechanization of the Ottawa post office.

title: Plan for Undersea Missile System Opposed
description: A major storm is gathering over the Administration's. request for $942million in the 1973 defense budget to develop a new Undersea LongRange Missile System.

title: Feminists Emerge as a Political Power
description: Feminist movements that were shrugged off by New York politicians only a year ago are this year exerting substantial political pressure comparable to that of civil rights organizations in the state.

title: Flags That Fly Indoors Devised
description: WASHINGTON, March 3Leonard G. Lorch, an artist and engineer whose home is in Woodmere, L. I., was granted a patent this week for what he calls the world's first indoorflying flag. Patent 3,645,026 covers the mechanical construction of, plastic flags, which can be hung from the ceiling and will move in any air current. Mr. Lorch's trademark for his flagmobiles is Mobility. He has designed special flagmobiles for the American bicentennial of 1976, for ecology and for Christmas. The inventor also expects wide use of his displays for producers trademarks in stores and showrooms.

title: Mujib and Kosygin Sign a Declaration On Foreign Policies
description: MOSCOW, March 3  Sheik Mujibur Rahman, Prime Minister of Bangladesh, and Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet Union signed a joint policy declaration here today, then traveled by air to Leningrad on the final stage of the Bengali leader's visit to the Soviet Union.

title: Rabbi Morris Silverman, Author and, Editor, Dead
description: HARTFORD, Conn., March 3 (AP)Rabbis Morris Silverman, author, editor and civil rights leader, died today aboard cruise ship in Acapulco, Mexico, it was learned here. He was 77 years old.

title: Greek Cypriotes Back Makarios in Ouster Move
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, March 3 (AP)Thousands of Greek Cypriotes shouted their support today for Archbishop Makarios as President and religious leader of Cyprus.

title: SUSQUEHANNA DENIES S.E.C.'S ALLEGATIONS
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., March 3 (UPI)The Susquehanna Conporation named along with four major banks for alleged violations of securities laws, denied today charges brought against it by did Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: BREDICE BREAKS I.C.4A MEET MARK IN WEIGHT THROW
description: PRINCETON, N.J., March 3Frank Bredice, a 260pounder who found throwing a weight in track and field more satisfying than throwing a block in football, set the first meet recordof the 51st annual I.C.4A indoor championships today.

title: U.S. Reports Jets Launch 3 Strikes Into North Vietnam
description: Saigon, South Vietnam, Saturday, March 4 (AP)Enemy antiaircraft defense opened fire on two American reconnaissance planes, prompting a new round of United States air strikes in North Vietnam yesterday, the United States command said today.

title: Army Experimenting With a Trial Period for Recruits
description: FORT JACKSON, S. C., March 3When David Blunschi and Fred Granitz of Powder Springs, Ga., arrived here last Monday morning with a busload of other young Army recruits, they were not at all sure they would like what they found.

title: MARY ROSS GANNETT OF SURVEY GRAPHIC
description: Mrs. Mary Ross Gannett, associate editor of Survey Graphic magazine here from 1920 to 1936 and later editor of the Board in Washington for 10 Bulletin of the Social Security years, died Wednesday in Ithaca. N. Y. Her age was 79.

title: U.S. PLANS TO SELL ARMS TO GREECE
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 The State Department announced today that the United States would sell approximately $70million worth of arms to Greece before June 30.

title: White House Aide Linked To I.T.T. Antitrust Case
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 The independent, analyst ,hired by the Justice Department to write a report on the financial consequences of an antitrust action against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation said today that he had dealt entirely with a key White House aide.

title: Mediation Chief Says U.S. Is at 3Year Low in Strikes
description: WASHINGTON, March (AP)J. Curtis Counts, director of the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service, said today that strike activity was at a threeyear low. He attributed it to President Nixon's economicstabilization program.

title: Message Found in Space
description: The longest interplanetary voyage of the space age was begun this week when Pioneer 10 was launched from Cape Kennedy, targeted to explore the environs of Jupiter some 21 months from now. The vehicle is designed scan the planet's atmosphere and radiation belt, after which it is to shoot out and escape the solar system to plumb the dark reaches of space.

title: FRANK CASTY
description: Frank Casty, founder, vice president and director of Chelsea Industries, Inc., of Boston, a diversified corporation in the fields of textiles, plastics, shoe products and food products, died yesterday in Tucson Medical Center, Tucson, Ariz., after a brief illness. He was 80 years old and lived in Brookline, Mass.

title: Paterson Charges U.S. Census Shorts City on Aid Funds
description: PATERSON, N. J., March 3 This city contends that inefficiency by the Federal Government during the 1970 census taking led to an underestimate of its population, which, if not corrected, could mean the loss of $1.5million to $2million under Federal and state aid programs based on population.

title: A Unionwork Orange
description: The increasing entry of huge corporate conglomerates into farming has had one unintended but predictable effecta spur to the unionization of farm labor, most exploited segment of the American work force.

title: Management Copsultant Lends Sophistication to javits's Staff
FEBRUARY SALES UP AT 3 RETAIL CHAINS
description: Three retail chains reported yesterday higher sales in February compared with the yearago month.

title: 18 Killed as Airliner Crashes in Albany
description: ALBANY, Saturday, March 4 A Mohawk Airlines turboprop plane crashed into a residential section of Albany two miles from the State Capitol last night, killing at least 18 of the 47 persons aboard.

title: Mayor Acts to Cancel Controversial Heating Pact
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that he was taking action to cancel a mobile heating contract held by a company in which a powerful Lower East Side poiltical figure was major stockholder.

title: Maker Cites Warning
description: BASEL, Switzerland, March 3 (Reuters)A spokesman for CibaGeigy, the Swiss drug concern, said today there was no question at present of removing imipramine from the market. He said the containers in which the drug was distributed carried a specific warning that it was not to be prescribed for pregnant women and that any doctor who did o would bear the responsibility, not the concern.

title: Gambling Curb in Togo
description: LOME, Togo, March 4 (Agence FrancePresse)Togolese are banned from gambling halls. A, Government announcement recalled that in December, 1970, a casino was authorized in Lome, the capital of the West African republic, to help tourism. But, it said it is clear that a large number of Togolese have been borrowing to go to the casino. Generally, they cannot repay because they do not always win.

title: CRUDE OIL WASHES ONTO FIRE ISLAND
description: SHIRLEY, L. I., March 3More than 15 miles of beaches on Fire Island were ,covered today with patches of a heavy grade fuel oil that apparently washed up from the ocean early yesterday morning.

title: One of Our Utilities Is Missing
description: When the Public Service Commission decided recently to investigate the adequacy of Western Union service in this state, it probably had no idea of the magnitude the task. New Yorkers have been known to try for, days to locate any such service and have come up with blankbut not a Western Union blank. To try to send Western Union message by telephone is all but a lifetime task; if one trudges to an office in person, it is more than likely to be closed. It remains only for the police set up a Missing Utilities Bureau.

title: Giscard Assails the U.S. On Dollar Indifference
description: VERSAILLES, France, March 3France's Finance Minister, Valery Giscard d'Estaing, warned a blueribbon EuropeanAmerican, businessmen's group. today that indifference by the United States Government to shortterm capital outflows and the dollar's inconvertibility posed a threat to monetary. truce in the West.

title: Green in Manila
description: MANILA, March 3 (Reuters) Marshall Green, United States Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian Affairs, arrived in Manila from Taiwan today on the fourth stop of a tour of America's Asian allies to explain President Nixon's visit to China. He will confer with President Marcos while here.

title: Gay Activists Win Appeal On Incorporation in State
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court, overturning a lowercourt decision, has ruled that the. Gay Activists Alliance, a homosexual organ!zation, is entitled to a certificate of incorporation.

title: P.B.A.SAYS MURPHY
description: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association accused Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy yesterday of sabotaging its contract negotiations, broke off the talks and warned of possible job action by the police.

title: HARVARD SETS PACE IN SQUASH RACQUETS
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., March Harvard grabbed the early lead in the 39th annual national intercollegiate squash racquet championships today by advancing all six players in the three divisions into tomorrow's quarterfinal round. Harvard had 24 points after three rounds.

title: IRVING C. CARPENTER
description: CLINTON, N. Y., March 3Irving C. Carpenter, who retired in 1959 as vice president of Max B. Miller Company of New York, developer of petroleum refining processes, died today at the age of 83.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Kroehler Manufacturing Company has promoted Elmer A. Dagenals to executive vice presidentmanufacturing and Terrence L. Henderson executive vice presidentmerchandising.

title: A School Shuts Down Mysteriously
description: The McLaren School, in Esopus, N. Y., for children with special learning problems closed down suddenly yesterday and nobody knew precisely why.

title: State's No Fault Sponsor Says Bill Will Be Amended
description: ALBANY, March 3  The no fault automobile insurance plan currently before the Legislature will be amended to meet some of the objections raised during three days of public hearings on the measure, the bill's sponsor said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: We have duly noted Governor Rockefeller's declared goal of channeling at least $33 million of public tax money to the Catholic Church for its parochial schools, despite the fact that a threeman Federal Court haS just declared such use of public tax funds unconstitutional.

title: L.I.R.R. 10Trip Tickets Ruled Invalid on Appeal
description: Riders on the Long Island Rail Road may no longer use 10trip tickets, the Appellate DiVision of State Supreme Court ruled unanimously in Brooklyn yesterday.

title: Scaring Mr. Nixon
description: The White House called William Buckley not long ago. An angry Nixon aide was on the line; he denounced Mr. Buckley's support of conservative Congressman John. Ashbrook's entry into the New Hampshire primary. Hadn't the Administration paid the proper attention to Buckley's patron age suggestions, the aide asked? Hadn't there been personal intervention on behalf of Buckley's brother in the 1970 New York Senate race?

title: Contest to Open on Ways To Save Tower of Pisa
description: PISA, Italy  The view from the Leaning Tower has changed in recent, years, but the confidence of the Pisans that their old landthark will go on leaning forever has not.

title: FIVE WORKS SOLD AT GALLERY HERE
description: Five works owned by the Cranbrook Academy of Art, bought in the 1940's and early 1950's for $15,368, grossed $445,000 In an auction sale at the ParkeBernet Galleries Thursday evening. The figure included a record $260,000 paid for Reclining Figure, a monumental sculpture of elm wood by Henry Atmore purchased by the academy in 1952 for $6,500.

title: Blazers Lose 12th in Row
description: PORTLAND, Ore., March 3 (AP)Jack Marin scored 12 of his 20 points in the final quarter tonight as the Baltimore Bullets handed the Portland Trail Blazers their 12th straight defeat, 9080.

title: Frederick E. Dreyer Dies; Nuclear Engineer Was 68
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., March 3 Frederick E. Crever, a nuclear engineer and retired manager of General Electric's Knolls Atomic Power Laboratory in Schenectady, N. Y., died yesterday in Menlo Park. He was 68 years old and lived in Los Altos.

title: He Says His Cooking Gets Worse Each DayBut Don't Believe It
description: DORSET, Vt.  When James W. Lee 2d stands at the stove in Barrows House, a country inn here, his is the ruling appetite. I serve only.what I like, he says.

title: Lawyer Testifies Thaler Signed Deal on Sale of Stolen U.S. Bills
description: A lawyer testified yesterday that former State Senatoi Seymour R. Thaler signed an agreement in 1970 to sell $800,000 in United States Treasury bills that were being offered for only 25 per cent of their true value.

title: Grayson Making a Tour for the Price Commission
description: DALLAS; March 1  C. Jackson Grayson Jr., chairman of the Price Commission, walked up to 72yearold Mrs. Lucy Miller, who was shopping in the Cliff Food Store, and, as television and news photographeis swiveled their cameras to capture the event, asked whether food prices were going up.

title: Cards Send Goode to Bills
description: ST. LOUIS, March 3 (AP)The St., Louis Cardinals of the National Football League traded Iry Goode for Joe O'Donnell of the Buffalo Bills today. Both are seasoned right guards.

title: Suit Calls Police Testic Biased Against Minority Candidates
description: A suit filed in Federal Court yesterday charges that the written examinations used. to select and promote New York policemen are biased and therefore violate the Constitutional rights of black and Spanishspeaking candidates.

title: Frank G. Huml Dead at 52; A Commissioner of Customs
description: Frank G. Huml, Deputy Assistant Commissioner of Customs for the New York area, died Tuesday of a heart attack at Long Island College Hospital, Brooklyn. He was 52 years old and lived at 7115 Narrows Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: J. FURY IAN DENTON, A BANKER IN JERSEY
description: NEWARK, March 3J. Furman Denton, who retired as executive vice president and cashier of the First National Bank of New Jersey in 1970, died Thursday on a visit to Lancaster, Pa., after a long illness. He was 58 years old and lived at 75 Old Army Road, Bernardsville.

title: Budget by Bludgeon
description: With a wild swing of its rhetorical nightstick, the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association (P.B.A.) has underscored some of the basic reasons for New York City's desperate budget crisis.

title: Peron Doesn't Plan Return
description: MADRID, March 3 (Reuter) Juan D. PerOn, the forrner Argentine dictator, said today that he had no plans to return to Argentina to take part in elections there.

title: RISE IN '71 PROFIT LISTED BY OGDEN
All Truants Are Not Delinquents
description: It's my life, I can mess it up I want to.

title: ECUADOR PROTESTS CURB IN U.S. AID BILL
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 3 Ecuador today denounced as a shameful and discriminatory act an amendment to the United States foreignaid appropriation bill giving President Nixon power to withhold aid to the LatinAmerican country.

title: Big A Turnout of 14,512 Second Smallest at Track
description: Attendance at Aqueduct plunged to 14,512 yesterday, increasing the danger of a labor crisis that could jeopardize racing here next week.

title: Lawyers for Mrs. Onassis Say Galella's Suit Is Publicity Stunt
description: Lawyers. for Mrs. Aristotle Onassis charged in Federal Court here yesterday that Ronald E. Galella, a freelance photographer, brought suit against their client to gain publicitY and the business he Itn,ew a lawsuit would spark.

title: Bolotowsky Shows a Vertical Format
description: It is generally agreed that neoplasticism, the art style that sought a universal esthetic through simple, clear geometric abstraction and pure primary colors, was originated in 1917 under the impetus of the great painter Mondrian and came to an end as a consolidated movement in 1931. Since then, however, its idiom and doctrines have found a response, if limited and sporadic, among several artists. Some a its American partisans in elude, for example, Harry Holtzman, Burgoyne Diller and Ilya Bolotowsky.

title: APPEAL BY LEFRAK IS DENIED BY COURT
description: A State Supreme Court Justice refused yesterday to set aside a unanimous decision of the city's Board of Standards and Appeals that blocked construction of a 400unit highrise Lefrak project in Forest HillsKew Gardens, Queens.

title: Irving, With His Attorneys, Meets With Prosecutors
description: Clifford Irving and his attorneys met with Federal and county prosecutors for six and a half hours yesterday at the Federal Court House on Foley Square.

title: Greece Affirms Demands
description: ATHENS, March 3The Greek Government affirmed as irrevocable tonight the demands it made of Archbishop Mskaries Feb. 11.

title: U.C.L.A. Defeats California, 8571, For Coast Crown
Books of The Times
description: It is only a small exaggeration to say that the Kinsey. Reportor, more accurately, Sexual BehaVior in the Human Malewas, when it appeared in 1948, the most controversial book since Uncle Tom's Cabin. Both struck at different kinds of hypocricy; in Kinsey's case it, was America's official sex code. Preceded by good deal of prepublication, publicity Sexual Behavior went on to;'become a best selleror a book noliedy:read, it was said, because of its formidable statistical baggage.

title: Dowdy Case to Be Examined By the House Ethics Panel
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (AP)The House Committee on Standards of Official Conduct will investigate the appropriateness of Representative John Dowdy, Democrat of Texas, retaining his status while appealing a conviction for bribery.

title: COURT ASKED TO END DEATHPENALTY BAN
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 3 (UPI)Evelle Younger, California's Attorney General,.asked the State Supreme ,Court today to reconsider its decision outlawing the death penalty. He accused the court of usurping legislative functions and eroding the constitutional separation of powers.

title: 8 I.R.A. Suspects Seized
description: DUBLIN, March 3 (Reuters) Eight suspected members of the Irish Republican Army were arrested by the police in a raid on a. remote farmhouse at Tydavnet, in County Monaghan, a few miles from the border with Northern Ireland early today.

title: ITALY'S NEOFASCISTS WEIGH WIDER ROLE
description: ROME, March 3The neoFascist, party, confident of achieving further advances in the general elections for the Senate and Chamber of Deputies on May 7 and 8, said today that it was considering participation in rightwing alliance on the government level.

title: REA Express Asks Cutback
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., March 4 (AP)The Public Service Board has received a petition from REA Express, generally known as Railway Express, asking permission to close its offices in the state, except for Montpelier. A series of public hearings will be held on the request before a decision is made.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The solutions suggested by the New Malthusians in A Blueprint for Survival [OpEd Feb. 5] are probably impractical, and perhaps undesirable. The primordial problem they skirt cannot be wished away, but little attention is given to how desirable and practical solutions can be found and even more importantly, implemented.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: WASHINGTON, March 3There is i French children's riddle about a pond with a water lily in it. The lily doubles in size every day. In thirty days it will cover the entire pond, killing the other creatures in it. The owner wants to avoid that, but he sees no hurry: He will cut the plant back when it covers half the pond. When will that be?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: If statistics are not lIes, interpretations of them frequently are. The ease in point is the reported demand for cutbacks in teacher training programs based on an alleged national surplus of teachers. (News story Feb. 7.) The surplus is explained very simply. A rising birth rate meant more children to be educated, requiring more teachers. The declining birth rate means fewer children, requiring in turn fewer teachers. (The unspoken, but inescapable, accusation is that professional educators ought to have anm ticipated this long since, of course.) What this dangerously simplistic analysis neglects to point out is crucial.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The recent furor over busing of children has made it painfully clear that when President Nixon told theAmerican people that he would bring them together, he was obviously not referring to black and white school children.

title: Dr. K.M. Klein Weds Constance R. Wise
description: Miss Constance Randolph Wise, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Randolph E. Wise of Philadelphia, was married here yesterday afternoon to Dr. Kenneth M. Klein, son, of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Klein of the Bronx. Rabbi A: Bruce Goldmann performed the ceremony at the Chuich Center of the United Nations; with the Rev Peter Jacobsni Roman Catholic priest, and, the Rev. Carl Soule a Meth odist minister.

title: Wooing the Sheik
description: Prodded by Congress and by fresh Soviet moves exploit Moscow's new diplomatic advantages on the Indian subcontinent, the Nixon Administration has disclosed that it is preparing to recognize Bangladesh. This overdue actionalready 47 nations, including the other major powers, have granted recognition to the breakaway Bengali nationwould initiate a welcome change in policies that have undermined American influence on the subcontinent.

title: Now the No.1 Consumer Complaint: Furniture
description: The Better Business Bureau held a seminar yesterday on the problems consumers are having with furniture dealers, but almost everyone agreed that the real culprits were far removed from the meeting room on Vesey Street.

title: Candidates'
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., March 3Senator Edmund S. Muskie declared his support here today for a 20 per cent increase in Social Security benefits.

title: Bus Line President
description: When Transport of New Jerseyor Public Service Coordinated Transport, as it was then; knownnamed a new president last year many. Jerseyans repeated, An. advertently the slogin of the 1961 mayoral campaign here Who's Gilheooey?

title: 2 Scotland Yard Detectives Convicted in Bribery Case
description: LONDON, March 3  Two Scotland Yard detectives were found guilty today of conspiracy and accepting bribes in a case that resulted from an investigation by The Times of London.

title: Foreign Aid Survives Obituary
description: WASHINGTON, March 3In defiance of its premature death notices, the foreign aid program has risen to live at least until July, largely because Congress, for all its criticism, finds the program politically convenient.

title: Miss Casals Triumphs
description: ROCHESTER, Mich., March 3 (UPI)Secondseeded Rosemary Casals of San Francisco finished strong to overcome eighthranked Julie Heldman of Houston today in quarterfinal action of a $15,000 women's tennis tournament.

title: Indochina at the Summit
description: President Nixon's journey for peace has ended but American bombs are still falling throughout Indochina and Communist troops are still massing and maneuvering in South Vietnam for an expected offensive that could pose a formidable challenge to the Vietnamization program.

title: Bronx Driver, 24, is Arrested Under New Scofflaw Program
description: The first arrest under a new program designed to plug. loopholes that haVe allowed drivers to ignore summonses for moving violations was announced yesterday by District Attorney Burton B. Roberts of the Bronx.

title: 10 of the 70 Newburgh Police Indicted
description: Ten of Newburgh's 70 policemeri were charged yesterday with burglaries and larcenies involving seven different concerns In their riverside city, which has been called acesspool of crime.

title: Mrs. Stravinsky Denies Charges Craft Distorted Husband's Ideas
description: Vera Stravinsky, widow of the composer, yesterday denied charges that Robert Craft had misrepresented or distorted the ideas of her husband. These charges are being made in bOok by Lillian Libman that will be published in the fall. Miss Libman for many years was Igor Stravinsky's personal representative, and Mr. Craft was the composer's amanuensis and associate.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Outside, rain dripped off the faded green El station at 241st Street and White Plains Road in a dismal area the Bronx.
