Inside, in a corner storefront that once housed The Factory East discotheque, men in dark overcoats and windbreakers waited yesterday for the computers to hum as the Offtrack Betting Corporation opened its 50th office. By the end of 1'972, OTB plans to have 115 offices available. But in less than a year, OTB is more than halfway catching Woolworth's, which has 99 outlets in the five boroughs. It has outdistanced the 18 book shops operated by the Womrath's chain. Perhaps most significant, it has equaled the number of Household Finance offices. And yesterday, as Howard J. Samuels presided over the opening of the 50th office, swarthy man in a leather cap and a black windbreaker spoke up.

title: Sales of Savings Bonds Up
description: Sales of Savings Bonds continued to advance in February, the Treasury reported yesterday. Net cash inflow rose to $187million from $110million in the preceding month. Sales of Series E and H Bonds increased to $537million from $521million, while redemptions fell to $350million from $411million.

title: Principals in the Controversy Over Antitrust Action
New Malta Bid on Bases
description: VALLETTA, Malta, March 4 (AP)The Maltese Government has offered to the British Government what reliable sources here called a fresh approach toward resuming negotiations on British and North Atlantic Treaty Organization use of bases here. Talks on the bases broke down last month in Rome, the NATO allies offering $35million in annual rent and $18.7million in interest free loans, Malta insisting on an additional lump sum of $12.5million.

title: Alfred Bersted, Chairman Of McGrawEdison Panel
description: Alfred Bersted, chairman of the executive committee of the McGrawEdison Company, manufacturer of small electric appliances and heavy industrial equipment, died in the Sherman Hospital, Elgin, Ill., Monday after an illness of several months. He was 73 years old.

title: Ottawa Names Defense Chief
description: OTTAWA, March 3 (AP) Lieut. Gem Jacques Dextraze of Montreal was appointed chief of the defense staff today to succeed Gen. Frederick Sharp, who is retiring. The new chief will be promoted to general on taking over his duties Sept. 15.

title: Music Films to Be Shown
description: PLAINFIELDFilms about Duke Ellington, Benny Goodman and Count Basle are among those being shown next Friday, March Id, at 8 in the Hartridge School Auditorium; Stillman and Sherwood Avenues, here. William Smith, curator of the film collection on. American music in the cinema, which ranges from early talkies to currentrock'n'roll will provide commentary. Donations are $1.

title: Penguins Down Stars, 42
description: PITTSBURGH, March 4 (UPI) Syl Apps scored one goal and assisted on another as the Pittsburgh Penguins defeated the Minnesota North Stars, 42, tonight to keep the Penguins in the West Division playoff race in the N.H.L.

title: Little Pacific Sultanate of Brunei Is Topi.Heavy With Wealth
description: BRUNEI, March 2  Sandwiched between the jungle Malaysian states of Sabah and. Sarawak, where tribesmen of northern Borneo once took heads and reportedly still do on occasion, the Sultanate of Brunei stretches out over ridges and swamps as far as the eye can see, but not much farther.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 4Well, it appears that the world really is coming to an end. It used to seem like a joke. Those people who walked the crowded Market and Broad and Main Streets of America bearing placards urging us all to prepare ourselves for the imminent arrival of doomsday kept cartoonists in pccket money even during the Depression, when doomsday was not as unpleasant to visualize as it is nowadays.

title: jersey City College Trains Teachers of Handicapped Children
description: JERSEY CITYLast year, when many wouldbe teachers were fcirced to drive taxicabs or take jobs in department stores, all of the graduates who had studied special education at Jersey City State College were placed tin attractive positions.

title: Hebrew Christians Plan Seder Showing Link With Communion
description: Ellen and Ronni Sarrett grew up on the West Side in family they describe as culturally Jewish but almost atheist.

title: San Diego Wrestlers Favored To Take N. A.I. A. Team Title
description: More, than 400 wrestlers representing 200 Colleges wail gather. at Klamath Falls, Ore:; this weekend to compete in the 14th annual National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics wrestling.. championships. The threeday tournament, with single elimination and backdoor consolations, winds up the N.A.I.A. season.

title: Public TV to Cover 98% of State This Year
description: TRENTON  New Jersey's infant public television system, which up to now has covered only the southern part of the state, expects to be ready to serve 98 per cent of the area by the end of the year.

title: Cost of Oil Pipeline Worries Alaska
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, March 4Gov. William A. Egan is worried that the state of Alaska cannot afford to have its North Slope oil produced.

title: Mike Quarry: Forget Old Days, There's a New Breed in Boxing
description: MASSACRE CANYON, Calif., March 4Mike Quarry, the 20yearold brother of Jerry Quarry, the No. 3 contender for the heavyweight title, is unhappy about the lack of progress in boxing as compared with some of the other major sports. He attributes it to the fuddyduddies who control the sport and some of the oldtime managers who are Still living in the days of John L. Sullivan."

title: A Bus Ride in Atlanta Costs 15 Cents Again
description: ATLANTA, March 4For the first time in 15 years Atlantans are riding buses for only 15 cents a fare.

title: Miss Sally Bradley Dayton Fiancee of Stephen Clement 3d
description: EXCELSIOR, Minn., March 4Mr. and Mrs. Wallace Corliss Dayton have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sally Bradley Dayton, to Stephen Merrell Clement 3d, son of Dr. and Mrs. Clement 2d of Buffalo and East Aurora, N.Y.

title: Photography
description: IT happens every year about this time: the photographers of the New York press break away from their picture editors, their scruffy newsprint and their coarse halftone reproductions to have a real exhibition with handsome original prints lined up on a wall just like the fine art photographers who show in museums and galleries. This year the exhibition is located in The Mill at Burlington House, and it is everything that an exhibition of press photographs should be.

title: BoatRace Dinner March 23
description: The OxfordCambridge annual boatrace dinner will be held March 23 nt the Harvard Club, 27 West 44th Street. Reservations are being accepted by Alan L. Bain, 445 Park Avenue, Suite 1001, or by telephone at 4861333.

title: 4 Die as Hovercraft Capsizes in Channel
description: LONDON March 4 Four persons drowned today when a hovercraft overturned in in mileanhour winds as the craft approached Southsea near Portsmouth on the south coast of England. The Craft was crossing from the isle of Wight Aboard were 26 passengers and crew. The dead were a girl of about 10 two women and one man. The pilot was among the survivors.

title: Museum Auctions Its Antiques at Fair
description: The Museum of American Folk Art divested itself of about 75 items at auction Friday night, grossing $56,000, which will go toward a building program and other plans for growth and increased service.

title: 2 KILLED, 100 HURT IN BELFAST BLAST
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland March 4  Two women were killed and more than 100 people injured in a crowded restaurant here today in one of the worst bombings since the Ulster crisis began three years ago Of those injured, between 15 and 20 were hurt seriously, according to officials.

title: G. Stuart Demarest Dead; ExRutgers Dean Was 65
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., March G. Stuart Demarest, who was dean of University College, the evening division of Rutgers University, from 1965 to 1969, died here yesterday. His age was 65.

title: IN THE NATION
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif.In 1966, California became the first state to require by law the control of emissions of hydrocarbons and carbon monoxide from automobile exhausts. The control devices developed by the auto companies have worked well enough; but the sad fact is that air pollution in Californiaparticularly here in the Los Angeles areais worse than ever.

title: LairdRogers Political Role Is Condemned by Mansfield
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) United States relations with foreign nationp could be hurt if heads of the Defense and State Departments get involved in President Nixon's reelection campaign as planned, the Senate majority leader Mike Mansfield, said today.

title: Florida's SupersquareA Man to Watch
description: IT'S a safe bet that Reubin O'Donovan Askew has never tasted white lightning, the corn nicker brewed by Southern moonshiners, but that hardly disqualifies him as one of the squarest native sons of Muskogee, Okla.

title: Stony Brook Aids Junior Colleges
description: STONY BROOK, L. I.The State University of New York at Stony Brook has begun a program designed to help to channel more Ph.D.trained teachers into the nation's twoyear junior colleges.

title: Temple Fencers Triumph In MiddleAtlantic Meet
description: HOBOKEN, N. J., March 4Temple University successfully defended its Middle Atlantic States fencing championship today at Stevens Tech. The Owls captured their eighth consecutive title by placing men in all three weapons and compiling 55 points. Stevens Tech and John Hopkins finished second and third, respectively, with scores of 52 and 42.

title: Tangley Lloyd, Robert Quinn Are Affianced
description: GREENWICH, Conn., March 4  Mr. and Mrs. Robert Spaulding Coleman have made known the engagement of Mrs. Coleman's daughter; Miss Tangley Campbell Lloyd, to Robert James Quinn, who is direCtor.of the Tonight show. He is the son of Mrs. Sidney Nathane of Melbourne, Fla., and the late Joseph Quinn.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: The HartkeBurke bill is prescription for economic disaster for the United States and the free world. Under the guise of allegedly preventing American jobs from being exported, it would jeopardize the jobs of millions now employed. It is a knownothing approach to the grave and complex economic problems facing the United States. Passage of HartkeBurke would lead to trade wars, widespread economic dislocation, spreading unemployment on a global scale, essential resources shortages in the United States and a weakening of our national security.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONIt is a little too early to tell whether a flood tide of sentiment for tax reform is running again in Congress.

title: COLUMBIA TUITION is RAISED BY $200
description: Freshmen entering Columbia University next:fall will pay an average of $3,668 for tuition and housing, or $1,103 more than current seniors paid when they arrived:in 1968.

title: Bruins Down Wings
description: DETROIT, March. 4 (UPI).Boston's Phil Esposito raised his leagueleading point total to 119 tonight, pacing the Boston Bruins to a 54 victory over the Detroit Red Wings.

title: JOHN S.WILSON'S Music
description: PASSAIC  The kind of home that rock once had at the Fillmore East on New York's Lower East Side Is being slowly reconstructed in a most unlikely location: A decaying downtown section of this old industrial city.

title: Kertesz: He Mourns for the Old Met
Home for 6 Retarded Boys Divides a Town
description: IMPERIAL BEACH, Calif., March 4The Chester Martins and the six retarded boys who make up their family received a letter from City Manager Thomas R. Parks this week, with an ,apology and a belated welcome to their new beachfront home here.

title: 30,000 to Be Ordered to Work Or Lose California Welfare Aid
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., March 4 (AP)Up to 30,000 men and women between the ages of 18 and 65 will be ordered to go to, work or lose their welfare grants beginning April 1.

title: Profits Toys Seesaw
description: The Lionel Corporation, which did about half of its estimated $80million sales volume last year in toy retailing increased its earnings eightfold in 1971.

title: Why the Computer Chose Cancun
description: It happened one day about noon... I was exceedingly surprised with the print of a man's naked foot on the shore....

title: Cutting a Road Through Brazil's Green Hell
description: IT is 6 A.M. in the Amazon jungle of Brazil. The mist is burning off the placid Xingu River, and already the sun is starting to broil the tinroofed shacks at the Belo Monte construction camp. On the dusty road in front of the mess hall, men pile into trucks to begin another day working in the jungle. Nearby, the grimy men of the night shift trudge to their barracks, to try to sleep in the stifling heat.

title: Former Head of Czech Uranium Industry Has Escaped to West
description: PARIS, March 4The former head of the Czechoslovak uranium industry, which accounts for about a fifth of Soviet needs in the strategic element, has escaped from Prague prison and found refuge in the West after a monthlong chase.

title: New Hampshire Primary
description: The New Hampshire primary campaign which comes to a climax in Tuesday's vote has demonstrated several of the worst features of American politics.

title: Liberal Party Proposes Trial and Prison Reform
description: The New York State Liberal party asked the Legislature yesterday to approve a number of measures to speed trials and reform prisons.

title: Movies
description: REMEMBER M*A*S*H? Sure you doit was the devastating black comedy about the Korean War that turned out to be one of 1970's biggest critical and boxoffice smashes. Director Robert Altman and star Elliott Gould remember M*A*S*H, too, and that's why they've decided to say hello to one another again, and hello to The Long Goodbye. They'll start shooting on their new film this summer in Los Angeles for producer Elliott Kastner and United Artists.

title: Muckraking Reformer Had Role In the History of the Hill
description: ENGLEWOOD  Sixtysix years ago this community on the heights of the Palisades was invaded by a band of writers, professors and dropouts under the leadership of a 28yearold muckraker, Upton Sinclair.

title: The World
description: In Londonderry, Northern Ireland, in what is known as the matinee performance, youngsters from the Bogside Catholic ghetto bait the British troops into firing rubber bullets at them. The aim of the game: to snag the projectiles as a valuable source of pocket money. American tourists, a dwindling band admittedly, pay as much as $12.50 each for them. That's enough incentive for one enterprising Bogsider to have refined the game by training his dog to retrieve the bullets.

title: Miss Crockett Plans to Wed
description: SCARBOROUGH, N. Y., March 4Mrs. Theodore Lyman Crockett has made known the engagement of her daughter, Miss Nancy Burbank Crockett, to Robert Eugene Bixler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Reyno Farrell Bixler of Waukegan, Ill.

title: My Friend The Bill Collector Stalks L. I.
description: If you live in Nassau or Suffolk, you just may be running into an old Point Lookout pal of mine, Jpe Slavin. That is, if you've been naughty.

title: The U. S. S. R. Looks Eastward
description: The Soviet economy this year has apparently made a less than auspicious start toward the goals set by the 1972 economic plan, largely as a result of an extremely severe winter. The widespread damage to the important crop of winter grains has already induced Communist party chief Leonid I. Brezhnev to hold two unusual conferences with regional officials to plan ways of compensating for the damage. In addition a beginning has been made toward what could become extensive 1972 grain imports.

title: HOTA,HUNGARIANS CUP FOES TODAY
description: New York Hota and the GermanHungarians will meet in the New York final for the United States Challenge Cup, the most coveted prize in American soccer, at Metropolitan Oval in Maspeth, Queens, today.

title: MARTHA ARGERICH SHOWS EXPERTISE
description: For an artist of Martha Argerich's reputation, she has played relativelY little in New York. The Argentine pianist made her debut here six years ago with a recital in Philharmonic Hall. Two years ago she played With the New York Philharmonic. She made her third appearance on Friday night as a recitalist at Rogers Auditorium of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Power From Waste Disposal
description: Combustion Equipment Associates, Inc., has found a way to dispose of waste and control pollution from offending plastics plants and, at the same time, generate power.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: CINCINNATI, March 4. (AP) The Cincinnati,Bearcats, utilizing a needling defense and balanced scoring, upended National Collegiate tourneybound Florida State, 88.64, today to keep alive their hopes of gaining a National Invitation Tournament bid.

title: Miss Schneider to Wed
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., March 4 Mr., and Mrs. Sidney Schneider have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Phyllis Ellen Schneider, to David Neil Sussman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman Sussman of Washington. Miss Schneider is an alumna of the American University. Her fiance attended. Memphis State University and Franklin Pierce College.

title: Mud Pies in the Sky
description: AS a child, Kate Serlin was an inveterate mudpiemaker. She's at it again, though her earthy creations are now a bit more sophisticated and she cooks them up in some of New York City's more elegant, aboveground gardens.

title: The World
description: RAWALPINDI, PakistanWith his nation beginning to heave dangerously under him, and with an uncertain government on his hands, Pakistan's President, Zulfikar All Bhutto, moved last week to blunt the claws of his most dangerous opposition.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: Pamela Bujarski's article, The Haute Cuisine Restaurants Here Are Up Against the Kitchen Wall (Feb. 20), indicates that haute is high in both quality and price. However, the customer whose bill is reproduced on the cover got a bargainthe tax for the meal was calculated at four cents less than it should have been! The New York Times knows better than most that the city can use every penny so please pay up.

title: TEMPLE FIVE TAKES MIDATLANTIC TITLE
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 4 (UPI)  Temple made six straight free throws in the final 36 seconds tonight to outlast St. Joseph's, 65.57, and capture the Middle Atlantic Conference University Division play offs at the Palestra.

title: The Campaign Managers Sometimes Get Caught in an Identity Crisis
Kozol the builder and Kozol the scourge
description: Free Schools is a pragmatic and polemical sequel to Jonathan Kozol's National Book Awardwinning Death at an Early Age. In the latter, Kozol described his brief career as an innovative teacher in the Boston Public Schools and his confrontations with its administrators, In the present book, he describes (and recommends) the far more wideranging confrontations necessary to the founding of a Free School, such as the one he and a small group have successfully run for six years in the black ghetto of Roxbury, Mass.

title: The life of a vengeful vegetable
description: Gun runner extraordinary, playboy son of a perpetual president of the Central American Republic of Tiniebias, lover of his father's mistress, Olympic wrestling champion, Yalie, Ambassador (Paris, Madrid), college abortion and prostitution entrepreneur, husband to a world famous movie star, card shark nonpareil, Kiki Sancudo is all these things and more. Then Kiki, the protagonist narrator of this revenge extravaganza, is shot down by his best friend on the eve of his own election as President of Tinieblas (translated: Darkness). Once grotesquely active and prodigiously virile he is now grotesquely inert, a vegetable. No matter. He lives now for revenge. He tells his story several after he has been shot, on the day of his father's last ascendancy. In the evening his father will be proclaimed President once again, and they will deliver the would be assassin to his bedside.

title: The Lakers Are Great, ut Why Aren't They Champs?; LOS ANGELES.
description: FRANKLY, I hate the Los Angeles Lakers. I've hated them ever since they were the Minneapolis Lakers back In the fifties, when they would regularly destroy my beloved and benighted New York Knicks. Their stars in those days still sound like a roll call of infamy: George Mikan and Jumping Jim Pollard, Slater Martin and Whitey Skoog (yes, Whitey Skoog). I despised any team that beat the Knicks, and that included just about everybody: the Syracuse Nats, the Boston Celtics, the Fort Wayne Pistons.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Driving home to Martha's Vineyard from Florida a few days ago, frogs singing in wet places and daffodils blooming on roadsides as far north as Georgia reminded me that I was once again totally unprepared for the advent of April trout fishing in the East.

title: A Friendly Phone Call for a ShutIn
description: Lynn Braswell, a stewardess, flew in from Beirut, took a taxi to her apartment on West 72d Street, read her mail and then picked up the telephone. The first person she called was Mrs. Evelyn Bennet, a homebound patient of Bellevue Hospital.

title: MIDDLEBURY SKIERS WIN EASTERN TITLE
description: CANTON, N.Y., March 4 (AP) Middlebury College won the Eastern Intercollegiate Skiing Association championship today as it took the crosscountry event to clinch a lead built over three days of competition.

title: Nets Defeat Condors, 133123, and Break Club's Season Attendance Mark
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., March 4Johnny Roche and Billy Paultz provided the late scoring that lifted the New York Nets to a 133123 American Basketball Association victory over the Pittsburgh Condors this afternoon at the Nassau Coliseum,) but Rick Barry made their lastminute heroics possible by scoring 37 points, including five 3point field goals.

title: House of 11 levels
description: The open, viewfilled house on Long Island illustrates just how far we've come in liberating the cramped, static rooms of the conventional house. The exterior of the 30foot cube gives little hint of the dramatic interior spaces. It contains eleven levels, stacked in short fourstep flights that encircle a center stairwellsomething like a giant pinwheel. Thus, architects Barbara and Julian Neski placed each room on a different. level with different view. Throughout the house there is an awareness of water, trees and skyand enough privacy to dispel the sense of nakedness that living in a glass house could induce.

title: HUNTER'S MATMEN CAPTURE CITY TITLE
description: Hunter College posted six victories in the 10 final matches yesterday and easily captured the first City University of New York wrestling championships at Hunter College yesterday.

title: Askew Raises $25,000 for TV Time to Continue Fight on Antibusing Referendum
description: MIAMI, March 4Gov. Reubin Askew of Florida has raised at least $25,000 for television time to combat widespread, antibusing sentiment.

title: The Magic Words In the Catskills: More, More, More
Arthur Daley
description: VERO BEACH, Fla., March 4There is new look to Dodgertown this year. There is, also a new look to, the Dodgers. For tourist who has been visiting this spring training encampment for almost a quarter of a century, its the first item that catches the eye. Dodgertown has finally moved from a slum into luxury surroundings. For 20odd yearssome were very too generations,of Brooklyn and Los Angeles ballplayers rejoiced. at the matchless facilities offered their for polishing their skills and then recoiled at the miserable facilities foisted on them as living quarters. Dodgertown was the creation of Branch Rickey and really wasn't too impossible a place in the early years, just after the war.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Princeton Wins, 7662
description: NEW HAVEN, March 4 Brian Taylor scored 23 of his 28 points in the second half tonight to lead Princeton to 7662 victory over Yale.

title: A peculiar trip on wild academic seas
description: Generally speaking, books by college presidents are artifacts on the day of their publication. They are like shards of ancient pottery: One must record their existence and occasionally exhibit them, but, of course, one does not actually expect to use them for anything. William Birenbaum's book about his own education is delightful and amazing exception. It is not only useful, it is entertaining and vastly alive. So much so that if Birenbaum doesn't shape up, it will probably be necessary to expel him, for a decade or two, from the society of college administrators.

title: D. L. Bartoletti Weds Pamela Lane
description: AKRON, Ohio, March 4Miss Pamela Ann Lane, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Harry Lane, formerly of Darien, Conn., was married here today to Donald Leroy Bartoletti, son of Mrs. Frederick A. Bartoletti of Carmichaels, Pa., and the late Mr. Bertaletti. Special to The New York Times

title: Mrs. Elizabeth Marvin Is Wed To Rev. Justus John Fennel Jr.
description: In the Dana Chapel at the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church yesterday, Mrs Elizabeth St. John Marvin, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Fordyce Barker St. John of New York and Woodstock, Vt., was married to the Rev. Justus John Fennel Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Fennel of Stratford, Conn. The ceremony, performed by the Rev. Dr. David H. C. Read, was attended only by members of the immediate families.

title: For 17, Roa,d Back From Jail Begins At L.I.U.
description: The New York State Board of Parole has released 17 men from prison on parole so that they can study at Long Island University.

title: Stoke City Captures English Football League Cup by Defeating Chelsea,21
description: LONDON, March 4 (Reuters) Stoke City gained its first major trophy since the team was formed 100 years ago by beating Chelsea, 21, in the English Soccer League Cup final before a crowd of 100,000 at Wembley today.

title: Most of us see only the surgical tip of the iceberg
description: Surgeons are the glamour boys of the medical profession. Mention the word transplant, and whose name comes to mind? Christiaan Barnard's. When, in 1967, he performed the first humantohuman heart transplant his picture graced the cover of Time, he danced with Sophia Loren, and he appeared on all the television talk shows. In short, he acquired what passes in the 20th century for fame.

title: The cool look of linen.
description: The costume that looks like separates combines linenlike orange jacket and forest green skirt with a green and white sheer cotton bodice. By Beene Boutique. $225. Signature Collection, Gimbels East. Hat by Mr. John.

title: 50,000 Auto Racing Fans Come to Sebring But So Do Golfers and the Shuffleboard Set
description: SEBBING, Fla.  If my father had not confessed his abnormal interest in Floridaboom hotels, I might still be under the mistaken impression that Sebring is on the map only because of the auto race that has been held here Tor the last 21 years and will be run again on March 25.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: G. J. Marcus, a British writer remembered for an account of the Titanic sinking (The Maiden Voyage) undertakes a history of a classic period of naval warfare  the Royal Navy's struggle against Revolutionary and Napoleonic France. It is a clear and readable narrative, marked throughout by able analysis, its value enhanced by useful maps, illustrations and bibliographies. For American readers, of particular interest it a good chapter on Mr. Madison's War"a subject about which English writers usually have little to say.

title: EAST CAROLINA FIVE IS SOUTHERN VICTOR
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., March 4 (UPI)Nicky White scored a basket I with one second left in the overtime period today that gave East Carolina a 7775 victory over Furman, the Southern Conference basketball title and a berth in the National Collegiate playoffs.

title: Lead Vie On Scores
description: BOWIE, Md., March 4 (AP)Lead Me On, the leading Marylandbred of 1971, gained her first stakes victory of the season in the $22,000added Conniver Handicap at Bowie today.

title: STUDENTS DECLINE DAVIS JURY DUTY
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., March 4At the end of the first week in the effort to select a jury for the trial of Angela Davis, a defense attorney was asked to comment on the progress.

title: Arehitectare
description: AND it's not happening just here and there. it's not the odd small town or the aberrant banker. It's an epidemic. To Main Street everywhere, the drivein banks come. To the New England village, the upstate town, the places that stand for history, beauty and amenity. They come, ruining the patrimony and the scenery, over the protests of the people who live there. Your friendly banker knows best.

title: HONG KONG FINDS HOPE IN NIXON TRIP
description: HONG KONG, March 4President Nixon's visit to China was followed with special interest in this British Crown Colony which has been described as a borrowed place living on borrowed time.

title: Three Sisters Of the Cornfield
description: SOME crops go together as a matter of convenience, to save space, or just because of natural affinity. Or, one crop may aid another.

title: Art
description: THE first of the Four American Primitives in the exhibition of that name, at the ACA Galleries, 25 East 73rd Street, is Edward Hicks, born in 1780 and dead since 1849, the grandest old man and gentlest spirit of them all. Thenine versions of his Peaceable Kingdom in the show; plus i a couple of other paintingsall of them familiarhave taken 'On the patina of old masters, both actual, with that delicate unifying textural film that old paintings acquire, and figurative, as survivors of an American past less than two centuries vanished but so far away from us in our turbulence that Giotto is hardly further removed than Hicks.

title: Miss deGive, Art Editor, Wed to Thomas Weber
description: Miss Ghislaine deGive, an art editor with Little, Brown & Co., the Boston publishing house, was married in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour here yesterday afternoon to Thomas Gard Weber, who is a special assistant to Mayor Kevin White of Boston. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Charles Quinn and was followed by a reception at the Colony Club.

title: 5 HELD IN DEATH OF DAKOTA INDIAN
description: GORDON, Neb., March 4Five persons have been charged with various counts of manslaughter and false imprisonment following the death of a 51yearold Oglala Sioux Indian in a case that has stirred anger nationally among American Indians.

title: 911 SERVICE HERE TO BE IMPROVED
description: The emergency police, fire and ambulance telephone number911which was dialed by nearly seven million New Yorkers last year, is to be improved through decentralization when the service is moved to the city's new Police Headquarters next January.

title: Wealth of Knowledge Gained By Dog Breeders at Seminar
description: It wasn't another California gold rush, but 600 fanciers did receive a wealth of knowledge at, the seminar for dog breeders sponsored by the Gaines bog Research Center recently in. San Francisco.

title: Marguerite E. Dorment Affianced
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., March 4The engagement of Miss Marguerite Ellen Dorment to William Harvey Glover 3d has been announced by Mrs. James Dorment, mother of the. bridetobe. Her fiance's parents are Mr. and Mrs. William H. Glover of Locust.

title: Blacks Organize Concern For Great Lakes Shipping
description: CLEVELAND, March 4The first blackowned Great Lakes shipping concern is scheduled to begin operation this spring.

title: The World
description: BEIRUT  The Palestinian guerrillas, once a potent force in the Middle East, have decided to give up their last settled bases without a struggle. The swaggering young men in their leopardspotted camouflage jackets, and with machine guns in hand, will now not risk a confrontation even with the 15,000man Lebanese Army.

title: New Meadowlands Chief Foresees Dramatic Things, for Region
description: NORTH ARLINGTON Operations of the Hacken?? Meadowlands Development Commission will be directed beginning Mardh 15 by an, early proponent of regional development of the reeadows, one of the agency's first commissioners, and a figure in, the New Jersey Sports and Recreation Authority that convinced the New York Football Giants to move to North Jersey.

title: New &Novel
description: An ancient redwood, in William Mulvihill's offbeat Western, becomes the focus of a dark night of the soul. The tree is encountered by a wagon train into 1846, negotiating the sierras into California. Some of erence by the manifestation of a godlike thing"; some find it an outlet for diabolical urges, and try to cut the tree down. In the shadow of the ominous branches, the forces of light and darkness work out a taut little parable.

title: Son to the Hngh Hellers
description: A son was born, Feb. 25 to Mr. and Mrs. Hugh M. Heller of New York at the University Hospital. The child has been named Peter Slade.

title: A theological prototype
description: Half of reviewing is hitting off a book's exact literary form not so easy in an age of waffling. Scholars imitate journalism; journalists write autobiography; autobiographers make fictions; novelists write history; theologianswell, here is a sample, part biography, part intellectual history, part treatise.

title: COACH OF FIVE CALLS IT A CAREER
description: Jack Barry, MIT's. most successful basketball coach, has announced his retirement after guiding teams that posted a 162.122 wonlost record over 13 seasons. Barry will continue as Assistant Director of Athletics at Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Englewood's East Hill Is Changing bui Gracefully
description: ENGLEWOOD  J. A. Humphrey, selected his site well. He chose to build on a pleasant pasture above the valley on the reverse slope of the ,Palisades. The land on, that hill today is still the choicest in. Englewood and its evolution from farmland in the days of the Dutch, to one of the most affluent residential areas within15 minutes of New York City would have gilded the hopes of any founding father.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Does foreign investment by American companies threaten the jobs of American workers?

title: March
description: If you like variety, March is your month. It is February with a chuckle, the sound of brooks flowing again, and it Is April with a head cold. March can be mud and snowdrifts, ice and innocent skies, with the sun higher and brighter than it has been since September. It is a time when you can believe almost anything might happen. It might snow a foot tomorrow, or it might turn so mild the trees could skip the preliminaries and burst into full leaf next week.

title: C.H.S.A.A. Final Today: LaSalle Opposes Power
Chiang Is Reported Willing To Accept Presidential Draft
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 4 (UPI)  Generalissimo Chiang Kaishek, 84 years old, who has expressed the desire to retire as President of Nationalist China will accept a draft and run for a fifth sixyear term party spokesman said today.

title: Post Five Beats Brooklyn; Webber Reaches 1,000
description: GREENVALE, L. I., March 4 Jim Webber became the third member of the 1,000point club at C. W. Post College as he hit for 24 in leading the Pioneers to a 7468 basketball victory over Brooklyn college tonight. Webber, a 6fobt2inch senior forward from Jamaica, wound up his career at Post with 1,001 points.

title: New Laws Help Minors to Receive Health Care Without Consent of Their Parents
description: A 15yearold boy. with a bad Cut on his hand went with his parents to the emergency room of a New York City hospital. The cut was stitched. When he returned alone a week later to have the stitches removed, the Hospital refused to treat him because his parents were not there.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON Whether or not it was the week that changed the world, it was the week that temporarily changed television viewing habits, and that alone was enough to make politicians nervous.

title: MRS. LOUIS WEINSTOCK
description: Mrs. Celia Dubowy Weinstock, widow of Louis Weinstock, a founder of the Metropolitan News Company, died Friday in Mount Sinai Hospital at the age of 84. She lived at 135 Eastern Parkway, Brooklyn.

title: Rhode Island Beats Maine, Takes Conference Crown
description: KINGSTON, R.I., March 4 (AP)  The University of Rhode Island won the Yankee Conference basketball championship today with an 8968 victory over Maine.

title: The true American lives in a fantasy of equality and homogeneity
description: One would like to be sympathetic toward Peter Schrag's new book. After all, his heart seems to be more or less in the right place, and he emphatically disapproves of much that deserves disapproval in American history. Thus, he repeatedly stigmatizes, with abundant illustrations, the perwsive fantasy of Americanism.. a fantasy of equality and homogeneity, that was embodied in the old myth of the cleancut, rugged Wasp as the true, the only, American. He argues energetically for the creation of a genuine cultural pluralism after the upheavals of the 1960's that finally destroyed the ideal of Wasp hegemony. He abhors the cult of technology, bureaucratic impersonality, the new plastic world of Holiday Inns and Green Stamps which Americam are encouraged to see as their fitting heritage; and he tries to envisage other, more human possibilities of life in this country.

title: Miss White, Fencing Standout, Bidding for an Olympic Berth
description: Her threeday visit to Turin, Italy, next weekend is only the first stop of a sixmonth journey for a New York University fencing star, Ruth. White. Miss White hopes the final.destination will be the Summer Olympic Games in Munich In August.

title: Missouri Democrats See Bill Bradley as the Open Man
description: ST. LOUIS, March 4Even when Bill Bradley was achieving statewide fame leading the Crystal City Hornets to the 1961 state basketball finals, his coach said, He never seemed to lose his deep interest in the problems of other. people.But for the future, he's just the type of young man we've been diligently searching for but  quite frankly  haven't found until now, Greenberg continued. You know, the athletic image, bright, intelligent, photogenic, young and serious.

title: N.F.L.Tackles Dullness Issue
description: Its critics, especially those who espouse college football with more plays per game and more scoring, say pro football has become dull. That is a fighting word to Paul Brown of the Cincinnati Bengals; Al Davis, Oakland Raiders; Jim Finks, Minnesota Vikings, and Tex Schramm, Dallas Cowboys, who compose the competitions committee. The committee is the National Football League's equivalent to Wilbur Mills's powerful Ways and Means Committee in Congress. The four committeemen, each the operating head of a franchise, will spend five days next week on the lovely Hawaiian island of Maui dissecting the state of the game. They will frame their recommendations in the form of rules changes for the annual league meeting, which opens in Honolulu on March 20.

title: RAMPAL SOLOS SHOW A FLUENCY ON FLUTE
description: JeanPierre Rampal, the celebrated French flutist, was again the star at Philharmonic Hall on Friday night, appearing this time as soloist with the Orchestre Jean Francois Paillard. This is an ensemble of 11 strings and harpsichord conducted by Mr. Pailliard.

title: Radicals Plan Strategy For National Convention
description: STONY BROOK, L.I., March 4More than 300 members of radical organizations from the New York area and scattered parts of the country gathered this weekend at the State University of New York at Stony Brook to lay the foundation for the development of a revolutionary youth organization.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Trout Fishing in Yugoslavia Plumbs the Depths of Emotion
description: YOU HAVE not fished until you have fished for trout in Yugoslavia. And you have not plumbed the depths of human emotion until you have seen the hard gray eyes of a Swiss banker brimming with tears after he has played and lost the trout of a lifetime. I will tell you all about the fishing in general presently. But first let me tell you about the banker.

title: Police Training Wins Praise and Criticism
description: NEWARKMore than 150 policemen went back on duty in communities across the state last week after completion of a twomonth basic training program that has been highly praised but also criticized as too little or too late.

title: Bridge When losers take all
description: TRADITIONAL economic theory I assumed that the head of a business enterprise would always take the line of action likely to lead to the maximum profit. In practice this may be poor strategy for an entrepreneur who faces competition: If his business is highly lucrative, he may tempt his rivals into the field.

title: Mrs. Nixon Plants Flower
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., March 4 (AP)Mrs. Richard M. Nixon planted today a, camellia named in her honor in the state capitol park before hundreds of cheering Girl Scouts to open Sacramento's 18th annual Camellia Festival. At least three hecklers were arrested for shouting obscenitis.

title: Stage: Four Black Plays
description: Last weekend and this weekend the LaMarna Experimental Theater has been producing an evening called Short Bullins at the Actor's Playhouse Theater on East Fourth Street between the Bowery and Second Avenue, just opposite the regular LaMama Theater. Short Bullins are four brief, vaguely interlinked plays by the prolific Ed Bullins, staged and directed by Allie Woods.

title: Poison Plot Laid to Youths
description: CHICAGO, March 4 (UPI)Steven Pera, 18 years old, and Allen Schwander, 19, were indicted by a Cook County grand jury yesterday on charges of conspiracy to commit murder by allegedly planning to poison Chicago's water supply.

title: Floridians Triumph, 124117
description: MIAMI BEACH, March (AP)The Floridians scrambled back from a 19point deficit and overcame a 45point performance by Julius Erving to beat the Viriginia Squires, 124117 tonight.

title: DEAL IS SURPRISE
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. March 4While heavy rain pelted Fort Lauderdale Stadium and the rays from eight light standards substituted for the elusive Florida sun, Denny McLain discovered a rainbow today, when the lowly Texas Rangers traded him to the pennant contending Oakland Athletics.

title: Lori Karen Mason To Be Wed June 25
description: WESTON, Conn. March 4 Mr. and Mrs. Harold J. Mason have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lori Karen Mason, to Richard Alan Reisman, son of Dr. and Mrs. Edward R. Reisman of. Atlanta. The wedding is planned for June 25.

title: Nixon Daughter Thinks Democrats Look Easy
MADISON AVE.
description: It took a while to penetrate. But social activists have finally proved to the business world that the real world is in chaos. That the environment is a mess. That there are rampant injustices in hiring practices. And that the public is reacting to business's lack of concern for social problems.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, March 4The gony of the long Presidential primary elections is now on top of us and about all the poor candidates and voters can do is to cry for help.

title: I.T.T. Lobbyist in Hospital Is Served Senate Subpoena
description: WASHINGTON March 4 Agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation have located Mrs Dita D Beard the missing lobbyist for the International Telephone and. Telegraph cor Oration in a Denver hospital.

title: Bareness is backand backs are bare.
description: Whitepure and simpleleaves lots of silky skin exposed. The petalcollared halter in silk and rayon crepe is by Oscar de la Renta. $335. Designer Dresses, fifth floor, Saks Fifth.

title: CARSAFETY DATA HARD TO GET HERE
description: Safety information about new automobiles is not too easy to find in New York dealer showrooms these days, even though dealers have been required by the Federal Government since Jan. 1 to have information on braking, tires and acceleration available for customers to take home.

title: John Britt Donovan Is Fiance Of Miss Nancy R. Goetzman
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., March 4 Mr. and Mrs. Robert Renn Goetzman, have announced the engageirient of their daughter, Miss Nancy Renn Goetzman, to John Britt Donovan, son of Mrs. Thomas M. O'Connor of Brooklyn, New York, and the late James Britt Donovan, a lawyer and educator.

title: GREECE DISAVOWS FORCE ON CYPRUS
description: ATHENS March 4Greece repudiated the use of force to settle the current Cyprus crisis today but insisted that the island's President Archbishop Makarios should obey Athens, the national center.

title: Smith Beats Morris High In Title Basketball, 6347
description: Clifton Hollingsworth, Steve Gillens and Carlos Martinez, seniors who stand under 6 feet 2 inches each, scored a total of 45 points yesterday to lead Alfred E. Smith High School to, a 6347 victory over Morris High School in the Public Schools Athletic League Class B championship at Brandeis High.

title: What is the role of the lawyer?; Law Against The People; Essays to Demystify Law, Order and the Courts. Edited by Robert Lefcourt. 400 pp. New York: Random House. Cloth, $8.95. Paper, $2.45.
description: At a recent Chicago conference of some 200 lawyers, political activists and community workers committed to prison reform, speaker after speaker inveighed against the narrow focus upon lawyers as technicians of due process. The law, it was charged, concerned itself with procedural niceties and formal rules while prisoners were brutalized and mechanized and their pressing needs ignored.

title: McCloskey's Primary Campaign Has Its Ups and Downs
description: CLAREMONT, N. H.It looked, at last, like a Presidential campaign.

title: Study Scores the Ways Property Is Assessd
description: TREITTONEYer Since the first local property taxes Were Imposed in New Jersey in 1851 one of the most Powerful and enduring traditions in the state has been the jealously guarded prerogative of individual communities to decide how much their Property worth so that they alone could judge how much it should be taxed.

title: The Nation
description: HARRISBURGAn exconvict with a record of forgery, impersonation and assault sat all last week in the witness chair at the antiwar conspiracy trial of the Harrisburg Seven. He was the Government's star witness against a group of Catholic priests and nuns, plus a Pakistani Moslem, accused of weird plot to blow up heating tunnels in Washington on a winter day in 1971 and to kidnap next day Presidential adviser Henry A. Kissinger.

title: Population:
description: The rich make money and the poor make babies. Of course. But there are indications that the poor are no longer going along. A private study of Census Bureau data was released last week by Planned ParenthoodWorld Population, a major nonprofit birthcontrol organization. It revealed that the birth rate among lowerincome women in the United States declined so sharply in the late 1960's that they bore a million fewer children than they would have if births had maintained the rate of the early years of the decade.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: LAWRENCE A. HYMAN
description: Lawrence A. Hyman, a retired textile manufacturer and a former member of the American Stock Exchange, died of a heart attack yesterday at his residence in the Ambassador Hotel, Palm Beach, Fla. He was 77 years old and lived also at 80 Park Avenue.

title: The World
description: TOKYO  On the night the SinoAmerican communiqu was released in Shanghai last week, newsmen of the boisterous Japanese press swarmed into the sleek and modern Ministry of Foreign Affairs to berate the Minister, Takeo Fukuda.

title: The World
description: Moscow's moral and diplomatic support for India and the Bengali rebels last December is generally credited with having been an important factor in winding up the brief IndoPakistan war leading to the independence of the Bengali nation of Bangladesh. So it was natural that when Bangladesh's new Prime Minister, Sheik Mujibur Rahman, made his first trip outside the Indian subcontinent, it would be to Moscow,

title: Poor Treehorn, poor Yanos; The Magic Tears; By Jack Sendak. Illustrated by Mitchell Miller. 58 pages. New York: Harper & Row. $3.95. (Ages 7 to 11)
description: To appreciate this story fully, you need to see two aspects: the one, simple fantasy and the other, something less common. The first is easy, the second is easy to miss.

title: Manhattan Defeats UConn By 83.71 as Garner Stars
description: STORRS, Conn., March 4Richle Garner's 26 points led Manhattan to its 10th victory in the last 12 games, an 8371 decision over Connecticut tonight.

title: Cambodians Bomb Enemy
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia March 4 (Reuters)The Cambodian Air Force today launched heavy bombing raids against enemy concentrations on a river island just outside Cambodia's second largest city, Kompong Cham the military command said.

title: Ohio State Beaten
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., March 4 (UPI)Indiana lost an 8point lead, then rallied to whip Ohio State, 6557, today and knock the Buckeyes out of a tie for the Big Ten lead. Ohio State is 9.4 in the Big Ten and 176 over all. Indiana is 75 and 157.

title: Helen Lubin Engaged To Robert M. Stark
description: Mr. and Mrs. Emanuel Lubin of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Helen Joan Lubin, to. Robert Michael Stark, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter M. Stark of Huntington Woods, Mich.

title: If You Haven't Got a Corpse, You're Dead
description: I SAW Night Watch at a preview matinee, and by midnight of the same day I had satisfied myself that I understood its plot. (I accomplished this by pinning the less muscular members of my family into corners from which they could not with honor escape and reciting to them, in the most patient detail, the story Lucille Fletcher had arranged and was trying to fathom. No member of my family has spoken to me since, and must say that that is the principal benefit I derived from the occasion.)

title: Sweater dressing means dress plus sweater.
description: The epitome of sweater dresses, by Chester Weinberg, is black silk with its red, white and green pattern picked up on the crocheted vest. The black patent belt has a silvery buckle. $345. Place Elegante, Bloomingdale's.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: The unsung hero of Seventh Avenue is the sales representative who spends many lonely weeks on the road selling his company's wares. This is the man who gets few accolades in the garment trade, yet without him the whole apparel distribution system might easily collapse.

title: Future of Nation in Trade Linked to Metric System
description: DENVER, March 4 (UPI)The United States must convert to the metric system of weights and measures or it will be slowly forced out of a growing share of world trade, according to the director of the National Bureau of Standards.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: TENNESSEE DOWNS AUBURN FIVE, 8070
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., March 4 (UPI)Tennessee, down by 3 points at the half, burst out of a deadlock with Auburn in the final five minutes today to Post an 8070 Southeastern Conference basketball victory that kept the Vols in first place in their drive for the league title.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: It has occurred to me that while you have presented in the article How Big Is Too Big? (Feb. 13) a few components of a very large system, it would be more useful to examine a much more fundamental concept That is:

title: UPSET BY MARYLAND PUTS VIRGINIA 2D
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., March 4 (UPI)Darreil Brown, junior, scored Maryland's last 8 points tonight to help the Terrapins past a 45.42 basketball victory over ninthranked Virginia.

title: LANDFILL CRISIS NEARING FOR CiTY
description: Faced with no suitable substitute for simply dumping the city's garbage on the ground, Mayor Lindsay and his top environmental official, Jerome Kretchmer, are disagreeing publicly on when the city will reach a crisis by running out of land.

title: Public Is Asked for Advice On New Wilderness Sites
description: WASHNGTON March 4(UPI) The Forest Service, which administers 40 nationals forests in Eastern states, has called for public advice on how to select and establish wilderness areas in the East.

title: Newark Medical School Is About to Start to Rise
description: NEWARK  The state's budding medical school system will take a giant $21.5million step forward tomorrow, when the next construction phase is scheduled to start at the College of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey, now housed in temporary quarters in the city's Central Ward.

title: Pittsburgh Grew With a Graded Tax
description: PITTSBURGH  The graded tax in Pittsburgh, has been in effect since 1913, has been given some of the credit for this city's, major urban renewal effort. after World War II. Although superficial efforts have been made to repeal the act that made it effective, it has never been seriously challenged.

title: Drugs:
description: The Latin Connection may never be the same. French customs agents last Thursday found half a ton of pure herion cached in concrete in the bilges of a Caribbean shrimp boat seized off Marseilles. Worth an estimated $200million on the streets of New York, the heroin cargo was by far the largest ever captured and was said by narcotics officials to be enough to supply the entire American addict population for a month.

title: CRIME STUDY DUE FOR WESTCHESTER
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 4A Westchester crime profile, a huge undertaking that seeks to correlate crime statistics in each of the county's 205 census tracts with social characteristics and with the level of services available there, is being compiled here by the Westchester Council of Social Agencies.

title: Censorship on Television
description: IT is our hope to convey to you our heartfelt belief that there are two related issues which fall within the scope of these hearings and which demand your most urgent attention.

title: We Have the Awful Knowledge To Make Exact Copies Of Human Beings
ExG. I. Who Disclosed Mylai BitterOver Army Role in Inquiry
description: TEMPE, Ariz, March 4Mylai is a name few Americans will easily forget. But few Americans are likely to recall the name Ronald Lee Eidenhour, the Vietnam veteran whose singular, yearlong effort exposed the massacre.

description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., March 4Miss Judith Hauck and Nelp Thomas Lippert of New York were married here today in St. Cassian's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Thomas Madden.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: Both these books are concerned with the same thing: the personal psychological and social consequences of accepting the myth of Jesus as Christ in the Gospels and particularly the myth of the Incarnation as extended through every man. Marc Oraison is a French priestpsychiatrist and apparently orthodox Freudian analyst. Eugene Kennedy, who teaches in Loyola University, Chicago, is a clinical psychologist of eclectic persuasion.

title: Cornell Six Blanks Brown, Earns 7th Ivy Title in Row
description: ITHACA, N.Y., March 4 (AP) Cornell picked up a record seventh consecutive Ivy League hockey championship today, trouncing Brown, 80, in the final regularseason game of the season for both teams.

title: Elks Racial Policy Fought
description: BOSTON, March 4 (AP)The whitesonly membership policy of the Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks has been challenged in a suit filed in United States District Court. William F. Ezell, scoutmaster of the Boy Scout troop sponsored by the Middleboro Elks lodge, alleges in the suit that, solely because he is black, he was not permitted to join the lodge.

title: Chanler A Chapman and Dr. Ida Wagman Are Wed
description: ANCRAM,. N.Y., March 4 Dr, Ida R. Holzberg Wagman of New York and Ancram, a psychiatrist with the Ulster County Mental Health Center, and Chanler Armstrong Chapman, a descendant of John. Jay, the first Chief Justice of the United States, and of the first John Jacob Astor, were married here this afternoon. Justice of he Peace Roy Boice Jr. of Columbia County performed the ceremony at the bride's home.

title: U.S S. Jets Bomb 3 Sites in. North; Hanoi Reports Downing a Plane
description: SAIGON South Vietnam Sunday, March 5 (AP)American fighterbombers yesterday attacked three antiaircraft artillery sites inside North Vietnam that fired on three unarmed reconnaissance planes the United States command announced today.

title: Mrs. Victor Has Child
description: A daughter was born Feb. 5 to Mr. and Mrs. William A. Victor of Bronxville, N.Y., at the University Hospital. Mrs. Victor is the former Miss Virginia McGough. Her husband is a vice president of E. F. Hutton & Co. The child has been named Lauren Michele.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor: Although it may be true of Diron Frieders, Edmund Wilson and now Vladimir Nabokovare mistaken when they assume I do not exist.

title: Poor Treehorn, poor Yanos; The Shrinking Of Treehorn; By Florence Parry Heide. Illustrated by Edward Gorey. Unpaged. New York: Holiday House. $3.95. (Ages 5 to 8)
description: It is always a pleasure to see that a new vehicle has been found for Edward Gorey's distinctive drawings, and in this instance a fey, imaginative little tale that fits them to perfection. Which comes first, the story or the drawings? Treehorn is a Gorey character, even without virtue of the illustrations. Florence Parry Heide has created an impassive yet anxious little boy fast learning the ways of the world he must grow into. And his finest lesson is that grownups pay no attention to children; that they are to be seen and not heard. Poor Treehorn even has trouble being seen. Or understood.

title: Explodent Captures Swift And Pays $7 at Aqueduct
description: With dwindling attendance and possible strikes threatening to turn it from the Big A to the little a, Aqueduct gave its top 3yearolds a chance to stand up and be counted yesterday.

title: Leafs Beat Kings, 32
description: TORONTO, March 4 (UPI)Pierre Jarry's first goal as a Toronto Maple Leaf, at 14:08 of the second period, proved decisive as the Leafs edged the Los Angeles Kings, 32 tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: McCarey Wins 2Mile At Mayor'sMeet in 9:15
description: Kevin McCarey, who has put Cathedral Prep on the scholastic track map, served notice yesterday that he's ready for the Eastern States Indoor Championships on Tuesday.

NATO Group Establishes Underwater Acoustic Testing Range in the Azores for Communications Research
description: CASCAIS, Portugal  A deepsea acoustic station installed in Portugal's Azores archipelago under the auspices of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization has begun limited operations and will soon be formally inaugurated.

description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 4It looks more like a camp for refugees from the New York Metswith Donn Clendenon, Art Shamsky, Don Shaw, Jim Bibby, Rich polkers, Charlie Hudson and Bill Denehy in those gray stretch baseball suits with the bright red trim.

description: One way or another, according to Manhattan Borough President Percy E. Sutton, plan to decentralize city government will be on the ballot here in November.
