description: The Chanel look goes on forever. This suit has a pleated plaid skirt and a solid aqua cardigan jacket bound with the plaid. In sizes 3646. $140. Blouse, $14. At Roarnan's. Shoes by Battani.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: Last year, when Kurt Salmon became 60 years old, a few kibitzers in the New York office of Kurt Salmon Associates wired him on the office. Teletype to Atlanta where he was visiting. In honor of the founder's birthday, the message said, the New York office will be closed tomorrow.

title: Special Bus Runs Set Up
description: TRENTON, March 4  William E. Ozzard, president of the Board of Public Utility Commissioners, has announced a number of steps taken to ease commuter problems in the wake of the strike.

title: Symphony Extends Season
description: Henry Lewis and his New Jersey Symphony, Orchestra are flexing their knees and preparing, for a great leap fOrward. Mr. Lewis, who was named music director of the orchestra in February, 1968, knows it won't be easy, but as the first black man ever chosen to lead an important American orchestra he has some experience with pioneeringand success.

title: COLONELS DEFEAT CHAPS, 98 TO 88
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., March 4 (AP)The Kentucky Colonels erased a 9point halftime deficit tonight and went on to defeat the Dallas Chaparrals, 9888, and clinch the Eastern Division championship of the American Basketball Association.

title: Camp uses Mobilizing For National Election
description: PRINCETON  Some of the passionate enthusiasm that marked the participation of youths in the election campaigns of 1968 and 1970 is missing, but political activity by New Jersey's collegeage voters currently is achieving a slow, but steady, momentum.

title: If...?
description: Once upon a time there was a Swedish folk singer who knew how to make movies and TV documentaries, was on government radio and also wrote books. It wasn't much of a time ago either; he's pushing 30 now. From an abiding passion he wrote SCIENCE FICTION: Begynnelsen Till Vara Dagar, revised it, enlarged and updated it, and translated it, now it comes to us from Ace (95 cents) as SCIENCE FICTION: What It's All About. His name is Sam J. Lundwall, and he is informed, opinionated, occasionally abrasive, often humorous and, above all, articulate. He has amassed the most astonishing amount of information on speculative fiction  its early history (he goes back to Lucian), its appearance in various literatures, what made it happen and what it makes happen. Speculative fiction  science fiction, if you like it is today what it has always been: provocative, mindbending, questing, testing and indefinable. Once you're sure it's Only about rocket ships, a Zelazny or a Bradbury dazzles

title: Bordeaux Wine Exports Up
description: BORDEAUX, France, March 4 (Reuters)The Wine Producers Association has announced that Bordeaux wine exports increased by 29 per cent in volume and 19 per cent in value last year. Thirteen million gallons of bottled and barreled wine worth $57.2mil lion was exported.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: HONG KONGThe most interesting political event of President Nixon's China trip was his meeting with Chairman Mao Tsetung. The President's actual negotiations were with Premier Chou Enlai but, when Chou arranged that Mao should give the talks and their subsequent accord the imprimatur of his. vast prestige, the matter assumed more vital importance.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONA network anchorman intoned that it was the biggest political scandal of this election year. Acting Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst called it a lie. To Senator Philip A. Hart of Michigan, a Democrat, it was one more chapter in the story of why people don't have faith in the system. To Senator Hugh Scott of Pennsylvania, a Republican, it was a fishing expedition.

title: WINTER INTERRUPTS ANTARCTIC MISSION
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand March 4 (AP)Operation Deep Freeze has closed down for the southern hemisphere's winter and will resume its support of United States scientific research In Antarctica early in September.

title: Complaints on Rent Rules Increasing
description: WASHINGTON, March 4The Price Commission's complex rent regulations, one of the biggest headaches of the economic stabilization program virtually from the outset, are coming under increasing criticism in Washington and throughout the country.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: Maurice (180572) was a major Victorian figure best remembered today for his efforts to apply Christian principles to social reform, especially after the revolutionary events of 1848. This study by a Columbia University historian shows him as leader of that group of Christian Socialists who argued that socialism was the truest expression of democracy. A convert from Unitarianism to Anglicanism, he wrote and lectured widely, taught at Kings College, London, and Cambridge and founded a Working Men's College to further his theological and social ideas, His individualistic views and his efforts to extract the essential truths from divergent religious groups made him a gadfly to all parties"; the author compares him in radical depth to Kierkegaard. Olive Brose has written a wellresearched book, not exciting, but valuable in its intellectual portrait of one who managed to be both radical and

title: Spring's Own Cleanup Crew
description: THE first member of our spring cleanup crew appeared at the back porch three nights ago. We'd been expecting him. We had put out table scraps nightly so there'd be something when he arrived. He's welcome at any time, but especially so now, for his presence is a sure sign that winter is losing its grip. Our little freeloader is the anchorman of the fourfooted maintenance forcethe skunk.Freeloader, of course, is the wrong term. Like so many of its wild neighbors the skunk is really a vital part of the outdoor world. After a long winter sleep, punctuated perhaps by a yawn and a short stroll during a January thaw, the skunk finally calls it quits and comes out for good on one of these blustery March nights. Sniffing about with that probing little nose, peering into crevices with those myopic black eyes, it starts in on the rubble left from the long winter.

title: Movies
description: LONDON LET me tell you about dream I had the other night, rather typical of the nouveau rave going around. Going around my skull, anyway. In this dream some guy is saying: This caper has to wait six months. Lap dissolves. Six months later. LIVING ROOM. EARLY MORNING LIGHT. Well, it woke me up.

title: The last days of the Daffy Brooklyn Dodgers
description: Any baseball book that begins with a quotation from Dylan Thomas can't be all good. But then, this book is about team so extraordinary that Marianne Moore wrote poems to it, so perhaps Roger Kahn's pretentiousness is not entirely out of place. The boys of summer" were named Reese, Robinson, Hodges, Campanella, Snider, Pafko, Cox, Furillo. They were the starting lineup of the best team the majors ever sawthe Brooklyn Dodgers of the early 1950's.

title: Bird of Peace Will Tour the Country
description: TRENTON  A replica of the Bird of Peace porcelain work that President Nixon presented to China and her people during his Peking visit last month will embark on a tour of the United States next month.

title: Vietnam Hospital Nurse Doubles in Surgery
description: KONTUM South Vietnam Phang does not know why the Vietcong shot him and his friends as they swam in the stream near their village one warm morning last week. He is a slender Montagnard boy of 15, and the Vietcong disappeared into the jungle after they wounded him in the hip.

title: Patricia Naomi Hilman Betrothed
description: GLEN RIDGE, N. J., March. 4Drittild Mrs. Ernest C. Hillman Jr. of Glen Ridge and Culver, Ind have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Patricia Naomi Hillman, to George Michael Brookover, son of Prof. and Mrs. Wilbur B. Brookover of East Lansing, Mich., and Bippus, Ind.

title: Television FrameSnatching
description: Television is about to spawn a multimilliondollar business based on the marriage of modern integrated circuit technology and the oldline electron tube. It is called framesnatching or frame grabbing and is already at work in space and Government laboratories, universities, pharmaceutical houses, airline terminals and even in the White House.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I enjoyed reading East Harlem Owner Says I Was a Slumlord,' [Jan. 30]. My plight was worse. I walked away from altered,.free and clear property, after an entire life spent in renovations, urban renewal and slum clearance. It was property where you had to wipe off your shoes on leaving. With sensible financing and alteration, our holdings became excellent investments. None of our mortgages and obligations exceeded twice the rental  excellent in real estate parlance.

title: NEW M'CARTHY FIGHTS IN ILLINOIS
description: CHICAGO, March 4The languid, erudite Eugene. J. McCarthy down among the sweaty crowds, reaching for any land he can hold onto?

title: Bergen Still Growing, Still Well Off and Still Heavily White
description: Without a single large city, Bergen County has all but overtaken Essex as the most populous county in New Jersey.

title: Dartmouth Six Wins, 54
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 4 Bill Dunbar, a sophomore forward, scored with 14 seconds elapsed in overtime tonight to give Dartmouth a 54 hockey victory over Princeton, Dartmouth ended the season with record of 13 victories, 10 losses and one tie. Princeton finished with a wonloss mark of 518.

title: Jersey Bus Strike Negotiations Scheduled to Open on Tuesday
description: NEWARK, March 4 (AP)Hopes for a settlement of the Transport of New Jersey bus strike brightened for the first time today as the New Jersey Labor Department announced that bargaining between the company and the drivers would open on Tuesday.

title: LANDUSE DEBATE ENLIVENS HEARING
description: Conflict over land use tween housing and educational and religious institutions and criticism of the dropping of an elementary school from the city budget dominated hearings yestreday on the city's master plan.

title: Inspectors Term Mental Hospital Bedlam
description: RIDGEFIELD PARKThe New, Jersey Attorney General's office is examining a report by state inspectors that questions practices at Meadowview Hospital, Hudson County's mental institution, and terms the facility foulsmelling, bugfilled and unfit for additional patients.

title: Mary Alice McDonough Wed to William Gabriel Mallon
description: WINCHESTER, Mass. March 4Dr. and Mrs. James F. McDonough have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Alice McDonough, to William Gabriel Mallon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward V. Mallon of Montclair, N. J.

title: Dayan Asserts Guerrillas Face Loss of Their Bases
description: JERUSALEM March 4Defense Minister Moshe Dayan said today that the Palestinian commandos who made a series of bold raids against Israeli settlements at the Lebanese and Syrian borders last week, now face the decision of to be or not to be.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON There had been warnings. They'd been ignored. And last weekend the waters of the huge rainswollen settling basin at the head of West Virginia's Buffalo Creek burst through the retaining wall of porous coal mine waste. A 50foothigh wall of inky water and coal sludge raged down the, creek, sweeping away: houses, familles, whole communities.

title: Newark's Postmaster Is Given Broader Job
description: NEWARK  Postmaster Joseph J. Benucci has been designated as acting manager for the Newark sectional center of the Postal Service.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Child to Morgenlanders
description: A daughter was born on Feb. 3 in Mount Sinai Hospital here to Mr, and Mrs. Lee Jay Morgenlander of Brooklyn Heights, The child has been named Melissa Gail.

title: U.S. Admiral Will Visit a More Friendly Ceylon
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, March 4 (UPI)The chief United States commander in the Pacific arrives tomorrow for a visit to this island nation off the southern tip of India at a time when shifting alignments of international politics have made United States naval vessels welcome again after a period of distrust and suspicion.

title: The World
description: KAMPALA, Uganda Barring lastminute complications, Sudan's President Gaafar alNimeiry and a small, slightly built Sudanese Army deserter, Joseph Lagu, will travel to Addis Ababa later this month to ratify an agreement ending Africa's longest and perhaps most bitter postindependence war, a war that has left many thousands dead.

title: The Good Word
description: The English are determined to get George Orwell straight if it takes all night. An excellent new collection, called The World of George Orwell (editor, Miriam Gross), devotes itself to this slippery task  which turns out, as usual, to be like catching a greased pig at a fair. In the end, Orwell trots off into the woods, still a bit more equal than we are.

title: Adults at 18 in California
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., March 4 (UPI)California's 18yearolds became legal adults today with virtually all the privileges of their parents except the right to drink. About 1.1 million young people reached adulthood at midnight when a new law that lowered the age of majority from 21 to 18 went into effect. It allowed them, among other things, to serve on juries, become policemen, sign contracts, obtain credit, conduct driver education classes and record cattle brands.

title: Go along with polka dots.
description: An orange and white polka dot halter tucks into a matching long pleated skirt. By Beverly

title: Soviet Pair Skates on Emotional Thin Ice
description: CALGARY, Alberta, March 4 (UPI)A turnabout Russian romance was intriguing the world skating community, as contestants arrived for the world figure skating chimpionships starting next week.

title: Don't Knock The $2Trillion Economy
description: WEALTH, wrote John Kenneth Galbraith in The Affluent Society, is not without its advantages and the case to the contrary, although it has been made, has never proved widely persuasive. But times have changed since 1958. We have become a richer nation but not, by common agreement, a happier one. The Gross National Product has gone up 64 per cent; but what of the gross national pleasure?

title: North Hempstead To Plant 10,000. Trees
description: MANHASSET, L. I.  The Department of Parks and Recreation of the Town of North Hempstead has announced that, with the arrival of spring, three conservation and tree farms will be installed at Denton Park, Bar Beach and Manorhaven Beach.

title: Soviet's 14 Gold Medals Dominate Student Meet
ExPentagon Aide Lauds The BureaucratPolitician
description: WASHINGTON  Tradition has it that if bureaucrats did not exist it would be unnecessary to invent them.

title: Go Deep Enough Into New Guinea
Two crippled birds mating
description: Michael Rubin's fourth book is sturdy, homely novel about the rightness of doing the incorrect thing under certain circumstances. Donald Collins, a BronxIrish shop teacher, has been behaving more or less correctly, according to his ghastly widowed mother and her ghastly version of the church, and he's fed up. Mrs. Norman Adler, The neurotic wife of a smug West Side Jewish psychologist, is fed up, too, with living correctly according to Dr. Adler's selfserving interpretations of her dreams.

title: Barbara Kelly, Craig L. Siebert Wed in Suburb
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., March 4Miss Barbara Mary Kelly and Craig Laurence Siebert were married here at noon today in St. Augustine's Roman Catholic Church. The Rev. John Bennett, chaplain of Georgetown University, performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: Milan Paper's Staff Strikes
description: MILAN, Italy, March 4Corriere della Sera, the newspaper with the largest circulation in Italy, failed to appear today because of a strike by its editorial staff in protest against the sudden dismissal of its managing editor, Giovanni Spadolini.

title: KNICKS SET BACK 76ERS, 118 TO 115, IN OVERTIME HERE
description: The New York Knickerbockers broke a twogame losing streak last night by beating the Philadelphia 76ers in overtime, 118.115, before a capacity crowd of 19,588 in Madison Square Garden.

title: Bowdoin Six Down Colby
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., March  Bowdoin College's hockey team closed its season tonight with a 53 victory over Colby for a wonlost record of 174 and a Division 2 record of 14 and 1. Ned Dowd and Pete Flynn scored three and two goals, respectively, for Bowdoin and Steve Self scored all three Colby goals.

title: McLain Believes in McLain
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 4After nearly losing his sanity in Detroit and his ability in Washington, can Denny McLain find success and happiness in Oakland?

title: Providence Tops Seton Hall As Barnes Gets 36 Points
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., March 4Marvin Barnes, sophomore, had 36 points to lead Providence College to 78.68 basketball victory over Seton Hall University tonight.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  For nearly two years Senator Sam Ervin of North Carolina has been investigating the military's system of spying on civilians. And all the while he has been telling friends and aides, halfkidding ly, that he wouldn't be surprised some day to find his own name in the Pentagon's files.

title: City Pension Funds'
description: The city's five pension funds policy of selling bonds and using the money to buy common stock paid off with the highest yield in the funds history, Controller Abraham D. Beanie reported yesterday.

title: Jenkins to Make Another Bid For $25,000 Gold Cup Sunday
description: The third edition of the North American Gold Cupthe richest individual jumping event in the countryis scheduled for next Sunday in Tampa (Fla.) Stadium.

title: Soviet Lofts Cosmos 477
description: MOSCOW, March 4 (AP)The Soviet Union launched the 477th satellite in its Cosmos series today. The Soviet press agenly, Tass, said the satellite had been put into an orbit with a high point of 204 miles and a low point of 132 miles.

title: To Probe the Ultimate
description: A milestone was passed last week when the Atomic Energy Commission's nuclear accelerator at Batavia, Ill., created a proton beam of 200 billion electron volts, by far the most powerful stream of subatomic particles ever produced by man. The achievement represents an economic as well as a scientific and technological feat. this case the vast installation was built and( put into working order ahead of ,schedule and at a cost within original budgetary limitations. There have not been many such pioneering Government scientific or technological projects of which that could be said in the past.

title: Books:
description: There must be no waiting for a public outcry because it is not coming. The public will adapt, even to massive loss of lifehistory tells us that. So let us not talk falsely now. The hour is getting late. This statement expresses the sense of urgency in Mr. Buel's book. He wants Americans or at least their leaders, to focus on the problems of the auto age because the auto has became an uncontrollable monster.

title: Lobbekists Fight CityHall From kitchen
description: CHERRY HILLFor the going rate of $5, anyone in New Jersey can register as a state lobbyist. Two who did are Mrs. Alene. Ammond and Mrs. Rosemarie Hospodor, founders of the Cherry Hill League, a, publicinterest group begun by 11 angry homeowners who found the doors of city hall closed to their complaints.

title: MALAYSIA PLANS PRINCETON TOUCH
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia (UPI)Malaysia Is sending soccer team to the Olympic Games for the first time this year. It may not make any lasting impressions on the field at Munich but there could be some memorable action on the sidelines.

title: Television: A. Night With the Video Freaks
Letters
description: A typographical error occurred in a sentence in Robert Bendiner's Feb. 27 article, The Presidential Primaries are Haphazard, Unfair and Wildly Illogical. The sentence, on Page 46, should read: Since [both candidates] would probably poll close to 70 per cent of the total party vote, it is clear that either would represent the political complexion of the party's majority.

title: Purdue Stops Iowa, 8785
description: IOWA CITY, Iowa, March (l7PI)Purdue held off a determined Iowa attack tonight and edged the Hawkeyes, 8785, in a Big Ten basketball game.

title: Recordings
description: AMONG people who live and breathe opera, an event that has caused considerable controversyprobably even more than the Bohm Salome of last year  is London's new release of Verdi's Macbeth (3 disks OSA 13102). Most of the comment has been extremely negative, and indeed for people who worship the beautiful voice alone, the recording has few attractions. True, Luciano Pavarotti makes a brief appearance in the stunted role of Macduff, which gives him only one real opportunity for his customary eloquence: the relatively unspectacular Fourth Act Ali, la paterna mano. And Nicolai Ghiaurov (when is he coming back to New York?) does well enough with boring Banquo, but Banquo, realizing how dull he is, gets himself murdered in Act

title: Religion
description: The 1950's was the era of the churchgoing boom and the prayer breakfast in the United States. The 1960's belonged to the social activists and the radicals. It's too early to say for sure, but a good case can be made that the 1970's will be a decade of evangelical revival.

title: Miss ChristenSen Wed To Paul F. Stulgaitis
description: RUTHERFORD, N. J., March 4Miss Mary Lee Christensen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Knud Christensen of Wood Ridge, was married here today to Paul Francis Stulgaitis, son of Frank J. Stulgaitis of Fort Lee and the late Mrs. Stulgaitis.

title: Dean Smith, 40, Runs 10.3 For 100 and 22.4 for 220
description: LOS ANGELES, March 4 (AP) A former University of Texas sprint star, Dean Smith, now 40 years old and competing as a senior, broke the world seniors record for the 220yard dash today with a time of 22.4 seconds.

title: St. John's 115Point Victor In 3Day Swimming Meet
description: St. John's University, with 513 points, coasted to victory last night in the threeday Metropolitan Collegiate Swimming Conference championship held at Queens College.

title: Lee Back at Williamette
description: SALEM, Ore., March 4 (UPI) Tommy Lee, Willamette College quarterback from 1959 to 1963, has been named assistant football coach et the school.

title: Press:
description: Radio station WBAI in New Yoilt accepts no commercials; all its Income is derived from listeners donadons. Because it doesn't have to cater to advertisers, the station boasts, it can offer programs unavailable whereand the more controversial the better.

title: Senate Panel Staff Says Welfare Bill Hurts Hunger Fight
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) The staff of the Senate Select Committee on Nutrition reported today that President Nixon's commitment in 1969 to put an end to hunger in America was clearly endangered by parts of his welfare reform package.

title: STUDENT RIGHTS FIELD VIOLATED
description: The New York Civil Liberties Union accused the city Board of Education and Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner yesterday of permitting principals to violate the rights of students and the board's own policies on such rights.

title: MYSTERY LINGERS IN YABLONSKI CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Pa., March 4 Two persons have now been convicted of firstdegree murder and sentenced to die in Pennsylvania's electric chair for the killing in 1969 of Joseph A. Yablonski, the United Mine Workers insurgent, and two members of his family.

title: Award for Prison Injury
description: CHARLESTON, S.C., March 4 (AP)A former prison inmate has won a $600,000 judgment for blindness he says was caused by tear gas used during a prison disturbance. A Federal jury made the award shortly before midnight Thursday to Artie Curtis Ussery. The ruling went against the Federal Laboratory Company of Saltzberg, Pa.

title: New Use for Personalized Auto Plates Fighting Smog
description: LOS ANGELES, March 4Batman and Zeus, with an assist from Cupid, Brahms, Dylan and Dreamy, have joined the battle against California'S archenemy: smog. There is no evidence of victory yet, but they have made a start of the use of their names.

title: F.C.C. Official Here Calls TV Enemy of the Wise Consumer
description: Nicholas Johnson of the Federal Communications Commission told the New York Consumer Assembly yesterday that commercial television was the foremost enemy of intelligent consumerism.

title: Home improvement
description: PREASSEMBLED wood windows, with frames, have been available for some time now with a permanent rigid vinyl covering or cladding on the outside so that the wood will never need painting on the exterior. These windows have been available in doublehung and awning styles, but now one of the largest manufacturers has added a new stylegliding or sliding windows. Available in standard double units with a stationary right sash and sliding left sash, the windows are designed so that the sliding unit can be easily removed to simplify cleaning.

title: How Planners View The L.I. Job Market
description: For the unemployed npw,casting about for jobs, it can be no consolation. But for youngsters growing up, the word is: There will be shortages of workers in Nassau Countyin 1985.

title: Paterson Gains as a Hub
description: PATERSON  In just nine months, progress has been made to transform Paterson into a major office and service center for Northern New Jersey, the Regional, Plan Association reported last week.

title: New &Novel
description: Pity this poor psychoanalyst. The sensitivity people are stealing his patients, and a woman's libber is stealing his wife. Looking back over a busy career at the couch, Norman J. Block concludes that the only patient, for whom he had achieved a permanent cure was one, Marvin Kleinbard, a suicide. (Marvin, I cured you! You came to me crazy, Marvin, but now you're not crazy any more!) Miss Lee's approach to Freudian psychology is less than reverent, her approach to the comic is less than subtleand the headon collision of force and object produces a few pale flashes of wit to brighten the story of Dr. Block's put downs and comeuppances.

title: HUME CAPTURES FORMULA ONE TEST
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, March 4 (UP)  Denis Hulme, in a McLaren, won the South African Grand Prix today after Jackie Stewart's Tyrrell Ford blew a gear box halfway through the race.

title: Annual Reports: Avoiding Pitfalls
description: If the average American stockholder has anything to say about it, the annual reports of big businessfrom A. T. & T. to Zion Foodswill never make the bestseller list.

title: ZELENKA WOODWINDS PLAY MASTER'S WORK
description: A piece by the Bohemian composer for whom it is named quite properly opened the program of the Zelenka Woodwind Quintet in Carnegie Recital. Hall on Thursday night.

title: IIc for City of Refuge
description: CENTURIES before this republic was born, and thus centuries before there were Americans who could become interested in savetheenvironment pursuits such as the creation of National Parks, there was a haven en the island of Hawaii a sanctuary for those who might have sinned against man or violated any of the island kingdom's native tabus.

title: Miss Brennan Plans Nuptials
description: PITTSBURGH, March 4Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Robert Brennan have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carol Mary Brennan, to Brian Hart Moss, son of Senator Frank E. Moss and Mrs. Moss of Salt Lake City, and Washington.

title: Walter D. Osborne, 54, Is Dead; Leading Photographer of Horses
description: WORTON, Md., March 4 Walter D. Osborne, a leading photographer of the horse in action, died here Wednesday. He was 54 years old. He had recently undergone two major operations and had returned to his home to recuperate.

title: Building Tax Cut Is Urged for Cities
description: NEWARK The fivevolumo report unveiled by the New Jersey Tax Policy Committee recently contains two pages intended to spark a revival of private construction in the larger cities in the state. The committee proposed that these cities get the right to change property taxes to a system under which land is assessed at full value and improvements at onehalf full value.

title: COMMUNISTS FILE IN ALABAMA RACE
description: MONTGOMERY,. Ala., March 4For the first time in many gears, the Communist party U.S.A. has filed for a ballot liosition in Alabama.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor: In an interview with Russell Baker (featured in your pages to celebrate the publication of his newest collection, Poor Russell's Almanac), he is quoted as saying: At heart, I'm a tombstone builder, and I'm worried about what the epitaph is going to say about me. I would still like to have a very serious book behind me, admired by literary magazines, reviewed favorably in Commentary. But now I don't think I'll make it.

title: MOEN'S VICTORY IS JEERED IN ROME
description: ROME, March 4  Carlos Monzon is no Argentine without means. The world middleweight boxing champion has more than just a hard punch for company when he enters the ringhe usually has his own referee.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: WILLIAM B. PAPE, 72, PUBLISHER, IS DEAD
description: NEW HAVEN, March 4 (AP) William B. Pape, publisher of The Waterbury Republican and The American, died last night at Waterbury YaleNew Haven Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived in Woodbury.

title: Minnesota Routs Illinois, 9162, and Clinches Tie for Title
description: MINNEAPOLIS, March 4 (AP) The Minnesota Gophers, moving closer to their first Big Ten basketball championship in 35 years, rocked Illinois, 9162, today with a harassing fullcourt press and the scoring of Clyde Turner Dave Winfield and Keith Young.

title: Garden Planning
description: WHAT is it about the green world that makes man respond? The sighting of spring's first fresh bud, or the brave emerging of a tiny new leaf of grass is enough 4.o change anyone's day from gloom and pressure to brightened hope.:

title: Miss Holcombe Sets Wedding
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., March 4The engagement of Miss Nancy Elizabeth Holcombe to Frank Ambler Camm son of Maj. Gen. Frank A. Camm, U.S.A., and Mrs. Camm of San Francisco, has been announced by the prospective bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. James V. Holcombe of Alexandria. A wedding in the summer is planned.

title: LETTER TO RECRUITS CALLED MISLEADING
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (UPI)The Pentagon has acknowledged that some Army recruiters have used a misleading letter in their drive for more volunteers.

title: POLITICAL CLUB HEAD IS SHOT IN BROOKLYN
description: The head of a Conservative party club in the Cypress Hills district of Brooklyn was shot and wounded early yesterday as he and two companions fought with about a dozen men outside a bar and grill at 216 Crescent Street, Brooklyn.

title: They May Just Be the Greatest Guidebooks Ever Published
Mrs. Watson Has Child
description: IRVINGTONONHUDSON, N. Y., March 4A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Russell E. Watson on Feb. 20 in Phelps Memorial Hospital in North Tarrytown. Mrs. Watson is the former Miss Susan Jane Waterbury and Mr. Watson is senior editor of Newsweek magazine. The child, the couple's second, has been named Jane Fairbanks.

title: President and Daughter Go Boating Off Florida
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., March 4 (UPI)  President Nixon went boating on Biscayne Bay today with his daughter, Mrs. David Eisenhower, and his friend, C. G. Rebozo.

title: Florida Unions Seek to Stop Wallace
description: MIAMI, March 4Florida's small but feisty labor movement is cranked up to try to stop Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, the frontrunning candidate, in the Florida Presidential primary.

title: On Your Mark!Get Set!Go!
description: ATHOUGH still cold and blustery, the, longer, brighter days of late winter portend the coming of spring. Some plants such as snapdragon, petunia, ageratum, tomato and eggplant require a long growing season and need, an early start indoors. There are other advantages besides economy. The fine dustlike seeds of snapdragon petunia, lobelia and ageratum need special care for good germination. Gardeners who want specific varieties for form color or flower shows cannot be assurred of finding them available at their local garden centers.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Mainstream novelists who turn to mysteries often bring to the genre a kind of writing the twiceayear murder professionals avoid. They are intensely interested in writing as a craftin style, characterization, background. I saw the swollen forks of vipers tongues lashing frothy blood in streets, and cancerous locusts filling doors, windows, board rooms, devouring secretaries breasts, trilling while they gored on pencil sharpeners... You don't normally expect to find this in a crime book. But you do in THE NIGHT IS A CHILD by Richard Llewellyn (Doubleday, $5.95).

title: OLD RASKOB ESTATE SOUGHT BY RUSSIANS
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., March 4Attorneys. for a land development corporation that owns several thousand acres near here and on Maryland's Eastern Shore have confirmed reports that the Russian Government is negotiating for the purchase of 45 acres of. the former John Jacob Raskob estate on the Chester River near Centreville, Md.

title: Heath Pompidou Meeting Scheduled for MidMarchl
description: LONDON, March 4 (Reuters) A meeting between President Pompidou of Frahce and Prime Minister Heath Of Britain, postponed from last month because of the British coal miners strike, has been rescheduled far March 18 and 19.

title: Carl Miller Weds Susan Lynn Miller
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., March 4Miss Susan Lynn Miller, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel S. Miller of Neponsit, Queens, was married here this evening to Carl A. Miller, son of Mr. and Mrs. Julius L. Miller of Great Neck. The two families are not related.

title: Buckle your spring belt.
description: As clothes get more body conscious, belts get more important. Some of the latest ways to accent the waist are, from top to bottom:

title: PHILIPPINES GIVEN ASSURANCES BY U.S.
description: MANILA March 4Assistant Secretary of State Marshall Green gave President Ferdinand E. Marcos solid assurances today that the United States will not withdraw from the Philippines and Asia.

title: For Chavez Fruits of Victory
description: MIAMIWe shall win, chanted an elated, boisterous group of migrant workers here last Wednesday. We can break, the growers power, gain our freedom while we learn. The union makes us strong. The workersblack, MexicanAmerican and whitehad good reason to celebrate. Their leader, Cesar Chavez, had just signed the first labor contract for migrant workers in the Southeast, a threeyear agreement between his United Farm Workers of California and the foods division of Coca Cola Company.

title: Union Strikes G.M. Facility In Work Methods Dispute
description: LORDSTOWN, Ohio, March 4 (UPI)The United Automobile Workers struck the big complex of the General.Motors Corporation here today, idling 10,000 employes and shutting down the only Chevrolet Vega assembly line in the nation.

title: NASA Says the Supercritical Wing Is Passing Tests
Schedule of Hearings By Legislative Panels
description: ALBANY, March 4Following are public hearings scheduled for the near future by committees of the Senate and the Assembly:

title: Bonaventura. E. Kenny Is Wed To. Bruce Dow Cooper, Banker
description: SUMMIT, N. J., March 4Miss Bonaventura Elizabeth Kenny, daughter of Mr. and Mrs., H. James Kenny Jr., was married here this morning to, Bruce Dow Fuller Cooper, son of Mr. and Mrs., Ronald W. A. Cooper of New York.

title: The World
description: ROMEThe campaign for Italy's general elections on May 7 and 8 is off to a flying start. Among those who have begun their electioneering earlier than the thundering herdand are running the hardestare the neoFascists. As a result, the political parties in the center and to the left are worried that the New Right may be greatly strengthened when the votes are counted.

title: The OilBlessed Sheiks of Modern Araby
description: BAHRAIN (AP)The ruling sheiks of Araby have an exotic flair for palace entertaining.

title: RICHARD CHURCH, NOVELIST, 78, DIES
description: LONDON, March 4Richard Church, poet, novelist and literary critic, died today at his home, the Priest's House, at Sissinghurst, Castle, Kent. He was 78 years old.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: To most readers, the life and teachings of Jesus are familiar, at least in a general waybut what do they really mean? Luigi Santucci attempts to tell us in an unusual little book that has had considerable success on the Continent. Phrases and sentences from the New Testament narratives serve as jumpingoff points for the author's sensitive, intelligent comment and improvisation. The improvisations include interior monologues, imaginary conversations, scenes and incidents that expand and illuminate the barebones Biblical record. The style is literate, perceptive and free of sentimentality: Readers of various religious persuasions and of nonewill find the approach rewarding.

title: R. L. Douglass, Fiance of Lesley Williams
description: Mrs. Louis Williams Rich of New York and, Billy Williams of Chicago, the vocalist who led. the former Hilly Williams Quartet, have announced the engagement, of their daughter, Mist.Lesley T. Williams, to Ralph L. Douglass; son of Mr. and Mrs. John Douglass of Boston. The wedding is planned for June 25.

title: Music
description: FVERYBODY'S a sinologist these days, none more so than the running dogs 41 of imperialism. The last few days, I have been looking through monthly magazine named China Reconstructs. It is the official organ in English of the Chinese Communist Party, and in many ways it makes terrifying reading.

title: Northwestern Victor
description: MADISON, Wis., March 4 (UPI)Mark Sibley's 30 points led Northwestern to a 9082 victory over Wisconsin today. Northwestern remained in last place in the Big Ten.

title: Art
description: JOHN CANADAY'S article last Sunday, Very Quiet and Very Dan gerous, on the subject of museum sales, was of a certain interest. It might have been of greater interest if his information about a number of pictures purportedly about to be sold by the Metropolitan Museum on a sealed bid basis had not been 99 per cent inaccurate. Not only were his facts garnered from the usually reliable sources grossly incorrect, but there were errors of detail within the overall inaccuracy, i.e., the George Mqore by Manet is not the glorious Havemeyer pastel vibrant with life and wit that came to the museum in 1929 but an unfinished painting of Moore that came to the in 1955.

title: Matisse: Solving the Problem by Sculpture
description: THE exhibition of 69 bronzes by Henri Matisse currently on view at the Museum of Modern Art through May 1 is, in its concentrated and special. way, one of the most.. striking exhibitions of this or several recent seasons. Selected and handsomely installed by Alicia Legg, associate curator of the museum's Department of Painting and Sculpture, the, show includes all of the known works by Matisse in a particular medium  an unfamiliar body of work compared to Matisse's sunny and opulent paintings  together with 23 drawings and prints closely related to the sculptures. Miss Legg has provided a fully Illustrated catalogue and text, covering the range of Matisse's bronzes from a pair of. rather academic portrait reliefs executed in 1894 to a small, standing nude, Katia, completed in 1950, four years death.

title: BRITISH TOURISTS SHUNNING IRELAND
description: DUBLIN, March 4The Irish Republic's $260millionayear tourist industry is facing crisis.

title: Dutch Women Swimmers Top U.S. by a point
description: LONDON, March 4 (AP)The Netherlands women's swimming team defeated the United States by one point in a triangular international meet today at the 50meter Crystal Palace Pool.

title: Von Ruden Runs 3:57.8 Mile
description: LOS ANGELES, March 4The Jim Ryun comeback saga continued on a dismal note today. The mile world recordholder ran dead last in a sevenman field as Tom Von Ruden won the Los Angeles Coliseum Meet of Champions mile in 3 minutes 57.8 seconds.

title: Corporation Man
description: The tendency to form hunting band groups of about ten people, nearly always men, is a part of our nature..., Antony Jay, a former B.B.C. television producer declares. These groups have been instruments of our survival: for up to fifteen million years... The modern corporation, or any large modern organization, still depends upon these groups for survival... No organization theory that does not rest on this base can ever make sense. Although Mr. Jay rambles through a great variety of subjectsnot the least of which is anthropologythrusting now back millions of years, then returning to factories in Lancashire or walltowall carpeted suites in contemporary London, he never tells us much about his ten groups except that they are aggressive

title: A Recorder Closes Books After 41 Years
description: Something of an institution was lost last week at New York University.

title: CAVALIERS DEFEAT ROCKETS, 130423
description: HOUSTON, March 4 (UPI)Austin Carr and Walt Wesley, a 6foot11inch substitute, led a fourthquarter surge today to give the Cleveland Cavaliers a 130123 triumph over the sluggisk Houston Rockets. It was only the fourth victory in the last 21 games for Cleveland.

title: 2 Projects Given $350,000 For Young Voter Education
description: The Carnegie Corporation of New York announced yesterday grants totaling $350,000 to support two nonpartisan voter education programs for 18to21yearold youths.

title: Flyers Down Blues, 62
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 4 (UPI)The Philadelphia Flyers scored five goals in the second period tonight to record a 62 victory over the St. Louis Blues and move into a tie for third place in the N,H.L.'s West Division.

title: COLUMBIA FENCERS CAPTURE IVY TITLE
description: Columbia won its 15th Ivy League fencing championship in the last 17 seasons by defeating Princeton, 18.9, yesterday at University Gym..

title: Justice is in the eye of the beholder
description: When Elia Kazan interrupted his impressively successful career as director of plays and films to write The Arrangement, he achieved great popular success and won high praise from certain writers of distinctionHenry Miller, John Steinbeck and James Baldwin, for example. I find the praise harder to understand than the popularity, but it should be on the record.

title: The Nation
description: MANCHESTER, N. Y. A few short weeks ago, many a political expert was predicting a straight, smooth course to the Democratic Presidential nomination for Senator Edmund S. Muskie. A few short weeks ago, most politicians were generally discounting the importance of the nation's first Presidential primary, which will take place here Tuesday. The Senator from neighboring Maine, they said, was shooin  his victory would prove nothing.

title: SPYING BY ARMY STIRS REACTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr.'s disclosure this week that the Army's surveillance of senior elected officials from 1967 to 1970 was more extensive than previously known has stirred up a flurry of protest here.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: FOLLOWING SENATE approval of legislation to formally. devalue the dollar by raising the official price of gold by $3 an ounce to $38, the Administration urged the House to approve it speedily.... Official British reserves increased $11million in February to a record $6.99billion.

title: Garbage Dump in State of Emergency
description: LYNDHURST The Hackeneack Meadowlands Development qommission expects to bear from the FederarEnvironniental Protection Agency this week on its proposals to alleviate the already critical garbagedisposal problem in the 20,000acre meadows.

title: JAMES M. CLEARY, 85, NEWS OFFICIAL, DIES
description: CHICAGO, March 4 (UPI)James M. Cleary, former executive of The Chicago Tribune and a member of the staff that founded The New York Daily News, died today at a suburban Evanston hospital. He was 85 years old.

title: Foyt Bids for Repeat Victory In Ontario (Calif.) 500 Today
description: A. 3. Foyt knows where the grass is greener. When there's no racing on his regular circuit, the United States Auto Club, Super Tex in: vades the turf of the National Association for Stock Car Auto (NASCAR) and beats the good o?? boys at their own game. Two weeks ago he won the Daytona. 500 (and $44,600) in a walkaway. Last season A. J. won $89,000 in NASCAR competition on top of his $192,056 in USAC purses.

title: 43 Stress Tax Reform
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) Any revenue sharing or other legislation for Federal aid to states and local governments should include revenueproducing, tix reforms, 43 Democratic Representatives said today.

title: Condor, Class D Yacht, Takes S.O.R C. Series
description: Class A yachts, the big boats of the Southern Ocean Racing Conference, had to take a back seat this year to the little craft when the correctedtime finishes were posted after yesterday's finale Nassau Cup race.

title: Oil Gamble
description: LONDON  Far bigger stakes are being wagered on the rocky floor of the North Sea these days than ever were hazarded on the green baize tables of Monte Carlo.

title: Army Tank Designers Seek Simplicity and Reliability
description: FORT KNOX, Ky.  A task force is at work here defining design and performance for the Army's primary, armored combat. weapon of the future, the main battle tank, or MBT.

title: Editorial Assistant, Thomasina, Alexander Photographed by Morgan Rank
description: There's cause for celebration. Beautiful clothes are here again! The tailors have gone back to work to produce wellcut coats and suits, giving them a sportswear look by including vests and sometimes blouses.Vests, in sweater form, go over dresses to carry on the sportswear feeling. But evening is the time women can really shinein brilliantly colored taffeta or pristine white with full, full skirts and bare, bare tops. Pants are not forgotten. Cut with wider legs and cuffs, they've become a permanent part of casual dressing for both day and evening.The newest color is no colorcreamy whiteand the newest fabric is oldfashioned silk.This is the spring to feel luxurious... look beautiful... be downright elegant.

title: Area Continues to Attract Corporation Headquarters
description: The New York area continues to be a magnet that attracts headquarters of national and international corporations as well as new administrative and production facilities of smaller companies.

title: 7 Democratic Rivals To Debate in Florida
description: MIAMI, March 4 (AP)Seven Democratic Presidential hopefuls have agreed to a televised debate on the eve of Florida's March 14 primary, a Miami television station announced today.

title: Sometimes a spring coat is actually a coat.
description: The spring coat that's really a cape is a sweeping circle of unlined beige wool covert by Pauline Trigere. To complete the costume, a matching skirt and a patterned dark red body suit. All for $840. Plaza Collections, Bergdorf Goodman. Hat, Adolfo.

title: Miss Hannah Leibowitz Is Married
description: NORFOLK, Va., March 4Miss Hannah. Leibowitz was married here this evening to Capt. Timothy O. Lipman, Medical Corps, U.S.A. Rabbi Lawrence Foreman performed the ceremony at the Admiralty Hotel.

title: Muskie Lagging but He Still Holds Edge; First Vote Tuesday in New Hampshire
description: CHICAGO, March 4Senator Edmund S. Muskie's drive for the Democratic Presidential nomination has begun to flag with the onset of the primary election season, which opens with Tuesday's vote in New Hampshire.

title: RANGERS TO PLAY CANUCKS TONIGHT
description: The New York. Rangers, unbeaten in seven straight games at Madison Square Garden, come up against the Vancouver Canucks for the final time this season on Garden ice tonight. Game time is 7:05.

title: Group Plans Cultural Programs
description: MONTCLAIRA series of dance, drama and music programs to be performed in churches and synagogues in major cities throughout the country is being planned by Pantheon Audience Network, a new, nonprofit organization designed to bring professional performances to large crosscultural audiences.

title: Michigan Is Upset
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., March 4 (UPI)Mike Robinson scored 37 points today while leading Michigan State to a 9692 upset over Michigan that severely damaged the Wolverines hopes for a Big Ten championship.

title: Laurie E. Schaffer Married to Dentist
description: HARRISON, N. Y., March 4Miss Laurie Ellen Schaffer was married here today to Dr. Ellis Richard Disick. Rabbi David Golevensky performed the ceremony in the chapel of the Jetvish Community Center of Harrison.

title: Ozaki Leads Singapore Golf
description: SINGAPORE, March 4 (AP)Masashi Ozaki, a former Japanese baseball star, moved into the lead in the $20,000 Singapore open golf championship today with his third straight round of 70 for a 54hole total of 210, six under par. Takaai Kono of Japan, and Graham Marsh of Australia, are tied for second, one stroke behind Ozaki.

title: Christine A. Beaudet to Be Bride
description: ST. DAVIDS, Pa., March 4 Mr. and Mrs. Eugene C. Beaudet have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Christine Anne Beaudet, to Michael Barbot McGovern, son of Mr. and Mrs. Michael M. McGovern of Eastchester, N. Y. The wedding is planned for September.

title: Skaar Moves to No. Dakota!
description: FARGO, N.D., March 4 (AP) Marvin Skaar, head basketball coach at Moorhead (Minn.) State College, has been named basketball coach at North Dakota State University.

title: Dartmouth Routs Columbia
description: Torrid firsthalf shooting led Dartmouth to a 10773 victory over Columbia last night at the Lions court in the final game of the season for both teams. The. Indians finished with 1412 wonlost record, 86 in Ivy League play. Columbia finished at 4.20, 3.11 in the league.

title: Stars Defeat Rockets
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 4 (AP)Seven Utah players scored in double figures, including 31 points for Mery Jackson, as the Stars beat the Denver Rockets, 136130, tonight.

title: C. B. Barnes Fiance of Lila Cummings
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., March 4  Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Robert Lincoln Cummings of Laurel Hollow of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lila Cummings, to Chaplin Bradford Barnes; son of Mr. and Mrs. Irston Roberts Barnes of Wallingford, Conn. A May wedding is planned.

title: New Health Pact Set For Railroad Industry
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP)The railroad industry says that it has reached agreement with more than 20 unions on a new twoyear health and hospitalization package for all the industry's 525,000 employes.

title: Killing of French Maoist Bolsters Far Left
description: PARIS, March 4  Tens of thousands of extreme leftists marched across northern Paris today in a funeral procession for a young Maoist slain a week ago at the Renault automobile plant.

title: Professor Gets Oxford Post
description: Norman F. Ramsey, Higgins Professor of Physics at Harvard University, will serve as the George Eastman Visiting Professor at Oxford University, Englund, for the academic year 197374. The Eastman Professorship was established in 1929 by George Eastman, founder of the Eastman Kodak Company.

title: Harvard Medical School Sets Up Cancer Research
description: BOSTON, March 4 (AP)The Harvard Medical School announced today the establishment of a cancer research center with a grant of nearly $2million from the National Institutes of Health, spread over five years.

title: Douglas Turnesa Is Dead; Member of Golfing Family
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 4Douglas Turnesa, a member of the golfing family, died today at Memorial Hospital in New York after a brief illness. He was 62 years old and lived at 40 Ridgeway here.

title: Child to Mrs. Grayson
description: A daughter was born, Feb. 13 to Mr., and Mrs. Fred N. Grayten of New York in the Flower mid Fifth Avenue Hospital. Mrs. Grayson is the former Miss Nancy Erlanger of New York. Her husband is vice president of the Park Lane Press, Inc,

title: Mary E. Quirk And Physician Wed in Boston
description: BOSTON, March 4Miss Mark Ellen and Dr. Robert Clews Wheeler 2d were married here this afternoon in Trinity Episeopal Church by the Rev. G. Stewart Barns He was assisted by the Rev. William Sharkey, a Roman Catholic priest.

title: Education
description: A highereducation aid bill that experts believe could be of historic importance passed the Senate last week. If enacted, the measure would mark the first time that Federal funds would be offered to the nation's colleges and universities on an unrestricted basis. The Senate bill, however, still must be reconciled with a somewhat different measure passed by the House.

title: COAL DAM CURBS URGED BY NADER
description: WASHINGTON, March 4Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, charged today. that 350,000:, persons in West Virginia may be threatened by sudden flooding from unstable coal. mine, dams like the one that breached last week with the loss of 93 lives.

title: Dream Match Looming in Women's Tennis
description: Another dream match in women's tennis is shaping up at the $30,000 Maureen Connolly Brinker international tournament starting tomorrow in Dallas.

title: New &Novel
description: This is a doubledip Saturday Evening PostCollier's kind of story, rich in love, warmth, good and mean people, and wide blue horizon. The time, appropriately enough, is the 1930's, a bad time for cattle farming as an occupational specialty. Carrie and Thomas Russell are a semiretired couple, sitting life out on a Montana cattle ranch that is proving less and less solvent. Their married daughter and slick soninlaw want the Russells to sell out and move into town with them, or perhaps end their days among the potted palms of some hotel lobby. But the old folks cling to a familiar way of life that requires more stamina than they can spare. Just when it seems that Carrie and Thomas may have to give way to those who want to tidy up their lives, help arrives: a slip of an unmarried mother who can pitch in with the housework. She teams up with Bud, the hired hand, who is a fallen sparrow in his own way. The title is not meant to be an irony, and the author steers her way toward it with restraint and an

title: Champion Calls Karate an Art
description: David Charney watched with a grin as a fellow karate player attempted to break four bricks with his forehead.

title: Mrs. Miller Has Son
description: A son was born on Feb. 12 at the New York Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. Ward: MacLaughlin Miller Jr. The child has been named for his father. Mrs. Miller is the former Miss Mary Anne Morecock. Her husband is assistant general counsel of Standard Brands in New York.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: New &Novel
description: If you liked M.A.S.H. (I didn't), there's no reason you shouldn't like this peacetime sequel. Some of the same funloving surgeons who were cutting up at the 4077th Mobile Army Surgical Hospital in Korea, are now hacking it in Spruce Harbor, Me. Their enterprise is called the Finestkind Clinic and Fishmarket, and it includes a wholesale and retail fish outlet, as well as specialists in thoracic, cardio=vascular, neuro and urological surgery, plus an internist. The boys are involved in one scapegrace caper after another, and the book ends, for no particular reason, with a massive attempt to save the life of Dr. Doggy Moore, Spruce Harbor's leading sawbones, who has been shot in the heart with a.45. The docs around Spruce Harbor are as frisky as a bunch of college sophomores in the prenarcotics era. I couldn't find much humor in their activities. Nor much harm, either, come to think of it.

title: Victim and oppressor simultaneously
description: I will tell you the whole truth about the rest of this, Hillard Elkins once said to a magazine writer, but only on the basis that you give me the right to eliminate certain aspects of that truth. No such right seems to have been asked for or granted in the case of The Producer, although a letter at the end indicates that Elkins has read the manuscript. We see him plainor as plain as any man who wears several snake rings, threads his watchband through special loops in his shirt cuffs and surrounds himself with Napoleonia can be seen: scrambling to raise money, browbeating a writer, conspiring to break the will of an unwanted director, convincing himself that a property is better than it really is.

title: Penn Overcomes Brown Stall, 3733, and Retains Ivy League Crown
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., March 4 Brown almost pulled off the miracle of Marvel Gymnasium tonight by holding the ball against the University of Pennsylvania, but the Quakers scored a 3733 victory to clinch their third straight Ivy League title.

title: Connecticut Power Plant Is Damaged by an Oil Fire
description: NORWALK, Conn., March 4An oil fire at the harbor plant of the Connecticut Light and Power Company on Manresa Island last night shut down the powergenerating facility, which serves southwestern Fairfield County. There were no injuries, a company spokesman said.

title: Pop
description: FEW performers can equal the claim Arena Franklin has to the title she has chosen for her new album: Young, Gifted and Black (Atlantic SD 7213). Like so many of the major figures who reached prominence in the 1960's, Miss Franklin is starting her thirties wellas sured of her influence. Some of the youth may be gone, but the bloom is as rich as evera perfect compliment to her gifted blackness.

title: Schenk, Keller Set Marks
description: INZELL, Germany, March 4 (AP)Ard Schenk bettered his 5,000meter world speedskating record at the Golden Skate competition here today, but saw his 1,000 mark eclipsed by Erhard Keller.

title: The Nation
description: ALBANYThey came with long hortatory harangues tucked under their arms and read them ad nauseam. They had mindboggling arrays of figures and tables and charts that could be used to prove whatever they wanted to prove.... They cited court cases and rattled off statistics like tobacco auctioneers gone berserk.

title: EXILED SYRIAN AIDE IS SLAIN IN LEBANON
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March A former Syrian Deputy Premier and Defense Minister was shot to death at his home in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon today.

title: Shut Up and Cease Criticizing Firemen, Murphy Is Warned
description: The head of the Uniformed Fire Officers Association called on Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy to shut up and not downgrade firemen.

title: Game Aids Recreation
description: NEW BRUNSWICKCommunitysponsored recreation programs in Newark, New Brunswick and Piscataway have received $28,000 from the receipts from the Urban Classic football game last Nov. 27 between Rutgers University and Morgan State College.

title: Winter Camping, a Girl Scout Treat
description: GLEN SPEY, N. Y.  To most people, winter, camping sounds about as appealing as shivering with George Washington's troops at Valley Forge, but to some of the Girl Scouts of Bergen County, it's an inexpensive way to have a good time outdoors, even when the temperature is below freezing.

title: Sherman Adams Is Disappointed in Nixon
Angela Davis:
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.Often she sat huddled in a heavy woolen shawl and much of the time she carried on whispered conversations with her lawyers. But through the first week of her trial, Angela Davis said nothing.

title: Stripping Coal
description: The number of bills on strip mining now making their glacialway through Congressnone of them promisingtestifies to the growing awareness of what the taking of surface coal is doing to this country. This particular form of mining now chokes the streams of a sizable part of Eastern America with acids and silt, destroys aquatic life, erodes hillsides, causes landslide's and floods, scars the countryside with naked spoil banks and eventually leaves the land economically spent and esthetically appalling.

title: Warner Leagues Abound
description: Pop Warner Junior League Football has registered teams playing in Canada and Mexicoi as well as at United States mil. itary bases throughout this world.

title: Brooklyn Museum Gets $23,000 in Print Auction
description: The Brooklyn Museum realized $23,000 last week from an elegant benefit auction staged there. The top price of $6,750 went for Mary Cassatt's The Coiffure, an 1891 drypoint and aquatint in delicate color.

title: Small Cut Seen in Welfare Costs Despite Efforts by Legislature
description: FREEHOLD  Despite efforts by the New Jersey State Legislature to reduce welfare costs by setting up a new category  Assistance to Families of the Working Poor  Most officials see little hope that there will be any largo saving during the current fiscal year, which ends June 30.

title: Carolyn Wilmot Is the. Fiancee Of John Gray
description: WASHINGTON, March 4Mrs. Donald Treat Armstrong of Washington and Willis Gilbert Wilmot of New Orleans have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carolyn Stanton Wilmot, to John Michael Gray, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ronald Douglas Gray of Cambridge, England.

title: The New Play
description: NIGHT WATCH, a play by Lucille Fletcher, got 6 favorable reviews (Barnes, Times; Watt, News; Watts, Post; Oppenheimer, Newsday; Rollin, NBCTV; Sanders, ABCTV) and 7 negative reviews (Gottfried, Women's Wear; Reidy, Newhouse Newspaper; Glover, UPI; Harris, CBSTV; Klein, WNEWTV; Bookspan, WPIXTV).

title: The Master
description: To the Editor: It is no disservice to Leon Edel's achievement to point out that Hilton Kramer's lead review of The Master falls far short of mastery. That is, it fails to be critical. It serenely floats into deep water upon hollow assertions and hollower assumptions. For example:

title: Flower Show Season
description: ON Friday the New Jersey Flower and Garden Show will open at the Morristown National Guard Armory, Morristown, N. J. ViSitors will enter the show through a large greenhouse. Four educational programs will be held on opening day and five each day thereafter. Each session will include. a halfhour lecture followed by a 20minute question4ndanswer period.

title: Ship Fire Off New Guinea
description: PORT MORESBY New Guinea March 4 (UPI)Seven seamen. are missing after a fire aboard the 3,000ton Norwegian tanker Aurora about 30 miles off the northern New Guinea coast yesterday the police said today. They said the fire apparently followed an explosion that the fire was under control and that the ship was anchored off Karkar Island in the Bismarck Sea.

title: Ski Award To Thomas For Service
description: Lowell Thomas, a member of skiing's Hall of Fame and an avid exponent of the sport since its infancy in this country, will be honored Thursday at a luncheon at Gallagher's.

title: Engineers Open Study Of Northeast Harbors
description: The Army Corps of Engineers has begun a compreheasive investigation of all commercial and navigable channels and harbors from Eastport, Me., to Hampton Roads, Va.

title: Renewal Of Roslyn Plaza Area Advances
description: ROSLYN, L.I.  Acquisition of property for the rehabilitation of the Roslyn Plaza area here has begun, Hector Gayle, executive director of the North Hempstead Urban Renewal Agency, announced last week.

title: Jennifer Funke Is Affianced To Nicholas Alexander Noell
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., March 4Mr. and Mrs. Carl H. Funke have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jennifer DeWitt Funke, to Nicholas Alexander Noell, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Noell of New Canaan, Conn.

title: In the Soviet Union things are not what they seem, they're what they are
description: In the United States, the sanction for science is that it puts bread on the table, cars on the road and spacecraft in orbit. Matters of science policy, concerning the relations of Big Science to Big Government, are reserved to appropriations feuds in which technocracy confronts bureaucracy in an annual ritual, of which the public sees only the shadowplay. In the Soviet Union, science is put to a double task: it too has to put bread on the table, cars on the road and spacecraft in orbit; there, too, no doubt, technocrats and bureaucrats fiddle at similar problems of priority and allocation. But beyond this there is the major issue of how scientific thought is linked to a philosophical program  MarxismLeninism, or dialectical materialism which, in turn, is the explicit ideology and maintained by the state.

title: Full Adult Rights Granted To 18YearOlds in Maine
description: AUGUSTA, Me., March 4Gov. Kenneth M. Curtis has signed a bill that gives full adult rights to 18and 19yearolds.

title: The People's Republic
description: CHINA'S postal communications stem from the longago past, as recorded by Marco Polo in hiS account of his adventures in ancient Pekingor Kambaluc, the capital of Kubla Khanwhen the khan's fabulous courier entourage roamed the extensive realm. More modern posts were functioning late in the last century, with early advice emanating from

title: Photography
description: THE Canon F1 35mm single lens reflex camera is a truly professional picture taking machine that is only part of an entire new 35mm system which Bell & Howell is now distributing in this country. Introduced simultaneously with the F1 last year at Photo Expo was a comprehensive assortment of over 180 accessories and a complete new line of over 40 different kinds of matching lensesall designed specifically for use with the F1 (and its lowerpriced cousin the FTb, which does not have some of the refinements of the F1, but which does accept all of the same lenses and many of the accessories). The wide range of optional equipment available, coupled with the quality that is typical of Canon, makes this camera adaptable to practically all types of photography in the journalistic, commercial, in

title: Miss Brooks Bride Of Charles Shafer
description: The marriage of Miss Sydney Lee brooks, an actress and costume designer, to Charles Bernard Shafer, who teaches sixth grade in the city school system, took place at the St. RegisSheraton yesterday. Rabbi A. Bruce Goldman performed the ceremony.

title: Greta Juggles Languages In Town Hall Song Recital
description: A singer billed only as Greta gave a program at Town Hall on Friday evening that encompassed songs in English, French and Armenian. Oddly, her English songs were all adapted [from French (Jacques Brel) or Greek (Mikos Hadjidakis) and her one basically English song, My Yiddishe Momme, was done in French.

title: ALABAMA ORDERED TO AID RETARDED
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., March 4  Alabama mental health officials moved quidkly this week to implement an emergency Federal Court order to correct conditions at a state facility for the mentally retarded that, according to the judge, placed 2,300 inmates in actual physical danger.

title: How to Go to a Convention and Pick a President
description: TRENTONSo you want to be a New Jersey delegate to a national political convention?

title: Why the Bombing Continues
description: SANTA. BARBARA, Calif.Aren't we disengaging from Vietnam? Then why are we still bombing? Isn't bombing an inhumane way of fighting? And isn't it really ineffective?

title: A world of social and sexual disappointments
description: I would not much like to meet Ann Birstein at a campus cocktail party. Which is not to say that she probably wouldn't be extremely amiable in every way, but she has a mean eye for pretensions, especially those liberated by the flow of alcohol. She wouldn't be the person, for instance, to throw a few confidences to about the traumas of breast feeding or toilet training, or a few opercos about current trends in French literature. In fact, it would be a good idea to avoid words such as apergus, come to that: Ann Birstein is, quite rightly, not altogether kind to those who pepper their conversations with au fonds and au contraires. If I were a man, I might be even more nervous before her judging from this, her fourth book, Summer Situations, that mean eye marks men equally acutely. Ann Birstein is not about to switch off when men grow romantic either. Why, even in an embrace, in the sexual act itself, her men are a little ridiculous:

title: GOVERNOR TO SEEK $33MILLION TO AID CATHOLIC SCHOOLS
description: ALBANY, March 4Governor Rockefeller plans to offer legislation next week to provide about $33million in state aid for nonpublic schools.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Draft Fugitive Endorsed for Australian Parliament
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March  Is draftdodging a crime? This question has engaged the Australian Parliament in prolonged debate this week and is expected to have an: impact on national elections later  this year.

title: Miss Casals, Miss Melville Take Tennis Semifinals
description: ROCHESTER, Mich., March 4 (UPI)Rosemary dasals of San Francisco and Kerry Melville of Australia notched semifinal victories today in the $15,000 KMart women's tennis tournament.

title: Education
description: When little Johnny first enrolls in school, officials start a permanent file of his records. As Johnny moves from grade to grade, and from school to school, the reports accumulate and follow him. By the time he graduates there is a comprehensive dossier of official test scores and extracurricular activities, teacher appraisals  informal as well as formal of his attitudes and social behavior, and sometimes letters from psychiatrists and special guidance agencies.

title: Nixonomics
description: I see by the papers, Herbert Stein, President Nixon's rotund chief economist, told the National Press Club the other day, that the economy is going to be a big issue in the 1972 campaign.

title: Federal Financing Bank
description: WASHINGTON  A bill with the potential of major implications for the nation's credit markets, and, thus, ultimately for interest rates and the economy as a whole, is nearing the hearing stage in Congress.

title: Son to the Ellenbogens
description: A son was born Feb. 25 to Dr. and Mrs. Mark J. Ellenbogen of Riverdale, the Bronx, in the Albert Einstein Hospital. The child has been named Jeffrey Michael. Mrs. Ellenbogen is theformer Miss Rona Sacks of Great Neck, L. I. Her husband is a resident at Montefiore Hospital.

title: Letters; PROFESSOR FRANKLIN (CONT.)
description: To THE EDITOR: should like to take exception to Kenneth Lamott's statement in his article, In the Matter of H. Bruce Franklin (Jan. 23), that the Franklin case was sure to have repercussions throughout the academic world, for it was the first firing of a tenured professor in Stanford's history.

title: Emily Ann Sagan Engaged to Wed
description: MOUNT LEBANON, Pa., March 4Mr. and Mrs. Emil A. Sagan have made known the, engagement of their daughter, Miss Emily Ann Sagan, to Paul Edward Culley 2d. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul E. Culley of Westbury, L. I. A. wedding in May is planned.

title: Osaka Using Electric Buses In Attempt to Curb Pollution
description: OSAKA, Japan, March (Agence France Presse)Batterypowered electric buses went on trial here this week in an attempt to cut pollution in this smogbound industrial city in western Japan.

title: Cougars Triumph, 124123
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., March 4 (UPI)George Carter hit jump shot and converted a free throw with eight seconds left to give the Carolina Cougars a 124123 victory over the Memphis Pros tonight.

title: AROUND THE

title: Dave Anderson
description: Growing up in Seattle, she lived near the Meadow Brook. Country Club, where she often searched for lost golf balls. The small change from their sale helped buy her school clothes. At dusk, she and half a dozen boys were permitted to play the private course. The deal was, Ruth Jessen remembers, we had to plck up scraps of paper as we went around. The bunch of us played out of two or, three skinny old canvas, bags: At the age of 12, She shot a 78. Two years later, she shot a 73. She began to win local tournaments. Soon she was a nationally known amateur. She turned pro in 1956.

title: Shoemaker Wins With Turkish Trousers for 5th Victory on Santa Anita Card

title: We Are Starved For Images Of Ourselves
description: WHEN he was 7, 8, 9 years old and so on, Gilbert Moses, a kind of ochrecolored kid from the Cleveland ghetto with a not too tough home life, often wanted to screamnot just about the tensions at home, where he had six siblings, but about the fights in the bars, on street corners, the euphoria during church services that took no notice of it all, the caught between two worlds feeling he had sitting in his allwhite classes, feeling like a dim space, in the room...

title: The Organizational Shrink
description: When someone refers to Harry Levinson as an organizational shrink, he smiles benignly. Because that, after all, is only realistic argot for what he is. A clinical psychologist and disciple of pr. Karl Menninger now transplanted to the Harvard Business School (with a thriving consulting practice. called the Levinson Institute on the side), he preaches the gospel of applying psychoanalytic theory to management problems.

title: Why Plant Perennials?

Clough's Feb. 27 letter is an indication of how too superficial an understanding and the use of generalization can prove to be a dangerous thing, leading the reader on the path of misunderstanding. Mr. Clough has not advanced along with the developments made in the modern research in SinoAmerican relations or in China foreign policy in general.

title: The science of what is not worth knowing
description: In a public dispute with Stephen Spender last year, W. H. Auden insisted that no novel or poem, however remarkable, had ever changed anything. Yes, probably, but I daresay Auden would agree that other books, say those of Freud or Marx, have effected profound changes in our consciousness or society. And now, sailing irresistibly down the anthropological turnpike, along comes zoologist Desmond Morris with Intimate Behaviour, after which, the female navel, at any rate, will never be the same again:

Not bad In intelligent or extravagant ways that demand attention, but certainly not good.

And the diplomatic fallout, from Seoul to Saigon, has been less than lethal.

title: The Guest Word; Padraic Colum (18811972)
description: An indelible picture that enters my mind when I consider my 30year friendship with Padraic Colum is of his crossing brassy, overlit, trafficnoisy Times Square late one. night and, oblivious of passersby, saying aloud to me (the word recite wasn't in his vocabulary) Yeats's poem Sailing to Byzantium: That is no country for old men ... Our talk was animated as usual, and we ended up walking the 60 blocks to Padraic's apartment house.

description: WASHINGTON, March 4Senator Edward M. Kennedy chairman of the Senate Judiciary subcommittee on refugees said today that the Adminstration Was ignoring humanitarian responsibilities in Vietnam by sabotaging and reducing health programs of the war.

title: New &Novel
description: What's a nice Amherst dropout doing as front man for a chic bar on upper Third Avenue? Doing his very own thing, that's what, and beating the whitecollar rat race in the bargain. (He had worries? Think of the poor bastards about to head for home, running for the five fortyseven heart attack express.) Besides his main preoccupation, young Curtis Larkin is able to pick up as many fringe benefits as he can cope with in lonely East Side bedrooms, and sometimes even on the West Side, where lives Lelia Bradford, exspeed freak and extrue love. Tuttle achieves a fine contrapuntal balance between the demands of the bar (whose hearty ambience conceals fiscal anemia), and the incessant drain on Larkin's machismo. Lovehungry bachelor girls, loan sharks, irate customers. creditors and tax men from city and country make this maitre d'htel's day a busy ont. The novel covers a five day crescendo, during which its hero makes a reentry into the real world from his boozefueled orbit. There's a nice feeling for bits of the New York scene in this edition of Butterfield 8, revisited.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: THE stock market's powerful performance shared attention with several other bullish developments in finance and business last week and cast a rosy glow over the general economic scene, brightening business and investor sentiment.

title: Both Sides Prepare for Battles on Court's Ruling Against Ban on Abortions

Jersey is readying an appeal of the Federal Court decision that struck down New Jersey's 123yearold abortion law, as organizations on both sides of the issue map their next moves.In a 21 decision last Wednesday, a Circuit Court panel said the state statute was unconstitutionally vague and invaded a woman's right to privacy. The court stopped short, however of issuing an injunction against prosecu don under the statute, saying it cohsidered that unnecessary.

title: Travel Notes: Air Travel Clubs, Camping Guide, London Lodgings

Basically the idea is this: Form a club with some duespaying members, buy a plane, hire a crew to fly it and start hopping around the world at bargain prices, charging just enough to pay the club's expenses.

title: Quebec's North Shore Booms Amid Blight
description: SEPT ILES, Quebec, March 5 In a province bedeviled by slow economic growth and chronically high unemployment, the north shore of the St. Lawrence River is a booming exception.

title: ERNEST LINWOOD IVES
description: SOUTHERN PINES, N.C. March 5 (UPI) Ernest Linwood Ives, a retired Foreign Service officer and brotherinlaw of the late Adlai E. Stevenson, died yesterday at the age of 86.

title: Florida's Democratic Primary: Victory May Mean a 15% Vote
Park's 20th Goal a Milestone for Defenseman.
LOBBYIST'S DOCTOR CALLED IN INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 The Senate Judiciary Committee has scheduled a. hearing tomorrow morning to take testimony from the doctor of Mrs. Dita D. Beard, the ailing lobbyist for the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: TOY MAKERS GEAR FOR PANDA CRAZE
description: The tools of capitalism are being reshaped and whetted to turn a profit on the giant pandas from Communist China.

title: Tokyo: Shakespeare As They Like It
description: TOKYOJapanese enthusiasm for Shakespeare has brought Britain's Royal Shakespeare Company back to Tokyo after only two years for a full month's run with Othello, Twelfth Night and Henry V. From this auspicious start, three Japanese troupes are picking up the 1972 season with King Lear Macbeth, Troilus and Cressida, Romeo and Juliet, and two Hamlets  all in translation..

title: MORE RHODESIAN ORE FOR U.S. IS REPORTED
description: LISBON, March 5The Portuguese press reported today that new shipments of chrome ore and minerals are planned from Rhodesia to the United States.

title: U.S. Insuring Agency May Face Claims of $216Million in Chile
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 The Overseas Private Investment Corporation is a 14monthold Government agency with a problem.

title: Swor Captures U.S. Title In Ski Jumping in Storm
LEWIS, SPARK INTACT, RETURNS WITH TRIO
