description: Ramsey Lewis spent nine frustrating years trying to develop a style for his pianoled, trio that would catch the public ear. And when, with The In Crowd, he finally achieved that goal in 1965, his success seemed almost as frustrating as lack of success had been. He had become trapped in a repetitious pattern of hit records that were intended to duplicate The In Crowd.

title: Seven Days in Vietnam: Bombing and Fighting, Swimming and Boredom
Halting the Missile Race
description: Decisions an many of the great issues facing the nation in the 1970's will be determined in this Presidential year by the debate of the candidates and the November vote. But one of the most important, the soaring military budget, could well be resolved earlier by longoverdue challenges now being mounted in the Congress to the Administration's request for a $6.3billion increase defense budget authority.

title: ENEMY BLOWS UP BIG RIVER CONVOY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, March 6 (AP)The South Vietnamese command lost 300 tons of ammunition, including bombs and artillery shells, in an explosion that ripped through a river convoy 10 miles east of Saigon yesterday.

title: Catered Health Foods, for Washingtonians More Curious Than Committed
description: WASHINGTON  Mother Nature on the Run, caterer of organic foods, has no illusions about the motive of most of its customers, establishment Washingtonians who occasionally turn from escargots and crepes to an evening of lentil soup and yogurt fruit salad.

title: SPECIAL U.N. AGENCY ON POLLUTION URGED
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 5  Secretary General Waldheim has conveyed to member countries a proposal for the creation of a United Nations agency that would coordinate all elements of a worldwide attack on the causes of pollution of the environment.

title: February New Orders Up
description: New order and production growth rates in February were higher than in January, according to the National Association of Purchasing Management.

title: Robert S. Overbeck Dies at 55; ExHead of Alcoa of Costa Rica
description: Robert S. Overbeck, retired general manager and president of Alcoa of Costa Rica, Inc., died yesterday in San Jose, Costa Rica, after collapsing Saturday following a game of tennis. He was 55 years old and had lived in San Jose since early 1971.

title: Planned Development on S.I.
description: The best if not the only chance of sparing 10,000 acres of southern Staten Island from haphazard and environmentally ruinous development lies in the establishment of a South Richmond development corporation.

title: Desk Sergeant at 24th Precinct Doesn't Fit the Stereotype
description: The night began slowly at the 24th Precinct. Surprising for a Saturday. A teenage boy came to retrieve his stolen motorcycle an angry woman asked help in getting her TV set back from a repairman who had kept it 11 months, an elderly man forgot where his nursing home was.

title: Erna Sack, Soprano, Dies at 69; Known for Her Effortless High C
description: WIESBADEN, German y, March 5 (AP)Erna Sack, the operatic soprano known for her effortless high C, died here Thursday. She was 69 years old.

title: Parliament Office Design Draws London Criticism
description: LONDON, March 5  A starkly modern rectangular edifice, clad in bronze and glass and featuring a roof garden and public piazza, has been chosen in a campetition for a new office building for Members of Parliament.

title: Segregation and Busing Both Opposed in Poll
description: Sixtysix per cent of Americans North and South, black and white believe in school desegregation, but 69 per cent oppose compulsory busing to achieve it, according to poll results released yesterday by Newsweek magazine.

title: DR. ISADOR W. KAHN, AN OBSTETRICIAN, 81
description: Dr. Isador W. Kahn, former attending obstetrician and gynecologist and chief of the gynecology clinic at University Hospital, died Saturday at his home, 965 Fifth Avenue. He was 81 years old.

title: Brendel Molds Skillful Piano Recital
description: Alfred Brendel's performance of the great B flat Piano Sonata of Schubert yesterday afternoon at Hunter College Assembly Hall was extraordinary in every way. The Viennese artist gave it the musical density of a Beethoven Work, which the Schubert is ableto support. This was done not by weighty tonal textures, but by giving meaning and thoughtfulness to every detail.

title: Miss Risa Frishtick Wed to Jay Levine
description: Miss Rise Leslie Frishtick daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth C. Frishtick of Fresh Meadows, Queens was married yesterday afternoon to Jay Michael Levine son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Levine of Brooklyn and Wurtsboro, N. Y. Rabbi Solomon Goldman performed the ceremony in the Utopia Jewish Center in Flushing, Queens.

title: Young Peoples Orchestra Gets Rep. Abzug's Bravo
description: Representative Bella S. Abzug showed up at Philharmonic Hall Saturday afternoon to tell the audience of the Cosmopolitan Young Peoples Symphony Or, chestra that she thought there, should be more events of the sort they were experiencing.

title: Akron Lawyer Is Queried for First Time About Collapse of $11Million financial Pyramid
description: AKRON; Ohio, March 5Don Lowers, an Akron lawyer has been questioned for the first time about the collapse of his $11million financial pyramid.

title: Brandt Arrives in Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, March 5 (Reuters)  Chancellor Willy Bramdt, making his first visit to a Middle Eastern, country as head of the West German Government, arrived today to,begin, an official visit of four days to Iran.

title: Demonstrators Support A Liberal Roman Abbot
description: ROME, March 5Roman Catholic laymen prayed and demonstrated today in support of a liberal Benedictine abbot whom the Vatican reportedly is seeking to remove from one of Rome's oldest basilicas.

title: BRYDGES SEEKING NO FAULT PACT
description: State Senate Majority Leader Earl W. Brydges, a principal critic of the modified no fault" Insurance bill favored by the !Governor, said yesterday that he would meet this week with the bill's sponsor to discuss a compromise:

title: FM, IN MERCURY, WINS MILLER 500
description: ONTARIO, Calif., March 5 (UPI)  A. J. Foyt, the tough Texan who made his reputation on the United States Auto Club trail, beat NASCAR's best today for his second victory in the $208,000 Miller High Life 500 stock car race. He finished in. front of Bobby Allison and Buddy Baker after a torrid race, during the last 45 laps.

title: Auto Improvement Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (UPI)In letters released today, Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, and the American Insurance Association urged the House Commerce Committee to restore proposed Federal standards for making automobiles more damage resistant and less costly to repair.

title: Fund Manager Expects. Gains in Consumer Area
description: James J. Awad, who will turn 26 next month, ranks among the topperforming money managers in the mutual fund business. His approach to investing, as outlined below in a recent interview with Vartanig G. Vartan of The New York Times, bears little resemblance to the gunslingers who ran gogo funds in the late 1960's and then watched the stock marketand their portfoliosfall apart. Mr. Awad's present post is senior manager of the Channing Special Fund, where he began managing part of the portfolio in January, 1971. Last year, the fund's net asset value per share rose 30 per cent, after a disastrous 41 per cent drop in 1970. Channing Special is one of seven mutual funds run by Channing Management Corp., which was acquired in mid1970 by American General Insurance. In the new look at Channing, Harry B. Freeman Jr. was installed as president of the mutualfund group. Portions of the interview with Mr. Awad follow:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It is a sad commentary on our values when political leaders and zoologists sink to playing politics and and oneupmanship with giant pandas. Instead of incarcerating two pandas in American zoos, how much more might be achieved if these rare animals, members of an endangered species, were left in their natural habitat, where they could be studied and protected.

title: Girl Dies in Sea Gate Fire
description: An 18yearold Manhattan girl was fatally burned early yesterday while visiting friends in the Sea Gate section of Brooklyn. The girl, Shelly Sobel of 530 Grand Street, was found dead after a fire in the basement apartment of a twoandonehalf story frame dwelling at 4909 Beach 49th Street.

title: La Salle Is Defeated 52 to 39 in Final of C.H.S.A.A. Event
Jennings Blind Mat Victor
description: WATERLOO, Mass., March 4  Richard Jennings of the New York Institute won the 132pound class last night in the Eastern Athletic Association for the Blind wrestling championships at the Perkins School. The Virginia School for the Blind won the 10school competition.

title: Bhutto Returns Passports
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, March 5 (AP)President Zulfikar All Bhutto personally returned about 200 passports of leading Pakistani businessmen and industrialists today. They had been confiscated on his orders last December when he took over as president.

title: Jersey Sets Up Hot Line For ChildAbuse Reports
description: TRENTON, March 5 (AP)New Jersey has set up a hot line telephone number fig any citizen to report a case of child abuse. The emergency, tollfree number is 8004529150.

title: Locomotive Helps Police Catch Four Suspects in Park Robbery
description: Four teenagers who allegedly beat and robbed four per, sops yesterday afternoon in Riverside Park were arrested after a chase in which policemen commandeered a Penn Central diesel locomotive.

title: GraySammis Duo Advances
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., March 5Gordon Gray and. Jesse Sammis 3d of The Field Club of Greenwich, Conn., reached the semifinal round of the United States men's national platform tennis doubles tournament at Fox Meadow Tennis Club today along with Ted Prince and Ted Rogers of Chevy Chase Md.

title: Bridge: Swiss Team Tourney Here Attracts Field of 62 Teams
description: The twoday Swiss team championship of the Greater New York Bridge Association at the New York Hilton attracted an entry of 62 teams including most of the topranked experts in the metropolitan area. Leading the field into the fourth and final session of play last night, with a score of 130 victory points of a possible 180, were Richard Budd of North Caldwell, N.J., Harry Stappenbeck of Uniondale, L.I., Mrs. Dorothy Hayden and Alan Truscott of New York.

title: Eurobond Volume Remains Sluggish Amid High Yields
description: BRUSSELS, March 5The Eurobond market is in a hodgepodge of conflicting trends, with the optimists having the slight edge at the moment.

title: NORMAN S. GQETZ, LAWYER 60 YEARS
description: Norman S. doetz, a. senior partner in the law firm of, Proskauer, Rose, Goetz & Mendelsohn, died here yesterday. He lived at 480 Park Avenue and in Deal, N. J., and would have been 85 years old tomorrow.

title: Red Smith
description: So now Charley Finley, who won't pay a cent more than $50,000 to a pitcher who won 24 games last season, is going to pay $90,000 to one who lost 22. However, before Vida Blue blows his stack over this example of his owner's acumen, he should remind himself that Denny McLain can justify his salary by playing the organ OaklandAlameda County Coliseum when he isn't pitching. What can Vida do besides working 318 innings, leading his team to the championship of its division, earning the Cy Young and Most Valuable Player awards and packing customers in all over the league?

title: Nixon Road to Moscow Still Open
description: MOSCOW, March 5  President Nixon seems to have begun the American reconciliation with China with enough finesse not to jeopardize his next important missionto Moscow in Maythough his Peking venture has rankled the Russians deeply.

title: SMITH WINS FINAL 3D WEEK IN ROW
description: HAMPTON, Va., March 5 (AP) Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., won the $35,000 Hampton indoor tennis singles tournament for the third time in four years today with a 63 62 67 6.4 victory over last year's winner, Ilie Nastase of Rumania.

title: Mrs. Ethelbert I. Low, 89, Led State Colonial Dames
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., March 5 Mrs. Gertrude Herrick Low, former president of the National Society of Colonial Dames in the State of New York and widow of Ethelbert Ide Low, who was chairman of Home Life Insurance Company at his death in 1946, died today at her home, 150 Ocean Avenue. She was 89 years old.

title: PLATFORM FORMED BY STATE BLACKS
description: Members of a steering committee of the New York State delegation to the National Black Political Convention adopted a platform yesterday for submission to the meeting.

title: SOUTHEAST ASIANS WEIGH NIXON TRIP
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 For the nations of Southeast Asia, other than Vietnam, the communique issued at the end of President Nixon's trip to China contained both good and bad news.

title: Hartke Relies on Plain Talk and Energy
Ceylon Grants Recognition
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, March 5 (UPI)  Ceylon, granted diplomatic recognition to Bangladesh today and expressed a hope for close relations andfriendly cooperation.

title: Jim Bostwick Wins Title
description: BOSTON, March 5  Jim Bostwick defeated his brother, Pete, 64, 61,.65, to win the national amateur court tennis championship tonight.

title: Schenk Betters Records
description: INZELL, West Germany, March 5 (AP)Ard Schenk of the Netherlands bettered his own world record in the 5,000meter speedskating race today at the Inzell Golden Skate cornpetition: His time was 7 minutes 9.8 seconds.

title: HaydnStravinsky, Philharmonic Team
description: Music by Haydn and Stravinsky will be featured in New York Philharmonic subscription concert programs during the 197273 season. The choices were made by Pierre Boulez, music director of the orchestra, who, announced plans for the coming season at a news conference in Philharmonic Hall.

title: Capital to See Rockwell's Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 An oil portrait of President Nixon by Norman Rockwellwho once complained that Mr. Nixon was no fun to paint"will be unveiled Wednesday at the National Portrait Gallery by Tricia Nixon Cox.

title: Melkite Rite Mass Is Introduced Here To Roman Catholics
description: Nearly 400 Roman Catholics participated yesterday in a Melkite mass, the normal form of worship for millions of Eastern rite Catholics, but little more than a name to Western churchgoers accustomed to the Latin rite.

title: U.S. AIDE IN SAIGON; BRIEFS THIEU ON TRIP
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, March 6 (AP)Marshall Green, a United States Assistant Secretary of State, briefed President Nguyen Van Thieu today about President Nixon's trip to China.

title: HardTalking Lobbyist
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 Mrs. Dita Davis Beard, the purported author of a memorandum linking the. International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation's reported contribution to the 1972 Republican convention with settlement of three antitrust suits against the company, is one of the capital's thousands of lobbyists who work behind the scenes and make every effort to stay out of the public limelight.

title: Miss Parker Bride of A. C. Heyman
description: Miss Joanne Parker and Adam Charles Heyman were married here yesterday afternoon at Carlton House by Rabbi Louis Goldberg. The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Parker. Her husband is the son of Mr. and Mrs. I. George Heyman. Both families are of New York and Harrison, N. Y.

title: EDWARD B. ASBURY.
description: Edward Bennett Asbury, who retired in 1966, as vice president of A. L. Burbank Company, ship brokers, died Saturday in Fort Lauderdale, Fla.. He was 71 years old and lived in Rockville Centre, L.I.

title: JACK J. WEISER, 54, OF JEWISH VETERANS
description: Jack J. Weiser, an insurance man and former state cornmander of the Jewish War Veterans, died Saturday in Beth Israel Hospital, where he was being treated for cancer. He was 54 years old and lived at 115 East Ninth Street.

title: Demand for Steel Continues to Gain
description: PITTSBURGH, March 5Demand for domestic steel continued to rise last week. On the basis of recent orders, steel analysts were predicting jump in shipments from 6.8 million tons in February to as high as 8.2 million tons in March. One analyst said orders were now high enough to sustain the March shipping rate indefinitely.

title: Pakistan Crash Kills 8
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, March (Reuters)Eight persons were killed and 14 injured last night when a bus skidded off the road in the rain and crashed into a tree, some 40 miles from Lahore.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: August Heckscher, head, of the city's Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs Administration, said yesterday that his agency had completed 80 per cent of its normal winterspring repairs in the city's parks and playgrounds and was five months ahead of its work schedule.

title: British Charge Suspect
description: LONDON, March 5A man was charged with murder tonight in the bombing of an army officers mess at Aldershot 12 days ago in which seven persons were killed.

title: Boston Globe Is 100
description: BOSTON, March 5 (UPI)The Boston Globe celebrated its 100th birthday this weekend by pledging to continue to fight to keep the press free.

title: Books of The Times
description: What's most surprising to discover in this excellent memoir of the theater is that so many of us have followed John Houseman's life quite closely without ever having noticed his name before. I myself spent three years in drama school without once hearing mention of him. And yet he turns out to have been the president and organizer of Orson Welles's Mercury Theater. He worked on the script of The Men From Mars radio show that panicked America in 1939. He coauthored, with Herman Mankiewicz, the script of Citizen Kane. He was responsible for the stage version of Richard Wright's Native Son. And practically every one of his friends and associates has now become a household name. Yet in gathering of such figures as Welles, Virgil Thomson, Marc Blitzstein, David 0. Selznick, Leslie Howard, Archibald MacLeish and Alfred Hitchcock, who would be able to identify John Houseman?

title: Nets Top Cougars 11496 Displaying Balanced Offense
Plant Spending Plans Dip
description: Appropriations for new plant and equipment by the 1,000 largest manufacturers in the country totaled $5.87billion in the final quarter of 1971, the Conference Board reported over the weekend.

title: More Reliable Lifeline
description: In a tardy but welcome action, President Nixon has directed the Department of Health, Education and Welfare to come up with a more dependable supply system of blood for transfusions and related medical purposes. Every day the ability of physicians to save lives depends, in the most literal sense, upon the availability of the types of blood their patients require to survive hemorrhages, undergo surgery or combat the ravages of such dread ailments as leukemia and hemophilia.

title: GEORGE MILLER
description: George Miller, an Associated Press reporter for 29 years, died yesterday at Lenox Hill Hospital after a long illness. He was 54 years old.

title: G.O.P. Right Fights Nixon Coast Slate
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 5The Republican right has moved to attempt to drain away President Nixon's strength la his home state in retaliation for political moves that it opposes.

title: PAY RISES PUT OFF IN CONSTRUCTION
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The Construction Industry Stabilization Committee is withholding hundreds of deferred construction wage increases in order to impose noninflationary wage patterns on a citybycity basis across the country, according to John Dunlop, chairman of the committee.

title: Plans for 73 Events
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., March 5  Enthusiastic about their success with the World Student Winter Games that closed today with a torchextinguishing ceremony in the Olympic Arena, officials of this Adirondack resort immediately began setting their sights on next winter.

title: City Block: Spring's Touch Stirs W. 85th St. Residents
description: Spring touched West 85th Street between Central Park West and Columbus Avenue, for a while, last week and changed it. The week before, hardly anyone had lingered on the sidewalks, the cold discouraging even casual conversations, and, other than comings and goings, the block had been empty most of the time.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Why must all buses be painted the same color? Different colors and combinations of colors not only would facilitate route identification at a distance but brighten up the city as well.

title: JupiterBound Pioneer 10 Completes 2 Maneuvers
description: PASADENA, Calif. March (UPI)Pioneer 10, the Jupiterbound spacecraft, completed two critical maneuvers  testing thrusters and turning on its earth pointing systemearly today, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration announced.

title: Chess: Mecking Plays With the Skill If Not Title of Grandmaster
MRS. J. WARD KEENER
description: AKRON, Ohio, March 5 (UPI) Mrs. Marian Feudner Keener, wife of J. Ward Keener, chairman of the board of the B. F. Goodrich Company, died today at her home. She was 63 years old.

title: New Presbyterian Synod
description: SHREVEPORT, La., March (AP)Pastors and laymen from Louisiana, Texas, Arkansas and Oklahoma will meet here Tuesday through Thursday to create a new regional synod of the Presbyterian ChurchU.S.

title: To Frighten and Stifle
description: NEW HAVENAll wars need lies, but some require that a whole people live in illusion. Though our Government has had increasing difficulty in maintaining the illusions of the Vietnam war, its harassment of suppOrters and sympathizers of the Harrisburg and Pentagon Papers defendants Suggests how far:it will go to keep trying.

title: JERSEY EXPANDS TRANSIT SERVICES
description: Special commuting services have been arranged to ease transportation difficulties stemming from the strike against Transport of New Jersey, the largest private bus company in the state:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In 1938 at Munich, a small nation was sacrificed in a vain attempt to appease an aggressor state.

title: Salem Is Another College Resisting Coed Approach
description: WINSTON SALEM, N. C., March 5  Salem College and Academy celebrated its 200th anniversary this weekend as a women's schoolwithout tears, without regrets, and without any handwringing or excuses about its singlesex character.

title: Michael Newmark Marries Mrs. Frost
description: Mrs. Gladys Goldblatt Frost, an interior decorator of Beechhurst, Queens, was married yesterday evening to Michael Newmark also of Beechhurst president of Village Mall Properties, a New York building concern, and former president of New mark, Posner & Mitchell advertising agency. Rabbi Charles Agin performed the ceremony in Ripple's on the. Water, a restaurant in Whitestone, Queens.

title: Marijuana Seized, 2 Held
description: BALTIMORE, March 5 (UPI) Two men were arrested today by policemen and Federal agents who stopped their automobile and confiscated 12 burlap bags filled with marijuana valued at $100,000. The suspects, Peter Hoyer, 27 years old, of Miami Beach, and Bernard Baston Jr., 24, of Newcastle, Me., were jailed on narcotics charges pending arraignment tomorrow in Federal District Court.

title: Jamaica Five Beaten in P.S.A.L.,7266Tarrant Is Hero.
DONALD BRAM LEY
description: HARTFORD, March 5 Donald Bramley, senior vice president of the Life Insurance Agency Management Association here, died yesterday in Hartford Hospital, after a brief illness. He was 49 years old and lived in West Hartford.

title: COURT BACKS RULING VOIDING LIBEL SUIT
description: KNOXVILLE, March 5 (AP) The Tennessee Supreme Court, reaffirming the right of the press to criticize government, has upheld a lower court ruling dismissing a $48million libel suit against Look magazine and others.

title: VACANCIES CITED ON SCHOOL PANEL
description: The Board of Education has asked Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner to make recommendations for filling, on a provisional basis, two impending vacancks, on the, school system's, controyersial Board of Examiners.

title: PRIVATE SCHOOLS LOSE ENROLLMENT
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The Census Bureau reported today a precipitious drop in the number of students attending private grade and high schools. Enrollment has plunged 23 per cent since 1965, the peak year.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The increasing number of Americans conscious of man's impact on the earth owe it to themselves to consider the political implications of their concern. For there is potentially a dark side to the ecological movement, and it has to be faced.

title: Soviet Flights to Co On
description: MOSCOW, March 5 (Agence FrancePresse)The Soviet Union intends to latinch more manned space flights, the Communist party paper Pravda said today.

title: Over There
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass,A new Amerlean foreign policy is being carried out. It acknowledges the passing of the bipolar world, in which each superpower was master of a camp and the U.S. saw itself as the suardian of the interests of the whole free world. We are striving now for the establishment of a new balance of power.In a world of five major unitsthe U.S., the Soviet Union, China, Japan, Western Europethe U.S. would be able to regain flexibility and to practice selfrestraint. Instead of having to concentrate on.keeping our alliances intact and to intervene everywhere in order to contain our main foes, we would again concentrate on our relations with the other major powers. Psychological and material strains on the U.S. would be reduced.

title: Gannett Seeks Texas Paper
description: ROCHESTER, March 5 (AP) The Gannett Company said today it had reached an agreement in principle to acquire The El Paso (Tex.) Times for $20million in Gannett stock. The Morning Times would be Gannett's 54th daily newspaper.

title: British Hovercraft Sinks
description: PORTSMOUTH, England, March 5 (AP)A 10ton hovercraft that flipped over in Portsmouth harbor during a gale, killing four passengers, sank today alongside a Royal Navy repair ship. A salvage attempt will be made.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In connection with your Feb. 22 editorial Saving Free Voices, I would like to emphasize that the liquidation of Radio Free Europe either by extinction or by policy decision would be interpreted by the peoples of Bulgaria, Czechoslovakia, Hungary, Poland and Rumania as the, final recognition by the United States of the present status quo and of the permanency of the Soviet rule in East Europe.

title: Penn, Temple, E. Carolina Confirm N.C. A. A. Berths
Datch Mother Takes Her 2d World Title In Speed Skatiiig
description: HEEREVEEN the Netherlands March 5 (Reuters)Mrs. Atte KeulenDeelStra of the Netherlands became the women's World speed skating champion today for the second time. The 33yearold mother of three won the 1,000meter race and finished second in the 3,000 raising meet total to 185.342 points. Mrs. Stein BaasKaiser of the Netherlands and Dianne Holum of Northbrook Ill., were second and third respectively in the overall cllassication.

title: Elmhurst Woman Raped By Apartment Employe
description: A 36yearold woman was raped last night in the Elmhurst section of Queens by an employe of the building she lived in, according to the police.

title: Health of the Hospitals
description: The uncommonly frank Report to the People issued recently by the City Health and Hospitals Corporation provides a dismaying insight into the magnitude of the problems the corporation inherited when it assumed responsibility for operating the municipal hospital system twenty months ago.

title: GiftWithPurchase Called Monster by Some Stores
description: Last week, a woman who lives in a high income area of Manhattan and has charge accounts with most of the leading department and specialty stores, sifted through her mail and discovered she could receive the following gifts: a Pucci bracelet and a kit of Estde Lauder Clinique products from Bergdorf's, a purse flacon of Tuvara spray and a box of four Germaine Monteil beauty products from Bloomingdale's, a kit of four Etherea cosmetics and other of five Ultima II products from Bonwit Teller, a package of four Max Factor products from Altman's.

title: Turkish Liner, at Istanbul, Sinks After 8Hour Fire
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, March 5 (UPI)  The 6,000ton liner Marmara, one of Turkey's most luxurious passenger ships, burned and sank today in Istanbul's Golden. Horn harbor while waiting to dock for repairs. Fire officials said that all crew members were rescued and that there had been no passengers aboard.

title: Goldberg and Law Teacher Ask Genocide Pact Action
description: Two authorities on international law have urged the Senate to immediately ratify the United Nations Genocide Convention, asserting that it is inconceivable for the Government to hesitate any longer in making an international commitment against mass murder.

title: National Symphony Rises To Ritornello Challenge
description: Lidholm's Ritornello may be a patchy work but it is a good orchestratesting piece. Dean Dixon led the Washington National Symphony through its athletic hurdles yesterday afternoon in Philharmonic Hall the assured performance proved that Mr. Dixon is a superior technician and that the National Symphony is becoming a major orchestra.

title: Malta and Britain Resume, Talks on Allied Use of Bases
description: LONDON, March 5  Prime Minister: Dom Mintoff of Malta and Lord Carrington, Britain's Defense Secretary, resumed negotiations on allied use of bases on Malta here today. There was no major progress reported after six hours, and the talks are to continue tomorrow.

title: Mrs. Constable Takes Title
description: CEDARHURST March 5  Mrs. W. Pepper Constable of Princeton, N.J., won the United States women's senior squash racquets championship today by defeating Mrs. Newtown Hunsberger of Philadelphia 155, 15.10, 1513 at the Rockaway Hunting Club,

title: Tanker Blocks Port Jefferson Harbor
description: PORT JEFFERSON, L. I. March 5  A 650foot oil tanker, loaded with 7.5 million gallons of fuel oil, ran aground in the mouth of the harbor here early this morning.

title: Miss Price Offers Lots to Cheer About
description: A roar of applause went up when Leontyne Price walked on stage at Carnegie Hall yesterday, and the enthusiasm seldom waned throughout the first recital the soprano has given here since 1969.

title: Flood Toll in West Virginia Is 103 as Search Goes On
description: MAN, W. Va., March 5 (AP) The death toll in flooddevastated Buffalo Creek Hollow rose to 103 today as National Guard men unearthed eight more bodies from the wreckage of coal camps.

title: 5 Hurt in Multiple Crash
description: BATAVIA, N. Y., March 5 (UPI)At least five persons were injured today, none seriously, in a chainreaction collision that closed the eastbound lane of the snowswept Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway, west of Batavia, authorities said. The state police reported that 50 vehicles were involved in the accident, which occurred when a trailer truck apparently skidded and blocked the lane.

title: RUDOLF PETRAK, TENOR, DIES AT 54
description: Rudolph Petrak, a leading tenor with the City Opera Company from 1948 to 1956, died Saturday of a heart ailment In Greenwich, Conn., where he lived. His age was 54.

title: Mrs. Meir Names ExChief of Staff to Cabinet
description: TEL AVIV, March 5  Premier Golda Meir today nomi nated Hahn BarLev, the former military Chief of Staff, as Minister of Commerce and Industry. The nomination, proved by the Cabinet, will be presented to the Israeli Parliament tomorrow for approval.

title: Internes and Residents Plan National Organization
description: ATLANTA, March 5  Internee and resident physicians from hospitals across the country have decided to form a national organization, independent of the American Medical. Association and other health groups, to work for sweeping changes in traditional ways of practicing medicine.

title: CHARGES DISMISSED IN MISSISSIPPI KILLING
description: GREENWOOD, Miss., March 5 (AP)Charges of murder have been dismissed against two of the three white men originally indicted in the death of a young Negro woman in Drew last May, District Attorney George Everett of Greenwood said tonight.

title: 2 Arrested After Attack On a Transit Patrolman
description: A Transit Authority patrolman, attacked by two men yesterday on a subway train at the Lefferts Boulevard terminal of the IND line in Richmond Hill, Queens, arrested his assailants after shooting one.

title: J. STORY SMITH
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 5 J. Story Smith, former vice president and secretary of the Jacobs Aircraft Engine Company in Pottstown, died Friday in Southern Jines, N. C. He in Southern Pines, N. C. He was 67 years old and lived in Gwynedd Valley.

title: The Goodman Jailing
description: Judges at all levels, up to the United States Supreme Court, are wrestling with the immensely difficult task determining what limits, if any, can be imposed on the right of the press to protect its sources of information. That task would have been needlessly confused had Federal Judge Marvin E. Frankel not acted yesterday order the release from jail of the imprisoned manager of radio station WBAI.

title: They've Gone Beyond Just Hats
description: Let those who will flee the city. Two who did are back at the same old stand and glad of It despite the fact that their rent has more than doubled during their absence They are Vincent von Berg and Harmik Gasparian whom New Yorkers may remember as Vincent Harmik, a team of hat designers who for 17 years turned out millinery that ranked with that of Halston, Emme Adolfo Sally Victor and the like. Two. years ago they decided to pack it all in and see what was on the other side of the mountain. Vincent set his sites on Houston and Detroit, while Harmik concentrated on London and Frankfurt.

title: ACTIVE WEEK DUE IN TAXFREE BONDS
description: States and cities plan to borrow $1.5billion this week, a substantial volume of taxexempt financing that could press interest rates higher.

title: Philadelphia Group Picks New Fair Site
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 5Promoters of a 1976 World's Fair in Philadelphia for the country's bicentennial celebration are going back to Washington March 21 with a new plan.

title: WBAI Chief Freed On a Federal Writ
description: Edwin A. Goodman, the general manager of radio Station WBAI, was released from the Civil Jail here yesterday afternoon after his lawyers got a writ of habeas corpus from United States District Court Judge Marvin E. Frankel in Larchmont, N. Y.

title: CALVIN E. BRUMLEY, AIDED CABINET MEN
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 Calvin E. Brumley, special as sistant for public affairs to both Secretaries of the Treas. ury in the Nixon Administration, died. today in Georgetown University Hospital of a heart attack.. His age was 48, He lived in Georgetown and on Martha's Vineyard, Mass.

title: Soviet Six Wins Medal
description: PLATTSBURGH, N.Y., March 5 (AP)The Soviet Union, unbeaten and tied only once during its six contests at the World Student Winter Games, won its gold medal in the hockey competition today by defeating the United States, 41. The Americans failed to win a game in the roundrobin series.

title: Elizabeth in Singapore
description: SINGAPORE, March 5 (AP) Queen Elizabeth II today toured the installations here of a small BritishAustralianNew Zealander force,, the remnants of the British Empire's presence in Southeast Asia. The force includes 3,400 Australians, 2,800 Britons and 1,200 New Zealanders; 38 Mirage fighters, three frigates and other vessels and planes. The British force here alone totaled 70,000 men at one time.

title: Small Fire Set in Theater
description: A small incendiary device flared up under a seat in the Olympia Theater, Broadway at 107th Street, at 8:40 last night, prompting the evacuation of 180 patrons but causing no inju'ries or damage. Shortly afterward, the police found another bottle of flammable liquid with a watch timer in the theater. An anonymous caller later told The Associated Press that the devices had been left as a protest against a forthcoming Cuban film festival at the theater.

title: Waldheim on Way to Confer In South Africa on Dispute
description: VIENNA, March 5 (REUTERS) Secretary General Waldheim of the United Nations left Vienna tonight for Capetown for talks with the South African Government on the controversy over SouthWest Africa.

title: Contract Gives Italian Seamen Second Highest Pay in World
description: ROME, March 5All the passengers of an Italian ship about to leave the port of Miami for a threeday cruise to Barbados were given their tickets back recently because of a 24hour strike of Italian maritime workers that idled 138 major vessels in domestic and foreign ports.

title: CITYPINNING HOPE ON NEW STATE AID OF $800MILLION
description: Deputy Mayor EdWard K. Himilton and City Budget Director DaVid A. Grossman contended yesterday that the $800million extra state aid sought in Mayor Lindsay's new expense budget could be met withoUt increased state taps at least this year Pelt, of this they Said could be made available through Federal revenue sharing.

title: TALKS SHOW GAIN IN G.M.OHIO STRIKE
description: LORDSTOWN, Ohio, March 5 Union and management representatives said today that some Progress was being made in settling the labor dispute at the General Motors plant here where all of the Vegas are produced.

title: ApartmentBuildingBlast In Spain Kills at Least 10
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Monday, March 6 (AP)A 10story downtown building with an apartment on each floor collapsed after an explosion early today while most of the residents were sleeping, the authorities said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I read your Feb. 6 news report from Athens containing the Opinions of former Greek political leaders as well as of other anonymous persons whom the military government has dislocated and apparently will keep away from leadership. For the last five years I have been reading the same jeremiads in The Times, namely, that the United States has practically ushered the pres ent rulers into Greek politics; that the opposition leaders, some selfexiled in the socialist capitals of Europe and some restrained in their luxurious palaces at Athens, blame the Republican Administration for the situation in Greece and project a democratic Trojan horse to take up Nixon's Troy.

title: 6 Die in Norway Slides
description: OSLO, Norway, March 5 (Agence FraricePresse)Avalanches in Norway over the weekend killed six people, three Norwegian skiers in the mountains near. Volda, a West German at Dombas, and two boys aged 8 and 10, at Knaben.

title: West Virginians Living in Hollows Fear That Mine Waste Piles in Their Areas Will Cause Next Flood
description: TWILIGHT, W. Va., March 3Alva Workman a retired coal miner who likes to keep a neat house. Right now he has laid boards across his yard so visitors won't have to walk in the mud.

title: V. A. Drug Clinics Seek Solutions After 14 Months of Drive Against Addiction
description: CHICAGO, March 4Fourteen months into a $17.5million nationwide fight against drug, addiction, the Veterans Administration is still getting organized in some of its 32 clinics, being flooded with applicants in others and, in all of them, learning a stiff lesson in the formidable difficulties that go with drug addiction treatment.

title: Industrial Condominium Opens as Experiment Here
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Feb. 18 editorial on abortion and Medicaid once again demonstrates an amazing lack of sensitivity to human needs and values. You speak of equal protection of the laws but, in practice, you advocate the Orwellian concept that some human beings are more equal than others.

title: Taiwan Is the Prize In Renewed Struggle
description: WASHINGTON, March 5In 1895 an island 120 miles off the coast of China was ceded from a dying Chinese empire to what soon would be a swiftly expanding Jap anese empire.

title: Bowling Green Park to Get Dutch Flavor Back
description: Bowling. Green Park, the historic halfacre oval at the foot of Broadway where Peter Minuit is, said to have purchased Manhattan. Island from the Indians. for $24 in 1626, will be rebuilt to look the way it did in the late seventeenhundreds. The restoration will be part of a $10million to $20million subway renovation project announced yesterday.

title: Advertising: Chet Is Airline's Spokesman
description: Until Contradicted, it would appear that American Airlines could easily claim that its current commercials starring Chet Huntley are the first in the industry employing an official spokesman.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I read with interest your Feb. 21 endorsement of the proposed sale to the state of New York University's Bronx campus and the establishment there of a center of engineering and technology. My interest is more than incidental because of the role Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn would certainly need to play in the establishment of a metropolitan engineering center.

title: Mujib eaves Soviet With Aid Agreements
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: During the McCarthy era the Truman and Eisenhower Administrations, with the ardent support of the Department of Justice and the Atomic Energy Commission, destroyed the careers of two distinguished scholars and public servants, Dr. Robert Oppenheimer and Prof. Owen Lattimore. In 1963 President Kennedy and then President Johnson made what was in effect official apology and restitution to Dr. Oppenheimer by conferring upon him, in a White House ceremony, the Fermi Award. Professor Lattimore, though completely cleared of the frivolous and vindictive charges leveled against him, never recovered from the effects of official harassment and eventually removed to England, where he could carry on, his China studies without interference.

title: World Exports Set Record Total in 71
description: World exports reached a record total of $343billion during 1971, according to estimates by the United Nations obtained over the weekend.

title: Mills Assures Supporters He'll Campaign Actively
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I read with interest John Robben's Feb. 24 OpEd article Roaming Catholics. As a Roman Catholic myself, and one of the same generation as Mr. Robben, I can empathize with him.

title: Blacks and Puerto Ricans Up Milliuon Herein Decade
Soviet Defends Maligned Homeowners
description: MOSCOW, March 5Private homeowners, sometimes overlooked and more often maligned despite their numbers in the Soviet Union, have won support from an unexpected quarterthe Government newspaper Izvestia.

title: Senate Bill to Authorize A Stock Clearing System
description: WASHINGTON, March 5, (Reuters)  Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr. said today he would introduce legislation tomorrow giving the Securities and Exchange Commission authority over a national clearing system for securities transactions. The bill also would eliminate by Dec. 31, 1976, use of certificates for transactions between brokers and would bar states and cities from taxing certain stock transfers.

title: Willa Israel Married
description: Miss Willa Harriet Israel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David Israel of New York, was married at noon yesterday to Stanley Jay Schneider, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Schneider of Floral Park, Queens. Rabbi Irwin Isaacson performed the ceremony at the Oakland Jewish Center. Mrs. Kenneth Bachner, a sister of the bride, and Jeffrey Schneider, brother of the bridegroom, attended the couple.

title: Hota Eleven Upset By Knitters, 42, In New York Final
description: Ignoring prognostications that they were supposed to lose, the GermanHungarians defeated New York Hota, the 1971 national soccer champion, 42,. in the New York final of the United States Challenge Cup yesterday.

title: Old Genoa Faces New Urban Problems
description: GENOA, ItalyThis ancient city, Italy's busiest seaport and one of its largest industrial centers, is beset by some of the same urban problems that bedevil Manhattan.

title: RESERVE REBUFF ON RATES IS TOLD
description: Last May, as the international financial crisis that led to the devaluation of the dollar was starting to develop, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York sought to raise interest rates to protect the United States currency but web rebuffed by the Federal Reserve Board in Washington.

title: A Senate Majority Speaks
description: A majority of the members of the United States Senate has sponsored a resolution designed to back continuation of Radio Free Europe and Radio Liberty.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: NEW DELHI, March 5 (AP) India has sought clarification from the United States on the inclusion of Kashimir in the AmericanChinese communique, authorities sources said today.

title: GEORGE W. OLIPHANT
description: George W. Oliphant, who retired in 1963 as chairman of Castle & Overton, Inc., international traders in pulp and paper supplies, died yesterday at his home. He was 86 years old.

title: Friends Fall Out
description: OTTAWAPrime Minister Trudeau continues to insist that relations with the United States have never been better, but Canadian officials involved in the recent economic haggling with Washington tell it differently.

title: Speakers 11 to 83 in Age Offer Village Solutions
description: I have a lot of good memories, Victoria Hartman reminisced.

title: Soviet Ends Exploration Of an Area in Antarctica
description: MOSCOW, March 5The Soviet Union has reported that its Antarctic scientists have completed a twomonth exploration program of Mac Robertson Land, described as a region that has not been studied in depth.

title: Retired Greek General Sues Over an Antiroyalist Article
description: ATHENS, March 5Angered by an editorial campaign against. Greece's exiled King Constantine, a retired Greek general is suing two editors and a former member of Parliament.

title: HIGH COURT TO SPEED GASSUPPLY RULING
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP)The Supreme Court set the stage today for an early ruling on the allocation of naturalgas supplies to homeowners during periods of shortages.

title: Egyptian Aide Said to Hint At Guerrilla Raids in Sinai
description: CAIRO, March 6Vice President Hussein elShafei was reported today to have hinted to Egyptian university students that commando warfare might be resumed against Israeli forces in the occupied Sinai Peninsula.

title: MILLS BIDS CITIES LOBBY ON SHARING
description: WASHINGTON, March 6Representative Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, indicated to a group of city officials here today that he did not know when or whether the committee would approve revenuesharing legislation.

title: ALBERT HERMAN
description: NORWALK, Conn., March 6 Albert Herman, a retired Norwalk police lieutenant who received the Distinguished Service Cross and Croix de Guerre in World War I, died yesterday in Fort Myers, Fla, where he had recently been engeged as a real estate broker. His age was 76.

title: 24 GROUPS TO FIGHT FOR POLLUTION BILL
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (UPI)  Accusing the Administration of inflated cost estimates, 24 organizations united today in a lobbying drive to strengthen water cleanup legislation and restore tough provisions adopted by the Senate under the sponsorship of Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: An initial offering of 364,000 common shares of HarteHanks Newspapers, Inc., San Antonio, Texas, at $21 a share, was announced by White Weld yesterday for today. The stock is for delivery March 14, the brokerage firm reported.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: SOUTH SUDAN REBEL ORDERS CEASEFIRE
description: KAMPALA Uganda March 6 The leader of the rebels in the southern Sudan Joseph Lagu today ordered his units in the Sudan's three southern provinces to stop fighting.

title: Details of Congressional Districting Plan Are Disclosed in Albany
description: ALBANY, March 6  The Republican legislative leadership, today disclosed the detailed Congressional redistricting plan that reduces New York City's delegation by two seats, creating dilemmas for some reformers and generally protecting organization incumbents.

title: Chinatown Gets New Mayor Figure
description: Surrounded by congratulatory wallscrolls and redribboned bouquets, Henry Chung took. the oath of office yesterday as president of the Chinese Consolidated Benevolent Association, a kind of mayor figure for Chinatown.

title: Brooklyn Student Denies Criticizing His Principal
description: An Eastern District High School student, Nestor Gonzales, said yesterday that quote attributed to him in a New York Times article last Friday mistakenly implied that students were dissatisfied with the high school principal.

title: Flood Toll Up to 107
description: MAN, W. Va., March 6 (UPI) National Guardsmen searching through the rubble of the Buffalo Creek flood found four More bodies today, thus raising the number of known dead to 107. A National Guard spokesman said 57 other persons were still missing from the flood, which struck the coalmining valley Feb, 26 when a slag dam broke after three days of heavy rainfall.

title: CURZON, AT PIANO, SHOWS ARTISTRY
description: Although Clifford Curzon has appeared here several times over the last few seasons as soloist with the New York Philharmonic and Cleveland orchestras, hiS appearance at Philharmonic Hall Sunday night marked his first New York recital since 1963. Choosing the six Moments Musicaux of Schubert's Op. 94, Beethoven's Eroica Variations and the Schumann Fantasy in C, Op. 17three works that have long been ,associated with the English pianist, and all of which he has recordedMr. Curzon upheld, his reputation as a refined, discerning artist.

title: Reedy and Hagerty Deplore Secrecy in Government
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP)James C. Hagerty attacked stamphappy bureaucrats and George Reedy questioned the growth of White House staff operations as new hearings began today on Government secrecy policies.

title: ROSEWALL DEFEATS DRYSDALE IN FINAL
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., March 6 (UPI)Ken Rosewall, refreshed by a oneday rainout, came back tonight to defeat Cliff Drysdale, 3.6, 62, 6.4, in the final of the $50,000 Saga Bay tennis tournament for contract pros at David Park.

title: Rep. Colmer 82 to Retire, Opening Key Rules Post
description: WASHINGTON March 6 Representative William M. Colmer of Mississippi the 82yearold conservative chairman of the House Rules Committee announced today that he would not seek another term in Congress.

title: Mrs. Onassis Cites Galella Harassing
description: Mrs. Aristotle Onassis spelled out in Federal Court yesterday what she said were aggressive actions toward her by free lance photographer Ronald E, Galella.

title: A Hall of Fame for the Theater To Honor Outstanding Figures
description: A theater Hall of Fame, honbring personalities who have made outstanding contributions to the American theater since its beginnings in the mid19th century, will be housed in the Uris Theater, now under construction on Broadway between 50th and 51st Streets.

title: Hatcher Chosen to Keynote Black Convention
Addonizio in Handcuffs, Starts His 10Year Term
description: NEWARK, March 6ExMayor Hugh J. Addonizio was led in handcuffs today from the Federal Courthouse, just across the street from his former office in City Hall, to begin serving a 10year prison term for extorting money from contractors.

title: Debate Debased
description: With New Hampshire's Democratic primary sputtering out in a desultory questioning of the five candidates by a panel of local newsmen, one is prepared to share the hope of a Muskie staff man that this might be the end of the debates"as these campaign shows are imaginatively called. Fatuous and anticlimactic, Sunday's televised performance recalled the LincolnDouglas exchanges only by the vividness of the contrast.

title: TIGERS BEAT PIRATES AS RODRIGUEZ STARS
description: LAKELAND, Fla., March (UPI)Aurelio Rodriguez drove in two runs with a double and a single today as the Detroit Tigers scored their first victory of the exhibition season, 30, over the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Mrs. Mohn Remarried
description: NEW CANAAN, Corm., March 6.  Mrs. AnneMercier, Motley Wickham Mohn, widow of George Valentine Mohn, was married here this evening. to Wilson Mendenhall Brazer, a. vice president of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York. The. Rev. T. Guthrie. Speers Jr. performed the ceremony in his study at the First Presbyterian Church. Only mem bers of the immediate families attended. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.

title: BUTZ IS CRITICIZED IN TIMBER DISPUTE
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP) Senator Gale W. McGee, Democrat of Wyoming, said today that Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz was primarily responsible for a January decision to kill a proposed Executive order regulating clearcutting in Federal foredts.

title: 3 TESTIFY HERE IN IRVING CASE
description: Investigation of the disputed autobiography of Howard Hughes accelerated toward conclusion yesterday as three of the principal figures testified here before grand juries.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (UPI)  Cliff Richey of San Angelo, Tex., easily defeated Colin Dibley of Australia, 64, 61, and advanced to the second round of the $25,000 Equity international indoor tennis tournament tonight.

title: Green Says He Assured Saigon on Policy of U.S.
description: SAIGON South Vietnam Tuesday March 7Assistant Secretary of State Marshall Green said today that he had assured South Vietnamese leaders that American, policy toward Vietnam had not been affected by President Nixon's trip to China.

title: British Missionary, Expelled by Taiwan, Cites Church Study
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan March 6Dr. Harry Daniel Beery, a British Presbyterian missionary who has lived in Taiwan since 1950, left today for Hong Kong after having been given until tomorrow to leave the country.

title: A Titian Stolen in London
description: LONDON March 6 (UPI)Thieves stole a Titian masterpiece from St. Augustine's here sometime last night, the police said today. The painting, which depicts the Annunciation, was presented to St. Augustine's which is in the Kilburn area, by Lord Rothermere in 1939. The thieves broke a stained glass window to get into the church and then carried the painting out through a side door, the police said.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Irving Trust Company has elected Anthony Rendino senior vice president.

title: Trevino, Ruth Jessen Receive Awards Here
description: Lee Trevino, after finishing in a secondplace tie in the afternoon in the Doral open at Miami, flew up last night and received the Gold Tee Award at the 20th annual dinner of the Metropolitan Golf Writers Association at the Hotel Americana.

title: Maurice Heyne Dead at 80; Former Belgian Minister
description: Maurice Heyne, Belgian minister and commercial counselor in Washington from 1947 to 1957, died Sunday in Vancouver, British Columbia. He was 80 years old and lived in Warren, Conn.

title: T.A. Reports Tests Prove New Subway Cars Safe
description: The Transit Authority said yesterday that tests of new subway cars found them to be well engineered and safe by any of the current standards.

title: 52 IN ULSTER HURT IN A NEW BOMBING
description: BELFAST Northern Ireland March 6  Fiftytwo persons most of them women shoppers and office workers were injured here today when a bomb exploded in a parking lot behind a movie theater.

title: Yugoslavia Gets Credit From Western Banks
description: LONDON, March 6 (Reuters)  A $100million fiveyear Eurodollar credit for Yugoslavia, the largest for an Eastern European country, (has been arranged by a consortium of international banks led by the Bankers Trust Company, the bank announced here today.

title: Hearing on Quality of Water For Queens Area Ordered
description: The quality of water served to 20,000 families, in Woodhaven, Queens, is deteriorating because of excessive pumping from wells, a staff report for the state Public Service Commission asserted yefterday.

title: Auburn Is Routed
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., March 6 (AP)Kentucky took an early lead and overwhelmed. Auburn, 10267, tonight. The Wildcats stayed in contention for the Southeastern Conference crown,

title: Bail for Corona Rejected
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., March (UPI)A visiting judge rejected today a defense motion asking that Juan V. Corona be freed on bail. But the Superior Court judge, Richard E. Patton, said he felt that Corona, who is charged with 25 deaths, would be entitled to have bail fixed when the decision abolishing the death penalty in California is final.

title: Amex Prices Climb as Volume Grows
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market started the week in a bullish fashion yesterday as prices on, both lists made strong gains in heavy trading.

title: Donald Allan Weds Miss Keown
description: Miss Belinda Keown, whose father, the late Eric Keown, was drama critic of Punch, was married here last evening to Donald Aspinwall Allan, a consultant to the United Nations Children's Fund. The Rev. Norman D. Stanton performed the ceremony at the Central Presbyterian Church.

title: Voris Quits Cardinals Eleven
description: ST. LOUIS, March 6 (UPI)Dick Voris, an assistant football coach with the St. Louis Cardinals for the last four years, resigned today to pursue other opportunities.

title: Why You Won't See Bumble Bee Adson C.B.S.TV
FARLEFT PARTY FORMED IN ITALY
description: ROME, March 6A proms Chinese faction of Italy's Communist party formally registered today its intention, to present its own slates of candidates in the forthcoming general elections for Parliament.

title: Allstate Insurance, Sears Subsidiary, Reports 33% Gain
description: Net income of the Allstate Insurance Company. rose 33 per cent last year, the Sears, Roebuck & Co. subsidiary disclosed yesterday.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., March 6(UPI)Louisville stole the ball repeatedly tonight en rdute to a 10283 triumph over Tulsa. The Cardinals forced a postseason playoff with Memphis State for the Missouri Valley Conference championship.

title: Heath and Mintoff Fail to Agree on Malta Bases
description: LONDON, March 6Prime Minister Heath and Prime Minister Dom Mintoff of Malta failed to reach agreement tonight in the dispute, over the allied bases on the Mediterranean island.

title: W. T. Grant and Interstate Had Higher Sales in Month
description: The W. T. Grant Company and Interstate Stores, Inc., reported yesterday sales gains in February, compared with the same month last year.

title: BIG CROWDS DRAWN BY STORE CLOSINGS
description: Large crowds were attracted yesterday to the start of the goingoutofbusiness sale at the 17 Broadstreet's and Weber & Heilbroner stores in the New York metropolitan area.

title: Is Another Male (or Female) Refuge on Its Way Out?
description: Women in barber shops, men in beauty salons togetherness is growing faster than hair around town. Two more shops are letting down their sexual barriers. One of them is on the sixth floor at Bendel's, where women used to have a good hearttoheart gossip as they stretched out in flowery chaise longues. Now the salon has opened a section for men. There's no reason why a woman should have to park her husband elsewhere when she's having her hair done, said a store spokesman. So Bendel's is welcoming him as well as her, and equality runs to prices: $15 for either, for shampoo, cut and dry.

title: Buses Roll Again in West
description: LOS ANGELES, March 6 (AP) After a weeklong strike, buses were back M service today in four Southern California counties. We're in full operation, said a spokesman for the Rapid Transit District, whose fleet of 1,500 buses serves Los Angeles, Orange, Riverside and San Bernardino counties. They carry 400,000 passengers a day.

title: Ratelle, His Big Stick Silenced, Talks Softly of Lost Opportunity
description: Stand next to daddy's leg, honey, the photographer shouted.

title: FULBRIGHT IS FIRM ON RADIO OUTLETS
description: WASHINGTON March 6Senator J. W. Fulbright said today that the Nixon Administration's pledge not to interfere in China's internal affairs made continued support of Radio Free Europe and Radio Liberty incomprehensible.

title: ELLIOTT ASSAILED AT PLAN HEARING
description: Residents of the ChelseaClinton area on Manhattan's West Side jeered the chairman of the City Planning Commission, Donald. H. Elliott, last night and denounced the city's blueprint for development of the waterfront neighborhood.

title: Why Supermarket Turbot Isn't the Gourmet's Delight
description: If ever a fish suffered an identity crisis, it's the turbot. Is it a prince of the piscatorial kingdom or a bargain counter bonanza?

title: Hoaxed, by Hero,'
description: MOSCOW, March 6  A hoax in the tightly controlled Soviet Press?

title: Saigon's Mayor Orders Bars to Quit City Center
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 6 (Reuters)The Mayor has ordered all bars in downtown Saigon and Cholon closed on instructions from President Nguyen Van Thieu.

title: Aqueduct Will Stay Closed for 2d Day
description: The footsteps of pickets will continue to replace the hoofbeats of horses at Aqueduct today as a strike by parimutuel clerks enters its second day.

title: PRO BASKETBALL SCORED ON MERGER; Football Players, ExOwner Of Celtics and Bill.Bradley Testify Before Senate
Article 3  No Title
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., March 6 (AP)A disciplined Providence team rolled to a 9076 victory over Jacksonville tonight in. a battle between tournamerit bound quintets. Ernie DiGregorio Scored points to pace the victors.

title: Lettet to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The recent OpEd article Tear that Mountain Down! by Robert Lasch focused on some of the worst features of what Mr. Lasch called an absurd relic of the robber baron era, the still surviving Mining Act of 1872. The features he pinpointed, namely that law's inadequate protection of the environment and the rights of others to use the public land, are the very reasons that the Nixon Aciministration has recently recommended a major reform of that law. We have also recommended a major revision of the Mineral Leasing Law of 1920 for the same reason.

title: Mrs. Court Has a Baby
description: PERTH, Australia, March 6 (UPI)Mrs. Margaret Court, the 30yearold tennis stare gave birth to an eightpound boy last night. The 1970 grandslam champion said she might return to play in the United States in June or July.

title: Dr. Richard J. Lernpke, 53, Of Mutual Life, Is Dead
description: WAYNE, NJ., March 6Dr. Richard Lempke, second vice president and chief medical director of the Mutual Life Insurance Company of New York, died yesterday at his home, 183 Hillcrest Drive, apparently of heart attack. His age was 53.

title: Lawyers in Black Panther Case Protest Timing of Split Trials
description: Despite the heated protests of defense lawyers, a member of the Black Panther party was ordered yesterday to stand trial before four other defendants do, in the murder of an official of an alleged rival party faction last April in Corona, Queens.

title: Attendance Zone Altered In 8 Bronx High Schools
description: New studentattendance zones for eight coeducational academic high schools in the Bronx, including two that will open for the first time this fall the John F. Kennedy and Herbert. H. Lehman schools were announced yesterday by Chancellor Harvey. B. Scribner.

title: CON ED EMPLOYE ARRAIGNED IN FIRE
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 6 A Consolidated Edison employe who worked as a mechanic at the Indian Point 2 nuclear power plant was arraigned in County Court here this morning on charges of setting a fire that caused millions of dollars of damage last November.

title: MARINA FINKELSTEIN, EDITOR AT HARVARD
description: Dr. Marina Salvin Finkelstein, editor of publications in Harvard University's Center for International Affairs, died Sunday in Brookline, Mass., after an illness of several months. She was 51 years old and lived in Lexington, Mass.

title: Justice Under Pressure
description: The case of. Attorney Generaldesignate Richard Kleindienst, the lady lobbyist for the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, and the huge sum which ITT offered to contribute to the next Republican National Convention while its antitrust suit was being settled, grows ever more complicated and disturbing.

title: British Soccer Postponed
description: LONDON, March 6 (Reuters) All eight English third and fourth Division soccer matches scheduled for today were postponed because of the power floodlighting restrictions imposed following the nationwide coal miners strike.

title: MISS. WELLS MAKES DEBUT. AS MICAELA
description: A pretty face, a charming manner and a lovely soprano are the chief requisites for Micaela in Carmen. Patricia Wells, who made ,her. City Opera debut in the role Sunday night, has all these qualities, but perhaps because of debut nerves she never quite consolidated the promise.

title: Martin Tananbaurn Is Named As Key Figure in Bribe Case
description: The late Martin Tanenbaum, who was president of Yonkers Raceway and long a powerful figure in Democratic party circles, was named here yesterday as the big man behind an Albany businessman who was accused of trying to bribe three Assemblymen to vote for legislation that would greatly benefit harness tracks.

title: Cargo Container Thefts in Port Reported Cut to Five in 1971
description: The Port Security Council said yesterday that cargo container thefts from New York and New Jersey pier areas were cut last year to a total of live with a value of about $250,000.

title: URBAN INDIANS FORM UNIT FOR EQUALITY
description: OMAHA, Neb. March 6 (UPI)  Urban American Indians united nationally for the first time yesterday to begin a drive for equality.

title: Books of The Times
description: The late Delmore Schwartz once told me that Andre Gide is supposed to have said on his deathbed: Before you quote me, make, sure I'm conscious. I don't know whether Delmore was putting me on or not, but it would have been like the. fastidiods Gide to worry about something like that; to imagine the assembled friends and critics preserving a bit of gibberish that bubbled up from delirium and passing it on as his apostrophe to posterity;

title: Statecraft Demands Imagination
description: CAMBRIDGE, MassLet us assume that despite its complexities and perils, the world of tomorrow will lend itself to a balance of power policy between five main, actorsiluid to a skillful and restrained American diplomacy aimed at building a stable, flexible world order around these powers. It is not clear, despite official explanations, that the Nikon Administration really wishes to practice what it praises.

title: Stock Indexes Soar In Heavy Trading
description: The stock market racked up another big gain yesterday in heavy trading.

title: Dollar Under Pressure
description: LONDON, March 6 (UPI) Moves to develop a strong and unified Common Market currency brought the dollar under renewed pressure in hectic trading on European, foreigncurrency exchanges today.

title: City Health Chief Urges Controls on Hospital Cost
description: Gordon Chase, the city's Health Services Administrator, called yesterday for enactment of tough state legislation to bring rising costs of hospitalcare under strict control.

title: Accord in Pakistan Averts Danger of Pathan Uprising
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Mardh 6President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto reached an accord today with the leader of his most important political opposition, who said the settlement averted a confrontation that would have been disastrous for, the nation.

title: SCANDAL IS FOUND IN SOVIET GEORGIA
description: MOSCOW, March 6Soviet Georgia, hit by a major new scandal involving an illegal private enterprise network run by an underground millionaire was accused by the Kremlin today of lax ideological and economic ways, signaling a crackdown.

title: ROBERT GOMERSALL
description: Robert Gomersall, who retired in 1958 as supervisor of export product distribution for the overseas operations division of General Motors in New York, died Sunday in Jewish Memorial Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at 735 West 172d Street.

title: I.T.T. Case: a Familiar Scenario
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 The current case involving the Intornational Telephone and Telegraph COrporation is only the latest in a long series in which there have been charges that improper influence was exerted to achieve outofcourt settlements of antitrust suits.

title: Debate Without Winner
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., March 6Every four years since 1960, Presidential candidates have engaged in debate about debates. If only televised confrontations could be arranged, the electorate is assured, the illfinanced little guy could beat, the machine; the real issues could be set before the public and a serious dialogue could begin. It almost never works out that way. The underdogs stay under, and issues stay subordinate to personalities.

title: Injury Puts Fregosi Out a Month
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 6The New York Mets learned today that Jim Fregosifor whom they traded four players this winterhad broken his right thumb and probably would miss the rust of spring training,

title: Vote Ordered at McDonnell
description: ST, LOUIS, March 6 (AP)The National Labor Relations Board has ordered a representation election for about 10,000 employes at the McDonnell Douglas Corporation aerospace plant here. Petitions have been submitted. by Technical Employes of Aerospace Manufacturers for an election to challenge the Machinists Union for representation.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: COMPUTER For that lunchhour break when it is good to get out on the street after working with people all morning, you can take your pleasure with machines, a whole room full of them in A Computer Perspective, the yearold exhibition on the ground floor of the IBM Building at Madison Avenue and 57th Street. This very serious and carefully researched survey of how computers grew and grew and what they can do today is open Monday through Friday, 10 to 5.

title: The Six Days, of Mr. Bhutto
description: Ina breathtaking display of political virtuosity, President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto has taken, three bold steps within six days that strengthen the prospects for stability in Pakistan and peace on the subcontinent:

title: Brubeck Night Held at Carnegie Hall
description: It was Brubeck Family Night at Carnegie Hall on Sunday evening.

title: U.N. Panel on Stockholm Conference Boycotted
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 6  The Soviet Union and Czechoslovakia boycotted the opening today of the final United Nations preparatory session for the global environ mental conference to be held in Stockholm in June.

title: Market Place: Street Weighing New Hartz Deal
description: You say you don't know the Hartz Mountain Products Corporation? Well then chances are you just aren't a canary fancier, since the company has long been a ma jor supplier of, bird seed and things with which canaries like to feather their nests.

title: The House Traffic Cop William Meyers Colmer
description: WASHINGTON, March 6As the parliamentary traffic cop of the House of Representatives, William Meyers Colmer of Mississippi, the chairman of the House Rules Committee, has suffered from a split public image. To many of the academic critics of Congress, the 82yearold Congressman is the epitome of the entrenched Southern conservative who rose to power by virtue only of seniority and then used his power to thwart the majority in the House. To most of his colleagues, including liberals, however, the courtly Mr. Colmer is a gracious, honorable man who seldom if ever has wielded his power as chairman of the Rules Committee to block legislation from reaching the House floor.

title: Nations Meet to Strengthen International Drug Accord
description: GENEVA, March 6 Delegates from more than 60 countries started work today on changes intended to strengthen the principal international instrument for the control of narcotic drugs, known as the 1961 single convention.

title: 2 ExPolicenien Sentenced To Jail on Bribery Charge
description: Two former policemen were sentenced to a year in jail yesterday for soliciting a $5,000 bribe from Montgomery Ward, Inc.

title: Ethel H. Wise, Welfare Leader, Correction Board Head, Dead
description: Ethel H. Wise, a welfare leader who served as chairman of the Board of Correction in 1965 under appointment of, Mayor Robert F. Wagner, died Sunday in Lenox Hill Hospital. She was 69 years old and lived in the Lowell Hotel.

title: Twins Trounce Yankees, 101
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 6Much to Fred Beene's surprise, it didn't rain, the team bus didn't break down and Tinker Field didn't burn down.

title: Latter to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Elias Schwartzbart blithely suggests that a fundamental land reform program financed by the United States (like that begun in South Vietnam but bigger, better and quicker) will win us the allegiance: of the Cambodian and Laotian peasantry and hasten our withdrawal [letter March 1] The limits of U.S. power in complex situations have been adequately demonstrated the last ten years or so we need no more grandiose designs but humility.

title: I.B.E.C. Names Officer
description: Leo E. Denlea Jr., former division vice president, has been appointed group vice president of the financial services group of the International Basic Economy Corporation, it was announced yesterday by Rodman C. Rockefeller, president and chief executive.

title: Maine to Curb Hunters
description: AUGUSTA, Me., March 6 (AP) Starting May 1, hunters will be banned from all state parks and land under the jurisdiction of the Department of Parks and Recreation. The move is one of the steps being taken to help restore the state's depleted deer herd.

title: GOLDPRICE HEARINGS ENDED BY HOUSE UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, March 6The House Banking Committee completed its hearings today on the legislation formally devaluing the dollar, by increasing the official price of gold from $35 to $38 an ounce, without hearing from organized labor.

title: PAY BOARD MODIFIES OHIO WAGE INCREASE
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP) The Pay Board modified tonight Ohio's request to allow 10.6 per cent pay increase for 56,000 state employes.

title: Senate, 62 to 10, Votes Job Bias Compromise
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP)The Senate passed today, 62 to 10, the compromise bill giving enforcement powers for the first time to the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission to move against job discrimination,

title: Halaby of Pan American Gets Medal From V.F.W.
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 Najeeb E. Halaby, chairman of Pan American World Airways, received the Veterans of Foreign Wars Gold Medal of Merit today.

title: British Are Taking Rift With Iceland To Court in Hague
description: LONDON March 6 (Reuters)Britain has decided to refer to the International Court of Justice her dispute with Iceland over a proposal to extend Icelandic fishery limits to 50 nautical miles from 12 on Sept. 1.

title: City Ethnic Survey Is renter of Dispute
description: An ethnic survey being conducted by the Lindsay administration to determine the sex, race and ethnic origin of the city's 400,000 employes has touched off a complex controversy involving questions of privacy, job discrimination, the merit system and the quest for social justice.

title: Lefty Clark Is Dead at 69; A Dodgers Pitcher Coach
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., March 6  William Watson (Lefty) Clark, former Brooklyn Dodgers pitcher, died Saturday at the age of 69.

title: Letter to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The valueadded tax now under active consideration by the Nixon Administration is, even as taxes go, a bad tax. Although it is to be impOsed on builness, the tax is expected to be passed on eventually to the consumer. If implemented, it will become In effect a national sales tax. with all the regressive features of such a tax.

title: M'CRORY AGREES TO BUY NEWBERRY
description: In one of the largest retail industry consolidations in some time, the McCrory Corporation and the J. J. Newberry Company announced yesterday that they have agreed in principle on a merger. The proposed combination, which would require approval by shareholders of both companies, would create a $1.3billion retail complex.

title: Latter to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The catastrophe in Logan Coupty, W. Va., was predicted, FOr the last ten, years we have been warningof the dangers of slag piles, which emit sulphurdioxide fumes and cause illness among women, and Children of the coal mining communities We know this to he a cause of chemical bronchitis and pneurnonitis which is almost impossible, to treat. This may be the reason for our very: high death rate among children. in our, state. We have issued a warning that we :would have a problem similar to the one in Aberfam, Wales, England, in which 116 children were killed.

title: Times Reporter Arrested
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., March 6Earl Caldwell, a correspondent of The New York Times, was arrested on a charge of possession of marijuana today by Santa Clara County sheriff's deputies outside the courtroom where Angela Davis is on trial.

title: RYUN'S PROBLEM: NO CONFIDENCE
description: The man who knows Jim Ryun best said yesterday that the world recordholder in the mile has lost his confidence as a runner.

title: Clorox Announces Bid for Acquisition Of MartinBrower
description: The Clorox Company announced yesterday that it had agreed in principle to acquire the business and assets of the MartinBrower Corporation of Chicago through an exchange of common shares valued at about $48million.

title: SCHOOLYEAR BILL LOSES AT ALBANY
description: ALBANY, March 6  A bill that would have created a continuous learning year with schools open and children attending classes during the entire year, was defeated today in the Assembly, 104 to 29.

title: Cost of Ending Lead Peril In Paint Put at $14.BiIlion
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP) The Senate Health subcommittee was told today that the cost of removing the lead paint hazard from all currently hazardous housing units could be as high as $14billion and perhaps even higher.

title: Mrs. Vosters Duo Wins
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 6The motherdaughter team of Mrs. Francis Vosters and Mrs. Halsey Spruance of Wilmington, Del., reached the quarterfinals of the national squash racquets women's doubles championship today by defeating Mrs. Woolsey Gilbert and Mrs. William Shettle of Philadelphia, 157, 1511.

title: Advertising:
