description: Barnett, Zlotnick, Inc., which opened less than six months ago with three accounts and less than $1million in billings, has just moved into a larger office. It now has nine accounts and $4,185,000 in billings. All but one of the accounts, however, are being handled on a fee.

title: COMMON MARKET IN MONEY TALKS
description: BRUSSELS, March 8  The Common Market's drive toward eventual currency union progreased faster today, as differences were narrowed by the community's members, spurred by FrenchGerman compromises and the challenge of inconvertible and excessive United States dollars.

title: New Australian Mission in Hong Kong to Woo Peking
description: SYDNEY Australia March Prime Minister William McMahon has declared that Australia will seek to broaden relations with mainland China through a new diplomatic mission to be established by this country in Hong Kong:

title: FROZEN DELIGHT WINS AT BOWIE
description: BOWIE, Md., March 6 (UPI)Frozen Delight ended a long losing streak with a threequarter length victory in the $7,000 allowance feature race at seven furlongs today at Bowie Race Course.

title: Peter Simon Play to Bow
description: In case of Accident, a new play by Peter Simon, will be presented at the Eastside Playhouse, 334 East 74th Street, beginning March 27 by William Carver. The cast will include Patricia Elliott, Henderson Forsythe, Terry Kiser and Michael Shannon.

title: Woman, 77, Who Refused Surgery, Dies in Milwaukee
description: MILWAUKEE, March 6 Mrs. Gertrude Raasch, whose decision to refuse an operation was upheld by a county judge six weeks ago, died today.

title: I.C.C. TURNS DOWN RAIL FREIGHT RISE
description: The Interstate Commerce Commission rejected yesterday a request of the railroads to impose general freightrate increases April 1 on a selective basis averaging about 4.1 percents, which would gave grossed the rails about $500million if fully applied.

title: HIRING BIAS CHARGED IN PHONE COMPANY
description: The State Attorney General's office filed a complaint with the State Division of Human Rights yesterday charging the New York Telephone Company with discriminating against women in its employ.

title: A Conspiracy to Eliminate Returnable Bottles Charged
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP) Supermarkets, bottlers and soft drink manufacturers have combined forces in an effort to eliminate returnable bottles, the Senate Environment Subcommittee was told today.

title: Miss Hirabayashi Strings Her Dan6es With Fragile Line
description: The thread of Kazuko Hirabayashi's choreography is so fragile that it would break in any less skilled hands than those of her welltrained company. With them it keeps its tenuous continuity. On Sunday evening at Japan House she presented three works including the new Legend.

title: 7 to 8% Sales Gain Is Seen for Boys'
description: Every five years you have a new market out there and this year there's more variety in the merchandise than there has been in a long time.

title: Rome Court Suspends Trial Of 12 in 69 Bombings Case
description: ROME March 6A trial here connected with a series of terrorist bombings in December 1969 was suspended tonight when the court ruled that proreedings must be held in Milan.

title: Latter to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In a recent interview with your paper regarding Northern Ireland, Prime. Minister Heath referred to Irish history 400 years ago and completely ignored the. Britishgerrymandered and unnatural partition of Ireland and Ulster in 1921.

title: William and Mary Lecturer Is Named Dean at Hamilton
description: CLINTON, N. Y., March 6 (AP)  Stephen G, Kurtz, a Buffalo. native who is on the faculty of the College of William and Mary, has been named dean of Hamilton College effective July 1.

title: Airlift of Cubans to Resume
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP) The State Department said today that the Cuban refugee airlift flights, suspended since Jan. 19, will resume for at least five days starting next Monday.

title: 2 Bridges Approved For Housing
description: The City Planning Commission approved yesterday a revised urban renewal plan for the Two Bridges area in Lower Manhattan that will convert a 10 block section into three superblocks.

title: Capital Director Wins Award
description: Zelda Fichandler, cofounder and producing director of the Arena Stage in Washington, has been named the winner of the 1971 Margo Jones Award. The award is made annually to the professional producer a.nd theater that has made the most significant contribution to the dramatic art through the presentation of new plays. It carries a cash prize of $500, and a commemorative medallion.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION UP BY 2% FOR WEEK
description: Steel production in the week ended March 4 rose by 2 per cent, to 2,487,000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This compared with 2,439,000 tons poured the week before.

title: Notes on People
description: The appointment of Charles P. Whitlock as dean of Harvard College was announced by Derek C. Bolt, president of Harvard University. Dean Whitlock, who had been serving as acting dean, is a lecturer on social psychology who for more than 20 years has taught a series of Harvard courses dealing with interpersonal relations. The 52yearom educator will continue as chairman of the administrative board of Harvard and Radcliffe Colleges.

title: Advertising:
description: In recent years the number of advertising agencies that also offer a publicrelations capability has been dwindling.

title: Brain Cell Energy Found Curbed by Hexachlorophene
description: Two Bronx biochemists have found that the antibacterial chemical hexachlorophene interferes with the ability of brain cells to produce the energy they need to function properly.

title: LIBYA IS SAID TO BUY ARMS FOR EGYPTIANS
description: BEIRUT Lebanon March 6A newspaper here quoted reliable Arab diplomatic sources today to the effect that Libya and the Soviet Union had concluded an arms deal under which the Libyans were to buy advanced Soviet offensive weapons for eventual delivery, to Egypt.

title: Study Reports a Public Mistrust of Government
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP)A study by the American Institute for Political Communication issued today concludes that there is a serious credibility problem among government and the press and the public and says that both the government and press help create it.

title: U.S. OUTLINES All IN ANTIDRUG FIGHT
description: Myles J. Ambrose, the new Special Assistant Attorney General appointed by President Nixon to combat heroin pushers at the street level, said yesterday that one goal of his undertaking will be to drive addicts off the streets and into treatment programs.

title: Murphy Will Begin Shifts Of Police Within a Month
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said yesterday that he would begin shifting the work schedules of patrolmen within the next month.

title: CORPORATE BONDS ADVANCE IN PRICE
description: Prices of corporate and taxexempt bonds rose slightly yesterday in light trading activity; Government bonds declined little.

title: Appeal on Prisons Blocked
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (UPI)  Without comment, the Supreme Court let stand today a lower court ruling that state prison officials may be sued by inmates for mistreatment or arbitrary punishment in the absence of a fair hearing.

title: LAUGHIN CREATOR WILL DO COSBY SHOW
description: George Schlatter, creator and producer of the longrunning National Broadcasting Company hit, LaughIn, will produce The Bill Cosby Show on the Columbia Broadcasting System next season.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Climb at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, March 6Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Eastern Junior Skiers Win Mixed CrossCountry Relay
description: HANCOCK, Vt., March 6The host Eastern Amateur Ski Association squad won the mixed relay crosscountry race today in the opening round of the national junior Nordic ski championships at the Middlebury College Snow Bowl.

title: Vaughn Approved as Dean
description: TALLAHASSE, Fla., March 6 (UPI)Jack Hood Vaughn, former director of the Peace Corps, was approved today as dean of international affairs at Florida International University by the State Board of Regents. Mr. Vaughn also will be director of the Center for International Affairs at the Miami school.

title: Three Persons Die as Blasts Wreck Plant Near Chicago
description: CHICAGO, March 6 (IJPI)A series of explosions, today reduced a big suburban fireworks plant into twisted, rubble, killing at least three persons.

title: Draft Calls to Resume With 5,000 a Month
description: WASHINGTON, March 6Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird announced today that draft calls for the second quarter of the year would average about 5,000 men a month.

title: Naval Academy Ousts 7 for Using Marijuana
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., March 6 (AP)  The United States Naval Academy announced today that it had expelled seven midshipmen, including two seniors, for the use of marijuana,

title: Utility Sets Record
description: The Continental Telephone Corporation, yesterday reported new highs in revenues, sales and earnings for 1971'. Charles Wohistetter, chairman and chief executive officer, noted that new highs had been set every year since the company was founded in 1961.

title: Nicklaus Wins by Two Shots
description: MIAMI, March 6On a day classified as cloudy but one that was bright and cheerful for him, Jack Nicklaus won the Doral Eastern open today by two strokes and became golf's alltime leading money winner. With a twounderpar 70 in his fourth round for a 72hole total of 276 over the Doral Country Club course, the 32yearold Nicklaus added $30,000 to his winnings and passed Arnold Palmer as the game's biggest cash earner.

title: Bridge: Budd Team liarrow Victor In Greater New York Play
description: An exciting finish, in which five teams had chances of victory going into the final round, marked the Greater New York Bridge Association's Swiss team championship at the New York Hilton during the weekend. The winners, with a total of 160 victory points of a possible 240, were Richard Budd of North Caldwell, N. J.; Harry Stappenbeck of Uniondale, L. L; Mrs. Dorothy. Hayden and Alan Truscott of New York.

title: Letter to the Editor
description: To the Editor: William V. Shannon in his Feb. 28 colunin Of Hope and Fear begins writing an analysis of the chances of the Democratic candidates and winds up with an editorial in favor of Senator Muskie. Senator Jackson he finds too Hobbesian, Senator McGovern the candidate of hope while Senator Muskie is centrist, which one might assume is just the right mixture of emotion a candidate should have blended into his psyche.

title: Actors Studio Opening Its Doors to General Audience
Drive Reported Repelled
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 6 (AP)  A Laotian Government drive around the Plaine des Jarres in northern Laos has reportedly been called off after encountering increasing counterattacks by North Vietnamese forces.

title: Doctor Testifies Lobbyist Suffered Mental Lapses
Suit Filed in Rape in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (Reuters)A 19yearold student filed a $5million damage suit today against George Washington University, where she was raped last month. She charged that the university was negligent in leaving open the door of an auditorium, which enabled her attacker to drag her inside late at night. The suit also names a university security guard, Charles B. Finney, 61 years old, who is alleged to have witnessed the attack but did nothing about it.

title: Secretary Image. A Tempestin a Typewriter
description: SECRETARY (n.)Gumchewing sex kitten; husband hunter; miniskirted dingaling; slowwitted pencil pusher; office gofer"; reliable old shoe.

title: Bus Strike in Jersey Is Aggravated  As State Fails to Open ParkRide Lot
description: NEARK, March 6  Efforts to open the large parkand ride lot at Route 3 near the Lincoln Tunnel and to provide bus service from there into the Port Authority's midtown Manhattan bus terminal has been stymied by union opposition, according to a spokesman for the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners.

title: Meredith Begins March
description: JACKSON, Miss., March 6 (UPI)James L. Meredith, the first black to enroll at the University of Mississippi, set out from heer on foot today for a journey that he said would take him 900 miles through 37 Mississippi counties. The 39yearold civil rights activist, an announced opponent of Senator James 0. Eastland in this year's elections, said the march had the twofold purpose of opening his campaign for the Senate and opening a voter registration drive among young blacks.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla., March 6 (UPI)  The Texas Rangers scored six runs in the first inning on three hits, four walks, an error and a sacrifice fly today and went on to defeat the Chicago White Sox, 114.

title: Two Others Accept Bids
description: The National Invitation Tournament selection committee completed half of its 16team field yesterday with the naming of Princeton, St. Joseph's of Philadelphia and the University of Texas, El Paso, all second place finishers in their conferences. Previously, St. John's, Fordham, Niagara, Syracuse and :Jacksonville had been named to the basketball tourney, which starts March 17 at Madison Square Garden.

title: City Plea to, State For $800Million Called Incredible
description: ALBANY, March 6 The State's Budget Director, Richard L. Dunham, said bluntly today that the Lindsay Lion's claim that an extra $800million in state aid, could be provided without an increase in state taxes through a form of deficit financing, WaS as incredible a notion as has eerie to my attention this year.

title: 85 Finance Officers See Monetary Risks
description: LONDON, March 6Corporatefinance officers who must juggle holdings in half a dozen currencies agreed at the opening of a threeday conference today that careful management might minimize their risks but that no set procedures could protect them from all the swings in today's turbulent foreignexchange markets.

title: Actors in Play About Prison Are Jailed on Drug Charges
description: FLORHAM PARK, N. J., March6 (AP)  Three young California actors who came here to stage a play about prison conditions ended up in jail yesterday.

title: U.S.Brazilian Fishing Pact
description: BRASILIA, March 6 (Reuters)United States and Brazilian representatives reached agreement here today on fishing rights within the 200mile territorial limit claimed by Brazil. Details of the agreement wee not disclosed.

title: Six Boys Charged With Slaying Of Youth on IRT Over a Nickel
description: Six boyseach described by the police as being small as a sneeze"were charged yesterday with the fatal stabbing of a 14yearold on a subway platfonn a week ago Sunday over a nickle.

title: Course Shift for Pioneer 10
description: PASADENA, Calif., March 6 (UPI)The course of the Jupiterbound Pioneer 10 spacecraft will be altered slightly tomorrow to put the probe on target. The maneuver will come five days after the launching of Pioneer 10 from Cape Kennedy on its 22month journey to Jupiter.

title: 3 JURORS CHOSEN FOR ANGELA DAVIS
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., March. 6 (UPI) Defense and prosecution attorneys tentatively seated three jurors, all women, today for Angela Davis's murder trial.

title: Supreme Court Refuses 72 To Rule on Vietnam War
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP) The Supreme Court today refused 7 to 2 to rule on whether the Vietnam war was constitutional, an action it has repeated at least half a dozen times each year since 1967.

title: Prison Reports Discounted.
description: SOMERS, Conn., March 6 (UPI)  State Correction Commissioner John R. Manson told legislative investigators today that outside activist groups were putting out false information about conditions at the Sothers State Prison here.

title: Warner Bros. Officer Quits
description: Norman B. Katz, executive vice president and chief executive officer of Warner Bros. International, has resigned because of philosophical differences in the operation of the foreign distribution program, it was anounced by Ted Ashley, chairman and chief executive of Warner Bros., Inc. Mr. Katz, in his position since 1967, had held a similar post with Seven Arts from 1954.

title: ALBANY STUDYING BILL TO OVERHAUL WAGERS ON RACES
description: ALBANY, March 6  Governor Rockefeller and leaders of the Legislature are studying a voluminous bill drafted by the NeW York Racing Association that would drastically overhaul the state's racing laws by consolidating the state's track and offtrack bettingcommissions and by absorbing New York City's Offtrack Betting Corporation.

title: French Report the Seizure Of 321 Pounds of Morphine
description: NICE, France, March 6 (AP)  French customs officers said today that they had seized 321 pounds of morphine from a car at the Italian border yesterday and had arrested a man with a diplomatic passport that identified him as a noted Turkish figure. But he was not identified. The seizure was described as one of the biggest of its kind.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 6Here is your handy guide to understanding what the New Hampshire election results really, mean. Keep it by, your side Tuesday night while listening to returns, along with a large dose of bromide:

title: Revolt of the Robots
description: The strike of young General Motors workers that has shut down the world's fastest assembly line is a symptom of, widespread rankandfile rebellion against the dehumanizing effects of automation.

title: Guerrillas in Malaysia in Action Again
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia The Communist insurgents of West Malaysia are making comeback after a decade of quiet rebuilding in sanctuaries in southern Thailand.

title: Freight Certificate Set
description: The Express Company, Inc., a subsidiary of REA Express, announced yesterday that it had been awarded an international air freight forwarding certificate, effective April 3.

title: Princeton to Close a Week
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 6 (AP)The Princeton University faculty voted 89 to 87 today to shut down the university from Oct. 29 to Nov. 8 before this year's Presidential elections to enable students to participate in the election campaign.

title: WASTE BILL VOTED BY JERSEY OM
description: TRENTON, March 6A Cahill administration measure that would empower the state to make industries clean up their wastes before emptying them into public sewer systems was overwhelmingly approved today by the State Senate.

title: A Man You Could Go To
description: In a magazine article last year wrote that among America's state prison guards there is a small but growing cadre of highly motivated, welleducated, bright young men who are the hope for the future as far as meaningful prison reforni is concerned, men who are dissatisfied with the record of the past and with have earned for themselves what the oldtimers, the hardhead guards, tonld never earnthe support Mid respect of the prisoners.

title: A MIG Is Reported Shot Down By U.S. Jets in North Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Mardi 6 (AP)Nearly a dozen United States fighter planes and MIG interceptors battled over North Vietnam today. American pilots reported downing one MIG in an exchange of at least eight airtoair missiles.

title: SCHOOL FINANCING BY STATES URGED IN FEDERAL STUDY
P. EMMETT TONER, 63, STATEN ISLAND AIDE
description: P. Emmett Toner, counsel to the Public Administrator of Richmond County, died Sunday In St. Vincent's Hospital, West New Brighton, S.I., after a long illness. He was 63 years old and lived at 8 Cromwell Circle, Dongan Hills, S.I.

title: Parochial Schools Aid Is Ruled Out in Vermont
description: MONTPELIER Vt., March 6Vermont's yearold parochial school aid law was declared unconstitutional today by a special panel of Federal judges.

title: Waldheim of U.N. Is in Africa for Talks on Disputed Area
description: JOHANNESBURG South Africa March 6  Secretary General Waldheim began talks with the Government here today on the question of South Africa's continued control over the disputed territory of SouthWest Africa.

title: German Education Torn by Frustration Over Reforms
description: MARBURG West GermanyThe schools and universities in West Germany are in a state of greater chaos than existed at any time since freedom was restored to them at the end of World War II after the Nazis were crushed.

title: HOOVER'S IMPACT ON PLOT RELATED
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 6 The Government's chief witness in the conspiracy trial of the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and six other antiwar activists testified today that J. Edgar Hoover's disclosure of the alleged plot had caused it to be hastily abandoned.

title: New Williams Play Due
description: Tennessee Williams's new play, Small Craft Warnings, which was formerly titled Confessional, will open at the Truck and Warehouse Theater, 79 East Fourth Street, on April 2. The cast includes Hel ena Carroll, Cherry Davis, David Hooks, William Hickey, Alan Maxon and Gene Fanning. Robert D. Currie, Mario De Maria and William Orton are the producers,

title: Arthur Daley
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 6While Baltimore Colt football fans nervously wait to see if the other shoe will really drop, Tampa's pushy pigskin promoters unashamedly hope that it will. They even are ready to clutch it in tender embrace, cleats and all, in the event that the Maryland metropolis fails to keep a tight grip on its franchise.

title: NILES R. BECKER, 89; AN EXOFFICIAL HERE
description: Niles R. Becker, who retired in 1955 as Deputy Motor Vehicle Commissioner for New York City and who had served as secretary of the State Republican Committee from 1946 to 1950, died Sunday in Orleans, Mass. He was 89 years old and lived ht 243 West 70th Street.

title: POTATO FUTURES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Prices of potato futures hit new lifeofcontract lows yesterday on the New York Mercantile Exchange because, potato traders said, the Agriculture Department has refused to divert fertile potato acreage in Minnesota and North Dakota to livestock feed.

title: Insurers'
description: Combined assets of the Atlantic Mutual Insurance Company and the Continental Insurance Company rose last year to $224.1million from $204.4million a year earlier, David A. Floreen, chairman, said yesterday. The New York insurers are members of the Atlantic Companies group.

title: Federal Abortion Law Is Urged by Lindsay
LAIRD SAYS SOVIET DEPLOYS WARHEAD
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird declared today that the Soviet Union was deploying at the present time multiple warheads on its intercontinental ballistic missiles.

title: Blacks Protest at Harvard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 6 (AP)Five hundred black crosses were placed in the snow in Harvard Yard today to protest Harvard University's ownership of stock in the Gulf Oil Company, the largest American investor in Portugueseheld Africa. Members of the PanAfrican Liberation Committee and the Harvard Radcliffe Association of African and AfroAmerican Students said the crosses represented blacks who died at the hands of the Portuguese in Angola, Mozambique and GuineaBisseau during the last two years.

title: Next Chief Rabbi a Vital Issue for Israel
description: TEL AVIV March 6Two secularists with personal stakes in the outcome of the forthcoming Israeli rabbinical election are Hanoch and Miriam Lange, a brother and sister. They have been labeled bastards by a rabbinical court, which makes them ineligible for marriage.

title: East Indoor Track Today
description: Many of the top scholastic track and field stars from. the Middle Atlantic and New England areas will compete today in the Eastern States Indoor Championships at the 102d Engineers Armory on West 168th Street. The shotput will open the program at 2:45 P.M. There will be several events for freshmen and sophomore athletes prior to the championship running events, which will start at 5:15 P.M.

title: Mr. Hebert's Blacklist
description: The roster of thirteen colleges and universities which have withdrawn from, the Reserve Officers, Training Corps program includes some of the most distinguished, institutions of higher learning. There can be, legitimate disagreement over the place of R.O.T.C. on a campps and particularly over the manner in which these programs were terminated under the duress of the radical student movement; But there can be no question that the final decision, on this matter; rests properly with the universities, which must be free to define their own relationship with the military.

title: Franco Granddaughter's Wedding Nears
description: MADRID, March 6 It will be a magnifiCent chaos, a Cabinet minister predicted the other day about the wedding next Wednesday of Generalissimo Franco's eldest granddaughter. to Don. Alfonso de Borben y Dampierre, a grandson of Spain's late King, Alfonso. XIII.

title: Pete Maravich's Father Ousted as L.S.U. Coach
description: EATON ROUGE, March 6 (UPI)Press Maravich, who built a nationally recognized basketball program around his son, Pete, and watched it slide after his departure, was dismissed today as coach at Louisiana State University.

title: Mileti Buys Indians; Price: $9Million
description: A hometown group headed by Nick J. Mileti has agreed to buy the Cleveland Indians for $9million from Vernon Stouffer and keep the 71yearold baseball team, a charter member of the American League, in the Ohio city.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following Spot primary prices for the week ended Feb. 29:

title: Measles Epidemic on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, March 6 (UPI) A measles epidemic was declared officially today in Los Angeles County and clinics were set up to immunize youngsters. Dr. Gerold Heldbreder, county health officer, said 91 new cases of measles were reported last week, bringing the year's total to 290.

title: Black Newspaper Is Offered
description: The Daily Challenge, a new morning daily catering to the black community, sold its first editions yesterday for 15 cents a copy. Besides carrying columns and features of special interest to blacks, the paper will carry news and photo services from United Press International and news and features from the Third World Media News reporting daily activities of blacks throughout the world.

title: Spanish Cardinal Strikes Back at the Conservatives
description: MADRID March 6Armed with a personal message from Pope Paul VI and a letter from the Vatican's Secretary of State, the president of the Spanish Bishops Conference struck back hard today against a. conservative campaign to halt or slow the reform of the Roman Catholic Church in Spain.

title: IN THE NATION
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 6California's Attorney General, Evelle Younger, has now opened a, legal battle to overcome the recent state Supreme Court ruling that the.death penalty may no longer be imposed in California. The Attorney General. has asked the state. court for.a rehearing; failing that, he says, he'll take the case to the Supreme Court in Washington.

title: NoHo's Illegal Residents Seeking Protection of Law
description: Across from SoHo, the specially zoned and thriving artists district south of Houston Street, there is a stirring in NoHo.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The General Electric Company has received a multiyear Army contract with an estimated value of $97.6million to design, develop and qualify engines for a new transport helicopter, it was announced yesterday.

title: Nixon MeetsTaipei Envoy
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP) President Nixon, apparently hoping to allay fears that he undermined Taiwan's position in his talks with Ohinese leaders held an unannounced meeting tonight with Taiwan's Ambassador James C. H. Shen.

title: Soviet Reports Drilling For Oil on Arctic Island
description: MOSCOW, March 6Soviet oilmen, pressing ever farther into the polar regions, reported today that they had started an exploration well on an island in the Arctic Ocean in the hope of tapping reputedly huge petroleum resources under the continental shelf off the Soviet Union's north coast.

title: 3d Place in '71 Forfeited
description: Western Kentucky University became yesterday the second team to forfeit a high finish in the 1971 National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament after the school's officials were convinced that Jim McDaniels, the player who I led the Hilltoppers to third :place in the championship, had signed a professional contract; in November, 1970,

title: British Sound Alert in Death Of Five Fed Intravenously
description: LONDON, March 6 (Reuters) Medical authorities tonight sounded a nationwide alert after the deaths of five patients who were all fed intravenously with a dextrose solution at a hospital at Plymouth in southwest England.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Grounded Oil Tanker Is Refloated on L.I.

title: Hammermilt Paper To Increase Prices
description: Price increases covering various paper, metal and chemical products were announced by several companies yesterday.

title: WALKOUTS CLOSE 2 RELIEF CENTERS
description: Several hundred employes walked out of two Bronx welfare centers yesterday after lye was thrown in a supervisor's face by a client in one center, and another center was occupied by 600 clients complaining that they had not received scheduled checks.

title: G.M.'S VEGA PLANT CLOSED BY STRIKE
description: LORDSTOWN, Ohio, March 6The plant where General Motors has placed its hopes of meeting foreign competition was closed today by striking workers who contend that management is forcing them to work too hard and too fast in an effort to cut costs.

title: Rise in Outlays Forecast
description: WASHINGTON, March 6Confirming earlier private surveys, the Government reported today that. business planned to increase its investment in plant and equipment this year by 10.5 per cent, more than projected three months; ago.

title: Muskie First, Kennedy 2d In a Rhode Island Survey
Manchester United Signs Soccer Star for $520,000
description: LONDON, March 6 (AP)The Manchester United soccer team signed Ian Moore for a reported $520,000 tonight, completing a threeteam transfer tangle.

title: 2 in Tombs Refuse to Go to Their Trial
description: Two brothers who have been detained at the Manhattan House of Detention for Men for more than a year on robbery charges refused yesterday to leave for a courtroom where their trial was to begin.

title: Fluctuation Limited
description: BRUSSELS, March 7  Finance ministers of the European Common Market, as part of ambitious plans to establish a singlecurrency area in the net decade, decided today to begin narrowing, the margins of fluctuation of their currencies before July 1.

title: Sports Telethon in the Making: All 24 Hours of Le Mans Race.
description: Is it worth $20 or so to see the Twentyfour Hours of Le Mans on television? A group of LatinAmerican entrepreneurs will explore that question on June 10 and 11 with a live telecast for closedcircuit, showings in eight countriesthe United States Canada, Mexico, Japan, Australia, Brazil, Argentina and Venezuela. The organizers have no experience in motor racing, but they believe they can match the success they had in broadcasting the 1970 World Cup soccer matches from Mexico they say that closedcircuit show grossed $700,000 in New York alone.

title: Judas Maccabaeus Given in Entirety
description: Judas Maccabaeus, with such stirring arias as Sound an Alarm and magnificent choruses as See, the Conquering Hero Comes, is one of Handel's most famous oratories That it is not put on more frequently is probably due partially to the fact that the work Is also endowed with a fair number of less compelling segments, not to mention an extravagant length overall, The complete edition presented by !the Handel Society at Carnegie Hall Monday night took some 3 hours from Overture to Amen, and at least one lis tener Would have been content with an abridged version.

title: 2 Vice Chairmen Elected By Burlington Industries
description: Horace C. Jones and George L. Staff have been elected vice chairmen of Burlington Industries, Inc., the country's largest textiles manufacturer.

title: 4 More Years for Dooley
description: ATHENS, Ga., March 7 (UPI) Vince Dooley, who has guided the University of Georgia football team to 59244 wonlosttied record in eight years, has been given new fouryear contract.

title: Odets Revival: Echoes of the 1930's
description: Clifford Odets, acclaimed In the midthirties as a new dramatist of exciting possibilities for his plays of social unrest, is enjoying a postmortem revival as an exciting playwright of the early seventies for his plays of pSychological perception. They are the same plays, of Course, but they are being perceived with a different angle of vision.

title: FRENCH ITEMS BEST IN THOMPSON SONGS
description: Arthur Thompson, a baritone who was presented in his New York debut in 1967 by Young Concert Artists, returned for another appearance under that organization's sponsorship on Monday night. In a recital at Town Hall, Mr. Thompson was assisted by Elizabeth Wright, pianist, and a string quartet headed by Rolf Schulte.

title: Policy Change Denied
description: WASHINGTON, March 7A Pentagon spokesman said to day that he knew of no change in the policy of announcing the number of planes that take part in strikes in North Vietnam.

title: Red Smith
description: HIALEAH, Fla., March 7Finishing the day's work at 8 A.M., a set of horses left the race track and plodded down a muddy aisle between rows of Australian pines, the boys and girls on their backs chirruping and chattering. As they neared Barn I, a skittish horse plunged at them from the side, fighting his rider. Two or three in the set shied abruptly and Bobby Woodhouse, riding one of the Dr. Fagers, sang out: Watch the trees. Sometimes they jump in front of you. He brought a laugh from John Nerud, the unretiring trainer, who was following on a stable pony.

title: YACCINE PRODUCED IN HUMAN CELLS
description: For the first time, the Government has licensed a vaccine produced in human cells, a step that is expected to reduce the risk of contamination that is associated with animalderived vaccines.

title: New Gas Requests Barred
description: The Cities Service Gas Company, a subsidiary of the Cities Service Company, announced yesterday that it would deny any requests from distributor customers for new or increased natural gas supplies for large commercial customers. Effective immediately, the move was attributed, to continued increasing demands for gas coupled with the inadequacy of additional gas supplies being committed to interstate markets.

title: The Quarrys: A Family That Spars Together Is No.2
description: Mike and Jerry Quarry sparred three rounds in the Felt Forum yesterday as. Mike continued preparation for a 10round lightheavyweight bout Friday night in Madison Square Garden with Tommy Hicks.

title: Two Dogs Pass BombFinding Test Successfully
description: A Labrador retriever named Sally and a Gerinan shepherd named Brandy were the two heroes of the bomb section yesterday. And both are rookies.

title: CLARINET AND TAPE IN BYARS PROGRAM
description: The program pxasented by Janita Byars Monday night in Carnegie Recital Hall, each piece built around Miss Byars's Jive clarinet and recorded tape, would have been impossible a few years ago. By now however, there is quite a sizable repertory available for instruments and electronic accompaniment.

title: SPANISH CARDINAL BACKED BY BISHOPS
description: MADRID, March 8 (UPI)Spanish bishops today gave Vicente Cardinal Enrique y Tarancn, leader of the reform movement, a resounding vote of confidence and then called for the resignation of two highly placed Vatican conservatives who tried to weaken his position.

title: CONTROL EXCHANGED FOR EXECUTIVE JET
description: Controlling interest in Executive Jet Aviation, Inc., was transferred yesterday in Columbus, Ohio, from a Penn Central Transportation Company subsidiary to a management group headed by Bruce G. Sundlun, president of the business jet charter service.

title: Nixon Calls Coexistence Goal of His China Trip
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 (AP)  President Nixon said today that he had gone to China because he hoped to promote the proposition that peoples of different views can live together rather than die together.

title: 2 Commuter Trains Delayed
description: Engine trouble on two Central commuter trains Aast evening caused rush hour delays of up to 30 minutes on the 6:05 P.M. train for Brewsteteon the Harlem diviSion and ito 15 minutes on the 4:38 P.M. train for Danbury on the New Haven division.

title: KISSINGER DISCUSSES TRIP WITH BUCKLEY
description: WASHINGTON, March 7After an hour with Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's assistant for national security, Senator James L. Buckley said today that he was still concerned about the effects of Mr. Nixon's trip to China on allies in Asia.

title: Cambodians Retake Island
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, March 7 (UPI)  The Cambodian Army today recaptured a small but commercially important island in the Mekong River 50 miles northeast of Pnompenh after losing 15 killed and 63 wounded in 10 days, the military command said.

title: ETHNIC MUST SET FOR 19 STATE JOBS
description: The State Civil Service Department has made black or Spanish ethnic identification a prerequisite for applicants for 19 jobs as state prison counselors.

title: Samuels to Resist TakeOver Of OTB by Racing Interests
description: ALBANY, March 7Howard J. Samuels, president of New York City's Offtrack Betting Corporation, said today that he would fight any attempts to take over the city's lucrative betting operation and charged that members of.the racing industry were attempting to take the profits for themselVes.

title: Reserved Laotian Reaction
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 7 (Agence FrancePresse)  Mr. Green held a twohour meeting today with Premier Souvanna Phouma.

title: FINSEY"S THE DICK GUMSHOE'S THE FLICK
Outside Influences Mark Four Dances By Laura Veldhuis
description: Laura Veldhuis has obviously seen a great deal of other choreographers work that she has been unable to forget in doing her own. At the Cubiculo Monday evening, the four pieces on her company's program vied with one another in proclaiming their indebtedness to outside influences.

title: When a Bachdor Diplomat Is the Host
description: Giving all those parties that are expected of Heinrich Gleissner, the bachelor Austrian Consul General here, wouldn't be possible these days without the help of among others, the Baroness Alice DreihannHolenia.

title: Mobutu Gives an Ultimatum to Catholics
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, March 7 (Agence, FrancePresse)  President Mobutu Sese Seko issued an ultimatum to the Roman Catholic Church here today to accept his Africanization policy or face the closing down of seminaries and the prosecution of bishops and priests.

title: Bridge. Pays Off in Pairs Victory Gift Tour to Tournament
description: Many non bridge playing wives had the task at Christmas of finding suitable gifts for bridgeplaying husbands. The most expensive, appropriate and unselfish presents were surely those received by George Matheme of Douglaston, Queens, and Fred Atiyeh of New York roundtrip tickets and tournament entries enabling them to compete in the Mexican Regional Championships in February. This more than compensated, Malhame reports, for many years of striped ties and Argyle. socks.

title: Inclusion of China and France In Arms Talks Urged by Italy
description: GENEVA, March 7Italy urged other members of the Geneva disarmament conference today to join in issuing ,a unanimous, invitation to Chinaand France to participate in the negotiations as soon as possible.

title: For Assistant Coaches, Game Is Musical Chairs
description: Musical chairs among pro football's assistant coaches continued yesterday when Dick Voris joined the Detroit Lions after having quit the St. Louis & Cardinals on Monday to pursue other opportunities. The Cardinals then elevated Larry Wilson to the status of playercoach. Assistant coaphes are mostly anonymous but important people who make the pro football show go.

title: Schoonmaker 2d in Sailing
description: PUERTO AZUL, Venezuela, March 7 (AP)James Schoonmaker of the United States trailed the leader, Jeorg Bruder of Brazil, by 7 points over all today in the international Star Class Sailing. championships. Schoonmaker was fifth in. the second day of competition in his yacht Dingo for a total of 113 points.

title: Vintage Congressman
description: Representative William. M. Colmer's decision to retire from Congress will hardly be put down as premature. He is 82 and, as chairman of the House Rules Committee, one of the most powerful political figures in the American scheme of government. The irony is that he had decided to run again, his age, far from barring him from the chairmanship, would have been his chief qualification.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In watching the President's visit in China on television, many of us were grieved to see that Mr. Nixon had to speak through a Chinese interpreter. One cannot but wonder what happened to the American interpreters that Mr. Nixon had brought along with him. The use of interpreters provided by the other side is not only unusual in diplomatic practice but is fraught with perilous consequences.

title: MARATHON TO OFFER A MUSICAL EVENING
description: Contemporary American music will be the subject of the Brooklyn Philharmonic's third Marathon, which is to be held at the Brooklyn Academy of Music on Saturday from 6 P.M. to 10:30 P.M.

title: W. E. Hutton &
description: W. E. Hutton & Co. said yesterday that it achieved record business volume of $43,941,000 in 1971, thereby marking a substantial increase over the previous year. The brokerage concern did not release 1970 figures.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Regarding your Feb. 14 editorial Raped by the Law, I have twice sat on grand jury panels in New York City. Each time we considered bills of indictment in a number of rape cases, and each time I experienced the frustration of finding myself required to refuse an indictment because, under New York State law, there was insufficient evidence. Yet in just about every case there was all the evidence a rational person would require to be persuaded beyond a reasonable doubt that the alleged crime actually had taken place.

title: H. K. PORTER PLANS A TENDER OFFER
description: The H. K. Porter Company announced yesterday that it had filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission and with the Nicholson File Company a notice of its intention to make a tender offer for 437,000 common shares of Nicholson, at $42 a share. If all the shares are tendered, the transaction would be valued at $18,354,000. Nicholson has about 584,000 common shares outstanding. The tender offer will expire April 4, unless extended.

title: Finnegan Stops U.S. Boxer
description: LONDON, March 7 (AP)Chris Finnegan, the Europe'an lightheavyweight champion, stopped Jerry Evans of Byrdstown, Tenn., in the fifth round of their scheduled 10round fight tonight. The British boxer, 172 pounds, used his reach advantage to pummel Evans, 180, until the referee, Harry Gibbs, stopped the match after 1:45 of the round.

title: Wounded Packer IsFair
description: MEMPHIS, March 7 (UPI)Bob Brown, defensive end for the Green Bay Packers, was reported in 'fair condition today at Baptist Hospital, where he had been taken Friday after a man he had given a ride in his cat had shot him in the neck. The West Memphis police said Howard Sanders, 41, of West Memphis was being held in connection with the shooting.

title: BromineCompound Prices Raised by Dow Chemical
description: The Dow Chemical Company said yesterday it had raised prices on a number of bromine compounds and specialties by range of 1 cent to 15 cents pound, effective immediately on spot sales and April 1 for contract customers.

title: Two Senators Issue Claims Of Triumph in the Primary
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., March 7Senators Edmund Muskie of Maine and George McGovern of South Dakota both claimed victory tonight in the New Hampshire primary. But Mr. McGovern, who finished a much stronger second than generally eipected, was clearly the more elated of the two.

title: Trade Bars Attacked
description: GENEVA, March 7Calls by the United States, the European Economic Community and Japan for mounting a major in ternational assault on trade barriers in 1973 won the endorsement today of other industrialized nations.

title: ISRAELIS PRESSING ON JARRING TALKS
description: TEL AVIV, March 7Fdreign Minister Abba Eban told Parliament today that a way was still being sought to reactivate the mission of the United Nations peace envoy, Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring.

title: R. R. Lounsbury Weds Mrs. Funk
description: Mrs. Eleanor McNeal Funk, widow of Wilfred John Funk, publisher, poet and lexicographer, and Ralph R. Lounsbury, retired board chairman of the Bankers National Life Insurance Company, were married sunday in Montclair. N. J., and sailed Monday aboard the Gripsholm on a Mediterranean cruise. Only members of the immediate families attended the ceremony, performed by the Rev. John Owen of St. Luke's Episcopal Church at the bride's home. The couple will live in Montclair and Southampton,.

title: Wider School Lunch Program Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 7The National Advisory Council on Child Nutrition urged President Nixon today to have all needy children in America provided with free or reducedprice school lunches within the next three years.

title: RODGERS TO GET MUSICAL SALUTE
description: A Celebration of Richard Rodgers, a oneperformance, allstar musical tribute to the Broadway composer, will be presented at the Imperial Theater on March 26 under the auspices of the Friends of the Theater and Music Collection of the Museum of the City of New York.

title: Soviet Offers Aid to Bengalis
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, March 7 (AP)The Soviet Union has offered Bangladesh $51.6million in loans, and, commodity aid, ships and loComOtives, Foreign Minister Abdus Samad Azad said today The offers were made last week while the Prime Minister Sheik Mujibur Rahaman, was paying a fiveday visit to Moscow.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Feb. 26 editorial Cypriot Setback rightly places the burden of the recent Cyprus crisis on the heavyhanded Greek diplomacy. It is, however, both mistitled and misleading in its complex reasoning.

title: LINDSAYA JUDAS, RESIDENTS ALLEGE
description: Mayor Lindsay, Was denounced as a Judas to be Id on the cross, and the City's proposed master plan was derided as hogwash and a charade, as the City Planning Commission appeared last night before mostly angry residents of the Mill BasinBergen Beach section of southeastern Brooklyn.

title: Advertising:
description: Advertising men we reached yesterday seemed surprised by the report that the canner of Bumble Bee tuna had pulled advertising from TV stations owned by the Columbia Broadcasting System as a protest against what it considered unfair coverage of a Congressional hearing on the, fishing industry.

title: Nixon to Act on Secrecy
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 (AP)The White House said today that President Nixon would announce tomorrow an executive order that will result in declassifying increased numbers of hitherto secret public documents. The Presidential Press Secretary, Ronald L. Ziegler, told a news briefing that the order would set up a new Federal system for classifying and declassifying the Government's paperwork.

title: Brut, Faberge Unit, Plans 5 Films and 4 TV Programs
description: A program of five feature films and four television productions will be made by Brut Productions, Inc., a whollyowned subsidiary of Faberge, Inc., the cosmetics firm, according to an announcement here yesterday by George Barrie, president of both concerns.

title: Reserve Recommends Allowing President to Adjust the Rate
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 The Federal Reserve Board recommended to Congress today that the President be given the authority to vary upward or downward the businessinvestment tax credit as the most important single contribution that could be made to easing the plight of the housing industry in recurring periods of credit restriction.

title: Chinese Envoy Leaves. For New Canadian Post
description: PEKING, March 7Yao Kuang, a taciturn career dipldmat who is expected to act as a liaison man for continuing contacts between the United States and China, left today for his new assignment as Chinese Ambassador to Canada.

title: For Maxim's, Still Three Stars in the Michelin
description: PARIS, March 7Gastronomes were thrown into something of a dither today when one of their bibles, the Guide Michelin, made its bow for 1972.

title: NAVAL CHIEF ASKS GREEK HOME PORT
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 Adm. Elmo R. Zumwalt Jr., chief of naval operations, warned a Congressional panel today that the nation was extracting inhuman sacrifices from seamen and airmen serving aboard the nation's 17 active aircraft carriers.

title: 5 TIGER PITCHERS FAIL TO STOP METS
Press Credentials Returned To Reporter for The Times
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., March 7 (AP)The police returned press credentials today to Earl Caldwell, a reporter for The New York Times who was barred from the Angela Davis trial yesterday after his arrest for investigation of possessing marijuana.

title: Hilton Hotels Corp. Reports Drop in 1971 Earnings
PhoneTapping Charges Stir Wide Protests in Italy
description: ROME, March 7  Some married man use private codes when they call girl friends, Many Italians open their first phone calls of the day with a sarcastic Good morning, Mr. Spy.

title: BERRGAN DEFENSE QUERIES INFORMER
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 7 The defense in the antiwar conspiracy trial of the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan began today crossexamination of Boyd F Douglas Jr., the Government's key witness in an attempt to show that he had served not only as an F.B.I. informer but also as a provocateur for the entrapment of the militant priest.

title: REV. JAMES P. SMITH
description: TROY HILLS, N. J., March  The Rev. James P. Smith, pastor of the Roman Catholic Church of St. Peter the Apostle from 1941 to his retirement in 1966, died Sunday in the Green Pond (N.J.) Nursing Home. He was 71 years old.

title: Students Set LongRange Goals
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., March 7 The Children's Crusade has grown up.

title: Welfare Inspector Urges Central File Of Relief Clients
description: The State Welfare Inspector General, George F, Berlinger, recommended yesterday that statewide.centraL registry of reliefrecipients be set up to stop losses of millions of dollars in duplicate cases.

title: Tricky Dicky Phrase Is Expunged by Tass
description: MOSCOW, March 7 (Reuters)Tass, apparently embarrassed by one of it's own dispatches, tonight, corrected a reference to the President of the United States as Tricky Dicky Nixon.

title: Executive Changes
description: Peter J. McLaughlin has been promoted to executive vice presidentadministration and David K. Green has been advanced to vicepresidentfinance of the Union Camp Corporation, Wayne, N.J.

title: 2 Legislators to Propose a $1.2Billion Environmental Bond Issue
description: ALBANY, Match 7The Republican chairmen of the Conservation Committees of both houses of the Legislature plan to propose a $1.2billion environment bond issue tomorrow.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Cancer. The President announced the appointment of 18 members to the new National Cancer Advisory Board. Also on the board are five exofficio members; the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare; the director of the National Institutes of Health; the chief medical officer of the Veterans Administration, and medical officer designated by the Secretary of Defense. Members of the existing National Advisory Council, which is superseded by the board, will continue to serve until their appointments expire.

title: Notes on People
description: The city of Aachen, West Germany, annually gives its Charlemagne Prize, worth $1,560, to a person who has furthered European unity. This year the prize goes to Roy Jenkins, deputy leader of the British Labor party, who broke party discipline to line up with the governing Conservatives to help them gain a majority in the initial vote on entering the Common Market.

title: U.S. to Seek Exchange Of Students With China
description: WASHINGTON, March 7Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today in his 621page foreign policy report to Congress that as a result of President Nixon's visit to China a concerted effort would be made to provide an opportunity for more Americans to learn Chinese and more Chinese to learn English.

title: Dock Workers Vote on New Labor Contract Today
description: Representatives of longshoremen and the shipping industry in New Orleans reached agreement yesterday on a new contract there, while negotiations went right down to the wire in at least five other ports.

title: Front Page 3  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH, DRINK DRWAR'S. 96.8 Proof, 100?? Blended Scotch Whiskies, William Lawson's Imported by Palmer & Lord Ltd., Syosset. N. T.Advt.

title: Hogan Seeks Stay of U.S. Writ That Freed Manager of WBAI
description: The office of District Attorney Frank S. Hogan yesterday asked the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit to overturn the lower Federal court order that freed the general manager of WBAIFM from Civil Jail on Sunday.

title: IMIPRAMINE MAKER WILL STUDY REPORTS
description: BASEL, Switzerland, March 7 (AP)The Swiss manufacturer of the drug imipramine denied today that there was any hard evidence that its product caused deformities in unborn children but pledged to study questions raised about the drug.

title: Federal Power Agency to Fight Ruling on Environmental Policy
description: WASHINGTON, March 7John N. Nassikas, chairman of the Federal Power Commission, said today that, if necessary, the commission would ask the Supreme Court to review a lower court's decision that the commission was not In compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969.

title: U.S. and Saigon Aides Refuse To Attend Paris Talks 2d Week
description: PARIS, March 7The United States and South Vietnam announced today that for the second week in a row they would refuse to meet with North Vietnam and the Vietcong in a plenary session of the Peace talks here.

title: THOUSAND DONORS LISTED BY LINDSAY
description: Mayor Lindsay made public the names of 1,010 people who have contributed $489,804.35 to his Presidential campaign.

title: Clashes In Londonderry
description: BELFAST, March 7 (UPI)British Army. spokesmen reported a series of duels in Londonderry between gunmen and British troops on patrol and in sandbagged observation posts around the Ronian Catholic Bogside district.

title: Witness Insists He Was a Tool Of Thaler in Selling U. S. Notes
description: A key prosecution witness maintained under crossexamination in Federal Court here yesterday that he had helped sell stolen United States Treasury bills under instructions from former State Senator Seymour R. Thaler.

title: Chiang Is Adamant
description: TAIPEI, March 7 (UPI) President Chiang Kaishek said today that Nationalist China's position as a pivot in Asia and the Pacific would not be affected by any unfavorable tide.

title: An Oper Door to City U.
description: The City University of New York started in 1847 as the first and only openadmissions university the United States. At that time the public spirited citizens of New York City began the tradition of free tuition by voting for it by a margin of more than six to one in a referendum authorized by the State Legislature. A century and a quarter ago, our city forefathers decided that the right to higher education for our citizens should not be in whole or in part function of the statistical accident of their personal parentage... The cost of tuition (the teaching of its citizens) would be borne by the citizens of New York equally for all their sons and daughters, not only in elementary and secondary school but also for those who chose their education.

title: FREE SCHOOL BUSES ORDERED IN NORFOLK
description: NORFOLK, Va., March 7 (AP) The city of Norfolk was told by a Federal, appeals court day that it must provide free transportation to pupils who are being bused beyond a reasonable walking distance of their homes under a courtordered school desegregation plan.

title: Advertising:
description: Those of you who are planning to watch the first half of the film, West Side Story, next Tuesday are for a special treata television adaptation of the American Telephone and Telegraph's annual report.

title: Cards Invoke Reserve Clause on Two
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 7  The St, Louis Cardinals invoked baseball's reserve clause on two of their four holdouts today  declaring them under contract though unsigned  but did not invoke it on Joe Torre.

title: COMPANY PROFITS ROSE 12% FOR 1971
description: A majority of American corporations pushed ahead to strong profit gains in 1971, a year of economic strain and slow recovery from the recession of 1970.

title: Backlash in Canada
description: With a general election likely in June, Canada is witnessing some backlash against the Liberal Government's policy of bilingualism and biculturalismthe effort to provide equal opportunity for the country's Frenchspeaking minority. The charge that Ottawa has moved too quickly to end discrimination against French Canadians is reminiscent of complaints in this country that Washington has gone too far to rectify past injustices against black Americans.

title: English Sometimes Is Just UnAmerican
description: Americans and Britons are close in many ways, but they are worlds apart.

title: From the East, a Durable Will Rogers
description: How did a nice, fasttalking Choate graduate and Yalee from Buffalo come to portray this country's quintessential drawling country slicker  Will Rogers?

title: 11 School Districts to Lose Up to $1Million Under Reallocation
description: Largely because of faulty enrollment estimates by the decentralized community schOol districts, the Board of Education will have to reallocate $4.6million in authorized operating funds among the districts.

title: Lottery in Pennsylvania
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 7 (UPI)Pennsylvania began a weekly state lottery today. The tip prize Is $50,000 and a chance to try for $1million. Millions of 50cent tickets went on sale at 6,500 licensed establishmentsbanks, department stores food stores, bars, restaurants and gas stations. Robert P. Kane, State Secretary of Revenue, said he hoped 5 million to 6 million tickets would be sold the first week. The first drawing will be held here March 15.

title: Vatican Is Weighing A New Department On Cultural Change
description: ROME, March 7The Vatican indicated today that it was considering a suggestion from the laity to set up a new central department on cultural changes in the world.

title: Handcuffs in Harrisburg
description: When a major Federal case is built upon the broad ground of conspiracy, it is likely to involve an equally broad range of people and institutions. Some may be only remotely related to the indictment, yet they can be caught up in the dragnet of eavesdropping and informersand find themselves in handcuffs on the way to jail.

title: Javelin Trading Suspended
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission today ordered the temporary suspension of both exchange and overthecounter trading in securities of Canadian Javelin, Ltd., for the next 10 days. The company's common stock is listed on the American Stock Exchange.

title: MISS GOOLAGONG IS NEARLY UPSET
description: DALLAS March 7 Reuters) Evonne Goolagong, the Wimbledon champion, came within 2 Points today of losing in her United States debut in the $30,000 Maureen Connolly Brinker international tennis tournament, but the 20yearold Australian survived by beating Wendy Gilchrist, also of Australia, 60, 16, 97

title: U.S. Auditors Accuse Insurers Of Costly Mistakes in Medicare
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 (AP)Health insurance coinPanics have misspent millions of Medicare dollars, Federal auditors report, because of busbless inefficiencies and excess Payments to doctors.

title: DEATH OF INDIAN SPARKS PROTEST
description: GORDON, Neb., March 7 (AP)A band of Indians established a 12member grand jury today to investigate the death of Raymond Yellow Thunder and vowed to remain in this Nebraska Sand Hills community of 2,106 persons pending the outcome of.a new autopsy..

title: PURSUIT DETAILED AT ONASSIS TRIAL
description: Continuing her recital of what she calls harassment by Ronald E. Galella, a freelance photographer, Mrs. Aristotle Onassis testified in Federal Court here yesterday that he followed her from walks in Central Park and shopping at Bonwit Teller to islands in Greece and Italy.

title: Prices on Amex Ease as Trading Dips
Police in New Rochelle Continue in Job Action
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., March 7  Policemen began stopping and inspecting commercial vehicles here today in the second phase of a job action to put pressure on the city in contract negotiation.

title: Pentagon to Treat Alcoholics; Punishment Is Being Dropped
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 The Pentagon announced today the establishment of a departmentwide rehabilitation program to treat an estimated 150,000 alcoholics in the military establishment.

title: A PEKINGHANOI PLAN REPORTEDLYABORTED
description: An American columnist who accompanied President Nixon to China and is still there reports that Chinese and North Vietnamese leaders recently reached a shortlived agreement that Premier Pham Van Dong of North Vietnam would go to Paris to push the peace negotia?? with the United States.

title: Harvard Overtime Victor
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 7 Bill Corkery's goal at 4:50 of a suddendeath overtime period tonight enabled Harvard to defeat Clarkson, 65, in the quarterfinal round of the Eastern College Athletic Conference hockey playoff at Harvard's Watson Rink.

title: Books of The Times
description: I admit I approached this first volume of Chester Himes's autobiography with so much apprehension that it took much longer than necessary for its winning character to work its ways. Mr. Himes has reputation for being an angry, alienated black who feels that his considerable body of writing has suffered because of bigotry a reputation that has doubtless in part been exaggerated by ideological taffypulls  and I was convinced that I was in for 350 pages of bile but not at all sure that I was up to It. So when I came upon his statement on page one that I can never again be hurt as much as have already been hurt, even though I should live one hundred thousand years, my suspicions seemed con firmed, and I immediately blocked out the preceding remark that human beingsall human beings, of whatever race or nationality or religious belief or ideologywill do anything and everything. (Not just white human beings, please note.)

title: Mayor Seeks to Ease Murphy Dispute
description: Mayor Lindsay attempted yesterday to cool the bitter controversy that has led to clashes in the last few days between Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy arid members of the Police and Fire Departments.

title: Harlem Unit Takes 600 From School
description: About 600 elementary school pupils were led out of Public School. 186 in Harlem yesterday by parents, teachers and the black selfhelp organization NEGRO in protest of alleged unsafe conditions at the 71yearold elementary school and to underscore demands that a, replacement school be built.

title: Earth Tremor in England
description: MANCHESTER, England; March 7 (AP) A 10second earth tremor shook northern England early today, cracking walls and ceilings from coast to coast but causing no casualties or serious damage.

title: SUGAR FUTURES RISE, THEN FALL;Contracts Hit Highest Price Since 64 Before Slipping
description: Prices of the leading world No. 11 sugar futures contracts rose fractionally to more than 10 cents a pound on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange yesterday, the highest prices since 1964, but then dropped and closed at just under the 10cent level.

title: JERSEY TO APPEAL ABORTION DECISION
description: TRENTON, March 7State Attorney General George F. Kugler Jr. anounced today that New Jersey would appeal the decision last week by a threeman Federal court that declared the state's 123yearold abortion law as unconstitutional and the ground that it was vague.

title: Hijackers Return Sought
description: MIAMI, March 7 (Reuters)Police Chief Bernard Garmire has sent a telegram to Premier Fidel Castro asking that he return the two hijackers who hijacked a plane to Havana today. The telegram said, ,in. part:

title: Rogers Calls His Policy Role Important
description: WASHINGTON, March 7Secretary of State William P. Rogers asserted today that he and the State Department had played, an essential and important role in the formulation and execution of foreign policy in, the Nixon Administration.

title: Nothing Doing
description: Seven months ago, I quit a moderately wellpaid semirespectable job as a newspaperman to embark on a new career: doing nothing.

title: At Kennedy, Passengers of T.W.A. Wait and Wait
description: Passengers at Kennedy International Airport had to wait up to two hours yesterday, sometimes longer, while their planes were searched for I bombs.

title: Nixon Wins, Mashie 2d In Vermont Town Vote
description: RANDOLPH, Vt., March 7 (UPI)President Nixon received 407 of the 772 votes cast here today to win what was believed to be the nation's only municipal Presidential primary.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: TOKYOEmperor Hirohito, a mildmannered, softspoken little man with greying hair and mustache and weak eyes shielded by rimless spectacles, is obviously by instinct a retiring, modest intellectual with a keen interest in the countryside and a passion for, marine biology and botany. Yet, by circumstance, he has been on the throne for 46 critical years, the 124th of an unbroken line of Japanese rulers.

title: The Talk of Madrid Bend, Ky.
description: MADRID BEND, Ky.,By any stretch of geographical imagination, this fourbyfivemile chunk of Mississippi River bottom should belong to Tennessee.

title: Officer Says He Lied on Ulster Killings
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 7A British Army lieutenant said today that he had lied in a television interview when he said he saw gunmen firing on British troops during the clash Jan. 30 in Londonderry in which 13 Roman Catholic civilians were killed.

title: STOCKES STALLED IN PROFIT TAKING;Some Indexes Continue Rise to Record Areas, but Dow Slips 3.31 to 946.87
Charles K. Campbell Dead at 60; An I.B.M World Trade Official
description: DARIEN, Conn., March 7Charles K. Campbell, a retired vice president and director of the I.B.M. World Trade Corporation, died today after a brief illness at his home, Ridge Acres. He was 60 years old.

title: Key West Public Schools Closed by Racial Strife
description: KEY WEST, Fla., March 7 (UPI)A white student protest about an interracial fight touched off a melee at Key West high school today that led to the closing of all public schools in the area.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The head of the unit charged with fighting corruption throughout the Police Department has received a new assignment in which he heads a special task force pursuing leads growing out of the Knapp Commission investigation.

title: CORNELL SIX TOPS PROVIDENCE, 111
description: ITHACA, N. Y., March 7Cornell's hockey team: reached the Eastern College Athletic Conference semifinals for the seventh straight year by routing Providence, 111, tonight at Lynah Rink.

title: Democrats, on a Tour, Criticize The State's Retardation Services
description: ALBANY, March 7Democrats in the Legislature pressed the Issues of mentalretardation care and welfare reform today as they sought to demonstrate what they regard a electionyear weaknesses in the Republicans administration of state services.

title: Salome Back at Met With a New Cast
PUBLIC TV AGENCY GETS COORDINATOR
description: James C. Lehrer, news director of public television station KERA in,Dallas, has been named to the new post of pub affairs coordinator for the Public Broadcasting Service.

title: U.S. Captures 4th in Row And Leads World Softball
description: MANILA, March 7 (AP) The United States defeated Singapore, 100, tonight for its fourth straight victory and took first place alone in the world men's softball championship. The American team is from Cedar Rapids, Iowa.

title: French Judge Comes to Query Heroin Smuggler
description: France's chief judicial expert on narcotics smuggling arrived here;yesterday to seek information from and about a Frenchman who ,has pleaded guilty to smuggling $12million worth of heroin from France to New Jersey.

title: Soviet Stresses Positive
description: MOSCOW March 7 (AP)The Soviet Union stressed the positive side of United StatesSoviet relations tonight in Tass comment on Mr. Rogers's foreign affairs report but said Washington still clings to old unrealistic positions.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Columnist William is supposed to be the humorous Buckley, but Senator James demonstrates considerable talent in that direction too. His concern [OpEd Feb. 29] that this country mar come to grief in Indochina because of its superabundance of goodwill and utter lack of aggressiveness ought to bring many a merry chuckle to the survivors of Mylai and all the other peasants who have been relocated, defoliated and napalmed.

title: NOMINEE DOUBTED AT BLACK PARLEY
description: State Senator Waldaba Stewart predicted yesterday that the first National Black Convention, which opens Friday in Gary, Ind., would not endorse Representative ShirleY Chisholm or any other slack Presidential candidate. Mr. Stewart made the statement at a news conference barred to white reporters.

title: A Lottery Distribution Set For Tickets for Bing Gala
description: Standingroom tickets for the gala farewell program honoring Sir Rudolf Bing at the Metropolitan Opera on April 22 will be distributed by lottery Sunday morning at 9.

title: A NATIONAL FRONT FORMED IN SYRIA
description: BEIRUT, March 7A national front has been established in Syria as the highest political authority in the country.

title: Gov. McCall of Oregon Won't Oppose Hatfield
description: SALEM, Ore., March 7 Gov. Tom McCall announced today that he would, not run against Senator Mark O. Hatfield in the Republican senatorial primary this year

title: JOHN ALBERT
description: John Albert, a former news photographer who had operated the. Graphic Arts Photo Service since 1953, died of cancer on Monday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived at 150 West 96th Street.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., March 7 (UPI)A male teacher, apparently trying to mediate a dispute between students at Dreher High School, was cut on the arm today. The school was closed for the second day.

title: Rabbi Says Hanoi Disallows A Visit to Jewish P.O.W.'s
description: PARIS, March 7A Bronx rabbi charged here today that the North Vietnamese had gone back on a promise to allow him to meet and conduct services with Jewish prisoners of war.

title: Coal Refuse Dams Are Being Pumped By West Virginia
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., March 7 (AP)More than 100 dams made of coal refuse and earth impounding water in West Virginia's mountain hollows have been ordered pumped dry by Gov. Arch A. Moore Jr. following the Feb. 26 flood disaster that was caused by such a dam giving away.

title: Peepers Are Dismissed
description: DONCASTER, England (UPI) The municipal swimming pool recently fired three male bath attendants for drilling peep hole from the men's to the women's dressing room.

title: AN ISRAELI WARNING REPORTED BY BEIRUT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 7 Premier Saeb Salam disclosed today that Lebanon had received another warning from Israel and that the Government was thinking of taking the matter to the United Nations Security Council.

title: BenefactorCritic Lends Ear To 2d Grade Music Makers
description: It was the meeting of the Titan with the Tots. The titan was Virgil Thomson, the emanent composer and critic, and the tots were secondgrade children of, P.S. 134 on the Lower East Side. Their common ground was music.

title: TRADING IS HALTED IN FABRICS CONCERN
description: The National Stock Exchange yesterday halted trading in the stock of the Applied Synthetics Corporation at the request of the company, Paul W. Silverstein, president of the disposable fabrics company, announced. He said the company has also requested the Securities and Exchange Commission to suspend trading in the stock indefinitely.

title: XEROX REORGANIZES ITS COMPUTER UNIT
description: The Xerox Corporation announced yesterday a major corporate reorganization, with the chief emphasis on integrating the company's computer and copier operations.

title: Brokrers Find Less Speculation in Bubbly Market
description: The stock market, as viewed yesterday by two managers of brokerage branch offices in midManhattan, is getting a bit more bubbly, but signs of customer speculation remain relatively sparse.

title: War Foes Map Protest
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., March 7 (AP)Rennie C. Davis, a Chicago Seven defendant, announced today plans to put 40,000 nonviolent antiwar demonstrators on the streets of Miami Beach during the Democratic National Convention. He said the purpose of the demonstration, which is being coordinated by the Florida People's Coalition, is to commit the Democratic Presidential candidate to an immediate end of the war in Indochina.

title: James Callaghan, Newark Aide Jailed in Kickback Case, Dies
description: EAST HANOVER, N. J., March 7James T. Callaghan, a former Newark councilman and municipal utilities authority secretary under former Mayor Hugh J. Addbnizio, died Friday in Morristown. He was 57 years old and lived here.

title: HIROHITO FAVORS A VISIT BY NIXON
description: TOKYO, March 7 Emperor Hirohito has said that he would be very pleased if President Nixon paid an official visit to Japan.

title: G.E. COUNTERSUES AMERICAN ELECTRIC
description: The General Electric Company filed a counteraction yesterday in Federal District Court to a suit by four operating subsidiaries of the American Electric Power Company.

title: Cyanamid to Submit Study On Drug Abuse to Holders
description: WASHINGTON, March 7The Project on Corporate Responsibility said today that it had reached an agreement with the American Cyanamid Company concerning the project's demand that the chemical cornpany study whether its advertising and marketing practices were encouraging drug abuse.

title: Police in New Rochelle Continue in Job Action
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., March 7  Policemen began stopping and inspecting commercial vehicles here today in the second phase of a job action to put pressure on the city in contract negotiation.

title: JERSEY BUS LINE IN NEW PAY OFFER
description: Negotiations focused on pensions as bargaining between Transport of New Jersey and eight locals of the Amalgamated Transit Union resumed yesterday for the first time since 4,500 drivers and other workers went on strike against the private bus company last Wednesday.

title: U.S. Decides to Bar Some Data On Aircraft Involved in Bombing
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, March 8Amid reports of continuing heavy American air strikes on North Vietnam, the United States command here said today that it would no longer disclose information on the number of American aircraft involved in the raids.

title: N.C.A.A. Bars Hunter's Quintet From Tournament Over 1.6 Rule
description: National Collegiate Athletic Association officials removed Hunter College from the association's college division basketball tournament yesterday because the City University of New York institution does not comply With the N.C.A.A.'s controversial 1.6 academic rule for athletes.

title: Steve Kuhn, Jazz Pianist, Leads Vibrant Quartet at Top of Gate
description: Steve Kuhn, a jazz pianist Who played with John Coitrane, Art Farmer and Stan Getz until he took off for Europe five years ago, is back in town leading an exceptionally good quartet at the Top of the Gate. Mr. Kuhn has not only picked up three of.the most consistently interesting jazz musicians in town  Ron Carter on bass, Airto Moreira on percussion and Paul Medan on drumsbut he also has welded them into a unit that is neither the customary piano soloist with accompaniment ,nor a constant parade of solos by each musician, routines that such group are apt to fall Into.Each member of the quartet provides a vital elementMr. Carter's strong bass figures,. Mr. Moreira's delightfully enlivening use of things that shake, bang and tinkle, and Mr. Motian's tremendously propulsive drumming. Their material ranges from lively Latin rhythms that Mr. Moreira fills with sparkling highlights to slow mood ballads, some of which Mr. Kuhn sings.

title: U.S. Student Dead in Spain
description: MADRID, March 7 (AP)A 21yearold American student, Neil. Friedlander of Ithaca, N. Y., was found dead by police Sunday in a parked. oar on the Valencia Madrid highway, United States consular officials said today. The Spanish police reported that a hose had been connected from the exhaust into the interior of the rented oar. The youth was a student at the Spanish Cultural Institute in Madrid under a program sponsored by New York University.

title: 500 More Employes Dismissed by Pan Am
description: Pan American World Airways announced yesterday that it had given dismissal notices to 500 more employes, nearly all management workers.

title: Mrs. Gilly's Trial Set
description: WASHINGTON, Pa., March 7 (UPI).Judge Charles Sweet announced toddy that Mrs. Annette Gilly, whose husband was convicted of first degree murder last week in the Yablonski slayings, would be tried for murder April 10.

title: Second Thoughts Rise on Merger
description: To appreciate the significance of Marvin Kratter's testimony against the merger of the National and American Basketball Associations, given in Washington on Monday, you have to understand the peculiar position. Kratter is in.

title: NEPALA CAPTURES LEAD IN SKATING
description: CALGARY, Alberta, March 7 (UPI) Ondrej Nepala, the Czechoslovak skating star, took a firm lead in the men's compulsory figures today with a performance calculated to secure his title as the world's best men's figure skater.

title: The Major Contributors As Listed by Lindsay
description: Following are people who have contributed $1,000 or more to Mayor Lindsay's Presidential campaign, as listed by the Lindsay campaign staff. Unless other wise noted, the contributors are from New York City.

title: Tug Found Near Vancouver
