description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, March 7 (Reuters)The tug Haro Straits, missing with five men aboard since Feb. 27, was found on the ocean floor last night in United States waters about 20 miles south of Vancouver.

title: TAIWAN SEEKING COMMUNIST TIES
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 7 (AP) Foreign Minister Chow Shukal said today that Nationalist China was interested in contacts with Communist nations if they are not the puppets of Communist China.

title: Japan Supports Dollar
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, March 8 (Reuters)The Bank of Japan intervened today in the local foreign; exchange market to support the United States dollar at 301.93 yen, which was 0.90 yen above the upper limit for the. Japanese currency under the new wider band, dealers said.

title: Prisons Not Censoring Mail From Newsmen
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP)The Federal Bureau of Prisons has changed its policy on prisoner contacts with the news media and says it now permits convicts to send uncensored letters to newsmen.

title: Gold Bill Advances
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 (AP) The House Banking Committee approved a dollardevaluation bill today exactly the form requested by Preslden Nixon. The action paved the way for final Congressional action next week.

title: Stevens Predicts A Profitable Year
description: With current orders running 15 per cent ahead of a year ago, 1972 should be a profitable year for J. P. Stevens & Co., Inc., James D. Finley, chairman, told shareholders yesterday at the company's annual meeting.

title: Black Protest Greets Waldheim On Visit to SouthWest Africa
description: TSUMEB, SouthWest Africa, March 7  Secretary General Waldheim of the United Nations was met In SouthWest Africa today by black demonstrators demanding that South Africa yield control of the territory.

title: Bomb Found on Jet. Here After Demand
description: Policemen using trained dogs found a live bomb powerful enough to blew the plane apart in the cockpit of a jetliner. at Kennedy International Airport yesterday and removed it minutes before it was set to go off.

title: Sabres Suspend Morrison
description: BUFFALO, March 7 (AP)George Morrison, a left wing obtained in a trade with the St. Louis Blues, was suspended by the Buffalo Sabres today after he failed to report to the National Hockey League team. The Sabres sent Chris Evans, a defenseman, to the Blues Sunday in exchange for Morrison.

title: FRED HEBERT DEAD; DIRECTORPRODUCER
description: Fred Hebert, a theatrical production manager, director and producer, died yesterday after openheart surgery in Beth Israel Medical Center, Newark. He was 60 years old and lived in West Orange, N. J.

title: 2 Hours In Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, March 7 (UPI)Mr. Green spent two hours with Cambodian officials today explaining President Nixon's trip to China and the effects of the visit on peace in Indochina.

title: ROBERT CLARK SINGS IN HIS DEBUT RECITAL
description: In an unusual gesture, Robert Clark engaged a chamber orchestra to accompany him in his debut recital at Tully Hall on Monday night. The tenor, a New Yorker who has studied here and in Israel, might have done better without it. He has a very light voice, which was obscured at times by the ensemble, and the latter played, under the direction of Nicolas Flagello, as if it had had no rehearsals.

title: A Show Where Gowns of Past Met the Pants Outfits of Today
description: Marc Bohan, the designer for Christian Dior, knew he had a hard act to follow. There was Louis A. Auchincloss, lawyer, author and president of the Museum of the City of New York making his debut as fashion show commentator. There were antique costumes from the museum's collection modeled by young women who supported the museum and had nothing against fashion.

title: 32 Doctors Resign in Dispute Over Board in Hospital on S.I.
description: In a dispute over a city plan for bringing more community control to its 18 hospitals, at least 32 of 150 attending physicians at the Sea, View Hospital and Home for elderly, chronically ill persons on Staten Island have submitted written resignations.

title: Boy Seized in Tampa
description: TAMPA, Fla. March 7 (AP) A 14yearold youth wielding a gun was overpowered by Federal marshal on a National Airlines entrance ramp today and charged with attempting to hijack the 727 jetliner to Sweden.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Feb. 16 editorial China Trade prompts me to write as a means of interjecting what I believe is an essential point in relation to your apparent misconceptions over the new detente between the United States and China.

title: Australian Aborigines Set Up Embassi, Score Diplomatic Coup
description: CANBERRA, Australia Alarm rippled through conservative political, circles in Australia when a spokesman for the selfstyle Aboriginal Embassy, a tent camp of young Aborigines on the broad lawn in front of the parliament building here annininced recently that the Peking Government had invited 20 Aboriginal activists on a 32day tour of mainland China is official guests expenses paid.

title: Lag on Minority Hiring Laid to Press
description: WASHINGTON, March 7Representative Shirley Chisholm accused the American press today of failing to make a concentrated effort to hire and promote members', of minorities despite repeated pledges to do so.

title: Terenzio Appointed Head Of United Hospital Fund
description: Joseph V. Terenzio, who was the. city's Commissioner of Hospitals from 1966 to 1970, yesterday was appointed executive vice president of the United Hospital Fund of New York.

title: Two Flee East Germany
description: GOTTINGEN, West Germany, March 7 (Reuters)A 32yearold East German worker and a 16yearold girl escaped unharmed across the border to West Germany during the night, customs officials said today.

title: Mayor Vows No Ethnic Quota System
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that the Civil Service system constantly needs reexamination because it locks people out, and predicted that the city's ethnic survey would shed light on those who were excluded.

title: Key Advocate for I.T.T. Felix George Rohatyn
description: Frontpage newspaper articles and television and radio newscasts in recent days have featured the name of Felix George Rohatyn as one of the key characters in the Controversy over the Justice Department's antitrust settlement with the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation. But whatever pressure is now being felt by Mr. Rohatyn (pronounced ROWatin) as a result of his conversations last year with Acting Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst about the pending Justice Department suits against I.T.T., on whose board he serves, his strain is probably less severe than it was during a 12month period in 1970 and 1971.

title: Labor Strike Shuts Aqueduct 3d Day
description: Countess Georgia won't get a chance to run today at Aqueduct, and neither will King Christy, Count Claridge, Prince Al or 108 other horses whose entries were taken yesterday.

title: Who Are They?
description: They are teachers and truck drivers, students and business executives, including the manager of a local department store, as well as priests, city politicians, a barber, a letter carrier and a disc jockey. They are the, disaster volunteers of the American Red Cross in Greater New York.

title: OUTLAY ON MEDIA HEAVY IN FLORIDA
description: MIAMI, March 7With one week to go, Democratic Presidential contenders in Florida's new primary are locked in one of the most expensive and fiercely competitive media battles in the history of preconvention political maneuvering.

title: Growth and Survival
description: OXFORD, EnglandProf. Henry C. Wallich's contention (The. New York Times, Feb. 12), that to, stop growing now would be to commit suicide for fear of remote.death, demands reply. Otherwise, people might believe him, and continue to bury their heads in the sand.

title: Committee Urges Senate to Aid Gravel in Supreme Court Fight
description: WASHINGTON, March 7The Senate Democratic Policy Committee urged the Senate today to intervene in behalf of Senator Mike Gravel, Democrat of Alaska, in his Supreme Court fight to block Federal inquiries into his publications of the Pentagon Papers.

title: New Realities Abroad
description: The leading economic cliche of our time has become the word new. The New Economics of fiscalism was temporarily supplanted by the New, New Economics of monetarism, but since Aug. 15, 1971, the Nixon Administration's policy has advanced to a New, New, New Economics with fiscal and monetary policy augmented by direct controls, voluntary controls and assorted guidelines. Just where domestic economic policy is heading beyond the electionyear recovery can be seen through a crystal ball, but darkly.

title: LA SALLE SNAPS SCHOOLBOY MARK
description: La Salle's distance medley team got what it wanted, Kevin McCarey just missed what he wanted and Dave Law wasn't expecting what he got last night at the seventh, annual Eastern States schoolboy indoor track championships at the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: MITCHELL REBUFF OF I.T.T. LOBBYIST REPORTED BY NUNN
description: WASHINGTON, March 7Former Gov. Louie B. Nunn of Kentucky testified, today that former Attorney General John N. Mitchell refused to discuss the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation's antitrust problems with Dita D. Beard, a lobbyist, at a Kentucky Derby party.

title: Taiwan Welcomes 3 U.S. Reporters Who Visited China
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 7Three American journalists who accompanied President Nixon to China arrived here this week, uncertain about their welcome and determined to leave immediately if any attempt was made to confiscate the Communist publications they had picked up.

title: Rogers Cautions Congress On Relations With Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, March 7Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that although SovietAmerican tensions had diminished, relations would continue to show strains until Moscow overcomes its temptation to exploit explosive situations for national advantage.

title: Judges Here Assail a Lack Of Facilities
description: In en unusual departure from traditional judicial behavior, the judges of the city's Civil Court lashed out yesterday at the executive and legislative branches of government, accusing them of debasing and destroying the court through their apathy and insensitivity.

title: Green in Bangkok After 2 Quick Stops
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 7 (Reuters)  Assistant Secretary of State Marshall Green arrived today to brief Thai leaders on President Nixon's visit to China.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on Colonialism 10:30 A.M.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A recent call to jury duty prompts me to write, both as a resident of New York City and as Secretary of the Municipal Art Society, to call public attention to the negligent maintenance of the Supreme Court Building at 60 Centre Street.

title: Kiev Jewish Leaders Said to Help Police
Proposals on Reform of Debt Management Offered by Volcker
description: The Nixon Administration proposed yesterday a range of technical reforms in they the Government manages its, debt.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Negotiations with the North Vietnamese may be more serious than The Times editorial of Feb. 3 The Negotiating Way suggested; but, chances for progress may find fruition beyond the predictions of the Rand Corporation study by Brian Jenkins titled Why the North Vietnamese Keep Fighting and referred to in a letter by Donald Miller on Feb. 14.

title: Sugarman Terms Job Training Plan By City a Failure
description: Of more than 12,000 potential graduates of the city's $40million job training program last year, a followup check showed that 3,575 had been placed in jobs and that only a few more than 1,000 were still on the job, members of the City Council were told yesterday.

title: Faberge Forms Brut Unit
description: Faberge, Inc., has established a subsidiary, Brut Productions, Inc., to produce feature films and television shows. George Barrie, president of both campanies, said that five motion pictures were under way and four, television properties bays been completed for next season.

title: Mrs. Abzug to Run for ReelectionNo Matter What
description: Wearing the floppy, feathered hat that has become her trademark, Representative Bella S. Abzug yesterday denounced the maledominated State Legislature's plans to remap her 19th Congressional District and vowed that whatever happens, I shall run for, reelection.

title: 2 Coarse Corrections For Pioneer 10 Made
description: PASADENA, Calif., March 7Space agency engineers twice fired rockets aboard Pioneer 10 early today to make minor midcourse corrections that are expected to put the spacecraft within 85,000 miles of the surface of the planet Jupiter 630 days from now.

title: Slumber in the Moonlight
description: Mayor Lindsay abandoned the Presidential campaign trail long enough yesterday to do a little firefighting. His mission was to put out the flames ignited by Police Commissioner Murphy's charge that firemen do more sleeping on the job than policemen. The way the police head tells it the extra slumber at taxpayers expense enables the men in the firehouses to rest up so they can beat the cops at moonlighting.

title: Power Project Feasible
description: Construction Of a pumpedstorage power project on upstate Schoharie Creek toprovide one million to two million kilowatts of power for the New York City. metropolitan, area was declared; feasible yesterday from engineering and geological standpoints. A report to that effect was submitted to the state's Power Authority by Uhl, Halt & Rich, of 60 East 42d Street.

title: A Coffeeless Sugar Exchange Is. Celebrating Its 90th Anniversary
description: It was birthday time as the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange celebrated its 90th anniversary yesterday. After the oneminute warning bell, Chandler A Mackey, the 84chairman of a coffee company bearing his name. as well as an eightterm former president of the exchange, wielded the opening gavel.

title: Librarian Released
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 7 (AP)  A librarian jailed for contempt in the Berrigan trial was released today pending hearing tomorrow in the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit in Philadelphia.

title: OFFICER WILL LEAVE ACCOUNTANTS BODY
description: Leonard M. Savoie, the outspoken controversial executive vice president of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, announced yesterday that he would leave his post on June 30, the expiration date of his predent fiveyear contract.

title: Black's Suicide Note a Plea for Harmony
description: FLINT, Mich., March 7To make his voice for racial harmony heard, Paul L. Cabell Jr., frustrated and discouraged, put a shotgun to his head and pulled the trigger.

title: SLUMJOB TESTS VOIDED AS BIASED,
description: A State Supreme Court justice yesterday struck down as unconstitutional a special citysponsored examination for selecting, aides for the Police land Fire Departments and for Housing Authority patrols from residents of predominantly black and Puerto Rican neighborhoods.

title: Chilean Showdown Looms On Expropriation Policies
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 7The future of, 100 business corporations that are the last reserve of large private enterprise in Chile has become the most serious political issue here since President Salvador Allende Gossens took office 16 months ago.

title: The Long Struggle
description: The primaries which began in New Hampshire yesterday and reach their climax in California and New York in June have become increasingly important in the struggle to determine the Presidential candidates of the two major parties. They are a severe test for the rival aspirants but not a comprehensive or conclusive test.

title: Molybdenite Meeting Put Off
description: The Molybdenite Corporation of Canada, Ltd., announced yesterday in Montreal, that its annual meeting, scheduled to be held there today, had been postponed.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: HAPPINESS & VITALITY Arica Institute (212) 4897930 Advt.

title: DR. JAMES S. POTTER, RESEARCH SCIENTIST
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., March 8Dr. James Streater Potter, a research scientist at the Carnegie Institution, Cold Spring Harbor, for many years, died on Monday at Huntington Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at Lloyd Harbor.

title: MERCHANTS PUBLISH GUIDE ON LABELING
description: The National Retail Merchants Association has published a Guide for Permanent Care Labeling, which has been developed by a joint committee from the retail, apparel and textile fields to standardize procedures conforming with the new Federal Trade Commission carelabeling regulation duo to take effect July 3.

title: MRS. ONASSIS CITES BLACKMAIL CARD
description: Mrs. Aristotle Onassis charged yesterday In Federal Court here that a Christmas card sent to her by Ronald E. Galella, the photographer, in 1970 was an attempt at blackmail.

title: Pride Panel Sets Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP)The Price Commission will hold a public hearing In Chicago March 24 to hear from econdmists, unionists, consumers and businessmen about how price controls are working.

title: Senate Approves Increase Of $20Billion in Debt Limit
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) The Senate passed today, 53 to 29, a bill to increase by $20billion the Federal debt limit, raising the figure to $450billion.

title: Sales Rise Reported By 3 Big Retail Chains
description: Three large retail chains reported yesterday higher sales in February compared with the yearearlier month,

title: Early I.L.A. Count Shows, Approval of a Pact Here
description: A preliminary tally last night showed that members of the International Longshoremen's Association in New York and at least six other ports voted to approve a new labor contract.

title: Leafs Rout Wings, 51
description: TORONTO, March 8 (UPI)Five players scored for Toronto tonight to help the Maple Leafs beat Detroit, 51, and move 2 points ahead of the Red Wings in the battle for the fourth and final playoff spot in the East Division.

title: McGovern Likely to Share New Hanwshire Delegates
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., March 8Senator George McGovern not only ran a strong second to Senator Edmund S. Muskie in yesterday's preferential primary here, but he apparently also won a share of New Hampshire's delegation to the Democratic National Convention.

title: Laotians Pushed Back
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 8 (UPI)Enemy troops supported by tanks and rockets attacked Laotian positions along Aoute 23 in southern Laos last night, forcing Government troops to retreat about a mile toward Pakse, a military spokesman said today.

title: MRS.DOUGLAS CAMPBELL
description: Mrs. Dorothea Owen Turner Campbell, widow of Douglas A. Campbell, who headed St. Lawrence Flour Mills of Montreal until his death in 1950, died on Sunday in London. She was 75 years old and lived also in Monte Carlo and Lausanne, Switzerland.

title: Ohio State Rejects N.I.T.; Missouri, Indiana in Field
description: The National Invitation Tournament selection committee added Missouri, Indiana and Lafayette to the field yesterday but drew a rejectio from Ohio State, whose players voted against extendig a long, hard season.

title: U.S. Offer to Help Nuclear Sub Is Politely Declined by Russians
description: WASHINGTON, March 8The Soviet Union has politely turned down offers of assistance from the Secretary of State and the Chief of Naval Operations for a nuclearpowered missile submarine that is in mechanical trouble off Newfoundland, official source's say.

title: IN THE NATION
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 8Attorney General Evelle Younger is convinced that the California Supreme Court's decision to abolish the death penalty was an effort to lobby the Federal Supreme Court, which is considering the same issue. Therefore, Mr. Younger is asking visitors these days, why shouldn't nine million California voters try to lobby the high court in the other direction, by a referendum vote?

title: Griswold Terms Accords On I.T.T Victory for U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Solicitor General Erwin Griswold told the Senate Judiciary Committee today that the Government had not settled its three antimerger suits against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, it would, he believed, have lost all three of them in the.Supreme Court.

title: MARKET IS FIRM IN HEAVY TRADING
description: The stock market continued to churn yesterday in heavy trading and closed with modest gains, although the major price indicators again were. mixed at the finish.

title: PAKISTANI P.O.W.'S REPORTED KILLED
description: NEW DELHI, March 8Several Pakistanis held in an Indian prisonerofwar camp are believed to have been killed when Indian security guards opened fire on a group of rioting prisoners last night.

title: Bears Hire Bratkowski
description: CHICAGO, March 8 (AP)Zeke Bratowski, former Green Bay and Chicago Bear quarterback was hired today as an assistant to head coach Abe Gibron of the Bears.

title: Stan Smith Defeats Zednik At Washington Net, 64, 62
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (UPI)Topseeded Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., advanced tonight to the quarterfinals of the 1972 Equity tennis tourney with a 64, 62 victory over Vladimir Zednik of Czechoslovakia.

title: Thals Burn Tons of Opium After Attack by Rep. Wolff
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 8 (AP)The Thai Government burned 26 tons of opium last night and officials said it was in answer to a New York Congressman's charge that Thailand was not doing enough to stop illegal drug traffic.

title: Redskins'
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) Pat Fischer, the Washington Redskins defensive back, was listed in good condition today following surgery for removal of a ruptured disc.

title: KODAK INTRODUCES MICROFILM READERS
description: The Eastman Kodak Company introduced yesterday two new lowcost microfilm readers that it hopes will provide the final step toward consumer acceptance of microfilm as a major informational medium.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Negotiations aimed at ending the eightday strike by 4,500 diivers and other employes of Transport of New Jersey continued yesterday. However, no progress toward settlement was reported.

title: Waldheim Sees SelfRule for SouthWest Africa
description: OSHAKATI, SouthWest Africa, March 8Secretary General Waldhelm of the United Nations said today that le believed the Government of South Africa intended to grant selfdetermination and independence to SouthWest Africa.

title: Mercury Poisoning in Iraq Is Said to Kill 100 to 400
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 8Informed travelers from Baghdad say Iraq is in the grip of a severe mercurypoisoning outbreak. The travelers, who arrived last night, reported that 100 to 400 people had died since the outbreak began early in February.

title: I.T.T. Denies Any Unpleasantness With Lobbyist
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation asserted yesterday that Mrs. Dita D. Beard, the, lobbyist who wrote a memorandum involving an antitrust settlement and a contribution to he Republican National Convention, was summoiled to the company's NeW York headquarters the day the memorandum was made public.

title: Merrill Lynch Chairman Advocates Flexible Rates
description: Donald T. Regan, chairman of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., declared yesterday that he favored a system of flexible posted rates for brokerage commissions paid by individual investors.

title: ECUADOR PLANNING SOCIAL REFORMS
description: QUITO, Ecuador, March 8The new military Government of Ecuador has spent most of its first 22 days in office draft ing plans for economic and social change that imply an indefinite stay in power.

title: P.R.A. and City Resume Efforts to Reach a Contract
description: Negotiators for the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association and the city began anew effort yesterday to resolve their contract differences on duty charts and productivity issues.

title: Electric Current Helps to Heal Bone Of Brooklyn Boy With a Rare Defect
description: The successful treatment of al 14yearold Brooklyn boy born with a rare defect in leg bone has provided further evidence that electric current can stimulate the healing of bone, according to medical researchers here.

title: HARRY NAGEL
description: Harry Nagel, owner of the Nagel Roofing Company estab lished by his father in 1919, died Monday of cancer at his home, 136 East 76th Street. He was 59 years old.

title: AQUEDUCT TALKS TO RESUME TODAY
description: Negotiations between the New York Racing Association and the Independent Association of Mutual Clerks will be resumed today in the hope of terminating the strike that has shut down Aqueduct since Monday.

title: Philharmonic Picks Violinist
description: Marc Ginsberg, a member of the first violin section of the New York Philharmonic since February, 1970, has been appointed principal second violinist. He fills a post that has been vacant since the death of Leopold Rybb in September, 1970. Mr. Ginsberg, who is 27 years old, holds bachelor's, master's and doctor's degrees from the Juilliard School, where he studied with Ivan Galamian. He also studied in Paris on ,a Fulbright scholarship in 1967 and 1968.

title: L.I. Bank Sale Authorized
description: The Federal Reserve Board has authorized the Bank of New. York Company to acquire the Valley National.Bank of Long Island. Valley. National has deposits of $158.7million.

title: NEW PLAN RAISES READING LEVELS
description: WYANDANCH, L. I., March 8 Officials of the State Department of Education said today they were studying a new method for teaching reading, which in the last two years has raised the reading scores of students in this largely black school district from the bottom quarter in the state to the top quarter.

title: Vaino Leskinen Is Dead at 55; Finland's ExForeign Minister
description: HELSINKI, Finland, March 8 Vaino Leskinen, an often controversial Social Democrat who was Foreign Minister in the Finnish coalition Government that fell last autumn, died today on his 55th birthday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Congressional Funds Asked To Pay Off Loan to Reading
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP)Congress has been asked for an urgent appropriation of $28million plus $5,000aday interest to pay off a 1963 guaranteed railroad loan to the Reading Company, according to testimony released today.

title: Morton Sets Investigation
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) Rogers C. B. Morton, Secretary of the Interior, said today that his department would investigate the death of Yellow Thunder and had asked the Justice Department to look into the incident as well t odetermine whether any federal laws have been violated.

title: Dollar Down to New Lows
description: LONDON, March 8 (UPI)Suitalned selling orders drove the dollar's price down to new lows today in several key European markets. Dealers in London, Zurich and. Frankfurt said trading was hectic.

title: T.W.A. jet Damaged in Las Vegas Blast
description: A bomb heavily damaged an unoccupied. Trans World Airlines jet in Las Vegas yesterday in what was apparently part of the $2:million extortion plot against the airline.

title: PRICE COMMISSION ACCUSED BY REID
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 Representative Ogden R. Reid accused the Price Commission today of Irregularities and violations of Its own rules in its dealings With the New York Telephone Company and filed a petition with the commission demanding it require the company, to roll back a $350million rate increase.

title: METS'
description: LAKELAND, Fla., March 8 The New York Mets won their third straight exhibition today with a 43 victory over the Detroit Tigers in a 12inning game marked by the return of Tom Seaver.

title: PRESIDENT ORDERS LIMIT ON LABELING OF DATA AS SECRET
description: WASHINGTON, March 8President Nixon signed today an Executive order to limit the secrecy surrounding Federal documents, a major source of information about the Government.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Secondary offerings of common Stock in two newspaper organizations were announced yesterday.

title: MEMO ON THALER IS CITED AT TRIM
description: Former State Senator Seymour Thaler was quoted yesterday as having told insurance investigators he was shocked to learn he had sold stolen securities and wanted to return the profit he had made on the deal.

title: Royals Beat Suns, 122105
description: CINCINNATI, March 8 (UPI) The Cincinnati Royals scored 42 points in the final period tonight and gained a 122105 victory over the Phoenix Suns in the N.R.A.

title: League Postpones Decision On Sale of Cleveland Team
description: SARASOTA, Fla., March 8 (AP)American League club owners, after a sevenhour meeting today, postponed a decision on the $9million sale of the Cleveland Indians to a group of five Cleveland businessmen.

title: Oliphant Brokerage House Proposes Pubic Offering
description: Jas. H. Oliphant & Co., Inc., said yesterday it has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for a proposed public offering of 300,000 common shares. Oliphant, founded in 1898, is a member firm of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Stars Win, 114113
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 8 (AP)Red Robbins's tipin at the buzzer gave the Utah Stars 114113 American Basketball Association victory over the Pittsburgh Condors.

title: U.S. Team Wins 5th in Row In World Softball at Manila
description: MANILA, March 8 (AP) The defending champion United States team beat Taiwan, 32, with a run in the last of the ninth inning today for its fifth straight victory in the world's men's softball championship.

title: A. WARD LAFRANCE OF FIRE TRUCK FIRMS
description: ELMIRA, N. Y., March 8 (AP) A. Ward LaFrance, founder of a company that manufactures fire trucks died today in ArnotOgden Hospital. He was 87 years old.

title: HOUSE BUSING VOTE BARS COMPROMISE WITH THE SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, March. 8 The House, by a margin of nearly 2 to 1, voted today to take an uncompromising stand against the Senate and insist on its own strong language in legislation to restrict the use of busing to achieve school desegregation.

title: Notes on People
description: At a dinner of the Harvard Club last night, Joseph P. Lash, author of the biography Eleanor and Franklin, received the 16th annual Francis Parkman Prize, presented by the Society of American Historians, to stimulate the writing of history as literature. Mr. Lash's book about Mr. and. Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt won him the society's, bronze medal and a cash prize of $500.

title: CANADIENS DOWN PENGUINS, 5 TO 4
description: PITTSBURGH, March 8 (UPI) Montreal scored on its first two shots tonight but had to get a thirdperiod goal by Jim Roberts to snap a 33 tie and defeat the Pittsburgh Penguins, 54. It was the Canadiens seventh consecutive victory in the National Hockey League.

title: 2d British Soccer Star Is Sold for $520,000
description: LONDON, March 8 (AP)Rodney March, a forward for the Queen's Park Rangers, was sold, to the Manchester City soccer team for $520,000 today, 36 hours before the deadline for player moves In the British Soccer League.

title: Bruins Triumph, 54
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., March 8 (AP)The Boston Bruins rallied from. three twogoal deficits tonight to beat the Minnesota North Stars, 54, on Johnny Bucyks's thirdperiod powerplay goal.

title: State Legislature Remaps Congressional Districts
description: ALBANY, March 8The State Legislature approve new Congressional District lines tonight. They action, reflecting, twoseat drop in New York City was taken over the prOtestations of black, Democrats who charged that BrooklYn had been racially gerrymandered.

title: ECOLOGY IS THEME OF TY MARATHON
description: A 12hour television program: on ecology and the environment, bringing together many of the world's leading experts and clone in cooperation with the United Nations, will be presented by WARTV Tuesday, March 21,. from 6 A.M. to 6 P.M. The marathon program, which will be uninterrupted by commercials, will also be carried in whole or partly by more than 50 other stations around the country.

title: 7 IN ALLENDE CAMP VOTE AGAINST VETO
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 8 (Reuters)Members of a party that normally supports Chile's Marxist President, Salvador Allende Gossems, split with his popular Unity coalition in Congress last night to oppose his stand on a broadcasting bill.

title: Communists File a Ticket In Pennsylvania for Nov. 7
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 8 The Communist party today; entered Gus Hall for President and Jarvis Tyner for Vice Presi, dent on the Pennsylvania ballot in the Nov. 7 general elections:.

title: Sanford, ExGovernor, Runs In Carolina for White House
Whose Fault?
description: The public hearings on State Senator Bernard Gordon's nofault automobile insurance bill paradoxically proved both the validity of the nofault approach and also the difficulty of winning its enactment into law. Senator Gordon himself is now talking about having to modify his bill, when to modify it materially is to weaken it and, perhaps, to undermine the nofault principle.

title: Rape Suspect Sketch Issued Here
description: The Police Department issued, yesterday an artist's composite sketch of a man wanted for the rapeslaying of a young receptionist.

title: The Alcohol Scourge
description: A dismaying accounting of the high cost of excessive drinking has been sent to Congress by the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism. Alcohol addiction warps some nine million lives, costs about $15 billion annually, causes directly or indirectly almost half, of all arrests in this country, and accounts for about 28,000 motor vehicle deaths each year. Alcohol abusers shorten their life span by ten to twelve years and cause incalculable grief to their unfortunate families.

title: Vessel Said to Be Moving
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) The disabled Soviet submarine in the North Atlantic has been sighted moving ahead under its own power, the Pentagon reported today. The Pentagon spokesman, Jerry W. Friedheim, said the vessel was moving at a speed of about three knots at irregular intervals, apparently still experiencing difficulty.

title: Phone Concern Disciplines 67 Over Actions in Strike
description: The New York Telephone Company yesterday discharged 13 union members and suspended 54 others throughout the state for alleged acts. of misconduct diving the sevenmonth strike by the Communications Workers of America.

title: NEPALA RETAINS LEAD IN SKATING
description: CALGARY, Alberta, March 8 (AP)Ondrej. Nepala of Czechoslovakia, the defender, took commanding lead after the men's compulsories in the world figure skating championships today.

title: Rangers, Hawks Battle To a Wordy 33 Draw
Children! Children! Closes
description: Children, Children, the Jack Horrigan play, starring Gwen Verdon in her first nonmusical role, closed at the Ritz Theater on Tuesday evening after its first performance. Arthur Whitelaw, Seth Harrison and Ben Girard were the producers of the $125,000 offering.

title: Chess: Kevitz Sets Pace in Race For Manhattan Club Title
description: The 14man roundrobin race for the Manhattan Chess Club championship continues, with Alex Kevitz, leading on a score of 31/211/2. A top echelon player who was on the American team when the United States met the Soviet contingent in 1956, Kevitz has annexed the club title in the decade of the twenties, thirties, forties and fifties.

title: Senate Weighs Bill to Allow Registration by Post Card
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (UPI)The Senate began heated (debate today on a Democratic bill that would permit eligible, voters nationwide to register by post card for Federal elections. Republicans fear that it is a scheme to swell the ranks of registered Democrats, for the November election.

title: South Vietnamese Come Under Attack Near the DMZ
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 8 (AP)  Ten enemy rocket and mortar attacks were reported today against South, Vietnamese bases guarding the demilitarized zone between North and South Vietnam.

title: Squires Triumph, 127117
description: NORFOLK, Va., March 8 (AP)  The Virginia Squires placed six men in double figures tonight and scored a 127117 American Basketball Association victory over the Floridians.

title: Opera: Beverly Sills Dons Crown as Scots Queen
Akron Lawyer's Tangled Affairs Are Aired at Bankruptcy Hearing
description: AKRON, Ohio, March 8The tangled affairs of D. Don Lowers became a little less, tangled in a bankruptcy hearing today, to the dismay of hundreds of Akronites.

title: Man Found Crushed By Many Vehicles On Busy Road Here
description: For half an hour, according to the police, numerous vehicles ran over the body of an elderly man who had been struck by a vehicle Tuesday afternoon on the heavily traveled eastbound lane of the Cross Bronx Expressway below the Jerome Avenue overpass.

title: Statewide Pension Plan Asked By Seven Senators in Albany
description: ALBANY, March 8Seven upstate Republican State Sen. ators have introduced legislation to freeze state pension systems at their current membership and create a statewide pension system covering all governmental employes.

title: Scrooge Goes to the Races
description: No sooner does New York City find a deVice for adding a few million dollars a year to its revenues than the Mate comes along to grab control of the money. That is the apparent purpose of the bill pending Albany to take over the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation as part of a general overhaul of the state's racing laws.

title: Jackson Claims Gains in 6,000 Precinct Caucuses in Washington
description: SEATTLE, March 8A coalition that is opposed to the nomination of Senator Henry M. Jackson for the Presidency claimed today to have withheld at least five delegates to the. Democratic convention, and possibly as many as 18, from the favorite son.

title: INQUIRY ORDERED IN INDIAN'S DEATH
description: GORDON, Neb., March 8 With smoke from a peace pipe hanging in the air, several, hundred Sioux Indians headed back toward their reservations tonight after persuading the state and officials of this remote northwest Nebraska town to reinvestigate the death of member of their tribe.

title: U.S. Official Briefs Thailand's Leaders On the Nixon Visit
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 8 (AP)Assistant Secretary of State Marshall Green met with Thailand's leaders today on his tour to brief Asian leaders on President Nixon's China visit.

title: Mills Quoted as Predicting Action on Revenue Sharing
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, was quoted today as saying he felt confident that his committee would soon approve a revenuesharing bill.

title: Executive Changes
description: J. N. Cooke has been elected senior vice president of Sterling Drug, Inc. Earl G. Tyree has been appointed to succeed Mr. Cooke as president and chief executive officer of Glenbrook Laboratories, division of Sterling.

title: MOSCOW FAVORABLE ON ROGERS MESSAGE
description: MOSCOW, March 8  Tess, the Soviet press agency, reported today on Secretary of State William P. Rogers's message to Congress on American foreign policy, with a soberly balanced account of SovietAmerican relations.

title: HAMILTON REBUTS STATE ON RELIEF
description: Deputy Mayor Edward K. Hamilton lashed out yesterday at State Welfare Inspector General George F. Berlinger, and declared New York City led the nation in all aspects of administrative reform and innovation in welfare.

title: SOKOL CONDUCTS ORCHESTRAL UNIT
description: The National Orchestral Association is a training organization that rightly attaches more importance to rehearsal than public performance. It does, however, play a concert now and then to let its supporters know how things are going, and this season it is giving these concerts increased usefulness and interest by focusing attention upon deserving guest conductors and by venturing outside the symphoniq repertory for its programs. At Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night, the ensemble was led by Thomas Sokol, primarily a choral man, who brought along the Dessoff Choirs, which he directs, to sing with the orchestra and offer a couple of numbers alone.

title: Berrigan Trial Witness Says He Weighed Informer Career
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 8 Boyd F. Douglas Jr., the Goverment's star witness against the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and six other antiwar activists, said today that he considered making a career out of betraying radicals and leftists soon after he began informing on the Berrigan group to the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: 10% of Hunter's SEEK Students. Make Dean's List or Honor Roll
description: More than 10 per cent of 937 SEEK students at Hunter College are either on the dean's list or the program's honor roll, the college announced yesterday.

title: Girl, 8, Dies of Dog Wounds
description: MANTECA, Calif., March 8 (UPI)DaWn Quintal, an 8yearold girl,: died yesterday of injuries suffered when she was mauled by a 200 pound St. Bernard dog. The child died of wounds received Sunday when the dog. her as she watched building construction work near her home.

title: YAAKOV HERZOG, ISRAELI AIDE, 50
description: TEL AVIV, March 8Dr. Yaakov Herzog, former Israeli Minister to Washington, died in Jerusalem tonight at the age of 50. He was serving at present as director general of the Premier's office.

title: Apartment House To Contain Chapel Of Mormons Here
description: The Mormon Church, reviving a style of building popular in Manhattan between the two World Wars, will establish house of worship within the walls of a 32story apartment hoUse to be built on Lincoln Square.

title: PUMA AND WAYNE SHINE ON GUITARS
description: Since the guitar duo of George Barnes and Bucky Pizzarelli broke up. and went their separate ways in January, the St. Regis Room in the St. Regis Sheraton Hotel has been trying to maintain the guitar atmosphere that the Barnes and Pizzarelli team established during its ninemonth run there. Guitarists, singularly, and in pairs, have drifted in and out but now a newly organized duo, Joe Puma and Chuck Wayne, has settled in hopes of the BarnesPizzarelli tradition.

title: In the Rustic Vermont Hills Chefs Show a Fine Flair
description: RAWSONVILLE, Vt.  Snow has finally come to the slopes this season, and, with it, skiers looking, not only for packed powder and uncrowded lifts, but also in search of a good meal after the last schuss of the day down Stratton Mountain or Big Bromley. In this area, up until the last two weeks or so, excellent dining has been easier to find than excellent snow conditions.

title: Little Orchestra Society Gives Rare Manfred by Schumann
description: Schumann's Manfred is an attempt to do the very difficult if not the impossible. His concert setting of Byron's, poem uses readers (or actors), singers, chorus and orchestra, and the composer never found a satisfactory mixture.

title: ' Tales From the Crypt':Richardson Plays Host of 5 Related Stories Theme Are Noted for Ancient Plot Devices
description: In one of the five vaguely related stories that make up "Tales From the Crypt," a philandering husband dreams that he and his mistress are in a terrible automobile accident, only to awaken to find that  well  you can probably guess.In another story, a very dim spin-off of "Freaks," the inmates at a home for blind old men rebel against the repressive rule of the home's director, a nasty ex-Army major who is inclined to remind them: "In the kingdom of the blind, even a one-eyed man is king."In a third story, it is Christmas Eve in a house that looks like a collection of model rooms in a department store. Joan Collins puts her daughter to bed, goes downstairs and splits Daddy's skull with a poker, and then hears over the radio that a homicidal maniac has escaped and is heading her way. With an embarrassing immediacy, a strange face appears at the window. . . .If "Tales From the Crypt" had any style whatsoever, the philandering husband's dream would not come true, the blind old men would possibly fail, and we might even find ourselves rooting for old Joan in her extremity, despite her momentary lapse in manners.Unfortunately, the only style exhibited by Freddie Francis, who directed the film, and Milton Subotsky, who wrote it, is in their dumb appreciation for ancient plot devices, and especially in their high-handedness with other people's stories, including "The Monkey's Paw." This they steal for one episode in which the characters have the poor taste to keep reminding each other that what's happening is just what happened in the classic W. W. Jacobs story.Four years ago, Mr. Subotsky (as the co-producer) and Mr. Francis collaborated on a similar but much wittier compendium, "Torture Garden," which was written by Robert Bloch and included one of horror fiction's most bizarre inventions, a jealous piano."Tales From the Crypt" is not, strictly speaking, a horror film at all, although it has its share of silly supernatural effects. Its people are small and spiteful and their bad ends exhibit the kind of heavy morality I associate less with fine horror fiction than with cautionary literature designed to persuade children to brush their teeth.The cast is familiar but not terribly good. Sir Ralph Richardson, dressed in monk's cloth, acts as the host. He is almost always interesting to watch, even in junk like this. There is no other actor in the English-speaking theater who could pronounce the word "plans" and somehow break it up into five syllables.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SINISTER U.S. PLANS SEEN BY MRS. GANDHI
description: NEW DELHI, March 8 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Indira Gandhi accused the United States tonight of planning something sinister for India and said that renewed American charges of Indian aggression against Pakistan were laying the groundwork for such actions.

title: Job Rights Bill Is Cleared By Congress, 303 to 110
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 The House, with little opposition, ended nearly a decade. of. Congressional debate today over whether the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission should have any way to enforce its findings of job discrimination.

title: Colonels Down Cougars
description: RALEIGH, N. C., March 8 (AP)The Kentucky Colonels withstood a fourthquarter rally by the Carolina Cougars tonight and gained a 98.96 American Basketball Association victory. It was the Colonels 10th triumph in a row over Carolina this season.

title: Patriots Sign Linebacker
description: FOXBORO, Mass., March 8 (UPI)  Ron Kadziel, a linebacker from Stanford, signed with the New England Patriots as a free agent today.

title: Personal Finance: Help for Debtors
description: Have you ever been asked to pay a bill that you paid a long time ago or a bill that you don't know anything about?

title: CASEY DEFENDS MEMBER BARRIER
description: WASHINGTON, March 8William J. Casey, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, defended today in harsh language the commission's decision to prohibit stockexchange membership by brokers whose primary purpose is to handle securities transactions for affiliated institutions.

title: Surplus Food? The Senator Decides It Doesn't Taste So Awful After All
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Senator Richard S. Schweiker of Pennsylvania sank his photogenic teeth into the chicken pt while Sophie Leavitt gazed at him expectantly.

title: Army Adds to Olin Contract
description: The Olin Corporation received a $14million addition to an Army contract for operation of the Badger ammunition plant at Baraboo, Wis., it was announced yesterday.

title: Dr. Shelden D. Elliott, 65, Dies; Was on the N.Y.U. Law Faculty
description: Dr. Sheldon, Douglass Elliott, former dean of the University of Southern California Law School and a legal scholar at New York University Law School, died on Tuesday in convalescent home at Lone Pine, Calif. He was 65 years old.

title: DOLLAR POUNDED IN TRADING ABROAD
description: PARIS, March 8The dollar was pounded today in the wake of the Common Market's agreement to create a European monetary zone.

title: Bridges Sees Dock Peace
description: MONTEREY, Calif., March 8 (AP)Harry Bridges, president of the International Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Union, yesterday predicted peace on the Pacific Coast waterfronts for the next 10 to 20 years if the Pay Board approves his union's new contract. The settlement Feb. 20 ended a 134day strike that closed 24 West Coast ports.

title: Kidnapped firehouse Watchdog Is Retuned Here
description: A firehouse watchdog, that was said by firemen to have been kidnapped and taken to Massachusetts, was returned yesterday to its home at Engine Company 2 on West 43d Street.

title: U.S. JUDGE BARS KNOXVILLE BUSING
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., March 8 Federal District Judge Robert L. Taylor ruled today that, the Knoxville school system was in compliance with recent Supreme Court decisions, on school desegregation and ruled out busing as a means of achieving a better racial balance.

title: Bunker Issues Quotation Device
description: The Bunker Ramo Corporation introduced yesterday a new type of stockquotation device that can provide a composite picture of prices for stocks traded on more than one stock exchange.

title: GRISSOM'S WIDOW TO GET $350,000
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., March 8 (AP)  The widow of Lieut Col. Virgil L. Grissom, one of three astronauts killed in 1967 in the fire in the Apollo spacecraft, has agreed to $350,000 outofcourt settlement of her $20million suit against North American Rockwell Corporation and three subsidiaries, her attorney said today.

title: I.C.C.'s Report on Pennsy Scores Role of ExChief
description: WASHINGTON, March 8The strongest criticism yet leveled at Stuart T. Saunders, former railroad executive, for his personal part in the Penn Central's bankruptcy, came in a 161page brief issued today by the Interstate Commerce Commission's Bureau of enforcement,

title: Clues From a Primary
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., March 8Before the votes were counted in the New Hampshire primary, the candidates reacted so loudly to what they guessed the pundits were going to say that analysis after the fact seems almost superfluous.

title: Denny's Wins Court Case
description: A Federal District Court in Portland, Ore., yesterday dismiised a suit filed againstii Denny's Restaurants, Inc., by one of its franchisees. The action had alleged that Denny's franchise agreements violated certain antitrust laws,. The suit was brought by Charles A. Van Landingham on Feb. 28.

title: National General's Profit Rises Other Companies Issue Reports
Cricket Kendall Dies at 65; Publicist for Film Concern
description: Mrs. Cricket Edwards Kendall, publicity director of Highroad Productions, a film production company that made Born Free, McKenna's Gold and The Mouse That Roared, among others,. died of a heart attack yesterday in New York Hospital. She was 65 years old and lived at 159 West 53d Street.

title: Chicagoan Pleads Guilty
description: CHICAGO, March 8 (AP)A Chicago man who pleaded guilty to a charge that he tried to extort $22,000 from American Airlines in a bomb scare plot was sentenced today to three years in prison.

title: Bridge: 2 New Books by Kantar Deal With Conventions and Bidding
description: The West Coast's most active bridge expert, who plays, writes and teaches with equal enthusiasm and ability, has recently completed two books of importance to all serious students of the game. One is Bridge Conventions (106 pages, $4) and the other is Bridge Bidding Made Easy (256 pages, $5).

title: Wedding of Franco's Granddaughter Attended by 2,000
description: MADRID, March 8Gen eralissimo Francisco Franco joined his funny with the Spanish. royal dynaSty today as he gaye his eldest granddaughtert Maria del Caiinen. MartinezBordiu Franco, in marriage to Alfonso de Borbon y Dampierre.

title: Bloc in House Maps a Tax Reform Bill
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Representative Henry S. Reuss, Democrat of Wisconsin, announced today the details of a tax reform bill he will introduce on March 16 if the Nixon Administration has not made its own reform proposals by then.

title: Bishop in Portugal Is Accused Of Maligning the Aimed Forces
description: LISBON, March 8  The leading liberal churchinan in this largely conservative Roman Catholic country has been accused in the National Assembly of having unjustly and wrongly treated Portugal's armed forces and of having offended military chaplains.

title: Bulls Beat Hawks, 9896, Clinching Second Place
description: ATLANTA, March 8 (UPI)The Chicago Bulls clinched second place in the Midwest Division of the National Basketball Association and earned a playoff berth with a 9896 victory over the fastclosing Atlanta Hawks tonight.

title: Market Place: Realty Equities Discusses Past
description: The letter to shareholders reads like a comedy of errorserrors, that is, in the choice of accounting firms.  For the Reality Equities Corporation of New York, the March 6 letter indicates, has gone through four accounting firms in a quest for certification of its financial statements for three years running.

title: Senate Unit Outs Amount Of a Medicare Deduction
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) The Senate Finance Committee removed from the Social Securitywelfare reform bill today a House provision to Increase from $50 to $60 the deductibilities under Part B of Medicare.

title: Actress Pleads for Animal Welfare
description: Show breeders were urged to channel some of their efforts toward animal welfare work by Gretchen Wyler at the Dog Fanciers Club luncheon in the Hotel McAlpin yesterday. The actress recently was elected to the board of managers of the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, the first woman named to the board in the organization's 106 years.

title: GOVERNMENT UNION SEEKS NEW AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 The head of the nation's biggest government employe union called today for a new and separate agency to regulate labormanagement relations in the public sector as the House's Special Subcommittee on Labor opened hearings today on a new national law for public employes,

title: Gold Aide Suspended in Failure To Prosecute a Narcotics Case
description: An assistant district attorney in Brooklyn was suspended yesterday, charged with having failed to preient to a grand jury a case involving a politically conneoted correction officer accused of the possession of more than $200,000 worth of cocaine.

title: BENJAMIN BLEIFELD
description: Benjamin Bleifeld, who retired in 1967 as president of London Fabrics, Inc., died on Sunday in North Miami Beach. He was 75 years old and lived at 2205 East 12th Street, Brooklyn.

title: Albany Votes $350,000 for Panel Investigating City
description: ALBANY, March 8The Republicancontrolled Legislature tonight approved a $350,000 appropriation for the state commission investigating New York's City's governmental operations after a debate centering on the feud between Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay.

title: BOONE THE GREAT SCORES BY A NOSE
description: BOWIE, Md., March 8 (AP) Boone the Great, winner of one division of the Campbell Handicap last month, scored by a nose over Amber Hawk today in the feature at Bowie Race Course.

title: No. Dakota Gains in Curling
description: CHICAGO, March 8 (AP)North Dakota, the defending champion, beat Michigan, 64, today in the United States men's national curling championship and moved a halfgame ahead of Massachusetts, which was idle in the sixth draw.

title: Yuksel Menderes, 42, Dies; Son of ExTurkish Premier
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 8Yuksel Menderes, a prominent politician and eldest son of Adnan Menderes, the former Turkish Premier who was executed in 1961, was found dead today. The police said he committed suicide.

title: Auto Talks Resume
description: LORDSTOWN, Ohio, Mar 8 (UPI)Under a threat that a third facility might be shut doWn, negotiations reamed today in an attempt, to end a strike that has idled 7,800 workers at the huge General Motors Corporation complex here. Members of Local 1112, United Automobile Workers, struck the Vega production line and the Fisher Body plant last Saturday. They threatened to close a. fabricating plant that employs 2,200 workers by the end of the week.

title: Advertising:
description: Sudler & Hennessey, a major ad agency in the healthcare field, has just got its first batch of business from the Wallace Pharmaceuticals division of CarterWallace, Inc.

title: ROGERS DEFENDS ASIAN ALLIANCES
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 Secretary of State William P. Rogers rejected a suggestion today that because of, the current irnprovement in relations with China the United States should reexamine its need for military alliances in Asia.

title: It's Election Meeting Time in Poland
description: CRACOW, Poland, March 2Professor, Kaczmarek can't do everything! a steelworker shouted during an election meeting at the Lenin Steel Works near here. The worker listed various positions that had been held by Jan Kaczmarek, Poland's chief scientific adviser. Then he continued his attack.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Arthur Daley
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 8Solutions never come simply to the New York Mets. Although their own traditions are a mite on the skimpy side, they seem to have inherited the rather bizarre traditions of the old Brooklyn Dodgers, especially those (involving the eternal snafu. Just as the Mets seemed to have solved one perpetual problem by installing Jim Fregosi as their third baseman, the 46th in a long and undistinguished line, the newest hotshot at the hot corner broke his thumb the other day.

title: DOG HELPS YOUTHS ROB A BRONX MAN
description: Three 15yearold youths were arraigned yesterday in Children's Court on charges they had used a 90pound Doberman pinscher to attack man on a Harlem street while they stole $5 from his pockets.

title: EDMOND L. BROWN
description: STAMFORD, Conn., March 8  Edmond L. Brown, an early advocate of the singletax theories of Henry George, died of heart failure at his home here on Sunday. He was 77 years old.

title: War Alert Sent in Hoax By a Coast Guardsman
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 8 (UPI)  An enlisted man standing watch sent a hoax message to ships at sea during President Nixon's visit to China, saying the President had been assassinated and the Vice President had declared World War HI, the Coast Guard revealed yesterday.

title: Bingham and Scheuer to Let Convention Decide
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 Representatives Jonathan B. Bingham and James H. Scheuer, who gave the Reform Democratic movement in New York two of its most significant victories eight years ago, agreed today to let a Reform convention decide next Tuesday which one will run in a newly drawn Bronx Congressional district.

title: E. KENTUCKY GAINS BERTH IN TOURNEY
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., March 8 (AP)Eastern Kentucky spotted Morehead State a 6point lead early in the first half, then wore down the Eagles for a 9886 Ohio Valley Conference playoff victory and a berth in next week's National Collegiate Athletic Association tournament.

title: NIXON GRATEFUL FOR PRIMARY VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, March 8President Nixon's political operatives and the White House said today that they regarded the balloting in New Hampsire yesterday as an, affirmation of his policies and of his lowkey approach to the early primaries.

title: ACCUSED IN ITALY NAMED CANDIDATE
description: ROME, March 8Italy's new proPeking party, Manifesto, announced today, that it had asked the main defendant in sensational terrorism trial to be its candidate for Parliament In the forthcoming general elections.

title: Ithaca Sends Emergency Call for Its Quintet
description: Anyone knowing the whereabouts of Mike Williams, 21 years old, 6 feet 4 inches tall and an excellent shot, or the whereabouts of Ken Nigh, Tom. Downey and Brian Chafin should get in touch with Hugh Hurst, Ithaca College basketball coach, at 6072770151, Hurst has been trying to locate these members of his team since Ithaca received an une x p e c t e d bid Tuesday to the National Collegiate Athletic Association's college division tournament.

title: TV: On Ars Americana
description: There's Clifford Odets and there's Will Rogers., Both happen to be represented on television specials this week and, in obviously different ways, both prompt reflections on the precarious state of what might be laboriously called Ars Americana.

title: A $5.4Billion Borrowing Is Planned by Treasury
description: The Treasury disclosed yesterday that it planned to borrow $5.4billion of additional funds between now and the end of April.

title: MISS EVERT GAINS A 62, 64 VICTORY
description: DALLAS, March 8 (UPI)Chris Evert and Rosemary Cassis breezed into the second round of the 30,000 Maureen Connolly Brinker tennis tournament today with straightset victories.

title: C. H. Webb Dies on Yacht During Solo World Cruise
description: PORT STANLEY, Falkland Islands, March 8 (AP)C. H. (Rusty) Webb, British solo yachtsman, collapsed and died today at the tiller of his 29foot yacht, Flyd, outbound from Stanley Harbor on the next leg of a world cruise. He was 58 years old.

title: PHYLLIS FINE SUSSMAN
description: HARTSDALE, N. Y., March 8 Mrs. Phyllis Fine Sussman, painter and the wife of Albert Sussman, executive vice president of the International Council of Shopping Centers, died today at their home, 24 Beechwood Road. She was 52 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ' Dagmar's Hot Pants, Inc.' Bows on Local Screens
description: For fun, if not steam, "Tillie's Punctured Romance" (1928) is way ahead of "Dagmar's Hot Pants, Inc.," which packed 'em in yesterday on good old 42d Street. Opening at the Liberty Theater and other, houses, this Danish-made, English-language pastry is coy, soft-core pornographythe "Oh, doctor" kindthat is occasionally funny almost in spite of itself.The picture is far from sizzlingDagmar, pants and corporation includedand it certainly is more suggestively infantile than offensive. Judging by the cast of pretty Nordic wigglers and flabby middle-aged men, it looks as though a road company of "Up in Mabel's Room" got stranded in Copenhagen and raced for the nearest color camera, shedding clothes on the way.For the first half of the picture, the simpering, red-haired heroine, played by Diana Kjaer, entertains various clients, among them Robert Strauss (far from Hollywood), a detective, a squealing, dimwit boy (this sequence is right out of burlesque) and two Japanese businessmen. One of the latter correctly notes that Miss Kjaer is "built like a brick pagoda."Dagmar, however, turns out to be a "sweet, sensitive and moral" girl, in spite of it all. Copenhagen's Little Orphan Annie (with a teddy bear instead of Sandy) is actually putting a young medical student through school. It's the old storyDagmar's cold cash and a heart of gold.

title: Biggest Thrift Unit Resigns From 2 Trade Associations
description: LOS ANGELES, March 8The nation's largest savings and loan association has resigned from the industry's largest trade associations, the United States Savings and Loan League and the California Savings and Loan League.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Troubles Ahead, for Okinawa
description: STANFORD, Calif.Any American who thinks that returning Okinawa to the Japanese homeland is bringing cheers from a grateful populace ought to visit Okinawa to see what is going on.

title: 54% of the Population In Soviet Are Women
description: MOSCOW, March 8 (Reuters)There are more than 131 million Soviet women, or just under 54 per cent of the population of 241 million according to statistics published today.

title: Tougher Standards issued For Brakes on Motorcycles
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (Reuters)The Department of Transportation issued today tough new motorcycle brake standards.

title: Joint Undertaking Seeks to Aid Minority Economic Enterprises
description: A joint undertaking, aimed at providing required financial underpinnings for minority economic development in the New York metropolitan area, was announced here yesterday.

title: G.O.P. OPTIMISTIC ON ECOLOGY BONDS
description: ALBANY, March 8The Republican chairmen of the Conservation Committees of the Senate and the Assembly expressed optimism today over a proposed $1.2billion bond issue to pay for air, water and land environmental projects in the state during the next five years.

title: A Baby Auction of Children So Few Want
description: City officials called it a baby auction. But it wasn't really an auction and there weren't any babies, although it was held in New York Foundling Hospital.

title: BIG TEN UPHOLDS BAN ON PLAYERS
description: CHICAGO, March 8 (AP)The Big Ten refused today to lift the suspension of two Minnesota basketball players.

title: Maye Defends Fire Union's $1,500 Gift to the Lindsay Campaign
description: After weathering a day of angry complaints from firemen about their union's gift of $1,500 to Mayor Lindsay's Presidential campaign, Michael J. Maye, president of th Uniformed Firefighters Association, issued a onesentence defense of the contribution last evening.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Oddly enough, a lot of people have been surprised to learn that the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation is putting up $400,000 (or maybe $100,000; the figures are still confused) to help pay for the Republican National Convention in San Diego this August.

title: A New Yankee Rates Ted Williams's Ego
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 8Pitchers never liked to pitch to Ted Williams and now there's a growing feeling that players don't like to play for him.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Education President Nixon announced the appointment of nine educators and business and labor executives to serve as members of the Board of Vocational Education.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today March 9, 1972
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: CAPITOL'S FRONT TO BE EXTENDED
description: WASHINGTON, March 8A commission of top. Congressional leaders ordered today that work be resumed on plans to extend the West Front of the Capitol.

title: Hertz and Hyatt in Pact
description: The Hertz Corporation and the Hyatt Corporation announced yesterday they had concluded an arrangement under which Hertz rentacar service will be made available through installations at all Hyatt hotels and motels throughout the world. The new agreement covers 66 Hyatt hotels, houses. and lodges and will include new units opened during the term of the arrangement.

title: Advertising:
description: If you're looking for a very happy person, look first for a very religious married woman who is between 18 and 34 years of age, making between $8,000 and $14,000 a year with her high school diploma, from a small family and has seven or more friends.

title: Adulthoodat18 Bill Gains
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., March 8 (AP)The Rhode Island House passed today without audible dissent a bill to reduce the age of majority from 21 to 18. The measure would give those 18 and older all the rights and resporisibilities of adulthood, now withheld until the age of 21. It was sent to the Senate.

title: Leftists Kidnap Renault Official, Link Him With Maoist's Slaying
description: PARIS, March 8A Minor executive of the Renault automobile works was kidnapped today by a group of extreme leftists in retaliation for the killing of a young Maoist 12 days ago.

title: Pakistan Sees Brutal Act
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, March 8Pakistan charged tonight that India had committed a shocking and brutal act by firing on Pakistani prisoners of war and said that the incident was a setback to all the efforts we have been making to solve our problems.

title: Hope for the Big Cities: A 10 M.P.H. Sidewalk
description: LONDON, March 8  The dev,elopment of a new way of moving people around. cities, on belts traveling 10 miles an hour through tubes with a controlled environment, was announced today, by Dunlop, Ltd. the tire manufacturers. The company said that the system, a refinement of the moving sidewalks already in use at air and bus terminals, fairs and shopping centers, was noisefree and pollutionfree and easy to build and maintain. It added that the belts were capable of moving 30,000 people an hour across Manhattan and could show a profit at a fare of only 5 cents a ride.

title: Tour of City's Penal System Stirs Businessmen
Barely Even Triumphs
description: MIAMI, March 8 (UPI) Barely Even won by a nose today in the $33,850 Jasmine Stakes at Hialeah.

title: HELL UNDERWOOD, EXFEDERAL JUDGE
description: NEW LEXINGTON, Ohio, March 8 (AP)Mell G. Underwood, a former Federal judge and Congressman whose career in public service covered nearly half a century, died on his farm near here today. He was 80 years old.

title: Intense Fire by Snipers in Ulster Riot Charged
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 8A British Army sergeant said today that gunfire directed at his unit during the Londonderry demonstrations in which 13 Roman Catholics were killed was the most intense had experienced in 20 months of service in Northern Ireland.

title: I.T.T. Reports New Highs In Sales and Profit for 71
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation reported yesterday its 12th consecutive year of new highs in sales and earnings. The record earnings in 1971 excluded an extraordinary nonrecurring charge of $70million, or 60 cents a share, applicable to Chilean operations.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Marine Study
description: Students who are interested in marine science would do well to attend the American Littoral Society's fifth annual symposium, Your Future in the Sea1972, on Saturday at Hunter College, Park Avenue and 68th Street.

title: Invasion of Taiwan: The Price for Peking Would Be High
description: The Nixon Administration, as part of its explanation that closer relations with Peking will not endanger Taiwan's independence, asserts that China will not in the foreseeable future possess the military strength to take the island by force. This view has been aired by Henry A. Kissinger and other Presidential aides in contacts with newsmen during Mr. Nixon's visit to China and since then. It rests, ac cording to wellplaced informants, on the present inadequacy of the Chinese capacity to transport sufficient troops by air or sea to mount a successful invasion.

title: Black Parley Aides Promise Admission Of White Newsmen
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 The three chairmen of the National Black Political Convention scheduled for Friday, Saturday and Sunday in Gary, Ind., said today that the convention would not condone the exclusion of any legitimate members of the press.

title: Controversy Over Cbairlift at Powder Ridge Area Ends
description: MIDDLEFIELD, Conn., March 7After a delay of almost a year, Powder Ridge's new fourplace chairliftthe only one in the Eastfinally, purred into action last Sunday.

title: Mansfield Assails Primaries
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (UPI) Senator Mike Mansfield, Democrat of Montana, believes Presidential primaries held on a state level are useless and worthless and should he replaced by a nationwide primary. The Senate Democratic leader said yesterday that he would soon propose a constitutional amendment to allow the national primary vote. I want to do away with conventions, too, Mr. Mansfield said.

title: Hospital Recalling Infants To Check on TB Exposure
description: CINCINNATI, March 8The University of Cincinnati Medical Center is conducting an intensive effort to bring in for examination approximately 500 infants as a result of the discovery that a nurse's aide has pulmonary tuberculosis.

title: China's Envoy to Ottawa Yao Kuang
description: Carrying his ownsultease across the airport apron in approved proletarian fashion, a slim, toughlooking, carcer. diplomat set out from Peking last Tuesday on a long journeyfirst to Shanghai then via Air France to Paristhat is to end today in Ottawa The traveler, accompanled by his short, whitehaired wife, is 51yearold Yao Kuang whose arrival in the Cariadian capital will end a yacancy in the Chinese ambassadorial post there that has existed since last November, when Ambassador. Huang Hua was transferred to. the United Nations as Peking's first representative there.

title: Securities Leader Urges SelfRegulatory Changes
description: Robert M. Gardiner, chairman of the Securities Industry Association, called last night for a restructuring of the selfregulatory system of the nation's securities markets.

title: Exacta at Yonkers Pays $4.20, Lowest Ever at the Track
description: YONKERS, March 8A record in reverse was set at Yonkers Raceway tonight when Scarpia ($2.60) led Drexel Vinnie, the 2to1 second choice in the third division of the Hopeful Pacing Series across the finish line by 2 lengths. The 72 combination paid $4.20, the lowest exacta payoff ever returned at the harness racing course.

title: PERSUASIONS REVIVE OLDIES BUT GOODIES
description: There's something about a capella harmonizations in rock stylethe fourpart and fivepart singing that must have taken place on every street corner in New York City in the late fifties that warms the heart of old rock n roll diehards. Monday night at the Gaslight Au Go Go, a superbly coordinated ensemble, called The Persuasions sang a set of oldies but goodies and conjured up the image of a time when we had another Republican President.

title: Courthouse Converted to Y.M.C.A. centr
description: Jail cells became gymnasium facilities yesterday as the Ridgewood Courthouse in Queens flew a grand opening banner across its front door, Celebrating its conversion to Y.M.C.A. sports and community center for people of all ages.

title: 2 U.S. Planes Crash
description: SAIGON, Thursday, March 9 (UPI)Two United States warplanes have crashed in the jungles of Indochina the United States command said today. One pilot was reported to have been rescued and two others were reported missing.

title: U.S. Starting a Drug Check On G.I.'s Arriving in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 8 (UPI)  The United States Army announced that starting today it would check arriving as well as departing servicemen for drug abuse.

title: William Peterson, 88, Dies; ExAd Agency President
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., March 8  William E. Peterson, who retired in 1954 as president of the Peterson & Kempner Advertising Agency of New York, died on Monday in Norwalk Hospital. He was 88 years old and lived here and in Woodstock, Vt.

title: Key West Under Curfew
description: KEY WEST, Fla., March 8 (UPI)A general curfew was imposed today on a predominantly black neighborhood after scattered incidents of rock and bottlethrowing were reported. Two persons were wounded by gunfire, and 10 persons were arrested during the incidents yesterday.

title: Hemisphere Museum Directors Close Meeting on Positive Note
Free University in Danger
description: When the Free University of Berlin was founded 1948, with substantial help from the United States Government and the Ford Foundation, it was intended as a model of democratic higher education. To succeed, the new institution needed to eliminate the ossified medieval traditions of German university control, break the stranglehold of reactionary nationalism among faculty and alumni, and prevent subversion by Stalinists Who had taken over the old university in East Berlin.

title: Soybean Futures Is Actively Traded On Chicago Board
description: Heavy buying and short covering near the close of trading on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday brought the prices of soybean futures up as much as 6 cents a bushel.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Double Exposure Danced by Burke; Astctrie Joins Bill
description: Alternate casting will not save Joe Layton's ballet Double Exposure. It is well beyond anyone's power to heal, but Astarte might benefit from a bit of freshening. Both were performed Tuesday evening by the City Center Joffrey Ballet.

title: McCloskey Hints Plans
description: PALO ALTO, March 8 (AP)  Representative McCloskey said today that he leaned toward seeking reelection.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: BAIL PLEA IS DENIED FOR BROTHERS HERE
description: A judge of the State Court or Appeals, denied yesterday an appeal for a hearing on a bail reduction sought by two brothers who have been in jail for more than a year on robbery charges.

title: BEAME INVESTIGATES LINDSAY VOLUNTEERS
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame initiated an investigation yesterday of city employes working for Mayor Lindsay in the Presidential primailes.

title: BLACKS IN HOUSE DENOUNCE F.C.C.
description: WASHINGTON, March 8The Congressional Black Caucus, charging that the Federal Communications Commission had clearly been abdicating its duty to see that the public air waves are used fairly, called on President Nixon today to appoint experienced blacks to the commission.

title: E.P.A., Starting Crackdovvn, Orders Pollution Curb by Plant in Delaware
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 8 The Federal Environmental protection Agency announced legal action today. to cut!) air pollution by a major Delaware power company.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX REGISTER A GAIN
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market. finished mostly higher yesterday in moderate trading.

title: Cambodian Assured
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, March 8 (Agence FrancePresse) Gen. Sisowath Sirik Matak, Acting Premier of Cambodia, said today that Assistant Secretary of State Green assured him yesterday that President Nixon's talks in Peking in no way affected the Cambodian situation.

title: 20,000Unit Coop Urged in Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY, March 8The builders of Coop City in the. Bronx met with Mayor Paul T. Jordan here today and proposed a series of studies that could lead to a 20,000unit cooperative apartAnent development along the, jersey City waterfront.

title: After New Hampshire
description: Whether the Democratic voter was for Muskie or McGovern, the Republican for Nixon or McCloskey, the results of the New Hampshire primary are encouraging, in at least one respect, to everyone in both parties who likes fair play and does not want to see gross abuse the power of the press.

title: Airlines Tightening Bomb Protection
description: The nation's airlines put the tightest security measures in their history into effect yesterday to deal with what they feared would be an epidemic of extortion attempts, with bombs secreted in jetliners.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: TOKYOAs a consequence of the implied shift in Asian relationships featured by President Nixon's Peking visit, Japan now finds itself in the delightful position of being simultaneously courted by all three superpowers, the United States, Russia and China.

title: Race FlareUps Mar Campaign in Florida
Thorndike Deland Sr., Founder Of Agency for Executives, Dies
