title: Slacks of the world uniteif possible; PanAfricanism or Communism; By George Padmore. 439 pp. New York: Doubleday & Co. $8.95.; African Congress; A Documentary of the First Modern PanAfrican Congress. Edited by imamu Amiri Baraka (Le Roi Jones). 512 pp. New York: William Morrow & Co. Cloth, $10. Paper, $4.95.
description: PanAfricanism, in one of its attributes, is black nationalism gone mad. To project the goal of PanAfricanism the political unification of black African states or of all groups or societies of African descent wherever they arein fade of the widespread socioeconomic and technological deficiencies of both African states and black societies outside Africa (Haiti, the West Indies, the American Negro community, etc.), is courageous, at best, and political fantasy, at worst.

title: Art
description: IN his article Very Quiet and Very Dangerous, John Canaday raised the serious and timely question of museums exchanges or sales from their collections. While I quite agree that such transactions can be hazardous, Canaday's statements are sometimes misleading and contrary to fact certainly insofar as his references to the Museum of Modern Art are concerned.

title: U.P.I. Struck In Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., March 11 (UPI)  Employes of United Press International in Puerto Rico went on strike today after a breakdown in negotiations for a new labor contract.

title: Restoring Abused Environment Is Termed Task for Engineers
description: NEW BRUNSWICK  The preservation of the world's ecological balance, and the restoration of man's abused environment are too import. ant to the Survival of man to entrust to idealists; this is the pork of the, engineer. according to Dr. Elmer C. Easton, dean of the College of. Engineering of Rutgers Univirsity.

title: GLOBAL ECONOMY IS UNDER REVIEW
description: WASHINGTON, March 11An idea for a future world economy divided openly and purposely into several major blocs is circulating at the highest levels of the Nixon Administration.

title: In the Mailbox
description: To THE ED.TOR:

title: POINT OF VIEW; Corporate Structure Requires Radical Changes
description: Much has been said and written about President Nixon's new economic policies during the past few months. While establishing price and wage controls, seeking new tax reform and realigning world currency values are all important steps in establishing a kind of new economic ball game for the country, one key player is still missing from the roster: corporate management.

title: IN THE NATION
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif.When the California Supreme Court ruled last year that equal educational opportunity was not being provided in the state's various school districts, Superintendent of Public Instruction Wilson Riles was technically one of the losers in the case. In fact, however, Mr. Riles was in thorough agreement with the court. He had long known that young Tony Serrano, the plaintiff, and others like him were not getting equal treatment in such poor or disadvantaged school districts as East Los Angeles or Baldwin Park.

title: About Pro Basketball
description: Pro basketball's championship playoffs, otherwise known as the real season, are still more than two weeks off, but the alignments are virtually settled and there is doubt about the identity of only two of the 16 qualifiers.

title: U.S. AGENCIES SEEK LEGAL CRACKDOWN IN INFLATION FIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, March 11Concern is spreading through the Nixon Administration's economic stabilization apparatus about the absence of vigorous legal enforcement of its own wage, price and rent controls.

title: Population Panel Warns Growth Must Be Slowed
description: WASHINGTON, March 11America should slowand gradually stopthe growth of her population, the Commission on Population Growth and the American Future told President Nixon and Congress today.

title: The Nation
description: ALBANYIs Bella Abzug the silk stocking type? Would her swaggering style go over with the burghers of Staten Island? Is that floppy hat a bit much for Riverdale? Republican mapmakers in the State Legislature, closely aided by the Democratic establishment, raised such dismal questions for Mrs. Abzug by the manner in which they have dealt with the Congressional district she represents  the 19th, which includes lower Manhattan and parts of the East and West Sides.

title: The RailHolding Controversy Advocates Call Plan Essential To Survival
description: In the last three years the securities of railroadholding companies have become the major part of all rail shares traded on the New York Stock Exchange. Rail assets of the holding companies are more than half the assets of the rail industry, and account for 1,20,000 miles of the country's 2,00,000 miles of track.

title: MRS. RANKIN TIED FOR LEAD IN GOLF
The Guest Word
description: Mr. Torn Guinzburg, President,

title: Home Improvement
description: FEW people will argue with the fact that no home or apartment ever seems to have enough closet or storage spaceso it is not hard to understand why so many remodeling projects include plans for adding extra closets or increasing the amount of storage space available.

title: In battle and bed
description: Napoleon, Napoleon, Napoleon: One follows another, each a chimera, a legend, a fictionthe savior of the Revolution; the glory of France to be ranked with Jeanne d'Arc, Louis XIV and General de Gaulle; the first romantic nationalist; the great lawgiver; the father of Fascism, and so on and so on. There is a Napoleon that will fit anyone's theories, and the books about him are endless. And not only Napoleon, but there are a myriad of books about his wives, his mistresses, his brothers and sisters, his marshals. Books about his campaigns would fill a library, even the legend of Napoleon has an extensive literature.

title: 3 Young Children. Rescued From an Apartment Blaze
description: Three young children left unattended were rescued by firemen from a fire late yesterday afternoon in a firstfloor apartment at 131 West 112th Street.

title: Bill to Reduce Bias In Housing Passes Virginia Assembly
description: RICHMOND, March 11 (AP) The Virginia legislature tonight passed an open housing law, barring discrimination in the rental or sale of some apartments and houses. Gov. Linwood Holton said net it was the first such law in states of the Old Confederacy.

title: Letter to the Editor 7  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Laser Beam to Be Used Here for Measuring Golf Course
description: An electric laser beam device will soon be used to measure golf courses in the metropolitan area.

title: The Nation
description: The Government's aviationsecurity chief, Benjamin O. Davis Jr., was recalling the freeandeasy days when you could close the doors of an airliner at the end of a flight and forget it. Now, he said, you've got to make sure there isn't a bomb on board.

title: But Shop Wisely
description: MANY people buy shrubs which soon outgrow the area and composition for which they were purchased. To avoid this, estimate how much spread and height of a shrub is needed. Then, go to a reliable nurseryman or garden center and relate the problem. If he is knowledgeable, your problem can be solved. Plants do not just stop growing at a certain height or width, but with proper selection, there is less necessity for needing over active pruning shears.

title: BUILDING PERMITS ON RISE IN STATE
description: The number of building permits for residential construction issued in the state went up sharply last year, State. Housing, Commissioner Charles J. Urstadt reported last week.

title: Abigail McMurray to Marry Next Month
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., March II Dr. and Mrs. David J. McMurray have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Abigail McMurray, to Lawrence G. Golds, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence W. Golde of Port Washington, L. I. The wedding is planned for next month.

title: Ethnic Pride Among Young ChineseAmericans is Increasing
description: The majority of Chinese youths born in this country cannot read a Chinese newspaperor for that matter, a Chinese laundry list or a Chinese menu. And their spoken Chineseeither Cantonese or Toishun dialectis often very poor.

title: ROMEMILAN PLANE HIJACKED BY WOMAN
description: MUNICH, West Germany, March 11 (AP)A middleaged woman armed with a pistol and a handbag that she said was filled with hand grenades hijacked an Alitalia jetliner on flight from Rome to Milan and forced it to fly to Munich tonight. She gave herself up after freeing the 32 passengers and five crew members.

title: The Nation Wow Florida: Wallace Yes, but Who's on Second?
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Now, even before the entrails of New Hampshire have been fully sifted and studied, comes Florida.

title: Criminals At Large
description: The subtitle of E. G. Perrault's THE TWELFTH MILE (Doubleday, $5.95) is A novel of adventure and espionage at sea. It is all that. But everything is subservient to the sea, about which Perrault writes with knowledge and awe. His description of a seagoing tug caught in a hurricane and tidal wave is fearsomely vivid, and one aches for the battered vessel.

title: Nuclear Experts Share Doubts on Power Plant Safety
description: WASHINGTON, March 11A band of determined environmentalists has severely shaken the Atomic Energy Commission's faith in its own safety standards for nuclear power plants.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE Automation for Briar Pipes
FelonyTrial Backlog Held A Peril to War on Crime
SOVIET ECONOMIST BACKS U.S. TREND
description: MOSCOW, March 11  A Soviet economist has returned from a visit to the United States with news likely to gladden the hearts of Soviet advocates of further economic reform.

title: SCHOOLAID BILL WOULD AVERT BAN
description: ALBANY, March 11Governor Rockefeller sent to the Legislature today a bill that would provide $30.7million in state aid for nonpublic schools.

title: Ho, Ho, Hoedown
description: Playtime, come summer, is going to look like a hoedown in the Golden West. Oldtime ginghams are everywhere, along with calico and ruffles and aprons and bows. For boys, there are overalls and miner's boots and for all childrenjeansusually decorated by the wearers in their own unerring fashion.

title: Ballantine Closing Ends Newark Era
description: NEWARKThe announced sale of the P. Ballantine and Sons brewery signals the end of nearly a decade of unsuccessful attempts to save the company and more than century of prominence for the Newark brewing industry.

title: LETTERS Guarantees
description: To the Financial Editor: I refer to the article Guarantees on Apparel (Feb 6).

title: Other Ways to Get There Soften Bus Strike's Impact
description: PATERSON  Although more than half of the state's 1.2 million daily bus riders have had to find alternate means of getting to their destinations since the drivers for Transport of New Jersey began a strike on March I, the State Police and the Department of Transportation have found that there has been no major effect on traffic, business or industry.

title: 11 Newspapers Seized By the Police in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, March 12 (Reuters)The police seized 11 of Saigon's Vietnamese language newspapers yesterday, the official press agency Vietnam Press reported today.

title: Jane Dubrowin, Melvyn Marks Plan Marriage
description: WHITE PLAINSMarch 11 Mr. and Mrs. Raphael Dubrowin have announced the engagement of their daughter, MiSs Jane Ellen Dubrowin, to Melvyn Bernard Marks, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Marks of Middletown, Conn., and Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Hey, Dummy; By Kin Platt. 169 pp. Philadelphia: Chilton Book Company. $4.95. (Ages 9 to 12)
description: A new kid moved into our neighborhood. Nobody knew his name. was the first to call him Dummy and that name seems to have stuck. The Dummy is Alan Harper, a braindamaged boy of 13, and the narrator Neil Comstock, 12.

title: Housing Boom for Wood Ducks
description: NEW VERNONMultiplefamily housing has finally come to the estate country of Harding Township and, as some residents have been saying for years, it's for the birds.

title: Hardy Vegetables
description: WITHOUT a crystal ball to predict next summer's weather it is hard to know which vegetable varieties to choose for planting.

title: JOSEPH STOKES, 76, PENATRICIAN, DIES
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 11Dr. Joseph Stokes Jr., a pediatrician who was credited in part with developing the German measles vaccine and vaccines against measles, mumps and, influenza, died here Thursday. He was 76 years old and lived in Chestnut Hill.

title: Jonathan Weisberg to Wed Miss Crowe
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., March 11Miss Pamela Jane Crowe and Jonathan Weisberg plan ,to be married on April 29.

title: SPECTOR ROS WINS IN YONKERS TROT
description: YONKERS, March 11Spector Ros, a 6yearold black horse who never appeared in downstate New York, and George Wallace, his trainerdriver, who never visited Fun City, collaborated to win the first division of the Pronto Don trotting festival at Yonkers Raceway tonight.

title: Banning Underground Tests
description: The United States and the Soviet Union have come under sharp criticism at resumed United Nations disarmament talks in Geneva for their, reluctance to move ahead expeditiously to negotiate an underground nuclear test ban.

title: Humphrey Says He's Even With Muskie and Has 3 Chances. in 7 of Being Nominated
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 11  Hubert Horatio Humphrey has once again arrived at a moment of truth, one of dozens in a political career that has spanned 30 years.

title: Politics and Emotions in Poland Still SurroundJewish Question
description: RADOM, PolandOfficials of the Foreign and Interior Ministries led a fruitless search here the other day for a lead box containing two Torah scrolls buried three decades ago by a Jew who was about to be taken to a Nazi. concentration camp.

title: Sheila Srnolens To Be a Bride
description: MADISON, N. J., March 11 Mrs. Stanley R. Smolens has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Sheila Joan Smolens, to Peter Traub of Washington, son of Mrs. Sidney Robert Lane of Sao Paulo, Brazil, and the late John Traub of New York. A May wedding is planned in New York.

title: Why Is This Man Just Sitting There?
description: THE gentleman with the cigar, oblivious to the women around him, is only minding the store. The scene was last year at the Boston Flea Market, an annual outdoor antiques fair, which will get under way this year on Sunday, April 9, and continue every Sunday from 1 to P.M. through Oct. 29 (except Sept. 3). The shoppers in the modish eyeglasses are ogling the wares in one of roughly hundred stalls occupying the area across the street from historic Faneuil Hall. Last year more than 100,000 Bostonians and visitors paid their way into the nonprofit Flea Market ($1 for adults; children free); the proceeds go to variety of charitable organizations. Members of church and civic groups sell homemade food in the market, and music is provided by a barbershop quartet and a hurdygurdy player. Free parking is available near the market, and on rainy Sundays the stalls are moved under cover into the nearby Quincy Market Building.

title: Vossberg's Trimaran a ShangriLa
description: LOWER MATECUMBE KEY, Fla.  rive ram ago, Redo beard and his mate packed, their gear in a 4Ifoot trimaran and sailed off to retirement, wow, they are the biggest attraction at the Toll Gate Marina in the southern part of Islamorada.

title: Callas RevisitedExquis te As Ever
description: MARIA CALLAS does not sing in public any more. Nor is there news of her having made any recordings recently. Nevertheless, there is a brand new disk out on which she can be heard.in a Bellini aria and five by Verdi. It is called Marla Callas/by request. It comes from Angel (536852) and comprises previously unreleased recordings made in 1960 and 1964. It has been issued with the singer's approval.

title: Seaside in Winter Is Waiting for July
description: ISLAND BEACH STATE PARK  The unobstructed winds sweep from the ocean across the sand to Barnegat Bay and wear the dunes to white smoothness. There N no green save the dumpy little evergreens that seem impervious to the wind. The clumps of moss on the dunes are brown and the stunted cedars are silver and bent southward, pushed there by the north wind.

title: Prepackaged Shows Offered
description: TRENTON  Prepackaged art is reaching the highways and byways of New Jersey, courtesy of the New Jersey State Council on the Arts, which supplies free, monthlong exhibits.

title: Blacks at Parley Divided On Basic Role in Politics
description: GARY, Ind., March 11The issue of independent black politics versus the building of black strength within the Democratic and Republican parties appeared today to be threatening the unity sought by delegates to the first National Black Political Convention.

title: Yorty Still a Candidate
description: LOS ANGELES, March 11 (UPI)Mayor Sam Yorty says he is still a candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination despite his finish in third place in Thursday's New Hampshire's primary. He said yesterday that he intended to run in the California primary June 6.

title: A mental Rigoletto
description: Some of the joy Anthony Burgess gives his readers grows from the evident joy he gives his work. His zeal for the act of writing becomes an overt part, though sometimes symbolized, of his art  represented to date by 21 books, two of them on the zealous Joyce, one on the zealous Shakespeare, two others on language and literature, and 14 of them novels, plus numerous articles. Burgess would seem to have uncontrollable literary energy, which he controls beautifully.

title: The Vulnerability of Systems
description: A bomb explodes in an airplane parked at Las Vegas and the entire American air transport industry is thrown into turmoil. A mechanical device malfunctions and almost the entire northeastern United States is deprived of electricity. A computer program has a single error and as a result a space mission involving a multimilliondollar rocket ends in failure. Wage disputes between workers and employers produce strikes that tie up the entire shipping industry of the United States on both the Pacific and the Atlantic Coast and impose billions of dollars in losses to the nation's economy.

title: Aussies Take 30 Lead
description: HARTFORD, March 11 (AP) Roy Emerson moved the Australians closer to capturing the World Cup tonight with en uphill victory, over Bob Lutz of the United States, 36, 76, 64.

title: Leftist Extremists Battle Police In Milan, Injuring at Least 80
description: MILAN, Italy, March 11 (Reuters)Rioting leftwing extremists turned central Milan into a battlefield tonight, overturning cars, attacking a newspaper office and fighting running battles with hundreds of policemen.

title: Three Lawyers Suspended On Misconduct Charges
description: ALBANY, March 11 (AP)Three lawyers were suspended from the bar on misconduct charges for oneyear each today by the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITIOR:

title: KENNEDY CRITICAL ON AID TO BENGALIS
description: WASHINGTON, March 11Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, today charged the Administration with having seriously misled Congress and the publics about the volume of humanitarian aid delivered  as distinct from promised  to the people of Bangladesh.

title: Wilson Switches to. Duke
description: DURHAM, N.C., March 11 (AP)Eddie Wilson,offensive coordinator at the University of Arizona, was appointed to the Duke football coaching staff, today.

title: SOCIALIST PARTY MENDS OLD SPLIT
description: The Socialist Party, U.S.A. healed a split of more, than 35 years yesterday, merging with the offshoot known since 1957 as the Democratic Socialist Federation.

title: FREED POET BUS MICHIGAN RULING;Sees Victory in Reversal
description: DETROIT, March 11John Sinclair, a radical poet, puffed on a marijuana cigarette at a news conference this week and concluded that the 29 months he had spent in prison for possessing two marijuana cigarettes had been worthwhile.

title: MUSIC
description: A chorale has taken root in the BedfordStuyvesant area of Brooklyn because a young black music student at Brooklyn College wanted to find out snore about choral conducting than he felt he could get in the normal course of his studies.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: The Promise of Spring
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass. Here on Martha's Vineyard, there Is something of spring in the air, palpable but timorous, sensed but unseen.

title: The Drug Addiction Business By Nicholas M. Regush. 141 pp. Dial. $9.95.
description: An angry, even flailing assault on the drugaddiction establishmentthe people in the business of curing drug addicts. Mr. Regush's perspective is that of the radical sociologist; he adds a whiff of the current critiques of the welfare system that describe it as device for cowing the poor. There is much to be said for Mr. Regush's tirade and his criticism of official definitions of what a drug addict is; his style has a McLuhanesque quality, with short subchapters interspersed with direct quotes from newspapers, manuals, etc. However, the book would have benefited from a more linear, logical argument.

title: F.B.Endernann to Wed Miss Nancy G. Fisher
description: CLOSTER, N. J., March, II Mr. and Mrs. John Galt Fisher of Closter and Kimogenor Point, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Nancy Gay Fisher, to Frederick Buck Endemann, son of Mr. and Mrs. Carleton H. Endemann of Lighthouse Point, Fla., and Kimogenor Point.

title: Where Has All The Laughter Gone?
description: MORT SAHL was in town recently, doing two weeks at the Upstairs at the Downstairs. After the opening show, he told a reporter for The Times that these days he finds a lack of intellect on the part of comedians and that they've failed to report the mood of the country. For his own part, he's mostly played the carimuses for the past decade, and he readily concedes that music  not humor  is the young people's entertainment. Yet they have a sense of reality, he added, calling their laughter A, form of recognition.. It has an underbelly of f%iCiSin.

title: Irish country elegance
description: A modest weekend cottage is what Sam Stephenson, a Dublin architect, had in mind for his family of four. Never did he consider converting one of Ireland's many fading Georgian manor houses. But that is what he finally did. Vacant for four years, the house was something of an architectural nightmare, extended with rare insensitivity in Victorian limes, the architect recalls. It stood on a small rise overlooking

title: UNION AT FIRESTONE BACKS PLAN ON JOBS
description: AKRON, Ohio, March 11Members of the United Rubber Workers Union Local 7 at the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company voted yesterday to approve work rule changes aimed at stabilizing jobs in this city.

title: ExGovernor of Oklahoma To Vie for Harris's Seat
description: NORMAN, Okla., March 11Former Gov. Dewey Bartlett of Oklahoma, a Republican, formally announced today that he would seek the United States Senate seat now held by Fred R. Harris, a Democrat.

title: Yamaha's Riders Dominate Daytona Motorcycle Events
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., March 11 (Ali)Yamaha had its day at Daytona International Speedway today, posting victories in the American Motorcycle Association's competition.

title: Jersey Girl Is Honored By College
description: Lynn Weiss was inspired by John F. Kennedy and disturbed by the Vietnam war. As an undergraduate, she prepared for medical school, but as the war dragged on in 1966, she changed her ambition to one of outlawing war, which she considered a disease itself, her mother recalls.

title: Armstrong Is elcomed By His Clan in Scotland
description: LANGHOLM, Scotland, March 11The Duke of Buccleuch took Neil Alden Armstrong, the first man on the moon, on a tour of the country of his reputed ancestors, the Armstrong Clan, today after the astronaut had been given the freedom of this small market town famed for tweedmaking.

title: Growing Up African
description: Essays, poems and stories about childhood in Africa. Much about African rites and customs, the initial chaotic response to Western penetration and domination, and the reassertive, nationalistic reactions of the 20th century. Among the contributors: Leopold Senghor, Camara Laye, Ezekiel Mphahlele, Kwame Nkrumah. A good sampler, but only a sampler.

title: TO THE EDITOR:
description: The dilemma in which women find themselves today is reflected very well not only in the subject matter of Anne Roiphe's excellent article but also in the author's own soulsearching over the questions which her material presents.

title: Movies
description: THE setting: a West 54th Street movie studio that has been eerily decorated to resemble a funeral parlor. A black and white crew, stands amidst the caskets, ferns and burgundy velvet drapes, laughing and laying soul handshakes on each other. One sound man remarks that a pink velvetflocked casket looks as if it was designed for a Playboy bunnyor Diana Ross.

title: Historians Conference: The Radical Need for Jobs
description: AT last December's meeting of the American Historical Association, one of the most popular sessions was an unusual panel on Lenny Bruce: American. Several hundred historians gathered in the Sutton Ballroom South of the New York Hilton to hear Prof. Frank Kofsky of Sacramento State College deliver paper on Bruce as a social and cultural critic of postWorld War II American society.

title: Social Events Coming Up: One Is for the Sons of Erin
description: Hark Hark The Ark!

title: Photography
description: ACOMPACT new 35mm enlarger called the Durst F30 has recently been introduced by Ehrenreich PhotoOptical Industries, Inc., of Garden City N. Y. 11530. Designed for amateur photographers who need flexibility in an enlarging machine, but don't have the space (or the money) for a larger unit, the F30 is actually a simplified version of the same company's model M301. It can be assembled in minutes and stored in a drawer or cabinet when not in use. It has an enlarger head that is made of diecast metal and can be tilted 20 degrees to the left or right for distortion control or cor

title: 4Channel Sound Breaks Through
description: HERE they comethe quadraphonic disks are finally on their way. After all the technical talk and engineer's jargon about methods and systems, the listening public finally has some real evidence that 4channel sound for the home is mom than a dream. The January issue of the Schwann Record and Tape Guidethat indispensable reference source for both the casual and serious record buyerincluded the catalogue's first listing of a substantial quantity of quadraphonic disks and tapes. The initial section was only three pages long, but there is little doubt that it will expand rapidly in the next few months.

title: Miss Sara Thompson
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., March 11  Miss Sara Ann Thompson and Richard Harold Bott have made plans to be married in June.

title: Olivia Spencer, D. S. Tuttle 3d To Be Married
description: MIDDLEBURY, Conn., March 11Miss Olivia Tuttle Spencer and Donald Seymour Tuttle 3d plan to be married Sept. 9.

title: LUTHERAN LEADER SEEKS ORTHODOXY;Literalism of Bible Is Issue
description: ST. LOUIS, March 11The Rev. Dr. Jacob A. O. Preus, president of the Lutheran ChurchMissouri Synod, has issued guidelines on his own authority to prohibit all teachers at his church's major seminary from questioning the historical validity of the Bible

title: Ricki Schwartz a Bride
description: Miss Ricki It Schwartz and Barrie Kellner, son of Mr. and Mrs. Karl Kellner of Miami Beach, Fla., were married last night in the Terrace Room of the Plaza by Rabbi Morris Goldberg. The bride's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Robert S. Schwartz of Oceanside, L.I. Her father retired as general manager with Herman World of Sporting Goods, a division of W. R. Grace Co. Her husband is in business with his father with OK Auto Parts of Miami Beach, Inc.

title: Ortiz, on Comeback, To Bid for 6th in Row
description: Carlos Ortiz, the former lightweight champion who is bidding to regain the title now held by Ken Buchanan, continues his comeback March 20 in Ponce, P.R., against Junior Varney.

title: Limbo
description: In this wasteland are the wives of American P.O.W.'s and men missing in action, suspended in a fog of uncertainty, insensitive officialese and political absurdity. Mesdames Silver and Gottlieb examine the survival strategies of three Air Force wives so entrapped. Sandy, a wife of only two weeks before her husband was shot down, enjoys playing Galatea to the Pygmalion of an instructor in ed psych, with whom her life becomes inextricably intertwined. Mary Kaye tries to be a regular guy, while sustaining a family of four. Sharon shuts her eyes to the presumed death of her husband and heads for a collision with reality. The pathos is inescapable, although the writing is inanimate.

title: Nub City, and Other Stories Of an Insurance Investigator
description: ON Saturday, Sept. 18, 1971, GailRichards, a 30yearold medical assistant, died in her apartment on Manhattan's upper East Side. According to the death certificate, her body was found on Monday; cause of death: viral pneumonia. Shortly afterward, Miss Richards was buried and seemed destined to become just another statistic, one of the city's total of 86,608 deaths last year.

title: Weatherford Joins V.M.I.
description: LEXINGTON, Va., March 11 (AP)Jim Weatherford, former University of Tennessee defensive back, has joined the staff of Virginia Military Institute as defensive backfield coach.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I read with interest the article on 996 Aldus Street in the Bronx, which is in my councilmanic district. I would like to warn the investors, and especially the Federal Government, which is using tax dollars, that unless roundtheclock guards are hired while the renovation work is progressing, the money is as good as lost. New plumbing will be installed during the day and carted away at night, for example. The junkies are stealthy and desperate.

title: Coleridge, The Damaged Archangel
description: The veneration that accompanies the posthumous birthdays of great men should rise to an ambivalent climax in 1972, bicentennary of Samuel Taylor Coleridge: poet, literary critic, metaphysician, political philosopher, psychologist. With the definitive edition of his works in progress, and the first publication of the amazing Notebooks, Coleridge scholarship has reached hightide. Wewill soon know almost everything about the thoughts of this myriadminded dreamer, who would wake from his nightmares (Night is my hell) to record them, hour and date as well. The terrors of the day were often not far from the terrors of the night: he led a miserable, drugridden, lovefrustrated life. Indeed we know so much even now that we know too much, and seekas he did himself,in looking always for methoda standpoint from which to master his beitig's being which he once defined simply as contradiction.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 11Datelines:

title: Bravo, Brando's Godfather
description: AFTER a very long time, in too many indifferent or halfrealized movies, giving performances that were occasionally becalmed but always more interesting than the material, Marlon Brando has finally connected with a character and a film that need not embarrass America's most complex, most idiosyncratic film actor, nor those critics who have wondered, in bossy print, what ever happened to him.

title: To THE EDITOM
description: While I share Mr. Canaday's belief that an occasional obituary exhibition of works to be sold is unthinkable, I think it would be most illuminating to see a kind of balancesheet exhibition, comparing the works sold by any museum with the works it was able to acquire as a result of these sales.

title: The Nation
description: GARY, Ind.  Brooklyn Assemblyman Thomas Fortune, caught in the crush in the Holiday Inn lobby, called out above the din: We mettherefore, we won.

title: Planning Completed for U. N. Environment Conference
description: UNITED NATIONS, March 11 After almost four years of discussion, the outlines of the first global attack on environmental problems began to emerge at the United Nations this week.

title: Rory McShane
description: Rory McShane, a 25yearold law clerk who organized a civil rights march in Newry, Northern Ireland, last month in defiance of the government, said here yesterday that the nonviolent civil rights movement among the Roman Catholic minority in Ulster was growing.

title: Pony Trekking In Britain Seeing The Countryside On the Hoof
description: WORTH, EnglandFor reasons that nobody has been able to explain entirely to my satisfac tion, most of the people interested in horseback riding in Britain these days are young women and teenage girls.

title: The Overture
description: While we wait for the trilling of the spring peepers and the morning song of the robins, an even older sound than the peepers can be heard. It, too, is one of the vernal sounds, the chatter of brooks after long weeks of icebound silence.

title: Winter Surfing,a Way of Life in Ocean city
description: OCEAN CITYLast Tuesday morning at a few minutes after 6, the sky was turning from black to overcast gray. A thin border of ice clung to the beach where the tide had run in during the belowfreezing night. The wind, blowing steadily out of the north at 20 knots an hour, forced the alreadyfreezing air down to 18 degrees. The graygreen surf cresting shoreward toward the 10th Street stretch of boardwalk here was in the 30's.

title: Poll of Liberals Proposed On Presidential Aspirants
description: Liberals for New Politics, a reform group, called on the state Liberal party yesterday to set up an impartially conducted mail poll of every Liberal party enrollee, to name preferences among majorparty Presidential candidates, no candidate or an Independent candidacy.

title: BHUTTO APPOINTS OUSTED OFFICERS
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, March 11 Two senior Pakistani officers who were relieved by President Zulfilcar Ali Bhutto last week for allegedly interfering in affairs of state have been named by him as ambassadors abroad.

title: Dance: Prism, a Work in Four Parts
Home TV Recording: Progress, but Hurdles Remain Compatible. Factor Is Main Problem
description: Last week on the French Riviera, more than a thousand hardheaded businessmen from countries all over the world were chasing a dream.

title: They Need Little Care
description: THERE is no shrub that is devoid of any maintenance and this must be understood before we delve into the discussion of low upkeep shrubs. Most people would not have it any other way.

title: Alice T. Bruchhausen to Re Bride

H., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Alice Thayer Bruchhausen, to Yeoman 2d Cl. Robert Maynard Schenck, U.S.N., son of Mr. and Mrs. Theodore Maynard Schenck, also of Brooklyn. The wedding is planned for late summer in Whitefield.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE. Import Link With Italy Becomes A Success
description: Robert Goldworm went to Italy in the early nineteenfifties to explore the possibility of a link with an Italian knit goods manufacturer so that his New York dress company would have a reliable import source. He wasn't looking for cheap labor but rather handicraft skills that were impossible to obtain in the United States.

title: The Nation
description: The Administration was calling it an expected postfreeze bulge, but for housewives and other consumers, what it meant was that inflation is still with us: Prices are still going up. The Labor Department reported last week that wholesale prices in February rose by seventenths of 1 per cent after adjustment for seasonal changes; before adjustment, the price rise was ninetenths of 1 per cent. This was the third month in a row that prices have gone up since the pricefreeze ended. The major areas of price rises came in the volatile and partly uncontrolled farm and food price sector, with 14 ofthe 15 major commodity groups in the index climbing.

title: The helpless victim
description: The fact that Chester Mimes has written a vacuous and unimportant autobiography might lie met with indifference were his life not remarkable. !limes, the author of novels such as If He Hollers Let Him Go, The Primitives and Cotton Comes to Harlem, is an extremely important AfroAmerican writer. Born in Jefferson City, Mo., in 1909, he began his writing career in the Ohio State Penitentiary where he served time for armed robbery between 1929 and 1936. After his release, he became involved with the Federal Writers Project and, in 1944, published his first novel. Since then he has published numerous novels and, in the last few years, has begun to receive the popular and critical attention that his efforts have long deserved.

title: Tax Study Urges New Aid by State
description: TRENTONThere are 725,000 people in New Jersey over the age of 65, and their number increases by about 2 per cent a year. Many of them are in trouble because of sickness and because their fixed incomes have not kept pace with inflation.

title: Fancy Onions
description: ONIONS (alliums) belong to the Lily family. To me, the most mild and sweet are shallots. (Leeks are a close runnerup.) Their place of origin was probably the Mideast. The botanical name, Allium ascalonicum, derives from Askalon, a city of the ancient Philistinesbut France became their home.

Miss Strizower is a student at Brooklyn College and her fiance, a rabbinical student at Yeshiva University, is studying for a doctorate in computer analysis at New York University. Rabbi Strizower is the spiritual leader of the Seaview Jewish Center in Brooklyn.

description: THE palette of fragrant plants is large. Starting with annuals, everyone knows the petunia for dependability and color. The cascading varieties are even planted in hanging baskets for porches, patios or terraces.

title: Journey To Topaz; By Yoshiko Uchida Illustrated by Donald Carrick 149 pp. New York: Charles Scribner's Sons. $4.95. (Ages 9 to 12)
description: It is probably unreasonable to be disappointed in a gentle unassuming story for little girls because it is not a more substantial book. But if the author is JapaneseAmerican and the story a fictionalized account of the year her family spent as enemy aliens uprooted from their home in California and sent to an internment camp in Utah, comparison with other basedonfact family stories is inevitable. Told through the eyes of 11yearold Yuki, the upheaval that faced the JapaneseAmericans after Pearl Harbor is related from a distinctly littlegirl point of view. Yuki worries about her father, who has been arrested by the F.B.I.; she reacts with outraged indignation when a classmate calls her You dirty Jap!"; and when word comes that the JapaneseAmericans are to be evacuated from the West Coast by Presidential decree, her main is the fate if her

title: Mainland Chinese Have Risen in Favor In U.S., Poll Finds
description: The American public has a far more favorable image of the Chinese Communists today, following President Nixon's trip to China and the events leading to it, than it did in the middle nineteensixties, according to a Gallup poll made public today.

title: The Nation
description: It's not just that Rockefeller hates Lindsay; cities everywhere are getting the dirty end of the stick from their state capitals, That doleful estimate came from a close associate of Mayor Lindsay last week after developments In a halfdozen key fields had underscored the extent to which a decidedly frosty state administration in Albany was peeking to assert control over New York City's most critical functions.

description: There used to be two, three, four million [Indians] in Brazil. How many are left? Barely 200,000 or 300,000 in the entire country. The massacre has gone on for centuries, and is still going on.

title: WILLIAM A. BLANK
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., March 11William A. Blank, a New York lawyer who specialized in railroad and negligence cases, died today of a heart attack. He was 73 years old and lived here and at 515 Avenue Brooklyn.

title: James Annenberg Levee Fiance Of Miss Deborah A. Casperino
description: PATERSON, N. J., March 11  Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Casperino of Totowa Borough have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Deborah Ann Casperino, to James Annenberg Levee of New York and Minneapolis. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Benjamin Levee of New York and Palm Beach, Fla., a nephew of Walter H..Annenberg, Ambassador to the Court of St. James, and a grandson of the late Moses L. Annenberg, who founded Triangle Publications. The wedding is planned for August.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: This mishmash epitomizes new Consciousness among American blacks, their cries for pride and humanity, their fearsome determination never to be victims again. Its best parts are the several essays by Angela Davis, the philosophy teacher who was in jail over a year for allegedly providing the guns for a bloody escape attempt at the Marin County courthouse in California. Most. of the rest is paddingstatements and letters from George Jackson, Bobby Seale and others described in the imprecise terminology of the present as political prisoners.

title: Catholic Worker Head Honored by Notre Dame
description: Dorothy Day, the founder of the Catholic Worker Movement, has been named this year's recipient of the University of Notre Dame's Laetare Medal, the university announced yesterday.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: No change In the condition. of the bald eagle. The bald eagle Population, which consists of about 950 breeding pairs in the contiguous United States, continues to decline. Alexander Sprunt 4th, director of the National Audubon Society research program, believes the population has declined about 10 or 15 per cent during the last decade.

title: The Little Island That Would, If It Could..
description: GREAT CORN ISLAND, Nicaragua When Howard Hughes and his entourage flew into Nicaragua last month, the rumors began to circulate at about the same time the billionaire's plane touched the runway: Hughes had arrived, moneybags aboard, to finance some grand development scheme. There is still no known basis for that belief, but attractive rumors have a long life span in Nicaragua.

title: The World
description: ATHENSGreece's throne, one of seven left in Europe, has been empty since 1967, when King Constantine went into exile following a military coup. During this period, public symbols of the monarchy have been eliminated gradually by the ruling colonels. Now there are signs, that the 140yearold throne is in danger of being abolished altogether.

title: Art
description: THERE is always a certain pleasure in viewing the works of en artist who is in command of his means. The means in the case of the 64yearold Amerken painter Ilya Bolotowsky Is NeoPiastioistn, that austere and conceptual style of painting, largely the brainchild of Mondrian and the Dutch De Stijl group, whose forms are dictated by the right angle and whose colors are restricted to the primaries plus black and white.

title: HIGH TOLL INDICATED IN MINSK ACCIDENT
description: MOSCOW, March 11  The Soviet Government announced today that an unspecified industrial accident in Minsk, canttal of the Byelorussian Republic, resulted in an undisclosed number of dead and wounded workers yesterday.

description: Clifford Irving, his friends and acquaintances say, is full of charm, resolute in his convictions about himself, and eager to be famous, which, of course, he now is. Moreover, if he invited disaster, as the indictment. Thursday suggested, he wanted to do it with style.

title: Restoring Health, Dispelling Fear
description: In a neighborhood where there are heavy concentrations of welfare clients, addicts and angry black youths, Mrs. Engh walks everywhere, every day without fear. Her familiar blue uniform and cap have provided her with safe passage and respect so far. She is a visiting nurse.

description: HACKENSACK  Professional ballet here? To those who consider the prospect as unlikely as a cricket match in Brooklyn, witness the performance of Jacques d'Arnboise, Melissa Hayden and eight other stars of the New York City Ballet in Hackensack Friday evening.

description: ISLAMABAD, March 11 (Reuters)  President Bhutto will pay a threeday visit to the Soviet Union beginning next Thursday it was officially announced today.

description: HOLBROOK, L. LA parents group that has helped find permanent homes for more than 300 hardtoadopt children is redoubling its efforts this week to match prospective parents with homeless children.

description: DOSES will be in bloom when the Long Island Garden Show open Wednesday at their Long Island Arena, Commack. There will also be a greenhouse, nature trails, daffodils end tulips and an air of spring. The Garden Theater will have daily conitinnous film showings, slide and lecture presentations.

title: Gospel Can Set You Free
description: THE passing of Mahalia Jackson took away one of black gospel's most joyous and effective messengers; it also took away the only gospel singer to consistently present the happiness and power of gospel to the white audience. Everybody loved her for the right reasons: she always remained herself, always stayed faithful to her concept of her mission, always maintained her talent at its peakshe seemed to have sprung fullblown from (pardon the pagan reference) the brow of Jove.

title: Can Archie Bunker Give Bigotry A Bad Name?
description: HOLLYWOOD.

title: The Roles Some Women Play
description: SO now the record industry is into aural sex. And that wouldn't seem so bad if the overall selections weren't so embarrassingly stereotyped. From the many predictable albums of heavy breathing and guttural grunts to the more recent recordings of tips for sexists and battle hymns for feminists. None of which say very much for society's sexual attitudes.

title: Lon Nol Dismisses Government Alter Assuming Supreme Power
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, March 12 (Reuters)Marshal Lon Not, who took over as the supreme power in Cambodia last night, has dismissed the Government effective today and has decided to form a completely new cabinet.

title: Italy's Tarquinia: What the Tomb Raiders Missed
description: $firprisingly, few Americans visit the Etruscan tombs in Tarquinia, which is about 50 ratios northwest of Rome and easily accessible by car or tour bus. Mates the pity, for the trip here is one of the most rewarding to be found in the environs of the capital, combining, as it does, an excursion to the seashore with a glimpse into one of the most interesting cultures of the ancient world.

title: Trenton Center Trains Prison Inmates in Skills They Can Use in jobs on Their Release
description: TRENTONIf a training program being tested at the Mercer County Skills.Center with inmates from Trenton State Prison and Bordentown Reformatory proves successful;. many of New Jersey's prisoners might return to society. with abilities suited to prevailing Job markets.

title: The Squirrel Wife; By Philippa Pearce. Illustrated by Derek Collard. 61 pp. New York: Thomas Y. Crowell Company. $4.50. (Ages 7 to 10)
description: Some fellows follow their good inclinations with such assuredness that others, confusing simple hearts with simple minds, think them fools. Such a one is Jack the swineherd. One stormy night, against all advice, he goes out and saves a green man whom a tree has crushed nearly to death. In return, the green people, fairy rulers of the forest, give Jack a ring with which he wins the love of a marvelous, mysterious being, part forest creature, part woman: the squirrel wife.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Rentacar companies that operate in New York owed the city $3,550,205 for 186,133 unpaid parking tickets as of Yan. 21, Controller Abraham D. Beam reported yesterday.

title: Spring Preview
description: THE color and beauty of flowering branches are appreciated when forced into bloom indoors. Forsythia; flowering quince and pussywillow. are easy to force in the home. Also branches of crabapple, peach, pear, dogwood, magnolia. The flower buds are them just waiting for warmth and moisture.

title: Law
description: ATLANTANearly two years have passed since that velvet May night in Jackson, Miss., when a dustpan clattered on a street... or, was it a pop bottle breaking... or a shot from a sniper's rifleand a contingent of Mississippi Highway patrolmen jerked up their shotguns and automatic weapons and fired into a surrounding crowd of black students.

title: Mussolini amused him
description: British respectability is frequently derided, but at times it has its advantages. One suspects that the lack of success of Sir Oswald Mosley's British Union of Fascists owes at least something to this unexciting but sensible trait. The British are fully capable of brutality and nastinessas much as any other groupbut they do not appear to like private military units, or violence getting out of hand at political meetings, or overt antiSemitism. Despite his disclaimers, Mosley fostered all three in his attempt to make Britain Fascist. Respectability joined with common sense and would not have it: Sir Oswald failed.

title: Noise Opponent Routed
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn March 11 (AP)Dr. David Lipscomb of the University of Tennessee says he had to move his laboratory for noise research because of too much noise coming from construction outside. Dr. Lipscomb, an early advocate of noise control who is noted rot his research into effects on hearing caused by rock music, said construction of an addition to the university's football stadium was so intense we couldn't carry out our functions.

title: Breath of U.S. History Fills 1700's Dutch Colonial Home
description: WYCKOFF  As you approach the Dambach house, you half expect your knock to be answered by a wigged old gentleman in velvet waistcoat, silk knee breeches, silver buckled shoes and smoking a long, clay pipe.

title: New Flexibility by North Korea Indicates Wish to End Isolation
description: TOKYO, March 11North Korea appears to be ending its long isolation by taking a more flexible posture toward South Korea, Japan and even the United States.

title: Two Rival Inquiries Are Begun Into Flood in West Virginia
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., March 11Two rival investigations began in West Virghia today, bringing to five the number of inquiries into the flood that took at least 113 lives along Buffalo Creek two weeks ago.

title: Students Bring New Thoughts to Seminary

title: Education

By so doing, the House not only erected a solid roadblock against Congress passing an antibusing measure this year, but also cast strong doubt on the enactment of the $20billion higher education bill.

title: HEAT GIVEN ROLE IN OIL FORMATION
description: PRINCETON, March 11 Great Bunsen burners beneath the earth's moving crust have played a critical role in producing some of the world's richest oil fields  including those yet to be discoveredaccording to a theory discussed here today.

description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 11 (AP)Many of golf's tourlug pros are disgruntled over a ruling that eliminated 30 players from last week's DoralEastern open.

description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, March 11 (AP)Marshal Lon Nol consolidated his new powers as Chief of State today while trying to check rising political opposition to the Government.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Polysensuum freak show
description: Brock Brewer's first novel was a macabre, Faulkneresque tale about a man trapped with a demented murderer in a duck blind on the Carolina coast, an exercise in terror elevated by a strenuous display of stylistics. It was called Debris. Now comes The Late Great Creature, an apocalyptic, slouching monster book, and we find Brower still messing around with his old partners, Dr. Jetsam and Mr. Flotsam  only the horror that floats the seadreck here is the drifting current of an age. As it goes with the horror movie, suggests Brower, so with the human condition, and both are definitely on the decline. Thus, where the German Expressionists could make a classic film like Nosferatu out of a Victorian thriller like Bram Stoker's Dracula, in later, less immaculate hands the genre has deteriorated to the level of trashy adaptations of Poe's tales the chief horror of which is the dismemberment before your eyes of a man's art after

title: CASSIDY IS FOCUS OF NEW POP TREND

The focus of it all was David Cassidy, singer and star of television's The Partridge Family, and the current idol of almost every 13yearold girl in America.

title: The Sidewalk cafe, a Flower in Europe's Streets, Is Fading

They, are also for relaxing, observing, meditating and, above all, communing with one's fellow beingsor at least they were in the days when life was slower, cars fewer and air pollution an unknown.

title: Letters to the Editor;Coop City Is No Aldus Street
description: Reading the article about the 996 Aldus Street apartment house ["A Building in Ruins May Yet Revive, Feb. 27] brought back memories of a happy childhood. I was brought up in that once lovely neighborhood. I attended Public School 75 just around the corner on Bryant Avenue and played softball in the schoolyard of P.S. 75. I hit many a ball into Aldus Street.

Mrs. Leventhal is the former Miss Sharon Tanzer of Wilmington, Del., and her husband is press secretary to Senator Jacob K. Javits of New York. The child has been named Joshua Tenzer.

title: The Airport: Where the, Suppressed Angst of an Insecure World Surfaces

The airport is the essential noplace of the travel world, the place that is both indispensable and unbearable, where one lives and waits in the maw of some awesome machine, having not yet departed nor yet arrived.

The Vatican at first considered the prophet Jonah, who, according to the Old Testament, spent three days in the stomach of a whale, but Paul was chosen ag more suitable for liturgical reasons.

description: Having firmly established himself in the field of spiritual selfhelp with How to Become a Bishop Without Being Religious, Charles Merrill Smith now addresses himself to the more common problem of gaining altitude in the middle class. What he offers is at once a stepbystep guide up the grand staircase of Social Achievement (also known as making it) and an edifying backstairs view of the means by which the upper middle class contrives its impressive show, confounding the lower elements and renewing its own members in faith and zeal.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: New York first became aware of John Barbirolli (no Giovanni Battista Barbirolli) in 1936, when the board of the Philharmonic chose him as guest conductor and in a matter of weeks named him permanent conductor. The Philharmonic's public, expecting another Toscanini, was terribly let down. Barbirolli's seven seasons were nigh disastrous. The consensus was that the orchestra's quality, had deteriorated embarrassingly when, to everyone's relief, he returned to his native England to reconstruct Manchester's Halle Orchestra. By 1959, when Barbirolli came back to the United States, he had been knighted and had worked his way once again to the top of the conducting heap. For a de ade he divided his time between Manchester and the Houston Symphony. At his death in 1970, aged 70, he was rich in honors, and welcome on podiums all over the world.

title: SHOP TALK
description: RIDGEWOOD  Minutes from Manhattan, across the George Washington Bridge, this village of 27,500 people Combines truly suburban living and a cosmopolitan lifestyle.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: Mr. Mitchell offers 100 photographs and seven interviews with black musicians of the Mississippi Delta area, whose special mode of expressioncountry bluesis fast disappearing. Between the interviews are interspersed Mr. Mitchell's impressions of a weekend barbecue and a church service. Appended is a small collection of blues lines, stanzas and songs. The photographs are terrible, technically, and the documentation of the music is inadequate. The musicians interviewed are scarcely a representative sampling, but their answers to Mr. Mitchell's questions are fascinating and valuable. The talk is of their childhood, upbringing and pa. rents; of how they were taught differences between black and white people; of how they be. gan in music; how they feel about the church; the kinds of work they have done; the story of their courtships and marriages; when and why they feel happiest and saddest; and whether they have ever thought of leaving Mississippi. To the question why they sing the blues, one answer: You gets pacified. Blues to blow the blues away.

title: OIL LANDS OFFERED SHARE OF ARAMCO

description: WAITSFIELD, Vt., March 11 (AP)Five persons were injured today when chairs on a 6,200foot ski lift at Glen Ellen slid back along their cable, the police said.

title: Did Mussorgsky Have Humor?
description: THAT Modest Mussorgsky had a sense of humor might be guessed at by most people only on the basis of some of the grotesques he inserted into the epic sweep of Boris Godunov. But what about those bitingly satirical sketches that turn up in Pictures at an Exhibition? Surely these may be reflections of a dramatic talent that could find comedy a congenial form for operatic statement, And so they are, for Mussorgsky labored long and hard on a comic opera  never completed  The Falr at Sorochinsk, now available on records (2 disks, Melatliya/Angel SRBL4117) in the version made by Viaserion Shebalin from the material the composer did finish before his death and from indications lie left concernthe balance.

title: On the Way To the Sky
description: Benny, Louis and Geo (for George) are three.boys age about 7 trying to grow up in a Utah cattle town circa 1944. Maturity is not guaranteed, since little Louis is a precocious desperado who drags By Douglas Kent Hall. 244 pp. New York: McCall Books. $5.95. his two friends along on one suicidal venture after another. Mr. Hall invents distinctive family backgrounds for his three heroes, and arranges them into an impressionistic chron Geo is the son of Godfearing Mormon ranchers. Benny's family are miners and countrymusic makers. Louis lives with his grandmother and grandfather, a freight agent. His parents are separated by the war and mutual polarity. Over a 10year span, the three friends are introduced to various rites of manhood, like fishing and girls. Upon reaching puberty, Louis tries to get back at his absent mother by impregnating every female who crosses his path. Benny becomes a guitar virtuoso, headed for The Grand Ole Opry. Geo retains an undiminished sense of wonder, as does the author of these refreshing

title: PORTAUPRINCE.
description: IN 1954, on the first evening of my first trip to Haiti,I stood with a departing diplomat on a mahogany ramp of the Hotel Oloffson, overlooking the smoky city, amid a universe of flowers and palms, chicken and automobile sounds, lizards darting, the thrum of drums. The diplomat, smelling sweetly of rum, said: Haiti ruined my life. lost my job. I lost my wife. My liver has gone bad. It's the most wonderful place in the world.

Y.It was a beautiful late winter day the morning we set out to drive a snowmobile the temperature had dropped down only to about zero during the night and by 11 A.M. under a blue sky and. a blazing sun it stood at 32 degrees. Deep in the woods and on the snowmobile trails it was a bit cooler, the snow was crisp and noisy underfoot, the air clear and sparkling in the lungsa perfect day to be in the North Woods.

title: AROUND THE

title: Always strictly business
description: All one can say is: high time. With the rehabilitation of Giuseppe Verdi that followed the postwar period, with the recognition of him as the Colossus of the South as opposed to Wagner, the Colossus of the North, it was high time that his letters were published for Englishspeaking peoples to read. For the letters of composers can tell more about their mental processes than any biography. Indeed, one can learn more about Mozart from his letters than from all of the biographies rolled together. But the same goes for any composer. In their letters they write about their views of the world, the way they compose, their philosophy of music. They lay bare their strengths and weaknesses.

description: MONTEREY, Mexico, March 11 (UPI) Nine persons were killed and 32 others injured today when a bus and a truck collided on the main road from Monterey leading south to Mexico City, the police reported.

He refused to give any details of the boy's reentry or his present whereabouts.
