Wallace of Alabama rode the school busing issue across north Florida today as other Democratic Presidential candidates made feverish lastditch efforts to stop him from winning all 81 of Florida's Democratic convention delegates in the primary election next Tuesday.

title: Donald Coyle to Wed Jane Louise Redeker
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., March 11The Rev. Dr. and Mrs. Russell, John Redeker have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jane Louise Redeker, to Donald Lorne Coyle, son of ,Mr. and Mrs. Donald Walter Coyle.

title: Ginsberg Dinner Speaker
description: NEWARK Mitchell I. Ginsberg, Presidant of the National Association of Social Workers, will address the New Jersey chapter of Social Workers at its annual dinner at 7 P.M. Tuesday at the Ramada Inn in East Brunswick. Mr. Ginsberg, dean of the Columbia University School of Social Work, is former head of the New York City Human Resources Administration.

title: Rail Service Normal Again
description: SAN PRANCISCO, March 11, (AP)  The Southern Pacific Company said that its train service was back to nermal today in seven Western states after an eighthour strike yesterday. About 8,000 station employes struck over elmination of 20 switchmen's jobs, and 12,000 other members of the United Transportation Union honored their picket lines.

title: Dumping Of Sewage In L. I. Water Is Charged
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I. Hempstead Town official has charged that large quantities of raw sewage and industrial wastes are being dumped illegally into storm drains, causing a health hazard and polluting Long Island's waters.

title: Drama Mailbag:
description: To ME EDITOR:

title: Brown Rice As a Way of Life
description: RICHARD M. NIXON just hasn't been looking well lately. Those swollen bags beneath the eyes, those puffy cheeks, the widening nostrils and that deepening wrinkle between the brows all suggest that there is something amiss with the Presidential kidneys, liver and circulatory system. And if his temper has seemed somewhat short in recent months, well, that too is understandable: Mr. Nixon is sanpaku, and he has no one to blame for this sorry condition but himself, Mrs. Nixon and the White House's chief chef, Henry Haller.

title: What in the World Is Modern Music?
description: NOAH had it easy. He simply had to round up two of every available creature and march them into his houseboat. But, to anyone who sets himself the task of preparing a discography of modern music such as, the one that appears on Page 3, the appropriate Biblical hero is not Noah but Solomon. What in the world is modern music, anyway? Where can it reasonably be said to start?

title: Music Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: New Liquor Threat
description: The liquor Industry and consumers of its products in New York State, especially those in New York City, are facing new threats.

title: Chenoweth Shifts to New Speedball
description: Dean Chenoweth, ,the national driving champion for unlimited hydroplanes, has decided to shake up his winning combination with Miss Budweiser and drive a new boat this year..

title: The Nation
description: DETROITThe men work in teams of four, in plainclothes and in unmarked cars. Their object: To make the streets safe in Detroit. And these special units, called STRESS (Stop the Robberies, Enjoy Safe Streets), have enjoyed a certain success. They have made some 800 arrests since they were set up in January, 1971, and have been credited for part of the 9.9 per cent drop in robberies in this city last yearthe first such decline in decade.

title: Christine Sullivan Plans Nuptials
description: Miss Christine M. Sullivan, who attended Trinity College In Dublin, plans to be married in July to Peter M. MacKenna, son of Mr. and Mrs. Pearse MacKenna of Glenngeary, Ireland. His father, who heads Pearse MacKenna & Associates, an architectural firm in Dublin, is a past president of the Royal Institute of Architects in Ireland.

title: Too Bad This Night Is Less Than Merry
description: THE Twelfth Night company takes it lying down. Literally. In the new production that Ellis Rabb has mounted for the Vivian Beaumont, when Feats the jester wishes to cheer up an Olivia who has mourned too long for her brother, he must take some pains to do it for she is less than available to him. She is stretched full length on the floor, wrapped in her folds of gauzy black, head averted, ears sealed. The poor fool must crawl on his hands and knees and virtually whisper his japerles to reach her at all. Rather understandably, does herself.

title: The World
description: South Africa took control of the territory of SouthWest Africa under a 1920 League of Nations mandate and has retained her hold despite declarations by the Intentational Court and the United Nations Security Council that she relinquish control. The White. dominated Pretoria Government has maintained that its policy of racial separation and its program for tribal homelands are in accordance with moves toward selfdetermination.

title: U.S. WILL CONTINUE RADIO FREE EUROPE
description: WASHINGTON, March 11Faced with an imminent shutdown of Radio Free Europe and Radio Libe.rty, the Administration dropped today efforts to secure longterm funds for the Americanrun stations and agreed to a plan to keep them alive for at least three more months.

title: Kansas State Hires Madden
description: AMES, Iowa, March 11 (AP) Joe Madden, Iowa State University defensive backfield coach, was named. head defensive football coach at Kansas State University today.

title: ZACK WHEAT DIES; EBBETS FIELD IDOL
description: SEDALIA, Mo., March 11 (AP) Zack Wheat, a member of baseball's Hall of Fame, died in a local hospital tonight. He was 82 years old.

title: Movies
description: DID you hear the one about the dolphin who spoke impeccable English? No? Well, you will before long, if Mike Nichols, Buck Henry and Joseph E. Levine follow through with their plans to put Robert Merle's 1969 novel, The Day of the Dolphin, on film. You may recall that this very same directorwriterproducer team got together once beforein 1967on a little number called The Graduate.

title: Commack Scuttles an Exchange
description: COMMACK, L. I. For the last four years, Emanuel Gininger, the principal of the Vanderbilt Elementary School in the Half Hollow Hills School District, has watched some of his white pupils play and learn alongside black pupils from the Wyandanch School District.

title: The World
description: MADRIDThe glee of Bishop Jose Maria Cirarda was unmistakable as he read, out to reporters two juxtaposed headlines in the newspaper Nuevo Diarlo: Holy Office Condemns Errors. Msgr. Vanes Elected Secretary of the Episcopal Conference.

title: So. California Trackmen Capture N.C.A.A Crown
Television
description: WHILE American television is having problems at home, it is not exactly booming onwards and upwards abroad. And, in some ways, the problems in one area are curiously related to those in the other.

title: Cukierman Union Captain
description: Marty Cukiemian, a sophomore from Montreal, has been elected captain of the Union College tennis team in Schenectady, N.Y.

title: Prices Luring Farmers Back to G.O.P.
description: GRIMES, Iowa, March 11Booming cattle and hog prices and a stable grain market have headed off incipient unrest in the Corn Belt and apparently returned the normally Republican farm vote to President Nixon.

title: MADISON AVE. Candidates and Direct Mail
description: If you have a small mallbox maybe you should get a bigger one; you might need it. The 1972 elections are the reason.

title: Joan Mercedes McCabe Affianced
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., March 11Mrs. W. Ambrose McCabe has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Joan Mercedes McCabe, to Kevin Vincent Carey, son of Mr. and Mrs. Vincent J. Carey of Merrick, L. I. A wedding in July is planned.

title: James Harlan Rich jr., Lawyer, Marries Miss Mary Ann Dattola
description: Miss MaryAnn Dattola, daughter of Mrs. McCarthy Dattola of Now York, was married here yesterday afternoon to James Harlan Rich Jr. of Haverford, Pa., son of Mrs. Raymond Rich of Beach Haven, N. 3., and the late Mr. Rich of Philadelphia. The ceremony was performed In the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More by Msgr. James G. Wilders, the pastor.

title: A. Patricia Dowd Wed To Lawrence Whitman
description: The Lady Chapel et the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More was the setting here yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Miss Alice Patricia Dowd, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Anthony Joseph Dowd of Remsenburg, L. I., to Charles Lawrence Whitman, son of the late Clarence Whitman 2d of New York and the late Mrs. Carolyn Whitman.

title: Congressianal Draws Top Skippers
description: Some of the best known names in sailing will put their reputations on the line starting HIM Thursday when the eighth annual Congressional Cup match race series is held at Long Beach, Calif.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Carol Godfrey Sets july Wedding
description: ST. PAUL, March 11Judge Otis H. Godfrey Jr. of the District Court of Minnesota and Mrs. Godfrey have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carol Jean Godfrey, to Thomas D. Warren, son of Mr. and Mrs. John D. Warren of New York, and Lyme, Conn.

title: Secret Sentries In Space
description: Unbeknownst to most people in the United States and the Soviet Union, both countries have been on camera for more than a decade. The cameras are in satellites that travel through open space at five miles a second, more than 100 miles above the earth. The latest U.S. models are said to be capable of photographing onefoot objects. The Russians have their own brand of satellite which returns photos to earth via film capsules or radio transmission. If the current Strategic Arms Limitation Talks (SALT) come to anything, one of the major reasons will be that both powers are confident the satellites will help police the agreement. Philip Klass, an editor of Aviation Week and Space Technology, here tells in detail (as nobody has before and in language understandable to laymen) the history of the satellites, how they work and how they affect world politics.

title: ...Be Just Like This Island
description: PARADISE ISLAND, the BahamasNow that Howard Hughes has departed this Paradise, most of the betting action here has retutned to the dancing dice and spinning roulette wheel of the Paradise Island Casino. Just a few weeks ago the poolside of the adjacent Britannia Beach Hotel resounded with action of its own: Seven will get you five that he is not up there on the ninth floor or Ten to one, the gu'y's not even alive.

title: VINCENT J. TITO
description: WILTON, Conn., March 11Vincent J. Tito, First Selectman of Wilton from 1956 to 1969, died today at Norwalk Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived at 48 Tito Lane.

title: WARRANTS EXPECTED IN POLICE SHOOTINGS
description: DETROIT, March 11 (AP)A spokesman for Mayor Roman Gribbs said today that high police officials would ask the county prosecutor Monday for warrants based on a fatal shootout last Thursday between city policemen and Wayne County sheriff's deputies.

title: UPPER CASE IS 2D
description: MIAMI, March 11  Upper Case, winner of the Florida Derby and $107,760 at Gulfstream Park last week, had to settle for $2020 in second money today, as Hold Your Peace, who had never run more than seveneighths of a mile, made off with the 53d Flamingo Stakes by 10 big lengths.

title: Music
description: NEXT Sunday night the New York City Opera will give the local premiere of Lee Holby's Summer and Smoke. A leading member of the cast will be John Reardon, and nobody will be surprised. He has taken part in more than 30 contemporary operas, 10 of them when they were given their premieres, eight when they were first presented in America. He even did an Italian premiere, singing in a Venice production of Menotti's The Last Savage. (It is one of the baritone's favorite Menotti works, but he says it has much more flavor in Italian, than in English.)

title: JEWISH SCHOOLS SEEK FEDERAL AID
description: The Rabbinical Council of America, the leading orthodox body, has appealed, for Congressional legislation that would grant tax deductions to parents who pay tuition for their children in the allday Jewish schools.

title: ExAgent Sees Revolutionary Potential on Taiwan
description: WASHINGTON, March 11A former agent of the Central Intelligence Agency who served for four years on Taiwan said today that there was a strong revolutionary potential among the native Taiwanese.

title: BIG MAN ON THE MAT: Chris Taylor of Iowa State, Ieft, who weighs more than 400 pounds, during his match with Mike McCready of Northern Iowa at the N.C.A.A. wrestling championships Friday night. Taylor won this match and went on to capture the heavyweight championship title last night.
Black Power in Sports: From Protest to Political Perspective
description: Four years after its stormy initiation on the American scene, the black power movement in sports retains the same intensity of involvement and longrange commitment, but its leaders feel their outlook has moved to another level.

title: The World
description: NICOSIAArchbishop Makarios has never forgiven himself, his aides say, for having compromised on enosis. The union of Cyprus with the Greek motherland, the polestar of the bearded archbishop's fiery political career, had to be given up as an Immediate goal in 1960. Independence for Cyprus, in partnership with Greece and Turkey and with a political role for the island's Turkish minority, was the alternative he had to accept.

title: MovieMaillbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Let's soak the rich
description: Populism cuts a queer figure in the American past. Its bestknown exponent, William Jennings Bryan, came on stage denouncing economic royalists in his Cross of Gold speech and went off battling for conformity of ideas and life style in the famous Scopes trial of evolutionary theory at Dayton Tenn. Huey Long, Tom Watson, Pitchfork Ben Tillman and other populists also followed the road from sharethewealth to beating on minorities. And they turned sour by no mere accident.

title: POINT OF VIEW Books: A French Cassandra
description: THE MONETARY SIN OF THE WEST. By Jacques Rueff. 214 pages. The MacMillan Company. $6.95..

title: AVENER STANDS OUT IN EAST GYM MEET
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., March IIPenn State's Marshall Avener became the first gymnast in Eastern Collegiate Gymnastic League championship history to finish in the top three places of each of the six Olympic events.

title: Dividing Line Brothers Rail Commuters
description: The Harlem Division of the Penn Central can be a fine railroad, its riders say, if you don't go too far. And, they add quickly, beyond North White Plains is too far.

title: Antiquarian Examines Old Copies Of Playboy
description: The wife and I had another one of our wild nights out a couple of weeks ago. We took in the National Antiques Show at Madison Square Garden.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To The EDITOR: Never mind the intellectual tons of Stephen Farber's review of the movie Cisco Pike, girls. nun, don't walk, to the nearest theater showing it to see the most gorgeous hunk of a sexy real male on the screen todayKris Kristoffersonl Moviemakers, take note: Kris Kristofferson is a helluva actor with tremendous physical (woweel) appeal.

title: U. S. Intelligence Costs Put at $3Billion a Year
description: WASHINGTON, March 11Ray S. Cline, director of the State Department's Bureau of, Intelligence and Research, estimated before a Congressional Committee yesterday that the United States spends about $3billion". yearly on collecting intelligence around the world.Mr. Cline, a fernier deputy director of the Central Intelligence Agency, was testifying before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee on. a $7.3million budget request for his, bureau. He conceded that the cost of collecting intelligence might be higher than $3billion, depending on what was considered intelligence.

title: Crack in the Secrecy Wall
description: The new rules laid down by President Nixon for guarding against overuse of secrecy stamps on Government documents are clothed in all the right rhetoric.

title: Grover Cleveland's Caldwell Home Seems the Same as in 1837
description: CALDWELL  As Just about everybody in this Essex County borough of 8,719 people knows, Grover Cleveland, was born here, the only President born in New Jersey.

title: Gloom in Backstretch
description: In the horsemen's room at Aqueduct yesterday, a trainer pointed to a sign above the mail window: HAPPY DAY... TODAY.

title: ALLISON ON POLE FOR CAROLINA 500
description: ROCKINGHAM, N. C., March 11The starting field was rounded out this afternoon to 40 cars for tomorrow's running of the Carolina 500, fifth race of the season on the Grand National Circuit of the National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing (NASCAR).

title: Broadway Meets the Sound of Soul
description: THE sound of the Broadway theater is more and more becoming the sound of soul, influenced not only by the kind of music that is being composed with increasing frequency for Broadway scores but by the gospeltrained singers who are being given an opportunity to use their remarkable vocal resources. Purlie gained much of its flavor and emotional, power from the singing of Linda Hopkins and Melba Moore. Two Gentlemen of Verona uses the, idiom in a broader manner and now there is Inner City (RCA Victor) with Miss Hopkins once again, and Delores Hall, whose skill with gospel technique turns several songs into vivid theatrical exper

title: Triple Bend, With Pierce Up,Wins $170,000 Santa Anita Handicap by Head
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 11Frank McMahon's Triple Bend, ridden by Donald. Pierce, outlasted favored Cougar II with a furious stretch drive today to win the $170,000 Santa Anita Handicap today.

title: Sales of Vitamin E Increasing Rapidly in the Latest Nutrition Fad
description: We know of no earthly use for it, proclaimed an ad for vitamin E in a Tulsa newspaper the other day, but we have it for $4.99 per 100:

title: On Reaching a State of Global Equilibrium
description: IF the present growth trends in world population, industrialization, pollution, food production and resource depletion continue unchanged, the limits to growth on this planet will be reached sometime within the next one hundred years. The most probable result will be a rather sudden and uncontrollable decline in both population and industrial capacity.

title: N.Y.U. to Offer a Baccalaureate Program With Few Courses and No Major
description: New York University will offer a baccalaureate program next September that will require no major and a minimum of classes.

title: Celtics Quietly Retire Bill Russell's No. 6
description: BOSTON, March 12 (AP)Bill Russell's No. 6 jersey, his for 13 seasons with the Boston Celtics, was quietly retired today at Boston Garden. The green number, sewn on a flag, was hoisted to the ceiling of the Garden an hour before the doors opened for the New YorkBoston basketball game.

title: Britain Expects New Rhodesian Crisis
description: LONDON, March 12  The British Government has resigned itself to the prospect of a new crisis over the Setdement terms with its, breakaway colony of Rhodesia.

title: G.M. Talks Continue
description: LORDSTOWN, Ohio, March 12 (UPI)Negotiators bargained for the fifth consecutive day today on issues in the nineday strike that has left idle more than 7,800 workers at the Genaral Motors Vega plant.

title: Monroe to Fight in Paris
description: PARIS, March 12 (AP)Max Cohen, French middleweight, will fight undefeated Willie Monroe of Philadelphia, a stablemate of Joe Frazier, the heavyweight champion, at the Palais des Sports here March 27, officials announced today. Monroe has scored 21 knockouts in 23 fights.

title: Lawyer Weds Nancy White
description: In the chapel at the Church Center for the United Nations here yesterday, Miss Nancy White, daughter of Mrs. Kathryn Breslin White of Old Tappan, N.J., and the late Thomas 3. White, was married to Stuart Kahan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack D. Kahan of Wyncote, Pa. The Rev. Clifford H. Johnson performed the ecumenical ceremony.

title: Lefkowitz Sues Sloane's in a Bid To Alter InstallmentFee System
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz has filed suit against W. & J. Sloane's In an attempt to force the furniture store to change, its method of computing finance charges on installment credit. accounts.

title: C. J. Burge Weds Marion Lefebre
description: Miss Marion Renee Lefebre daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Lefebre of New York, was married here last evening to Christopher John Burge, son of Mrs. Alene Butler of Guildford, Surrey, England, and the late Hugh Burge. Justice Arthur Markewich of the Appellate Division of the Supreme Court performed the ceremony at the St. RegisSheraton.

title: Couple Die in Car Crash
description: FITCHBURG, Mass., March 12 (AP)Mr. and Mrs. Onni M. Forsti, who had celebrated their 40th wedding anniversary and the wife's birthday, were, killed today when their car, plunged over an embankment near here.

title: Arts Abroad
description: PARISThe herd of brightly painted plaster cows that stand Swiss watch on the ChampsElyseas, near the Presidential residence, pro.; vide the answer to the question: why, in the last two years, has Paris again, become, as far as art is concerned, the liveliest city in the world? The answer is: a new, wide open acceptance of all that Is created beyond the borders of France. The Grand Palais is like a concentrate of this ex4 exciting cultural permissiveness, sparked off by the French Ministry of Culture some three or four years ago. It has simultaneously given shelter to contemporary Swiss art (hence the cows on the sidewalk outside), to Eskimo sculpture through the ages, and to Belgian symbolism and surrealism. Across the street, at the Petit Palais, there is what may well be the most important exhibition of English art ever held outside and perhaps even inEng land: English Romantic Painting and the preRaph aelites,

title: Isaac Triumphs in Carolina 500
description: ROCKINGHAM, C. March 12  Bobby Isaac easily stood oft a challenge by Richard Petty today and won the seventh annual Carolina 500 stockcar race at North Carolina Motor Speedway.

title: Aussies Win Back Cup
description: HARTFORD, March 12 (AP) Australian contract pros recaptured the Aetna World Cup last night with a fourmatch sweep of United States players at Trinity College. The triumph carried a $20,000 first prize.

title: TV Staff's China Memories: Offers of Tangerines Filled Pauses
description: A snowball fight in Peking. Orange peel littering a Hangchow park. Shoppers pushing and shoving. A vein throbbing in the forehead of an anxious official. Deadpan offers of tangerines whenever negotiations stalled.

title: Canada Defeats U.S., 10, For World Softball Title
description: MANILA, March 12 (AP)Richard Hames's basesloaded single in the 11th inning broke a scoreless tie and gave Canada a 10 victory over the United States and the title in the third World men's softball championship today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: More Spending Set By Paper Industry To Curb Pollution
description: The paper industry will spend an estimated $320million on pollution control facilities this year, compared with $234million in 1971, according to the annual report of the American Paper Institute.

title: Managing Directors Named At 3 Lord &
description: Three managing directors of Lord & Taylor stores have been appointed effective Aug. 1.

title: GEORGE A. BOYD
description: MIDDLETOWN, N.Y., March 12George A. Boyd, who retired in 1963 as executive vice president of the domestic American Fore Loyalty Group of insurance companies, died yesterday at Mount Joy Farm, his home here. He was 73 years old.

title: Britain and China to Establish Full Ties
description: LONDON, March 12Britain and China have agreed to establish full diplomatic relations after months of negotiations aided in part by President Nixon's recent visit to Peking.

title: Capitol Crime
description: The United States Capitol does not belong to the seven Congressmen of the Commission for the Extension of the Capitol. It belongs to the people of the United States and to history. In spite of pubic and professional opinion that the controversial extension of the Capitol's West Front is a gross error of art and judgment, these gentlemen seem determined to proceed with this gigantic bungle and boondoggle.

title: Singapore Plant to Expand
description: SINGAPORE, March 12 (UPI) The North American Rockwell Corporation said today it would invest $500,000 more in its $5million factory here. It makes roller chains, among other products.

title: MARQUETTE OUT OP N.C.A.A. PLAY
description: The National Collegiate Athletic. Association, in a show of toughness and apparently seeking to avoid another Villanova and Western Kentucky incident, threw Marquette out of its baskettiall championship touraliment yesterday. Ohio University may replace the Warriors.

title: INDIAN VOTE GIVES MRS. GANDHI 70% OF REGIONAL SEATS
description: NEW DELHI, March 12 Prime Minister Indira Gandhi has won more than 70 per cent of state assembly seats, according to incomplete election returns announced tonight.

title: Peking Mission in Guyana
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, March 12  A sevenman permanent Chinese trade mission arrived in this South American capital from Peking last night, in accordance with the agreement last November between Guyana and China to establish such missions in each other's capitals. The m'ission's director, Nieh Kungcheng, said on arrival he would make further efforts to promote trade relations and economic cooperation between our two countries.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editors

title: MRS. RANKIN TAKES PLAYOFF IN HOUSTON
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: China Demands That U.S. End Interference In Laos
description: PEKING, March 12 (Reuters) China, in her second attack on American policy in Indochina since President Nixon's visit ended two weeks ago, accused the United States today of interference and aggression in Laos and demanded that these actions be halted immediately.

title: Advertised Prices Up 2.31 % At Retailer Stores in January
description: Prices advertised by department, specialty and general merchandise stores during January averaged 2.31 per cent higher than those in the same month last year, according to the Bureau of Advertising, a division of;the American News paper Publishers Association. Women's and misses apparel prices as advertised in 13 cities throughout the country were up 3.17 per cent, while women's sportswear rose by an average of 8.22 per cent. In the latter category, however, slacks and shorts declined 3.8 per cent, while sweaters declined 2.5 per cent.

title: Ceausescu's Trip Seen as Bid for Trade and New Links
description: BUCHAREST, March 12 Rumania's President Nicolee Ceausescu, a political and economic dissident in the Communist bloc, set off on a new diplomatic course this weekend as he began a tour of eight African and Arab capitals.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on Peaceful Uses of the Seabed, subcommittee on international regime3 P.M.

title: Books of The Time
description: At a lunch a few years ago, when I was getting to know Wilfrid Sheed, I asked him if he was realy a Catholic.. Reviews of his books described him as a Catholic, but was he really? What I meant by the question was, did he really believe in, say, the existence of a place called limbo, to which the soil! of a dead unbaptized infant would go while the soul of dead baptized twin would go to heaven. I wasn't inquiring about miracu, lous Matters like the virgin birth or transubstantiation, and certainly not about central concerns like the divinity of Jesus, only about propositions that had struck me as lib. surd or unjust. Sheed understoOd the icebergery of the question. I was five years or so older than he and bad come of ago beforeWorld War II, when the Cath olic Church in America, at least on the parish level, was at its most Irishimmigrant rigid. As a Catholic, I had been given an: allornothing choice (something like American Communists of the time) and had chosen. the nothing. After ex plaining in what ways he was a Catholic, which seemed to me a rather loose con struction, Shred went on to say, If you were young toddy, there would be a place in the Church for you. After reading Andrew M. Greeley's Priests in the United States: Reflections on a SurVey, it seems to me there might even have been a place in the priesthood.

title: Membership Bill Set
description: WASHINGTON, March 12 (AP)Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, said today he would offer legislation to suspend the Securities and Exchange Commission's power to block institutional membership in stock exchanges until one year after inflexible commission rates on all trades exceeding $100,000 are eliminated. Institutions have stated they have no interest in engaging in a general brokerage business and probably would join an exchange only to avoid fixed commission costs, he said.

title: G.O.P. Aide Shifts Jobs
description: The state government switched one of its major bank accounts from Morgan Guaranty Trust Company to Bankers Trust Company less than two months after the treasurer of the Republican State Committee changed jobs from Morgan Guaranty to Bankers Trust, state and party officials said yesterday.

title: Harassment Drives City's Resident Policemen From Their Home Precincts
description: The city's first two resident policemen"picked earlier this year to test whether patrolmen assigned to their home neighborhoods can build a special trust with the publichave quietly transferred out of their home precincts after becoming the targets of telephone harassment and other abuse and annoyances.

title: Article 4 No Title
description: DENVER, March 12 (UP)Two heart specialists who examined Mrs. DIU. D. Beard said today that the Washington lobbyist, while not physically able to appear before. the Senate Judiciary Committee, could answer questions of the committee from her hospital roof as early as Tuesday or Wednesday. Mrs. Beard's Denver physician, Dr. L. M. Radetsky, refused to identify the specialists.

title: POLICE USE COPTER TO FOIL BURGLARY
description: Policemen using unmarked cars, walkietalkies and a helicopter, yesterday captured four teenagers who allegedly were breaking into a Brooklyn mini bike factory.

title: Rising Welfare Here Laid To Family and Addict Ills
2 SENATORS ACCUSED BY 3D IN I.T.T. INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, March 12 (AP)Senator Marlow W. Cook, Republican of Kentucky, said today, that he believed Demo, cratic Senators Edward Kennedy and Birch Bayh and Jack Anderson, the columnist, had conspired to discredit Government officials despite the abSenee of wrongdoing of any kind in the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation merger case.

title: Labor Bids the Pay Board Approve West Coast Pact
description: WASHINGTON, March 12 (AP)The International Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Union, backed by most of the rest of the nation's labor movement, urged the Pay Board today not to tamper with the 32 per cent threeyear wage settlement that ended a 134day West Coast dock strike.

title: LowGrade Gas Is Found Adequate for Many Autos
ExJustice Benjamin Schreiber Of State Supreme Court la Dead
description: Former Justice Benjamin F. Schreiber of the State Supreme Court died last evening at Lenox Hill ,Hospital.. He was 87 years old and lived at 930 Fifth Avenue.

title: HARTFORD GIVEN RENOVATION PUN
description: HARMED, March 12 (AP) An $800million 15year plan to renovate the northern half of Hartford was proposed last night by the Greater Hartford Process; Inc.

title: PRINCETON WILL ADD WOMEN TO FACULTY
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 12  Princeton University has released an affirmative action plan calling for substantial increases by 1974 in the number of women and members of minority groups on its faculty and administrative staff.

title: J. R. RADIN CONCERN FACING LIQUIDATION
description: J. R. Raclin & Co., Inc., small brokerage concern, has been placed in the hands of a courtappointed trustee and will be liquidated under the provisions of the Securities Investor Protection Corporation. Radin is situated at 70 Wall Street.

title: Rule on Deferring Interest Cited by Revenue Service
description: WASHINGTON, March 12 (Reuters)Taxpayers who have money in deferred interest accounts must pay taxes as though they received the interest on a prorated monthly basis, the Internal Revenue Service noted today.

title: 3 Children Die in Fire
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., March 12 (UPI) Three children were burned to death and their father was seriously injured when fire destroyed a twostory home, here early yesterday. The police identified the victims as Caroline Chryst, 3 years old, and her sister Deborah, 5, and brother, David, 7. Their father, Robert Chryst, was admitted to Sacred Heart Hospital here, where he was listed in serious condition.

title: Nebraska Nuclear Plant Mired in Dispute
description: OMAHA, Neb.The mighty works in steel and concrete of Peter Kiewit's many companies can be found from Greenland to Southern California, from Alaska to Florida.

title: Elks Dismiss Opponent Of Their AllWhite Rule
description: A New Jersey mailman who carried on a fouryear campaign to integrate the membership of the Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks was expelled from the fraternal organization yesterday.

title: Publish and Perish
description: On the very day of Clifford Irving's indictment, the authenticity of Chief Red Fox's bestselling memoirs was challenged, plunging reverence for the printed word to low for the season. If Howard Hughes autobiography was written wholly without his knowledge and much of the Sioux's chief's recollections were culled word for word from another man's work, a reader may for a time approach books with the skepticism he now reserves for the blurbs on their jackets.

title: Jersey Tax Collections Up $39Million in 2d Half of 71
description: TRENTON, March 12 (AP)New Jersey salestax collections were $39million higher in the second half of 1971 than they were in the comparable period the year before.

title: DR. J. GRANT IRVING OF AETNA LIFE DIES
description: HARTFORD; March 12Dr. J. Grant Irving, chief medical director since 1960 of. Aetna Life and Casualty Company, died last night in. Hartford Hospital. He was 64 years old.

title: RESERVE'S CHIEF CALM ON DOLLAR
description: BASEL, Switzerland, March 12Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today I am a very calm man after a weekend of talks with central bankers from Western Europe, Japan and Canada to coordinate policies in the latest attack against the dollar.

title: KEY SENATORS SEEK A NATIONAL PRIMARY
description: WASHINGTON, March 12 (AP)Two of the most influential members of the Senate will propose a constitutional amendment tomorrow that would establish a national Presidential primary election.

title: Shields &
description: Shields & Co., a member firm of the New York Stock Exchange, announced yesterday that pretax earnings rose last year to $8,506,877 from $4,995,480 in 1970.

title: Italian Woman in Custody In Munich After Hijacking
description: MUNICH, West Germany, March 12 (Reuters)  An Italian woman who took over an Alitalia jetliner on a flight from Rome to Milan last night and forced it to fly to. Munic.h was in custody here today on charges of hijacking.

title: MIGRANTS WORRY ESTONIA, LATVIA
description: MOSCOW, March 12  The Communist leaders of two Soviet Baltic republics, apparently concerned over possible friction with a growing influx of Russian migrants, are pressing an ideological cam paign to foster ethnic toles ance and understanding.

title: TACCHINO, PIANIST, SHOWS SENSITIVITY
description: Gabriel Tacchino is well known to record collectors through his fine albums of Mozart, Prokofiev and Poulenc, among others, but the French pianist has appeared here only twice since his American debut in 1962, and his concert at Hunter College Playhouse yesterday afternoon marked his first New York recital.

title: Personal Finance: Moving Expenses
description: For taxpayers on the move, there are some worthwhile tax deductions. In fact, the Internal Revenue Service recently changed a rule that slightly widens tax benefits for a husband and wife, filing separate returns, when move and job change are involved.

title: LOUIS MOROANSTERN
description: HARTFORD, March 12 Louis Morganstern, owner of the Resolute Insurance Company until its sale a year ago for $15million to Triumph Investment Trust, Ltd., died today in Hartford Hospital. He was 76 years old and live in West Hartford and in Palm Beach.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: LOS ANGELES, March 12 (AP)Mayor Sam Yorty said today that he would reassess his Presidential campaign plans because of the death of his Deputy Mayor, Eleanor Chambers, 69 years old, who died of influenza complications.

title: Wheat Rites Tomorrow
description: SEDALIA, Mo., March 12 (AP)  A funeral service for Zack Wheat, former star outfielder of the Brooklyn Dodgers, and a member of the Baseball Hall of Fame, will be held here Tuesday. Mr. Wheat, who died at a Sedalia hospital last night of a.heart attack, was 83 years old.

title: Far Coats From Dogs? South Africa Is Shocked
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, March 12Van der Sandt de Villiers Smit is on the way to becoming the most unpopular man in South Africa.

title: Weather Was a Mess Bat 1888 Was Worse
description: An unusual combination of thunder, lightning and snow that moved over the metropolitan area late Saturday night gave way to intermittent showers throughout yesterday, the anniversary of a 21inch snowfall during the fourday blizzard of 1888, in which nearly 400 died.

title: A Bow to the Colonels
description: There is simply no way that the United States can station 6,600 more American officers and seamen plus 3,100 Navy dependents in Greece without bestowing dramatic public blessing on the Athens military dictatorship. It is an exercise in hypocrisy as well futility for the State Department to contend that this arrangement does not affect U.S. views on the Greek Government and does not change our disappointment at the slow pace at which democracy is returning that country.

title: 4 Crewmen Die in Crash of Penn Central Freights
description: SUNBURY, Pa., March 12 (Renters)A southbound Penn Central coal train ran through a stop signal, jumped a switch and collided head on with a northbound freight today. Four locomotive crewmen were killed.

title: VILLAGE FOE DRIVES 35 OUT OF HOMES
description: A threealarm blaze badly damaged a Greenwich Village apartment house at 77 Perry Street, near Bleecker Street, early today, forcing about 35 residents out of their homes.

title: Chiefs Subdue Red Devils in Roller Derby, 49 to 48
description: Bob (Thumper) Woodberry of the Red Devils spent much of yesterday afternoon's Roller Derby game at Madison Square Garden attempting to knock Mike Gammon and Ronnie Nel son of the Chiefs out of aotion but was unsuccessful, His fail ure was costly as his two rivals combined for 3 points as time elapsed to give their team a 4918 International Roller Derby League victory In the final reg ularseason game at the Gar den.

title: Flunking Is Harder as College Grades Rise Rapidly
description: College grades are rising steadily and perhaps at an accelerating rate on campuses across the country, although teachers :and professors do not agree on the reasons why.

title: Merrie Anne Shapse Is Bride Of Philip Fredericks, a Student
description: Miss Merrie Anne Shapse and Philip Swart Fredericks, students at Ithaca College, were married here yesterday morning in Central Synagogue by the bride's granduncles, Rabbis Victor E. Reichert of Cincinnati and Joseph I. Weiss of Hello Harbor, Queens Rabbi Sheldon I Zimmerman and Cantor Frederick Lochner, both of Central Synagogue, assisted.

title: Feuerbach Puts Shot 70 Feet, World's 2d Best
description: Los Angeles, March 12 (Reuters)  Al Feuerbach has become the second man to put the shot over 70 feet He bettered that mark by a halfinch yesterday at Mount San Antonio College.

title: GROSSMAN ENSEMBLE FEATURES MASSELOS
description: In the 15 years since Julius Grossman founded the Municipal Concerts Orchestra, the ensemble has given hundreds of free concerts in the city parks, schools and hospitals. It also has presented a number of interesting selfbenefit programs in major auditoriums, the most recent being Saturday night's at Alice Tully Hall, with William Masselos contributing his services as guest pianist.

title: U.S. AGENTS LIME TO SUIT ON RIGHTS
description: A Federal appeals court ruled here last week that Federal agents might be sued for violation of constitutional rights after an arrest or search, but It declared that a valid defense would be that they had acted in good faith and in reasonable belief.

title: TV: Ballet From China
description: There it was yesterday afternoon right on the capitalistic homescreen: the first spectacular from China. Over at the National Broadcasting Company, producer Lucy Jarvis had the clever sense, plus the cooperation of the United Nations delegation from China, to obtain rights to the filmed. version of the Peking Opera's Red Detachment of Women.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 11 The burly. Baptist preacher leaned into the battery of microphones and his question exploded through the massive speakers on either side of the stage.

title: Reform Rabbis Elect Head
description: The Association of Reform Rabbis of New York and Vicinity last week elected as its president Rabbi Selig Salkowitz of Temple Avoda in Fair Lawn, N. J. The association, the largest regional group within the Central Conference of American Rabbis, consists of 225 rabbis serving congregations in New York, east New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: LEVITT QUESTIONS CITY FOOD BRING
description: The State Controller's office urged yesterday an investigation into the possibility of bid rigging in the annual purchase of more than $3million worth of fruits and vegetables by city and state institutions in the metropolitan area.

title: INDIA'S SOLDIERS QUIT BANGLADESH
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, March 12 (AP)  The Indian Army mounted a ceremonial retreat from Bangladesh today, bidding farewell to the nation it helped to create.

title: Chess: Success Not Sole Measure  Of Tourney Player's Form
BLACK ASSEMBLY VOTED AT PARLEY
description: GARY, Ind., March 12Delegates to the first National Black Political convention adopted today a farranging political agenda that would establish an independent black political assembly to seek to strengthen the overall effectiveness of some 7.5 million black voters. Such an assembly would also perform followup duties recommended by this convention.

title: Green Confers in Jakarta
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Monday, March 13 (Reuters)United States Assistant Secretary of State Marshall Green held talks today with Foreign Minister of Indonesia Adam Malik at the Foreign Ministry. Mr. Green, who is on a tour to brief allied leaders on President Nixon's trip to China, will leave for Australia tonight.

title: British in Ulster Accused of Psychological Torture
Enemy Tanks Reported Hit
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 12 (AP)United States military sources said today that American planes destroyed several North Vietnamese tanks in raids in southern Laos during the last week.

title: Birth Study Urges Broader Services Throughout Nation
description: Thirteen countries have lower infant mortality rates than does the United States, and 10 countries outrank this one in maternal mortality. Approximately 15 per cent of the nation's births are unwanted and most of the hundreds of thousands of women who have abortions each year used either no contraceptives or, an ineffective one.

title: Turkish Senators Linked To a Drug Smuggling Ring
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 12 (Reuters)Several Turkish Senators have been implicated in drugsmuggling ring, the Interior Minister, Ferit Kubat, said today.

title: Back to 5Cent Malted and Plenty of Room to Stroll
description: A jumbo malted milk cost a nickel in the late 1930's. Queens was a borough of empty lots, and the streets of Manhattan were easy to move around in. A young man named Rudy Burckhardt was photographing the city then  its signs, buildings, bridges, factories, subways, pavements and people and his friend Edwin Denby was writing sonnets to the photographs.

title: 95% FOUND IN LINE ON PRICING RULES
description: A random check by the Internal Revenue Service of 687 larger retail stores in Manhattan and the Bronx at the end of February found 658, or 95 per cent, in compliance with the Price Commission's base price posting regulations, an I.R.S. official said last week;

title: LUKE C. QUINN JR., 64, CANCER SOCIETY AIDE
Boswell's Hit Wins, 2.1, in 9thSeaver Tests Arm Without Pain
If Her Dinner Guests Like the. Dining Room Table, They Can Buy
description: Mary Ann Murray never knows when one of her guests is going to go home with the dinner dishes. Which is fine with Miss Murray, since she lives in an antiques shop and does almost all her entertaining there.

title: Charles H. Smith Jr. Dies; Knoxville Journal Publisher
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn. March 12 (AP)Charles H. Smith Jr publisher and president of The Knoxville Journal, died today. He was 62 years old.

title: Scott's Case Will Result In Lawsuits by Squires
description: NORFOLK, Va., March 12 (AP)Earl Foreman, owner of the Virginia Squires, announced tonight the club had decided to take legal action in two directions against its missing star, Charlie Scott.

title: Article 1 No Title
description: SUNBURY, Pa., March 12 (AP)The dead crewmen were identified as H. C. Billig and Robert W. Otto, engineers, and Emil L. Sirhan and W.T. Kennedy, brakemen.

title: Pakistan Drops 1,200 Aides On Charges of Corruption
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, March 12 (AP)The Government tonight announced the forced retirement on corruption charges of more than 1,200 officials, including two ambassadors and two consulsgeneral.

title: Dread Disease Insurance Bar To Go Into Effect Here on May
description: The State Insurance Department has decided to outlaw the dread disease kind of health insurance policy now held by tens of thousands of people, on the ground that it does not provide broad enough coverage.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The police reported yesterday that the back windows of 54 medallion taxis parked at or near six Bronx garages that own them had been shattered by heavy sticks cudgels. The police and the Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade said that dissident drivers, unhappy over the lower percentage of the metered fare paid to inexperienced drivers, may have been responsible.

title: End Blue Shirts Streak at 16Kurt Stars
description: Maybe, said Glen Sather after the fall, the odds catch up to you.

title: 3 TOP PLACES TAKEN BY JENKINS'S MOUNT
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 12Rod Jenkins, a 27yearold professional from Orange, Va., scored a clean sweep today in the $25,000 American Gold Cup show jumping competition by riding the first three finishers.

title: Pride N Joy Gains Laurels For Pony Division at Show
JAMES TRIMBLE, 78, EXREPRESENTATIVE
description: EUREKA SPRINGS, Ark., March 12 (AP)Former Repre sentative James. W. Trirnbip, who served in the House from 1945 to 1967, died Friday at hOspital here. He was 78 years old.

title: McGrawHill's Woes Could Help Speed Copyright Law Reforms
description: WASHINGTON, March 12The publishing scandals surrounding Clifford Irving and William Red Fox are inspiring new attempts to protect an author's work and may bring momentum to longstalled legislation for the revision of the 1909 Copypright Act.

title: Philharmonia Puts Focus on Conductor In a Foss Marathon
description: The Brooklyn Philharmonia's fouranduhalfhour musical ;marathon at the Academy of Music Saturday night focused on the American composeror more accurately, on the Philharmonia's conductor, Lukas Foss, whose compositions, improvisations and musical hangups monopolized the evening.

title: Aqueduct Stays Closed; OTB Opens for Pimlico
description: The strike that has kept Aqueduct closed since last Monday will keep the Big A closed again today.

title: Advertising :
description: Schick's $3millionplus TV network advertising effort to promote its injector shaving system among the 18 to 25yearolds began over the weekend. And before long (once the product gets in distribution) will be joined by what is expected to be a $6million campaign for Schick Super II, the WarnerLambert's subsidiary delayed answer to Gillette's TRAC IL.

title: Italy Fights Political Violence and Crime
description: ROME, March 12  Italian policemen are. piling up overtime and have been advised not to ask for any days off during the next two months as they wage a twopronged battle.

title: Bridge: Entry Play Helps Establish PlayerofYear in Brooklyn
description: Some unusual plays are sometimes available to a declarer who appears to be an entry short in the dummy, as uncovered by South in most ingenious resource on the diagramed deal.

title: Untypical Florida
description: This week's Democratic primary in Florida, even more than its predecessor last week in NeW Hampshire, cannot offer a true measure of the mettle of the party's principal Presidential contenders because of the inclusion of a host of marginaland some submarginalchallengers. The proliferation of candidates in tomorrow's election could make the results especially misleading because it enhances the probability of a victory by Alabama's Governor George C. Wallace.

title: Talks Fail to End Dispute Between 2 Tennis Factions
description: LONDON, March 12 (AP) Tennis officials failed today in a bid to end the dispute that threatens to prevent the contract professionals from playing at Wimbledon, Forest Hills and the French open.

title: Divisive Census
description: The angry opposition to the ethnic survey ofthe city's 400,000 public employes arises from widespread distrust of the motives behind the census. Mayor Lindsay and Human Rights Commissioner Eleanor Holmes Norton insist that the statistical count by race amt. sex will Mr be used for establishment of a quota system. But these disclaimers have failed to allay the suspicions of those, who see scant reason to conduct an ethnic head count for any other purpose.

title: Murphy Vows Suspensions If Police Refuse to Work
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said yesterday he would immediately suspend any policeman who refused to work. His warning was issued as Edward J. Kiernan, the head of the Patrolmen's Benevdlent Association, threatened a job action before the end of the month.

title: Early Pennsy Report Fails To Stir Creditor Interest
description: With only 19 days to go before the trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company must file their formal plan of reorganization with the Federal Court in Philadelphia, there has been surprisingly little reachion so far from the principal creditors to a preliminary report the trustees filed with the court last month, according to Jervis Langdon, one of the four trustees.

title: Democratic Concessions Likely On Post Card Registration Bill
description: WASHINGTON, March 12 Only with some lastminute concessions does it now appear that the Senate Democratic leadership can rescue legislation designed to increase voter Participation by permitting registration by port card. erotic leader, Senator Mike Mansfield of Montana is, prepared to make some concessions,

title: Questions Must Be Raised About the Imminence of the Disaster
description: MRS. Antrobus, in Thorn ton Wilder's The Skin of Our Teeth, steps out of her part to say, I hate this play and every word in it. As for me, I don't understand a single word of it, anywayall about the troubles the human race has gone through, there's a subject for you.

title: Mrs. Gunter Takes Final From Mrs. King, 76, 61
description: DALLAS, March 12 (AP)Mrs. Nancy Richey Gunter defeated an exhausted Mrs. Billie Jean King, 76, 61, today in the Maureen Connolly Brinker tournament final and won $11,000, the largest first prize in women's tennis history.

title: Advertising :
description: Let's get St. Patrick's Day week off to a flying start with some news of Byrne, McCaffrey, McCall and Colihan.

title: GRIFFIN RETURNS TO CHANNEL 5 SLOT
description: WNEWTV will introduce new lineup of evening talk shows tonight. Merv Griffio, late of the Columbia Broadcasting System, returns to Channel 5 in his old 810 P.M. time slot, replacing David Frost, who takes over the 1.1:30 P.M. spot opposite Johnny Carson on the National Broadcasting Company; Dick Cavett on the American Broadcasting Company and the new C.B.S. movies.

title: Finding Government jobs for Women
description: WASHINGTONAt a party recently in Manhattan, Barbara Franklin of the White House staff was mistaken for Gloria Steinem. Not just once, but a couple of times. Several guests, all members of the National Organization of Women, walked up and addressed her as Gloria and started talking.

title: Synagogue Plays Host To Bishop Mugavero
description: The Union Temple of Brooklyn was host to Bishop Francis J. Mugavero yesterday for the annual interfaith gathering of the Jewish and Catholic communities of Brooklyn and Queens.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ULSTER WOMAN DIES AS TRUCE IS BROKEN
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 12 (AP)  Guerrillas opened fire tonight on a British Army patrol and a young woman bystander was killed, a military spokesman said. The shooting cut short a weekend of peace brought by a ceasefire proclaimed by the militant Provisional wing of. the Irish Republican Army.

title: Lieut. Gov. Wilson: No. 2 Bides His Time
description: ALBANY, March 12The Valentine's Day gathering of Republican women tittered appreciatively as the speaker lauded Governor Rockefeller for the achievements of his 13 years, one month, 1300BD days and two hours and 29 minutes in office.

title: 3 U.S. Planes Claimed
description: HONG KONG, March 12 (Reuters)The press agency of the Pathet Lao said today that Communist troops in Laos had shot down three United States planes, killing six Central Intelligence Agency spies.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: MIAMI, March 12I don't think you have to mix up the children to get quality education at all. I'm opposed to forced integration.

title: DONALD C. MARTIN
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., March 12  Donald Creagh Martin, sales manager for the Crosssay, Queens, district of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, died today in Nassau Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived at 44 Kingsbury Road.

title: Study Shows Much Federal Housing Subsidy Money Goes to Middlemen Instead of Poor Families
description: WASHINGTON, March 12A new study of federally subsidized housing indicates that as much as half of the subsidy money is passed to middlemen and never. reaches the needy families for whom the funds are intended.

title: 4 SovietBloc Aides Ordered Out of Italy For Alleged Spying
description: ROME, March 12Intelligence sources here said today that four Eastern European diplomats who have been ordered to leave Italy had been spying on allied military activities in Malta and elsewhere in the Mediterranean.

title: Smith Wins 4th in Row
description: WASHINGTON, March 12 (AP) Stan Smith turned back a determined bid by young Jim Connors today and captured the $25,000 Equity Funding international tennis tournament final, 46,.61, 63, 4.6, 61.

title: Il Matrimonio Segreto Is Performed
description: Domenico Cimarosa's 11 Matrimonio Segreto is among those operas people have always known about but few (in this country, anyway) have ever seen. The Metropolitan Opera produ'ced it in 1937 and, after giving a few performances that year, dropped it.

title: Nixon Returns to Capital
description: WASHINGTON, March 12 (AP)  President Nixon returned to the White. House tonight after spending a long weekend at Camp David, Md., working on a position paper on school busing.

description: To the Editor:

title: Danish Aid for Nationalists In Africa Angers Portugal
description: LISBON, March 12The Lisbon press has expressed indignation over Denmark's support to nationalist movements in Portuguese Africa but remained silent on Peking's latest claims to Macao.

title: Soledad Trial Nearing End
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 12 (UPI)The Soledad Brothers murder trial enters its 12thand probably final  week tomorrow, with closing arguments scheduled to get under way, The defendants, John Clutchette and Fleeta Drumgo, are accused of killing a Soledad state prison guard.

title: VERSE SETS A TREND FOR FILM AND DANCE
description: Legion are the sins committed in the name of mixedmedia theater and program No. 3 of The Film and Dance Theater added a few more Saturday evening.

title: Voters From Port Moresby to Jungle Elect a Papua New Guinea Legislature
description: PORT MORESBY, Papua New Guinea, March 11Under some of the most primitive conditions imaginable, this vast Australianadministered tropical territory has elected a new legislature that is expected to decide when the country will become selfgoverning, and may possibly fix a date for independence.

title: Stores Uneasy as NoParking Clears Brussels Square
description: BRUSSELS, March 7On March 1, the Brussels civic. administration banned parking in the Grand Place, and a week later as Eugene Bols, a 41yearold carpenter, was walking across the oilstained cobblestones of what is perhaps the most elegant square in Europe, he remarked:

title: Arts Endowment Appoints Head of Museum Program
description: WASHINGTON, March 12 AP)Dr. John R. Spencer, pro. fessor of art at Oberlin College and director of its Allen Memorial Art Museum, has been named director of the museum program of the National Endowment for the Arts.

title: Rain Toll at 36 in Peru
description: LIMA, Pert, March 12 (Reuters)  The death toll in a summer deluge that has beset parts of Peru for nearly a month rose to at least 36 today, with 20 people missing and more than 150,000 homeless.

title: Wilson O. Railway Dies at 54; Active in Church World Service
STATE U. APPLICANTS RISE 15% ABOVE 71
description: ALBANY, March 12Applications for admission to the State University of New York are running 15 per cent ahead of lest year, the university reported today.

title: NEW ENEMY DRIVE REPORTED IN LAOS
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 12 (UPI)  Government military sources said today that North Vietnamese forces have resumed an offensive against Long Tieng and Sam Thong, two key Government bases in northcentral Laos.

title: Twins Reject Pension Plan
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 12 (AP)  The Minnesota Twins have voted, 30.0, to reject the club owner's proposed pension for players, Jim Perry, the team's player representative, said today. He said the action was not a strike vote.

title: Emde Motorcycle Victor
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., March 12 (Reuters)  Don Emde, on a Yamaha 350, won the annual Daytona 200 motorcycle championship today before a record crowd of 46,500.

title: TRAINEE FLIGHTS GUT BY AIR FORCE
description: WASHINGTON, March 12In an effort to stem the rising costs of pilot training, the Air Force has begun to streamline its flying course and has put increased reliance on simulated flying.

title: World Figure Skating Ends With Russians Taking Dance
description: CALGARY, Alberta, March 12  With the pressure gone, the atmosphere casual and the skating excellent, the world figure skating championships concluded today with an exhibition by the champions and the top placers in all divisions.

title: Big European Satellite Put In Orbit for Research Task
description: PARIS, March 12. (Reuters).Western Europe's biggest and most advanced scientific satellite went into orbit early today after a successful launching on an AmeriCan rocket from the test range in Lompoc, Calif., last night, space officials here said today.

title: Integration in Private. Schools Urged at Forum. at St. James
description: A black community leader told parishioners at prestigious St. James Episcopal Church yesterday that unless Christians accept the principle of open, or integrated, education in private elementary schools they are not ready to practice. what they preach:

title: J. Alvin Kugelmass Dead; Newsman and Biographer
description: SAN. JOSE, Calif., March 12 (UP1),J. Alvin Kugelmass, biographer, Magazine Writer and newpaper editor, died of cancer yesterday at the age of 61 in Los Gatos Community Hospital.

title: DOLLAR PURCHASE OF U.S. UNITS SEEN;EconOmist Says Foreigners Might Use Holdings to Acquire Subsidiaries
description: One of Wall Street's leading economists raised the posibility yesterday that foreign governments might use their swollen holdings of United States dollars to take over foreign subsidiaries of American corporations.

title: PENGUINS, BRUINS PLAY TO A 44 TIE
ELEANOR CHAMBERS, YORTY'S DEPUTY, 69
description: LOS ANGELES, March 12 (UPI) Deputy Mayor Eleanor Chambers of Los Angeles died early today, at the age of 69.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Doctor Links Methadone Treatment To a Decline in Crime in the Capital
description: WASHINGTON, March 12The director of the District of Columbia Narcotics Treatment Administration has cited recent local statistics as evidence that the crime rate can be reduced in inverse proportion to the increase in the number of heroin addicts who undergo the controversial methadone treatment for their addiction. cent of the men between 20 and 24, were heroin addicts, according to a study made by the narcotics treatment agency in 1970.

title: City Hall Notes
description: Despite a projected $800million budget gap, an atmosphere of calm prevails around City Hall these days. The tranquility contrasts sharply with the Lindsay administration's response last year when an $800million budget gap led to the preparation of four optional budgets, and the threat to cut 90,000 city jobs, Why the difference this year? We have lived through a period of extreme budget crisis, said Deputy Mayor Edward K. Hamilton who was Budget Director during last year's fiscal crisis. I think people understand the significance now We don't have to go through public histrionics.

title: LON NOL ANNOUNCES HE HOLDS 3 OFFICES
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Monday, March 13 (UPI)Marshal Lon Nol, the Cambodian Chief of State, announced today that he has taken over as President, Commander in Chief of the armed forces and Premier.

title: MUSKIE, IN SHIFT, PLEDGES TO NAME HIS FUND SOURCES
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 12 Two days before Florida's Democratic Presidential primary, Senator Edmund S. Muskie suddenly reversed today his position on campaign finances, pledging to disclose the sources of an estimated $3million in contributions.

title: Jackson and McGovern Differ on Mrs. Kennedy
description: MIAMI; March 12Senator Henry M. Jackson suggested today that Senator George. McGovern might have concealed a campaign contribuLion from Mrs. RobertF. Kennedy. Senator McGovern quickly termed the charge outrageous and untruthful.

title: Brazilian Merger Creates Biggest Private Latin Bank
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 12  The Brazilian Government has just created the largest private bank in Latin America by approving the merger of Banco Brasileiro de Descontos and the Unido de Bancos Brasileiros.

title: DRILLING OFF L.I. FORESEEN AS PERIL
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. L, March 12Nine State Senators and Assemblymen from Long Island held two days of legislative hearings last week on four state bills that would prohibit offshore oil drilling and attempt to restrict oil pollution in the coastal waters of New York.

title: Carlisle's Doberman Is Winner at Saw Mill Show
N.Y.U. IS ASSISTING ITS HANDICAPPED
description: Spurred by growing discontent among disabled stu dents, New York University is acting to sharpen the school's appeal to the handicapped, and in so doing it hopes to triple the enrollment of disabled students within four years..

title: Liquidator Says Marathon Agrees to Buy Shipyard
description: GLASGOW, Scotland, March 12 (AP)  A Governmentappointed liquidator flew home from Texas today and said the Houstonbased Marathon Manufacturing Corporation had agreed to buy Scotland's ailing Clydebank shipyard for building oil rigs.

title: U.S. Emigration to Israel Tapering Off
description: HAIFA, Israel, March 12 Immigration from the United States, which increased year after year since the 1967 ArabIsraeli war, appears to be declining.

title: Bing's Treat Soothes Opera Standees
description: The treat was on Sir Rudolph Bing, it turned out yesterday, as the Metropolitan Opera's, general manager turned conductor for a tery of standingroom.tickets to the April 22 farewell gala in his honor.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN Wallace Eyes Primaries In Ohio and California
description: MIAMI, March. 12 (AP)Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama said today thathe might campaign in as Many as 10 more Democratic manias, probably including California's on June 6.and possibly Ohio's on May 2.

title: 2 NATIONS CLAIM MALACCA STRAIT
description: SINGAPORE, March 7Indonesia and Malaysia maintained again this week that the Strait of Malacca, long considered an international waterway, was their property.

title: Snacks and Busy Families Blamed for Much Poor Nutrition Among Youths
description: WASHINGTON, March 11A harried family life style and too much reliance on Convenience foods are responsible for much of the poor nutritional health of the nation's teenagers, according to a Maryland nutelti6nist. she said, Is not for a doctor to demand that his patient go on a diet. Rather, she said the doctor should try to understand his patient's worries, his economic situation, his life style and other traits, and design a program that takes these all into account.

title: JAPANESE SHOCKED BY MASS MURDERS
description: TOKYO, March 12A group of young Japanese radicals has horrified the nation with the sadistic mass murder of 12 of their own comrades.

description: To the Editor:

title: David They Yelled and Parents Quietly Paid
description: They came tripping over their long, peasant skirts worn under bunnyrabbit coats. Their littlegirl legs were goosebumpy from the cold, exposed by their hot pants. Blue jeans ended in platform solesa sign that you were over twelve and shopped for, your own shoes. Even the guards at Madison Square Garden shook their heads and said they'd never seen the like.

title: No Major Combat
description: SAIGON, March 12 (Reuters) South Vietnamese troops operating in eastern Cambodia and in South Vietnam border areas to smash a suspected enemy buildup have made no major contact in the first three days, military sources said today.

title: WILLIAM T. HOWES
description: PASSAIC, N.J., March 12William T. Howes, a sales representative of the Novar Corporation, a division of General Telephone and Electronics, died yesterday at his weekend home in Wilmington, Vt. He was 53 years old and lived here.

title: Indian Bus Crash Kills 12
description: JHANSI, India, March 12 (Reuters)Twelve people were killed and 25 injured today when a bus carrying a wedding party crashed 30 miles from this central Indian town.

title: Man in the News
description: GARY, Ind., March 12At the first news cenference two clays ago of the National Mick Political Convention, die issue of the admittance of white reporters was raised.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: LEADERS INSTALLED BY ARAB FEDERATION
description: CAIRO, March 12 (AP)The leaders of Egypt, Libya and Syria, partners in the Federation of Arab Republics, took an oath of office tonight, pledging to struggle for the achievements and aspirations of the Arab nation.

title: Johnnie Ray Avoids Histrionics in Stint At Rainbow Grill
description: In the 20 years that have passed since Johnnie Ray made his brief, weepy flight to fame singing Cry and The Little White Cloud That Cried, he seems to have disappeared into the mists of, time, another of those shortlived phenomena of show business. But. Mr. Ray is still with us, currently at the Rainbow, Grill, where he is counting on an ingratiating personality rather than exaggerated histrionics to put his songs across.

title: Yemen's Leaders confer In Syria on Border Crisis
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, March 12 (UP)Premier Mohsen alAini of Yemen arrived here today to consult with his ailing President, Abdul Rahman alIryani, on the threatening situation along the border between Yemen and Southern Yemen, political sources said.

title: ASIAN AREA IS AIM OF DRIVE ON OPIUM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 12  The golden triangle In Southeast Asia has become the target of an intensive campaign to suppress the illicit opium trade.

title: STRONG DEMAND FOR STEEL FOUND
description: PITTSBURGH, March 12Demand for steel was surprisingly strong last week.

title: Curbs on Pollution Costly but Feasible, Industry Is Advised
Suspected Leftist Leaders Held After Spanish Riotig
description: EL FERROL, Spain, March 12 (Reuters)  The police today rounded up suspected leftist leaders of a mass walkout at a local shipyard that erupted on Friday into violent clashes in which two workers were shot dead and about 50 persons were injured.

title: Sports of The Times
description: MIAMI, March 12Hialeah Race Course is a popular winter resort for wealthy horses, a halfway house provide ing fast, fast, fast relief for tourists burdened with money, and a sanctuary for overdressed poultry. Probably its most famous residents are the flamingos, those ornate descendants of Cuban immigrants who colonized the infield lagoon almost 40 years ago.

title: Berrigan Informer Says He Spied Only. After He Learned of a Plot
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 13 Boyd F. Douglas Jr., a paid F.B.I. informer, insisted today that he began spying on the peace movement only after he learned that a group of priests and nuns of the Catholic Left was, according to his testimony, plotting to blow up heating tunnels in Washington.

title: SWISS ART PATRON INDICTED IN THEFTS
description: FLORENCI., Italy, March 13 (UP1)One of Switzerland's bestknown businessmen was indicted today on charges of having smuggled ark treasures valued at $1million out of ltaly.

title: TerOvanesyan jumps Over Age
description: Even when his English was limited, Igor TerOvanesyan's warmth and charm overshadowed the politics of the cold war that surrounded early track and field meets between the United States and Soviet Union.

title: INNOVATION IS SET AT LONGACRE PLAY
description: Shepard Traube and Edwin S. Lowe will bring Ronald Alexander's new comedy, Keep Off the Grass, to the Longacre Theater during the week of April 24 under an innovative plan.

title: City's First Subway Tunnel in 40 Years Cut Through
description: The city's first new subway tunnel in almost four decades moved a step closer to completion yesterday.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Pete McCloskey of California has become the first official victim of the 1972 pritnaries. He is dropping his in?? campaign for the White House because the 20 per cent of the vote he received against President Nixon in New Hampshire was not enough to bring in the funds needed to make other primary races or to cover the $45,000 debt he had already in&#z0020;curred.

title: INVESTORS REPLACE CHELSEA BANK HEAD
description: A group of investors headed by Justin S. Colin, senior partner of Colin, Hochatin & Co., members of the New York Stock Exchange, has taken control of the Chelsea National Bank and has replaced Daniel K. Sobol, who has been head of the small New York City bank since its inception in 1964.

title: Doomsday for the Pay Board
description: A makeorbreak test for the Pay Board's antiinflation standards will come today with formal hearings in Washington on the West Coast longshore strike settlement, an accord that provides increases in wages and fringe benefits nearly quintuple the board's basic 5.5 per cent guidepost.

title: Peking Reports Meeting
description: HONG KONG, Tuesday, March 14 (Reuters)Hsinhua, Peking's press agency, today reported without comment China's first formal contacts with the United States.

title: Hubbard Is Hospitalized
description: KIRKSVILLE, Mo., March 13 (AP)  Cal Hubbard, the 71yearold former supervisor of American League umpires, was hospitalized today with a bleeding ulcer and emphysema.

title: Italian Communist Leader Asks SovietChinese Unity
description: MILAN, Italy, March 13 The acting leader of the Italian Communist party opened its national congress here with a cautious appeal to Moscow and Peking to reestablish normal relations.

title: UNION AND OWNERS JOIN IN CAB FIGHT
description: The Taxi Drivers Union and the Independent Taxi Owners Council jointly announced yesterday it working alliance to fight a proposed City Council bill that would regulate and license nonmedallion or gypsy cabs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Several recent columns (e.g. Ecology and Politics [Anthony Lewis] on Meech 4, The Machine, the Fool and Doom [Russell Baker] on March 5, and others) refer to the thesis that environmental protection is inconsistent with economic growth.

title: 5 ANIMAL SPECIES OFF PERILED LIST
description: MEXICO CITY, March 12The bald eagle, brown pelican and other animals are still in danger of extinction, but at least five species that had been considered doomed appear to be making a comeback.

title: LieDetector Tests for Police Weighed
description: The New York Police Department is considering adopting a policy under which a patrolman suspected of corruption would be required to take a liedetector test. The idea is sharply opposed by the Patrolmens Benevolent Association and other employe groups.

title: GAINS IN EARNINGS LISTED FOR UTILITY
description: The Central and South West Corporation reported yesterday gains hi operating revenues and net income for 1971. The company's annual report, released yesterday, placed operating rev?? at $386,322,272 against $358,402,082 a year earlier. Net income of $69,330,941, or $2.99 a Share, compared with $65,290,433, or $2.85 a share on fewer shares, in 1970. Central and South. West is a holding company with operating subsidiaries in parts of Arkansas, louisiana, Oklahoma and Texas.

title: 6 New Resident Policemen Volunteer
description: The Police Department introduced at a news conference yesterday six patrolmen who have come forward to replace the two resident policemen driven out of their home precincts by abusive telephone calls and other harassment after their selection had been announced publicly.

title: BRASS SOCIETY GIVES JUDGMENT PREMIERE
description: Simplicity is often valuable in a musical work if the composer knows exactly what he's doing. Frederit Rzewski's The Last Judgment, given its local premiere by the New York Brass Society in Carnegie Recital Hall Sunday night, is a case, in point.

title: Joseph A. Abey Dead at 77; Led Rotary International
description: READING, Pa., March 13 (AP)Joseph A. Abey, president of Rotary International in 196162, died yesterday at his home here. He was 77 years old.

title: PORTUGUESE GUINEA SAYS 14 DIED IN RAID
description: LISBON, March 13African nationalist guerrillas destroyed a hamlet in northeastern Portuguese Guinea last weekend, leaving 14 dead and 12 seriously injured, it was announced here tonight.

title: Kodak to Pay $102MiIlion, In Wage Dividends in U.S.
description: ROCHESTER, March 14 (AP) The Eastman Kodak Company said today that it would pay $102.6million in wage dividends to its United States employes Friday.

title: Attacks Increase In South
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 13 (AP)Enemy troops reportedly increased their attacks across South Vietnam today, staging most of them in the Central Highlands provinces of Kontum and Pleiku.

title: INCENTIVES URGED TO SPUR ENLISTMENT
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)The Defense Department told Congress today that additional incentives might be needed to achieve an allvolunteer armed force by July 1, 1973.

title: C.A.B. Studies Status Of Holding Companies
description: WASHINGTON, March 13The Civil Aeronautics Board announced today that it was beginning an Investigation into airlines becoming parts of holding companies.

title: FOE SAID TO SEIZE KEY EASE IN LAOS
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 13 Enemy troops have captured Sam Thong, a key Laotian base near the Plaine des Jarres, and are threatening to engulf the nearby Americanbacked base at Long Tieng, military sources here reported taday.

title: Britain Had Trade Deficit Of $83Million in Month
description: LONDON, March 13Britons sharply increased their overseas buying last month, putting the nation's trade balance into deficit by $83.2million, the Department of Trade and Industry said today.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation arrested two men yesterdayone here, the other in Salt Lake City and accused them of using bomb threats to extort money from airlines.

title: Americans Say Bangladesh Requires Assistance Badly
description: Seventy Americans returned yesterday from a 10day visit to Bangladesh convinced that if the new nation does not receive vital economic and material assistance within the next three months it might cease to be a viable nation.

title: MARYLAND RATED SLIGHT N.I.T. PICK
description: Neither Maryland's 23.5 wonlost record nor Tom McMillen, its 6foot 11inch super sophomore, have impressed rival coaches Sufficiently to establish the Terrapins as clearcut favorites in the National Invitation Tournament that begins Friday night at Madison Square Garden.

title: 5 Killed in Air Force Crash
description: FORT WORTH, March 13 (UPI)A giant refueling plane crashlanded today at Carswell Air Force Base when one of its engines quit, skidded more than 300 yards down the runway and exploded. All five crewmen burned to death. The plane, a KC135 tanker, was making its final approach to land after a routine training flight. Identities of the dead men were withheld pending notification of next of kin.

title: Hebrew Unit Picks Leader
description: Milton Schwartz, a real estate investor in the city, has been named the seventh president of the 80yearold Hebrew Free Loan Society, which makes loans without interest or other charges to individuals and Jewish community organizations, mainly in the field of religious education.

title: France Reports Deficit
description: PARIS, March 13 (Reuters)The Finance Ministry of France said the February foreigntrade account showed a deficit for the first time since September, 1971. The deficit was $77.4million, compared to a January surplus of $39.1million.

title: Univac Given Navy Work
description: The Univac division of the Sperry Rand Corporation said yesterday that it had received a multiyear subcontract for electronic computer systems for the Navy's new Spruance class destroyers. The contract has potential value of $39.3million.

title: Women in China Still Face Inequalities
