description: HONG KONG, March 13Thousands of representatives of women's organizations attended a rally held in Canton, capital of Kwangtung Province in south China, to celebrate Women's Day last Wednesday, according to a broadcast from the city monitored here.

title: Diversity in Gary
description: The first National Black Political Convention, which has Just been held in Gary, hid., would have been unthinkable only a few years ago because of the political powerlessness and poverty of the great mass of the black citizens of the United States. The fact of the meeting itself was thus implicit testimonial to the progress that has been made, unsatisfactory, uneven and inadequate though it isprogress that sparked the rising aspirations which provided much of the emotional fuel behind the Gary gathering.

title: Revlon Set Marks In'71 Sales and Net
FRAZIERALI BOUT IN COOKE'S HANDS
description: Jack Kent Cooke, who provided a guarantee of $5million purse money for a Joe FrazierMuhammad All heavyweight championship fight last March; disclosed last night that he holds in perpetuity the rights to a rematch between the fighters.

title: Woman Sworn In as an Economic Adviser
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)President Nixon provided a new Bible as a gift for the swearing in today of Marina von Neumann Whitman, the first woman ever to serve on the President's Council of Economic Advisers.

title: Swiss Ties for Bangladesh
description: GENEVA, March 13Switzerland has decided to recognize the Goverment of Bangladesh, the Foreign Ministry. announced today. The delay in establishing diplomatic relations with the former East Pakistan is ascribed to the fact that Switzerland has represented the interests of India in Pakistan, and those of Pakistan in India, since the two countries went to war last December.

title: Hunt for Boy Abandoned
description: GREENWOOD LAKE, N. Y., March 13 (AP)The police have called off the hunt. for 7yearold, Walter Starr Jr. after more than a week of searching in the hilly countryside surrounding this New YorkNew Jersey stateline community. The 50pound, 3foottall boy was last seen March 4, sitting on the steps of a village church. The police said they would continue their investigation on the assumption that the boy was either abducted or drowned.

title: WASHINGTON ZOO TO GET 2 PANDAS
description: WASHINGTON, March 13President Nixon resolved today one of the lesser controversies of his tenure by announcing that the giant pandas from China would reside hero at the National Zoo and not in San Diego, St. Louis, Chicago or New York.

title: PENALTIES CITED IN SECRECY ORDER
description: WASHINGTON, March 13Assistant Attorney General Ralph E. Erickson told a House Armed Services subcommittee today that administrative and criminal sanctions may attach to the unauthorized release of secret national security documents under a new Presidential order.

title: Spain Revalues the Peseta
description: MADRID, March 13 (UPI)Spain revalued the peseta today, increasing its value by 2.2 per cent against the dollar. The sank of Spain announced that it would allow the peseta to fluctuate from 64:47 to 64.41 to the dollar, compared with the earlier price of 65.92 to 65.86. A spokesrnan for the bank said the action reflected the recent weakening of the dollar on European markets and was designed to stop a strong influx of dollars into Spain.

title: U.S. CASE RESTED IN THALER'S TRIAL
description: Grand jury testimony by Seymour R. Thaler was introduced as evidence yesterday as the prosecution sought to show that the former State Senator had committed perjury about his handling of United States Treasury bills that had been Stolen.

title: Hanoi Group to Visit Japan
description: TOKYO, March 13 (UPI)The Justice Ministry today approved the visit of a 14member North Vietnamese economic mission to Japan March 20 for a 40day stay, the JapanVietnam Trade Association announced.

title: Chicago Mercantile Seat
description: CHICAGO, March 13 (UPI)A membership on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange has been sold for $87,500, the fourth highest price ever paid for seat, the exchange announced today.

title: Computerized Campaigning Has Made the Personal Appeal to Voters Possible in Florida
description: MIAMI, March 13  Computerized campaigning has emerged as a major political technique in the Florida primary and promises to become equally important in Presidential politics for the remainder of this election year.

title: FREDERICK ALLEN JR.
description: GREENWICH, Conn., March, 13  Frederick H. Allen Jr., a lawyer and president of Allen Brothers, Inc., automobile dealers, died yesterday apparently of a heart attack at his home, 75 West Brother Drive. He was 62 years old.

title: Scott, Top A.B.A. Scorer, Signs With Sims of N.B.A.
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 13 (AP)Charlie Scott, the American Basketball Association's leading scorer, signed today to play for the Phoenix Suns of the National Basketball Association.

title: 15 MUSKIE VICTORS NEW HAMPSHIRE
description: CONCORD, N. H., March 13 Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine picked up 15 pledged delegates to the Democratic National Convention in last Tuesday's New Hampshire Presidential primary, according to final ,figures made public today.

title: Books of The Times
description: I don't know whether it's anticipation of the spring or the result of overlong confinement indoors, but this is the time of year when the reviewer's mind begins to pace its cage and gnaw at its bars; and the only antidote, short of doing the real thing, is to read a hook about trout fishing. Almost any book about trout fishing. Trout fishing, you seeespecially trout fishing with artificial fliesis essentially prelapsarlan (essentially, I say, because one must spend Hundreds of dollars on pounds of synthetic material in order to do it properly; although I might also add that the biggest trout I ever personally saw taken was caught with a stick, a length of twine and a leaderless hook  no, not a bent pinby a farroboy who simply felt the bite and walked backward until the creature was beached). Trout fishing, more than most outdoor activities I can think of, demands that one climb out of one's head and merge with the ecosystem, know its minutiae, accommodate oneself to its secret rhythms, be Adam and Eve In the Garden.

title: CITY HALL IN PACT ON CAPITAL FUNDS
description: The Board of Estimate and leaders of the City Council reached agreement with negotiators for Mayor Lindsay last night on shifting funds in the capital budget to add 35 school, 30 library and 43 park projects.

title: DAVIS CUP RENEWS SO. AFRICA ISSUE
description: LONDON, March 13 (AP)South Africa's fate in the. Davis Cup may be decided April 14 in Copenhagen, Denmark,

title: Songs of Companies Resound in Japan
description: TOKYO, March 13Japanese company songs are a source of wonder for foreign visitors. They can never quite believe the spectacle of hundreds of workers at, say, the Matsushita Electric Industrial Company, whose sales exceed $2billion, bursting into song.

title: Dominant Leftists in India Are Losing in State Vote
EAU CLAIRE'S FIVE GAINS IN N.A.I.A.
description: KANSAS CITY, March 13 (AP)Eau Claire, Wis., the topseeded five, routed Bishop College of Texas, 9665, and GardnerWebb (N. C.) seeded fourth, beat Eastern Montana, 10994, in the opening round of the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics championship today.

title: BENJAMIN SOSLAND
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., March 13  Benjamin Sosland, vice president of the Sosland Publishing Company, publisher of The Southwestern Miller, died today. His age was 74.

title: Sculptures Put on Market Stir Concern for Angkor
description: An unexpectedly large number of choice Cambodian sculptures has appeared on the Western market in recent weeks. The fear of experts in this country and abroad is that these art objects have been stolen from the historic Angkor Park region with its incomparable 1,000yearold treasure of sculptures, temples and other buildings.

title: Ethnic Symposium Slated For Airing on WRVR Here
description: A symposium on ethnic communities organized by the Congress of ItalianAmerican Organizations will be broadcast, on WRVR tomorrow from 10 A.M. to 5:30 P.M.

title: A DANGEROUS FOE: BOREDOM OF GIL'S
description: FULDA, West Germany, March 3For the 2,000 men of the United States Army's 14th Armored Cavalry Regiment, whose principal mission is to guard a section of the Soviet bloc border near here the major enemy appears to be boredom.

title: Nixon Donors Undisclosed
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)The White House hedged today when asked if President Nixon would follow the lead of Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine and some other Democrats in promising to identify publicly the main donors to his 1972 campaign. Ronald L. Ziegler, press secretary, said, I think he'll leave that to the citizens committee, referring to the Committee for Reelection of the President.

title: Medical Oath Cited to Win Objector Status
Chisholm Appeal Divides Blacks; Imperils Liberals in Florida Race
description: MIAMIRepresentation Shirley Chisholm, who has been unable to mount an impressive campaign in Florida, is nevertheless expected to cut into the thin ranks of liberal voters, especially among blacks, in tomorrow's primary election here.

title: Xerox to Acquire DiskDrive Maker For $28Million
description: The Xerox Corporation announced yesterday that it had agreed in principle to acquire Diablo Systems; Inc., a Hayward, Calif., manufacturer of computer disk drives and a recently developed communications printer. The agreement calls for Xerox to issue approximately 84,000 of its common shares for the common shares of Diablo, and 121,000 Xerox common shares for all of the Diablo convertible preferred shares. The Diablo shares are owned by the Itel Corporation, which provided the principal financing for Diablo.

title: Testimony by Mrs. Onassis Contradicts Pretrial Deposition Given by Secret Service Agent
description: Mrs. Aristotle Onassis insisted under crossexamination yesterday in Federal Court here that she had never said anything to a Secret Service agent who accompanied her and her son, John, on a bicycle ride through Central Park Sept. 24, 1969.

title: Queen Elizabeth in Maldives
description: MALE, Maldives, March 13 (AP)Queen Elizabth II and; her husbnd, Prince Philip; arrived today in the capital of this tiny Indian Ocean republic. Their visit to the Maldive Islands followed a onemonth tour of Southeast Asia and was the first stop of the royal yacht Brittania in its journey across the Indian Ocean.

title: Navy, Citing Fund Problem, Freezing Most Transfers
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (UP1)The Navy announced today a 15week ban on transferring most personnel to new duty stations because it has run out of money to pay the moving costs.

title: 2 City Policemen Accused Of Accepting $100 Bribe
description: A city detective and a patrolman were arraigned yesterday on bribery charges after they had allegedly accepted $100 in marked bills from a bar owner.

title: 3 Children Die in Fire
description: MARSHFIELD, Mass., March 13 (UPI)Three young children were killed today when fire swept their home in March field, Mass. The victims were identified as David Pauline, years old, his sister, Christina, 2, and brother, Stephen, 1.

title: Kentuckians Seek Wallace
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., March 13 (UPI)Petitions are being circulated in Kentucky to place the name of Gov. George C. Wallace. of Alabama on the November ballot as the American party nominee for President.

title: BRAZIL SEEKING WIDER MARKETS
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 13 While United States industry struggles to keep European and Japanesecompetitors at bay, a new coMpetitive force is massing south of the lucrative North American marketBrazil.

title: Men in the News
description: PARIS, March 13As high military officer, a member of the Central Committee of the Chinese Communist party and the head of the most important mission that China maintains in the West, Ambassador Huang Chen is a major figure in the Chinese hierachy.

title: FirstYear Profit Of $2Million Made By Orion Banking
description: LONDON, March 13The Orion Banking Group, a new kind of international consortium organized to serve the capital needs of the world's leading multinational companies, reported today a profit of $2.18million on its first year of operations and projected strong growth in 1972.

title: Priests'
description: DENVER, March 13A theologian who is a former innercity priest warned today of what he viewed as a trend among American Roman Catholics to pull back from a commitment to social action.

title: MRS. CLAIRE SCHEIN
description: Mrs. Claire Rosenwald Schein, who retired as an arbitrator for the Family Court in 1970, died today at her home, 8013 212th Street, Hollis Hills, Queens. Her age was 68.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Last month while making a nighttime shakedown cruise aboard his party boat, Jamaica, Capt. Howard Bogan of Bridle, N.J., saw cluster of lights 10 miles away that, he said, resembled the Manhattan skyline.

title: MRS. WILLIAM NEWBERRY
description: Mrst Eulalia Cox Dow Newberry, widow of William F. Newberry, a retired purchasing executive of the F. W. Woolworth Company, died Sunday in St. Petersburg, Fla. She was 87 years old and lived in WilkesBarre, Pa.

title: Hockey Honors Weiland, Kelley
description: Two Boston personalities, as familiar to many New Englanders as the Cabots and Lodges, were honored last night for contributions to amateur hockey at the annual Lester Patrick awards dinner here.

title: Muskie Offers Drug Plan
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (UPI)Senator Edmund S. Muskie proposed today to reduce the price of prescription drugs by reducing their patent protection from 17 to three, years. The Maine Democrat released his proposal through his Washington office while campaigning in Florida's Presidential primary.

title: DUCK DANCE, $3, WINS Al PIMLICO
description: BALTIMORE, March 13Duck Dance matched the track record of 1:09 15 for six furlongs today in winning the $27,850 Old Line Handicap as Pimlico Race Course opened a 63day meeting before a crowd of 12,479.

title: Enter Mr. Sanford
description: With today's Democratic primary in Florida largely drained of significance by an excess of candidates running on similar platforms, the entrance of Terry Sanford into the North Carolina contest raises the risk of a similar devaluation of the primary in that state.

title: State Senate Is Due to Get New NoFault Plan Today
description: ALBANY, March 13A new version of a modified nofault automobile accident insurance plan that is said to have strong bipartisan support in the Senate is expected to be introduced tomorrow by Senator John H. Hughes, Syracuse Republican.

title: Coal Mine Workers Return
description: PINEVILLE, W. Va., March 13 (AP)Striking coal mine construction workers in southern West Virginia returned to work today, ending their sixdayold protest against inaction by the Federal Pay Board on their contract calling for a 20 per cent wage increase. A spokesman said the workers voted to return to work after they were advised against continuing their walkout in defiance of Federal court restraining orders.

title: WORLD JEWISH AIDES ASSAY SOVIET POLICY
OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 13In consulting the following directory of this week's events, it should be noted that while admissions are free unless otherwise indicated, special credentials may be required in some cases.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: My surprise at a statement in your March 3 editorial The I.T.T. Hearings prompts me to write. I refer to the assertion that Mr. Kleindienst was guilty of impropriety in discussing the I.T.T. case several times with a New York investment banker representing I.T.T., in setting up a conference with officials of the antitrust division and in attending that conference.

title: JOHN N. SHINE
description: TEANECK, N. J., March 13John N. Shine, a second vice president of the Chase Manhattan Bank, died yesterday of a heart attack in Holy Name Hospital. He was 48 years old and lived at 67 Roxbury Road, Dumont.

title: ExPresident of Argentina In Spain to Talk With Peron
description: MADRID, March 13 (AP) Arturo Frondizi, who was President of Argentina from 1958 to 1962, arrived today for talks with Juan D. Peron, the former dictator.

title: RISE IN SALES SEEN BY MANUFACTURERS
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)Manufacturers expect a big rise in sales in the first three months of the year, survey conducted by the Com. merge Department showed today,

title: Yale Corporation Backs Suspension of a Teacher
description: The Yale Corporation agreed over the weekend to support the decision of Yale's president, Kingman Brewster, to suspend Kenneth I. L. Mills ,an assistant department who had held a simultaneous appointment at the Stony Brook, L.I. campus of the State Univ,ersity of New York.

title: METHADONE FOUND RISING AS KILLER
description: In the first two months of this year, New York City and the District of Columbiawhich have the two largest methadonemaintained populations in the countryhave had more overdose deaths from the drug than in the previous 12 months.

title: Meat Price Freeze Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)  Two Connecticut Repsentatives, Stewart B. McKinney, Republican, and Ella T. Grasso, Democrat, urged President Nixon today to impose an executive freeze on meat prices until such time as the Price Commission revises the guidelines governing food cost increases.

title: 5,100 G.I.'s Go Home
description: SAIGON, March 13 (UPI)The United States command said today that 5,100 American servicemen were sent home last week, the largest number in six weeks. A total of 114,500 troops remain.

title: FREDRIC BROWN, WRITER, 65, DIES
description: TUCSON, Ariz., March 13 (AP)Fredric Brown, a mystery and science fiction author, died here Saturday. His age was 65.

title: I.R.A. Leader on Trial
description: DUBLIN, March 13The chief of staff of the Official wing of the Irish Republican Army, Cathal Goulding, went on trial here today on charges of incitement.

title: 10 Bombs Follow Truce
description: BELFAST, Tuesday (UPI)Ten bombs and gunfire exploded throughout Northern Ireland early today within two hours after the end of a threeday truce called by the Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army. It's now total war, a spokesman for the militant arm of the I.R.A. said.

title: Turnover of Medical School Deans Heavy in Eraof New Complexities and Wide Array of Social Strains
description: LOS ANGELES, March 12The deanship of a medical school, once a plum job for a lifetime, has lost much of its luster.

title: Newfoundland Discovers Suburban Living
description: LABRADOR CITY, NewfoundlandThe band struck up I'se the Bye, a popular tune in Newfoundland. Mainlanders would call it I'm the Boy.

title: PARIS TALKS BEGUN BY U.S AND CHINA IN CORDIAL MOOD
description: PARIS, March 13The United Stites and Chinese Ambassadors to Paris began a series of contacts today as the first tangible followup to President Nixon's visit to China.

title: Bomb Proves to Be Candy
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 13 (UPI) A cluster of red sugar candy sticks, bound up to resemble a bomb, was taken from National Airlines flight 46 last night shortly after the plane arrived from New Orleans. A security officer said someone had called to report a bomb aboard the plane. A search turned up the candy sticks,

title: Two Reluctant Defendants Hear Trial in Absentia
description: The robbery trial of twin brothers who have resisted offorts to, bring them to court got under way yesterday, again after they had been teargassed in their cells and carried to pen adjoining the courtroom where they could hear the proceedings broadcast.

title: Harlem Unit Asks to Build 2 BudgetBlocked Schools
description: The Harlem Urban Development Corporation said yesterday that it should be allowed to start building in Harlem two schools that have been cut out of the Mayor's proposed capital budget.

title: 3 Upstate Cities Exemplify the Busing Dispute
description: BUFFALO, March 13Three of upstnte New York's major cities, under pressure to desegregate their neighborhood schools, are involved in disputes of the sort that have made busing the subject of a national controversy.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: UNION CITY, N. J.Heralded by the barking of her dogs, Duke and Duchess, Sister Mary of the Compassion came into the guest parlor of the Blue Chapel, as the Cloister of the Perpetual Rosary is known here. They are my friends, she said of the dogs, who sat quietly at her side once they had been introduced.

title: Soviet Sub Taken in Tow
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)The Pentagon said today that a Soviet rescue ship took a disabled Soviet submarine in tow in the North Atlantic over the weekend. It had been wallowing about 950 miles northeast of Newfoundland for more than two weeks.

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES ON FUND SHARING
description: WASHINGTON, March 13The House Ways and Means Committee voted tentatively today to give the states some say in how the money provided by a Federal revenuesharing program would be distributed among the local governments within a state.

title: JOSEPH CANNATA
description: Joseph Cannata, a former editor of the ItalianAmerican radical periodicals, Il Proletario and Il Lavoratore, died Sunday at the DeWitt Nursing Home, 211 East 79th Street, at the age of 79.

title: Feminists vs. the Media: Signs of Change
description: About two years ago, when the quotation marks were still bracketing women's liberation, about 100 allegedly militant feminists staged a wellpublicized invasion of the editorial offices of The Ladies Home Journal'trying to change attitudes, according to a spokeswoman for the invaders.

title: DEMOCRATS URGE MORE TRUST LAWS
description: WASHINGTON, March 13Almost all of the Democratic tandidates for President agree that the antitrust laws need more vigorous enforcement and that some new laws may also he required.

title: 6 Killed in Venezuela
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 13 (UPI)All four members of a family and two of their friends were killed today in an accident involving their car and a truck on the Guarico Highway

title: FLORIDA EXPECTS RECORD TURNOUT IN PRIMARY TODAY
description: MIAMI, March 13  Six Democratic aspirants for the Presidency ranged across Florida today in last efforts to win support in tomorrow's Presidential primary, M which every other issue has been lost hi a long and loud debate, on school busing.

title: BLACK IS DROPPED FROM DAVIS JURY
description: SAN JOSE Calif., March 13 A black woman who was the center of a heated controversy last week was removed today as a possible juror in the trial of Angela Davis.

title: Is Welfare Out of Control?
description: At a time when the proposed budget for New York City is almost $I billion out of balance, and an expected rise in welfare costs accounts for much of this gap, reasonable suggestions to bring the soaring welfare rolls under some control deserve careful attention city officials.

title: Spanish Police Act to Curb Protest Demonstrations
description: MADRID, March is (AP)The police cracked down today against demonstrators across Spain who attempted to protest the shooting of two shipyard workers last wee kin El Ferrol.

title: $500,000 In Drugs Seized In Italian Anticrime Drive
description: MILAN, Italy, March 13 (Reuters)The police seized a package of drugs worth over $500,000 during an anticrime camphign in northern Italy over the weekend, it was announced today.

title: PRICES ARE LOWER ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market dropped sharply yesterday in Slower trading.

title: At 70, Houseman Is Active and Visible
description: This winter, in my 70th year, I thought I would be respected but neglected," says John Houseman. Instead, the distinguished producer and director is having one of his most active and visible seasons.

title: ARIAS AND DUETS PLEASE AUDIENCE
description: Carnegie Hall was the scene of a rather special event Sunday night, perhaps totally comprehensible only to the dedicated opera fan. Licia Albanese and Giuseppe Di Stefano, both distinguished singers backed by long years of operatic experience, appeared before a frankly, adoring and easily excitable audience in a program of arias, and duets.

title: London in Peking Accord; To Close Taiwan Offices
description: LONDON, March 13Britain And China formally agreed today to establish full diplomatic relations after the British had acknowledged that Taiwan was a province of China.

title: Rumanian in Secrets Case Now Said to Face Trial
description: BUCHAREST, March 12 Diplomatic sources here believe that a Rumanian general rumored to have been executed for passing secrets to the Soviet Union is still alive and awaiting trial.

title: PRISONER COMMITS SUICIDE IN TOMBS
description: A heroin addict being held without bail on a murder charge hanged himself yester day in the Manhattan Men's House of Detention shortly before he was to receive his final, detoxifying dose of methadone. He was the first prisoner to commit suicide in a city penal institution this year.

title: Standard &
description: The Standard & Poor's Corporation, one of two major investment services that evaluate the quality of bonds, has downgraded its rating of New York State bonds one level to AA from AAA.

title: British Officer Gets 21 Years for Spying to Pay His Family Debts
description: WINCHESTER, England, March 13 (UPI)A Royal Navy officer was sentenced today to 21 years in prison for selling defense secrets to the Soviet Union at his wife's urging to pay household debts.

title: Memorial for Basil O'Connor Is Attended by 200
description: A memorial service for Basil O'Connor, whose fundraising ingenuity as president of the National Foundation was a major impetus in the fight against polio, was held at Rockefeller University yesterday. It was attended by 200 scientists, doctors, friends and former employes of Mr. O'Connor, who died in Phoenix, Ariz., Thursday at the age of 80.

title: I.T.T. Says Geneen Saw U.S. Officials
description: WASHINGTON, March 13The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation announced today that its prod: dent, Harold S. Geneen, had held discussions with more than a score of high Government officials including former Attorney General John N. Mitchell, about what it termed the serious consequences of the Justice Department's antitrust policies.

title: Obstacle to Travel Seat
description: HONG KONG, March 13Travel from Taiwan to Hong Kong will become a little more difficult as a result of the agreement announced today by China and Britain raising their relations to the ambassadorial level and closing British Consular offices in Taipei.

title: MISS HEYER WINS IN JUNIOR SLALOM
Raja Baba Pays $20.20
description: MIAMI, Fla., March 13 (UPI)Heavily favored Eastern Fleet finished a distant sixth today as Raja Baba led all the way to win the feature race at Hialeah Park.

title: Bingham to Fight Scheuer in Primary
description: Representative Jonathan B. Bingham announced yesterday that he would fight Representative James H. Scheuer in the June 20 primary instead of letting a convention of Bronx Reform Democrats decide between them to avert a headon clash.

title: Irvings and Suskind Admit Hughes Hoax Conspiracy
description: Clifford and Edith Irving, publicly admitting for the first time their culpability in the $750,000 Howard Hughes autobiography swindle, pleaded guilty yesterday in the Federal District Court on Foley Square to charges of conspiracy.

title: MISS BASSEY GIVES PROGRAM OF SONGS
description: Sunday night's Concert by the English singer, Shirley Bassey, at Philharmonic Hall was a study in the practice of Musical melodrama. Miss Bassey is perhaps bestknown in this country for her performance of the theme music for the James Bond film Goldfinger (or, as Miss Bassey sings it, Goldddfingahh). In England, however, she is one, of the most prolific producers of cover songsfollowup versions of tunes made popular by other performers.

title: Church Council Cuts Its Budget And Names Layman as Head
description: George M. Duff Jr., a lawyer Who lives in Riverdale, was installed yesterday afternoon as president of the Council of Churches of the City of New York.

title: Panel on Aging Scores Mandatory Retirement
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)The mandatory retirement age should be eliminated, the White House Conference on Aging recommended today.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: PRETRIAL JAILING HELD INEFFECTIVE
description: WASHINGTON, March 13Despite repeated insistence that preventive detention is essential to controlling crime, the Administration has failed to prove either its necessity or effectiveness, according to an independent study of the highly controversial procedure.

title: Executive Changes
description: John P. Freeman Jr. has been elected president and John F. Ford vice chairman of the board Aubrey G. Lanston & Co., Inc. C. Richard Youngdeli!. who was named chairman of the board, remains as chief executive officer.

title: KLASSEN OPPOSED TO MEDIA SUBSIDIES
description: Postmaster General Elmer T. Klassen said yesterday that neither the United States Postal Service nor other mall users should provide subsidies to magazines and newspapers to ease the impact of sharp increases in postal rates.

title: Duncan of Oregon Enters Democratic Senate Race
description: PORTLAND, Ore., March 13 Former Representative Robert Duncan, Democrat, announced today that he would seek the Senate seat held by Mark 0. Hatfield, Republican.

title: Advertising:
description: Several important changes of responsibility in The New York Times advertising department, effective April 3, were announced yesterday by Max Falk, the advertising director.

title: Homosexuals'
description: Mayor Lindsay promised homosexuals yesterday that he would fight for their rights if he is elected President. His pledge to the Gay Activist Alliance came in a letter released at a news conference at the Overseas Press Club,

title: Houston Harte, Publidter, Dies; Led Paper Chain in Southwest
description: SAN ANGELO, Tex., March 13 (AP)Houston Mate, owner of The San Angelo StandardTimes for more than 50 years, died today at the age of 79.

title: Profile of a PariMutuel Clerk
description: To some people, he's an underpaid expert handling a tedious, pressurepacked job that requires speed, concentration and utmost accuracy.

title: Texas Democrats To Vote on Busing
description: DALLAS, March 13Texas Democrats will vote May 6 on an antibusing referendum, but the state's party leaders decided today not to have a Presidential prefernce primary.

title: Parley Shows Complexity and Vitality of Black America
description: GARY, Ind., March 13Exhausted after an almost continuous and often tumultuous three days of meetings, delegates to the first National Black Political Convention made their way out of this grimy steel mill city to return to cities in 42 other states this morning, and to ponder Just what had happened and just what it meant. The meetings at this city's West Side High School pointed up the complexity of black America, its vitality and its many problems as an awakening minority on today's political scene.

title: BILL RATES RISE FOR SHORT TERM
Assemblymen Vote For a Referendum On Queens Project
description: ALBANY, March 13  After nearly three hours of haggling, the Assembly approved this evening a bill designed to block the controversial Forest Hills publichousing project by requiring county referendums on all such projects.

title: Dollar Strengthened in Japan
description: TOKYO, March 13  The United States dollar firmed up slightly in foreignexchange trading here today as a result of buying operations undertaken by the Bank of Japan to keep the currency from, falling.

title: WaterColors by Blake To Be Shown at Yale
description: NEW HAVEN, March 13 (UPI)  A collection of 116 watercolor illustrations by the English poetartist William Blake will have their first American showing this week at the Yale Art Gallery.

title: Green, in Australia, Terms Nixon Trip a Path to Peace
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Tuesday, March 14 (Reuters)Marshall Green, United States Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs, today described President Nixon's visit to China as an opening for peace.

title: Rights Leaders Ask Nixon to See Them On Busing Decision
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 Seven prominent civil rights leaders asked President Nixon today to assume strong moral leadership in behalf of school desegregation and to grant them an audience before announcing any policy decision.

title: Auschwitz Revisited
description: In the annals of man's inhumanity to man, there are few names that evoke more horror than that of Auschwitz, the Nazi death factory in Poland. The systematic savagery practiced there against men, women and little children during the years of Hitlerian terror is shocking almost beyond belief.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Dr. M. Royal Schoenfeld is one sawbones who does most of his cutting in his basement. No, there are no bodies involved. Dr. Schoenfeld moonlights as a jewelry designer there. I'm a doctor first, last and always, the 43yearold Yonkers cardiologist insisted yesterday, before making a personal appearance with his complete line of baubles at the Marcus Jewelry counter in Gimbals East.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Feb. 18 editorial Back on the Line suggests that the Unemployment Insurance Fund is subsidizing strikers. We consumers are, in fact, subsidizing the strikebreakers. Management personnel from Bell System companies in other states were brought to New York to maintain telephone services. They earned considerably more than the mechanics they replaced. In addition, they were paid full expenses during their stay in New York and they must have been given a premium pay over and above their salaries an an incentive to come to New York. All these added expenses will be passed on to the telephone user in the form of higher rates. If the Unemployment Fund subsidized the strikers, the telephone users of New York State subsidized the strikebreakers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: C. L. Sulzberger in a recent column perceptively assesses the Egyptian habit of developing excellent myths rooted in truth when he asserts, Cairo firmly believes that no Ameelean Presidentespecially at election timecan politically afford to deny Israel whatever it requests for fear of losing the Jewish vote.

title: Geneva International Test May Become Passport to World Schools
description: GENEVA, March 13A new examination, the international baccalaureate, has been set up here to provide the equivalent of an international high school diploma for students who attend school outside their own countries.

title: Bodies of 3 More Victims Of Radicals Found in Japan
description: MAEBASHI, Japan, March 13 (Reuters)  Three more bodies of persons executed in a purge carried out by an ultralefist guerrilla group were unearthed today from mountain graves, bringing to 12 the number found in the last week.

title: Du Pont Reduces Prices Of Mylar Polyester Film
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., announced yesterday that it had reduced prices by a range of 3 per cent to 20 per cent on most gauges and types of Mylar polyester film, effective immediately.

title: Politicians Snapping Up Book That Most Publishers Rejected
description: BOSTON, March 13New American Library would not touch the manuscript. Neither would Harcourt Brace Jovanovich. It was a clever idea, several big New York publishers all agreed, but there wasn't enough production time and no one would buy it anyway.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a Western Union stockholder was intrigued by your unhappy March 4 editorial on the terrible telegram service. You say Western Union can afford to do better by the public. It is just too profitably engaged in selling complex services to business to bother.about the personal messages of individuals. Right. So what's wrong with that? Since when has the profit motive been abolished from business?

title: Notes on People
description: Three years ago, in a candid magazine interview, Mrs. Hiroko Sato, wife of Japan's Premier, Eimaku Sato, told the world that in the early days of her marriage, her husband used. to beat her. Now, in another interview, she has told a Tokyo magazine how sorry she was for having exposed.Mr. Sato to criticism.

title: A. SHERRILL WHITON JR.
description: WILTON, Conn., March 13A. Sherrill Whiton Jr., director of the New York School of Interior Design, which was founded by his father, died on Saturday at his home, 92 Chestnut Hill Road. He was 53 years old.

title: Rev. Jerome Barnych Dies; Headed Program for Young
description: The Rev. Jerome Barnych, who had charge of the youth program at St. George's Ukrainian Catholic Church, 22 East Seventh Street, died yesterday at Hawthorne, N. Y., after long illness. His age was 41.

title: Bridge: Precision System Users Cut Guesswork on Grand Slams
description: A player who is considering slam prospects often needs to know the length and strength of his partner's suit. Using standard methods some guesswork is often necessary, but the growing number of players using the Precision System have a conventional device at their disposal.

title: PILOT EXAMINATIONS BY DOCTORS SCORED
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (UPI) The Government's air surgeon complained today that some, doctors permit airline pilots to continue flying by not reporting such. serious ailments as alcoholism, heart disease or mental trouble.

title: Rail Disruption Ends
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 13 (AP)  Southern Pacific service was reported back to normal today following a oneday strike Friday that briefly halted the company's rail service in in seven Western states. The eighthour strike ended when a Federal court order sent members of the United Transportation Union back to work. They had walked out over 20 switching jobs they said the company had given to brakemen.

title: Advertising:
description: The time has come. Gulf and Western has decidedafter 14 years building up a conglomerate  to tell the public just who and what it is.

title: Conservative and Reform Jews To Cooperate on U. S. Problems
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., March 13Conservative and Reform leaders of Judaism in this country agreed today on an immediate cooperative effort to cope with such nettling problems confronting American Jews as mixed marriages, education, the future of the synagogue and identity.

title: Secrecy Will Prevail
description: WASHINGTON, March 13The State Department said today that the United States and China had agreed to conduct their new diplomatic contacts in Paris under conditions of virtual secrecy to help insure their ultimate success.

title: Lilly Endowment directors Seeking Secondary Offer
description: Lilly Endowment, Inc., Indianapolis, yesterday announced that its directors had requested Eli Lilly & Co., to register a proposed secondary offering with. the Securities and Exchange Commission of shares of. Lilly's stock owned by the Endowment. Lilly Endowment will receive the entire proceeds of the sale, which is presently not exPected to exceed three million shares.

title: Generous Recital By Jane Carlson, Pianist, of Juilliard
description: Jane Carlson, a member of the Juilliard faculty who has successfully combined teaching and performing careers, gave a generous piano recital at Alice Tully Hall Sunday evening. The program began with Bach's French Suite in G, proceeded chronologically through Mozart's Rondo in D (K.485), the Chopin B minor Sonata and Hindemith's Second Sonata, then backtracked for a pair of Rachmaninoff Preludes and Ravel's Rigaudon and Toccata.

title: BOARD CITES LAG FOR RETAIL FIRMS
description: The New York Stock Exchange indicated yesterday that securities commission business remained unprofitable for retail brokerage firms in the fourth quarter of 1971.

title: Toll in a BengaliBihari Clash Is Put at 200 Killed or Injured
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, March 13 (AP)Some foreign relief authorities estimated today that a clash between Bengali and nonBengali Moslems in Khulna over the weekend had left at least 200 killed or wounded.

title: Pentagon Aide Says Laird Plans No Political Talks
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)  In an apparent switch, a Pentagon spokesman said today that Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird does not plan specific partisan politital appearances this campaign year.

title: Men in the News
description: PARIS, March 13Discretion surrounds the contacts being made here between the United States and China, which suits the man at the American endArthur K. Watson.

title: Captive Whale Is Released
description: SAN DIEGO, March 13 (Ronters) Gigi, a 14,000pound California gray whale, was released in the Pacific Ocean today after a year in captivity in a marine recreation park here. Scientists had hoped she would join other gray whales migrating back to the Bering Sea. However, instruments attached to the whale's back indicated she was still swimming in circles 20 miles offshore more than 10 hours after her release.

title: Law Firms Are Reported Hiring More Women and Fewer Blacks
description: Columbia University Law School, reported yesterday that the job market for graduating law students had changed dramatically Within the last year, with more jobs going to women and fewer to blacks.

title: The Song Writes Me, Lyricist Tells Series at Y
description: Midway through its second season, the Lyrics and Lyricists series at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. seems to be changing its focus. Originally the lyricists presented at these Sunday evening sessions came, for the most part, from the musical theater, and their tendency was to analyze the craft of lyric writing on the basis of, their individual experiences.

title: Musicians End Strike
description: The musicians of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra, who have been on strike since Dec. 29, were scheduled to resume rehearsals this morning and play a concert tonight. The new contract agreed upon with the management of the orchestra covers the rest of this season only., It calls for a $10aweek increase across the board; the addition of four weeks work at the end of the season, to make up for lost time during the strike,

title: Rome Gunmen Get $350,000
description: ROME, March 13 (AP)Four armed youths held up an armored car in downtown Rome today, shot dead a policeman who was riding as a guard and escaped with $350,000.

title: Niagara Falls Plan is Cited
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y., March 13 Stan Alex, teacher at the modernistic Beech Avenue School here, recently asked his sixthgrade pupils how they felt about attending a racially integrated school.

title: HOUSE VOTE TO RAISE DEBT LIMIT BLOCKED
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)With the national debt almost at the ceiling figure of $430billion, quick Congressional action to raise the limit was blocked by a tax reform advocate today.

title: GUN BLAST MISSES RAHWAY PRISON HEAD
description: RAHWAY, N. J., March 13U. Samuel Vukcevich, superintendent of Rahway State Prison, escaped injury last night when a shotgun blast shattered a rear window in his home across the road from the prison.

title: WORLD COFFEE PACT APPROVED IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (UPI)The Senate gave final Congressional approval today to a bill extending the International Coffee Agreement until Sept. 30, 1973.

title: Burns Offers Europeans Reassurance on Currency
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, March 13Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, has reassured European central bankers on two of the points that worried them most in the recent dollar scare, European informants said toclay after the weekend meeting of central bankers in Basel.

title: Waiting It Out at The Pregnant Pilgrim
description: HINGHAM, Mass.Back in the premature New England springtime of April, 1970, counsel for the commonwealth and the defendant assembled a jury of notable crankiness to consider what the state of Massachusetts had against a companion of Vinnie Teresa's, indicted after getting a loan from a bank.

title: Pakistan Resuming Ties
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, March 13Pakistan and Yugoslavia announced today that they would resume diplomatic relations, which were broken off last month by Pakistan after Yugoslavia's decision to recognize Bangladesh.

title: Yank Errors Help Brayes Win, 10
description: PORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 13 an unearned run and a proclamation by their manager, the Atlanta Braves shut out both the Yankees and the Mets today.

title: Antiburglary Pencil Backed
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (UPI) Representative Claude Pepper, Democrat of Florida, and Les Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, introduced a. bill to authorize $2million in. Federal funds to proMote the use of an electronic engraving pencil to combat burglaries. The pencils would be used by local communities and police forces to engrave license numbers into objects of value such as television and stereo sets, thus, it is hoped, hindering the pawning or selling of loot.

title: Arthur Daley
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 13When I heard how Johnny Unitas ripped his Achilles tendon, said Bobby Tolan, the once wounded warrior of the Cincinnati Reds, it sounded exactly the same as what happened to me. Unitas was playing handball with Tom Matte when he asked if Matte had accidentally kicked him in the heel. When Tom said he hadn't, Johnny said, Then I've ripped my Achilles tendon.

title: Number of Priests Drops
description: ROME, March 13 (UPI)The number of Roman Catholic priests in the world is declining but the number of Catholics is increasing, a Vatican report said today. According to statistics published in a book on the Holy See's activities in 1971 and presented to Pope Paul VI, the number of priests fell from 351,000 in 1969 to 347,000 in 1971. The number of Roman Catholics, the book said, increased from 526.5 million to 534 million during the period.

title: TAIWAN BANK ASSETS CLAIMED BY PEKING
description: TOKYO, March 13 (AP)Peking accused Nationalist China today of illegally selling stock in the Bank of China and the Bank of Communications, and declared that it reserved the right to recover assets of the two banks.

title: One Yankee Abstains And 28 Vote for Strike
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 13One unidentified member of the New York Yankees abstained today, but 28 others approved authorization of a majorleague players strike on March 31 for increased pension benefits.

title: Knight to Coach in 5th N.I.T. With a New Team, Old Concept
description: Bobby Knight is returning to New York for his fifth coaching effort in a National Invitation Tournament. It used to be that the former Ohio State player would bring his defenseminded Army team down the Hudson River to Madison Square Garden each year and the cadets would do much better than expected in the N.I.T. This year, Knight is bringing in his defense minded Indiana University team that will meet Princeton in the first round of the 35th annual N.I.T. on Sunday afternoon.

title: 300 Demonstrators Back Tilden School one Plan
description: Morethan 300 parents and students demonstrated outside Board of Education headquarters yesterday in support of a zoning proposal that, they said, would assure an integrated enrollment and the continuation of quality education at Samuel J. Tilden High School in the East Flatbush section of Brooklyn.

title: Survey at Polls to Seek Voters Views on Issues
description: The New York Times's coverage of the Florida Democratic Presidential primary today will be augmented by the results of the first of a series of special surveys of voter attitudes.

title: U.S. and Poland in Pact On North Atlantic Fishing
description: NEWARK, March 13 (AP)The Coalt Guard is now allowed to inspect Polish fishing vessels in the North Atlantic, according to an agreement signed by both countries, it was announced today.

title: S.E.C.Williams Dispute Widens Over Institutions
description: WASHINGTON, March 13The Securities and Exchange Commission and Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, each took another step today on what appears to be their collision course on the issue of institutional membership on stock exchanges.

title: N.C.A.A Reinstates Marquette
description: KANSAS CITY, March 13 (AP)  Marquette's basketball team was reinstated tonight in the National Collegiate Athletic Association tournament.

title: Baby Sitters Toss Children to Safety In Apartment Fire
description: Two teenage baby sitters; trapped yesterday in a burning sixthfloor apartment, tossed four children across an eightfoot air shaft to waiting neighbors and then jumped themselves.

title: Nixon Proclaims Book Year
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)President Nixon today proclaimed 1972 International Book Year. He said in the proclamation, We must abolish functional illiteracy so that all our citizens, rich and poor alike, will have a better chance to learn of the accumulated wisdom of man.

title: Corn and Wheat Futures Drop On News of an Acreage increase
description: An Agriculture Department report indicating that acreage planted to soybeans and grains in 1972 may be higher than was planted in 1971 tended to lower prices in those futures traded yesterday on the Chicago Hoard of Trade.

title: Market Place: Oil Agreement Affects Stocks
description: Oil Industry observers took the agreement in principle between major international oil companies and six Persian Gulf countries in stride yesterday.

title: MRS. L. A. HAUPTFLEISCH
description: SUMMIT, N. J., March 13Mrs. Margaret Hall Hauptfleisch, wife of Louis A. Hauptfleisch, executive vice president of Halsey, Stuart & Co., bond and stock dealers, died yesterday in Overlook Hospital after a brief illness. She was 53 years old and lived at 10 Sherman Avenue.

title: Primary at a Glance
description: PRESIDENTIAL PREFERENCE.

title: British Admit Report on Killings Erred
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 13A British Army lawyer apologized today for official statements that four of the 13 persons killed by British troops in Londonderry on Jan 30 were on the wanted list of suspected members of the Irish Republican Army.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A large body of American citizens suffered significant financial losses when, after 1949, their property was confiscated or nationalized by the People's Republic of China without compensation. Claims resulting from this action were processed by the U.S. Foreign Claims Settlement Commission under the International Claims Settlement Act of 1949, and valid awards were certified to the State Department.

title: Measure to Regulate Flood Control Gains in Jersey
description: TRENTON, March 13A Cahill administration measure that would give the state broad power over local floodcontrol plans in New Jersey was, approved today, by the State Senate, 33 to 0.

title: SAMMARTINO VICTOR WITH BACKBREAKER
description: Bruno Sammartino returned to Madison Square Garden last night, defeating Smasher Sloan in a heavyweight wrestling exhibition. Sloan said he could not continue when, after 5 minutes 29 seconds, Sammartino slung him over his shoulder in a backbreaker.

title: Pentagon Isn't Worried
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (Reuters)United States intelligence officials tended tonight to minimize the possible impact on American defense planning of the Bingham case.

title: Pupils at High School in Bronx Said to Stay Home From Fear
description: Hundreds of students assigned to Adlai E. Stevenson High School in the Clason Point section of the Bronx have not attended classes since September because they, as well as their parents, fear for their safety, a Board of Education meeting was told last night.

title: BERRIGAN JUDGE WARNS O'DWYER
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 14 The judge in the Berrigan conspiracy case threatened Paul O'Dwyer, defense counsel, with a contempt citation today after Mr. O'Dwyer said that the judge was frustrating the crossexamination of the. Gov, ernment's star witness, Boyd F. Douglas Jr., a paid F.B.T. informer.

title: Sports of The Times
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla., March 14When the Boston. Red Sox came over to play the Texas Rangers recently, their public relations director, Bill Crowley, stayed at home base in Winter Haven. In Winter Haven you can hear the Spanish moss grow on the live oaks, and unless a man's pulse quickens at the sight of a shuffleboard court he may tend to brood there all by himself. Later Crowley told how. he had happened to make a trade for Vida Blue behind the backs of Dick O'Connell, general manager of the Red Sox, and Charley Finley, who owns Vida Blue and the rest of the Oakland Athletics.

title: VIRGINIA AND UCONNS WIN IN POLO TOURNEY
HOUSE UNIT BACKS A POLLUTION BILL
description: WASHINGTON, March 14The House Public Works Committee reported out today a water pollution control bill that is significantly weaker in some respects than the bill unanimously passed by the Senate four and onehalf months ago.

title: Hughes Sees Somoza And Envoy of U.S.; Departs Nicaragua
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 14 Howard R. Hughes, lean, healthy and wearing a Van Dyke beard, left Managua, Nicaragua, early today after a social visit with the President of Nicaragua and the United States Ambassador aboard his private jet.

title: Notes on People
description: Vice Adm. Noel Gayler, who flew fighters from the decks of aircraft carriers during World War ll, has been named commander in chief of all United States forces in the Pacific area. The 57yearold officer, now head of the National Security Agency, will succeed Adm. John S. McCain Jr., who is retiring this summer, Admind Gayler will supervise operations from the West Coast to the Indian Ocean and north to the Bering Sea. President Nixon has nominated him for promotion to the rank of full admiral.

title: DAROFF IS CONFIDENT ON BOTANY RESERVES
description: Michael Daroff, chairman of Botany Industries, Inc., reiterated yesterday his belief that the $10.5million reserve for losses on discontinued retailing and manufacturing operations for the finscal year ended last July 31 was sufficient.

title: RALPH E. MORTON
description: Ralph Emerson Morton, retired president and director of the Hawaiian Trust Co., Ltd., died yesterday of a stroke at his home in Honolulu. He was 76 years old.

title: NIXON MARGIN BIG
description: MIAMI, March 14  Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama scored a dramatic victory in the Florida Presidential primary today, capturing 75 of the state's 81 delegates to the Democratic National Convention.

title: Jewel Companies Sales Up
description: Jewel Companies, Inc., Chicago, a major food chain, said yesterday that its sales in four weeks ended Feb. 27 rose 8 per cent to $140,641,086 from $130,229,843 in the comparable 1971 period.

title: McGrawHill Editor Demoted Over Gift or Loan by Authors
description: McGrawHill, Inc., the center of two recent bookpublishing storms, removed Robert S. Stewart yesterday as editor in chief of the company's trade book division, charging he had received $1,700 as a gift or loan from two of his authors.

title: Beautiful Show: Chinese Calligraphy'
description: Why not pull out all the stops? You don't get a chance very often. But Chinese Calligraphy, which opened to the public yesterday at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, ??? an exhibition that leaves a reporter groping for adjectives better than stunning, magnificent and exciting to describe it. The collection and the installation are all of that, but they are also as fresh as the adjectives are stale, although the objects inCluded go back as much as 2,000 years.

title: ANTIDRUG PROGRAM VOTED AT CITY HALL
description: Fourteen antinarcotics contracts  stalled last week by a Board of Estimate coalition that protested assertedly skimpy information about them  were approved by the board yesterday.

title: Manson Follower Convicted
description: LOS ANGELES, March 14 (AP) Davis, 28 years old, a follower of Charles Manson, was convicted by a Superior Court, jury today of murder and conspiracy in the 1969 slayings of Gary Hinman, a musician, and Donald Shea, a film stuntman. Manson and three others in his hippie family were found guilty last year of first degree murder in the 1969 slaying of Sharon Tate, the actress, and six other persons.

title: Forman Challenges Patterson
description: The manager of George Foreman, boxing's undefeated heavyweight contender and the 1968 Olympic champion, challenged Floyd Patterson. te fight Foreman in a winnertakeall charity match this year.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MIAMI, March 14Following are excerpts from an interview tonight with Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama by Sandor Vanocur of the National Public Affairs Center for Television:

title: Wrong Answer for Forest Hills
description: The State Assembly has stooped to a disgraceful and probably unconstitutional maneuver to block construction of the controversial publichousing project in Forest Hills. It has rushed through a bill requiring countywide referendums on all such projects and made it apply retroactively to the one in Queens.

title: King's Expected Move Confuses West Bank as Local Vote Nears
description: RAMALLAH, Israeli occupied Jordan, March 14Palestinian political leaders were thrown Into confusion today at the start of their municipal election campaign by reports of an imminent decision by King Hussein of Jordan on the Palestinians future.

title: FRANK DOSTAL
description: Frank Dostal, retired chief electronics engineer of the American Time Products division of Bulova Watch Company, died last Friday in Queens General Hospital atfer suffering a stroke while walking near his home at 42.10 94th Street, Elmhurst, Queens. He was 59 years old.

title: Volpe Wants Road Funds Tapped for Mass Transit
description: WASHINGTON, March 14Transportation Secretary John A. Volpe asked Congress today to allow part of the Federal money that is earmarked for highways to be used for public transportation in the nation's cities.

title: HOLDING OF A.M:C. IS SOLD BY KAISER
description: The Kaiser Industries Corporation sold 5,245,000 shares of the American Motors Corporation yesterday in the largest trade ever executed on the New York Stock Exchange, in terms of shares. It topped the previous record block of 3.25 million shares of the AllisChalmers Manufacturing Company traded Feb. 8, 1971.

title: Sarawak Combating Guerrillas With Civic Action
description: KUCHING, Malaysia, March 6The state government of Sarawak has launched a Vietnamstyle civicaction program to contest a tenacious Chinese guerrilla movement for the allegiance of isolated tribal villagers and restless Chinese youth in the towns.

title: LENNIE FORD, 46, END FOR BROWNS IN 50'S
description: DETROIT, March 14Lennie Ford, a football star for the Cleveland Browns in the 1950's, died Monday, apparently of a heart attack, in a hospital here. Mr. Ford, 46 years old, was an assistant recreation director for the city of Detroit.

title: Mrs. Onassis Leaves the Stand After Five Days of Examination
description: Mrs. Aristotle Onassis stepped down from the witness stand at 3:30 P.M. yesterday after five days of crossexamination in her suit against Ronald E. Galena, a freelance photographer.

title: Democratic Race Widens; Muskie Concedes Setback
description: MIAMI, March 14After a year of campaigning, during which most politicians and every poll agreed that Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine led the Democratic Presidential race, a new contest appeared to have stareed tonight.

title: 12 Young Men Indicted in Riot At Bikers Island Jail Feb. 27
description: Twelve young men were indicted yesterday on charges growing out of rioting at the Pikers Island Adolescent Remand Shelter on Feb. 27 in which five correction officers were taken hostage.

title: Miss Devlin In London
description: LONDON, March 14 (Reuters)Bernadette Devlin was flown back to London today after French authorities refused to allow her to land in Bor deaux.

title: State Senators Balk AtCrangleProposal For Delegate Races
description: ALBANY, March 14  The state Democratic chairman, Joseph F. Crangle, met with skeptical Democratic State Senators today on his proposal to have aspiring delegates for the Democratic National Convention compete in the June 20 primary on the basis of State Senate rather than Congressional district lines.

title: Surgery for Purdue Star
description: LAFAYETTE, Ind., March 14 (AP)  Purdue's quarterback, Gary Danielson, will undergo surgery tomorrow to repair damage to his left shoulder, injured in Purdue's fifth game last season, against Minnesota.

title: Nursing Home Patients Take Moving Day in Stride
description: It may not have been winter's worst day, but it hardly seemed, the right one for moving 236 patients, up to 107 years In age, from he Home and Hospital of the Daughters of Israel in. Manhattart to the Jewish Institute of Geriatric Care at the QueensNassau border where Bellerose meets New Hyde Park.

title: HUSSEIN REPORTED PROPOSING STATE FOR PALESTINIANS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 14 King Hussein has reportedly proposed to the Big Four powers a plan for rejoining the Israeliheld west bank with the east bank of Jordan in a federa! system to be called the United Arab Kingdom instead of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan.

title: MANSFIELD UPHOLDS REGISTERING BY MAIL
description: WASHINGTON, March 14The Senate Democratic leadership, weakened by absenteeism, employed considerable parliamentary maneuvering today to thwart a surprise move to kill legislation that would establish a national system of voter registration by postcard.

title: Rockefeller Said to Favor Ronan to Head Port Unit
description: Governor Rockefeller wants Dr. William J. Ronan, chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, to be named executive director of the Port of New York Authority, an aide to the Governor said last night.

title: MRS. WILLIAM DASHEFF
description: Mrs. Patricia Carbery Dasheff, wife of William Dasheff, an account executive with J. Walter Thompson, died yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital. She was 51 years old and lived at 860 Fifth Avenue.

title: Suns, Squires Trade Suits As Scott Changes Uniforms
description: The Charlie Scott case erupted in a flurry of legal actions and threats yesterday, compounding confusion in the latest squabble between the National and American Basketball Associations.

title: Wife of British Officer Sentenced for Espionage Says She Nagged Him Into Becoming Spy for Soviet
description: LONDON,March 14 (UPI) David Bingham began serving a 21year prison term today because he listened to wife who loved to play bingo rand buy new clothes.

title: Pakistan Accuses Indians
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, March 14Pakistan today reported a number of ceasefire violations by India for the week ending March 4 and said she was making a protest to the Indian Government. The violations are said to have included crossing by Indian Army units into Pakistani territory, at one time in platoon strength, firing on Pakistani positions with machine guns and mortars and digging of trenches much ahead of the Indians main positions.

title: Action Ordered on Papers
description: WASHINGTON ,March 14In a move important to historians and scholars President Nixon has ordered the State Department to cut the time lag in publishing its annual official documentary series Foreign Relations of the United States from 26 years to 20.

title: THE I972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON; March 14 (AP)  Representative Silvio O. Conte, Republican of Massachusetts, filed legislaion in the House today to create a national ,primary to state system.

title: What a Segregated School Is
description: DURHAM, N. C.The fall of 1971 saw the introduction of widespread busing of pupils in many parts of the United States, particularly the South. Its aim was to achieve racial balance in formerly segregated school systems. Politicians ranging from the nation's Chief Executive to. Congressmen to state and municipal officials have made pious statements about the sanctity of neighborhood schoolswhich busing interfered with. Not one word has been said, however, about the system which busing was designed to alleviate, total segregation.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: March 14, 1972

title: BRITISH OFFICE NOW EMBASSY IN PEKING
description: PEKING, March 14 (Reuters) Britain's first embassy in Communist China opened today, replacing a mission estab1ished 22 years ago.

title: 4 Men Selected as Jurors In Panther Murder Trial
description: Four men were selected as jurors yesterday in the murder trial of Mark Holder, a 17yearold Black Panther who is accused of slaying a fellow Panther, Samuel Napier, in an alleged intraparty feud.

title: Other Testimony Heard
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 (AP)Paul Kolton, president of the American Stock Exchange, and John G. Weithers, senior vice president of the Midwest Stock Exchange, were among those testifying at today's House subcommittee heating. Discussing institutional mem

title: Ulster Official Tried to Restrain Troops
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 14The tribunal investigating the killing of 13 civillens by British soldiers in Londonderry tin Jan. 30 ended today with testimony of plea by the city police chief to one of the army commanders.

title: Wilberforce U., One of the Oldest Black Schools in U.S., Is Looking Forward
description: WILBERFORCE, Ohio Dr. Rembert Stokes, president of Wilberforce University, did not attempt to hide his entnusiasm over the three new buildings that form the beginning of a new campus for one of the oldest black colleges in the nation.

title: ARGENTINA CHILLS MEETING IN BRAZIL
description: BRASILIA, March 14Almost one year of highlevel diplomatic activity in South America came to a chilly climax here today in a meeting of the Presidents of Brazil and Argentina, the two largest and most militarized nations on the continent. Despite the preparations, they made it clear that they had not reached an understanding.

title: 727 Braniff Place Joins No. 747 in Frank Campaign
description: Since 747 Braniff Place has turned out to be a popular address, the airline people have added another address to their neighborhood in the sky.

title: Economic Analysis
description: The statement by Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, that American interest rates have hit their lows and will be trending upward may have reassured European central bankers, but it certainly jarred the New York stock market. Not long ago it was conventional for American economic and financial analysts to say that international monetary disorder might be desperate but was not of serious moment to the huge do mestic United States economy. Is that time past?

title: G.M. PLANS TO TRAIN MINORITY DEALERS
description: DETROIT, March 14 (AP)General Motors Corporation announced today a new program for the development of minoritygroup automobile dealers.

title: Bridge: Strong Candidate Suggested For The Worst Lead of Year
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Kollek Denies Reports
description: Mayor Teddy Kollek of Jerusalem !denied reports last night that his city would become part of an autonomous Palestinian state under a peace agreement reached between Israel and Jordan.

title: De Gaulle's Warning to Kennedy: An Endless Entanglement in Vietnam
description: The successor [to President Eisenhower] was John Kennedy. Chosen to get things done, but elected only by the skin of his teeth; placed at the head of a vast and wealthy country, but one with grave internal problems; by nature inclined to act swiftly and boldly, but hampered by the cumbersome machinery of Federal administration; entering upon the scene in a world in which American power and glory had spread far and wide, but whose every wound was suppurating and in which a hostile monolithic bloc stood opposed to America; enjoying the advantages of youth, but suffering the drawbacks of a novicehi spite of so many obstacles, the new President was determined to devote him, self to the cause of freedom, justice and progress.

title: Danish Plane Carrying 112 Crashes Near Dubai
description: MANAMA, Bahrein, Wednesday, March 15 (UPI)A Danish chartered jetliner with 112 persons aboard crashed In mountains east of Dubai on Persian Gulf, Dubai airport officials said today.

title: RIGHTWING LEADER IS INDICTED IN CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, March 14 (AP)The president of Chile's rightwing National party was indicted today on charges brought by the leftist Government that he violated the country's internal security law.

title: BRYDGES ATTACKS STATERATING CUT
description: ALBANY, March 14Senate Majority Leader Earl W. Brydges announced today that he would appoint a committee of Senators to investigate the downgrading of the state's credit rating by the Standard & Poor's Corporation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your March 6 editorial The Goodman Jailing misses the main issue in the conflict between the Manhattan District Attorney and radio station WBAIFM. While you correctly assess the indefensibility of the court in jailing station manager Edwin A. Goodman for his refusal to surrender subpoenaed materials relating to the city's investigation of the 1970 Tombs riots, your editorial dwells too heavily on legal distinctions of dubious applicability.

title: BUSINESS LEADERS ASSAIL TRADE BILL
description: Two leaders in international business asserted yesterday that the BurkeHartke bill, designed to restrict imports and American corporations investment abroad would result in economic disaster instead of the increased employment its backers intend.

title: BASKETBALL PILOT IS OUT AT ADELPHI
description: The contract of Mike Gordon, Adelphi University's varsity basketball coach for the last six years, will not be renewed for next season, James Bedell, the athletic director announced yesterday. Bedell was notified two weeks ago that his own contract would not be renewed past this August.

title: INVENTORIES SHOW RISE FOR JANUARY
description: WASHINGTON, March 14The moderate rise in total business inventories continued in January, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Drag and Alcohol Use Grounds for Annulment
description: ROME, March 14 The Vatican dissolved marriages for the first time last year on the ground that one or both partners were drug addicts or alcoholics.

title: Miss Liebetseder Wins
description: LEYSIN, Switzerland, March 14 (AP)  Annelies Liebetseder of Austria won the women's slalom, which opened the Leysin ski series here today.

title: RINDS FOR CITY U. URGED AT ALBANY
description: ALBANY, March 14Representatives of 63 civic, labor and religious groups from New York City today sought tlw restoration of about $34million in state funds for the City University in the state budget that takes effect April 1.

title: Butz Says Controls On Beef Could Lead To Meat Shortages
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 (UPI)Dr. Earl L. Butz, Secretary of Agriculture, said today that there would be meat rationing and empty meat counters if the Government was forced to put price controls on beef.

title: MRS. CHARLES E. FARR
description: Mrs. Helen Woodhull Farr, widow of Dr. Charles E. ,Farr, a surgeon at New York Hospital for 60 years who died on Feb 20, died Monday at the Mary Manning Walsh Home here. She was 88 years old.

title: Stock Exchanges at Odds On Consolidation of Tape
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 Testimony before a House subcommittee disclosed today that the major stock exchanges are still unable to agree on how to take the first step toward a unified market for stocks: the creation of a consolidated tape.

title: Books of The Times
description: If I seem to haven little glint in my eye. today, a little extra spring in my step, it's because today is Kick Irving Wallace Day. Kick Irving Wallace Day is a day set aside by Eastern Establishment critics for highjinks and revelry  a sort of literary faschung, a rag day when the critical fraternity subjects poor Mr. Wallace to a hazing with verbal paddles. Stop me. before I overkill again! In Order to save time thinking up adjectives I looked up some old Irving Wallace reviews. Here is a Sampling of the kind of critical gales Mr. Wallace's books fly in the teeth of: gamey, fat., bloated, sheer drUdgerY, libidinous bore, outrageously contrived, meretricious, wildly improbable, pretentious, contrived and amateurish and lousy: (There are some favorable words too; if you Must know.)

title: windDriven Rain, Sleet and Snow Slow Traffic Here
description: Those bravo if foolhardy crocuses that have been poking their heads up in eager anticipation of spring were covered yesterday with several inches of snow or slush.

title: F.B.I. Says Black Militant Hijacked Aircraft to Cuba
description: MIAMI, March 14 (UPI)An alleged member of the militant National Black Liberation Army was named by the Federal Bureau, of Investigation today as one of the two men who hijacked a Chalk's Flying Service amphibian plane to Cuba on March 7.

title: Senate Loses Papers, So Drug Bill Can't Pass
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 (UPI)Congress was all set to stamp its final approval on a longpending Sibillion drug abuse bill, but the Sen. ate according to Representa. tine. Harley O. Staggers, Democrat of West Virginia, lost the papers.

title: March 110 Auto Sales Off
description: DETROIT, March 14 (AP)The boom in auto sales apparently came to at least a temporary end in early March.

title: City Center Is Considering Creation of a Drama Unit
description: The City Center of Music and Drama, whose two chief constituents are the New York City Ballet and the New York City Opera, is considering the creation of its own drama unit, according to Norman Singer, executive director of the City Center.

title: Polls, Pollsters and People
description: The political season"pivotal primaries, Presidential pilgrimages, portentous pollsis in full swing, rocking logic and roiling reason.

title: 4 Killed and 41 Injured in Derailment Near Paris
description: MANTESLAJOLIE, France, March 14 (Reuters)  An express turbotrain jumped its rails at high speed and caught fire near this town west of Paris today, killing four people and injuring 41, railroad officials said.

title: Man In the News
description: In newspaper clippings over the last six years or so, Dr. Allan Murray Cartter's name usually appears rather far down in articles about academic conferences or analyses of the problems of universities.

title: Senator Calls Flanigan
description: WASHINGTON, March 14The International Telephone and Telegraph case flared up for the first time on the Senate floor today as Senator Thomas F. Eagleton of Missouri charged that a Presidential aide, Peter Flanigan, had become Mr. Fixit for big business, and the White House responded with indignant denials.

title: OFFENSIVE IN LAOS PRESSED BY ENEMY
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 14 (UPI)heavy fighting was reported under way tonight along the outer defenses of the Americanbacked base at Long Tieng just south of the Plaine des Jarres.

title: Nixon Cautions Against Cut in Arms Aid
description: WASHINGTON, March 14President Nixon told Congress today that any substantial cut in the $2.15billion he had requested for foreign military aid for the fiscal year beginning July 1 would jeopardize his plan for stable, peaceful relations with China and the Soviet Union.

title: Sweden Says Inspection Impasse Perils 4YearOld Nuclear Pact
description: GENEVA, March 14Sweden charged today that the fouryearold treaty prohibiting the spread of nuclear weapons has entered a kind of twilight zone.

title: Philadelphia Hospital Suspends Carbon Dioxide Drug Treatment
description: Testing of a controversial treatment for heroin addiction called carbon dioxide rapid coma therapy  at Philadelphia's Hahnemann Hospital has been suspended after the deaths of two addicts in the program and the exhaustion of funds.

title: MARSHALL PASK, 83, STOCKBROKER, DIES
description: Marshall W. Pask, a retired investment broker who for many years was head of the New York Stock Exchange firm of Pask & Walbridge, died Monday at the United Hospital in Port Chester, N.Y., after a brief illness. He was 83 years old and had lived in Byram, Conn.

title: BADILLO WILL RUN IN NEW DISTRICT
description: Herman Badillo, the nation's) first Puerto Rican Representative, announced yesterday that he would seek reelection from the new seek Congressional District in the South Bronx.

title: StoneHeller Comedy Due
description: The Soft Core Pornographer, a comedy by Martin Stone and John Heller, wil open at Stage 73, 321 East 73d Street, on April 11. Word Baker is the director.

title: China Will Help Pakistan Build $36Million Foundry
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, March 14China will help Pakistan build a $36million foundry and forge at Taxila 16 miles from Rawalpindi, Pakistan's interim capital.

title: I.L.C.W.U. Counsel Named
description: Max Zimny has been named general counsel for the Inter national Ladies Garment Workers Union. He succeeds Morris P. Glushien, who has retired. The appointment was annouced yesterday by Louis Stulberg, president of the union. Mr. Zimny, who had been serving as associate general counse joined the staff in 1958.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 (UPI)  A Federal antinoisepollution program, including a ban on supersonic flights of commercial aircraft over the United States, was proposed today by Senator John V. Tunney, Democrat of California. The bill would establish a $48.5million, threeyear noise pollution control program.

title: 150 Doctors May Quit Sea View Hospital in Protest
description: The 150 physicians who serve the Sea View Hospital and Home on Staten Island plan to leave en name at 5 o'clock this afternoon to protest the seating of a community advisory board that includes only one doctor.

title: SUPERSTAR'S $1.5MILLION SUPERPAD
description: Mrs. Gertrude M. Bacon, a former Family Court judge, wife of a successful businessman and grandmother of three, considers her day a success when she gets a lot of telephone calls from strangers. When the strangers call back repeatedly, she is even more pleased because she Is almost certain that, eventually, she will meet them in person.

title: The Urgency of Monetary Reform
description: The boiling up of speculation against the dollar, stimulated by growing rumors that the monetary agreement negotiated at the Smithsonian Institution last December is already breaking apart, has finally provoked a response from the United States Government. Chairman Arthur Burns of the Federal Reserve Board, meeting with foreign central bankers in Zurich, has reportedly sought to dispel beliefs that the United States is indifferent to European concern over the convertibility of the dollar or is so determined to push the money supply up and interest rates down that it is willing to risk a renewed outflow of dollars.
