description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 20A large time bomb exploded today in a central Belfast street crowded with shoppers and office workers, killing six and injuring 146.

title: Bill Rates Up Sharply At Treasury Weekly Sale
Business and Labor Split on Work Compensation
description: Organized labor and Senator JaCob K. Javits of New York both urged mandatory Federal standards for Workmen's compensation yesterday, but business spokesmen recommended Federal. guidelines rather than compulsory standards.

title: Theater: Calderon's Life Is a Dream
description: NEW HAVENA profound 17thcentury Spanish classic, Life Is a Dream, by Pedro Calderon de la Berea, and trivial Italian domestic comedy, I Married You for the Fun of It, are alternating repertory at the Yale Repertory Theater.

title: Stokes of Cleveland May Join WNBCTV News as Anchorman
description: Former Mayor Carl B. Stokes of Cleveland may join the National Broadcasting Company as coanchorman of WNBCTV's 6 P.M. evening newscasts.

title: Casino Reorganization Planned
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, March 20 (AP) The Hughes Tool Company will continue plans to reorganize its hotelcasino operation in Nevada despite difficulties with the state's Gaming Control Board, a company spokesman, Richard Hannah, said today. Mr. Hughes is currently in a hotel here, after flying in last week from Nicaragua.

title: JOSEPH D. FARRELL
description: Joseph D. Farrell, who retired as senior vice president and consultant of the Fidelity Union Trust Company of Newark last December, died yesterday in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., where he lived. He was 66 years old and formerly lived in Rutherford, N. J.

title: Southern Yemen Said to Kill 40 Exiled Leaders in Ruse
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 20 (UPI)The Saudi Arabian press agency asserted today that Southern Yemen's Marxist Government invited 40 exiled leaders to a peace conference last week and subsequently killed them.

title: Let's Talk It Over, Mr. Grossberger
description: To the Editor:

title: Riklis: Personal Conglomerate
description: A personal conglomerate is being formed by Meshulam Riklis, the bouncy chairman of the RapidAmerican Corporation, who described to visiting French businessmen yesterday how he offset the frustrations that accompany success.

title: Columbia Discloses Hiring Plan Backed by U.S.
description: Columbia University made public yesterday a governmentapproved plan to centralize in its president's office the final approval of all hiring, promotion and dismissal of faculty members, to guard against job discrimination and to promote the employment and advancement of women and racial minorities on the faculty.

title: Marilyn Maxwell, the Actress, Dead
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., March 20 (UPI)Marilyn Maxwell, who starred in numerous songanddance movies in the 1940's and later on television comedy shows, died today at her home at the age of 49.

title: British End Inquiry Into Ulster Killings
description: LONDON, March 20Britain today ended her official inquiry into the killing of 13 Roman Catholics during a civil rights march in Londonderry on Jan. 30.

title: Arthur Daley
description: WINTER HAVEN, Fla., March 20The Boston Red Sox have long been convinced that they possess the game's best left fielder. They also have long had the strong suspicion that they probably have as competent a first baseman as there is in the business. The trouble with such thinking is that it becomes a cerebral jamup because both their highly regarded left fielder and their esteemed first baseman happen to be Carl Yastrzemski. Not even superstars can play two positions at once. I hope I can keep Yaz in left because he's the best there is, says Eddie Kasko, the Bosox manager. But the Red Sox are not so set that Kasko can he sure about anything. In aiming to reinforce their pitching department, the Fenway millionaires swung a massive nineplayer deal with the Milwaukee Brewers last winter and the Bostons may have shortchanged themselves somewhat manpower. With Yaz as an outfielder, they have a Grade outfield, while Yaz, the first baseman, gives them a topranking infield. At the moment, however, he has grave difficulty in being in two places at once.

title: Nixon Upheld on Gold Spacial to The New York Times
description: LONDON, March 20 David Rockefeller chairman of the Chase Manhattan Bank, said today that until there was more confidence in the dollar, the United States could not resume freely converting dollars into gold for foreign central banks.

title: Muskie Expected to Skip Maryland Primary Drive
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)Senator Edmund S. Muskie plans to concentrate on certain key states for the rest of the spring, and Maryland's Presidential primary May 16 is one contest the Maine Democrat is expected to deemphasize.

title: Executive Changes
description: John K. Castile has been elected executive vice president of Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, Inc.

title: Nuclear Heart Pump: Moon Shot for Medicine
description: BOSTON, March 20From the mooing sounds and odors rising from the basement of Boston City Hospital these days, you might think the hospital ran its own dairy farm. In fact, the 300pound calves that startled visitors sometimes glimpse in the white brick corridors are residents of something called the intensive cow unit.

title: Doctor Links LSD to Gangrene From Constricted Blood Vessels
description: A doctor at New York's Hospital for Special Surgery has reported a previously unpublicized side effect of using LSD constriction of the blood vessels of the hands and feet that could be severe enough in some cases to cause gangrene requiring amputation.

title: MANSHOLT WILL BE PRESIDENT OF E.E.C.
description: BRUSSELS, March 20 (AP)Sicco L. Mansholt will take over the presidency of the Common Market Executive Commission for the rest of this year, Nobert Sclunelzer,,, Dutch Foreign Minister, announced today.

title: Home Mortgages Show Sharp Drop In February Rates
description: The average interest rate on conventional home mortgage loans that were closed during February dropped sharply from the month before, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board reported yesterday.

title: LINCOLN MICHEL, 61, INSURANCE MAN, DIES
description: Lincoln M. Michel, executive vice president of the Excess and Treaty Management Corporation, reinsurance underwriting managers at 99 John Street, died yesterday in BeekmanDowntown Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived at 36 Hawthorne Place, Montclair, N. J.

title: FULBRIGHT IN THREAT ON U.S.I.A FUNDING
description: WASHINGTON, March 20Senator J. W. Fulbright threatened today to block Congressional action on the United States Informatton Agency's budget unless the agency reversed its refusal to supply documents to the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.

title: Slsco Cites Soviet Aid
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (Reuters)Joseph J. Sisco, the Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern and South Asian Affairs, said today that continued Soviet provision of large amounts of modern weapons to Egypt and other Arab countries had led the United States to act to maintain the Middle Eastern arms balance.

title: Rams Get $18Million Offer To Purchase N.F.L. Club
description: HONOLULU, March 20 (UPI) William Barnes Jr., president of the Los Angeles Rams confirmed today that a Los Angeles landscape contractor Carlos Romer, had made an offer to buy the National Football League club.

title: Birbach Will Oppose Gold For State Senate Backing
description: Jerry Birbach, president of the Forest Hills Residents Association, said last night that he would run against Emanuel Gold for the Democratic nomination to the State Senate.

title: SENATE VOTES TODAY ON SEX RIGHTS BILL
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP) The Senate agreed today to start voting tomorrow on amendments to the constitutional amendment that would outlaw all legal forms of discrimination based on sex.

title: Two Senators Visit Tombs and Court
description: New York's two United States Senators made a quick tour of the Manhattan Criminal Court and the Tombs yesterday to lend impact, as Senator Jacob K. Javits put it, to the drive for court and prison reform.

title: JOSEPH B. ROBERTS
description: Joseph B. Roberts, a retired New York stockbroker, died yesterday at his home in Hobe Sound, Fla. His age was 66.

title: Let's Talk It Over, Mr. Grossberger
description: To the Editor:

title: ARMY DESERTER BACK FROM PARIS
description: Sgt. John David Herndon, who in 1968 was sent home wounded after 15 months in Vietnam, returned to the United States again yesterday to be test case in a campaign for amnesty for deserters.

title: IN THE NATION
description: By now, we know enough about the problems of reclaiming a decent environment to understand that in this field, as Adlai Stevenson once said in a different context, there are no gains without pains. It is just not going to be possible, for example, to indulge ourselves in an evergrowing demand for electric power and at the same time to prevent a comparable increase in the pollution that results from present methods of generating electricity. At the least, some new technology will be needed; more likely, at the worst, the national appetite for power is going to have to be curtailed.

title: Mrs. Chisholm Urges Jobs
description: RALEIGH, N. C., March 20 (UPI)  Representative Shirley Chisholm, Democrat of Brooklyn, accused the Nixon Administration today of setting a deliberate policy of unemployment. Mrs. Chisholm, one of five Democrats entered in the North Carolina Presidential primary, said that the nation must create a full new sense of economic priority. She spoke at Meredith College for Women.

title: Port Authority Police Take Credit for Traffic TieUp
description: The Port of New York Authority and its policemen continued their contract disagreement yesterday, with tiveness of a police job action. The 1,200member Port Authority Patrolmen's Benevolent Association had threatened to enforce all traffic regulations to the letter to tie up traffic in the LincoinTunnel; it ended up reporting a job action in the Holland Tunnel. With heavy inbound traffic at the Holland Tunnel, there were some delays. But, the authority attributed these to truck breakdowns, a bomb threat and the usual Monday morning influx of computers. each side accusing the other of unwillingness to negotiate and the two sides disagreeing on the extent and effec tiveness of a police job action. The 1,200member Port Authority Patrolmen's Benevolent Association had threatened to enforce all traffic regulations to the letter to tie up traffic in the LincoinTunnel; it ended up reporting a job action in the Holland Tunnel. With heavy inbound traffic at the Holland Tunnel, there were some delays. But, the authority attributed these to truck breakdowns, a bomb threat and the usual Monday morning influx of computers.

title: Wilkins's Request Weighed
description: At least two of the three major television. networks are considering a request by Roy Wilkins, executive director of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, that he be granted equal time to reply to President Nixon's statements last week on school busing to dsegregate public schools.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: DETAILS ANNOUNCED FOR WORLD CHESS
description: AMSTERDAM, the Netherlands, March 20 (AP)Chess officials decided today that the match between the world champion, Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union and Bobby Fischer of the United States would begin in Belgrade, Yugoslavia, on June 22.

title: Zambian Police Accuse 97 Of Seeking to Revive a Sect
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, March 20 The police arrested 97 suspected members of the Lumpa religious sect yesterday arrested on charges of trying to revive the movement, banned seven years after a rebellion in which 800 people were killed.

title: The Talk of SatuMare
description: SATUMARE, Rumania, March 11  It was Witty 14, 1970, and the rain hall been coming down steadily for three days. The residents of this northwestern town were uneasy. Many of them, especially those living near the river, had spent the day reinforcing the 21foot dikes.

title: CHARLES SCHANDL
description: STAMFORD, Conn., March 20 Charles Schandl, a founder of the Agrarian party and former Secretary of State for Agriculture in his native Hungary, died yesterday at his home, 26 Main Street. He was 89 years old.

title: CAMBODIA'S RADIO OFFERS A CABINET
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, March 20In an unusual maneuver that appeared to indicate that President Lon Nol was still finding difficulty forming a new cabinet, the Cambodian radio announced today what it termed a provisional list of cabinet members, subject to further change.

title: Senate Panel Votes to Let 400,000 Join Medicare
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)The Senate Finance Corn mittee voted today to permit persons over 65 years old without Social Security coverage to enroll in Medicare if they pay the full cost.

title: Knick Home Playoffs April 2, 6, 11
description: The KnicksBullets National Basketball Association playoff will open in Baltimore on Friday, March 31, the Bullets getting the extra home game in the fourofseven series for winning the Central Division title while the Knicks were finishing second in the Atlantic Division.

title: Garrison Petition Rejected
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)Jim Garrison, the New Orleans District Attorney, was turned down by the Supreme Court toddy in, an effort to block a $5rnillion damage suit brdught against him by Clay L. Shaw of New Orleans, who was unsuccessfully prosecutdd by Mr. Garrison on charges of perjury and conspiracy in the assassination of President Kennedy.

title: Anderson Charges Plot Against Allende By I.T.T. and C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, March 20Jack Anderson, the syndicated columnist, said tonight that the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, working closely with the Central Intelligence agency, attempted to to stop the election of President Salvador Allende Gossens of Chile in 1970.

title: PROBLEMS FACING N.F.L. ANALYZED
description: HONOLULU, March 20 (AP) Commissioner Pete Rozelle said today he had cautioned the assembled National Football League owners about several problems facing the sport even as an offiical count of regularseason attendance showed that the 10million mark was exceeded for the first time.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION RISES 0.3 PER CENT
description: Production of steel in the week ended Saturday totaled 2,561,000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This represented a gain of threetenths of 1 per cent over the 2,553,000 tons poured the week before.

title: Summer and Smoke at City Opera
PRESIDENT CALLS FOR TOTAL WAR ON U.S. ADDICTION
description: President Nixon met here for three hours yesterday with Governor Rockefeller, lawenforcement officials, judges and narcotics rehabilitation specialists, and then called for total war on drug addicition.

title: U.S. and Chinese Envoys in Paris Talk for Hour at Second Meeting
description: PARIS, March 20The United States and Chinese Ambassadors to France held their second meeting today amid even more secrecy than surrounded first meeting last Monday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The anonymous United Airline official quoted in a recent article on the weight problem among airline stewardesses unwittingly summed up the incredible obtuseness of some airline executives. You run a $1.5billion business, he declared, and it boils down to whether some chicks look good in their uniforms. If you have fat stewardesses, people aren't going to fly with you.

title: CONFLICT ARGUED AT THALER'S TRIAL
description: A single sheet of rather wrinkled paper was the focus yesterday of the final testimony in the trial of Seymour R. Thaler and two codefendants charged with dealing in stolen Government securities.

title: Canadian Defends Ottawa's Position On U.S. Trade Tie
description: A Canadian leader asserted yesterday that it was unrealistic for the United States to demand exactly equal treatment in its trade with Canada.

title: FRANCO ROSSI GIVES DEMANDING RECITAL
description: Franco Rossi displayed a big, though. seriously worn, bass voice in his recital Sunday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. Mr. Rossi kept one interested in his demanding program, which ranged back as far as Carissimi and Purcell and up to Ravel, by his ability to step inside a character. His considerable opera experience in Europe no doubt helped, and his stage presence was generally impressive.

title: Pennsylvania Job Accidents
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 20 (AP)Onthejob accidents in Pennsylvania last year killed 578 workers and caused more than 93,000 to miss at least a day's work because of injuries, according to figures released today by the State Department of Labor and Industry.

title: Situation Termed Serious
description: PNOMPENH, Tuesday, March 21 (UPI)The military situation in this southeastern province of Preyveng was described as serious by the Cambodian command after enemy gunners hit two towns yesterday. A South Vietnamese ammunition dump was destroyed, six persons were killed and at least 24 were wounded.

title: PARLEYS RESUME IN BIG A STRIKE
description: Although the atmosphere was more agreeable than at any other time since the strike started, there was still no accord yesterday between the parimutuel clerks and the New York Racing Association. As a result Aqueduct Race Track will be closed again today.

title: SCOTT CHARGES DEFAULT ON PACT
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 20 (AP)Attorneys for Charlie Scott of the Phoenix Suns introduced letters in United States District Court today to show that Virginia Squires owner Earl Foreman defaulted on.a contract with the thenAmerican Basketball Association scoring leader.

title: PRICE OF FUTURES OFF FOR SOYBEANS
description: Heavy profit taking late yesterday erased a 3 centsabushel gain in soybean futures on the Chicago Board of Trade. At the close, soybeans were off  cent to  cent a bushel.

title: Bombs Mailed to I.R.A. Chiefs
description: DUBLIN, March 20Three bombs were received in the mail today by I.R.A. leaders and two exploded when they were opehed.

title: Couture. Fashions, Reduced Prices
description: Ohrbach's semiannual shopping spree cum fashion show was on yesterday. As usual, there was something for everyone:

title: Black Officials Concerned
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)A group of black Nixon Administration officials said today that the President's antibusing proposals raised grave constitutional questions that unintentionally might adversely affect black Americans.

title: Times Reporter Arraigned
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., March 20 (AP)Earl Caldwell, New York Times reporter, was arraigned in Municipal Court today on charge of possessing marijuana. Judge William Harris set Friday for the entry of a plea by Mr. Caldwell. Sheriff's deputies alleged that Mr. Caldwell had marijuana in a film canister when he submitted to a search March 6 at the Angela Davis trial.

title: Gentele Promotes 2 Met Opera Aides to New HighLevel Poets
description: The Metropolitan Opera has promoted two assistant technical administrators, Charles Riecker and Michael Bronson, to newly created posts in the tipper echelon of the company. Goeran Gentele, the Metropolitan's new general manager, disclosed yesterday that Mr. Riecker would become artistic admistrator and that Mr. Bronson would be technical administrator.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The valueadded tax may or may not be a desirable addition to our Federal fiscal system. But it was probably not the source of Spain's economic troubles in the sixteenth century, as alleged by Don C. Bliss in his recent letter.

title: Hughes Suit Links $8Million Swindle to Former Aide
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 20 A suit on file in Federal Court here puts on the record the story of how Howard R. Hughes, the billionaire, believes he was swindled of about $8million by a group that included one of his trusted employes.

title: Bail or Jail
description: At first glance, the notion that the money bail system as it now exists in New York should be declared unconstitutional seems ludicrous. Especially since the defendants in this action brought by the Legal Aid Society in the Appellate Division are every one of the. judges and justices authorized to sit in the New York City Criminal Court and the New York State Supreme Court in New York County. For good legal measure, the lawsuit also throws in as a defendant District Attorney Frank S. Hogan.

title: F.T.C. Examiner's Report
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (UPI)A Federal Trade Commission examiner recommended today, dismissal of a complaint challenging the legality of the 1969 merger of the American General Insurance Company of Houston and the Fidelity and Deposit Company of Maryland.

title: Mrs. Abzug Reported Planning To Challenge Ryan for His Seat
description: In what is likely to be one of the most bitter primary contests in recent years, Representative Bella S. Abzug will challenge a fellow Reform Democrat, Representative William F. Ryan, in the June 20 Democratic primary, persons close to Mrs. Abzug reported last night.

title: TWO QUOTE PRIEST ON TUNNEL SYSTEM
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 20 The. Government's contention that the Rev. Philip, F. Berrigan and another antiwar priest secretly checked a utility tunnel system In Washington to see whether its destruction was feasible received circumstantial support today from witnesses at the Berrigan trial.

title: Pioneer Encotinters Debris
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., March 20 (UPI)Pioneer 10, the Jupiterbound spacecraft, has encountered increased micrometeorite activity seven million miles from the earth, scientists reported today. The spacecraft's asteroidmeteorite instrument sensed its second piece of cosmic debris, described as a quite large event by scientists at the Ames research famility here. Other instruments have counted eight dust particles striking the spacecraft at speeds of about 30,000 miles an hour.

title: S.E.C. ACCUSES 9 OF STOCK RIGGING
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission charged yesterday that a group of alleged stock promoters had artificially rigged the price of Coatings Unlimited, Inc., in the overthecounter market last fall as part of a scheme to sell or place 110,000 shares of the stock.

title: ARGENTINA SUSPENDS FOREIGN EXCHANGE
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 20 (AP)  The Argentine central bank closed the foreignexchange market today pending new regulations on exports and imports.

title: Official Sues l.T.T. Over Giftto G.O.P.
description: LOS ANGELES, March 20Edmund G. Brown Jr., the California Secretary of State, filed a suit today against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, charging it with violating Federal law by contributing $100,000 to the Republican National Convention in San Diego next August.

title: Mets Halted by Dodgers, 43; Seaver Returns, Allows 3 Runs
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The United States has now been engaged in the Vietnam war for decade, and for six years the American people have been Involved in a shooting war.. Although President Nixon keeps stating that he is winding down the war, the fighting, the killings and the bombings still go on and as yet there is no end in sight.

title: Let's Talk It Over, Mr. Grossberger
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 HEED IN JERSEY IN POLICE SLAYING
description: Two teenaged suspects in Saturday's fatal shooting of an offduty patrolman in Brooklyn were jailed yesterday in Union County, N.J., following their arrest Sunday by a very sharp Plainfield, N.J., policeman.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The current effort to prohibit foreign vessels from fishing any closer than 200 miles from the United States coast is gaining momentum. ToMorrow at 8 P.M. at the Sheepshead Bay Yacht Club, the Emergency Committee to Save America's Marine Resources will hold its first public meeting.

title: Rangers'
description: The Rangers top right wing Rod Gilbert, will miss some of his team's most important games of the National Hockey League season after the New York club disclosed yesterday he had been sidelined with a strained neck muscle.

title: Volunteers Offer More to Youngsters Than help With Reading
description: Just about everybody complains about the school system. Morton Lazarus and Lois Thompson are doing something about it.

title: Kohls Voted Best in State
description: HAMILTON, N. Y., March 20 (AP) Greg Kohls, a highscoring guard who led Syracuse into the National Invitation Tournament, has been named New York State University Division basketball player of the year.by.the State Sportswriters Association.

title: OTTINGER TO SEEK HOUSE SEAT AGAIN
description: YONKERS, March 20Richard L. Ottinger, who gave up his seat in Congress for an unsuccessful Senate race in 1970, announced today that he would seek reelection to the House from the new 23d Congressional District.

title: Eastland to Run Again
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)Senator James 0. Eastland, Democrat of Mississippi, announced today that he would seek election to a sixth Senate term this year. The 67yearold Senator said that his qualifying papers had been filled in Jackson.

title: CITY BIT ADOPTS WATERFRONT PLAN
description: A revised plan for a large new containerport facility on the South Brooklyn waterfront that floated about considerably in the minds of planners before landing in Red Hook was adopted yesterday by the City Planning Commission.

title: C. &
description: The Interstate Commerce Commission approved yesterday the purchase of the Chicago & North Western Railway by group of the carriers employes. The employe group, the North Western Employes Transportation Corporation, known as Netco, had proposed to buy the railroad from Northwest Industries, Inc., the parent company.

title: Striking Spanish Workers Return to Shipyard Jobs
description: EL FERROL, Spain, March 20 (Reuters)Hundreds of striking workers returned to their jobs at the stateowned Razan naval shipyards here today after the Government threatened to impose martial law unless they ended a strike for higher pay.

title: C. &
description: The Chesapeake & Ohio Railroad will ask its stockholders at their annual meeting on April 20 in Cleveland to approve an $81million debtrefunding plan for its Baltimore & Ohio Railroad subsidiary.

title: BOYLE AND 2 AIDES OF U.M.W. ON TRIAL
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 The Government opened its case today against the United Mine Workers president, W. A. Boyle, and two other union officials on charges , that mine workers funds were illegally funneled. to political candidates and campaigns.

title: Man Dies in Synagogue Fire
description: A small fire in a Brooklyn synagogue left one employe dead early yesterday. The Fire Department said the victim was found on a burning mattress in the basement of the twostory congregation B'nai Israel Synagogue at 4815 Avenue I, near East 49th Street in the Midwood secion of Brooklyn. The victim was tentatively identified as James Igoe, 45 years old, who the police said was a kitchen employe at the Synagoue.

title: BRITON, IN PAKISTAN, TALKS WITH BHUTTO
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, March 20Britain's Foreign Secretary, Sir Alec DouglasHome, con ferred today with President Zulfikar All Bhutto of Pakistan and later appeared pessimistic about progress toward a peace settlement on the subcontinent.

title: U.S. Views Talk as Moderate
description: WASHINGTON, March 20Administration officials said today they regarded Mr. Brezhnev's foreign policy remarks as a moderate statement of Soviet views that did not appear to raise new elements in United StatesSoviet relations.

title: Advertising:; An (Not the) Agency IS Named by A.M.C
description: Well, the American Motors Corporation has named an ad agency. Bates? Cunningham & Walsh? No. No. It was French Sullivan, Inc., in Troy, Mich. How do you like that?

title: Kerosene Put Into Apollo 16
description: CAPE KENNEDY, March 20 (UPI)Engineers pumped 212,000 gallons of kerosene into the first stage of Apollo 16's Saturn 5 rocket today for the April 16 start of the nation's fifth lunar landing expedition.

title: HUMPHREY SHIFTS, NOW DISAPPROVES NIXON BUSING PLAN
description: MILWAUKEE, March 20 Senator Hubert H. Humphrey reversed his stand tonight from the generally favorable position he took last week on President Nixon's proposals to limit the busing of school children.

title: Merger Situation Still Up in the Air At Kings Lafayette
description: The annual meeting of the Kings Lafayette Corporation ended yesterday as it began in a guessing game as to the intentions of its largest stockholder, Edmond J. Safra, an international financier.

title: Volcker Sees S.D.R. Issue As Not Economically Vital
description: WASHINGTON, March 20  Another allocation next year of Special Drawing Rights, or Paper Gold, is not vital on economic grounds, but there may be psychological reasons for avoiding a hiatus in issuing the new international currency, PA A. Volcker said today.

title: Justices Refuse to Block California Death Row Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (UPI)The Supreme Court refused today to block from taking effect a California Supreme Court ruling abolishing the death penalty in that state, possibly meaning that 108 Death Row inmates will serve life sentences and may not be resentenced to death.

title: Samuels'
description: The 19yearold son of Howard J. Samuels, chairman of the City Offtrack Betting Corporation, who was arrested Oct. 30 at Kennedy International Airport on drug charges, pleaded guilty yesterday to attempted criminal possessicin of dangerous drugs.

title: New Strikes in North
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 20 (AP)The United States command reported today that the 100th protective reaction air strike of the year was flown last night over North Vietnam.

title: NEW ULSTER HELP HINTED BY BRITISH
description: LONDON, March 20 The British Government indicated today that it would ease the controversial internment policy and pump more economic aid into Northern Ireland as part of its efforts to end the crisis in the troubled province.

title: Atmospheric Test Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)Adverse weather condtions forced a 24hour postponement today of the first in series of five planned rocket launchings from Wallops Island, Va.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: A public offering of 1,585,000 shares of Johnson & Johnson common stock at $10934 was announced yesterday by Morgan Stanley & Co., Inc., managers of the underwriting group handling the sale. The stock closed on the New York Stock Exchange at 10934, downI/4. The shares being offered included 1,500,000 from the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation. The remainder came from other selling shareholders.

title: WALTON HEADS FIVE PICKED BY COACHES
description: Bill Walton, the 6foot11 center for the University of California, Los Angeles, has been selected unanimously on the allAmerica team selected by the National Basketball Association coaches.

title: BREDINEV VOICES HOPE NIXON VISIT WILL IMPROVE TIES
description: MOSCOW, March 20Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, expressed hope today that talks with President Nixon in Moscow in May would help strengthen world peace.

title: Cautious Reaction in Brussels
description: BRUSSELS, March 20The possibility of bloctobloc negotiations to arrange trade relations between Eastern and Western Europe after 1975 was evoked today as Common Market sources cautiously welcomed Mr. Brezhnev's declaration that the Kremlin finally recognized the Western European bloc.

title: Nixon Asked to Plead for Soviet Jews
description: CHICAGO, March 20  An interfaith consultation on Soviet Jewry, described as the first of its kind in this country, established a permanent secretariat today to mount pressure against what it called extreme and special acts of discrimination against Jews in the Soviet Union.

title: VERDI REQUIEM LED BY JON ROBERTSON
description: Verdi's Requiem, like his operas, is so unquenchably vital that its eloquence shines through even when the performance conditions are less than ideal. As heard in Carnegie Hall Sunday night in a program sponsored by the Northeastern Conference of SeventhDay Adventists, the essence of the work made its familiar impact despite an uneven execution.

title: Books of The Times
description: When he was a very small boy, Paul Bowles used to he put out in the backyard of his family's brownstone to play for an hour. The yard was shut in by a very high wooden fence, which blocked out the view of everything but the house with its nine widows looking out at him like nine eyes. If he stood still and watched the clock that was always placed in the window so he would know when the hour was up, he would hear taps on one of the glasses and see his mother making gestures exhorting him to move around and play. If he began to gallop around the yard, his father would call from another window: Calm down, young man!

title: Three Primary Dates Over Nation Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (UPI)Representative Morris K. Udall, opposing plans for what he termed a sudden death national Presidential primary, has proposed that candidates run in state primaries to be held on three specific dates.

title: Jobless Engineers Admitted Free to Show
description: Some members didn't pay yesterday to get into the annual conference and exhibition of the Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers. Instead, they just had discreetly to show proof that they were unemployed.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Like human beings, institutions of higher learning grow slowly and sometimes painfully. In times of crisis, they are heavily dependent upon friends for support and sustenance.

title: CityPrisoner Furloughs Backed by State Senate
description: ALBANY, March 20  The State Senate passed a bill today that would permit prisoners in New York City prisons to be freed, without supervision, for periods up to three days.

title: Let's Talk It Over, Mr. Grossberger
description: To the Editor:

title: Soviet Reported Agreeing To Aid Egypt on Missiles
description: CAIRO, March 20  Wellinformed sources in Cairo say that the Soviet Union has agreed to assist Egypt in overcoming guidancesystem problems that have held up development of mediumrange missiles capable of reaching targets in Israel.

title: India's Troops Reported Back In Bangladesh to Fight Rebels
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, March 20 (UPI)Western eyewitness reports reaching here today said that Indian troops had returned to Bangladesh within a week of their official withdrawal and were going into action against tribal rebels in the Chittagong Hill Tracts district of southern Bangladesh.

title: Jersey Assembly Moves To Ban Floating APlants
description: TRENTAN; March 20  The State Assembly unanimously approved a legislative resolution today aimed at blocking the construction of two floating nuclearpower generating plants off New Jersey's southern coast.

title: Big Board Operations Chief Quits
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that Les D. Arning, senior vice president for operations, had resigned, effective Aug. 15, to join Tucker, Anthony & R. L. Day, a member firm, as a senior partner.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 20Down in the cellar we went, the whole family, to light the box and watch the Presidential election.

title: Illinois Expects Big Vote Today In Its First OpenBallot Primary
description: CHICAGO, March 20With a primary registration of 2.7 million in Chicago's Cook County, a record, and an open ballot throughout the state for the first time, Illinois voters will have the opportunity tomorrow to choose 160 delegates to the Democratic National Convention and express a limited preference for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Blizzard Kills 10 on Mt. Fuji
description: TOKYO, Tuesday, March 21 (AP)A blizzard caught two mountaineering parties on the slopes of Mount Fuji and at least 10 persons, including two women, were frozen to death, the police said today. Eight other persons were reported missing. The two groups had been training on the mountain since Sunday.

title: Labor Member Set To Quit Pay Board; Others May Follow
description: WASHINGTON, March 20A labor member of the Pay Board, Floyd. F. Smith, the president of the International Association of Machinists, said today he was readyto leave the board and would recommend that other labor leaders do the same when a special meeting of the executive council of the A.F.L.C.I.O. convenes Wednesday.

title: Two Blacks Arrested as Rhodesian Ore Is Unloaded
description: BURNSIDE, La., March 20 (UPI)  Deputy sheriffs aimed shotguns today at 40 blacks protesting the unloading of 25,000 tons of Rhodesian chrome ore from the Argentine ship Santos Vega and attested two for having trespassed on port terminal property. The group was protesting the unloading of the first shipment of Rhodesian chrome ore to the United States in six years.

title: Crowd Tries to Free 3
description: DUBLIN, March 20 (UPI)A crowd of 2,000 attempted to free three suspected members of the I.R.A. at the police station in Monaghan, 70 miles northwest of Dublin, but were driven off by Irish troops and policemen.

title: SokolowAlcaly Pair Wins
description: Mel Sokolow and Roger Alcaly defeated John Halpern and Tom Jones, 156, 157, 159, yesterday for the Class A doubles title of the Metropolitan Squash Racquets Association at the Racquet and Tennis Club here.

title: The F.B.I. on Trial
description: An informer for the Federal Bureau of Investigation in last year's raid on draft board files in Camden, N. J., has accused the F.B.I. of complicity in that criminal act. His charges implicate highranking officials in planning, financing and equipping the illegal and potentially dangerous raid.

title: PRESSMEN REJECT NEWARK CONTRACT
description: NEWARK, March 20 (AP)Pressmen at The Evening News of Newark rejected a proposed contract today that would have lead to the resumption of publication after 10 months of suspension.

title: CHURCH OF CHRIST ENDS SOCIAL UNIT
description: The United Church of Christ, one of the most active. of the major Protestant denominations in the area of social issues, announced yesterday that It was disbanding its Council for Christian Social Action.

title: ANTIBUSING MOVE ASSAILED IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (UPI)  House liberals denounced today President Nixon's proposed moratorium on busing as a return to segregated schools, but Senator James 0. Eastland, Democrat of Mississippi, urged the President to go further and support a constitutional amendment, to prohibit busing.

title: Lawyer Labels 25 as Pros in College
description: Richard G. Phillips, a former Villanova football tackle and now a Philadelphia lawyer who counts professional athletes among his clients, says, There are at least 25 players of the 300 or so entered at the start of the 1972 National Collegiate basketball tournament who were under a professional agent's wing prior to the start of this tournament. Phillips is the attorney for Howard Porter, last year's Villanova star, who was found guilty last spring by the National Collegiate Athletic Association of having signed a professional contract months before he played in the 1971 N.C.A.A. tournament. It is against N.C.A.A. rules for a player to compete in college athletics after he makes an agreement to have an agent handle his pro contract dealings.

title: Pentagon Ineptness On Voting by. G.I.'s Is Charged in Study
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)The majority of United States servicemen and women are being left out of the nation's political process because of uninterest in high places, a new study asserts.

title: Tredear Rugby Victor
description: LONDON, March 20 (Revters) Treadeger beat New bridge, 2419 in a Rugby Union match tonight.

title: Redemptions Top Sales for Funds
description: WASHINGTON, March 20The redemptions of mutual fund shares exceeded sales in February by $88million, on a seasonally adjusted basis, the Investment Company Institute reported today.

title: By the Numbers
description: When the Social Security Act was passed in 1935, enemies of New Deal socialism delighted in conjuring up the specter of enslaved Americans obliged wear their Social Security numbers on dogtags around their neck. Fears of such perversion of a law enacted to protect people against the economic hazards of old age and unemployment were laid to rest long ago.

title: Norbert Markus, 75, Dies; Adviser for Smith, Barney
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 21Norbert W. Markus, a member of the advisory board of Smith, Barney & Co:, member of the New York Stock Exchange and other exchanges, died yesterday.. He was 75 years old and lived here.

title: OLIN TO LIFT PRICES FOR POLYVINYL PIPE
description: The Olin Corporation said yesterday that it would increase prices of polyvinyl chloride sewer and drain pipe and fittings, beginning with orders April 26.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: This is how. nofault insurance worked for me.

title: Screen: Albert Finney's Adventures in an Affecting Gumshoe
Time and the Voter
description: In an admirable opinion by Justice Thurgood Marshall, the Supreme Court has struckslown a Tennessee requirement that a citizen has to be resident in the state for one year and in the county for three months before he can register to vote.

title: Eurodollar Suggestion Made
description: MUNICH, West Germany, March 21 (UPI)A New York banker today urged the United States Treasury to issue special dollar denominated securities to overseas branches of American banks to help take international pressure off the dollar.

title: Indians'
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 21 (AP)  American League baseball owners will confer again tomorrow on Nick Mileti's plan to purchase the Cleveland Indians. The owners delayed action on the proposal at a meeting here March 8 to give the Cleveland sports entrepreneur an opportunity to come up with a stronger financial presentation.

title: ALICE B. GREENE, 77, PSYCHOLOGIST, DIES
description: Dr. Alice Borchard Greene, a psychologist, writer and lecturer, died yesterday of cancer at Memorial Hospital. She was 77 years old and lived in Montclair, N. J., and Lake Atitlan, Guatemala.

title: A Plan for Preventing Abuse of Drugs
description: Last summer President Nixon created the Special Action Office for Drug Abuse Prevention, headed by Dr. Jerome Jaffe, an expert on methadone maintenance and operating under the direction of the President himself.

title: Long Residency for Voting Upset by Supreme Court
FARM FIGHT GRIPS COMMON MARKET
description: BRUSSELS, March 21The Common Market, plagued by farm problems since its birth, became embroiled in a new agricultural dispute today as Sidco L. Mansholt became the fourth president of the market's Executive Commission.

title: Senate Panel Approves Agency on Consumers
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)  Despite. Administration pleas, the Senate Commerce Committee approVed today a bill that would dismember the Food and Drug Administration and establish an independent agency to regulate consumer products. The vote was 16 to 1.

title: About Motor Sports
description: SEBRING, Fla., March 21The most important piece of equipment around here today was the 1972 F.I.A. Yearbook of Automobile Sport, which includes the Federation Internationale de 1'Automobile rules that govern racing. The occasion was the opening day of tech inspection for Saturday's 12hour endurance race, the third round in this year's series for the World Manufacturers Championship.

title: Jersey Investigates a Complaint That Troopers Tortured Youth
description: TRENTON, March 21 New Jersey authorities announced today that they were investigating charges that four state troopers assaulted an Ocean County youth in the Laurelton barracks and tortured hire on the buttocks with a red hot, makeshift brand:

title: Nixon Signs Law to Curb Drug Abuse
Short Interest Up To 11Month High On 8.4% Increase
BEAL AND OTHERS IN A MUSIC SERIES
description: Three string players from the American Symphony Orchestra appeared in. Carnegie Recital Hall Monday nightthe second in a series designed to spotlight musicians from both that orchestra and the Philharmonic. On the first portion of the program Gerald Beal, the featured artist of the evening, and Mary Lou Galen performed two works for violin duo: a tautly drawn reading of Honegger's Sonatine and a welldone if ripely romanticized version of a Bach Sonata in C.

title: A Bill to Cut Auto Repairs Is Shelved by House Panel
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The House Commerce Committee voted today to kill legislation designed to encourage the production of automobiles that are less prone to costly damage in crashes than present models are.

title: HAROLD B. STORMS
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y, March 21 Harold Beekman Storms, a former president of Mount Vernon Hospital, member of the city's Board of Education, and a rationing board member in World War II, died yesterday at his home, 15 Edna Place, New Rochelle. He was 75 years old.

title: PHILIP MUNTER DIES; LAWYER, CHEMIST, 89
description: Philip Munter, a retired lawyer, importer exporter and chemist, died yesterday at his home, 246 Westminster Road, Brooklyn. He was 89 years old.

title: Hesburgh Is Joining Board of Bank
description: The Rev. Theodore M. Hesburgh, president of the University of Notre Dame and one of the most influential clergymen in the nation, has been elected a director of the Chase Manhattan Bank.

title: Chiang, 84, Is Elected to Fifth Presidential Term
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 21Generalissimo Chiang Kaishek, receiving a record total of more than 99.9 per cent of the votes, was elected by the National Assembly today to his fifth sixyear term as President.

title: Rep. Reid Quitting G.O.P.; Plans Race as a Democrat
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 Representative Ogden R. Reid of Westchester County, whose family's involvement with the Republican party dites back almost. a century, will announce tomorrow his switch to the Democratic party.

title: PROFESSOR IN COURT ON PENTAGON PAPERS
description: BOSTON, March 21A HarVard professor was ordered to jail today for refusing to answer questions before a Federal grand jury investigating the release and publication of the Pentagon papers, but an appellate judge temporarily stayed the imprisonment.

title: Barges With Cargo Of Rhodesian Ore Awaiting Delivery
description: BURNSIDE, La., March 21 (AP)A controversial shipment of Rhodesian chrome ore was stored on barges in the Mississippi River today, awaiting delivery to an inland alloy plant. It was believed to be the first United States purchase of Rho desian goods since a United Na tions embargo was imposed in 1966 because of the white Government's racial poliices.

title: Marines Urge Ouster of a Homosexual
The Ballet: Jahn Butler's After Eden'
New E.E.C. Chief Sicco Leendert Mansholt
description: BRUSSELS, March 21Gruff, sensitive, irascible, yet deeply tolerant, Dr. Sicco Leendert Mansholt is a man who can shut out the world when he wants to.

title: MUSKIE IS VICTOR OVER M'CARTHY IN ILLINOIS VOTE
description: CHICAGO, Wednesday, March 22Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine won a solid 63 per cent of the Illinois Presidential preference primary last night over Eugene J. McCarthy.

title: MOST IN POLL BACK REQUIRED SERVICE
description: Americans continue to favor legislation that would require every young man to give a period of service to the nation, according to the Gallup Poll.

title: MILLIONS IN ITALY STAGE STOPPAGES
description: ROME, March 21Millions of Italian workers stayed away from their jobs today or staged walkouts of several hours.

title: Dock Wage Accord Heads for Pay Board
description: Leaders of the International Longshoremen's Association and stevedore management interests said yesterday that they were scheduled to meet with staff members of the Federal Pay Board tomorrow.

title: 2 ExU.S. Aides Back Life's Report of Tampering With Justice in San Diego
description: SAN DIEGO, March 21 (AP) Two former Federal investigators described today as accurate portions of a Life magazine article charging that the Nixon Administration had seriously tampered with justice in San Diego.

title: U.S. Advances in Curling
description: GARMISCHPARTENKIRCHEN, Germany, March 21 (AP) Canada opened defense of its world curling title today with an 116 victory over Switzerland. In other first round matches, the United States, represented by Grafton (N. D.) Rink, beat Norway, 7.5.

title: True Cigarette Account Assigned to de Garmo
description: Lorillard has assigned True cigarettes and a new product to de Grumo, Inc., and Maverick cigarettes, and BeechNut and Big Red Chewing tobaccos to Masius, WynneWilliams, Inc.

title: Mrs. Marcia S. Wells Is Wed To Benjamin Holt Ticknor
description: FITZWILLIAM N. H., March 21  Mrs. Marcia Siller Wells and Benjamin Holt Ticknor, industrialist and former AllAmerican and captain of the Harvard football team, were married here this afternoon.

title: Two H.D.A. Officials Arrested For Alleged Extortion Attempt
FREDERIC KING, 84, ARCHITECT MEAD
description: Frederic Rhinelander King. architect of the Episcopal Church of the Epiphany York Avenue and 74th Street, and the Women's National Republican Club at 3 West 51st Street, died Monday night his home, 340 East 72d Street. He was 84 years old.

title: ARTHUR QUARANTA
description: Arthur A. Quaranta, who retired in 1963 as a vice president of Mash & McLennan, Inc., insurance brokers, with which he had been associated for 42 years, died yesterday at his home, 125 Fairview Avenue, West Brighton, S. I.

title: Public Enemy No. 1
description: As the nation inches ever so slowly toward a more responsible answer to the crisis of spreading drug abuse, political leaders irresponsibly accelerate their rhetoric. It was two years ago that President Nixon announced there is no higher priority in this Administration than attacking the addiction problem. One year ago, he said that he would give this problem the highest priority. attention. This. week, he declared total war on addiction, calling it public enemy No. 1.

title: Grounded Tanker Spills Oil in L.I. Sound
February Orders Down for Durables
description: WASHINGTON, March 21A drop in the erratic flow of defense orders reduced new orders for durable goods in February from the high January level, but February orders were still higher than any preJanuary month, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: CASE COMPLETED FOR MRS. ONASSIS
description: Lawyers for Mrs, Aristotle Onassis completed their case yesterday in their efforts to get a permanent injunction that would bar the photographer Ronald E. Galella from approaching within 100 yards of Mrs. Onassis or her children.

title: 4 ExAides Indicted In Plot to Hide Fund Against Latex Union
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)  The former president and three former officers of the International Latex Corporation were indicted today on charges of conspiring to conceal from the Government nearly half a million dollars in payments to keep union activities out of the concern, the Justice Department announced.

title: Executive Changes
description: Maul Bros., Inc., announced yesterday the election of Jack L. Foyil as executive vice president and chief operating officer. He was previously director of research and development of the glass container group of Indian Head, Inc. Maul Bros. is a producer of glass container production equipment.

title: Jobs Over Revolution
description: Britain has decided to go for economic growth and jobs for the unemployed even at the risk of renewed inflation and the cost of cherished Conservative dogma. Prime Minister Heath's quiet revolution, based on the steady disengagement of Government from the economy, was effectively buried yesterday. by the budgetone jammed with social, economic and fiscal benefitsthat Chancellor of the Exchequer Barber delivered to Parliament.

title: Candidates'
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., March 21 (UPI)Drug addiction and racism are destroying the United States, Representative Shirley Chisholm of Brooklyn told a predominantly white and female audience at Queens College here today.

title: Battle 4th Day at Long Tieng
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 21 (AP)As heavy fighting was reported for the fourth day at Long Tieng, American officials here said they believed enemy forces had sustained heavy losses because of waves of assaults against entrenched defenders.

title: TRIAL ON MURDER CLOSED TO PUBLIC
description: The murder and arson trial of a 17yearold Black Panther was ordered closed to the public and press yesterday in State Supreme Court in Queens.

title: Surgeon General Wants TV To Curb Violence for Children
description: WASHINGTON, March 21Dr. Jesse L. Steinfeld, the Surgeon General, today urged appropriate and immediate remedial action to counter the overdose of violence television provides for chiloren.

title: SENATE I.T.T. UNIT TO GO TO DENVER
Macdonald Is Named To N.W. Ayer Board
description: There's been a substitution on the top management team of N.W. Ayer & Son Tyler Macdonald has gone in for Brydon S. Greene on the board of directors.

title: 3forI Split of Stock and Offering Set
description: The S. S. Kresge Company, Detroit, one of the country's !most successful retail chains, yesterday named a new chairman and chief executive officer, split its common stock threeforone and authorized a secondary offering of Kresge common stock owned by the Kresge Foundation.

title: THOMPSON, VIOLIST, SHOWSSOLID STYLE
description: Violists have a necessary. but unenviable place in the hierarchy of musicians. Their instrument has neither the brilliance of the violin nor the strong sonority of the cello. They must make do with a kind of unpretentious middle ground.

title: COMMUNITY RULE FOR CITY IS URGED IN A STATE REPORT
description: A decentralization plan that would restructure the government of the city to enable cornmunities to hire employes, buy equipment and administer local services was proposed yesterday to the State Study Commission for New York City.

title: Makarios Is Said to Be Resisting Ouster
Advertising:
description: In support of a new Ambassador Express service featuring shorthaul flights connecting 16 cities, Trans World Airlines is about to break its biggest product promotion in recent years.

title: 3 Hurt in FireBombing Of a Home in Jamaica
description: A gasolinefed fire, apparently set off by a fire bomb, raced through a house in Jamaica, Queens, last night, seriously damaging it and slightly injuring three persons, the police said.

title: BLUE CROSS HERE GAINS RATE RAISE
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The Price Commission approved a 17.9per cent rate increase yesterday for hospitalizationinsurance premiums Charged to communityrated subscribers of Greater New York's Blue Cross.

title: Vermont Seeks Idea People
description: RUTLAND, Vt., March 21 (AP)The secretary of the Vermont Agency of Development said today that an advertising campaign would soon be conducted in three large cities to entice inventors, entrepreneurs and innovators to Vermont. Roland A. Loveless, the secretary, said the plan was to develop a pool of thinkers for new and diversified industry in the state.

title: JohnsManville In Accord To Buy General Sprinkler
description: The JohnsManville Corporation announced yesterday that it has agreed to acquire the General Sprinkler Corporation of Fresno, Calif., and its affiliated companies, for more than $13million.

title: MRS. GERTRUDE MOLLOY
description: SAN MATEO, Calif. March 21Mrs. Gertrude Sprague Molloy, the mother of Ernest L. Molloy, who recently retired as president and chief executive officer of R. H. Macy & Co., Inc died today at a Onvalescent home. She was 86 years old.

title: For Silone, Radical of Old School, The Struggle Continues Unabated
description: ROMEHis real name is Tranquilli, which is ironic, for he has never been serene or detached. Born on May Day, 1900, Ignazio Silone was a radical editor at 19, a founder of the Italian Communist party at 21, the author in his thirties of those major leftwing novels Fontamara and Bread and Wine, a leader of the fight against Communism after World War II.

title: Reaction in Israel
description: JERUSALEM, March 2IIsrael's leaders have firmly denied the recent reports that there was highlevel IsraeliJordanian consultation before King Hussein made his proposal last week.

title: Senators Bar Weakening Of Equal Rights Proposal
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The Senate, by unexpectedly large margins, defeated today attempts to dilute a constitutional amendment that would bar all legal forms of discrimination based on sex.

title: U.S. CONFIRMS AID TO MEO GUERRILLAS
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)A top foreign aid official confirmed today that Meo guerrillas in Laos got hospital treatment under American humanitarian assistance but denied that any aid had gone to the Central Intelligence Agency's combat role.

title: Morton Thinks a Black Could Win No. 2 Post
description: RICHMOND, March 21 (AP)Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. Morton says the nomination of a black for Vice President would be politically somewhat difficult but I think he could win.

title: Books of The Times
description: How now to celebrate the magic of Don DeLillo's second novel without making it sound like merely glorious verbal horseplay, or merelyto paraphrase de Lautremont, the 19thcentury French poet, on Beauty  the fortuitous encounter of a football team and poet on a rubdown table? Let's try approaching the matter in a roundabout way.

title: N.F.L. Players to Give Demonstration at Paris
description: PARIS, March 21 (AP)Representatives of the National Football League Players Association announced plans today to bring 42 of the league's top stars to Paris May 27 for a demonstration, that will be part of a charity sports week for the benefit of the American Hospital in Paris.

title: U.S.I. A. Confirms Role in Unattributed Pamphlets
Turkey Bans Nixon Film
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 21 (AP)The martiallaw command in Ankara has banned an exhibit and film on President Nixon's visit to China. The command told the TurkishAmerican Association it did not believe the showing would be suitable under present circumstances. It was to have opened today.

title: MESSIAEN PLAYS ORGAN IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, March 20The National Shrine of the Immaculate Conception is the largest Roman Catholic church in the United States, the seventh largest church in the world and, not surprisingly, is lavishly equipped with organs. There is a goodsized instrument in the chancel and a giant ga llery. some 100 stops in the rear

title: Soviet Missile Peril Now Found Unlikely By U.S. Till 1980's
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The Defense Department, which in the past has justified requests for a missile defense system by Russia's projected ability to destroy a large part of America's Minuteman missile force by the midnineteenseventies, now estimates that this threat may not materialize until the nineteeneighties.

title: Legislators Ask for Welfare Ceiling in Two Categories
description: ALBANY, March 21  In what they admitted was a drastic measure, the chairmen of the Legislature's welfare committees today proposed that the rise in the caseload of Aid to Dependent Children and home relief come out of the checks of the recipients themselves.

title: India Still Banning Flights By Foreign Mission Planes
description: NEW DELHI, March 21 (UPI) The Government of India is still banning foreign missions from using their own aircraft for flights within the country, a spokesman for the Foreign Office said today.

title: Atlantic Studies Planned
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)The United States Geological Survey said today that it would make studies, including bottom samplings, of the outer continental shelf in the Atlantic north of Cape Hatteras this summer to gather geological data.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy has rethought the police needs of the City of New York and advanced detailed plans for meeting them more effectively.

title: G.O.P. MAY SPEED BUS MORATORIUM
description: WASHINGTON, March 21  Republican Congressional leaders have told the White House that some form of moratorium on busing can probably be written into the higher education legislation pending in a HouseSenate conference.

title: CONSERVATIVE JOINS NEW HAMPSHIRE RACE
description: MANCHESTER, N. H. March 21Roger Crowley Jr., who was the unsuccessful Demo.; cratic gubernatorial nominee in 1970, today declared himself a candidate for Governor again.

title: Magnavox Files a Complaint On Japan. Export Subsidies
description: The Magnavox CoMpany said yesterday that it has filed a complaint with the Treasury Department's Bureau of Customs charging that the Japanese Government has been granting substantial export subsidies to Japanese manufacturers of blackandwhite and color television receivers shipped to this country.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS Balancing Asia's Vacuum
description: One outstanding conclusion after long Asian trip is that the postwar strategic balance is dissolving. Since there never was a truly stable balance, this means that a state of flux has set in. In no other area has this new power relationship become more obvious.

title: Greek Premier Supplants the Regent
description: ATHENS, March 21  The general who has been the regent, or acting chief of state, of Greece was dismissed today, and Premier George PapadopouIos assumed the office in addition to his three others.

title: Easter Display Canceled
description: DUBLIN, March 21The Irish Government decided today to cancel the traditional Easter Sunday military parade.

title: Wingate to Seek Seat in Congress; Rangel Plans to Run for Reelection
description: Livingston. L. Wingate resigned yesterday as executive director of the New York Urban League to seek the Democratic nomination for the Congressional seat from the new 19th District, which includes all of Harlem.

title: Aetna Brussels Office
description: The Aetna Life and Casualty Company said it has opened an office in Brussels together with Generali, a Triestebased insurer, to market employe benefit plans in the European Common Market.

title: Governor Is Considering A Citizen Study of OTB
description: While the strike by parimutuel clerks kept Aqueduct closed yesterday, related developments in Albany centered on the possible formation of panel to study offtrack betting.

title: Air Purity Delay Granted
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 21 (AP)The Federal Environmental Protection Agency today granted Pennsylvania and New Jersey an extension until July 30, 1973, of the deadline to submit plans to achieve longrange air purity goals in the Philadelphia area. The agency said the longrange goals could. not be met with available technology.

title: Vietnam Base Attacked
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 21 (AP)An attack by enemy demolition men was reported against the big Tayninh West base camp, 60 miles northwest of Saigon, the headquarters of a South Vietnamese drive against enemy base camps in eastern Cambodia.

title: Candidates'
description: MADISON, Wis., March 21 (AP)  Mayor Lindsay of New York said today that the country could not stand the political trauma of a rematch between Hubert H. Humphrey and Richard M. Nixon.

title: Health Violations Found In All the City Hospitals
description: Health Department reports showed yesterday that nearly all of the 18 crtyowned hospitalk were foUnd at their last inspections to have rodent and, roach infestation, peeling paint and leaking pipes.

title: Fee Plan for Exchange
description: The first new commisionrate structure in 14 years will be put into effect Friday by the New York Stock Exchange. Since the sales charges set by the Big Board are followed in most other stock markets in the nation, a fundamental change will occur in the revenue structure of one of the nation's most important industries. The new fee package will present no surprises to Wall Street and will have little immediate impact on most investors, partly because the rate changes finally are coming after years of negotiations with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Dispute Over OnSite Inspection Arises Anew at Geneva Parley
description: GENEVA, March 21The EastWest deadlock over how to verify compliance with any disarmament agreement arose again today when the Geneva disarmament conference addressed itself to a proposal for the prohibition of chemical weapons.

title: Oil Companies Said to Agree To an Equity Role for Qatar
description: BEIRUT, March 21 (UPI)Foreign oil companies operating in the Persian Gulf state of Qatar have agreed to the principle of a 20 per, centparticipation in their concessions by the Government of Qatar, the Saudi Arabian news agency said today.

title: Harvard Lets S.D.S. Hold A Convention on Campus
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 21 (AP)  Harvard University granted Students for a Democratic Society permission today to use college facilities for a national convention on racism from 3 P.M. March 31 through April 2.

title: The Indian Ocean Contest: III
description: ROXBURY, Conn.  The United States and Western positions in the Indian Ocean area are, so far, small scale and low profile.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Having spent the better part of the past eighteen months studying the adequacy of the existing tax base to support elementaty and secondary education, we must take issue with your editorial assertion on March 12 that unless the Federal contribution is substantially increased, the school budget crisis would merely move from the local to the state level.

title: BLASTS INJURE 25 IN LONDONDERRY
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 21 (AP)Four bomb blasts rocked Londonderry today and gunmen fought a twohour battle with British troops that the army called the city's biggest confrontation since street fighting began in August, 1969.

title: Industrialist Seized As Terrorist Wave Sweeps Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 21 A wave of political assassinations and kidnappings sweeping Argentina is regarded as a serious challenge to plans to hold elections for a constitutional government.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: We agree that ... the record in recruiting and promoting blacks or women has in a large number of cases remained unsatisfactoryuntil pressure was applied. If N.Y.U. serves as an example for other colleges then the only thing that will prevent the elimination of blacks from the campus will be pressure from the outside.

title: Mrs. Abzug Picks Ryan as Primary Foe
description: Despite personal efforts Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay to head off such a struggle, Representative Bella S. Abzug announced yesterday that she would fight Representative William F. Ryan, one of the original ,Reform Democrats, for the Democratic nomination in his West Side Congressional district in the June 20 primary.

title: 12 Senators Offer a Tax Reform Bill
DISCONTENT SEEN IN VOTE IN POLAND
description: WARSAW, March 21The official results of Sunday's Polish parliamentary elections indicated today that voters throughout the nation registered a measure of dissatisfaction while endorsing Edward Gierek's yearold reform program.

title: Market Place: I.C.C. Rail Study Spurs Confusion
SWEDEN MAY STRIP KING'S LAST POWERS
description: STOCKHOLM, March 21 (Reuters)A constitutional reform bill to strengthen the influence of Parliament and to remove residual powers still vested in the king was announced today.

title: Excerpts From Questions and Answers on Decentralization Plan
description: The report on Restructuring the Government of New York City, commenting that any effort to make a major change in our form of municipal government inevitably encounters resistance, posed what it called some of the questions which have been most frequently asked and our replies.

title: U.S. Envoy, at NATO Post, To Go to Spain on Mission
description: BRUSSELS, March 21 (AP)David M. Kennedy, President Nixon's new envoy to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, arrived at headquarters here today and announced he was off to Spain immediately on a trade mission.

title: Average Yield Is 7.531% At Fanny May's Auction
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (Reuters)The average yield of fourmonth mortgage commitments auctioned today by the Federal National Mortgage Association fell to 7.531 per cent from the previous auction's 7.555 per cent.

title: Britain Cuts T axes Sharply To Spur Lagging Economy
description: LONDON, March 21  The British Government announced immediate tax cuts worth $3.14billion today to jolt the economy into a faster recovery and to get it ready for competition within the European Common Market.

title: I.T.T. SAID TO SEEK CHILE COUP IN '70
description: WASHINGTON, March 21Jack Anderson said tonight that the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation had told the White House in 1970 it would be prepared to assist financially in sums up to seven figures to block the impending inauguration of Salvador Al lende Gossens as Chile's Presi dent.

title: G. O. P. Drops Media Drive in Wisconsin
description: MILWAUKEE, March 21President Nixon's political strategists have quietly canceled the first major radio and television drive of his reelection campaign in a move that could materially assist the Democratic candidacy of Gov. George C. Wallace in the Wisconsin primary next month.

title: Revenues Grow Beyond Expectations on Tax OverWithholding
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 The Treasury announced today a sharp reduction in its borrowing requirements over the months ahead because overwithholding of personal income taxes has swollen revenues well above expectations.

title: NASDAQ System Planning to Include Philadelphia Prices
description: WASHINGTON; March 21The National Association of Securities Dealers has decided to expand its NASDAQ stockquotation system to include quotations by stock specialists of the Philadelphia Balthmore Washington Stock Exchange.

title: Laver Tops Pilic, 64, 75 Newcombe Beats Pasarell
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S. C., March 21 (AP)Topseeded Rod Laver beat Nikki Pilic, 64, 75, as four favorites gained opening victories in the $47,500 C.B.S. tennis tournament today.

title: Record Spending Indicated in Primary Campaigns
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 Candidates of both patties for this year's Presidential nominations are estimated to have spent nearly $4million in the primary struggles in New Hampshire and: Florida.

title: Munich Isn't His No. 1 Goal
description: The way Mrs. Myrtle Meriwether remembers it, she was sitting on the hood of this car in the parking lot outside a football stadium in Durham, N. C., when a tall, lanky man walked toward her with this compelling, selfContained grace.

title: REV. JOSEPH DURMANN
description: LINDENHURST, L. I., March 21The Rev. Joseph J. Durmann, pastor of the Roman Catholic Church of Our Lady of Perpetual Help here, died yesterday at Good Samaritan hospital, West Islip. He was 70 years old.

title: Pakistani Prisoners
description: Three months after hostilities ceased on the Indian subcontinent India is still holding more than 90,000 Pakistani prisoners, including some sick and wounded. This is contrary both to international law and to India's own interest in restoring peace based on mutual confidence and cooperation on the subcontinent.

title: Tokyo ErAide, Leaving For China, Is Attacked
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, March 22 (UPI)A 31yearold man tried to attack former Foreign Minister ?? Fujiyama today as he walked toward his plane for a trip to China. Mr. Fujiyama was unhurt.

title: Mrs. Howard C. Davison, 59, A Fellowship House Leader
description: WASHINGTON, March 21Mrs. Alicia Vereide, Abrahamsen Davison, wife of Howard C. Davision, with whom she conducted Fellowship House, center here of a prayeratbreakfast movement, died of a heart attack in Hong Kong on Sunday while the couple were on a world tour. She was 59 years old.

title: U.S. Health System Is Termed Ineffective
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 21 (UPI)The presidentelect of the National Health Council said today that the health system in the United States was so ineffective that $10billion more would not substantially improve it.

title: 4 Suburban Counties Go to the Polls
Rockefeller Backs Nixon On a Busing Moratorium
U.S. Pledges Millions to City For Addicts, Easing Relief Load
description: The city was authorized yesterday to begin billing for and collecting millions of dollars is Federal funds to reimburse it for a variety of rehabilitation and preventive services for drug addicts.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your March 8 editorial Vintage Congressman asks whether mere aging can do for Congressmen what it dOes for cheese and wine.

title: Nixon Acts to Aid U.S. Investment in 2 Red Lands
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 President Nixon has, authorized the use of Government funds to underwrite joint economic ventures In Yugoslavia and Rumania by private American investors. This was the first time such United Statesbacked protection has been granted for use in Communist countries.

title: Envoy to Costa Rica Resigns
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)President Nixon has accepted the resignation of Walter C. Ploeser as Ambassador to Costa Rica, the White House announced today. Appointed in April, 1970, he will return to his St. Louis insurance concern.

title: COAST RACE WON BY HAIL THE GREY
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 21 (AP)Hail The Grey, paying $54.80, rallied in midstretch and defeated Manta by two lengths today in the $65,500 Santa Barbara Handicap at Santa Anita.

title: Meminger to Get Award
description: Dean Meminger will, receive the New York Catholic Youth Organization's annual award as the most popular Knick player during the halftime break at the KnickBuffalo Braves game tonight at Madison Square Garden.

title: BarbosaLima, Guitarist, Makes Debut
description: Carlos BarbosaLima, a Brazilian guitarist in his late 20's, demonstrated in his New York debut recital Monday night enough talent and schooling to put him on the upper levels among performers on his instrument. His program at Alice Tully Hall, moreover, took pains to bypass most of the guitar's stereotyped repertory, and included first New York performances of works by Leonardo Balada, Albert Harris, Francisco Mignone and Isaias Savio.

title: Lockheed's Tristar jet Gets Introduction Here
description: Lockheed's L1011 Tristarthe jetliner that almost foundered with the collapse of Britain's Rolls Royce, Ltd.came to New York for the first time yesterday, and company officials insisted that the troublebeset airliner was now out of trouble.

title: United Jewish Appeal Sets $150Million Goal
description: A campaign to raise $150million to help needy and endangered Jews overseas was begun by the United Jewish Appeal of Greater New York at a dinner last night at the Americana Hotel. About 800 Jewish communal leaders for the metropolitan area heard Shimon Peres, Israel's Minister of Transport and Communications, characterize the influx of Jews from the Soviet Union to Israel an historic development.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: William R. Phillips, the suspended patrolman who was indicted Monday on a murder charge, was released yesterday from a city detention facility after posting $30,000 bail, but he later surrendered to Pedenti authorities as a material witness in pending, cases. Federal Judge Charles L. Decant Jr. set bail at $lopo and ordered Mr. Phillips held in protective custody. Mr. Phillips was a key witness in the Knapp Commission hearings last October on police corruption.

title: PRICES DROP AGAIN IN AMEX TRADING
Dow Off 7.15 to 934.00 as Prices Decline on Broad Front
ARAFAT SAYS KING MET ISRAELI CHIEF
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 21 Yasir Arafat, leader of the Palestine Liberation Organization, said last night that King Hussein met recently with Premier Golda Meir of Israel at the Jordanian port of Aqaba and that a Jordanian Army officer who accompanied the King had defected to Cairo and told about the meeting.

title: STATE, UNIT REJECTS A PENSION RISE HERE
description: ALBANY, March 21  Otto Kinzel, chairman of the State Pension Commission, said today that the fivemember panel had rejected a bill to increase retirement benefits for 121,000 municipal employes in New York City. Initially, it would have cost taxpayers about $30. million a year.

title: TV: Channel 9 Pays Earth Day a 12Hour Tribute
description: Yesterday was International Earth Day and, while the event got a respectable share of passing notice, WORTV, Channel 9, made the staggering most of it. In cooperation with the United Nations, the station presented a 12hour ecology marathon called EDay 72.

title: Brewers Drop Schofield
description: TEMPE, Ariz., March 21 (AP) The Milwaukee Brewers announced the unconditional release today of Dick Schofield, an infielder with 19 years in the major leagues. He hit.107 for the Brewers in 28 times at that last year.

title: Two TeenAge Aussie Prospects Join Mets Minor League Training Camp
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 21  Casey Stengel went to bat today for baseball's new PingPong diplomacy, which has been intensified lately by the arrival of Japanese teams, Italian coaches and even the Berlitz School of Languages.

title: Attack Dogs Kill a Girl, 3, Who Fell Into Their Pen
description: A 3yearold girl in the East New York section of Brooklyn was fatally bitten yesterday by two attacktrained dogs when she fell into the animals pen.

title: Candidates Day
description: MILWAUKEE, March 21 aerator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine vowed today to go all the way to the Democratic convention next July in Miami. Beach regardless of the outcome of the primary electiong in which he is entered.

title: Moorhead Finds Errors in Nixon's Secrecy Order
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The stamp of approval placed by labor mediator Theodore W. Kheel [news story March 12] on the right of public employes to strike against the people and against the government which employs them seems to me public.disservice. It presented the anomaly of a call to arms by a peacemaker in a forumWorkers Defense Leaguewhich would be predictably inflammable.

title: Sports of The Times
description: ISLAMORADA, Fla., March 21A new dimension has been added to bonefishing here in the turquoise and emerald world of the Florida keys, and 12 pounds 5 ounces is not its only measurement. To be sure, those are the figures in the official report signed by Mary Frances Dressing, the weightmaster at the Islamorada Yacht Basin. Guide: Jack Brothers, the report.states. Boat: Fox III. Name bait and lure: shrimp. Line size: 10pound ibst. Was fish mutilated or cut. No. Is there any doubt as to validity catch? No. All true, as far as it goes. Mr. Sobel here set a world record the other day for bonefish caught on light tackle, Brothers said as he headed the boat north along the Florida Bay side of the keys.
