Twelve pounds 2 ounces on sixpound test line, said Arnold Sobel of Chicago. I fought him hour and 58 minutes. Can't just horse em in on sixpound line.

title: Davis Cup Team Wins, 41
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, March 21 (AP)The United States split the two final singles matches with the Caribbean Commonwealth today for a 41 Davis Cup victory.

title: FASHION TALK
description: The great big wide coat, which has been turning up in high fashion collections during the last year, is getting ready to occupy center stage next fall.

title: WEST BANK VOTE SEEMS IMPERILED
description: JERUSALEM, March 21Israeli plans for municipal elections on the occupied West Bank next Tuesday appeared in danger of collapse today, as pressures from Jordan and Palestinian guerrilla threats of assassination against candidates began to have an impact.

title: Interest Rates Edge Up in Bond Markets Amid Signs Rise Is Waning
Wisconsin Adults Now 18
description: MADISON, Wis., March 21 (UPI)Gov. Patrick J. Lucy signed tonight a bill making Wisconsin citizens adults at age 18 instead of 21. The new law will become effective at 12:01 A. M. Thursday, following formal publication tomorrow. It will permit persons age 18 and older to drink liquor, Marry without parental cons sent, enter into contracts, file lawsuits and be sued.

title: Palm Grove Will Be Sanctuary
description: The last natural palm grove in Texas, described as a unique treasure, has been purchased by the National Audubon Society and will be preserved as a sanctuary. The price paid was not disclosed.

title: Cigarette Use Rises
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (Reuters)Cigarette smoking rose to new high in the United States last year and is expected, to Increase more this year, the Agriculture Department said today. It said 555 billion cigarettes were smoked by Americans in 1971, 3 per cent more than in 1970.

title: Three Retail Chains Set Profit Marks.for Year

description: YONKERS, March 21Stanley Dancer will not be at Yonkers Raceway to drive Scarpia in one of the three semifinal divisions of the Hopeful Pacing Series tomorrow night.

title: Old Inn Bows to Women
description: SOUTH AMBOY, Mass., March 21 (AP)Longfellow's Wayside Inn, said to be America's oldest inn, has changed its slogan to include women. The sign on the 270yearold inn, named for the poet, now reads: Food and Lodging for Man, Woman and Beast. It previously read: Food and Lodging for Man and Beast.

title: Bankers Trust Corp. Sees Dip in Quarterly Earnings
description: The Bankers Trust New York Corporation expects its earnings in the first quarter to decline not more than 10 per cent from the excellent results posted in the yearearlier period, William H. Moore, chairman of the company, said yesterday.

title: Peso Regulations Shifted
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 21 (Reuters)The Argentine Government announced today new foreign exchange regulations.

title: Asarco Reports End of Bar To Voting Its Revere Stock
description: The American Smelting and Refining Company yesterday announced that a consent judgment limiting its relationship with Revere Copper and Brass, Inc., had expired and been terminated by order of a New York Federal Court.

title: Bridge: Jacoby's Team Stages Rally To Win Men's Championship
description: CINCINNATI, March 21A team including two of the reigning world champions rallied to capture the men's team championship at the American.Contract Bridge League's Spring Nationals early today.

title: Thomas Caldecot Chubb Dead; Biographer and Book Reviewer
description: THOMASVILLE, Ga., March 21ThOmas Caldecot Chubb, biographer and book reviewer, died yesterday in Archibald Memorial Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at Springwood Plantation here and on Porchuck Road, Greenwich, Conn.

title: Exchange Will Follow S.E.C. RuleChange Recommendation
description: The New York Stock Exchange said yesterday that it would, move forward promptly with hew rules to abolish its ban on institutional membership in line with a policy recommendation made by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Britain Doubles Garrison In British Honduras to 550
description: LONDON, March 21 (AP)The British Government announced today that it had doubled its garrison in British Honduras from 275 to about 550 men. The purpose apparently is to continue a show of force in answer to the renewal of Guatemala's claim to the neighboring British protectorate.

title: Tananbaum Empowered To Sell Yonkers Track
description: The board of directors of Yonkers Raceway yesterday empowered Stanley Tananbaum, the president of the Corporation, to sign a contract for the sale of, the harness racing track and its assets to the Rooney brothers of Pittsburgh. The signing, calling for $46 per share, will take place within 48 hours. A group headed by the Tananbaum brothers acquired control for $1.75million in 1954.

title: GOLDPRICE BILL IS SENT TO NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The House passed overwhelmingly and, sent to President Nixon today the legislation formally reducing the intemational value of the dollar by raising the official gold price from $35 an ounce to $38.

title: Thaler Summations Presented; Case Is Due to Go to Jury Today
description: Seymour R. Thaler was characterized by the prosecution in his Federal Court trial here yesterday as a greedy dealer in $800,000 worth of stolen United States Treasury bills.

title: U.S. Advances With Australia And France in Federation Cup

description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 21A rising wave of Protestant militancy is surging across Northern Ireland and consolidating into a powerful movement seeking to thwart any major political initiative here.

title: Chinese Table Tennis Team Set To Begin Tour of U.S. April 10
description: DETROIT, March 21 (UPI)1 A Chinese table tennis team and six Chinese newsmen will, begin a twoweek tour of the United States April 10, just a year after the historic visit of the United States team to China.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: This is to make a very loud exception to a portion in your Feb. 25 editorial Death by Postal Rate. That portion is unwarranted namecalling and is not justified.. (I must agree, however, with the rest of your opinion regarding secondclass rates and how wrong the Postal Service is regarding their demand for a 142 per cent increase.)

description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 21 (AP)  BankAmerica Corporation shareholders overwhelmingly approved a 2for1 split on outstanding shares of common stock today.

title: Democrat Reid
description: Leaving the Republican party is a much tougher wrench for Representative Ogden R. Reid than it was for Mayor Lindsay. His grandfather was a founder of the G.O.P. and its VicePresidential candidate 1n 1892 on a slate headed by Benjamin Harrison. The Westchester Congressman was the last member of his family to edit The New York Herald Tribune in its long career as a voice of intelligent Republicanism.

description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (Reuters)The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation said today it had advanced 1,4million to the Bank of the Commonwealth, Detroit, under a $60million loan commitment to the bank.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I read with great interest William A. Rusher's comments on President Nixon's visit to China [OpEd March 2]. In his article, Mr. Rusher remarks, Not one of America's Asian allies.. views this development [that is, the improvement in America's relations with China] with anything but misgivings and alarm. He mentions the Philippines among these allies.

description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 22 (Reuters)  Reports in Jack Anderson's column that the International Telephone and Telegraph Corportion tried to prevent President Allende from coming to power was frontpage news in Chilean newspapers today.

title: AEOLIAN ENSEMBLE MARKS MILESTONE
description: Groups dedicated to the furtherance of new music have a way of coming and going quickly. In the nature of things, they are usually formed by the idealistic young and tend to be about as enduring as seniorclass friendships. And yet, there are exceptions, such as the Aeolian Chamber Players, which celebrated 10 years of existence on Tuesday night at the Whitney Museum.

title: Advanced Memory's Suit Against I.B.M. Is Settled

title: Key Congressional Democrats Oppose Nixon Busing Proposal
description: WASHINGTON, March 22President Nixon's proposals to curtail busing were attacked today by Democrats holding key positions on Congressional committees, indicating that the Administration's legislation faces a difficult road in Congress.

title: Fall Off a Bus
description: Presidential candidates may occasionally be pardoned when, too tired to think and too eager to keep quiet, they say things they later wish they hadn't. But even such mitigation is hard to invoke in assessing Senator Humphrey's proclamations on the Administration antibusing proposals. Both the original supportive reaction by Mr. Humphrey to President Nixon's televised address and his subsequent reversal had the unfortunate trappings of a man who would rather be President than right.

title: WELFARE RECIPIENTS UP FOR 4TH MONTH

title: Players Applause Accorded to Giulini After Mahler's 9th

The latter is unusual, a sign of high regard for the conductor. In the face of so much approval, this listener is still forced to submit a minority report on the performance.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON AMEX AND OTC
Sir Alec Cuts Israeli Visit
description: JERUSALEM, March 22, (Reuters)The British Foreign Secretary, Sir Alec DouglasHome, who arrived here last night, started a busy schedule of talks with Israeli leaders today after his planned stay in Israel was cut short by one day. The British Embassy said he had to return to London a day early for a Cabinet meeting on Northern Ireland tomorrow.

description: VERNON, Vt., March 22 (AP) The Vermont Yankee Atomic power plant here was issued a low power testing license today by the Atomic Energy Commission. The license allows Vermont Yankee to operate its 540 megawatt facility at 1 per cent of full capacity for testing purposes.

title: WOMAN IS LINKED TO JAPAN KILLINGS
description: TOKYO, March 22A 27yearold woman reportedly described as abnormally jealous and of frail mind has been identified by the police here as the presiding judge in the torture and murder of at least 12 young Japanese radicals.

description: Greater New York's Blue Cross yesterday received state permission to institute a 14.8 per cent increase in rates for hospitalization insurance charged to communityrated subscribers. The Federal Price Commission last Tuesday approved a 17.9 per cent rise.

title: Allende, Seeking Deal, Closes Congress and Begins Land. Inquiry
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 22 (Reuters)Both houses of the Chilean Congress were closed today, as President Salvador Allende Gossens moved to meet two threats to his authority.

title: TRIMBLE SYMPHONY HAS U.S. PREMIERE
description: Few composers find the symphony a congenial medium for major musical statements nowadays. Lester Trimble evidently is one exception and his Second Symphony, which was given its premiere three years ago in Lisbon by Igor Buketoff, had its first American. performance at Tully Hall Tuesday night by the Juilliard Theater Orchestra under Mr. Buketoff's guest direction.

title: Daniels &
description: The midManhattan branch of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People has joined leaders of tho securities industry to honor Daniels & Bell, Inc., at a testimonial dinner May 22 at the New York Hilton Hotel. The New York Stock Exchange member firm is the first with an integrated partnership.

title: F.C.C.'s Johnson Accuses TV of Molesting Children's Minds
description: WASHINGTON, March 22Nicholas Johnson, the maverick member of the Federal Communications CommisSion, told a Senate subcommittee today that the television networks had molested the minds of the nation's children  and was himself denounced by a committee member who termed Mr. Johnson's charges violent.

title: MUSKIE CAPTURES 59 OF DELEGATES IN ILLINOIS VOTING
EDWARD B. LEVY
description: Edward B. Levy, a lawyer for more than 60 years, died Tuesday at New York Hospital. He was 88 years old and lived at 20 East 74th Street.

title: Man In the News
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 In 1969 when Raymond Philip Shafer was Governor of Pennsylvania, he decided, despite his previous opposition, that the state needed an income tax. In his fight for that proposal, he was overwhelmingly turned down by the Legislature, lost much of his popularity with the voters of the nation's thirdlargest state, and, broke with his Lieuten ant Governor. Today, as chairman of the National Commission on Marijuana and Drug Abuse,, the craggyjawed Republican presented a recommendation that would end criminal penalties for private possession of small quantities of marijuana. And once again the 55yearold politician finds himself supporting a program that may provoke dissent.

title: NEW RELIEF PLAN IS URGED BY CITY
description: New York City made public yesterday a major new workrelief employment plan meant to put 35,000 people into public or private nonprofit agency jobs instead of on nomerelief rolls.

title: Stravinsky Memorial Set
description: A service commemorating the first anniversary of the death of Igor Stravinsky will be held next Thursday at 6 P.M. at the Russian Orthodox Church, 75 East 93d Street. The composer died on April 6, but since it falls during the Russian Orthodox holy week this year, the memorial had to be held ion another date.

title: Nathan Pintchik, 80, Dies; Founded Decorating Stores
description: MIAMI BEACH, March 22Nathan Pintchik, founder of the Pintchik Home Decorating Centers, died today in a hospital of a heart ailment. He was 80 years old and had lived here since his retirement some years ago.

title: Film: Time-Tripping With 'Slaughterhouse-Five'
description: "Slaughterhouse-Five," George Roy Hill's screen version of Kurt Vonnegut Jr.'s novel, is a wild, noisy, sometimes very funny film that eventually becomes as unstuck in its own exuberance as its hero, Billy Pilgrim, the Illium, N. Y., optometrist, is unstuck in time.The things one remembers most vividly about the movie, which opened yesterday at the Sutton Theater, are its marvelous subsidiary characters and its affection for middle Americans of immense vulgarity and pride. When Billy's overweight wife tries to squeeze into her birthday present, a brand-new white Cadillac, she whines: "It's a little tight." When Billy congratulates Derby, his sweet-tempered, over-age Army buddy, on his way with words, Derby answers: "We didn't mince phraseologies at Boston Trades and Industrial.""Slaughterhouse-Five," however, is not about Valencia or Derby or the absolutely stunning Hollywood starlet, Montana Wildhack, with whom Billy winds up spending the rest of eternity on the planet Tralfamadore. It's about the epic travail of Billy himself, through marriage, childhood, nervous breakdown, death and war (sometimes in that order, sometimes not). Billy time-trips from past to future and back again, thereby attaining the kind of serenity that could look like madness only to the people who find Vonnegut too deep for their tasteswhich would include most of the characters Billy meets in life.Billy Pilgrim, very nicely played by a new young actor named Michael Sacks, who looks like a cartoon fall-guy copied in flesh, is Everyman and, like most Everymen, he becomes a bit tiresome, since he never is allowed to express his own outrage with the human condition. Billy simply endures, a passive figure set against a background in which the author inventories man's idiocies to man, from the little deceptions of childhood to the legalized lunacies of war.I thus have certain reservations about the point of the filmI mean I hate war too and I'm not sure that this sort of work does much more than increase our smug satisfaction with our own high-mindedness. Mr. Vonnegut, however, could not survive on high-mindedness alone, and Mr. Hill's achievement in "Slaughterhouse-Five" is in transferring to film, in a way that was lacking in "Happy Birthday, Wanda June," the author's ebullient senses of humor and chaos.Second to "The Godfather," "Slaughterhouse-Five" is probably the most perfectly cast film in months, mostly with actors who have had little previous film experience, with the exception of Ron Liebman, so good in "Where's Poppa," who plays Billy's paranoid Army friend. They are all fine, out special mention must be made of Valerie Perrine as Billy's Hollywood starlet, Eugene Roche as Derby, and Sharon Gans as Billy's nice dumbbell of a wife.The problem with the film, as it was with the novel, is that it's really not outraged or outrageous enough, much like its time-tripping gimmick. Not only do all movies time-trip, since all time in movies (including flashbacks) is a type of present, but so also do we, a dozen times a day, slip from the past into the future, and sometimes sideways, into visions of present moments, not as they really are but as they might be.
