description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Executive Changes
description: The Commonwealth Oil Refining Company, Inc., has appointed Julian O. Cumberland executive vice president of finance and administration, a new post.

title: OIL SPILL THREATENS CONNECTICUT SHORE
description: NIANTIC, Conn., March 22Thousands of gallons of oil spilled yesterday by a grounded tanker covered a threemile stretch of beach here today about 10 miles west of New London, with a barely visible film and a pungent stench.

title: IN THE NATION
description: President Nixon's facile declaration in his television address that a large and increasing number of blacks agreed with his antibusing position was no doubt true, but it was nevertheless misleading. Three times, for instance, Mr. Nixon used phrases such as most Americans or the great majority of Americans and followed with the quick interjection white and black.

title: Court Voids an AntiContraceptive Law
description: WASHINGTON, March 22The Supreme Court ruled today that a state could not outlaw the distribution of contraceptives to single persons when birth control devices are legally available to married couples.

title: MRS. R. M. ISAACSON
description: SAYVILLE, L.I., March 22 Mrs. Mary Regina Harding Isaacson, widow of Rousseau M. Isaacson, who was chairman of the Fire Commissioners and a funeral director here, died yesterday in South Side Hospital, Bay Shore. She was 82 years old.

title: Democrats Ask Big Social Security Rise
description: WASHINGTON, March 22The majority of the Democrats on the Joint Economic Committee of Congress called today for a Social Security increase this year substantially greater than the 5 per cent proposed by the Nixon Administration.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN Delegates Committed In Democratic Race
description: CHICAGO, March 22 Following are the delegate votes committed to the Democratic Presidential candidates, as compiled by. The New York Times:

title: Tayninh Base Attacked
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam, March 23 (AP)Enemy troops poured nearly 30 rockets. into and around the main operational base for the current South Vietnamese drive into Cambodia, killing seven persons, wounding seven and destroying more than 100,000 gallons of fuel, the Saigon ommand reported today.

title: All in the Family
description: Disaster volunteering is a family affair, according to Toni Levy, citywide chairman of Red Cross disaster services. For example, he said, Ed Popper was chasing fires 25 years ago when he helped found the Third Alarm Association, the fire buff organization that has since joined the Red Cross disaster services. Mr. Popper's soninlaw, Warren Zorek, became a disaster volunteer and he is now Red Cross disaster chairman for Manhattan.

title: St. John's to Play Minus Davis
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: REVENUE SHARING CLEARS A HURDLE Ways and Means Committee Reaches Agreement on Bill Adminstration Pleased
Letters to the Editor; Owen Lattimore Asks: To Right What Wrong?
description: To the Editor:

title: Caseworker Pleads Guilty
description: A suspended Social Services caseworker pleaded guilty yesterday in State Supreme Court in the Bronx to a charge of grand larceny arising from the theft last year of $16,799.35 by furnishing false identification to individuals, issuing them emergency checks and splitting the money with them after they cashed the checks. The caseworker, Stephen Isaacman, 29 years old, of 460 West 24th Street, was scheduled for sentencing May 22. He worked at the Bergen center in the Bronx.

title: TV: N.B.C. Takes Turn to Whimsey With 2 Shows.
description: This week the National Broadcasting Company seems to have taken a turn to Whimsey. Tuesday night, at 7:30, the network offered Miss Pickerell, an hourlong journey with an unusually talkative woman and her pet cow. Last night, at 8:30, It presented a 90minute adaptation of Harvey, the stage comedy that won a Pulitzer Prize for Mary Chase.

title: Personal Finance: Policy Renewals
description: Dear Sir, the form letter read. This is to inform you that your automobile insurance policy will not be renewed on expiration.

title: Saldivar Hangs Up Gloves
description: MEXICO CITY, March 42 (UM Vicente Saldivar, the former twotime featherweight champion, retired from the ring today to Pursue a career as a sports commentator and, movie actor. Saldivar, 28 years old, was knocked out last year by Kuniaki Shibata of Japan in the 13th round and lost his title.

title: Soviet Orders a Crash Program of Computer Training
description: MOSCOW, March 22The Soviet Government disclosed today that it had ordered a crash program of training a small army of computer specialists as part of its ambitious plan to computerize the nation's economy by the nineteeneighties,

title: Welfare Workers Stage Job Actions at 2 Centers
description: Welfare workers walked off their jobs at a Queens center yesterday and conducted paralyzing work stoppage at Manhattan center after two incidents of violence in as many days.

title: Showdown Imminent
description: BUFFALO, March 22Defying an order by the State Education Commissioner, Ewald B. Nyquist, the Buffalo Board of Education voted 4 to 3 at tumultuous meeting today to refuse to submit a plan for achieving racial balance in its 98 schools.

title: Thieu Ousts Five Defense Aides In Scandal on, Retirement Fund
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 22President Nguyen Van Thieu dismissed five top aides of the Minister of Defense today and consulted with him about the possibility of the minister's own resignation or dismissal for political reasons in a scandal about a military retirement fund.

title: MAYOR CRITIZES PROPOSAL ON CITY
description: Mayor Lindsay, yesterday assailed as 'amateurish", what he termed the work of a TamMany, politician, the decentralization plan proposed on Tuesday by a task force of the State Study Commission for New York City.

title: Moscow and the Moon
description: The Soviet officials and astronauts Mr. Wilford interviewed also gave him another important message: Moscow intends to step up its manned space activities, and it looks forward in particular to sending Soviet astronauts to the moon in the next few years.

title: SUGAR FUTURES DECLINE BY LIMIT
description: Prices of world No. 11 sugar futures, reflecting continuing liquidation by traders, declined the limit of  cent a pound across all.contracts yesterday on. the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange.

title: TEACHERS SEEKING BETTER SECURITY
description: Albert Shanker said yesterday that the United Federation of Teachers would ask the Board of Education to provide school district attorneys to prosecute those who commit crimes in schools and to take other measures to protect pupils and teachers.

title: A REPORT CRITICIZES PUPIL FOOD PROJECT
description: WASHINGTON, March 22The Agriculture Department was accused in a study released today of having deliberately! underestimated the number of schools that want to participatit in the school breakfast program in an effort to conceal the true need for increased funds.

title: Poll Puts Humphrey Ahead in Wisconsin
Bridge: Tennessee Collegians Score Upset in Vanderbilt Cup Play
LAKERS DETOURED IN BID FOR RECORD
Market Place Money Manager Limits Losses
description: When John L. After totaled his losses in the 1962 bear market, the slim, frenetic money manager's $150,000 personal stake was gone and he was $50,000 in debt.

title: Paris in the Spring. Young Lovers Are Barred From Luxembourg Gardens
description: PARIS, March 22It was the balmiest day of the year. Children were sailing boats around the fountain as mothers knitted in the sun, old men bowled and played cards, the trees burst into full foliage and the bees visited the first flowers of spring. But not a boy kissed a girl in the Luxembourg Gardens, unless they were foreigners.

title: Two Big Utilities And Gas Company Plan Expansion
description: Two large utility holding companies and a natural gas company announced, plans yes terday expansion programs totaling more than $885million this year. Financing requirements will be in excess of $722million.

title: Sports of The Times
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 22Despite disavowals to the contrary, the trade was made out of petulance. At least that's what the more perceptive baseball men believe. The St. Louis Cardinals were balking at the salary demands of Steve Carlton, their 20game winner, at the same time that the Phillies were resisting the salary demands of Rick Wise, their 17game winner.

title: CHASE PLANS TO BUY AUSTRALIAN STOCK
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank and Alliance Holdings, Ltd., lending concern In Sydney, Australia, announced yesterday that they had reached an agreement on the purchase price to be paid by the Chase Manhattan Overseas Banking Corpora. tion or another wholly owned subsidiary of Chase Manhattan for 6,526,542 shares of Alliance.

title: Yanks Trade Cater for Lyle, Star Red Sox Relief Pitcher
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 22  The New York Yankees were held scoreless for the sixth time in 18 games today, and adding insult to injury, it was the Mets who did the shutting out, 30.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Lindsay Forces Prepare AllOut Wisconsin Effort
Sadat in Libya for Talks
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, March 22 (Agence FrancePresse)President Anwar elSadat of Egypt arrived here today for urgent talks with Premier Muammar elOaddafi. The reason for the talks was not announced.

title: ONASSIS HEARING NEAR CONCLUSION
description: Ronald E. Galella, a freelance photographer, was portrayed by opposing, sees yesterday in his court battle with Mrs. Aristotle Onassls as a journalist with an absolute right to pursue his occupation and as Peeping Tom who has un mercifully harassed Mrs. Onassis.

title: Excerpts From Court of Appeals Decision on Posters Action in Barring Press
STERN, CLARINETIST, SHOWS LIMPID TONE
description: The clarinetist David Stern brought limpid tone and a versatile sense of how to maneuver a musical line to his New York recital debut Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. At the same time, there is no overlooking the fact that he was having trouble with air slippage at the mouthpiece, the steaming radiator effect.

title: Public Service Picks Nuclear Power Site Off South Jersey
description: NEWARK, March 22  The Public Service Electric and Gas Company today announced it had chosen a site three miles southeast of Little Egg Harbor Inlet near the boundary between Atlantic and Ocean Counties for a billiondollar floating nuclear generating station.

title: Cahill Backs Device
description: TRENTON, March 22  Gov. William T. Cahill said today that while the problem of racially segregated schools would not be solved by busing, he supported busing black students across municipal boundaries if necessaryto get them quality education in New Jersey.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)  National Basketball Association club owners refused to allow players to have collective legal representation until the American. Basketball Association was formed, House subcommittee was told today.

title: DR. CURT PROSKAUER, A DENTAL HISTORIAN
description: Dr. Curt Proskauer, a dentist and dental historian, died Monday at his home, 720 Fort Washington Avenue. He was 84 years old.

title: Samuels Proposes 365 Daysof Racing
description: Accusing New York's racing industry of resorting to the Big Lie technique, Howard Samuels proposed a plan yesterday he estimated could net an additional $29million in parimutuel tax revenue.

title: Bridges Vows Support
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 22 (UPI)Harry Bridges, the longshore union leader, pledged a full and undivided effort by his union in labor's fight with the Pay Board.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: AROSA, Switzerland, March 22 (AP) Rosi Mittermaier of West Germany won the women's slalom In the Arose series today, but the thirdplace finisher, Fabienne Serrat of France, clinched the European Cup.

title: Daley Sums Up: You Win Some, You...
A.B.A. Sues for $300Million, Charging N.B.A. Is Monopoly
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 22 (AP)The American Basketball Association filed an antitrust suit today against the rival National Basketball Association, citing recent defections by A.B.A. players to the N.B.A. and asking $300million in damages.

title: Jeremiah Milbank, a Financier Who Aided the Crippled, Dead
description: Jeremiah Milbank, a financier whose 1917 investment in aiding the crippled helped rehabilitate many, died yesterday in Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. He was 85 years old and lived on Byram Shore Road in Byram, Conn.

title: Borrowers Helped
description: LONDON, March 22 The Government today put into effect eased exchange control regulations that will make it possible for foreignowned companies to borrow money here for investment in Britain. Previously, such companies had to borrow investment funds abroad and bring them into Britain.

title: Van Wolf, 45, Producer And ExTheater Executive
description: Van Wolf, producer of Trials of OZ, which is in rehearsal for an opening at the Mercury Theater, Third Avenue and 13th Street, died of cancer yesterday at Doctors Hospital. He was 45 years old and made his home at Nassau, the Bahamas.

title: Diners'
description: Diners' Club, Inc., the creditcard issuer, and the Continental Corporation, its parent company, are being, sued in Federal District Court here for $31million.

title: Rockwell Retrospective in Brooklyn
description: The Brooklyn Museum opened yesterday an exhibition honoring Norman Rockwell, America's alltime most popularno, make that bestlovedAmerica's alltime bestloved artist, with a 60year retrospective. In order to see it I shouldered my way through the crowd of pimps, prostitutes and perverts on nines Square to duck Into the part of the subway system that, like a rat in a maze, I've learned will eject me on Eastern Parkway a few steps from one of my favorite institutions.

title: London Finds That Decentralization Works
description: LONDONSeven years ago, the 2,000yearold City of London decentralized its government and divided itselfin a spurt of quiet but radical change into 33 separate Londons.

title: Eighteen Texts Out of Greece Airs Protest in Verse and Prose
description: When Christopher G. Janus, the former publisher of Great, Heritage, met with a group of writers in Athens late in 1969, none of them thought their Eighteen Texts, a book of poems and short stories protest ing Greece's military dictatorship, would ever get into print.

title: POWELL QUESTION SETTLED IN MIAMI
description: MIAMI, March 22  Mrs. Yvette Diago Flores Powell was recognized.today by a Miami Circuit Court to be the. lawful wife of former Representative Adam Clayton Powell, who is reported to be in deep coma at Jackson Memorial Hospital here.

title: U.N. BODY CONDEMNS ISRAELI OCCUPATION
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 22 (Reuters)  The United Nations Human Rights Commission adopted a resolution tonight branding as war crimes and an affront to humanity actions committed by Israel in occupied Arab territories.

title: Tennis Tourney Tomorrow
description: Peter Doerner, a ranking Australian living here, is seeded first for the New York City men's indoor tennis tournament starting tomorrow at the Wall Street Racquet Club. Ninetytwo players are in the draw.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Miss Casals, Mrs. Gunter Easy. Victors, at. Richmond
description: RICHMOND; March 22 (AP)  Rosemary Canals overpowered Esme Emanuel of. South Africa, 61, 6.4, and moved into the third round of the $18,000 Virginia Slims international tennis tournament today.

title: Park Enlargement Backed
description: WASHINGTON, March22 (AP)A bill approved today by the House Committee on In terior and Insular Affairs would permit the enlargement of the Gulf Islands National Seashore in Florida and Mississippi. The bill, would authorize the donatioa by Mississippi of the Magnolia :State Park for inclusion in the seashort park.

title: Starr Unhurt in Air Crash
description: SCOTTSBORO, la.,March 22(UPI)Bart Starr, quarterback of the Green Bay Packers, escaped without injury today: when a light plane he was in crashed while landing at the, airport here. The twinengine Pipe Comanche was on a landing approach when it was caught by a gust of wind and crashed into a hangar. The plane was cut into two pieces.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Once again, the Environmental Defense Fund, with cooperation from state and local interests, is challenging the validity of a United States Army Corps of Engineers flood control project already under way.

title: For Whites in Black Africa, Uncertain Role
BALL CLUBS BAR RISE IN PENSIONS
description: ST.PETERSBURG, Fla., March 22Baseball's club owners voted 240 today not to increase their offer in pensionbenefit negotiations and sent John Gaherin, their representative, back to new bargaining sessions with Marvin Miller, director of the Players Associa, tion, in Arizona Friday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: JIMMY CARROLL, 59, ARRANGER OF MUSIC
description: LOS ANGELES, March 22Jimmy Carroll, a musician who had made the arrangements for many Mitch Miller recordings, died Saturday. He was 59 years old.

title: Man Kills Himself After Gun Battle With AlhanyPolice
description: ALBANY, March 22'  A fourhour long gun battle with the police, which began in an argument in a tavern here, ended this morning with the apparent suicide of an unemployed Schenectady man.

title: Turkey Seeks U.S. Aid to Modernize, Armed Forces
description: WASHINGTON, March 22Premier Nihat Erim of Turkey presented to the United States Government today a plan for the modernization of the Turkish Army and Air Force.

title: The Man in the Sky Is a Killer
description: There's a good deal of, sentiment and dreamy invention attached to the American prisoners of war in North Vietnam. Politicians and newsmen often talk as though these pilots had been kidnapped from a farm in Iowa or out of a canoe paddling the waterways of Minnesota.

title: Pay Board Getting Pier Pact Despite Defection by Labor
description: Thomas W. Gleason, president of the International Longshoremen's Association, said yesterday that his union still intended to submit its new contract for Federal Pay Board approval although three of the five labor leaders on the panel have quit the regulatory agency.

title: Hussein Under Fire
description: King Hussein's plan for a semiautonomous Palestinian state on the West Bank, linked to Jordan, has been attacked by Arab leaders as a sellout to Israel and by the Israelis as an obstacle to peace. Somebody must be mistaken.

title: Duvillard Wins Giant Slalom, Vanquishing Both Thoenis
description: PREDAZZO, Italy, March 22 (Al)  Henri Duvillard of France won the Five Nations giant slalom ski race today, clearly outdistancing the World Cup champion, Gustavo Thoeni of Italy.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 22One of the few compensations for a life sentence to Washington is the opportunity it affords to observe the circularity of history.

title: ELLIOT S. SCHATZKIN
description: INTERLAKEN, N. J., March 22Elliot S. Schatzkin, who had operated the Architectural Tiling Company in Keyport for many years until his retirement in 1956, died today at his home, 517 Bridlemere Avenue. He was 69 years old.

title: Renege on Elderly Charged
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (UPI)Senator Frank Church, Democrat of Idaho, charged today that the Nixon Administration had reneged on a promise to improve the lot of the elderly. Senator Church was particularly critical of an Administration proposal to raise Social Security payments by per centan amount he said would not keep up with increased living costs. He said the Administration had apparently decided to ignore major recommendations made at last year's White House Conference on Aging.

title: Grateful Dead, in Concert, Retain Their Magic Glow
description: The Grateful Dead play New York often enough so that one might reasonably expect some of the shine to have tubbed off their local appeal. But watching them and listening to them Tuesday night at the start of their soldout, twoweek engagement at the Academy of Music, I realized that the magic glow of the seminal San Francisco rock group was as strong as ever.

title: It's a feast that commemorates hunger.. it's a time of contradictions, of lavish dishes to reflect on days of oppression... it's the time that all the artistry of the Jewish cuisine comes to the fore.
description: MAYWOOD, N. J.The Seder, the Passover meal, is the culinary highpoint of the Jewish ritual year. But for the cook it is a paradoxical event, a feast that commemorates hunger, a banquet preparedand consumedat painstak, ing length in order to instruct the young about a hasty flight from Pharaoh's Egypt that forced Israelite housewives to forget about leisurely yeastbaking and rustle up matzoh on the double.

title: Weis and Aspromonte Cut From Active List by Reds
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 22 (AP) Two infielders, Al Weis and Bob Aspromonte, were cut by the Cincinnati Reds trom the active roster today.

title: CHURCH ACCUSED BY SOLZHENITSYN
description: MOSCOW, March 22The author Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, in a Lenten letter circulating in Moscow, has accused the Russian Orthodox Church of forsaking its flock and of being a tool of the atheist state.

title: New City Rule Bars Deceptive Ad Uses Of Review Quotings
description: The Department of Consumer Affairs has adopted a regulation barring the use of deceptive quotations in movie, theater and book advertisements.

title: Six Workers Hurt in Blast
description: BOSTON, March 22 (AP)Six construction workers were injured today when a propane gas cylinder plummeted eight stories at an airport tower construction site at Logan International Airport and exploded, according to eyewitnesses at the scene.

title: Commission Considers Reducing the Fixed Level in Steps
description: WASHINGTON, March 22William J. Casey, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, disclosed today that the commission is thinking of ending pricefixed commissions on large stock orders in two additional steps, in April, 1973, and April, 1974.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Navy Chaplain Is Defended By Sunday School Teacher
description: JACKSONVILLE, March 22 (AP)Two Navy wives, one a Sunday school teacher, came to the defense of a Navy chaplain today, testifying that one of two officer wives with whom he is accused of having sexual relations acted very aggresgive toward the chaplain.

title: Advertising:
description: Robert D. Campbell has been named publisher and Gibson McCabe has been returned to the presidency at Newsweek as part of a top management realignment aimed at continuing the forward momentum that has propelled Newsweek into position of leadership in the past decade.

title: Foe in Laos Is Reported to Hold 4 Points Overlooking Key Base
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 22 (Agence FrancePresse)  Four of the nine defense positions on the ridge overlooking the Long Tieng army base were reported in enemy hands today as heavy fighting continued for the fifth day.

title: DR. ROY D. DUCKWORTH
description: PONTE VEDRA, Fla., March 22Dr. Roy D. Duckworth, director emeritus of radiology of the White Plains Hospital and consulting roentgenologist of the New York Hospital's Westchester division, died Monday. He was 81 years old and lived here and in Westhampton Beach, L. I.

title: I.T.T. Employs 7,900 in Affiliates in Chile
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation employs about 7,990 workers In six chief affiliates in Chile.

title: Pan American Removes Halaby From Top Post, Names Seawell
description: Najeeb E. Halaby resigned as chairman and chief executive officer of Pan American World Airways yeSterday after the airline's board of directors gave him an ultimatum to quit or be dismissed.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Cashman Is Out as Rangers Face Bruins
description: The Boston Bruins nearly outmaneuvered themselves yesterday with an unsuccessful ploy to get Wayne Cashman, who was suspended for stickfighting, to play against the Rangers tonight.

title: CONFLICT IS DENIED IN HARLEM 4 DATA New Disclosure Backs Its View, Prosecution Says
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office asserted yesterday that the new information recently disclosed by the defense about the eightyearold Harlem Four case does not contradict the prosecution's caseas the defense has chargedbut, rather corroborates it.

title: DR. WILLIAM M. BRONSON
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., March 22  Dr. William M. Bronson, a physician for more than 30 years, died in New Rochelle Hospital this morning, apparently of a heart attack. His age was 59.

title: Books of The Times Add One Epiphany and Stir
description: DOWNSTREAM. Stories by Paul Brodeur. 206 pages. Atheneum. $6.95.

title: LENINGRAD INCIDENT IS PROTESTED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 22The United States has protested to the Soviet Government over the detention and forcible search of two assistant United States naval attaches in Leningrad last week, the State Department said today.

title: Senator Muskie's Day
description: Senator Edmund S. Muskie claims a solid victory the Illinois Democratic primary and former Senator Eugene McCarthy a significant achievement. The statements are as predictable as the results, but Mr. McCarthy's adjective is clearly more in need of modification than Mr. Muskie's.

title: Texts of Statements by A.F.L.C.I.O. Council, Pay Board and the White House
description: WASHINGTON, March 22Following are the texts statements by the A.F.L.C.I.O. Executive Council (as transmitted by United Press International) in connection with the resignation of three labor members from the Pay Board, by Judge George H. Boldt, chairman of the Pay Board. on behalf of the board's public members, and by Ronald L. Zeigler, White House press secretary (as transmitted by The Associated Press):

title: A Wine Lover's Night to Remember
description: The social phenomenon popularly known as the B.Y.O.B. Party soared to a new level of distinction the other evening at an extraordinary dinner staged by the Wine and Food Society of New York at Le Pavillon.

title: Floating Prime Splits Bankers
description: Two leading bankers presented differing views on the floating prime rate yesterday at the annual meetings of two major bankholding companies.

title: Theater: The Selling of the President
ITALY ARRESTS 2 IN MILAN INQUIRY
description: ROME, March 22A lawyer in Genoa and a woman student in Milan became today the first people to be arrested in the inquiry into the death of the leftwing millionaire publisher, Giangiacomo Feltrinelli. More arrest warrants were expected to be issued shortly.

title: Senate Votes to Broaden Waterfront Unit's Powers
description: ALBANY, March 22  The Senate approved today a controversial bill giving the Waterfront Commission broader powers to regulate the, handling of cargo end personnel in the Port of New York shipping area.

title: AUSTRALIA GAINS TENNIS SEMIFINAL
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, March 22 (A.P)AusValle swept into the semifinals of the women's Federation Cup tennis tournament with a 3.0 victory over Italy today before rain halted play for the third straight day.

title: Governor at Condon Funeral
description: YONKERS, March 22  A large delegation of state, county and city officials; headed by Governor Rockefeller, attended the funeral today of former State Senator William F. Condon, who died Sunday. A concelebrated mass of requiem was was sung here at the Roman Catholic Church of Christ the King. Also present were Lieut. Governor Malcolmn Wilson, Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz and Senate Minority Leader Joseph Zaretsky. Senator Condon was coauthor of the CondonWadlin Bill, which forbade strikes by municipal employes.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Appropriations. The President signed a bill providing $057.5million supplemental appropriations for unemployment compensation, student loans and claims against the Government for the fiscal year that ends June 30. The largest appropriation, $600million, is for advances to the

title: Equal Rights Amendment Is Approved by Congress
description: WASHINGTON, March 22The Senate passed the Equal Rights Amendment today, thus completing Congressional action on the amendment, which would prohibit discrimination based on sox by any law or action of any governmentFederal, state or local.

title: C. C.N.Y., at 125, Seeing change in Student Body
description: There are still no dormitories and most of the students still arrive by subway, though fewer carry their lunches in brown paper bags. The splendid gothic classroom buildings are still standing, a little grimier, and now joined by newer structurescolder and more modern.

title: Total Still a Record
description: WASHINGTON, March 22The oncezooming grOwth of investment in plant and equipment by foreign affiliates of United States corporations has begun to slow, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Preyveng Still Under Attack
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, March 22 (Reuters)  As Pnompenh observed a day of mourning today for the dead in yesterday's rocket and artillery attack, the Cambodian command reported that the besieged district capital of Preyveng, nearly 30 miles to the east, was under enemy attack for the third day.

title: Secret Police Agents Fight Corruption
description: About one out of every 13 policemen among the 925 assigned to arresting narcotics pushers and gamblers has been secretly recruited for another mission: providing top commanders with intelligence about any corrupt policemen in their ranks.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN Public Broadcasting Fund Gets House Unit's Approval
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (UPI)  The House Commerce Committee unanimously approved a bill today to authorize appropriations of up to $155 million over two years to Open. ate the Corporation for Public Broadcasting.

title: News Analysis Muskie Survives, and Then Some Heads For Wisconsin, a Likely Watershed, With Momentum
Columbia Asks Antitrust Waiver In. Subscription, Plan for Movies
description: The Justice Department will oppose a petition for the formation by the American Express Company, Columbia Pictures Industries and the Ely Landau Organization of their subscription plan of American Film Theater.

title: Oil Spill in Utah Blocked
description: Henrieville, Utah, March 22 (UPI)A 1,500gallon crude oil spill was blocked today by wood and straw dams before it flowed into the Colorado River near the Grand Canyon. The oil came from a tanker truck that overturned east of here Saturday and dumped into the Paria River, which runs into the Colorado near the beginning of its winding route through the Grand Canyon.

title: Chess: Olafsson Has an Easy Time In First Nordic Tournament
RIVA RIDGE TAKES FIRST 1972 START
description: MIAMI, March 22 (AP) Riva Ridge, this year's prime Kentucky Derby favorite, scored an easy twolength victory today over New Prospect in the $33,800 Hibiscus Stakes.

title: Aid to Handicapped
description: Easter seals provide help for nearly 300,000 handicapped children and adults. That help cannot be measured in terms of money. But it can be measured in terms of the human beings who are made useful, independent and certain of dignified Eves.

title: Air Jamaica Cancels Order For Two Lockheed Tristars
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation disclosed in its annual report yesterday that it bad lost another airline customer for its L1011 Tristar.

title: American League, In Shift, Approves, Sale of the Indians
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 22  The American League approved unanimously today the sale of the Cleve?and Indians to a group headed by Nick Mileti, who already operates the Cleveland Cavaliers of the National Basketball Association, the Cleveland Barons of the American Hockey League and the Cleveland Arena.

title: HARLEM AWAITS USE Of 1965 PLAN
description: Eight years ago, Harlem Community Board 10 arranged with the Columbia University School of Architecture for a neighborhoodrenewal study, that the board chairman said aimed at a substantially integrated Harlem based on excellence by 1975.

title: JURY DENIES CLAIMS IN JACKSON SHOOTING
description: BILOXI, Miss., March 22 (AP)  An allwhite jury rejected today all damage claims in the $13.8million suit against Mississippi highway patrolmen and Jackson policemen in connection with the May 15, 1970, shooting at the predominantly black Jackson State College, where two young Negroes were killed.

title: 8 Me in Peruvian Bus Crash
description: LIMA, Peru, March 23 (UPI) Eight persons were killed and 22 injured today when a bus plunged over a cliff at Cangallo, 225 miles southeast of Lima.

title: PullOut on Controls
description: The decision of the A.F.L.C.I.O. to withdraw its three members from the Pay Board is a destructive actas harmful to labor as it is to all other citizens. It cannot be allowed to wreck the joint effort of the Administration and Congress to check the ruinous wageprice spiral.

title: I.T.T. Is Accused of Having Tried to Influence U.S. Policies in Latin America
description: WASHINGTON, March 22The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation was depicted today as having sought to convince the White House not only to act against President Salvador Allende Gossens of Chile in 1970 but also to reappraise and strengthen United States policies in all Latin America.

title: Trial of Ailing Critic Of Saigon Regime Put Off Indefinitely
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 22Mrs. Ngo Ba Thanh, a leading critic of the Saigon Govemment and the war, who has been in prison and has been suffering asthmatic attacks for six months, was carried to military court in downtoWn Saigon on a stretcher today to face charges of having engaged in activities harmful to ,national security.

title: 4 Killed and 25 Are Hurt In Fire at Sloane House
description: Four persons were killed and at least 25 injured last night when a twoalarm fire swept through part. of the Y.M.C.A.'s Sloane House residence, on. West 34th Street.

title: Governor Appoints New Welfare Chief
description: ALBANY, March 22Governor Rockefeller today appointed Abe Lavine, director of the Office of Employe Relations, as the new Commissioner of Social Services.

title: Ailing Canonero II Coming To Belmont in MidApril
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 22 (AP)Canonero H, the sensation of thoroughbred racing last year, is going back to New York in midApril. The 4yearold stallion's ailments have failed to Heal enough for him to run in California.

title: BLACK CAUCUS HITS ANTIISRAELI VIEWS
description: WASHINGTON, March 22The Congressional Black Caucus has disassociated itself from a resolution to dismantle Israel that was passed last week at the National Black Political Convention in Gary, Ind.

title: Not Steel, but People
description: MR. JUSTICE [WILLIAM O.] DOUGLAS, dissenting.

title: Richardson Backs Nixon
description: Elliot L. Richardson, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, said yesterday that President Nixon's proposed antibusing legislation would produce more school integration, not less, by removing the cause of most resistance in towns and cities across the country.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: EMMETT JOYCE
description: Emmett Joyce, a designer of men's and women's clothing who had operated his own concern, Emmett Joyce, Inc., died Tuesday of a cardiac arrest at Roosevelt Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 222 West 77th Street.

title: Loyalty Day Proclaimed
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)  President Nixon today designated May 1 as Loyalty Day 1972 and asked Americans to pause as a nation to ask themselves how we can live our loyalty better.

title: Accounting Board Eases Rule Plans for Oil Units
description: Under heavy pressure from the oil industry, the Accounting Principles Board has softened considerably its proposed overhaul of the rules governing profitandloss reporting by petroleum producers.

title: SICKLE CELL FUND BACKED BY HOUSE
525 American Advisers and Trainers Teach Thais Counterinsurgency Role
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 22  American officials have disclosed that 525 United States military men are engaged in advising and training Thai troops in counterinsurgency operations in Thailand.

title: F.B.I. Agent Says He Supplied Explosives Manuals to Informer
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 22 Delmar Mayfield Jr., an agent for the Federal Bureau of Investigation, testified today that he supplied explosives manuals to a paid informer who lent them to one of the defendants in the Berrigan conspiracy case.

title: Advertising:
description: Buffalo Bob, who ended a 12year stint as Howdy Doody's TV pal in 1959, is still popular among the notsoyoungsters who were once his audience. But now he's playing the college campuses.

title: 2 More Convicts Recaptured
description: CINCINNATI, March 22 (AP) Two more of the 24 prisoners who escaped from the Hamilton County jail on Monday night were captured today. Fourteen remain at large.

title: INDIA SEEN HESITANT ON MEETING WITH U.S.
description: NEW DELHI, March 22Official sources said today that India was not eager to open a serious dialogue with either the United States or Pakistan. until the two countries recognized Bangladesh.

title: 3 LABOR LEADERS QUIT PAY BOARD; WHITE HOUSE SAYS ACTS OF A FEW CAN'T SABOTAGE INFLATION FIGHT
Saks Fifth Avenue Names Two New Vice Presidents
description: Saks Fifth Avenue announced yesterday the appointment of two new vice presidents and six general managers in charge of local stores.

title: History Demands Military Safeguards
description: WASRINGTONAll of us today certainly are concerned about the many serious internal needs which face our country. There is the critical task of improving the quality of our lives in terms of health, housing, education, control of drugs, and crime prevention, And there is still much to be done in the newly recognized area of preserving and controlling our environment, as well as the more traditional tasks of providing basic resources such as food and minerals for an increasing population.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Penn. Central, announcing the approval Tuesday by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority and the Connecticut Department of Transportation of its proposal to raise New Haven division fares by 20 per cent, said yesterday it had petitioned the Interstate Commerce Commission for approval of the increase.

title: Adelphi Bows in Lacrosse
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., March 22Brown University's lacrosse team defeated Adelphi, 53, today. Bob White, with two goals, paced Brown.

title: Notes on People
description: C. K. Yen, Vice President of Nationalist China for six years, and unopposed for a second term, was reelected in Taipei yesterday. Mr. Yen is also Premier, and it was expected that following the Presidential inauguration in May, when Chiang Kaishek begins his fifth sixyear Presidential term, Mr. Yen will resign as. Premier and turn that post over to Chiang Chingkuo, the President's elder son, who is now Deputy Premier. The 84yearold President Chiang is grooming his 62yearold son as his

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: LEGISLATORS SEEK ACCORD ON BUDGET
description: ALBANY, March 22Fiscal committees of the Legislature today began intensive, lastminute deliberations to firm up cuts and revisions in the Governor's nogrowth $7.9billion budget in an effort to come up with an acceptable bill In time for the start of the fiscal year, which begtns April 1.

title: Highlights of Marijuana Study
description: WASHINGTON, March 22The National Commission on Marijuana and Drug Abuse recommended today the following changes in existing Federal and state laws:

title: Bank Offers Bonus Passbook
description: Thhe Crocker Bank of San Francisco announced yesterday that it was again offering a oneyear passbook account that earns interest at 5 per cent per annum. The minimum initial deposit for opening an account is $500 and additional deposits may be made in amounts of $100 or or more. The bank said it has not offered the oneyear bonus passbook since last Jan. 1.

title: Watson Sees Pompidou
description: PARIS, March (AP)The United States Ambassador, Arthur K. Watson, conferred with Presidefit Pompidou today for 30 minutes yesterday. The only subject disclosed was Mr. Watson's congratulations for the recent series of major drug confiscations in southern France.

title: Vote by the French On Market Treaties Is Set for April 23
description: PARIS, March 22The Government has chosen April 23 as the date for its planned referendum, whose ramifications may well go beyond simple approval of treaties widening the European Common Market from 6 to 10 members.

title: U.S. Proposes Date for Soviet Talks
description: WASHINGTON, March 22The United States has proposed to the Soviet Union that negotiations to settle the multimillion dollar debt for lendlease aid during World War II begin in Washington early next month, a high Administration official said today.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Once there was a young artist whob decided to knit a sweater as a present for a friend's baby, but she didn't know how to knit. Her aunt showed her how to work knitting needles and how to follow a pattern. Now, a year and a half later, Lorraine Shuman is working with 20 colors and her designs include stripes, squares, triangles, hearts and bows. Each sweater is a mlange of patterns, and all are one of kind. In fact, the back and front of each isn't even the

title: Indians Confirm Some Troops Are Still in Bangladesh
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, March 22  Indian sources here confirmed today that Indian troops were helping Bangladesh forces in a drive against rebellious Mizo tribesmen in the Chittagong Hill Tracts area of southeastern Bangladesh.

title: Drug Projects Get Grants
description: Two grants totaling $122,227 have been awarded to two researchers to develop nonaddictive antagonist drugs as possible alternative to methodone for treating heroin addicts, Health Services Administrator Gordon Chase. announced yesterday. The funds go to Dr. Alfred M. Freedman and Dr. Max Fink of New York Medical College for one project and to Dynatech Corporation of Cambridge,. Mass.; for the other.

title: Changes in its Top Management A re Made at Kaiser Resources
description: New top officers were named yesterday by Kaiser Resources, Ltd. The company, a subsidiary of the Kaiser Steel Corporation, has since January been the center of controversy concerning stock dealings on Canadian exchanges by insiders, company officers and directors who might have had access to information not available to the public.

title: Agency Asking Broader Powers to Regulate Stock Processing
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)  The Securities and Exchange Commission asked Congress today for broad new powers to regulate stock processing and transfers, an area where the commission said many buyers lost money in 1969 and 1970.

title: Excerpts From the Report of National. Commission on Marijuana and Drug Abuse
description: WASHINGTON, March 22Following are excerpts from the report of the Nalional Commission on Marijuana and Drug Abuse released today.

title: Ulster's Leader Agrees to Put British Plans Before His Cabinet
description: LONDON, March 22After nearly 10 hours of hard bargaining with: Prime Minister Heath, Prime Minister Brian Faulkner of Northern Ireland agreed tonight, to present to his cabinet a series of proposals to end the crisis in the strifetorn province.

title: Thaler Case Goes to Jury After 3Week Trial Here
description: A jury continued its deliberations last night in the Federal court trial here of former State Senator Seymour R. Thaler and two codefendants on charges Of dealing in stolen securities.

title: Reid Motes to Democratic Party To Seek Reelection to Congress
description: Representative Ogden R. Reid took his liberal principles and his political ambitions into the Democratic party: yesterday.

title: Bridge: Team Led by Kaplan Is Upset In Play for the Vanderbilt Cup
description: CINCINNATI, March 23 One of the world's most powerful bridge teams was eliminated from the Vander bilt Cup play here in the small hours of this morning by a tiny margin in a stun ning upset. The event is the highlight of the American Contract Bridge League's spring nationals.

title: U.S. BARS CUBANS FROM FILM EVENT
description: The State Department has refused visas to four Cuban film directors, arousing new protests from critics of the Government's policy of deny ing entry to aliens because of their political views.

title: Local Labor Leaders Generally Support Decision to Leave the Pay Board
description: Labor officials at the local level here and in other parts of the country generally sup ported yesterday the decision of four labor members of the Pay Board to resign.

title: A Loneliness I Never Expected
description: Arranging for her funeral while she lay in a coma with death imminent was an activity I find hard to believe I went through. It was the last thing in the world I had ever wanted to do, but it had to be done, although I was still too dazed to fully comprehend the impact of losing the person in the world I loved most dearly.

title: 11 ARE RECIPIENTS OF POLK AWARDS
description: Courage and intelligence were cited as indispensable equipment of the good jour nalist by William Leonard, senior vice president of C.B.S. News and keynote speaker at tne 24th annual George Polk Awards luncheon, held yester day at the Roosevelt Hotel.

title: PENSION INCREASE WEIGHED BY PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 The Senate Finance Committee indicated today that it was lean ing toward sharp increases in Social Security benefits for those who have worked for many years at lowpaying jobs.

title: Provocation Charged
description: BRUSSELS, March 23France rejected tonight as totally un acceptable a set of compro mise proposals put forward by the European Economic Com munity's Executive Commission.

title: Executive Changes
description: Albert T. Sommers, 53 years old, vice president for eco nomic research, will become senior vice president and chief economist of the Con ference Board on July 1. He will replace Martin R. Gains brugh, 65, who will retire on that date after 33 years of service as the board's principal eco nomic spokesman. Also announced by Alexander T. Trow bridge, president of the New York  based business economic re search institution, were the following changes, effective May 1: Walter Hamilton, deputy assistant secretary of Commerce and executive director of the Commerce Depart ment's National Industrial Pollution Control Coun cil, will become vice president for public affairs re search at the Conference Board. John W. Kendrick, professor of economies at George Washington Uni versity, will become vice president for economic research at the board. And, Donald F. McMahon, vice president for public research affairs, will re sign but continue as a consultant in the public af fairs area.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Delmarva Power and Light Company filed yesterday with the Securities and Ex change Commission a rights offering of 1,118,041 common shares. The company has said it will use the proceeds to re duce outstanding short term notes which were issued, it was said, to finance a construction program. Common shareholders of record April 27 will be of fered the right to subscribe to one share for each ten shares held, with the offer scheduled to expire May 18. The stock closed yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange at 17 unchanged.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MILWAUKEE, March 23  Senator George McGovern said today that George C. Wallace's strong victory in the Florida primary last week represented an angry cry from the guts of ordinary Americans against a system which doesn't give a damn about what's really bothering people in this coun try today.

title: Do Women Want Equality? A Poll Says Most Now Do
description: In a sharp reversal from last year, most American women now favor the thrust for equality, according to the results of a women's opinion poll made public here yesterday.

title: Hussein Seeking to Quiet Arabs' Clamor Over Plan
description: AMMAN, Jordan, March 23 King Hussein sought today to calm a storm of criticism in the Arab world against his proposal for a united Arab kingdom involving federation status for Palestinians in the West Bank territory of Jordan, occupied by Israel since 1967.

title: Elizabeth Marshall Gives Piano Recital Of 6 Works by Liszt
description: Elizabeth Marshall, a pianist who has appeared here previ ously, came to Carnegie Recital Hall on Wednesday night to play music by Liszt. Her rela tively brief program consisted of six of the bestknown works  two Concert Etudes (La Leggierezza and Un Sos piro), a Paganini Etude (La Campanella), Les Fundr allies, Au bord d'une source and the Sonata in B minor.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: INDIANAPOLIS, March 23 Indiana's Democratic Presi dential preference primary on May 2 will be a threeway race involving Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota, Sena tor Edmund S. Muskie of Maine and Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The New York and American Stock Exchanges this week is sued their latest reports on changes in stock ownership by major stockholders, directors and officers of listed companies. The reports included the fol lowing:

title: UNEMPLOYED RATE CLIMBS IN STATE
description: ALBANY, March 23The state's unemployment rate reached a nineyear high in February, with 545,000 work ers, or 6.7 per cent of the work force, without jobs, the State Labor Department reported to day.

title: S. AFRICAN TEAM WINS IN TENNIS
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, March 23 (AP)  South Africa, the No. 3 seeded team, upset France, No. 6, 21, today to advance to the semifinals of the Women's Federation Cup tennis tourament with teams from the United States, Britain and Australia.

title: Prosecution Rests in Berrigan Trial
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 23  The Government rested its conspiracy case against the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan, and six other antiwar activists today after authenticating letters that discussed a plot to kidnap Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser onnational se curity affairs, and blow up heating tunnels in Washington.

title: GREEN TABLE GIVEN BY JOFFREY BALLET
description: Devoid of sentimentality and slickness, The Green Table, Kurt Jooss's 40yearold anti war ballet, remains a great work of the theater and a unique dance statement. It is the sole survivor of the Ger man expressionist dance style of the 1920's and 1930's that was able to enter the interna tional repertory and weather fashion in both technique and content.

title: Senate Votes to Ease the Law On Equal Time for Candidates
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 The Senate voted today to re veal that tart of the communi cations law that requires broad casters to offer equal time to all Presidential and VicePresi dential candidates.

title: JAPANESE ACCUSED ON CADMIUM PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (AP)  The Treasury Depart ment moved today to assess additional customs duties on cadmium imports from Japan.

title: BUDDY MILES HEARD IN A ROCK PROGRAM
description: Buddy Miles has never quite hit his stride as a pop per former. A fairtomiddlin' sing er, he does not have a voice that is really distinctive enough to let him do a standup vocal act. A good drummer whose styles range from jazz to rock and blues, he rarely has defined just exactly what it is he wants to do.

title: MONEY EXPANSION SHOWS A SPURT
description: The rate of monetary expan sion spurted upward in recent weeks, the Federal Reserve System reported yesterday.

title: N.B.A. ACTS TO CURB PLAYER SWITCHES
description: A resolution designed to stop players from jumping between the National Basketball Asso ciation and the American Basketball Association was adopted by the N.B.A.'s Board of Governors here yesterday.

title: Koosman Impressive
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., March 23  Jerry Koosman, continu ing his fight to retain a spot in the Mets' starting rotation, gave his most impressive per formance of the spring today with six innings of sixhit ball while the Mets were thrashing the Philadelphia Phillies, 83.

title: BroadwayHale Names Aide
description: Eaton W. Ballard has been named executive vice president of BroadwayHale Stores, Inc. Mr. Ballard, who joined the West Coast department store chain in 1947, has been a vice president since 1960.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MILWAUKEE, March 23 Gov. George C. Wallace of Ala bama repeatedly stressed the need for tax reform today as he began his bid for support in the Democratic Presidential pri mary on April 4.

title: NameChange Vote Set
description: The Texas Gulf Sulphur Com pany, at its annual meeting April 27, will vote to change its name to Texas Gulf, Inc.

title: 5 City Hotels to offer Films on Pay TV
description: Pay Television will get its first major test in New York this summer when TransWorld Communications, the closed circuit division of Columbia Pictures Industries, installs its Tele/Theater system in five ho tels here. They are the Plaza, the Essex House, the City Squire, the New York Shera ton and the St. Regis Sheraton.

title: NICKLAUS, CASPER AMONG 5 IN LEAD
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 23 Jack Nicklaus and Billy Casper finished all even in an informal crawfish eating contest last night. Then, in the first round of the $125,000 Greater New Orleans open today, the friend ly golfing rivals were even again as each put together a 66 in a fiveway tie for the lead.

title: Language Law Voided
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (AP) The Supreme Court struck down today by a 5to2 vote a Georgia law that makes the use of bad language in the presence of another person a crime. The ruling, written by Justice William J. Brennan Jr., said that the Georgia law violated the Federal guarantee of freedom of speech because it was too vague.

title: State Department Denies Any Move to Block Allende
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 The State Department said to day that the Nixon Administra tion had firmly rejected any ideas of blocking the inaugura tion of Salvador Allende Gos sens as President of Chile in 1970, or of subsequently oust ing him.

title: Car Sales for MidMarch Rose on DailyRate Basis
description: DETROIT, March 23Sales of American type cars in midMarch were 216,726, or 27,091 in each of the period's eight selling days. This was up 2 per cent from an averageof 26,457 sales per day last year, when 238,111 cars were delivered in nine selling days. But midMarch car sales were not particularly impressive; they have run well above this year's figure in four of the last seven years.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor.

title: Sports of The Times
description: ISLAMORADA, Fla., March 23On the raucous main land, ballplayers were taking strike votes, their owners were saying strike and be damned, George Wallace was taking bows like a matador who had won both ears and the tail, and the papers were loud about the straw vote against forced busing of school children, but on the motley waters of Florida Bay was a peace above all striving. Florida Bay, in Everglades National Park, is the shallow sea between the Florida peninsula proper and the scimitarcurve of the keys. Capt. Eddie Wightman, who has lived all but the first few months of his life here, was going to show a visitor around this back country.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH. DRINK DEWAR'S. William Lawson's 86.8 Proof Blended Scotch Whiskies. Imported by ?? & Lord Ltd.. ?? N. Y.Advt.

title: COLUMBIA, N.Y.U. GAIN IN FENCING
description: CHICAGO, March 23  Co lumbia and New York Univer sity, which tied for the team championship last year, each advanced all three of their fencers into tomorrow's second round of the National Collegi ate Athletic Association's fenc ing championship. The three day meet is being held at the University of Illinois at Chi cago Circle.

title: From Shimmying to Standing on Your HeadWays of Shaping Up
description: A few years back, every body was opening a boutique; now the exercise studio is the thing.

title: Sabres. Stars Tie, 44
description: BUFFALO, March 23 (UPI) Danny Lawson nut a 15footer pastn Cesare Maniago with 2:34 left as the Buffalo Sabres gained a 44 tie tonight with the Min nesota North Stars.

title: Bobby Allison Gains Pole
description: HAMPTON, Ga., March 23 (UPI)Bobby Allison of Huey town, Ala., drove his Chevrolet to a qualifying record today to take the pole position for Sun day's $113,000 Atlanta 500 stock car race. Allison covered the 1mile oval at an average speed of 156.245 miles an hour to break the previous record for cars running with restrictors on their carburetors, set last August by Buddy Baker.

title: Cosmos 479 Orbiting
description: MOSCOW, March 23 (AP)  The Soviet Government launched its 479th unmanned Cosmos satellite today, Tass, the Soviet news agency, an nounced. It said it was operat ing normally. The announce ment said Cosmos 479 carries scientific instruments for con tinued space exploration.

title: Westchester Democrats Endorse Reid
description: Representative Ogden R. Reid, who quit the Republican party on Wednesday, won the unani mous endorsement of the Westchester County Democratic executive committee last night to seek his sixth term.

title: Weekly U. S. Assessments
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 The State Department said to day that the United States would be making a continuous assessment each week to de termine whether or not the Communist delegations in Paris were prepared to negotiate seriously.

title: Advertising:
description: Chiquita Banana will hit the comeback trail next month.

title: An Old Chinese Custom
description: China is  la mode in current Amer ican history but it is doubtful if Presi dent Nixon or any of his entourage brought back from their Peking Picnic even a hint of an old Chinese custom certainly abandoned by the Maoist re gime. This is the habit of punishing those who seek anonymously to charge others with wrongdoing and of refus ing to punish those so charged, even if guilty, because their accusers pre ferred to remain unknown.

title: Credit Markets
description: Interest rates settled into a narrowly mixed pattern yester day with little inclination to recede or to climb.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: SUGAR, THE NEW MUSICAL COMEDY Seats Now Majestic Thea., W. 44. (Advt.)

title: WOODCOCK ASSAILS CURBS AS UNFAIR
description: DETROIT, March 23 The president of the United Auto Workers, Leonard Woodcock, quit the Pay Board today, join ing three leaders in the Ameri can Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Or ganizations yesterday.

title: Long Tieng Battle Continues
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 23 (AP)  Informed sources re ported today that North Viet namese forces were bringing up tanks to help them in their current attack on Long Tieng, the hardpressed army base nearly 80 miles northeast of Vientiane. The battle for the base began six days ago.

title: Open Primaries Ordered by Connecticut Democrats
description: HARTFORD, March 23The state Democratic party in Connecticut today ordered the party organizations in three cities and a town to hold open, direct primary elections to se lect delegates for the state con vention, which will in turn select delegates for the Demo cratic National Convention in Miami Beach in July.

title: Judge Asked to Defer Detroit Bus Case Move
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (AP)The Justice Depart ment asked a United States District Court judge today to defer action in the Detroit school desegregation case until Congress acts on Presi dent Nixon's request for a temporary moratorium on courtordered busing.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Amateur Wrestlers Fill Hall Tonight
description: With no need of boxoffice help from pro idols like Go rilla Monsoon and Beautiful Bobby, tickets are just about sold out for tonight's amateur wrestling extravaganza be tween American and Russian allstars at Hofstra Univer sity.

title: WEST BANK LEADER IS SEIZED BY ISRAEL
description: JERUSALEM, March 23 The Israeli military government on the occupied West Bank of Jordan arrested the political leader of the Nablus District today, accusing him of collab orating with Palestinian guer rilla organizations in an effort to sabotage next week's sched uled municipal elections.

title: SHOP TALK
description: When it says it's offering Paris fashions at a price, Lord & Taylor isn't kidding. A polka  dotted Givenchy dress with a sailor collar at $52, a Chanel suit at $130, an Ungaro raincoat at $60 these are typical of the styles and prices in the Parl siennes collection that went do sale yesterday.

title: FILLEY CAST JOINED
description: Thanks to Covent Garden, whose production of La Fine du regiment was imported virtually whole, the Metropoli tan Opera is enjoying a crazy success with the Donizetti comedy. We don't see an inten tionally comical Met production every day, and this one not only is staged with an apt Gil bert & Sullivan touch but is a voice fan's dream as well.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: NASHVILLE, March 23 (AP) The Tennessee House of Representatives approved today by 70 to 0 ratification of the amendment and sent it to the Senate.

title: Seminoles Oust N. Carolina in 7975 Upset
description: LOS ANGELES, March 23 The University of California, Los Angeles moved almost rou tinely onward in quest of its sixth straight National Collegi ate basketball championship tonight by beating Louisville, 9677, in the semifinals of the N.C.A.A. tournament.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: High Court Rules Debtors Are Entitled to a Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (AP)The Supreme Court ruled 7 to 0 today that debtors whose bank accounts have been at tached without a hearing may use an old civil rights law against their creditors.

title: Prices Climb on Amex and Counter List
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthe counter market moved sharply higher yesterday in increased trading.

title: WOODCOCK LEAVES
description: WASHINGTON, March 23  President Nixon, assailing labor leaders who quit the Pay Board as selfish and irresponsible, reconstructed the board today as a single public unit.

title: MARGARET DALE, LONG AN ACTRESS
description: Margaret Dale, a former lead ing lady with John Drew, George Arliss and E. H. Sothern who later played character roles on Broadway until her re tirement 25 years ago, died yes terday in Roosevelt Hospital. She was 96 years old and lived, at 310 West 79th Street.

title: Market Place: Big Company's Small SpinOff
description: What happens when a com pany discovers it has a fine product that it cannot mar ket effectively?

title: Merger News
description: The Singer Company an nounced yesterday that it has agreed in principle to acquire the Mitchell Corporation of Mo bile, Ala., and nine affiliated companies for Singer common stock. Terms were not an nounced, but trade sources esti mated the value of the acquisi tion at well over $10million.

title: Madison Fund Stock Price Is Discussed
description: In a hostile mood because of the sharp drop in their stock, shareholders of the Madi son Fund, Inc., questioned its president for two hours at the annual meeting here yesterday.

title: Susannah Returns To the City Opera With New Staging
description: Last fall's new production of Carlisle Floyd's Susannah is back again at the City Opera, restaged by Patrick Bakman and with three new singers in the leading roles. As seen at the second performance, on Wednesday night, Mr. Bakman's direction seemed much smooth er and tighter than the original, craftily minimizing the cruder aspects of the action (Susan nah's bathing scene is now totally left to the imagination), while sharply focusing on the twists that lead the heroine to her downfall.

title: Children Happen to Things At the Museum of Art's Fair
description: The Children's Art Carni val occupies the dividing line between Wonderland and Harlem. More precisely, it sits at the junction of St. Nicholas Avenue, 141st Street and the rainbow.

title: St. John's Audience Sees Acupuncture
description: A Chinese acupuncture specialist demonstrated yes terday what he called his gentle art for a half hour to 550 awestruck laymen who jammed the de Andreis ?? of St. John's Uni versity in Jamaica, Queens.

title: TOP STATE MEDIATOR JOINS RACING TALKS
description: Negotiations between the striking Independent Associa tion of Mutuel Employes and the New York Racing Associa tion assumed a new phase yes terday when Vincent D. McDon nell, chairman of the State Mediation Board, conferred with both sides at his office at 270 Broadway.

title: Racial Bias Charged at Washington Post
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 Following nearly seven weeks of unsuccessful quiet negotia tions with the management of The Washington Post, seven black reporters filed a com plaint with the Equal Employ ment Opportunity Commission today charging the newspaper with discrimination against blacks in its employment prac tices. Commission sources said they believed this was the first such action against a major newspaper.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Federal Court test of the State Social Service Com missioner's ruling that denies the use of Medicaid funds for abortions except for medical reasons began yesterday in Brooklyn on behalf of Mrs. Elizabeth Linda Klein of West Babylon, L. I., and all other similarly situated women in Suffolk and Nassau Counties.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., March 23 As the deadline for with drawal from the Presidential primary here passed tonight, election officials placed 12 Democrats and three Republi cans on the ballot for the May 16 election.

title: A Key Knapp Figure Indicted for Bugging
description: Theodore Ratnoff, the elec tronics expert and informer who played a key role in the Knapp Commission's inquiry into po lice corruption, was indicted here yesterday by a Manhattan grand jury on charges of grand larceny, conspiracy, bribery and 36 counts of illegal eavesdrop ping.

title: BILL WOULD HELP THE MENTALLY ILL
description: ALBANY, March 23  The Senate today approved a re vision of the state's 45yearold Mental Hygiene Law designed to strengthen the civil rights of mental patients and provide greater protection for their property.

title: STATE'S TOP COURT UPHOLDS LEGALITY OF OFFTRACK BETS
description: ALBANY, March 23The Court of Appeals upheld today the state's Offtrack Betting Law, finding that reasonably fair compensation is being provided to the racetrack owners.

title: News of Skiing
description: Barbara Ann Cochran, the bouncy little blonde who re cently gave the Americans their first Winter Olympic skiing gold medal since Mrs. Andrea Mead Lawrence earned two golds in 1952, came to New York yesterday to help the productive New York City Committee of the United States Ski Team Fund in its moneyraising ef forts. The 21 year  old Miss Cochran was accompanied by her older and much taller sister, Marilyn, who, with her brother Bob, also was a member of the 1972 Olympic squad.

title: U.S. CALLS A HALT TO PARIS PARLEYS ON VIETNAM WAR
description: PARIS, March 23The United States declared an in definite suspension of the Paris peace conference on Viet nam today.

title: P.O.W.'s Secondary, Hanoi Says

In spite of oft expressed reservations about the amendment's oversim plified form, we are glad of its approval and hope it will enjoy swift ratification by the states.

The change will help teams in their running, passing and kickingand will eliminate one of the keys employed by some teams which use zone defenses.

Gleason, presi dent of the Internationl Long shoremen's Association, and Harry Bridges, head of the In ternational Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Union, met here yesterday to discuss mat ters of mutual interest, includ ing the possibility of a nation wide dock strike against ad verse Pay Board rulings.

title: Sudan Appears at Peace After Long, Fierce War
description: WAU, the Sudan, March 14 The sounds of drums and chanting drifted over this provincial capital in the Southern Sudan from grass hut encampments on the out skirts. Black warriors, paint ed and armed for battle, brandished spears and stirred up clouds of red dust as they stomped with bare feet.

description: BRUSSELS, Friday, March 24, (Reuters)  European Com mon Market farm ministers agreed today on a package deal including higher prices for the coming year coupled with an ambitious program to modernize agriculture in the European Economic Com munity.

description: To the Editor:

description: WASHINGTON, March 23  After two days of testimony about the effects of televised violence on children and what can be done about it, the top executives of the three major commercial television networks had a chance to present their views in the hearing room to day.

description: YONKERS, March 23  When Muncy Boy outpaced Eyredale by a head in the ninth race at Yonkers Raceway last night, there were as many cheers for the man who drove the 8yearold chestnut gelding as there were for the horse.

title: Erim Leaves U.S. for Turkey
description: Premier Nihat Erim of Tur key left New York for home last night after a fiveday United States visit that included discussions with President Nixon, Secretary of Defense Melvin Laird and Secretary of State William P. Rogers.

description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 23 (UPI) The Israeli mission to the United Nations today denounced the resolution of the Human Rights Commis sion accusing Israel of commit ting war crimes in the occupied Arab territories.

title: Basis of Nixon Pupil Aid Shift Doubted
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 Authorities both in and out of the Government said today that there was no new evidence to show that putting additional money into slum schools would significantly increase the edu cational achievement of poor minority students.

title: Coaches See Future of Basketball and Most Feel It might Work
description: LOS ANGELES, March 23 A preview of college bas ketball of the future was given in a test game before an audience of about 100 coaches last night. Baskets were a foot higher (11 feet), a 30second clock prevailed and there were virtually no oneshot fouls.

title: Bruins Beat Rangers, 41, Increase Lead to 7 Points
description: BOSTON, March 23An im probable 170foot goal by Bobby Orr while the New York Rangers had a twoman advan tage and left their net unguard ed sealed a 41 victory for the Boston Bruins tonightand probably first place as well.

title: SENATE TO ASSIST GRAVEL IN COURT
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 The Senate, in a case growing out of Senator Mike Gravel's publication of the secret Pen tagon study of the Vietnam war, decided today to challenge the executive branch before the Supreme Court on the scope of Congressional immunity un der the Constitution.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 0.8 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 115.0 from 114.2 last week.

title: Green Reports Wide Asian Concern Over Aid Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, March 23  Assistant Secretary of State Marshall Green said today that his recent tour of 13 Asian and Pacific countries had con vinced him that countries in the area were more concerned about a Congressional mood opposing foreign aid than about President Nixon's trip to China.

title: 25 Held in Gambling Raids Across State
description: Syndicate feeder lines in bookmaking and loansharking that took in more than $50 million a year were disclosed yesterday after a series of co ordinated statewide raids by the state's organized crime task force and county district at torneys.
