title: Open Trials Begin May 22
description: New York area qualifying for the United States Open golf championship will be held May 22 and 23 at 57 locations, with regional tests at 32 sites June 5 and 6, the United States Golf Association said yesterday.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTON  The exasperation and sense of being used had been building for months. At the State De partment, the Pentagon and the White House, a consensus had developed that the sterile and stalemated Paris peace talks were serving the enemy's pur poses far more than those of the Unit ed States or South Vietnam.

title: Mrs. Charing Has a Son
description: RIVER VALE, N.J., March 25A son was born Feb. 25 to Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Charing at the Pascack Val ley Hospital in Westwood. Mr. Charing is market re search brand manager for the Leeming/Pacquin Divi sion of Pfizer, Inc.

title: The leading man in the pageant of 20thcentury literature
description: Hugh Kenner's The Pound Era could as well known as the Kenner era, for there is no critic who has more firmly established his claim to valuable literary property than has Kenner to the first three decades of the 20th century in England. Author of previous studies of Joyne, T. S.

title: Some Tips About the Making of a President
description: LEONIA  In directing President Nixon's New Jer sey campaign for reelection, Governor Cahill would do well to study Marvin Kit man's research and writings on George Washington as this country's greatest poli tician and ponder his own campaign for the Presidency in 1964.

title: Aussies' Stacked Cats Spoil U.S. Bid
description: SORRENTO, AustraliaIf you want to know how the Australians feel about com ing in second so often in the America's Cup, ask the Amer icans who traveled to Aus tralia last month and chal lenged the Aussies for the Little America's Cup (Class C catamarans).

title: Mrs. Barbara Levy Rosenstein Married
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 25 Mrs. Barbara Levy Rosen stein and Thomas Evans Thompson, both of Philadel phia, were married here this morning in the Latham Hotel. Judge Leo M. Weinrott of Common Pleas Court per formed the ceremony.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: City College Protest Ends After 3Hour Conference
description: A dozen representatives of ChineseAmerican, black and Puerto Rican student organiza tions at City College who had occupied Goethels Hall for two days turned the building back over to the college's adminis tration yesterday.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: The View From ThirdClass: Absorbing and Being Absorbed by India
description: The travelogue cliche for a large and varied country like India is kaleidoscopic, but like most clichs, it captures only part of the truth while it begs the rest. Tourists usually look, through the kaleidoscope; Fergus M. Bordewich, a 24yearold. New York writer, became one of the moving pieces, living almost entirely as the Indians do. This is the first of a twopart report on his experience.

title: BRITISH MINISTER FLIES TO BELFAST FOR DAY OF TALKS
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 25 William Whitelaw, the new British Secretary of State for Northern Ireland, flew here this morning for an all day visit with military, police and civil service officials.

title: Albee to Direct in Hamptons
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I.Who's afraid of summer theater? Not Edward Albee, and not Richard Barr, his friend and the producer of his plays, for both have just signed to direct the John Drew Summer Theater here for eight weeks, starting July 12.

title: Jocelyn Keith Wed to D. C. Taylor
description: Miss Jocelyn Deborah Keith, daughter of Mrs. Jocelyn Freer Keith of Wash ington and Norman Clinton Keith of New York, East Hampton, L. I., and San Juan, P. R., was married here yesterday afternoon to Doug las Campbell Taylor, son of Mr. and Mrs. Vernon Frank Taylor Jr. of Denver.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: REVIVAL: Revival (Kama Sutra, 2047) Built around strong two, three and four part harmonies, this new group touches more bases than the countryrock which dominates the album. There are two beautiful balladsI Was, You Were and Words No. 1and an exciting pop jazz number, Barbara. Mi chelle Conway's gutsy vocal solo on the latter serves as much as a musical instru ment as the coneyor of the lyrics.

title: 5 Killed in HeadOn Crash
description: MARIETTA, Ohio, March 25 (UPI)Five persons were killed today when two automobiles collided headon on Ohio 60 north of here and burst into flames. The victims were iden tified as Ronnie L. Stark, 19 years old, and Steve Fortney, 17, both of Marietta; Randall B. Perkins, 22, Karen M. Duley, 22, and Sharon McFee, 27, all of Parkersburg, W.Va.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Two Answers to Ed Bullins
description: BECAUSE Ed Bullins has refused to talk to me, and has taken his prob lems and feelings to the press before any discus sion between the two of us occurred; and because Bul lins' statements have forced many critics to review the controversy surrounding The Duplex rather than the play itself; and because the integ rity of more than one black artist is called into question, I am forced to respond to the attacks leveled against me on this page last Sunday.

title: Students in the elementary schools Grow tip suffering from asthma. Plants wither and dia. The birds around Mount Fuji Are decreasing in number. They no longer Visit the town.
description: TOKYO.

title: A Look Back In Sorrow And Pity
description: TOWARD the middle of the second half of The Sorrow and The Pity (Le Chagrin et La Piti), Marcel Ophuls' 4hour documentary now at the Beekman Theater, the director interviews Madame Solange, a beautician in ClermontFerrand, a woman who may or may not be younger than she looks, which is the drab but neat 60 of someone who pays no at tention whatsoever to chic. During the Nazi occupation, she had minded her own business and had been a P tainist, but not because she was Catholic or especially po litical. She was simply fond of the old marshal, the hero of Verdun who, at France's fall in 1940, had made his country the gift of his per son as the Nazi puppet pre mier.

title: Average Housing values in Hudson County Lowest in Area
description: A county in one of the na tion's fastestgrowing states, Hudson, just across the river from Manhattan, was the only one in New Jersey to lose population during the 1960's.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Gail Susan Baum Engaged to Joel Sheriff
description: STAMFORD, Conn., March 25The engagement of Miss Gail Susan Baum to Joel Sheriff, son of Mrs. Saul Sheriff of New York and the late Mr. Sheriff of Portland, Me., has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Seymour I. Baum of Stamford.

title: Philippines Defaults
description: MANILA, March 25 (Reuters) The Philippines has defaulted to South Korea in its Davis Cup tennis elimination match, the Philippines Tennis. Association said today.

title: Impending Ruling by U. S. Judge Promises Hope for the Neglected in Mental Institutions Around Country
description: After more than a century of neglect, thousands of mentally disabled citizens, once doomed to lives of deprivation and hopelessness in public mental institutions around the coun try, are expected to find new hope in a decision to be handed down by a Federal district judge in Alabama in the next week or two.

title: School Board Issues a Black Anthology
description: Unable to find an anthology of black literature suitable for junior and senior high school, the city's Board of Education has taken the unusual step of publishing its own.

title: 6 G.I. S CONVICTED IN CAMP DISORDER
description: WASHINGTON, March 25  A series of military trials stem ming from a riot by prisoners at Fort Gordon, Ga., has result ed in the conviction of six enlisted men on riot charges.

title: Treatments for Trees
description: The most important treatment for in fectious diseases of foliage caused by fungi is a preventive spray at bud break. This should be followed by a second and third treatment at 710 day Intervals. In the case of tip blight of pine it is pru dent to prune out infected parts as a supplement to spraying. Pruning should be done, when branches are dry, Among the effective fungicides are ferbans, thi ram and zineb. The usual dosage rate is 1 pounds of the 75% wettable powder in 100 gallons of water (approximately 1  tablespoons per gallon). Read the label on package carefully.

title: Wayne College Plans A PeaceScience Course
description: WAYNE  Students who don't want to study war no more have come up with an alternate study  peace sci ence.

title: Government Should Be the Employer of First Resort
description: ON July 12, 1971, Richard Nixon became the first President since Franklin D. Roosevelt to sign a general public  employment law: the Emergency Employment Act, which calls for an investment of $2.25billion in the creation of 150,000 publicservice jobs. Nixon had vetoed a similar measure only eight months earlier, with appropriate conservative scorn for Rooseveltian W.P.A.type jobs; in retrospect, his sudden fond ness for his own W.P.A. program can be interpreted as having been a portent of his dramatic conversion or opportunistic accommodationto Democratic party Keynesianism. That came a month later, in August, with the wageprice freeze. And then in the last few months there have even been unconfirmed reports, usually described as coming from the Presi dent's chief economic adviser, Treas ury Secretary John Connally, that the Administration is going to come up with an even more sweeping, New Dealtype, program.

title: Kerr on Black Visions
description: BLACK VISIONS, a program of four one acters put together by the Public Theater and offered for a limited en gagement in its new store front Annex across Lafayette Street, isn't intended as a showcase for performers as much as for playwrights, but the first and most obvious thing to be said about it is that Gloria Foster's work in the opening monologue is as breathtaking as anything the American theater can come up with just now.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: Front Page 2 No Title

title: POWER SETS RECORD IN DISTANCE RELAY
description: Matt Centrowitz ran a 4 minute13.9second mile an chor leg as Power Memorial clocked 10:17.9 in winning the distance medley yesterday at the 21st annual Fordham Prep Relays.

title: MODERATES HAIL ULSTER PROPOSAL
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 25The voice of mod eration in Northern Ireland Spoke up today at the second annual conference of the Al liance party, one of the few parties here with both Protes tant and, Catholic members.

title: Priscilla Griffiths Is Married on Coast
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., March 25Miss Priscilla Ann Grif fiths, a teacher of Spanish in Woodside, was married here this afternoon to William Bailey Russel, a Ph.D. candi date at Stanford University, from which the bride re ceived an M.A. degree.

title: Public Hearings Set By State Legislature And by Council Unit
description: Following are public hearings and open meetings scheduled for this week by committees of the State Legislature and the City Council. The legislative ses sion will be in the General Don ovan Building in Buffalo. The City Council hearings will be conducted on the second floor of City Hall here.

title: Life at Sea Fans Desire In Dropouts
description: During the latter part of 1967, a Juvenile Court judge in Florida asked his sailing buddy, Robert A. Rosof, if he would mind taking two boys who were wards of his court on a sea voyage aboard an oceanographic research ship.

title: Nicklaus and Casper Share TwoStroke Lead With 207's in New Orleans Golf
New York
description: Who's in charge here?

title: The World
description: SAIGON The Americans and their South Vietnamese, Laotian and Cam bodian allies are fighting three dif ferent ground wars these days. The North Vietnamese are fighting one, in three different places. And last week American analysts here, trying to make sense of it all, were saying that the Communists might be concentrat ing their attacks in Laos and Cam bodia because it is easier for them to succeed there now than it is in South Vietnam.

title: The Stoned Apocalypse
description: This selfcentered charmer tells how he took all the late sixties trips  Gurdjieff, scien tology, LSD, consciousness and relaxation, Jesus, sex  and how he finally came back to New York after a stint as at tendant in a psycho ward. Everywhere he goes he con verts, a kind of Johnny Apple seed of the soul, making girls and boys along the way. Vassi has a genuine narrative gift. Despite his protestations that he was only trying to Find Him self he is anything but a naif.

title: NATIONS PLEDGE AID TO SOUTHERN AFRICA
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 25Eighteen member nations paid or pledged amounts totaling $892,960 this week for aid to the peoples of southern Africa on the oc casion of the International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination.

title: PENTAGON PUSHING BUGGING DEVICES
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 The United States has invited the 14 other members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organi zation to view a demonstration of the electronic bugging of battlefields and military instal lations.

title: AMIN CANCELS ORDER FOR ISRAELI ARMS
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, March 25 (AP)  President Idl Amin canceled today all armaments orders placed with Israel and directed that work stop imme diately on a number of Israeli construction projects here.

title: Listening in on Radio Free Europe The Station That Fulbright Wants to Shut Down
description: MUNICH.

title: Dispute Over Stock Selection
description: There has been a long standing conflict between the inside out and the outside in approaches to stock se lection. Advocates of the first approach look only at indi vidual stocks although how they decide which ones to look at tends to remain a mystery. The outsidein method starts with an over all view of the stock and bond markets and then tries to discover the attractive areas for investment. Ana lysts are then asked to in vestigate more fully individ dal issues in these attractive areas.

title: Miss Eleanor F. Trevor Is Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Bronson Trevor of New York, Mill Neck, L. I., and Paul Smiths, N.Y., have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Eleanor Fisher Trevor, to Charles Steele von Stade Jr., son of Mrs. von Stade of Ballytore, County Kildare, Ireland, and Lieu tenant von Stade, who was killed in World War II while serving with the Army in Germany.

title: PenalReform Coalition Seeks Community Help
description: TRENTONA broadbased coalition of religious, civic and legal groups wants the state to involve local com munities in penal reform.

title: Auto Show, With Something for All, Opens Saturday
description: Cars of all kindssleek luxury vehicles that only a millionaire could afford, crazy contraptions that only an eccentric could want and a moon car from the space program that only an astro naut could drive and standard modelswill go on display Saturday when the Interna tional 16th Automobile Show opens its nineday run at the New York Coliseum.

title: Remote Town Gets Health Care From Medical School Students
description: HATCH, N.M., March 25A group of students at the Uni versity of New Mexico School of Medicine believe that they have come up with an answer to a problem that has long plagued health plannersget ting medical assistance to re mote, isolated areas.

title: The Nation
description: MILWAUKEE  The Illinois Demo cratic Presidential primary last Tues day was a little like a serene teapot amid the electoral tempests of 1972.

title: Towns Face Problems in Pollution Fight
description: CASTLETON  ON  HUDSON, N. Y., March 25The $1.2bil lion environmental bond issue proposed by state officials and endorsed in principle by lead ing environmental groups is fac ing an uncertain future because of the feeling in small towns like this one.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: SAN FRANCISCOIncreas big numbers of California homeowners make out their monthly mortgage checks to R. H. Lapin & Co., Inc., of San Francisco. If Raymond H. Lapin, sole owner of the company, has his way, mort gagors throughout the coun try will be doing the same.

title: SOVEREIGN BILL WINS IN ENGLAND
description: DONCASTER, England, March 25 (AP)Edward Hide, a sea soned English jockey, rode to his third victory in the. Irish Sweepstakes Lincolnshire Hand icap and second in two years guiding cofavorite Sovereign Bill to a threequarter length triumph over fastclosing Dowdstown Charlie today.

title: Art
description: SINCE forgery and fraud are very much in the cultural news nowadays, the current exhibition at tha Guggenheim Museum, Rodin Drawings: True and False, is topical if nothing else. But the showon view until May 7is a good deal more than that. It includes some 150 drawings and prints, drawn from public and private collections, ranging from Rodin's early academic work to the extraordinarily free figure drawings of his last years. It is a striking and unusual exhibition.

title: Music
description: Atypical movie star entrance it's not. Oh, Jesus, croaks Richard Harris, opening the door of his bedroom at the Plaza and lurching toward the nearest sofa. I'm bushed. Finished. I didn't get to bed till 3 this morning.

title: Parking Fee Of 25c Had Impact on Journalism
description: Every day we are probably involved in some event that in one way or another alters the rest of our lives. But how many do you remember?

title: The Winning Of Independence
description: The first of a projected six volume history of the American Revolutionary era. (There will be a spate of such works in the next few years as the bicen tennial approaches.) This vol ume, a survey of political, dip lomatic, military and financial developments from Boston in 1774 to Paris in 1783 is a digest of all the latest research and writing on the subject. Pro fessor Smelser, a wellthought of professor at Notre Dante, presents no new interpretations or theses of his own, occasion ally provides a sensible insight. but his book is so factpacked as to interfere with reading. It can, however, be consulted and studied with profit.

title: Mrs. Travers Is Wed
description: LAKEVIEW, N. Y., March 25  Mrs. Gertrude O'Con nor Travers, widow of Peter Raymond Travers, was mar ried here at noon today to Judge Matthew J. Jason of the New York State Court of Appeals, a widower. The Rev. W. Robert Burns, cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in Our Lady of Perpetual Help Roman Catho lic Church.

title: Peru Says Floods Over 3 Weeks Left 60,000 Homeless
description: LIMA, Peru, March 25 (UPI) A spokesman for the Minis try of Housing said today that floods and an earthquake that struck Peru in the last three weeks have left 60,000 persons homeless and destroyed 12,000 houses.

title: It's Like Old Times as Hot Tips Run Cold
description: For the first time in three weeks, whadya hear? meant what it usually means at a racetrack as racing re sumed at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: Rundgren's Rock and Revival's C & W
description: TODD RUNDGREN: Some thing/Anything (Rears vine 2BX 2066). With the coming of George Martin and Sergeant Pep per's Lonely Hearts Club Band, the studio became more than a place with the right acoustics for recording music. The control board in front of the producer and en gineer became an instrument in and of itself, and the final product was as much theirs as it was the musicians'.

title: Rep. Keith Bars 8th Term
description: BOURNE, Mass., March 25 (UPI)  Representative Has tings Keith, Republican of Massachusetts, a veteran of 14 years in Congress, announcedtoday that he would not seek reelection. Mr. Keith, 56 years old, narrowly won reelection in 1970, and his 12th Congres sional District has been ap preciably altered since then. His home town of West Bridge water was removed from the district, along with several other Republican towns.

title: New York
description: The survival instinct, possibly stronger in politicians than in the rest of the species, was dramatically evi dent on the left wings of the Demo cratic and Republican parties last week.

title: Median Rental in Nassau Leads Metropolitan Area
description: Topping both Westchester and Bergen County in New Jerseyand all the boroughs of New York CityNassau County has the highest apart ment rents in the metropoli tan area.

title: Miss Eileen Weinberg Bride Of William Hesse, Law Student
description: Miss Eileen Spinoza Wein berg, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert F. Weinberg, was married here last evening to William Blass Hesse, son of Mrs. Stanley W. Hesse and the late Mr. Hesse, a senior partner in H. Heintz & Co., stockbrokers.

title: Leaders of the Brethren Church Vote to Sever Its Defense Ties
description: In what is believed to be the first action of its kind by a United States denomination, the Church of the Brethren has voted to sell its stock in all corporations that produce de fense or weaponsrelated prod ucts.

title: Don't Say Ive Been To Greece, Say Ive Been to Corfu
description: COKFU, GreeceWhen you finally leave this little island, you don't say, I've been to Greece. You say, I've been to Corfu.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Movies
description: BURT REYNOLDS was wearing maroon leather body shirt with matching boots, and a lady sitting beside the indoor pool gave him a long, cool look and said maybe she was beginning to understand why some people were leather freaks.

title: Fort Lee Is Captured Againby Bulldozers
description: FORT LEE  If these rocks could talk, they mire would have a story to tell, said Mrs. Margaret M. Toolen as she scanned a stony ledge atop the New Jersey Pali sades, and then looked south over the Hudson River, Man hattan and Long Island, as no doubt George Washington did nearly 200 years ago when he decided to retreat to Valley Forge for the win ter of 1776.

title: A Sort of Rehabilitation Of Warren G. Harding
description: FOR decades every student of American history has known that Warren Gamaliel Harding, 29th President of the United States, probably had a longrunning affair with the buxom Nan Britton from his hometown of Marion, Ohio. Then in 1963 the historianbiographer Francis Russell, doing research in Marion fora life of Harding, found his way to local lawyer who possessed an old cardboard shoe box containing about 100 letters which established beyond any question a second affair.

title: New York
description: Even hardened court observers winced in sympathy in Manhattan Fed eral Court last Thursday as the jury announced its verdict. There stood Seymour R. Thaler, his long and dis tinguished career as lawyer, legislator and judge in ruins. He tad just beenfound guilty of dealing in stolen secu rities and of perjury. The 52yearold Queens Democrat shuddered violently and his hands clapped his face in stunned anguish.

title: The Economic Pain of Ocean Racing
Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: If Only They'll Eat More Cake
description: Arthur Ebinger, the 82year old chairman of the board of the Ebinger Baking Company, still goes to his office in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn six days a week and still keeps an eye on the execu tives who run the business founded in 1898 by his father, George, and his mother, Catherine.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: All about aerial hijacking. Beginning with a blowbyblow transcript, from radio trans mission tapes and interviews, of the Palestine Liberation Front's hijacking of a Pan Am 747, which was eventually blown up in Cairo, James Arey traces the phenomenon back to an obscure incident in Pent in 1930. The worldwide rash did not break out until the sixties and the AmericanCuban shuttle service for people with problems (Let's jet away from it all, as one airline jingle had it.) Informative, if you're still interested in the subject. A good book to take on that cruise ship.

title: WALL STREET
description: Let's say the man's name is Clancy Smith. He works for a large industrial com pany and participates in its employe stockpurchase plan.

title: Son to the Roosevelts
description: JERICHO, L. I., March 25  A son was born March 16 to Mr. and Mrs. David Boyn ton Roosevelt in the Com munity Hospital, Glen Cove. The child, who has been named Matthew Chopin, is a grandson of Elliott Roose velt of Miami Beach, and Mrs. Harry T. Eidson of Fort Worth, and a greatgrandson of President and Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt. His mother is the former Miss Michele Chopin of Greenvale. His father is a financial con sultant with the Eugene O'Neill Memorial Theater Center in New York.

title: '76 PLAN PRESSED BY PHILADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPIA March 25 Bicentennial planners sent their first team to Washington this week to seek approval for a world exposition here in 1976. They returned expressing opti mism that they would have a goahead by the end of next month.

title: Towns Try To Reduce Dog Litter
description: NUTLEYThree residential communities in New Jersey that enacted contioversial ordinances requiring pat own ers to clean dog droppings from the street have met with varying degrees of success.

title: GOLFERS DEFY CHILL AS CITY LINKS OPEN
description: Although the weather exhib ited no inclinations toward spring, golfers in the city, trooped out yesterday to herald the beginning of the municipal golf course season.

title: Rebel Surrender Reported
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, March 25 (Reuters)The Costa Rican Foreign Ministry said tonight that army rebels in El Salvador surrendered tonight after tanks manned by loyal troops shelled their headquarters ending an attempt to oust President San chez.

title: Easter's Turnout Is a Seashore Barometer
description: ASBURY PARK  The first flood of tourists this year is expected to con verge on the boardwalks of the state's seashore resorts in its holiday finery Easter Sunday, and officials of the 130mile resort sector from Keansburg south to Cape May will be concerned about weather and the economy.

title: WORLD CHAMPIONS TRAIL AT BRIDGE
description: CINCINNATI, March 25The world ?? Aces were looking fur revenge in the semi final of the Vanderbilt Cup competition at the Spring Na tionals of the American Con tract Bridge League here today.

title: Dawn of Remembered Spring
description: Jesse Stuart finds sermons in snakes as well as stones. Blacksnakes, copperheads and water moccasins, slithering about in the undergrowth of the author's native Kentucky. are arranged into a reptilian nosegay of stories  plus 11 poems that close the volume. Why this fascination with the snake? Its primal nature, per haps, in the scale of being. Its ubiquity in legend. Its pa tient rhythms. And its circular propensity, symbolic of the cyc lical nature of life, which Jesse Stuart has always celebrated.

title: Stamps
description: THE United Nations Postal Administration staff will be quite busy for the next three months. On April 7, two stamps and a souvenir card are due for World Health Day. On May 1, four new air post stamps are to be issued, and on June 5, the U.N.P.A. will release four stamps commemorating the United Nations Conference on the Human Environment in Stockholm that month.

title: Battle to Preserve High Mountain Divides Wayne
description: WAYNE  It's been said that when Henry Hudson sailed to the new land more than 350 years ago the first land he sighted above the horizon were the rugged steep slopes of High Moun tain here.

title: E. J. Boyd 5th Weds Josephine Hilliard
description: Miss Josephine Antoinette Hilliard, daughter of Mrs. Russell Warren Wetjen of Waxahachie, Tex., and the late Barton Villiers Hilliard, was married here yesterday afternoon to Edward John Boyd 5th, son of Mr. and Mrs. Boyd 4th of Garden City, L. I.

title: Meetings on Aid to Cities
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 (AP) Housing Secretary George Romney has announced the dates of the first two of five meetings on new ap proaches to the improvement and development of the na tion's cities. The first meeting will be in Wilmington, Del., March 30 and the second in St. Paul April 6. The additional meetings will be in Detroit, Boston and Philadelphia.

title: MRS. DAVID GORDON
description: Mrs. A. Hermine Klein Gordon, wife of Rabbi David W. Gordon of Fresh Meadows (Queens) Jewish Center, died yesterday in Long Island Jewish Hospital after a long illness. She was 55 years old and lived at 5006 188th Street, Fresh Meadows.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Imagine trying to make a success in a business where a million companies disap peared in the last 10 years.

title: U.S. Disperses B52's to Counter Soviet Submarine Missile Peril
description: The United States Air Force is dispersing its B52 bomber squadrons to an expanded com plex of 47 bases to counter the mounting threat of nuclear mis siles from Soviet submarines in the Atlantic and Pacific, accord ing to the Secretary of Defense, Melvin R. Laird.

title: Jakarta, in AntiRed Drive, Censoring Chinese Songs
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, March 25 (Agenco FrancePresse)  The Government has imposed a censorship regulation for all imported records, recorded tapes and cassettes containing Chinese songs.

title: Michele Martuscello, a Teacher, Is Married to John Hug Jr.
description: Miss Michele Marla Mar tuscello, daughter of Associ ate Justice M. Henry Martus cello of the Appellate Divi sion, Second Department, of the State Supreme Court, and Mrs. Martuscello of Brooklyn, was married yesterday after noon to John T. Hug Jr., son of Warrant Officer Hug of the New York City Police Department and Mrs. Hug of New York and Putnam Val ley, N. Y.

description: Something new under the leisure sun has been launched for boatmen and women this season by a couple of old prosClub d'Azur, which is shaping up as a continual yacht club cruise for Everyman.

description: The World

title: A Yank at Cambridge Hopes to Sink Oxford
description: LONDON, March 25 (AP) Gardner A. Cadwalader, former University of Penn sylvania oarsman, will try to help Cambridge University defeat Oxford in the varsity, boat race next Saturday.

title: . S. Lindeuren Marries Roberta Thrun
description: CROTON  ON  HUDSON, N. Y., March 25Miss Rober ta Read Thrun was married here this afternoon to Len nart Sebastian Lindegren. Justice Morrie Slifkin of the State Supreme Court per formed the ceremony at thehome of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert Thrun. The bridegroom's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Sture Lindegren of Bloomsbury, N.J.

title: World War II Veteran Pays Off Pacific Debt
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 (AP)A World War II vet eran has sent $20 to Repre sentative Joe Skubitz, Re publican of Kansas, as repay ment for having destroyed one combat boot and taking a can of pineapple from the beach at Bougainville in the Pacific.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: One curious aspect of the new isolationist mood among so many Americans is their hostility toward the relatively modest U.S. propaganda apparatus. Ever since it was quite properly disclosed that some funds supporting Radio Free Europe came from the C.I.A., there have been mounting signs of distaste for the very idea of explaining America's viewpoint to citizens of countries where there is no freedom of expression.

title: Enemy Captures a Town
description: VIENTIANE, March 25 (Reu ters)North Vietnamese troops tightened pressure on the Gov ernment defense line around Luang Prabang, the seat of Laotian royalty, United States sources said here.

title: MISS CARTUS WINS TITLE FIGURE SKATE
description: Valerie Cartus of West Orange, N.J., rallied yesterday to win the senior women's title at the 50th Middle Atlantic figure skating championships at the Sky Rink.

title: Balenciaga Rites Held
description: GUETARIA, Spain, March 25 (UPI)  Cristobal, Balenciaga, the fashion designer, who died yesterday at the age of 77, was buried today beside the grave of his mother, who was a seam stress in this Basque village. Relatives and friends attended the funeral service, among them Balenciaga's longtime personal assistant, Ramon Esparza, sev eral former business associates and fashion designers Hubert de Givenchy and Emanuel Ungarp.

title: The World
description: The Soviet Communist party leader, Leonid Brezhnev, was speaking last Monday to a congress of trade union ists in the Kremlin, but the import of some of his remarks seemed aimed at a more distant audiencein Washing ton.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Convention business is a multibilliondollar proposition that is getting some unac customed attention in Wash ington and points West.

title: Travel Notes  And Notes And Notes to Louis Lefkowitz
description: HENRY DAVID THOR EAU, America's best known stayathome, once defended his style of living  he had been chided by literary contem poraries for not visiting Eu rope's cultural centers with the observation, I have traveled a good deal in Con cord. Walt Whitman, on the other hand, unrestrain edly celebrated the rootless life with the lines, Afoot and lighthearted I take to the open road/Healthy, free, the world before me/The long brown path before me lead ing wherever I choose

title: 36 Nations Sign a Narcotics Agreement
description: GENEVA, March 25An agreement intended to strength en international machinery for uncovering the illicit production and sale of narcotics was signed here today by 36 countries.

title: Marsh Leads Thailand Golf
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 25 (AP)Graham Marsh of Australia posted a threeunder par 69 today to take the lead in the Thailand open golf tournament after the third round. Marsh, who shared the tworound lead with Taiwanese pros Hsieh Minnan and Kuo Chiehsiung, had a 208 total one stroke better than Hsieh, who shot a 70.

title: MRS. MOWBRAY COOPER
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 25 Mrs. Ruth Campbell Love Cooper, a kindergarten teacher in New York from 1943 to 1963, died here yesterday. She was 78 years old and lived at 31 Lynton Place.

title: Kilimanjaro Climb: From a Pleasant Walk To a Painful High
description: The top of Kilimanjaro still keeps the secret of Hemingway's leopard, but it rewards a climber with an exhilarat ing, strenuous victory. Of Kiliman jaro's two peaks, Kibo and Mawenzi, it is the higher one, the snow dome of Kibo, that is the easier climb; no special equipment or knowledge of mountaineering is necessary, but stamina and the will to use it are. For Cynthia Anne Chang, a freelance writer who lives with her designer husband in Manhattan (both are 30 years old), the highest mountain in Africa was their first. They reached the peak of Kibo and returned to their base, the town of Marangu in northeastern Tanclear all the way to the hut, and no climbing was needed, but the incline was enough to give us aches and pains; this first walk, with lunch break and rests, took five hours. At the hut, which has bunks with mattresses (a luxury which disappears in the next two huts) for 18 people, we met three climbers who were on their way down. One of them had turned back without completing the ascent be cause of the extreme cold. The others had reached our objective, Gillman's Point, 18,695 feet.

title: Aleman Visiting Israel
description: TEL AVIV, March 25 (Reuter) Former President Migual Ale man of Mexico arrived here tonight for a visit to Israel as the guest of the Foreign Min istry and the Hebrew Univer sity in Jerusalem.

title: Organ Recital, a Cathedral Regular
description: NEWARKIt is a perfect hall for the music, and more and more concertgoers rec ognize the fact. Its limestone walls, long and high, sustain the sweet, clear treble of a Bach chorale. Its spacious breadth absorbs the might of its 150rank pipe organ.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: DALLAS, March 25 (AP)A young Dallas policeman wasshot to death with his own gun today while struggling with two youths who had al legedly broken into a junior high school and taken $3 from candy and soft drink machines.

title: The Nation
description: National opinion surveys show that Americans worry more about drugs than anything except the economy and Vietnamand since the spring of 1970 the drug panic has risen sharply. Can the politicians be far behind?

title: PANEL URGES CURB ON CITIES GROWTH
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 Continuing migration out of rural areas should be chan neled away from larger cities and into economically healthier smaller cities, the Commission on Population Growth and the American Future urged today.

title: 42 WORKS BY ROTHKO ON EXHIBIT IN PARIS
description: PARIS, March 25A show of 42 works by Mark Rothko was opened today at the National Museum of Modern Art by Cul ture Minister Jacques Duhamel. It was a way of stressing France's belated interest in the American painter who has had a show here only once before, in 1962, and therefore is nearly unknown.

title: Glen Cove Copes With Trash Dispute
description: GLEN COVE, L.I.This city of 26,000 people has been without the regular col lection of trash for almost four weeks, but the residents are finding the situation lit tle more than a nuisance.

title: The I.T.T. and Chile
description: Already mired in political controversy at home, the International Telephone & Telegraph Corporation has now been plunged into Chile's politics in a time of crisis. Whatever the truth about I.T.T. activities, columnist Jack Anderson's charges will inevitably make life more difficult for it and other American firms hoping to sur vive in Chile or at least to obtain fair compensation if nationalized by the Marxistdominated Government.

title: Cypriotes Celebrate Greek Independence Festively With Parade Reviewed by Makarios in Nicosia
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, March 25 With bells tolling and bands blaring, Nicosia celebrated Independence Day today. Flags flew, and people in their Sun day clothes sauntered in bril liant spring sunshine.

title: I.T.T. Says Its Experts Dispute F.B.I. on the Dating of Memorandum
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation dis puted today the findings of a Federal Bureau of Investigation analysis of the memorandum that touched off the contro versy over the corporation's financial support for the Re publican National Convention.

title: The Monetary Sin of the West
description: Nobody welcomes the bearer of bad tidings, as Jacques Rueff should know. As a major French economist, he has warned for more than 40 years that our international money game was leading to catastrophe; he says today, I'd much rather have been wrong. Still, duty obliges. While deprecating the bitter satisfac tion of I told you so, Cassandra now assembles the record of his gloomy prophecies, for our own good, and this time, we had better listen.

title: RIVAL GREEK PARTIES BACK A JOINT POLICY
description: ATHENS, March 25Greece's two biggest political parties have accused the leaders of the militarysupported Government of trying to perpetuate them selves in power, and offered for the first time to back jointly any government that would lead the nation to democracy.

title: Training of Nurses Is Moving From Hospitals Into Colleges
description: HACKENSACX  Although 12 hospital schools of profes sional nursing have shut down in New Jersey in the last seven years and two more will close within the year, the nursing picture is brighter than it seems.

title: Fla. State Is Considering Law Suit Against Coaches
description: LOS ANGELES, March 25 Dr. Stanley Marshall, president of Florida State University, asked for an apology from Bill Wall, president of the Nation al Association of Basketball Coaches, and threatened to sue him for remarks Wall made yesterday in which he express ed regret that Florida State was in the National Collegiate tournament.

title: Music
description: INTELLIGENT musicians have always concerned them selves with style and the history of performance prac tice. Obviously a pianist is not going to play a Mozart sonata with the same agogics and dynamics with which ho approaches a Liszt rhapsody or a Brahms inter mezzo. But what is there in the Mozart style that makes it Mozartean? What makes Brahms Brahmsian as con trasted to Lisztian? The question of style is of special urgency today, because there does seem to be a growing interest in romantic music, and very few musicians under stand or feel romanticism. As this column has been insist ing for over ten years, musicians today know less about the romantic style than they do the classic, despite the fact that it is an article of faith that since most of the repertory is romantic or postromantic, everybody knows about it.

title: Prison Officials Back Reform of Education for Inmates but Differ on the Details
description: Prison officials around the country agree that educational reform within prisons is an im portant element in rehabilita tion, but there is little agree ment about the details of how best to achieve it.

title: Artist Paints Famed Horses
description: OLDWICKA casual en counter in the Province of Yuman in the hinterlands of Southwest China during World War II resulted in an Oldwick man's becoming an internationally known equine artist.

title: Party FundRaisers Rush To Beat New, Tough Law
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 Political fund raisers are ex ploiting loopholes in Federal campaign financing regulations to enrich their election treas uries before a new and stricter law takes effect in two weeks.

title: Coast Guard Cutter Is Accused Of Polluting River in Michigan
description: CHEBOYGAN, Mich., March 25  The Coast Guard Cutter Mackinaw, the principal ice breaker on the Great Lakes, has been charged with violating Michigan's new antipollution law by dumping raw sewage into the Cheboygan River.

title: Space
description: ZVEZDNY GORODOK, U.S.S.R.The chief of Soviet cosmonaut training, Maj. Gen. Vladimir A. Shatalov, thrust his glass of vodka toward the center of the table. There had been many lighthearted toasts to wom en and children and even journalists, but now was the time to be serious, and he chose his words with care.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 25This guide to the I.T.T. case was prepared after studying all the facts assembled by the White House and I.T.T. over the past three weeks:

title: VACCINATION URGED IN POULTRY EPIDEMIC
description: TRENTON  New Jersey poultrymen are cautioned to observe their flocks of tur keys, ducks, geese and other domestic and game birds for symptoms of a lethal disease that has recently infected and killed poultry in four states.

title: STUDENTS LOBBY BESIEGES CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 Hundreds of students from all over the country descended on Congress this week to talk to their elected Representatives about money for higher educa tion.

title: U.S. Sale of Zinc Backed
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 (AP)A Senatepassed bill au thorizing sale or other disposal of 515,200 short tons of zinc from the national stockpile was approved Thursday by the House Armed Services Com mittee. The zinc is surplus un der a stockpile objective estab lished Dec. 3, 1969.

title: Miss Corriero Wed in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, March 25  Miss Marianne Corriero, an assistant for Congres sional relations at the De partment of Housing and Ur ban Development here, and Franklin Gabriel Polk, minor ity counsel to the Committee on the Judiciary of the House of Representatives, were mar ried here this afternoon. The ceremony was performed in Holy Trinity Catholic Church, Georgetown, by the Rev. Francis Xavier Metbower.

title: United Fund Drives Are Aiming for New Records
description: HACKENSACK The an nual campaign of the United Fund of Bergen County has vaulted over the $800,000 mark for the first time, and is expected to bring in an additional $20,000 before it finishes next weekend. That would put it more than $100,000 ahead of last year's drivethe biggest leap since the fund's booming inception in the early 1960's.

title: Maryland Gets All Starters Back in 1973, Aims for N.C.A.A. Title
Queens College Students Find Parking a Problem
description: There are 15,000 parking spaces at the Queens College campus in Flushing, but each day hundreds of students have to scramble to find a space to leave their cars.

title: Tommy Davis: Another Finley Victim?
description: Tommy Davis, who 10 years ago won two consecu tive batting titles with the Los Angeles Dodgers; sat in his room yesterday at the Sands Hotel in Phoenix, Ariz., talking on the telephone and trying to find a job.

title: Ripon Society Hails Romney
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 25 (UPI)The Ripon Society, a Republican research and policy organization, announced today that it had selected George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, as its Republican of the Year. The society cited Mr. Romney's achievements in the areas of new housing, metropolitan plan ning and Federal revenue shar ing with state and local gov ernments.

title: Man and the Natural World
description: MORGES, SwitzerlandOur world today stands in grave danger of losing many animals and plants which have given joy to countless generations. They need not be lost if we manage our affairs properly, for it is man's own interest to see that the natural world, which is, the root of his own existence, survives for his children and their successors.

title: Miss Marcia Seligman Is Bride in Manhasset
description: MANHASSET, L. I., March 25  Miss Marcia Lurey Seligman and Salvatore Anthony Benedetto were mar ried here this afternoon in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church by the bridegroom's cousin, the Rev. Robert Benedetto.

title: Jets Sign Guthrie, ExKicker for Bills
description: Bobby Howfield is going to get some competition this year for the New York Jets' kicking job.

title: L. W. Brown Weds Miss Carol Munder
description: NORTHPORT, L.I., March 25Miss Carol June Munder and Lawrence Wayne Brown were married here this after noon in St. Paul's Methodist Church by the Rev. Robert Jewett.

description: The Thedford Corporation of Ann Arbor, Mich., Electro Gas Dynamics, Inc., of Han over, N.J., and Basic Pack aging Systems Associates of Avon Lake, Ohio, have sev eral things in common:

title: Black Photographer's Art on Display
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I.Dan O'Neill, a photographer whose work is being exhibited flat Adelphi University through Wednesday, is going beyond his responsibilities as a teach er at Junior High School 275 in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn to train a group of teenaged black girls to be his high fashion models.

title: Connecticut sophisticate
description: It took the present owner just ten minutes to decide that this late 18thcentury house, set behinda picket fence and high hemlock hedge in Connecticut, would be his retirement home, despite its forlorn, rundown appearance. The high ceilings and spacious roomswere the deciding factor. Re modeled in 1925, the exterior of the house had lost many of its Victorian detailsand gained a Federal facade. James Wyckoff had ruled out an authentic Colo nial, house because the tiny rooms and low ceilings would hardlysuit the French and Biedermeier furnishings that he had assem bled over the years. European traces slip into the roomsin the formal tone a the drawing room. the ceiling moldings installed in the dining room and the new entry door with leaded lights.

title: Nor II, $13.80, Wins San Luis Rey Handicap at Santa Anita By Two Lengths
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 25 (UPI)Englishbred Nor II scored his biggest victory in the United States today when he finished two lengths in front in the $85,650 San Luis Rey Han dicap over Santa Anita's hill side and infield turf course.

title: Mass Marks Beatification of Heroic Auschwitz Priest
description: A special mass was cele brated yesterday in St. Pat rick's Cathedral to commem orate the beatification of the Rev. Maximilian M. Kolbe, who chose death, at the Auschwitz concentration camp in 1941 so that a fel low prisoner might go home to his wife and children.

title: Walter B. Cooke, Founder Of Funeral Home, Is Dead
description: Walter B. Cooke the under taker, died Friday at his home in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: JETS ARE SHIFTED TO THE AIR GUARD
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 (AP)The Air Forco handed the National Guard today a sub stantially increased responsi bility for defending the United States against possible bomber attack.

title: Sailing Popular in Jet Age
description: Despite the advances in technology, the jetage man still prefers sailing as one of his hobbies. There were 620,000 sailboats in use last year, demonstrating that man is not always in a hurray to get where he wants to go.

title: Laird Says Draft's Future Hinges on New Volunteers
description: FORT RUCKER, Ala., March 25 (AP)  Secretary of De fense Melvin R. Laird, report ing a downward trend in vol unteers, said that this summer would be crucial in telling whether the draft can be ended.

title: Child to Mrs. R. H. Ader
description: A daughter was born March 9 to Mr. and Mrs. Richard H. Ader of Armonk, N. Y., at Lenox Hill Hospital. Mrs. Ader is the former Miss Pamela Bennett of East chester, N. Y.

title: The World
description: LONDON  For two hours and 10 minutes the Chancellor of the Ex chequer, Anthony Barber, stood be fore the packed and expectant House of Commons last Tuesday, reading from sheafs of paper he drew out of a battered dispatch box. Toward the close of his speech he drew gasps of surprise, cheers and shouts of Hear! Hear!

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Never before has there been so great a need for corporate chief executives to become totally involved with all of the facets of their pension funding. If the chief executive and his top man agement fail to take the initiative, it is becoming in creasingly apparent that the vacuum will be filled by governmentboth state and Federal. Few chief executives understand the complexities of pension funding, but fewer still recognize it as one ofthe great profit improve ment tools with which they can deal directly, while at the same time providing greater safeguards for em ployes.

title: Lisa Bleiweiss Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Irving Blei weiss of Brooklyn have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lisa Carole Bleiweiss, to Todd Jay Swick, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph S. Swick of the Bronx.

title: Hungry for Spring
description: The yearning for spring, these last few days of March, is instinctive. We exclaim over the first few shoots of squill on the sunwarmed south side of the garden wall, as though they were rare and exotic. The sight of cro cuses up and in opening bud is as exciting as a whole bank of rare irises will be in another six weeks. When a country roadside finally melts clear of the snowplow's heap and celandine shows its frostdefying green we half expect to see bluets and spring beauties in another day or two. The buzz of hungry bees, even two or three in search of an open crocus, is a herald of the hum that will fill every apple tree in midMay.

title: Backer of Angela Davis To Sell His Dairy Herd
description: FRESNO, Calif., March 25 (UPI)Rodger McAfee, the Communist farmer who posted bail for Angela Davis, says he plans to sell his dairy herd and go on a speak ing tour of American colleges.

title: Carol L. Pfister, James Hindels Wed in Jersey
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., March 25  Miss Carol Lynne Pfister, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert K. Pfis ter of Short Hills, was Mar ried here at home this after noon to James Henry Hin dels. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. George W. Hindels of Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MADISON, Wis., March 25 The assignment this week of Secret Service agents to protect five leading candi dates for the Democratic Presidential nominations has profoundly affected their campaigns and caused some discontent among newsmen, aides to the candidates and some voters.

title: Fischer Reported Quitting an Accord On Site for Match
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, March 25 (AP)Bobby Fischer was reported today to have with drawn from an earlier agree ment to play the second half of his world title chess match here with the Soviet Union's Boris Spassky the current champion.

title: Basic Pointers on the Spring Lawn Ritual
description: THIS year will be a good year for lawns. Everyone responsible for maintaining a lawn must feel this way to provide the spark of effort and enthusiasm necessary to make the wish come true. Much or the success of the lawn during the year depends on what happens during the first month of the growing season. Getting the main tenance cycle started, fertilization and liming, patching the bare spots, and anticipating weed control difficulties are the important decisions now.

title: Saigon Reports Cambodia Drive Uncovers More Enemy Supplies
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 25 (AP)South Vietnam ese troops reportedly pushed deeper into eastern Cambodia today, uncovering more enemy supply dumps along the way.

title: 22 Food Outlets Cited as Violators Of the Health Code
description: Twentytwo restaurants and other foodhandling establish ments are on the Health De partment's latest list of places charged with serious health code violations. The listed places must pass new inspec tions or they may be shut down.

title: News of the Rialto
description: WAY back there in the Rooseveltian days of 1938, Broad way was hit with one of the wackiest musicals in its history. It was called Hellzapoppin and though the sophisticates turned their aristocratic noses skyward, it caught the fancy of the ple beians, urged on by the then terribly influential columnist, Walter Winchell.

title: Russian Salesman Gets Mixed Reception in Nassau
description: HICKSVILLE, L. I.  A traveling salesman from Rus sia came to Long Island last week and got the kind of mixed reception that sales men and Russians frequently get.

title: REV. HAYNE R. MARTIN
description: The Rev. Hayne R. Martin, an assistant at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola, 980 Park Avenue, who taught Latin, Greek and English at the Jesuit House of Studies in Wer nersville, Pa., from 1934 to 1966, died yesterday in Lenox Hill Hospital. His age was 77.

title: Fast Third Leg by Ryun Helps Relay Team Win
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., March 25 (UPI)Jim Ryun, who said he was doing something right for a chance, ran a relaxed threequarters of a mile in 2 minutes, 56.3 seconds today. His run helped the Club West team to victory in the distance medley relay at the 29th an nual Florida Relays.

title: How Much Can Teacher Criticize Her Superior?
description: BRICK TOWNSHIP  A suburban tenure hearing that could set statewide stand ards for relations between school officials and teachers is nearing an end here.

title: Suffolk's New County Agent Fighting to Keep Agricultural Land From Speculators
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I.Daniel H. Fricke believes commer cial agriculture must be pre served in Suffolk County if only to keep from having everyplace out here filled up with people.

title: The World
description: Turkey's 500,000  man Army is the second largest in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, exceeded only by that of the United States. But Turkish military leaders feel that the army's weapons and those of the Turkish Air Force are obsolete. In view of Turkey'sstrategic location at the eastern ex tremity of NATO's sphere, Turkish Pre mier Nihat Erim had a strong case when he met with President Nixon in Washington last week to seek help in modernizing the Turkish forces.

title: Bolivia Reports Rebels Slain
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, March 25, (Reuter)  The Bolivian police killed two Marxist guerrillas, one a 24yearold woman, in clashes yesterday near Cocha bamba, the Interior Ministry announced today. The ministry identified both of those killed as members of the outlawed National. Liberation Army, organized in 1967 by the late Ernesto Che Guevara.

title: Media Campaigning Cut in Wisconsin
description: MILWAUKEE, March 25 The Democratic Presidential candidates, poorer and more uncertain about the value of media campaigning after their Florida experience; are general ly scaling down their invest ment in radio and television for the Wisconsin primary.

title: Many Legislators Are Lax In Filing Campaign Reports
description: PRINCETON  If New Jer sey's election laws were ap plied precisely, 10 of its 40 State Senators and 26 of its 80 Assemblymen would be in eligible to hold their offices, according to the Center for Analysis of Public Issues.

title: On Planting the Tree
description: THE successful establish ment of a shade or flowering tree is de pendent upon a num ber of factors including the proper site, planting properly, care for one or two years after planting. Success is measured not by one of these factors but by all three in combination with one an other.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: RULING ON RENTAL SAVES PHARMACY
description: A tiny, cluttered, 55yearold Italian pharmacy in the heart of Chinatown has been saved by what legal authorities call a landmark decision providing that its owner need pay no more than a reasonable rent.

title: SPECTOR ROS WINS PRONTO DON PACE
description: YONKERS, March 25  A horse Who almost was out of the race before he started cap tured the $25,000 Pronto Don Trotting Festival final before a crowd of 23,328 at Yonkers Raceway tonight.

title: Rats Meet Pied Piper: Ultrasonics
description: ROSELANDA new twist to an old rodentcontrol method is having remarkable success in four public housing units of the Newark Housing Authority.

title: Beloved Exiles
description: The willing exiles in Sabah, corner of North Borneo, are the British District Officer, Charles Evans and his Ameri can wife Sara. Mrs. Keith is an Old Asia hand. She gives a fair minded assessment of the whiteman's burden before and during the Japanese occupation.

title: Thieu Gives Amnesty to 162
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 25 (Reuters)  President Nguyen Van Thieu today grant ed amnesty to 162 convicted criminals to mark the first anni versary tomorrow of South Vietnam's fiveyear rural eco nomic development plan.

title: Fred & Calvin & Pauk A Musical Triangle
description: HEMPSTEADA romance between a 17yearold high school student, Fred Taub, and a computer named Cal vin has resulted in a form of threeway musical com position by Fred, Calvin and Fred's 19yearold brother, Paul, a music student.

title: Bridge
description: SUPPOSE that while driving a car in a nightmare you find yourself at the intersection of seven roads. Unfortunately they are all oneway with the arrows pointing toward you. There is no good way out.

title: Sameness of Songs Blurs Simple Style Of Joanne Barretta
description: Joanne Barretta is a singer who thrives on welldirected simplicity. Although she has an usually wide vocal range, she uses it subtly, implying as much as she exposes. She is, in my experience, unusually effective in a small, intimate room with very basic accom panimenta piano.

title: Johan Uiling to Wed Cheryl Young
description: Dr. and Mrs. Morris N. Young of Manhattan have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cheryl Lesley Young, to Johan Uiling, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard K. Uiling of Zeist, the Netherlands. The couple plan to be married May 13.

title: Nixon Is Leading Wallace, 51 to 33%, in Alabama Poll
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., March 25A poll conducted by a pro fessional public opinion re search concern has indicated that President Nixon is running substantially ahead of Gov. George C. Wallace in Alabamd as a Presidential perference.

title: U.C.L.A. Wins Title
description: The University of Califor nia, Los Angeles, captured its sixth straight National Collegiate basketball title yesterday by beating Florida State, 8176, in the final at Los Angeles. Maryland rout ed Niagara, 10069, to win the National Invitation Tour nament at Madison Square Garden. Details, Section 5.

title: Turnstiles in the Library?
description: The heart of the New York Public Library has always seemed to me to be Room 315.

title: 3 Years In the Deep Red?
description: Federal budget deficits of $30billion a year for the next three years are a dis tinct possibility unless taxes are increased or spending is curtailed, Tilford C. Gaines, senior vice president and economist of the Manufac turers Hanover Trust Com pany, believes.

title: Ouster of Governor Sought By a Tennessee Legislator
description: NASHVILLE, March 25  A Democratic legislator from Memphis has initiated a move to impeach Gov. Winfield Dunn of Tennessee, a Republican, for what the lawmaker says is ac ceptance of favors from the John Hancock Mutual Life In surance Company.

title: New Roles Are Found for Magnets
description: A dentist maneuvers a magnetic burr over a cavity and drills painlessly.

title: 12 Years Later, HouseBuilder Gets a Deed to the Lot
description: SECAUCUSBack in July, 1959, Richard and Christina Farrell purchased a small piece of land in this Hudson County community. Before signing the sale agreement, attorneys for the Farrells searched title to the parcel back more than 200 years, satisfying all concerned that it was unencumbered.

title: Fire Kills 7 in Maine Family
description: CARMEL, Me., March 25 (AP) A flash fire in a house here killed a woman and her six children and left her husband in critical condition. The state police identified the dead as Mrs. Henry Carrow, 33 years old, and her children, Lillian, 14, Diane, 13, Hope, 11, Bertha, 10, Edward Jr., 6 and Donna 3.

description: Announcements 5000

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Former Attorney General John Mitchell has declared that LT.T.'s pledge to subsidize the Republican National Convention and the settle ment of an antitrust suit are no more related than the Lord and the Devil.

description: To the Editor:

title: The Road? Do Actors Still Go on the Road?
description: WHEN Mrs. Pat Campbell came to this country on one of her last visits, she went backstage to see a contemporary of hers who was enjoy ing a resounding success on Broadway. And she said: Well, my dear, here you are with a tour de force and I am forced to tour.

title: Movies
description: GEORGIA, GEORGIA deals with the ad ventures of a Black woman caught in the throes of the psycho logical affliction known in Black circles as white fe ver. A Black person so af flicted is in such a state that he or she can only be turned on emotionally and/or sex ually by a white. Black folks don't move him or her at all.

title: Frank Talk On A Forbidden Subject
description: WHEN Buddha was still Prince Siddhartha he often escaped from the splendid palace in which his father kept him shut up and drove about the surrounding countryside. The first time he went out he saw a tottering, wrinkled, toothless, whitehaired man, bowed, mumbling and trembling as he propped himself along on his stick. The sight astonished the prince, and the charioteer told him just what it meant to be old. It is the world's pity, cried Siddhartha, that weak and ignorant beings, drunk with the vanity of youth, do not behold old age! Let us hurry back to the palace. What is the use of pleasures and delights, since I myself am the future dwelling place of old age?

title: Gas Up in Safety
description: As a safety precaution in fueling, ground the nozzle of a gas hose against the rim of the filler pipe to eliminate static electricity.

title: A PIMLICO RECORD BY ARCHIE SPEARS
description: BALTIMORE, March 25 Archie Spew's, a 4yearold who raced in claiming ranks last year, moved up in the last one sixteenth today and won the $29,100 City of Baltimore Han dicap in trackrecord time at Pimlico.

title: The Closed Box of Karl Marx
description: Almost anyone who comments on the America of today assumes that some profound change took place in the sixties, and that in the seventies we are seeing that change as it works itself out. Analyses of the alleged change have one trait in common: the marshaling of single historical facts and events, and the selective observa tion of them as they seem to struc ture themselves according to their own character and bias.

title: Senators in Denver
description: DENVER, March 25 (UPI) Seven members of the Senate Judiciary Committee arrived here today to begin taking tes timony tomorrow from Mrs. Beard, who is a heart patient at the Rocky Mountain Osteo pathic Hospital.

title: Black Pilots Are Laid Off
description: Solomon Cates wanted to be an air line pilotand he wanted it badly enough to do it the hard way, by buying more than 1,200 hours of civilian train ing.

title: Communist Party Petition
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., March 25 (AP)A petition has been filed asking that Communist party candidates for President and Vice President be on the bal lot for Kentucky's general election in November. Mike Welch, chairman of the Ken tucky Communist party, said Thursday that he had collect ed 1,453 signatures. The peti tion would put the name of Gus Hall and Jarvis Tyner on the ballot for President and Vice President, respectively.

title: Kathy Hellenbrand, A Student, Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Samuel H. Hellenbrand of New York have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Kathy Hellenbrand, to R. Mi chael Rocklen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sherman Rocklen of West Haven, Conn. A No vember wedding is planned.

title: Dogcatcher Prowls the Halls of Stony Brook
description: STONY BROOK, L. I.  Leonard Francis was sitting in his office at the State Uni versity of Stony Brook the other day when a student dropped by and handed him scrawny black kitten.

title: Law
description: HARRISBURG, PaThe defense rests.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Turnstiles in the Library?
description: Libraries have died and men have mourned them more than once in history: in 47 B.C., when Julius Cae sar set fire to the fleet in the harbor of Alexandria and the spreading flames destroyed the most celebrated library of the ancient world; in 1914, when, to punish Belgian resistance, the Germans burned Louvain, includ ing the University Library with its unique collection of medieval manu scripts and incunabula. These were the results of violence, not the ero sion of neglect. Currently one of the major libraries of the modern world, housed in this city, is slipping into a deterioration that will not destroy it in any single melodramatic moment but may gradually destroy its usefulness.

title: ARGENTINA REJECTS ITALY'S RANSOM PLEA
description: BUENOS AIRES, March ?? (AP)President Alejandro ?? nusse rejected tonight an ap peal by the Italian Government to free imprisoned guerrillas and union leaders so kidnappers would spare the life of an Ital ian industrialist.

title: Claus G. Labes to Marry Miss Virginia Menzies
description: Mr. and Mrs. Michael Menzies of New York, Upper Brookville, L.I., London and Johannesburg, South Africa, have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Virginia Victoria Graham Menzies, to Claus G. Labes, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Labes of Cologne, West Ger many.

title: Legislative Notes: Reform of Counties Advancing
description: TRENTONThere are few political institutions in New Jersey held in lower esteem by many politicians than county government: badly organized, characterized by petty politics and under the firm thumb of the state, the county governments with their boards of freeholders seen as little more than State House outposts.

title: Restaurant's Proprietor Is Montreal
description: MONTREALThe cellar is stocked with between 40,000 and 50,000 bottles of French wine, most of them exclusive to the restaurant. The spring flowers on the tables and the potted plants on the window ledges are sent over several times each week from the Montreal Botanical Gardens. The china is patterned with the French fleurdelys, the Scottish thistle, the Irish clover and the English rose.

title: Retreat From Reason
description: Dicontented white voters in Florida so frightened the Democratic politicians that the state assumed leadership in segregating railroad coaches and enacting a poll tax. That was in 1884, and whatever hopes for an integrated society may have been harbored during the postCivil War Reconstruction were fading rapidly. Advocates of integrated schools were vilified.

title: Humans were different from gall wasps
description: In the now stage of the sexual revolution, embracing women's libera tion, homosexual liberation, commu nal living, and laboratory observa tions of intercourse, it is hard to recall the storms provoked 18 years ago by the first reports on American sex behavior of the zoologist, Alfred Kinsey. His bestselling, scholarly surveys, based on 18,000 interviews, were shocking then partly because they revealed high levels of premari tal intercourse and male homosexual ity.

title: Camera World
description: THE New York 8mm Mo tion Picture Club has scheduled its annual film festival for May 19, 1972, and invites any one interested to submit films in color or blackandwhite.

title: Jean Everett Wed to Philip Bonafide
description: FALLS CHURCH, Va., March 25Miss Jean Gilman Everett and Philip Peter Bo nafide were married here this afternoon at St. Anthony's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Carl Wise, who also celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: Barcelona: A New Life Will It Work?
description: BARCELONA, Spain  The United States consulate lists 3,400 Ameri cans as living in Barcelona, a number which seems high since the membership of the American Women's Club fluctuates between 90 and 100. But even accepting the 3,400 figure, Americans constitute less than two tenths of 1 per cent of the city's popula tion of 1.7 million.

title: Home Improvement
description: MANY painting and re finishing jobs require that all of the old finish be removed fistespecially when work ing on furniture or repainting a surface where the old paint is badly checked, blistered or peeling; This task can be per formed in one of three ways: by scraping the old finish off with a hand scraper, by sand ing it off with an electric sander, or by using a pre pared chemical paint and varnish remover.

title: How people help and wreck each other at home
description: Only late in his career, in his stud ies of American families, did Jules Henry achieve that Insight and that sureness that are the marks of a man coming into his own. As a young anthropologist, Henry studied the North American Indian and the primi tive Kainging of Brazil so thoroughly described in his first book Jungle People (1941; Vintage Books, paper, $1.95). In midcareer, at the Univer sity of Chicago and later at Washing ton University in St. Louis, he turned to us, exploring in Culture Against Man (1963; Vintage, paper, $2.45), a variety of American groups rang ing from teenagers to the elderly in oldage homes, and beginning his family studies. But it is Pathways to Madness, a passionate rendering of the lives of five families, published now, two years after his death at 65, that is Henry's achievement.

title: Letters:
description: Both I and the attorneys in my office were greatly dis turbed by the article on rent strikes in the South Bronx [Rent Strikes Grow Wide spread in the South Bronx, March 19]. Not only do we feel that certain statements attributed to Mr. Fischbein were incorrectly quoted, and that they in no way reflect the actual goals of this office, but also that Mr. Oser's understanding of land lordtenant relations in our area is sorely lacking.

title: New & Novel
description: This last book by the Nor wegian writer, who died in 1970, is an impressionistic voy ageback into his childhood on a farm, and forward from the soluble riddles of youth to the great mystery ahead. Vignettes materialize and fade as the author glides through memory. Visions appear of his father and mother, of adoles cent yearning and groping, of his native marshes  until the symbolic boat is ready to float out of the landscape and in to the unknown ocean.

title: 30,000, Many of Them Children, Protest Nixon Welfare Policies
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 More than 30,000 demonstra tors, many of them children, joined in a march and rally here today to protest the Ad ministration's policies on wel fare, education and child care.

title: Should girls play football? And boys change diapers?
description: ARE parents encouraging ster eotyping of sex roles in children's play? Few'child. study experts have yet turned their thoughts to this question or to whether or not it is helpful for a child's emotional develop ment to have sex roles reinforced by play activities. This important area has been the almost exclu sive concern of the Women's Liberation Movement.

title: Formula for Sharing
description: The House Ways and Means Committee has reached a reasonable compromise on the complex issue of reve nue sharing. It has approved in principle a bill to pro vide more than $5 billion a year in Federal money to state and local governments, most of which are in severe financial distress.

title: CARROLL K. BASSETT, GENTLEMAN RIDER
description: Carroll K. Bassett, a gentle man rider, trainer and owner of thoroughbred horses, and a sculptor who specialized in bronze statues of horses, died Friday night in Gordonsville (Va.) Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived in Montpelier, Va.

title: Vermont Withholds Funds For a 4State Basin Plan
description: BOSTON, March 25 (AP)  For want of a token invest ment from the State of Ver mont, the $980million Connec ticut River Basin program has apparently been jeopardized.

title: Lucinda Smith Plans Nuptials
description: Mr. and Mrs. Stanford Smith of New York have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lucinda Leggett Smith, to Steven M. Warnick, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nathan Warnick of Fredonia, N.Y.

title: 2 Suburban Policemen Slain In Holdup Near Pittsburgh
description: PITTSBURGH, March 25 (AP)  Two suburban policemen were shot to death and two other persons were wounded today in an attempted holdup in a department store at a crowded shopping center.

title: Jib, Genoa, Spinnaker and/or Main?
description: IF YOU NEED BUOY ANCY: Flotation jacket from Moby Dick has all foamfilled compartments in front to assure faceup flotation. One model is made with nylon PVC coating and knitted col lar, cuffs and waist. probably will be a larger genoa. Mild believes that for a boat used mainly for day sailing or cruising, the pur chase of a spinnaker can be postponed indefinitely.

title: Mrs. Valerie P. Slick Engaged To George M. Horn, Realty Man
description: RICHMOND, March 25 Mrs. Richard Catlett Peyton has announced the engage ment of her daughter, Mrs. Valerie J. Peyton Slick to George Martin W. Horn, son of Mr. and Mrs. George Horn of New York and Tuxedo Park, N. Y. A wedding in the autumn is plannend.
