title: 1,500 Attend a Rally Here Seeking Release of P.O.W.'s
description: A rally for prisoners of war in Vietnam attracted a crowd of up to 1,500 yesterday after noon in the financial district of lower Manhattan.

title: Kennedy Arts Center Reopening to Tourists
description: The John F. Kennedy Cen ter for the Performing Arts will reopen to tourists on Fri day After being closed for the last three months because of a lack of funds to maintain and safeguard the memorial features of the building.

title: Candidates' Day
description: MADISON, Wis., March 26 Senator George McGovern has been endorsed by Representa five Robert W. Kastenineier who represents the district in which the vast University of Wisconsin main campus is sit uated.

title: 200 Hear China's Envoy Praise Snow at Memorial
description: Chinese and American, friends of Edgar Snow joined yesterday in eulogizing the late writer for his lifelong effort to promote understand ing between the peoples of china and the United States.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PARTIN CONVICTIONS ON 3 COUNTS VOIDED
description: ATLANTA, March 27 CAP) A Federal judge has set aside conviction of Edward Grady Partin, a Louisiana teamster leader, on three counts of con spiracy to violate antitrust laws and ordered a new trial on an extortion conspiracy charge.

title: LOWENSTEIN SET TO OPPOSE ROONEY
description: Charging that Representative John J. Rooney, Democrat of Brooklyn, has an overly close relationship with the Nixon Ad ministration, former Repre sentative Allard K. Lowenstein announced yesterday that he Would Challenge Mr. Rooney in the June 20 Democratic primary.

title: TURKISH LEFTISTS KIDNAP 3 BRITONS
description: UNYE, Turkey, March 27 ??  Leftist guerrillas kid ?? three British radar tech nicians from this Black Sea coastal town last night, and reliable sources reported today that they were being held as hostages for three leftists sen tenced to be executed.

title: Golden Eagle II, $9, Wins San Bernardino Handicap
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 27 (UPI)Golden Eagle II, return ing from an unsuccessful visit to Florida, raced to a nose victory today over New Zeal and's Panzer Chief in the $61,000 San Bernardino Handi cap at Santa Anita.

title: Romney Says His Agency Can't Solve Housing Problem
description: DETROIT, March  The Federal Government cannot and will not solve the massive housing deterioration going on in the central cities, George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Cahill Asks a Housing Plan With Local Zoning Eased
description: TRENTON, Match 27Gov. William T. Cahill asked the Legislature today to approve a balanced housing plan for New Jersey. He said the plan in cluded a state system of vol untary local zoning reforms de signed to end what he called the systematic exclusion of poor people from the suburbs.

title: Kapp Starts Trust Suit, Says N.F.L. Barred Him
description: Joe Kapp, the colorful, care free qarterback who gave up most of a threeyear, 600,000 salary rather than sign a stand and player contract, has insti tuted a rnulthrilllion dollar suit against the National Football League and its 26 teams.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine has picked up 15 addi tional delegate votes in his quest for the Democratic nomi nation, President and now has 97.5, according to a com pilation by The New York Times.

title: BP Oil Agrees With F.T.C. To Halt Practice on Cards
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (UPI)The Federal Trade Com mission announced today that the BP Oil Corporation had promised to stop practices that allegedly violated a law bar ring concerns from issuing un requested credit cards.

title: BROOKLYN TO GET SPECIAL SCHOOLS
description: The establishment next fall of two special schools within schools in Brooklyn was an nounced yesterday by Chan cellor Harvey B. Scribner. One special school, at Erasmus Hall High School will be for the study of music and art; the other, at Samuel 3. Tilden, will be for students specializing in political science.

title: Laird Predicts Soviet Will Start Tests on New I.C.B.M.'s Soon
description: FORT HOOD, Tex., March 27 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird predicted today that the Soviet Union would soon start test firings of new inter continental ballistic missiles.

title: Troop Strength in Vietnam Put at Fewer Than 100,000
description: SAIGON, South Vietnan, March 27 (AP) The United States command announced to day that American troop strength in Vietnam dropped to 101,700 in the week ended last Thursday.

title: Javits, Hartke Debate Trade Bill
description: Curbs on investments abroad by Amer ican multinational corporations and on imports by this country were pictured yesterday both as essential for averting economic disaster and as a sure way of inviting it.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: 21 Hurt in Bus Mishap

title: Charles Manson, B.M.O.C.
description: If the entire population of California went mad tomorrow and released Charles Manson from prison, he could make a handsome income for him self on the college lecture circuit. He wouldn't even have to write a book. In the ranks of academia he has a growing body of admirers and a speaking engagement at Columbia would pack the hall. Most of his audi ence, of course, would merely be curious, seeking to fathom that cha risma so touted by the magazines, but some would arrive with a more con suming interest: they are fans of his.

title: Miss Mercouri to Do Lysistrata in Fall
description: Melina Mercouri has been signed to star in Michael Cacoyannis's new English version of Aristophanes's Lysistrata. Mr. Cacoyannis will direct.

title: Art Show Celebrates West of 1800's
description: LOS ANGELES, March 27 while smog pollutes our atmosphere and industrial waste fouls our waters, citi zens here are enjoying a ro bust exercise in ecological nostalgia at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art. A big exhibition called The American West, it celebrates the days when rivers ran clean, the air was fresh and the vast open spaces of the West helped shape our dream of the country's limitless po tential.

title: BANGLADESH REDS STEP UP ACTIVITY
description: GAURNADI, Bangladesh, March 27 (AP) The brightest sign of independence along the single main street that makes up the village of Gaurnadi 150 miles northwest of Dacca is the freshly painted scarlet hammer and sickle over the door of the new branch office of the Com munist party.

title: KNICKS AWAITING PLAYOFF START
description: Coach Red Holzman and his Knicks took a day of rest yes terday. They needed it. Today and tomorrow they will work hard to prepare for their open ing National Basketball Asso ciation playoff game at Balti more on Friday. They need to.

title: GUNAWARDENA DIES; CEYLONESE MARXIST
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, March 27 (Reuters)Philip Gunawardena, a leading Ceylonese. Marxist and former member of Parlia ment and the Cabinet, died last night after a long illness. He was 72 years old.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: NEW RICHMOND, Wis., March 27  Mayor Lindsay began today his last, most hec tic and most enthusiastically received day of a fourday campaign swing around Wis consin by driving a manure spreader over a cornfield this morning.

title: 2,400 Rail Crossings In State Unguarded By Gates or Lights
description: New York State has 4,300 railroad grade crossings, where tracks cross public roads, and more than half of them, some 2,400, have neither automatic gates nor electric warning lights.

title: Burglars Steal Scotch
description: Burglars stole two trailers, each containing 1,000 cases of Scotch, from the AustinNicho las warehouse on 55th Drive, Long Island City, Queens, early yesterday the police said. The police said the burglars had hooked their own tractor trucks to the trailers and driven off before the police could respond to an alarm that sounded when the warehouse door was forced. The whisky was valued at over $100,000, the police said.

title: Bill on Direct. Rule of Ulster Formally Offered in London
description: LONDON, March 27 (Reuters)  The Government's bill to im pose direct rule on Northern Ireland and suspend the Parlia ment there for a year was for mally introduced in the House of Commons today.

title: Collegian Fans 21 Batters
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 27 (UPI)Ed Bernard set a Tulane University record by striking out all 21 batters he faced yes terday in the Green Wave's 110 victory over Cornell Col lege of Mount Vernon, Iowa. John Olagues held the previous Tulane record of 20 strikeouts in one game in 1965 against Mississippi.

title: Associated Dry Goods Up;
description: The Associated Dry Goods Corporation, which operates 85 department stores nationwide including Lord & Taylor units, registered record sales and earnings in the final quarter and fiscal year ended Jan. 29, the company reported yesterday.

title: Lobbyist's Lawyer Accuses Anderson and Kennedy of Political Game to Get II.T.T. and White House
description: DENVER, March 27  In a sharply partisan attack, an at torney for Mrs. Dita D. Beard charged today that Jack Ander son, the columnist, and Sen ator Edward M. Kennedy were conducting a purely political game in an effort to get I.T.T. and the Administration by alleging a deal over the settlement of three antitrust suits against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corp oration.

title: Erratic Reading Scores in Wyandanch Are Suspect
description: The state asked Wyandanch, L. I., school officials yesterday to investigate reports of pos sible irregularities in the con duct of state reading achieve ment tests on which pupils scored unusually high.

title: Boeing Jets Ordered
description: World Airways, Inc., the largest of the nation's supple mental air carriers, announced yesterday it had placed an order with the Boeing Aircraft Corporation for three 747 four engine jetliners and had also taken options on an additional three planes. The aircraft is scheduled for delivery next year.

title: Theater: In Case of Accident Opens
description: A pregnant pause can sometimes fall between two stoolswhich is perhaps the enduring message of Peter Simon's modishly obscurant ist play, In Case of Acci dent, which opened last night at the Eastside Play house.

title: A School Official in Detroit Stabbed to Death
description: DETROIT, March 27 (UPI) Lorenzo C. Wright, supervisor of athletics for the Detroit public schools and a 1948 Olympic gold medal winner, was stabbed to death today with a 12inch butcher knife.

title: Sabotage Is Admitted
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 27 (AP)A group calling itself the Citizens Committee to demili tarize Industry said today that it had sabotaged several hun dred casings for 500pound bombs intended for use in Southeast Asia.

title: High Schools Projection
description: The following table, based on Board of Education pro tections for next fall, gives the estimated enrollment, school utilization rate (based on enrollment and building capacity) and the ethnic composition of zoned academic high schools in Brooklyn. Brooklyn Technical High school, a specialized school that admits students on a citywide basis after an entrance examination, and vocational high schools, which gen erally have borough zones, are not listed.

title: CITY UNIT ASSAILS STATE ON BUDGET
description: Mayor Lindsay's commission on statecity relations yesterday accused state officials of back room budgeting and urged that the state'e budgetmaking pro cess be decentralized to provide a role for local governments.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Amnesty for Dissenters on War Is Backed by Religious Leaders
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 A conference of Protestant, Roman Catholic and Jewish leaders called today for almost total amnesty for deserters from the Vietnam war.

title: DR. EUGENE PACSU, 80, RESEARCH CHEMIST
description: PRINCETON, N.J., March 27 Dr. Eugene Pacsu, professor of chemistry emeritus at Prince ton University, died Saturday at his home at 152 Winant Road here. He was 80 years old.

title: Garden State Revolt
description: When historians come to assess the doings of 1972, most of them will no doubt concentrate on the high politics of President Nixon's Wanderjahr and the low politics of the election campaign. But those with a special feel for historic turning points may dwell, rather, op the New Jersey Assembly's revolt against highway worship and the tyranny of the automobile. By a vote nearly two to one, the lawmakers recently rose up and rejected a major extension of the New Jersey Turnpike.

title: 11 Sculptors Chosen For Design Contest At New Family Court
description: Eleven American sculptors including multiple awardwin ners Louise Nevelson, Richard Lippold, Tony Smith, Richard Hunt and Albino Manca, will compete in a citysponsored de sign contest for a large free standing sculpture and related sidewalk dcor for the new Family Court building at Foley Square.

title: Quantum Theory Posed Enigma of Freedom in Causality
description: Probably nothing in the scientific developments of his lifetime so dis mayed Albert Einstein as the evi dence that individual atoms can emit particles, light waves or other forms of radiation at unpred table times, in unpredictable directions and with no discernible, immediate cause.

title: Scottie Wilson Dead at 85; A London Primitive Painter
description: LONDON, March 27 (Reuters) Scottie Wilson, a prominent primitive painter, died in his London home yesterday at the age of 85.

title: Navy Chaplain Went To Motels for Rest, His Wife Tells Court
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., March 27 (UPI)The wife of Comdr. Andrew F. Jensen, a Navy chap lain, said today that her hus band had gone to motels on a doctor's advice to get away from the pressures of his job and not to carry on an affair with another officer's wife.

title: Proud Birmingham Steers Into Mainstream, U. S. A.
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala.  As it begins its second century, Birmingham has finally be come sufficiently American ized that Northerners who move here feel right at home. Some like it so well they refuse to leave.

title: U.S. Auditors Question $7Million Litton Charge
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 Litton Industries, Inc., charged about $7million to Navy ship building contracts when the costs should have been ap plied to commercial projects at the same shipyard, Govern ment auditors told a Congres sional inquiry today.

title: Excerpt From Essay by Einstein On Happiest Thought in His Life
description: Following is an excerpt entitled, The Fundamental Idea of General Relativity in Its Original Form, from an unpub lished essay written by Albert Einstein in longhand about 1919:

title: Sports of The Times
description: SARASOTA, Fla., March 27If Vida Blue had not come whirling up from nowhere to toss the pitching pro fession into a total tizzy last season, the most surprising mound performer of the year possibly would have been Wilbur Wood of the Chicago White Sox. Lifted from the relief rolls and given a starting assignment, the muscular lefthander with the tantalizing knuckleball proceeded win 22 games. Only the spectacular Blue had a lower earnedrun average and only Mickey Lolich pitched more innings. If you judge a man by the com pany he keeps, Wood was moving only in the best circles. It's uncommon for a top ranking relief pitcher to switch from finisher to starter and names don't come that readily to mind. But after Hoyt Wilhelm had long been solidly established as a reliever, he became a starter for the Orioles in 1958. Facing the Yankees when they were great, he produced a startling nohitter. What's more, Wilhelm is still a relief pitcher with his effortless knuckleball. And this brings us right back Wood.

title: Sources of Genius
description: How are we to explain genius in all its many forms? What is the mysterious source that gives mankind all too infrequently a Bach or a Beethoven, a Rembrandt or a Leonardo, a Newton or a Harvey? Is it nature or nurture, genetic endowment or childhood environment or some esoteric combination of the two that produces the rare and extraordinary individual who leaves an immortal mark on mankind's history and culture?

title: American Express Plans Convertible Eurobond Sale
description: The American Express Com pany said yesterday that in the near future it expects to authorize a sale of Eurobonds, convertible into the Company's common stock.

title: Candidates' Day
description: WEYAUWEGA, Wis., Murch 27Senator Henry M. Jackson took his campaign for the Democratic nomination for President to the Weyauwega High School, which held the first political rally in its history.

title: C. G. TWINAME
description: C. G. (Bun) Twiname, a for mer toiletries buyer for B. Alt man & Co., who retired in 1966, died Sunday at his home in Farmers Mills, N. Y. His age was 68.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Not many Americans, skeptical of politicians anyway and tending to be lieve that where there's smoke there must be fire, are likely to be per suaded by the belated contention of I. T. T. and Mrs. Dita Beard that she did not, after all, write that damaging memo about its Sheraton subsidiary and the Republican National Conven tion.

title: W. J. MURRAY JR., DRUG EXECUTIVE
description: William J. Murray Jr., an executive of McKesson & Rob bins, Inc., from 1929 until 1964 when he retired as chairman of the executive committee, died Saturday at his home in Colum bia, S. C. He was 84 years old.

title: 25Acre Rockefeller Site Will Be Used as State Park
description: MOUNT PLEASANT, N.Y., March 27Laurance S. Rocke feller announced today that he Would make 125 acres of un developed land on the east bank of the Hudson River here available as a state park.

title: Judge in the Trial of Angela Davis
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., March 27Just about 10 months ago in a bright and roomy courtroom in Marin County, Judge Richard E. Arnason be came involved in the trial of Angela Davis. His appoint ment then was to preside only over the pretrial pro ceedings. But when the state made its opening arguments here today in the cramped little courtroom where the trial is being held, Judge Arnason was still in charge.

title: PROFIT DATA ISSUED BY TRIBUNE COMPANY
description: The Tribune Company, which publishes The Chicago Tribune, Chicago Today, The Daily News in New York City and five newspapers in Florida, an nounced yesterday that it earned $13.5million on reve nues of $479million in 1971.

title: JERSEY DEFEATS DISTRICTING PLANS
description: TRENTON, March 27Legis lative efforts to approve a Con stitutional Congressional redis tricting plan for New Jersey deadlocked in the Assembly this evening when rival, Democratic and Republican plans were nar rowly defeated.

title: Man Arrested in Bond Case
description: A man from London was arrested here yesterday for try ing to sell more than $500,000 in counterfeit corporate bonds, the Federal Bureau of Investi gation announced. The F.B.I. identified the man as John Michael Devereux de La Pena, 44 years old president of Inter national Art Collectors Inc., with offices in London and Geneva.

title: Riverside Church Holds Annual King Memorial
description: Combining dance, youth choruses and spoken tributes, the Riverside Church at Riv erside Drive and 122d Street yesterday held its fourth an nual memorial service for the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., the slain civil rights leader.

title: Volunteer Group Chief
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 Douglas K. Kinsey is the new president of the National Cen ter for Voluntary Action, the private organization that sup ports and mobilizes volunteers nationwider Mr. Kinsey, 48 years old, replaces Edwin D. Etherington, who has been elected chairman of the board. Mr. Kinsey has been a commis sioner of the General Services Administration.

title: U.S. Bars Contractor
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (UPI) The Government barred a Philadelphia contractor today from participating in any fu ture. Federal construction work because of the company's fail ure to hire minority workers. The firm was identified as Randeb, Inc.

title: College Sports Notes
description: Bill Wall is not a very suc cessful basketball coach by the allimportant standard of victories and defeats. His MacMurray College team won only four games this season and his 14year record is slightly below 500. He is not in the running for coach of the year. But the Ohio State graduate may become one of the best known coaches of the year because of his attacks on rewaiting practices, officiating, bench and fan conduct and fellow coaches. He had some thing to say about all these last Friday during the Na tional Association of Basket ball Coaches convention in Los Angeles.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: Leaders of Uprising in Salvador Reported in Hiding in Embassies
description: SAN SALVADOR, March 27 (UPI)Several leaders of the unsuccessful uprising against the Government Saturday were reported hiding in foreign em bassies here today.

title: Candidates' Day
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., March 27Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama said today that he would make public this week the names of all contributors to his Presidential campaign.

title: SOVIET LAUNCHES A CRAFT TO VENUS
description: MOSCOW, March 27The Soviet Union announced today the launching of Its eighth un manned spacecraft for the ex ploration of Venus as it main tained en active pace in a vigorous program of planetary studies.

title: The Genocide Convention
description: WASHINGTONIt is now more than twentyfive years since the United Nations approved a convention on the prevention and punishment of the crime of genocide.

title: Democrat Will Oppose Thurmond fog Senator
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., March 27State Senator Eugene N. Zeigler of Florence, a 50year old Harvard Law School graduate, announced today that he was a candidate for the Democratic nomination, for the Senate. He will run against Senator Strom Thur mond, a Republican:

title: Merger News
description: The Justice Department filed suit yesterday in United States District Court in Los Angeles to force Texaco, Inc., to dispose of 222 service stations it ac quired last year from the Doug las Oil Company of California.

title: RentRise Delays Here Are Laid To ComputerConfused Owners
description: The complexities surrounding the city's new computerized rentcontrol procedures have delayed rent increases for about 75 per cent of the 1.1 million families now living in controlled apartments.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 27Profes sor Kissinger, who has been arrang ing President Nixon's visit to the Soviet Union, has run into a samovar problem with the Kremlin leaders.

title: Milan's Police Chief Bans Public Funeral for Publisher
description: MILAN, Italy, March 27 (Reu ters)Milan's police chief to day banned a scheduled public funeral and procession for Giangiacomo Feltrinelli, the millionaire leftist publisher who was killed by a dynamite blast 13 days ago.

title: Advertising:
description: Last fall three fiveman television commercial pro duction crews left the coun try to capture on film a series of Schlitz commercials written at the Leo Burnett Company, Chicago.

title: Foe Downs 3 Copters
description: SAIGON, Tuesday, March 28 North Vietnamese troops shot down three helicopters with heavy ground fire yesterday, killing one American and wounding five others, the United States command re ported.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CHICAGO, March 27 (UPI) A plurality of A.F.L.IC.I.O. delegates from Illinois, Wis consin and Michigan attend ing a weekend meeting here have voiced their support for Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Minnesota, as their No. 1 Presidential can didate. President Nixon fin ished last.

title: Brandeis Studies Women
description: WALTHAM, Mass., March 27 (AP)Brandeis University es tablished today a commission to study the status of women at the school, Charles I. Schott land, president, said.

title: A Ray of Hope Comes to Londonderry
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, March 27In many of the hearts and homes of Londonderry's Bogside sec tion, there is hope today where there was none be fore.

title: SUPREME COURT DENIES MB. CASE
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (AF)An appeal by Dun & Bradstreet to broaden libel pro tection for specialized publica tions was denied review today by the Supreme Court.

title: Poot Defendant Is Cleared of 2 Counts
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 27 Dr. Eqbal Ahmed, a Paki stani Moslem and the only non Catholic among the Harrisburg Seven, was cleared today of two of the three counts against him in the Berrigan antiwar conspiracy case.

title: Netherlands Dance Troupe Will Present 10 Premieres
description: The Netherlands Dance The ater will present 10 ballets new to New York during its season at the Brooklyn Academy of Music today through April 9.

title: Hearing Set on Tax Quirk
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (AP)A Congressional hearing was announced today on a tax law quirk that subjects some working married couples to a bigger levy than they would pay if unmarried. The House Ways and Means Committee will conduct the hearing April 10.

title: The Einstein Papers: A Flash of Insight Came After Long Reflection on Relativity
description: At that point, wrote Al bert Einstein, there came to me the happiest thought of my life. It was a thought that was to revolutionize concepts of gravity, space and time, and lead to the so called general theory of relativity.

title: STOCK TRADING SLOWEST OF YEAR
description: The stock market drifted through its slowest trading session of 1972 yesterday as prices generally assumed a weaker tone. FOOD CHAINS ARE WEAK

title: Fed Proposes Change in Bank Reserves
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 The Federal Reserve Board an nounced today two major pro posals affecting the nation's banking system.

title: AMEX LIST DOWN IN SLOW TRADING
description: It was a blue Monday on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market yesterday as prices on both lists declined in slow trading.

title: NATO's Weak Anchor
description: President Nixon's promise of additional military aid to visiting Turkish Premier Nihat Erim is reasonable in light of the Soviet military buildup in the eastern Mediterranean. Yet American help in modernizing Tur key's forces will not help solve the grave political, social and economic problems which represent an even more urgent threat to the security of the nation that is NATO's eastern anchor. More American arms for Turkey will not help solve and could even aggravate the problem that currently poses the most immediate threat to peace in the areathe deteriorating situation on Cyprus.

title: S. AFRICA EASES COLOR TENNIS BAN
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, March 27 (Reuters)The South African open tennis championship made history to day by allowing South African nonwhites to play for the first time.

title: Candidates' Day
description: MILWAUKEE, March 27 Senator Edmund S. Muskie put in a 14hour shift today seek ing the support of union lead ers and factory workers in Wis consin.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Rise in Oil Spills Is Issue At Hearing on Suffolk Port
description: NORTHVILLE, L.I., March 27 Early Sunday morning, Har old Evans drove his, jeep down to the beach on the property his family has, owned here for more than 75 years.

title: F.P.C. Chief Warns 5 Regions Face Summer Power Shortages
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 The chairman of the Federal Power Commission said today that power shortages would threaten five areas of the United States next summer and five other areas next winter if construction of new nuclear and fossilburning electricity plants was subjected to fur ther delays.

title: Notes on People
description: At the end of almost a week of skiing with 7 of her 11 children on Mount Te cumseh, near Waterville, N. H., Mrs. Ethel Kennedy took a fall and broke her right leg in two places.

title: ExInspector Louis Goldberg, Foe of Crime and Bingo, Dead
description: Louis Goldberg a retired deputy Chief polish inspector, whose raids on bingo games in 1954 helped precipitate a state referendum legalizing them, died yesterday in Cale donian Hospital, Brooklyn. He was 78 years years old and lived at 1 Tennis Court Road, Brooklyn.

title: A.M.A. Urge Medical Schools to Train on Hazards of Drug Abuse and Alcoholism
description: The American Medical As sociation, citing drug abuse and alcoholism as two of the most pressing problems of medical care facing the nation, has urged medical schools to revise their curriculums to teach students how to cope with these hazards.

title: BP Oil Consents to a Ban On Unsolicited Credit Cards
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 The BP Oil Corporation has consented to a Federal Trade Commission order prohibiting it from issuing unsolicited credit cards.

title: Court Declines to Review Prohibition On Cigarette Ads Over Radio and TV
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  The Supreme Court declined to day to review a lower court de cision upholding the yearold prohibition against cigarette advertising on television.

title: End of Hearings Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 Senate Republican leaders, pro testing that the Democrats were turning the investigation of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation into a political circus, called to day for termination of the eatnings after the Easter recess.

title: HEAD OF I.R.A. WING ACQUITTED IN DUBLIN
description: DUBLIN, March 27A court today cleared the head of the Official, Marxistoriented wing of the Irish Republican Army, Tomas MacGiolla, of charges of being a member of an illegal organization, attempting to raise a military force without constitutional authority, and possessing incriminating docu ments.

title: Speech Therapy
description: Thousands of children, be cause of birth defects or ill ness, cannot speak clearly services offered by Easter Seals. Donations sbould be sent to Easter Seals Society, 185 Madison Avenue, New York, N. Y. 10016.

title: SUGAR FUTURES CLIMB SHARPLY
description: Prices of world No. 11 sugar futures rose as much at the trading limit of  cent a pound on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange yesterday, re versing the downward trading limit that the prices hit more than once last week.

title: Executive Changes
description: Abe Plough, 80 years old, president and founder of 64yearOld Plough, Inc., maker of such products as St. Joseph Aspirin, Coppertone sun oils and Mattelline eye cosmetics, will become chairman of the board on April 1. He will be succeeded as presi dent by Harry B. Solomon, executive vice president.

title: CAPITAL OUTFLOWS DROPPED IN QUARTER
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (Reuters)United States net corporate capital outflows fell to $401million in the fourth quarter of 1971 from $1,345, 000,000 in the third quarter, mainly as a result of a decline in direct investment, the Com merce Department reported to day.

title: Welfare Middle Way
description: President Nixon has again come strongly to the support of his welfare reform program, the Family Assistance Plan. After suggesting last summer that the wageprice freeze somehow made it desirable to postpone the effec tive date of the plan, Mr. Nixon in a special message to Congress yesterday reiterated his conviction that reform of the ramshackle welfare system is imperative.

title: Chinese Leave for Canada, TableTennis Tour Opener
description: HONG KONG, March 27 (UPI) A 16member Chinese table tennis team left Peking today for an exhibition tour in Canada, the United States and Mexico, the New China News Agency (NCNA) Said.

title: NETS MEET PACERS IN FINALE TONIGHT
description: The Nets will complete their American Basketball Associa tion season tonight against the Indiana Pacers at the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, L.I.

title: N.M.U. Reaches Accord on DeepSeaSailor Pact
description: The National Maritime Union Said yesterday it had reached agreement on a new labor con tract with tanker and drycargo management interests opera ting out of Atlantic and Gulf Coast ports.

title: SMOKING PERIL SEEN IN JAPANESE STUDY
description: CLEARWATER BEACH, Fla., March 27A Japanese study has confirmed that cigarette smoking is hazardous to life and health.

title: Rise in Passover Food Prices Upsets Buyers
description: Passover shoppers were, com plaining yesterday, and retail ers and manufacturers were admitting, that the cost of serv ing kosherforPassover meals for the holiday beginning to morrow night has gone up since last year.

title: Monroe Loses First Bout
description: PARIS, March 27 (AP)Max Cohen got off the floor in the third round and went on to gain a 10round split decision tonight over previously unbeat en Willie Monroe of Philadel phia in a middleweight bout.

title: Esposito Advises Mayor to Quit Race
description: In a major blow to Mayor Lindsay's Presidential campaign, Meade Esposito, the Brooklyn Democratic leader, urged the Mayor last night to drop his bid for the Democratic nomina tion for President.

title: 4 WORKS, 4 ROOMS AND VARIED SOUND
description: Max Pollikoff's musical supermarket, which he calls the Gallery of Music in Our Time, loitered another of its four layer cake sales on Sunday night at the 92d Street YM YWHA. As usual, four new Compositions were played, simultaneously in four separate halls of the building, and re peated four times. One could, therefore, exercise a consider able range of options, including the recommended plan of hear ing the pieces in orderly rota tion.

title: Mink Pelts Stolen
description: WANTAGH TOWNSHIP, N. J., March 27 (AP)Mink pelts esti mated to be worth $300,000 were stolen today from the Space Farms in Beemerville in this Sussex County township. The state police said the farm's owner, Fred Space, had discov ered the theft. They said the pelts were fully processed and ready for shipping to New York furriers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bay State Turnpike Cited
description: BOSTON. March 27 (AP) The International Bridge, Tun nel and Turnpike Association has rated the Massachusetts Turnpike the safest highway in the Northeast for 1971.

title: Wieland Wagner's New Opera Computerizes Valhalla of Old
description: KASSEL, West Germany, March 27Two decades after Wieland Wagner revolutionized staging style with his New Bayreuth in 1951, the State Theater here is well on its way toward the establishment of Wagner as a spaceage com poser. His Waiktire has been unveiled here and the revolu tion in stage design that was already evident in the 1970 Rheingold took several steps forwaid.

title: Foe Said to Lose 70 South of Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, March 27 (AP)The Cambo dian command reported heavy fighting today 20 miles south west of Pnompenh and said that 800 enemy soldiers had been sighted 10 miles closer to the city.

title: YANKEES DEFEAT BRAVES, 10, IN 10
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., March 27  In little more than a week, major league baseball teams will be playing regular games and provoking the com ment, The pitchers are ahead of the hitters. Another demon stration of how the pitchers got that way under the Florida sun was given today as the Yankees needed 10 innings to defeat the Atlanta Braves. 10.

title: 3 in Family Die in Queens Fire; L.I. Blaze Kills 2 Young Women
description: A young mother and her two small children were killed yesterday when a fire swept their apartment in Glendale, Queens. Two young women also died yesterday in a fire in Lawrence, L.I.

title: FREGOSI IN ACTION AS METS WIN, 40
description: WINTER HAVEN, Fla., Mitrch 27Three weeks after suffering a fractured right thumb in practice, Jim Fregosi returned to the Mets' lineup at third base today and fielded three chances without difficulty and chipped in with a base hit as New York downed the Bos ton Red Sox, 40, on Mike Jor gensen's grandslam homer.

title: Cockney Puncher Is Set for Napoles
description: LONDON, March 27The sun squinted through a crack into the dark East End bar, magnifying the speck of dust on the pint glass that Bill Hill was swabbing with a towel. He was talking about champagne.

title: German Border Barrier, Ever Stronger, Casts Harsh Shadow on Both Sides
description: SEIFERTS, West, Germany East Germany's border barri cedes, expanded steadily for the last two decades, cast shad ows in West Germany here, both literally and figuratively.

title: Rescue at Hunter
description: Fears that the Hunter College elementary and high schools might have to be closed in September were allayed last week when State Senator Roy M. Goodman brought the news that the necessary funding had been underwritten.

title: Candidates' Day
description: SUPERIOR, Wis.. March 27 Senator Hubert H. Humphrey returned to Wisconsin today after meeing in Philadelphia with a group of state and local union leaders gathered to or ganize support for his Pennsyl vania primary drive.

title: Candidates' Day
description: MADISON, Wis., March 27 Former Senator Eugene J. McCarthy of Minnesota listed himself as last among equals today in the April 4 Wiscon sin Presidential primary cam paign.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE POUND ERA. By Hugh kenner. 606 pages. Illustrated Univereity of California. $14.95.

title: CRIMINAL INTENT DENIED BY BOYLE
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (UPI)W. A. Boyle, president of the United Mine Workers of America, told a Federal court Jury today that he never thought he had done anything illegal in authorizing the union's political arm to make contribu tions to campaign funds.

title: Price Changes
description: Price increases were an nounced yesterday on Japanese television sets and brass rods. Revised pricessome up and some downwere set by the Armco Steel Company.

title: Briton Named Columbia College Dean
description: Peter R. Pouncey, an En glishman who is an assistant dean at Columbia College, will be appointed dean of the college, Dr. William J. McGill the university president, an nounced yesterday.

title: MOSCOW DEFENDS EMIGRANT POLICY
description: MOSCOW, March 27The Kremlin, defending its policy of limited emigration for Jews, labeled as absurd and truly fantastic today the estimates of some Zionist groups that hundreds of thousands of the more than two million Jews would leave if given a chance.

title: 40 Gypsy Taxi Drivers Tie Up South Bronx Traffic in Protest
description: About 40 gypsy cab drivers created a massive traffic jam in the South Bronx throughout the afternoon rush period yes terday by abandoning their taxis in a key intersection to protest what they allege is police harassment and inaction by the City Council on a bill that would, regulate their busi ness.

title: Bridge in Newark Closed as Unsafe; TieUp Affects Pike
description: NEWARK, March 27The closing of the Doremus Avenue Bridge, a main link between the city and Port Newark, that officials said was in danger of collapsing, caused a traffic tie up today that spread onto the New Jersey Turnpike.

title: FILMS FROM CUBA GOING TO CAPITAL
description: The American Film Institute Theater in Washington is going ahead with plans to show next month the. Cuban films that the Federal Government blocked from showing here last week end is now trying to seize under provisions of the Trading With the Enemy Act.

title: A. A. DELLE CESE SR.
description: Alexander A. Delle Cese Sr., a realestate broker for 50 years, died Sunday after having been injured in a midtown traf fic accident Wednesday. He was 73 years old and lived at 1625 Benson Street, the Bronx. His office was at 384 East 149th Street, the Bronx.

title: FLANIGAN OFFERS ANTITRUST VIEWS
description: Peter, M. Flanigan, the Presi dential assistant whd played a controversial role in the settle ment of an antitrust case in volving the International Tele phone and Telegraph Corpora tion, discussed the Administra tion's antitrust posture last week at a private, offtherec ord dinner meeting in New York of money managers and corporate and foundation ex ecutives.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Detective Units Will Be Studied By Special City Police Bureau
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy, reversing decades of department tradition, has authorized a police inspection unit not under the command of the chief of detectives to in vestigate the performance and efficiency of detective units.

title: WILKINS DEFENDS U.S. JOBS IN AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, March 27Roy Wilkins, the head of the National Asso ciation for the Advancement of Colored People, defended United States business involve ment in South Africa today and said the condition of black workers there could worsen if the Americans pulled out.

title: Cooke Says Mass for Three Bus Victims
description: CONGERS, N. Y., March 27 Cardinal Cooke stood before 700 people who crowded into St. Paul's Raman Catholic church here today and blessed the coffins of three teenaged boys who died Friday when a school bus and a Penn Central train collided.

title: State Senate Passes Ban On Sabbath Poverty Votes
description: ALBANY, March 27After, nearly two hours of emotional accusatory debate between black and Jewish legislators, State Senate voted final pas sage this evening of a bill that would bar antipoverty elec tions in New York City on the Jewish. Sabbath.

title: BIG PENSION RISE FOR LOWESTPAID GAINS IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 The Senate Finance Committee voted today to increase Social Security benefits to $200 a month for those who have worked at least 30 years at lowpaying jobs.

title: MIDDLEMEN'S PRICE FOR FOOD GOES UP
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (AP)Middlemen's prices for a market basket list of grocery store food items went up about 2.5 per cent in February while the farmer's share increased 0.9 per cent, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Griswold Defends Surveillance by Army
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 The Justice Department argued before the Supreme Court to day that the Army's surveil lance of civilians from 1987 into 1970 violated neither the Constitution nor Federal law.

title: M.T.A. TO SERVICE REPUBLIC PLANES
description: The Metropolitan Transporta tion Authority said yesterday that it had canceled, effective April 1, its contract with a private company to operate some services at Republic Air port in Farmingdale, L. I.

title: 8 Killed as Flames Sweep Dublin Lumber Warehouse
description: DUBLIN, March 27 (Reuters) Eight people were killed when fire swept through a lumber warehouse in the center of Dub lin today. Seven of the dead were women.

title: 17,000 Lithuanian Catholics Charge Discrimination
description: MOSCOW, March 27 (AP) In the largest collective protest against Soviet authority in re cent memory, some 17,000 Lithuanian Roman Catholics complained today they were be ing denied freedom of worship and subjected to discrimination in secular life.

title: $4.80 Dares J. in Feature, $28 Ninfa's Squaw Among Puerto Rican's Mounts
description: Carlos Hiram Marquez thrilled a crowd of 24,056 at Aqueduct yesterday with a succession of brilliant riding performances. The 23yearold native of Rio Piedras, Puerto Rico, guided home five winners in seven at tempts, including the feature event on the ninerace card.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 Dr. Richard E. Neustadt, a professor of government at Harvard University, has been chosen to head the Platform Committee for the 1972 Dem ocratic National Convention.

title: Peking Is Offered a High Post In Secretariat, Waldheim Says
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 27Secretary General Waldheim said today that he had offered Peking the post of Under Secretary General for Political Affairs and Decolon ization, a position that would place a Chinese in the rank of the highest level of the Secre tary General's immediate ad visers.

title: BISHOPS AGAIN ASK MAKARIOS TO QUIT
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, March 27 The three Bishops of the Cypriote Orthodox Church to day renewed in insistent terms their demand that the head of the church, Archbishop Ma karios, resign as President of Cyprus.

title: Smallpox Cancels Sports
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, March 27 (AP)  All sports events in Yugoslavia were can celed today because of small pox, and athletes were ordered vaccinated. Two persons died of the disease in the province of Kosovo.

title: BLACK AIDE QUITS TESTING SERVICE
description: C. Sumner Stone has resigned as director of minority affairs at the Educational Testing, Service, expressing doubt about the organization's ability to commit itself to the change necessary to make tests more humanistic and relative to the minority experience.

title: Mets Obtain Sadakis On Waiver by Dodgers
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 27  Bill Sudakis, switclphitting catcher for the Los Angeles Dodgers, was acquired on waivers today by the Mets, who placed him on the disabled list for 21 days.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Some people are crazy about wood. They love the look, the smell and the feel of it and are irresistibly drawn to lumber yards. For such wood nuts, one of the more interesting shops in town is Great North Woods at 683 Lexington Avenue, be tween 56th and 57th Streets.

title: Boumediene Has First Talk With U.S. Official in 5 Years
description: ALGIERS, Algeria, March 27 President Houari Boumediene of Algeria today received a highranking American official for the first time since Algeria broke relations with Washing ton in 1967.

title: Hussein Sees Nixon Today; Expected to Explain Plan
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (AP)  King Hussein of Jordan is to meet with President Nixon tomorrow for talks that are expected to include an explana tion of the King's plan for a federal kingdom on the East and West banks of the Jordan River.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: $400Million Lockheed Payment Scored
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 Senator William Proxmire said today he was asking for a criminal investigation of what was described as a $400mil lion overpayment by the Air Force to the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation for the C5A cargo plane.

title: Strong AntiInflation Curbs Are Imposed in New Zealand
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, March 27 (AP)Prime Minister John R. Marshall announced tonight the toughest economic stabilization measures in New Zealand since World War II to control inflation.

title: T.R.P.B. DISCOVERS SWITCH IN HORSES
description: PAWTUCKET, R.I., March 27 (AP)The New England Thor oughbred Racing Protective Bureau said today that a faster and better horse than the one posted actually raced at a Nar ragansett Park on March 16.

title: A Bursting Turin Is Looking to Fiat for Help
description: TURIN, Italy, March 20  This carmaking city, en circled by majestic Alpine ranger, has almost doubled its populationto 1.2 million during the last 20 years and dreads further growth.

title: Argentina Again Rebuffs Kidnappers
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 27 The Argentine military Govern ment hardened its opposition today to negotiating with the leftwing kidnappers of an Ital ian automotive executive.

title: YOUNG COUPLE FOUND DEAD IN JERSEY GULLY
description: HOLMDEL TOWNSHIP, N. J., March 27A young man and a young woman were found shot to death in a gully today in this Monmouth County community.

title: 2 Soledad Blacks Cleared In Killing of Prison Guard
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 27  The Soledad Brothers  two black convicts accused of kill ing a white prison guardwere cleared today in a case that has been linked to that of Angela Davis.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Mixed at Auction
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 Yields on threemonth Unit ed States Treasury hills fell in the Government's weekly competitive sales today of these shortterm securities. Yields on sixmonth bills rose.

title: Gorman Beats Graebner
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., March 27 (AP)Tom Gorman of Seattle, a member of the United States Davis Cup team, toppled Clark ?? of New York, 46, 70, 64, in the first round of the annual Caribe Hilton tennis tournament today.

title: Credit Markets
description: Interest rates moved in decisively again yesterday, but with a slight upward in clination, as the money and capital markets began a week that will perhaps be influenced more by seasonal, holiday and tax factors than by actual demands for credit.

title: RCA Is Awarded Contract
description: The RCA Corporation an nounced yesterday the receipt of a $24.5million contract from the Air Force for the company's AstroElectronics Division to design, build and integrate Spacecraft, systems.

title: Production of Steel Gains; Joint Ore Venture Is Set
description: The nation's steel industry poured more steel in the week ended March 25 than in any week since last June 19.

title: About Pro Hockey
description: Unless the Ranger goalies, Gilles Villemure and Ed Gia. comin, suffer injuries, the New Yorkers should finish second in the National Hockey League's East Division (they need only one tie in their last three games).

title: S.E.C. INVESTIGATING 2 NEVADA CONCERNS
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (AP)The Securities and Ex change Commission today or dered a public investigation into staff allegations that two Ne vada companies and, eight indi divuals had violated Federal se curities laws.

title: KENNETH NORRIS, INDUSTRIALIST, 72
description: LOS ANGELES, March 27 Kenneth T. Norris, chairman of the board of Norris Industries, Inc., here, a leading producer of building, industrial and mili tary, products, which he founded in 1930, died Friday in Pasadena, Calif. He was 72 years old and lived in Saw Marino.

title: G.M. Plant in Ohio Is Producing Again
description: DETROIT, March 27Vegas were rolling off the assembly line again at the General Motors plant in. Lordstown, Ohio, to day, but it was uncertain whether the labor strife at the plant had ended.

title: A Bank for Blacks And Puerto Ricans To Open in Newark
description: NEWARK, March 27  A group of businessmen an nounced today the formation of a new commercial bank that will be operated primarily by and for the city's black and Puerto Rican communities.

title: Cleveland Quartet, Flutist and Pianist Perform Schubert
description: The first of three concerts at the New School devoted to Schubert's works drew an over flow audience Sunday after noon (subsequent programs are scheduled for Sunday and April 16). The heaviest, part of the proceedings was carried by the young and vigorous Cleveland Quartet, which played the one movement Quartet No. 12 in C minor (Quartettsatz) and the Quartet No. 12 in D minor (Death and the Maiden).

title: OFFICERS SHIFTED BY DEAN WITTER
description: Dean Witter & Co., a major investment house, disclosed top level executive changes yester day that involve the return of the concern's presidency to San Francisco, Witter's longtime headquarters city.

title: Democrats Select Wager As 20th District Candidate
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., March 27 Assemblyman Eli Wager of Woodmere was selected tonight as the Democratic candidate for the Assernbly by the Democratic designating committee for the new 20th. Assembly District.

title: Amex Advisory Unit Set
description: The American. Stock Ex change has elected Revis L. Stephenson and C. V. Wood Jr. chairman and vice chairman, respectively, of the new Listed Company Advisory Committee.

title: U.S. TO TEST IDEA OF LORD KEYNES
description: PARIS, March 27 As the Allied armies of World War II were pressing toward Tokyo and Berlin, John Maynard Keynes and Harry Dexter White had a series of encoun ters in Washington that relate to the monetary reform talks about to be opened three dec ades later in Paris by Paul A. Volcker.

title: Siciliano Picked to Stay on Pay Board
description: WASHINGTON, Mareb 28 Rocco C. Sicilian, a 50year old specialist in lahormanage ment relations and an official itb two Republican Administra tions, has been named by Presi dent Nixon as the sole business representative on the Pay Board.

title: Regrouping Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 27 (UPI)  Military sources said that thousands of South Vietnamese troops with drew from eastern Cambodia today to regroup for a new as sault on a big Vietcong supply base.

title: Advertising:
description: The new chairman of the Advertising Council struck back yesterday at a recent critic who suggested that the volunteer organization be disbanded because it was out of touch and its board members were too old.

title: Busing in Britain, for Aliens Only, Is a Growing Issue
description: SOUTHALL, England, March 27 (AP)It was 7:25 A.M. and raining when N. S. Sahib, a tur baned Sikh with a dark full beard, reluctantly handed over his 5yearold daughter, Harvin der, to the school bus driver.

title: 300 Hurt in Crash in Japan
description: TOKYO, Tuesday, March 28 (UPI)  An electricpowered commuter train carrying about 1,500 persons slammed into the rear of another commuter train halted at a station east of Tokyo today, injuring nearly 300 persons.

title: BRAVES' M'CARTHY DROPPED AS COACH
description: BUFFALO, March 27 (AP) John McCarthy was dismissed today as coach of the Buffalo Braves of the National Basket ball Association.

title: Mansholt Urges E.E.C. To Ease Burdenon U.S.
description: BRUSSELS, March 27The newly appointed president of the Common Market's Executive Commission, Dr. Sicco Man sholt today called on the Eu ropean Economic Community to play a greater role in the world to case the burden on the United States.

title: Pete to Serve Youth In Soccer Program
description: Pel, the soccer player, banker, actor and possibly the wealthiest athlete in the world, will assume a leading role in a worldwide youth soccer program sponsored by, PepsiCola, the company an nounced yesterday here and in Sao Paulo.

title: Solzhenitsyn to Get '70 Nobel In Private in Moscow April 9
description: Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, the 1970 Nobel laureate in lit erature whose works are ban ned in the Soviet Union, will re ceive his Nobel medal at a pri vate ceremony in a Moscow apartment on April 9.

title: U.S. Malta Bill Put at $9Million a Year
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 The United States will pay Malta more than $9million yearly as its share of the $37 million package that allows Britain to retain military bases on that island and prevents the Soviet Union from establishing a presence there, an authorita tive Administration official said today.

title: Ingrid Bergman Here April 17 in Shaw Play
description: Ingrid Bergman is return ing to Broadway for two weeks as Lady Cicely Wayn flete in George Bernard Shaw's Captain Brassbound's Conversion. The production will open on April 17 at a theater to be announced and will costar Pernell Roberts in the title role.

title: Harold A. Filehne Is Dead; Christian Brother Was 67
description: Brother Harold A. Filehne of the Christian Brothers in New Rochelle, N.Y., died yesterday in St. Clare's Hospital alter a long illness. He was 67 years old.

title: Waldheim Says U.N. Fails To Channel World Opinion
description: Secretary General Waldheim said yesterday that despite the technological revolution in world communications, the United Nations had not yet suc ceeded in making world opin ion a living force in interna tional cooperation or in giving the peoples of the world their rightful influence in world af fairs.

title: Kansas for Women's Rights
description: TOPEKA, Kan., Mar. 28 (AP) Kansas became today the seventh state to ratify the con stitutional amendment guar anteeing equal rights to wom en.

title: Gladieux on Bail in Drug Charge
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 28Bob Gladieux was charged with possession of marijuana today but the New England Patriots back denied he had ever used it.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Hiss, at Harrisburg, Recalls His Days As Peace Activist
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 28 (AP)Alger Hiss, who served a Federal prison term in con nection with proCommunist activities a generation ago, sug gested tonight that maybe we were premature Ralph Naders.Many of the peace move ment aspirations are familiar to me from our day, the 67 yearold former high State De partment aide told an estimated total of 500 listeners at an anti war seminar in support of the Harrisburg Seven.

title: Rush by Navy to Spend Funds Charged
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 Senator William Proxmire pro duced a document today in which Adm. Elmo R. Zumwalt asked key commands for rec ommendations on how best to spend a newly available sum of more than $400million by June 30, the end of the fiscal year.

title: Arsonist Gets Life Term
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 28 (AP)Louie C. Taylor, the Tucson teenager convicted last week on 28 counts of first degree murder, was sentenced today to life in prison. Taylor, 17 years old, was arrested soon after flames raced through the upper portion of the Pioneer International Hotel on Dec. 20, 1970, killing 28 persons and in juring dozens more.

title: CYPRIOTES REPORT NEW GREEK MOVE
description: NICOSIA. Cyprus, March 28 Qualified Cypriote Govern nent sources said today that Greece was urgently demand ing that President Makarios form a new Cabinet made up of men of mutual confidence and that this new Cabinet purge the top level of the ad ministration of those Athens considers insufficiently na tional, or proGreek.

title: Members of Protestant Family in Belfast Explain Their Militance
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 28We are the ma jority here and we had our own government, but Lon don took it away from us. What kind of democracy is that? It's worse than any thing Hitler would have done. Now we have to make a stand.

title: Pilic Sets Back Alexander In $25,000 Macon Tennis
description: MACON, Ga., March 28 (AP) Nikki Pilic of Yugoslavia up set John Alexander of Australia, 76, 46, 64, today in the first day of the $25,000 Macon ten nis tournament.

title: Congress Is Urged to Require Reports From C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 Two former officials of the Central Intelligence Agency urged Congress today to require the agency to provide it fully and currently with the same intelligence and analyses it now regularly provides to the White, House.

title: Glenn Turner Resigns As Company Chairman
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 28 (UPI)Glenn W. Turner an nounced his resignation today as chairman of the company that he built from a borrowed $5,000 into a multimillion dollar conglomerate within four and a half years.

title: MRS. ROLAND H. HOGUET
description: Mrs. Gwendolyn de Roth schild Hoguet, wife of Roland H. Hoguet, a retired executive of Engelhardt Industries, died yesterday in ColumbiaPresby terian Medical Center. She was 44 years old and lived in Princeton, N. J.

title: U.S.SOVIET TALKS ON ARMS RESUME
description: HELSINKI, Finland, March 28 The United States and the Soviet Union today began the seventh round of their negotia tions on limiting strategic nu clear weapons, the last before President Nixon's scheduled visit to Moscow in May.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)Two liberal Democratic Senators will propose that seni ority be stripped from Senators who refuse to support the na tional party or its candidates.

title: The Sound of Class
description: Sports of The Times

title: RICHARD L. BOND
description: COLONIA, N. 3., March 28 Richard L. Bond of 63 Frieda Lane, assistant circulation man ager of The Newark Star Ledger, died yesterday at Muhlenberg Hospital, Plainfield. His age was 59.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Leidesdorf Points to Losses, Reserve
description: The auditor for Botany In dustries, Inc., S. D. Leidesdorf & Co., explained yesterday at a special meeting of the men's ap parel company some of the rea sons why it gave only a qual ified opinion on Botany's annual report.

title: Poland Names a New President; Liberal Aide Dropped by Party
description: WARSAW, March 28Parlia ment elected Henryk Jablonski, a noted academician, president of Poland today.

title: Blues Win Playoff Berth
description: ST. LOUIS, March 28 (UPI) Garry Unger scored two goals tonight and the St. Louis Blues clinched a spot in the Stanley Cup playoffs with a 21 victory over the Vancouver Canucks.

title: Financial Concern Seeks Credit Unit
description: Merger News

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (UPI)President Nixon's re election organization denied today its campaign slowdown in the Wisconsin primary April 4 was aimed at encour aging Republican crossover votes for Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama.

title: Funny Thing Due Earlier
description: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum, the revival of the 1962 musical with book by Burt Shevelove and Larry Gelbart and songs by Stephen Sondheim, has ad vanced its local opening at the Lunt  Fontann?? Theater from April 4 to tomorrow evening.

title: Army Alerted Troops in '68 to Guard Candidates
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 The Army, fearing an eruption of civil disturbances during the 1968 Presidential election cam paign, had troops on twohour And sixhour alerts throughout the nation from the spring un til after the Nov. 5 Election Day.

title: BENJAMIN MORRIS
description: SUMMIT, N. J., March 28  Benjamin Morris of South Har vey Drive, former vice presi dent of Thomas A. Edison In dustries in West Orange, died yesterday at a nursing home in Livingston. His age was 82.

title: New City Program Offering Hope for Many Alcoholics
description: Somewhere in the fuzzy past he had been a proud policeman, one of New York's finest.

title: Sanctuary for Bald Eagles Established in Alaskan Area
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)Dr. Earl L. Butz, Secre tary of Agriculture, designated today 10,788 acres of the Ton gass National Forest in Alaska as a sancturay for American bald eagles.

title: Demand Is Increasing
description: The American Gas Associa tion reported yesterday a 4 per cent decline in proved gas re serves during 1971. The trade association estimated such re serves at 278.8 trillion cubic feet on Dec. 31, 1971, against 290.7 trillion cubic feet a year earlier.

title: State Budget at a Glance
description: ALBANY, March 28Following are the tax in creases already approved for the 15month period that began Jan. 1 and the major parts of the state's $7.87 billion budget, approved today for the fiscal year begin ning Saturday:

title: Western Bancorporation Sues Insurer on Swiss Loss
description: The Western Bancorporation, the parent company of the United California Bank, Los An geles, said yesterday that it had sued the Fidelity and Casualty Company of New York to re cover losses sustained in the collapse of U. C. B.'s former Swiss subsidiary in 1970.

title: London Appeals to Ulster Protestants
description: LONDON, March 28  The British Government today urged Protestants demonstrating in Northern Ireland against Lon don's takeover of the province to settle down and help ease the crisis.

title: Candidates' Day
description: WAUSAU, Wis., March 28  Senator Hubert H. Humphrey denounced as inadequate today President Nixon's recent mes sage to Congress on older Americans, calling for a 25 per cent increase in Social Security benefits rather than the 5 per cent proposed by the Admin istration.

title: A Revealing Eastman Johnson Show
description: Back in 1870 a sympa thetic critic commended East man Johnson, who was then 46 years old, for his paint ings of quaint ways and folk who were vanishing from the American scenethus beat ing to the draw by 102 years any critic expecting to ap proach the new Eastman Johnson exhibition at the Whitney Museum as neo nostalgia. This is all to the good, since nostalgia for the American past, however great the part it has played in the revival of 19thcentury Amer ican painting, turns out to be beside the point in this quite unexpectedly revealing show.

title: World Economic Parley Is Discussed by the Treasury Aide
description: PARIS, March 28  Paul A. Volcker, Under Secretary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs, said today the United States hoped for agreement within a perspective of weeks on a new forum for the upcoming round of international negotia tions to restructure the world's economic order.

title: Machine of State Stalled, Italians Feel
description: ROME, March 28These are days of bombings and plots, spectacular robberies and urban guerrillas, an election campaign full of cabals and alarming rumors, and on top of it all the death of a famous pub lisher, a friend of Fidel Castro, in a mysterious explosion at the foot of a power pylon.

title: 17 Dates in '70'71 With Flier's Wife Denied by Chaplain
description: JACKSONVILLE. Fla., March 28 (AP)  Navy Chaplain Andrew F. Jensen specifically denied today that he had had sexual intercourse with Mrs. Mary Ann Curran on each of the 17 dates in 1970 and 1971 cited in her testimony against him.

title: Dispatch of The Times, London
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, March 28  Eight Yugoslavs have died of smallpox and 75more are undergoing treatment in the first smallpox epidemic in Yugoslavia in 40 years.

title: Kidnappers Deadline to Kill Fiat Official Passes in Argentina Without Word
description: BUENOS AIRES, Wednesday, March 29The Fiat subsidiary here announced early today that the ransom demands of the left wing kidnappers of Oberdan Salustro, a high Italian execu tive of the company, were be yond reach as the midnight deadline for his execution passed.

title: 3 Die in West German Crash
description: WERTHEIM, West Germany, March 28 (UPI)Three persons were killed today in the crash near here of a small private plane flying from Frankfurt to Stuttgart, the police said.

title: POLICEMAN WINS DISMISSAL FIGHT
description: The Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court, the state's second highest tribunal, re voked yesterday the dismissal of a police sergeant charged with having solicited a Christ mas gift and ruled that a two year suspension without pay was sufficient punishment.

title: Stock Prices Mixed on Amex as Trading Edges Up
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthe counter market showed no definite trend and finished mixed yesterday in quiet trading.

title: Watson Says Report Exaggerated Drinking
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)Arthur K. Watson, United States Ambassador to France, says a report that he got boisterously drunk on a flight from Paris to New York was exaggerated. But he concedes that he was rude to crew members.

title: Mrs. Beard May Lersve
description: Denver, March 28Mrs. Dita D. Beard, the ailing Washing ton lobbyist for the Interna tional Telephone and Tele graph Corporation, could be re leased from the hospital by this weekend, her doctor re ported today.

title: A Thief Relents
description: DANBURY, Conn., March 28 (AP)Whoever took presents, clothes and several heirloom rings from Mr. and Mrs. David Seaman on their wedding night Saturday has proved that not all thieves are heartless. He re turned everything today after an appeal in the news media from the bride's father, Anthony Januzzi of Danbury.

title: Blast in Soviet Reported
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)The Atomic Energy Com mission reported today seismic signals that presumably came from a Soviet underground nu clear explosion. It said that the signals had originated at the Semipalatinsk nucleartest ing area and were the same as those of an underground nu clear explosion with a yield of 20 to 200 kilotons, equal to the blasting power of 20,000 to 200,000 tons of TNT.

title: LOCAL PARLIAMENT IN ULSTER CLOSES
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 28The Northern Ire land parliament, a symbol of Protestant dominance here for 51 years, went into suspension today while 50,000 flagwaving demonstrators surged angrily outside.

title: G.M. to Pay $90,000 Fine For Opel Safety Violations
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (UPI) The General Motors Corporation agreed today to pay a $90,000 fine for violating Federal safety standards for windshield mountings on its Germanproduced Opel automo bile.

title: Theater: Gene Feist Directs Shaw's Misalliance
description: Shaw labels Misalliance A debate in one sitting. It is Shaw who is windily de bating himself, loading his characters with his rumina tions on class strictures, pa rental blindness, youthful blandness, the indelicacies of marriage, and the liter ary and moral superiority of Shaw. Gentlemen are cads. Young ladies are teases. Old men are lechers. Workers are downtrodden. Capitalists are complacent. Constantly we are aware of the author's chuckling over his own chid ing.

title: TV Urges Fairness Doctrine Not Be Applied to Ads
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 The television industry, con tended today that application of the fairness doctrine to broadcast commercials could drive advertisers to other media and destroy the economic strength of the industry.

title: ALLSTAR CONTEST DRAWS 128 NAMES
description: The office of the baseball commissioner announced yes terday the 128 nominees for the starting teams for the 1972 AllStar game and promptly in vited criticism for some of the nominations.

title: MRS. WILLIAM F. TOBIN
description: Mrs. Margaret Beckert Tobin, the wife of William F. Tobin, a New York lawyer, died of a cerebral hemorrhage in the Neurological Institute of the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center, on Monday evening. She was 61 years old and lived at 75 Thayer Street in the Inwood section of Manhattan.

title: UTILITY IN MIDWEST INCREASES EARNINGS
description: The Northern States Power Company yesterday reported gains in operating revenues and net income for 1971.

title: Kosciuszko Bill Gains
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)The Senate passed and sent to the House today a bill designating the Philadelphia home of Gen, Thaddeus Kos ciuszko as a national shrine. Kosciuszko fought under George Washington in the Rev olutionary War, then returned to his native Poland, where he was imprisoned for leading a revolution.

title: Bank Robbery Foiled By Frightened Employe
description: Two wouldbe bank rob bers were foiled yesterday by a fainthearted bank em ploye.

title: Bridge: Rival's Hesitation Leads To a Share of Pairs Title.
description: The sensation in the early stages of the Spring Nationals of the American Contract Bridge League in Cincinnati last week was the adjustment in the result of the Open Pairs that gave Matt Grano vetter of Jersey City and Merle Tom of New York a share in the title with the original winners, Barry Crane of Los Angeles and Dr. John Fisher of Dallas.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1 No Title

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on Peaceful Us es of the Seabed, subcom mittee on international rule 3 P.M.; subcommittee on Law of the Sea10:30 A.M. and 8 P.M.

title: HARDIN AMONG SIX DROPPEDBYYANKS
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 28The lifeisreal, life isearnest aspect of baseball life overshadowed the games andglory aspect for the Yankees today, and not be cause they lost a 65 decision to the Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An intensive antinarcotics campaign aimed at vulner able young kids who are not hooked was disclosed yesterday at City Hall by Mayor Lindsay.

title: Some Corporate Operations Of Budd Set for Detroit
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 28 (AP)Officials of the Budd Company said today that new corporate offices would be opened in the Detroit suburb of Troy with nine vice presi dents making their headquar ters there.

title: Barclays Seeks Boston Unit
description: BOSTON, March 28 (Reuters) Barclays Bank International, London, said today it is seeking state permission to open a branch office here. Barclays would be the first foreign bank with a branch in Massachusetts.

title: Flyers Tie Stars, 22
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., March 28 (AP)  Goals by Philadel phia's Bob Kelly and Ross Lonsberry matched a pair by Minnesota's Dennis Hextall as the Flyers salvaged a 22 tie with the North Stars tonight in their fight for a West Divi sion playoff berth.

title: Dance: Adventurous Visitors From Netherlands
description: NETHERLANDS DANCE THEATER, DI. rector, Carel Birnie; artistic director, ?? Flier: ballet mistress, Hanny Bauman. At iho Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: Flight of Fancy Costs $25
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., March 28 (UPI)A 22yearold Avon man who took a balloon flight in February was fined $25 yesterday in West Hartford Cir cuit Court for illegally operating an aircraft. The man, Brian J. Boland, was charged with flying a 60foot high balloon 500 feet over Red Oak Hill Meadow Road in Avon.

title: Republican Senators Urge End to I.T.T. Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, March 28A political tug of war developed today between Republican leaders, who are attempting to choke off the Senate Judiciary committee's hearings into the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, and Democratic Senators, who are insisting upon continuing the hearings a frantic exercise in continuing irrelevancy.

title: BERRIGAN SCORED AS PEACE PRIEST
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 28 In closing argument against the Harrisburg Seven, a Gov ernment attorney poured scorn today on the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan as a priest of peace, contending that Father Berrigan and the other alleged antiwar conspirators planned acts of violence against the United States.

title: Diplomat in El Salvador Protests Arrest at Home
description: SAN SALVADOR, March 28 (AP)A Venezuelan diplontat charged today that Salvadoran authorities violated his diplo matic, immunity bytarging in to his home with bayonets and dragging away a politician seeking asylum.

title: 14,000 on West Bank Vote Amid Threats
description: JERUSALEM, March 28 Nearly 14,000 Arabs on the Israelioccupied West Bank of the Jordan River defied threats of terrorism from Palestinian guerrilla leaders and voted for town leaders today in the first general election on the West Bank since 1963.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The House of SemiRepresentatives
description: WASHINGTONIf a man from Mars were to visit Capitol Hill and take the term House of Representatives literally, he would conclude that the United States is a prosperous land of small towns, farms and suburbs occupied by middleaged and elderly white men who are lawyers, bankers, businessmen, farmers and occasionally teachers or journalists. Many are quite rich. No one under thirty lives there. No veterans of the Vietnam war. It has an insignifi cant number of women and black members.

title: Candidates' Day
description: MILWAUKEE, March 28  Senator George McGovern ac cused President Nixon today of shabby treatment of the fam ilies of prisoners of war by fail ing to answer letters from them if they contain criticism of his Vietnam policies.

title: Private Talent Joins Fight On Connecticut Pollution
description: HARTFORD, March 28  Connecticut is relying on the public spirit of men in private enterprise to help it enforce its cleanair regulations fairly.

title: And Now a Time for Peace
description: CAIROThe big question in the Middle East today is: Is it time to fight or a time to make peace?

title: Police Seeking Clues In Jersey Slayings Of Man and Woman
description: Police in rural Holmdel Town ship, N. J., were puzzling over an inconclusive handful of ob jects yesterday in the slaying of a man and woman whose bodies were found Monday in a farm gully.

title: Inmate for 20 Years Free While His Case Is Appealed
description: WESTBURY, L I., March 28 Robert Clayton, a 43yearold migrant farm worker who spent nearly 20 years in state prison on charges of having commit ted a murder, was freed today on his own recognizance. Fed eral courts have ruled that his confession was involuntarily obtained.

title: Texas Senate Picks Negro
description: AUSTIN, Tex., March 28 (AP)  Senator Barbara Jordan of Houston, the first Negro wom an elected to the Texas Senate, was selected by her colleaguds today as Prsident Pro Tempore. Miss Jordan will now be the assistant presiding officer of the Senate during the special session that started today. She was chosen in a caucus and will be nominated later on the floor.

title: Cardinal Conway Says Religion Is Not an Issue in Ulster Crisis
description: ARMAGH, Northern Ireland, March 28William Cardinal Conway, the Roman Catholic Primate of All Ireland, said today that religion was not an issue in the present crisis and that his church had no desire to impose its moral outlook on Protestants in a united Ire land.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Honduras. President Nixon transmitted to the Senate a treaty with Honduras on the Swan Islands. It provides for United States recognition of Honduran sovereignty over the two rock keys in the Caribbean. The two govern ments also agreed to estab lish a cooperative meteoro logical program to maintain the weather observation and telecommunications facility on the islands.

title: Missing: One Policy
description: During his three years as Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, George W. Romney has tried without success to evolve an Administration policy for the cities and their suburbs. The other day in Detroit he rhetor ically threw up his hands and said the job was too big for the Federal Government. Nothing that Washington could do, he suggested, would halt the terrible slide of innercity housing into slums.

title: A Gift From Grandma: Easter Brunch
description: Vera Maxwell is, of course, best known as a designer of simple but casual clothes with a timeless style to them.

title: Comment on Gold Reports
description: PARIS, March 28 (Reuters) Under Secretary Volcker said here today that he was un aware of any plans to sell off any of the American gold stock on the free market.

title: Hussein, at White House, Meets Caution on Plan
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 King Hussein of Jordan re ceived assurances of continued American military and eco nomic assistance today during more than four, hours of dis cussions with President Nixon and top Administration offi cials.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: DID YOU Buy BACK YOUR BUSINESS from a conglomerate? Join DivorceCorporate Style Club, now in formation. Write Den Cueuow 777 Third Ave., N.Y., N.Y. 10017ADVT.

title: Landlord Is Indicted In RentalBias Case
description: A Yonkers landlord was in dicted by a Westchester Coun ty grand jury yesterday on charges of refusing to rent an apartment to a black family. The State Division of Human Rights and the District Attor ney said it was the first indict ment in the state under the Human Rights Law.

title: Security Is Strong As Leftist Publisher Is Buried in Milan
description: MILAN, March 28Giangia como Feltrinelli, the millionaire leftist publisher who died in an explosion at the foot of a pow er pylon near here two weeks ago, was buried here today.

title: The Einstein Papers. A Man of Many Parts
description: On Feb. 27, 1939, six months before the German attack on Poland, the great German physicist Max von Laue secretly wrote to Albert Einstein in the United States that certain German scien tists wanted to cleanse his relativity theory of its Jew ish taint.

title: Maritime Union Men Back Pact in Incomplete Tally
